review_body: Absolutely loved my experience at the hotel, i came with my father and we both loved the hotel, only thing that could be fixed was i found when housekeeping had come round, and you try to get in bed at night the duvet is literally impossible to move as it is so tightly tucked in between the wall, staff were very friendly and helpful, loved the music in the elevators and in the lobby when you walk in, and the do not disturb button was a very good design feature, steamer in room was great for getting outfits ready to go out into the city, close to times square and brunch on the rooftop is brilliant with a great view of the empire state and surrounding buildings. Only issue i had with the brunch was the fried chicken and waffles, the batter on the chicken was so incredibly hard that when you try to bite or cut the chicken it literally pops off as a shell, i would 100% percent come back and hopefully after covid i can come back to the city. Loved the Room Design

Great spot central to all the action! Very prompt check-in experience and pleasantly surprised with our room. Although a little on the smaller side, extremely functional and perfect for a get away weekend! Rooms are quiet and beds are comfortable. I titled review, as this is an upbeat, energetic, fun hotel, with lots of color variety and modern furniture. The rooms have functional folding furniture hanging on the wall to conserve space, however, a very functional idea! We got a package that included breakfast and definitely a great way to go. Would come back!

I stayed at the Moxy for 5 nights and absolutely loved it. The hotel is very modern and very well kitted out. Onsite there is a restaurant, bar, gym, 24 hour ice cream vendor and a cool rooftop bar (with a crazy golf course - not to everybody's taste!). The room was fantastic, I really liked the layout in the 'Double Double Room' and the bathroom was really nice and had a rainfall shower. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The only negative points I would have is that the breakfast was the same every day - it would have been nice to have some pancakes or other breakfast dishes and maybe some more fruit juice options. Also, the storage space in the rooms is minimal so if you do pack a lot, you will struggle. The location was brilliant, a very short walk from Penn Station and about 1 0 minute walk (if that) to Times Square. Considering how close we were to the main spots in NYC, I always had a great nights sleep and couldn't hear a thing! We were on level 11 and our room had windows that looked out onto a side street.

Great hotel, great staff, great location. My family and I stayed here for a full week, and I can honestly say that it's one of the best hotels we've ever stayed in. Can't find a negative thing to say!

After having to cut my trip short due to covid-19 the hotel staff were excellent in helping me..special mention must go to steve,dashaun,francico and of course ali...hotel location was great and all staff very friendly and helpful...until again thanks very much

The hotel is great and in a fabulous location, very modern and quite quirky. Rooms are typically small as you expect in New York but are very ikea like. My only negative was the staff interaction which was couldn’t care less if you were there or not, I probably would stay here again but I would miss the bar and restaurant area to avoid the bad service

We really loved our stay in the Moxy in the heart of Manhattan. It is perfectly located between Penn Station and Times Square. The rooms are innovative and practically arranged and you meet young, stylish and cool people!

My girlfriend and I liked this hotel a lot. I would not recommend paying extra for breakfast included. We were only able to make it to breakfast one time because they stop serving at 10am. This place has a young vibe. We are both 21 and felt too young. Most people there were between 25 and 35

The hotel and the rooms were very clean. The beds and pillows so comfortable.The location was perfect between Times Square and ESB. The breakfast was included and it was OK although everyday the same. I would like to thank the doorman J. J. for his help. He has been very nice and kind with us.

First time at a Moxy and I loved it. I have traveled extensively across Europe, so I am familiar with the smaller room style. Dont let the small rooms fool you/ they are perfect - everything is there, super comfortable and you dont feel like you are in a typical room.Staff, restaurants and bar were also fantastic. Highly recommend.. I will be back!

I had the privilege to stay at the MOXY Times Square hotel this week, and every moment from start to finish made me feel refreshed. The check in was so cool, the staff were using tablets and welcomed me like I was their friend. My room was cozy, and very comfortable queen size bed with the softest linen I've ever felt. The i connected my Pandora account to the smart TV for tunes all night while i was doing some work before going out to dinner. The MUK Bath products smell amazing! and the towels were so fluffy and comfortable to use. Legasea is where I had dinner! the decor is like something from a magazine! The server recommended the Steamed Mussel pot, (hint: ask for extra crostinis for the white wine/tomato broth!) My experience was comfortable, delicious and clean! the staff was very friendly, i really like that they wear t-shirts and introduce themselves each time when you engage with them. I cant wait to come back!
user_name:
BossFarlee
New York City, New York

review_body: the room was extremely small, the food was good, the lobby spaces were modern and fun, but never had time to stay ther. the rooftop bar was fun but for youner people, during weekends was too loud y and too busy

I recently stayed at Moxy with my son and daughter in law. The trip was a surprise for my 50th birthday. Staff made sure we had rooms next to each other and they were excellent, loved the shower.  Hotel was central for all attractions and the atmosphere summed the whole City up ... it was young diverse and vibrant ! Moxy I loved you and all your staff (I even managed to work the lifts out myself). I'll be back !!

Loved every part of my stay !! Great Vibe, friendly staff, loved the hangout area and the bar. Great Breakfast. Look and feel of the hotel is full of character and very trendy! Would definitely go back !
user_name:
Johann N
Cape Town Central, South Africa

review_body: I Lost a very personal bag in the Moxy Time Square on my Feb Trip .I didn't realize it till i returned home. I went crazy looking for this bag.I called the hotels lost in found and spoke with Johan and he said it was returned by housekeeping. Johan knew how important the bag was to me and he told me he would go to fed store on his break and put it in an overnight letter for me .Someone from Fed Ex called me and took all my information. Johan waited till he rcvd the receipt from Fed Ex took a picture and texted it back to me . Johan is a great human being that works for the best Hotel Chain .I felt so relieved when I rcvd the package. Johan made me feel so happy knowing he went the extra mile in helping me getting my bag back.Very proud of him and very proud the Marriott Hotel chain for having such a great human being working for them.Cheers to Johan !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

This stay had many ups and downsUps:-Jason M. from Engineering that came to help get my phone out from under the bed. He was super sweet and polite. My birthday hero!-Lady from the bar with a March Bday that gave me candles so I could light up my birthday cake I appreciate you so much. -Nice guy with a beard and green jacket that would hold the door for me every night so I wouldn’t have to was awesome. -The Stash is full of good toiletries that help during your stay. Downs:-Guy at check in didn’t really greet us and just told us to go to the pad. Didn’t really explain anything was just super monotone.-I dropped my phone under the bed and could not get it out (beds are bolted to the floor). Upon looking I found a dirty bra, dirty/lint, and wrapper. I called The help desk and they said they would send someone over but nobody came. I had to go to FD in person to ask for help and which the guy gave me 2 free drinks. Housekeeping didn’t clean the room. All they did was take take the towels I left in a little pile for them. I didn’t get fresh sheets during my stay which blows.-Nobody has a name tag so it makes it hard for me to name the nice people that helped other than Jason. Overall:This place is nice if you plan to be out and about. Close to Penn Station and 42 St making it easy to get to any destination. The bar lounge area is super chill during the day perfect for some light work. During the night it’s nice with good music and the drinks are pretty good. I was on the 16th floor (I requested a high floor) and I didn’t really hear the music. I would try another Moxy on my next visit. This hotel isn’t for everyone. This hotel is perfect for those that are super chill and enjoy the laid back experience.

this is a great hotel located right near Penn station. The rooms are really nice but small. The breakfast buffet was good, the gym is excellent the bar on the second floor is great and there is a really cool bar on the roof. The hotel is situated right between Penn Station and Times Square. The staff was really nice.
user_name:
avidtraveler1976
New York City, New York

review_body: Throughly enjoyed my stay at the Moxy NYC Times Square. The members of staff who checked me in was lovely and incredibly welcoming. An American breakfast was included, which was nice and plentiful. I liked the fact that take away cups were available for your hot drinks so you could grab one and go on your way. The room was comfortable and cosy.

Hotel is brand new with a great design and free restaurant. The rooms are clean with vinyl floor, so no nasty carpets. The beds are clean and good noise isolation. Like the idea of rooms with 2 beds for families

Spent 5 nights at this hotel and it was everything that I expected it to be after reading the reviews. A good hotel for the price which was modern and clean. I would stay here again. Rooms: We stayed in a double room with two double rooms. Expect the room to be small but it's New York and in Times Square so what do you expect really. Beds were very comfy and plenty of plug sockets in the room. Only two problems with the room and hotel it's self was the noise from the street level and we were on floor 14 and the lack of storage. No wardrobes for clothes so you had to live out of our suitcase. The hotel itself it can get quite noisy and lively in and around the lower levels due to the nightclub / rooftop bar. It's quite a young persons hotel (Ages 20-30) so that can lead to extra noise too. Gym: Good size, modern equipment and it has just about enough equipment and weights to allow you to vary your workout's each day.

JJ the doorman made us feel at home and safe as he welcomed us in every time through the doors! His smile is contagious! Will definitely be coming back as the service is amazing and the hotel is in a perfect location! 100% would recommend!

I’ve never stayed at Moxy before now and I’ve also never written a review for any hotel. I felt compelled to write based on the amazing service my family received and how special they treated my daughter on her leap day birthday. They recognized the special nature of only having one birthday every four years with several surprises - a cake and balloons, a card signed by the staff, but most impressively, a vinyl album of Alannis Morissette’s Jagged Little Pill. My daughter is 20 (it was her fifth birthday) and we were headed to see Jagged Little Pill on Broadway, and the staff took that knowledge and made her day even more special. They even wrote, “Isn’t it IRONIC that your birthday only comes once every four years....” in a play on one of the songs in the album. The staff also sang happy birthday to her when they delivered the cake. She was in awe of how they treated her.There was a special for leap day birthdays that didn’t work for my daughter based on her bringing two friends with her. They still gave her the birthday special with an upgraded room that allowed her to have both friends stay with her. They proactively found a way to get us the special package for her birthday, and we are very grateful. Everything they did was with my daughter in mind. I am 100% sure that they lost money on our stay, but they will make it up in our future stays. They have customers for years to come. Stay at this hotel, tell the staff if you have a celebration, and bask in the service that they provide.

The hotel was fantastic. Fun atmosphere, great value, and the best hotel shower I've ever had. Location was also very convenient. Walking distance to Times Square and the Empire State Building. 10/10 would recommend.

Moxy is perfect for young people. Rooms are cozy, functional and clean. Breakfast is pretty good with all the essentials. WiFi is good. They keep your luggage in a safe place when you checK out. Overall is an hotel with a great vibe and exceptional functionality.

MOXY is a wonderful contemporary boutique hotel designed for travelers enjoying trendy touch of lifestyles. As a millennial I enjoyed the facilities very much! Arrived early but was able to be upgraded to a bigger room since my original booked room was temporary on hold for maintenance. Room was cozy and all the furniture pieces could be arranged the way the guest prefer, and the space in the room was perfectly divided and used.The location of the hotel was amazing and the staffs were super friendly and helpful!Will definitely stay at MOXY time square again when I visit New York again. Also recommend to checkout the rooftop bar Magic Hour, great place for IG feed and amazing view of the city!Loving the vibe

Had a great experience overall. The hotel is beautiful and most of the staff were super friendly and made me feel welcome. My only issue was getting toiletries delivered to my room. I stopped a clerk on my floor to ask for a toothbrush and was told it would be dropped off at my room. Hours later and no toothbrush! I then went downstairs to the front desk and asked for the same thing and an hour passed by with no knock at the door. I had to call the desk to finally get someone to bring it up to the room. I did like "The Stash" room that they have on each floor where you can get thinks like extra pillows and hangers, etc. I just wish they had more everyday items that people would need in these areas so that we wouldn't have to reply on hotel staff for those types of items.

Moxy properties are always great to stay at for solo travelers in urban locations. The rooms are on the smaller side but still very pleasant with a comfortable bed and rain shower heads. I highly recommend this property as it is in a very central location in Manhattan at an affordably price.

Stayed at Moxy last summer and February 2020 and both occasions did not disappoint. Moxy is consistent in their customer service, attention to detail and overall value. not to best location. Everything within walking distance.

We loved our room, all except for the music and street noise from below. We were on the 12th floor and suffered til 3 am with the bass of the music played from the lobby into the street. Definitely ask for a room away from the street. We were there for three nights and it was the same story every night. No closet or drawers, but plenty of hang hooks to hang up your stuff. We were the only people over 35 staying there.

I stayed 3 nights at Moxy Times Square, and during those 3 nights I could hardly sleep, because of the noise and vibrations of the terribly loud music coming from the hotel night-club ... plus, on Friday night I could also hear people shouting in the corridors... Moreover, even if you have breakfast at the opening time, 7 am, the sausages are cold and the rest of the supposed-to-be hot food is lukewarm. The price for breakfast is 23 dollars but it’s not worth it : no choice of jam, no pancakes, no fruit salad, no ham, no cheese, etc ... the choice is indeed very limited.The location is great and the staff is polite.

The rooms were lacking a few things: a wardrobe, somewhere to put your luggage (even a rack would do), a desk, a small privacy lock/chain... the bathroom was oversized for the room, but yet it lacked functionality - there was nowhere to put your toiletries (there was plenty of room to install a proper counter on the sink, but yet one was not put in? It was just a sink) there should also have been a hook/rail near the sink for a towel as well. The room was also noisy, so that when anyone was walking past the room door, everything they said could be heard word for word. Also you could hear "housekeeping!" very clearly and loudly when it was called next door. Maybe a card hanging on the door for privacy/room clean would help there. The room was also very stark - no warmth to it at all. My blinds also did not open. On this same trip I stayed at the Renaissance closeby, it was about the same size and price, and it was much nicer.

Moxy is great! It is VERY clean. Rooms are tiny, but comfortable. The location is perfect with places to go and things to do. Upon checking-in one of our rooms wasn't available until 5:30 (check-in is 4:00). That would have been a problem if we didn't multiple rooms. We were able to change and begin preparing for our night while we waited. Also, we went to the rooftop for brunch. The calendar received in an email confirmation stated that there was a brunch with drink specials. The manager claimed that was a special beginning in March. Even though I showed him the February calendar. Front desk was meant to look into it and get back to me....never heard from them.

Short trip to the city for a nice break. Hotel was fun, modern and clean. A great NYC experience. A good place for solo travellers to stay be a they have dedicated single rooms. Big thanks to Steve at the door for carrying my suitcases! Very friendly guy. Only slight problem was that I had loaded my dollars onto a prepaid Visa card to pay for my stay. I did this so that I knew how much I’d be paying in my own currency before I went. But unfortunately the hotel system would not accept that card, so I ended up having to use my credit card anyway then convert my dollars back again - at whatever the rate was on the day. If they could sort this out, it would be great. Prepaid currency cards are very popular nowadays, and I have used them in other hotels without any issues at all.

This was my second time staying at a Moxy hotel and it did not disappoint. The place was beautifully designed. The rooms were comfy and everyone was very helpful. I especially liked the lounge and bar area. Highly recommend this hotel.

JJ was on doors for most of our stay and he was super smiley and super kind! Lovely person to see both at the start of your day and at the end. A ray of sunshine and happiness! Thanks JJ for being awesome

This is an excellent hotel. Close to time square, Empire State Building and much more. One of the perks I love about this hotel is that you can go to the Moxy in Chelsea which as a very nice rooftop. I will highly recommend this hotel.

I have been to the Moxy plenty of times and I am always impressed with the exceptional service. Today was no different during my check-in as I evaluating different room suggestions. Ashley took very good care of me - I am glad she is on the Moxy team.

Make sure that you know what Moxy does/does not offer. If you are okay with Housekeeping never happening, friendly but unhelpful staff, enjoy listening to club music in your room - this is the place for you. I would recommend for the young and young at heart who are staying in NYC for a few days and have a very busy schedule and will only spend a few hours to catch up on snooze at the hotel. I knew what I was getting myself into and as a “millennial” had to see for myself what Moxy was like. Plus location is great - everything is walking distance - and compared to the well known brands is about half the price. I did have a few experiences which led me to the conclusion I will most likely never come back or only stay a few nights when I plan to party hard in the city. Experiences that annoyed me -1) hours of housekeeping depends on the day some days they seem to come before noon > so if you plan to snooze until brunch you will not get your room cleaned. other days they don’t come until 3 or 4pm so if you plan an early shopping/ sightseeing day and want a quick nap before hitting the theaters or dinner you will not get your room cleaned. Because of this my room was only cleaned 1 day out of the 7 nights stayed. And the day it was cleaned was because I was gone for over 30hours visiting upstate.> but you can get “clean” towels from the “stash” which is an amenity closet accesible to guests 2) called for help when I dropped my phone between the bed but took one hour for somebody to come.first off why would you create a bed frame that is not completely fitted to the walls if you have sockets on the wall. the space between the wall and bed frame is perfect for your phone slipping but your arm not fitting! every time I called guest service they told me someone was on the way/ will be there shortly/ someone from front desk just headed for my floor. If it is going to take long don’t lie about it. I finally got fed up and used an iron board (from the stash!) and hanger to get my phone out. It was like a disgusting scavenger hunt as I was also able to collect used tissues, someone’s old receipts and the tv remote. I would recommend the hotel to urgently get a mop so housekeeping can clean this space and also leave some in the “stash” so people can use when they drop their phone.3) it’s just so loud!i get it it’s real close to times square but the club music from the rooftop bar is really annoying. but I guess Moxy wants all of their guests up on the roof partying until 3AM. doubling up on curtains at least should help a tad bit. and yes I am aware that they have ear plugs in the “stash”.Overall if you want to feel nostalgic about living in your college dorm I would recommend! I especially enjoyed the exercise I got from carrying a fridge from the “stash” to my room. Took me back to move in day.

I've stayed at a lot of hotels in NYC over the years and the Moxy is one I will keep coming back to. The staff are very friendly (front desk, bar, restaurant), the breakfast included in the rate is excellent and there are a lot of places to get work done if you're traveling on business (conference rooms, tables for laptops, outlets everywhere, etc.). The rooms are smaller but well appointed ... the huge walk-in shower is my favorite. For the money this place is fantastic.

I stayed recently at the Moxy Times Square. The room was clean, well appointed and the location and price were great! While my stay was short and I was not able to use all of the restaurants/facilities, I would stay there again and do recommend it. The driver for me leaving a review, happened AFTER my stay. I unfortunately left 2 coats in a drawer in the room while packing to leave too quickly. Initially it was a challenge to get a call back from the hotel when I realized what I had done. Finally, I was able to connect with Security (apparently they deal with these issues) which lead to a dead end and quite frankly gave me the impression that this issue was of little concern to the hotel. I called again and ended up reaching Tammy Diggs who I believe is in accounting and billing. While not her area of responsibility, she was polite, courteous, responsive and solution-oriented. After a quick call, she dug into the matter, and within 3 hours, located the items and sent them on their way back to me. My guess is that people leave things at the hotel all the time. There is a real opportunity for the hotel to train the folks in Security to deal with future issues the way Tammy did. Moxy will have happier customers and most likely build loyalty. Thank you again Tammy!

I stayed at the Moxy Times Square for the first time. I found the location to be great. There was a nice vibe in the hotel - although Moxy's tend to be dark which I'm not a big fan of. The room was small but the space was designed nicely. It was perfect for a business trip - I'm not sure that I would stay there on leisure.

The staff at Moxy NYC Times Square were very helpful and nice. The rooms were clean and well laid out. The second floor is a great space to plug in and work for a bit which I appreciated. Great location in New York for both personal and business travel.

We stayed for three nights in a double. The interior is very nice and modern, but I don't know how they are thinking when the rooms have practically no storage for unpacking of the suitcase. I bunch of hooks, some of which would completely hide the TV if used is the only option along with some room under the bed. Also, the showers sound horrible. If the next door neighbour is using the shower it sounds like if you are actually there with them. As showering commences at 5 am in the morning for jetlagged guests, it was impossible to sleep in. Breakfast was inlcuded during our stay and it was half decent. at 23 dollars it did't offer value for money in my opinion.Fitness room was great and open 24/7 and like a said, common areas very chic.

We booked a double room, which looked perfect for our needs on the pictures posted on booking.com. However, we received a smaller room with an entrance right into the bed. Disappointing when I called the front desk and was told that this was the double room despite the pictures that we were shown prior to booking. Overall, nice and clean hotel but very disappointed with spending money on a room that turned out to not be the room.

We stayed here for 4 nights. The hotel is very nice with a welcoming atmosphere and friendly staff. The location is really central and you will be able to visit most places on foot. Highly Recommended.

This was my second time visiting New York. Almost stayed at the same location I stayed at the first time since I’m not too familiar with the area, but luckily I found this hotel. They have just about everything you need in this area. Staff was great especially the doorman, Steve. He was so nice and welcoming. Directed me on where to go and didn’t hesitate to help me with my bags. Made me smile after having such a rough travel day.

This was a great hotel with an excellent location. Even though the rooms were super cramped (in true NYC fashion), the property and it's staff made it well worth the stay. Especially Steve the doorman! He is truly an asset to the property!! Not only was his customer service impeccable. He went out of his way to provide great suggestions on things to see/do, places to eat, and kept me updated on the weather which was a big worry of my mine when arriving. I will definitely recommend this hotel to friends/family and will be staying again during future travel!

Well situated, super clean hotel. Loved all the funky quirky bits in the foyer. It smelt gorgeous too! Staff were super friendly & helpful. Beds were comfy & bathroom was great with lovely smelling toiletries. Lots of choice for breakfast, super fresh fruit,yoghurt, lots of cereal, breads, pastries. I look forward to returning. X

If you are looking for something fresh in the Times Square area, this boutique hotel fits the "bill." While it may be short on living space, it serves entertaining extras (like a handy steamer in the room!) to make up for it. An instagrammers dream!

I stayed here with my daughter and another mother daughter pair.Great location, great staff and services, and most of all great room! We had the room with bunk beds. Very comfortable mattresses and nice design room for four people. I will also use this hotel for work travel!
user_name:
kimbJ2773IU
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: great vibe, amazing staff, rooms were a little IKEA esq - all style, little substance (shower door broken, bed draws wonky etc, but really , considering you don't spend much time in the room it kept you wanting more.

I visited New York alone and with the cost and location I didnt expect much.... oh how I was wrong. Surprisingly spacious room, excellent staff, food and bar. The cost is an absolute bargain for what you get. Location is spot on, right between times square and empire state. I will 100% be returning. Thank you for a fab week!

I found the security amazing, the room cozy and chic all at once, and you’re right in the heart of midtown. The walk from Penn was the easiest thing, and the service was honestly incredible. Having a staff that completely leaves you alone but makes sure you’re secure and set and all of your requests are answered is a rare gem. Magic Hour was the perfect pre concert spot to grab a drink and have a fun hang. I would definitely stay here again.

Recently stayed for 4 nights at the Moxy. It was a very cool hotel and the staff was very friendly and accommodating. The upstairs rooftop bar is not to be missed. Also in a great location, close to everything. Definitely would recommend.

Experience was brilliant from the moment we arrived. Quite a late check in but hey ho more time to explore. So we dumped our bags into secure storage amd walked into the new york city to start our adventure.

Great hotel in a great location . Ideal place for a first visit to New York. I would recommend it to everyone. The only downside is the queues for breakfast and the same food every day. We got fruit then eat out most of the time.

my room was under the restaurant so was very noisy, and between 3-4 am you can hear the trash truck so actually i didn´t sleep so well, but the hotel is beautiful, and have a very good location, i really love the Moxy hotels

It was a good place to stay. Very close to Times Square and other places. Breakfast was included for us, it was a good place to quickly grab a bite to eat before heading out. The room was a little bit loud at nights, but not too distracting.

The Moxy NYC Times Square was a great location for my recent business trip to NYC. I took the train in and out of Penn Station, and the Moxy is a close, easy walk up 7th Ave. The vibe is very hip, and the service is incredibly kind and welcoming. There are food options both in the hotel and walking distance away. The variety of rooms is really great - you can pick the set up that works best for you. I also appreciate that you can request room service every other day which is more environmentally friendly! Overall, great stay.

Moxy is by far the best hotel I've ever stayed at, the decor was really nice. Felt welcomed and safe.. The rooms were very neat and clean.. Halls were nice and quiet then going to the second floor was a nice bar with music and a restaurant. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

We stayed at the Moxy Times Square, coming in from the suburbs for the weekend. The hotel is in a great spot, right outside of Penn Station on 36th street. Anything and everything is outside the door. The hotel is not large but makes incredible use of the space provided. The rooms are small, but so very efficient and impressive. We were given a free breakfast which was worth exactly that. It was served in the Legasea restaurant and was pretty awful. The front check in can be pretty hectic, but the staff does an excellent job handling that.

Our trip from Baltimore to NYC was a nightmare but upon arrival the staff was accommodating and incredibly friendly despite how busy it was. The young woman who checked us in was kind enough to give us a voucher for 2 free appetizers from the Legasea restaurant on the second floor. Our room was clean and comfortable. They have done a great job at maximizing small spaces. We went to dinner at Legasea and they were able to accommodate us without a reservation. The food was fantastic. We were only there one night but our stay was completely worth it. Their proximity to bus stops, Penn station and Madison Square Garden is perfect. We will definitely stay again the next time we are in NYC.

Great location, <10 min walk to/from MSG and subway. ~10 min walk to Time Square. Room is small (expected for New York City), but very clean! Check in took way too long (+15 min) and front desk doesn’t pick up the phone on multiple occasions and goes to VM.

This hotel is beautiful and so conveniently located. The staff was friendly and check in and check out was easy breezy. Defiantly my new place to stay for any New York overnight stays! Thank you, Moxy!

Nice hotel, friendly staff, and great location in the city. The bakery next store was awesome, great coffee and pastries. Close to MSG, Times Square, and easy walking to attractions. We would definitely stay again.

Arrived yesterday for a 6 night stay and could not be happier with our base. We had a super friendly welcome from Ivette upon arrival, who wished my daughter a happy 18th and provided a voucher for complementary appetizers in the Legasea restaurant - very thoughtful. The hotel is in a great location for attractions, the subway and places to eat. I had asked for a quiet room and up on the 17th floor was just that; it may have been the long flight from the UK but we all slept soundly. The rooms are smart, clean and plenty big enough for 3 of us to live comfortably. Love the quirky features like having fold up table and chairs hanging on a peg ready for when you need them. The bed was super comfy and the breakfast was just what was needed to set us up for a day of sightseeing. A fabulous find, couldn't recommend more highly!

Just returned from a 4 night stay at Moxy! Very modern hotel with great staff. Loved the hotel vibe. Great location for venturing out. Make sure you check out Magic Hour roof top bar! Would 100% recommend and re book for future visits. Thanks for a great stay.

Say was awesome ! Great location and very clean. We went for my boyfriends birthday for a weekend stay and walked nearly everywhere- Times Square Central Park etc. very nice area and very safe. Layout of the room was small and cozy.

Stood at this great hotel end of Jan via hotel tonight and it worked out perfectly. Just me which was great due to Close to Penn Station (so if you are coming from Newark Airport via train it's ideal.) Ton of NY staples around, Madison Sq Garden for a game or another event. Macy's if you need some last minute clothing and a few Duane Reades for anything you make have forgotten to pack. The hotel has a barber in the lobby, bar/food as well , but I didn't check either out due to my short trip. Room was small yet cozy. Not much of a view, stayed on the 6th floor. Great water pressure in the shower. if your purpose is to hop around the city and just need a place to lay your head, this is it!! Front desk was awesome! Only complaint is ironing boards are tiny, so if you ball your clothes up.... it may take a little longer to get them crisp.
user_name:
dgnyc113
New York City, New York

review_body: From the moment you walk in, the relaxed and different vibe hits you.. The rooms are small, but with clever storage solutions you can relax and enjoy the space. Beds very comfortable and showers great power.. Service was great, someone always on hand with a smile to make sure your stay is perfect.. Thanks for the jellybeans :)

This is my new go-to hotel in NYC. The rooms are on the smaller side, but the price is definitely worth it (especially because I don’t spend much time in the room). The only things that I don’t like are: coffee isn’t available until 6:30 am in the lobby (which is about an hour later than I prefer) AND that the lobby is HEAVILY perfumed.

Had a great stay with Moxy! Location was in the middle of everything and staff was beyond great. We didn’t have any issues throughout our stay and there were also plenty of activities going on the hotel as well! It was super trendy and accommodating to our needs.

The Moxy Times Square is absolutely ravishing. The staff was wonderful and accommodating assisting us with all of our needs. The room was spacious and pristine with available amenities to make our stay as comfortable as possible. Will certainly return!

Really loved this hotel and thought it represented great value. However I was surprised to see that the breakfast bowls cups etc were all plastic. Given that the meal is served it the hotels Legasea restaurant. Why not use the crockery ? Seeing all the unnecessary waste was sad and I would think that a forward looking "trendy" establishment would have a recycling ethos to match.

The communal areas of this hotel are great, and there's a rooftop bar venue immediately adjacent (technically part of the hotel, but you have to queue outside with all visitors rather than getting any form of priority entry). But, for me, the rooms are not great. I am 5ft 6 and the room was as wide as I am tall - I could fit across it on the bed. The rooms have [comfy!] mattresses mounted on a wooden base that elevates them, but since they are not completely flush to the wall and sealed this means that slim items - such as my mobile phone - easily slip down the side and become irretrievable - cue mad scrambling with a stick. There are no wardrobes as the room instead has a wall covered in hooks to hang your clothes on, which - for my fairly long stay in NYC - felt cluttered and messy. I also found it frustrating to have to clamber onto the bed to lean over and open the blind. I should specify that I was aware of the room style before attending since the photographs are accurate, but simply booked in alongside my colleagues on a work trip in the area, for ease. Essentially, if you're travelling solo and are just in town for a few nights its probably fine, but for longer trips or shared rooms I would personally opt for something more traditionally spacious.

This was my first trip to the city so I wanted to stay somewhere that was easy to get everywhere I wanted to go. It's far enough from time square to avoid the craziness but close enough to walk. The staff are all great. My room was so great, the beds are so comfy and there was a steamer provided!

Everytime we come to NY, we always stay at the Moxy. The vibe of the hotel and super fun, inviting, and the bartenders make a great cocktail. The night staff, Steve Dashaan and Ali, always have great energy whether we were coming or going and consistently made that extra effort to ensure we have a great time with their recommendations of places to go and see. Great staff, great rooms, and a great location!

We love staying at the Moxy. The staff are super cool, especially the night staff, Steve, Dashaan and Ali. They always take good care of us and make sure we have a good time. 10/10 definitely recommend.

Loved The Moxy! Great rates, great location, awesome vibe. Ashley & Johnny Vegas at the lounge bar were fantastic! The entire staff was very attentive to our needs. The rooms are very cool too. We definitely can’t wait to come back!

Moxy is a great and modern hotel, well located in the centre of New York, near Times Square. Wide and clean rooms. When you have a room on the top floors of the hotel, you can hear the music of the rooftopbar during the night. That was the only negative thing of the hotel.

Hotel is very well located and spaces are all beautiful. Double beds in some room configurations may be too small for anyone six feet or taller since the bed is between the window and a wall with no "extra" space at the end of the bed.

Stayed here when they first opened and loved it. This time was horrible. We are titanium level was not mentioned at check in. I had to ask. I asked for a quiet room but was given right above the bar. It was so loud could barely sleep. Asked to be moved. Huge fiasco. Got moved around a couple of times then they tried to put us back in our original room. Our bill was wrong they partially fixed it but we still overpaid by $100. Will not be going back

Stayed at the Moxy for a week and had a really lovely experience.They decorated the room as a surprise for my boyfriend which was extremely thoughtful.The rooms are small but the location makes up for this.Really handy for Times Square, Madison Square Gardens, Broadway etc. Also, close to the subway stations. The shower was excellent. We didn't experience the issue with the noise that many others comment on. I brought earplugs and they worked a treat. We were also on the fourth floor so quite removed from the noise. The breakfast is just OK - we had it included with our stay but had we paid 23 dollars for it each day, we would be disappointed.All staff were extremely helpful and friendly, the doorman JJ especially.Would recommend

I really enjoyed my stay at Moxy in Midtown - The rooms were very comfy and clean. My stay was for a work trip which made their lounge helpful when I needed to do some work. I suggest checking out Magic Hour for a nice rooftop bar.

This was my first trip ever to NYC!!! I was going on a cruise and wanted to be there a day or two early. I picked this property because it was relatively close to the port and is a Marriott property. This hotel couldn't have been in a better location. Very close to the Empire State Building, Macy's & tons of other shops. The hotel was very modern and had minimalistic decor, but versatile as well. I was traveling solo, so got the smallest room, which was fine because I wasn't there much anyway. The bed was comfortable and there was not much street noise from my location. The staff was very helpful with any questions I had. I even did a late checkout, as I was feeling ill before I even left for my trip, (ugh). The nice thing about staying here, if you want to go to Magic Hour (which was quite popular), if you are a hotel guest, you tell the front desk, they will escort you to the club entrance, and you DON'T HAVE TO WAIT IN LINE!!! It was fabulous being treated like a VIP!!, esp since the line stretched down the block and there is no cover charge for hotel guests either. Even though I wasn't feeling great, I felt I had to enjoy one night out in NYC, so I did Magic Hour at the hotel. Unbeknownst to me, it's a basically millenials, very young crowd, but whatever. There were some patrons over 30 there but definitely the minority. I had good time people watching etc. I figured drinks would be expensive, but was not expecting a $15.00 mojito, YIKES-note to self next time I go back. However, the drink was good, made with Bacardi, and the bartenders were excellent, despite the crowds. Music was OK, but aside from bar stools (and they were full quick), there was no place to sit, as all the booths etc were reserved for TABLE SERVICE ONLY!! God only knows what that costs given the price of the drinks, I asked, but never got a straight answer. Overall, it was very unique and I would certainly stay here again. Loved it!!

Modern clean hotel centrally located. Quirky in design. Nice breakfast but would have liked a pancake or french toast option. Staff very nice and Jamal in reception most helpful. Single rooms small as per standard in a big city but well equipped and warm and clean. Nice bar and a rooftop bar. Jamal in reception was most helpful.

This was my first time here. Moxy is part of the Marriott Bonvoy hotel chain, therefore, I was able to book my complimentary room using my free annual anniversary night. I booked this hotel, because it was close to NY Penn Station and the Times Square/Broadway area. My check in went smoothly. I was recognized at Marriott Bonvoy Lifetime Titanium Elite, including complimentary buffet breakfast their Legasea restaurant. The hotel has some of the newer hotel elevators, which take you directly to your room floor by manually entering your room floor and also using my key card. I enjoyed my lunch at the hotel’s Legasea seafood restaurant located in the second floor, where the bar and lobby are also located. See my separate Legasea review.The rooms are very unusual efficient, small and compact in design with pegs on the wall and no furniture except for a folding directors chair and folding table hanging on the pegs. The width of the room is a little larger than the length of the queen size bed. As you can see from my pics our bed was pushed up against the exterior wall with window. The bathroom was also small. The bathroom sink was located in the main bedroom area. This was a unique place to stay for only one night. It was an interesting experience.I walked up to Rockefeller Plaza, St. Patrick’s Cathedral and my restaurant for dinner prior to seeing Hamilton. I used my Marriott Bonvoy app on my iPhone to check out of my room. My hotel bill was accurate. I recommend this hotel for a single night stay especially if you can confirm a good hotel rate.

The Moxy is like the W when they first started . The attention detail is amazing , feels like 5 star hotel and an affordable rate. They fulfill every need , barbershop , gym , great bars , food and staff. I cannot wait for next adventure in a Moxy hotel . Marriott

We only stayed here for one night (raptors game) so we didn’t get to use all of their amenities (i.e. bar, mini golf, gym) but it was a great experience. It’s a pretty modern hotel, when you walk into the hotel instead of one large check-in desk, they have a lot of little kiosks where you check in with a few staff members. The room was clean, we had the room with two double beds, and they were very comfortable. The shower did tend to leak into the main bathroom area, however a few towels solved that problem. Just a heads up if you’re sensitive to perfume smells, there is a lot of scents going on in the hotel. Kind of reminded me of Abercrombie and Fitch, like when you walk into the store and all you smell is perfume. It’s not a bad smell, or too overbearing, it’s just apparent throughout every inch of the hotel from room to lobby to elevator, and I know it’s not for everyone. The hotel is in a nice area, a lot of restaurants nearby. Walking distance to madison square garden and the train station. Would def stay there again!

I’m surprised by this hotel, it’s a lot better than I anticipated. It’s extremely modern and has a very fun hip design. So if that’s not your style then you might not like it.They have a great lounge area with foosball and a giant ice cream machine. One thing I wish they had though, is some sort of breakfast. They do offer free coffee, but breakfast would really make this place stand out.When you stay here, it feels kind a like you’re staying at a club. So it’s a lot of fun that way. But for those who don’t like new designs and want fridges, irons, and other items… This might not be for you.

We enjoyed our stay very much. The location is excellent, minutes on foot from Times Square and other attractions. Very comfy mattresses, helpful staff, coffee-to-go in the mornings. Everything is clean and modern, good atmosphere, fast elevators, nice lounge area for relaxation, great interiors, good music. Minus for repeatable breakfast (same food every day, no vegetables) and too much plastic (Moxy - offer your guests glasses and reusable cups!) and dark rooms (I would have liked to switch on more lights). Overall the stay was great.

Way to hip for me. I booked a room for my sister and her 22 year old daughter. I used points and was very happy that each night was just 30 K points. My niece had stayed at a Moxy downtown last year and just loved it. When we walked into the lobby there were no chairs or sofas. That was my first sign of how different this hotel was. The staff was very friendly at check in. The room was tiny. A bed that went from wall to wall with the TV hanging over the end of it. And a bathroom, that's it. The girls loved it so what do I know. Very convenient for midtown activities.

For my mom’s birthday this year, I thought I’d bring her to New York and I found this gorgeous hotel! I had sent them an email to tell them about my mom’s birthday and boy did they impress us! We arrived to a fully decorated room and my mom was so happy!!The staff is extremely kind and helpful, rooms are small but fun and modern, the bathroom is awesome! Breakfast was great, but in my opinion, was lacking in “sweet” stuff like croissants, pastries, etc...MOXY is perfectly situated, walkable distance to Times Square, Bryant Park (we even walked to the financial district and we’re not that fit haha)!Overall an amazing experience, would ABSOLUTELY return!Ps: NO RESORT FEE! (Unlike most hotels in NY now!)

Love the design of the hotel and the security aspect of having to scan your room key in order to get in the elevator to go the floor your room is on. The hotel bar is beautiful but unfortunately had terrible service. Staff of the bar were either just standing around ignoring us or socializing. Great food though and the drinks were incredible.

Was staying here for few nights and chose this mainly because of it was in good location, it was trendy/urban enough and price was not off the roof.Whole hotel is decorated nicely and that atmosphere was around in every location at hotel: lobby, restaurant, bar and room.Room is very small but it still was very convenient, at least to me travelling solo. Toilet/bathroom was spacious which was kind of funny compared to room size but I wasn’t complaining.Soundproofing is obviously something that builders in USA don’t know how to do, so you’re able to hear everything from the hall and also from ventilation ducts. It was okay in other nights but on Friday it was affecting to sleeps. Also bed located near to window was a bit annoying because cold wind came through the window to your shoulders and neck. Bed itself was very comfortable and nice!Breakfast was okay, little selection but I didn’t need anything else.I really liked this hotel, could come again!

I always love staying at The Moxy. Service is excellent, rooms are clean (love the shower!!), great location - close to Penn, great atmosphere, cozy, super cute! My home away from home whenever I go to the city!!

The Poxy as is became know in our group. What a joke of a place. We booked the as the rooftop bar looked nice and it was my boyfriends first visit to NYC. The rooftop bar is rubbish. Cheap and tacky looking with expensive price tag. We went once and then left. We booked our rooms (our friend was travelling with us) direct on the hotels website. And PAID in full £2000 a room over NYE (we thought we might go the rooftop bar but after visiting didn’t bother!) We arrived after a long flight from UK to be told our room had been sold... we paid in full, over a month before.. £4000 in total..They gave us a cheaper room on the noisiest floor and said come back tomorrow morning and we will move you....Didn’t sleep as it’s sooooo noisy and the rooms are beyond small. I’ve just spent a month in NYC and this is the worst hotel ever...Anyways the next morning we went down to reception to get moved and unpacked into the room we had paid for and... sold again... no room?!!!!! This place is a money grabbing beyond reason!! After talk to the staff this happens ALL the time!! BE CAREFUL DO NOT BOOK!! There is so much competition in NYC it’s NOT worth it.As you can imagine we asked to talk to the manager, he promised free drinks, reimbursement of room free etc.. we left at 4am the morning of our flight.. have been charged for drinks AND the management of the hotel has emailed us ‘we never offer or give reimbursement’ we all heard it!!!!!!!!!DISGUSTING and DISGRACEFUL service! We are continuing to sort this out but I though people need to be aware. Don’t bother with this place-it sucks!!!!

Hello guys n girlsWell I booked moxy as I think from web sight look great modern style amazing features etcBut once I arrived there was no warm welcome but just shown to pad to book in , no one to tell me about hotel or anything,Think staff need to look at this as not great first impression! Now we was on the third floor and omg the sound from there own bar was horrendous with no thought for their own guest.So this only second night of no sleep , So I would give this hotel miss , this has made a dream holiday a nightmare Stay away from the moxy

Must be the smallest room in NYC. Clean, tidy and a good rate - for New York. Breakfast was included. Fantastic location would certainly recommend providing you like broom cupboards. We would certainly stay there again.

Really enjoyed our stay. Clean rooms. Sassy and playful decoration. Excellent location. The staff was helpful and polite. I would definitely stay here again. It's a little expensive, but worth it for a special occasion.

This was my 2nd time at The Moxy Times Square. I love the convenient, central location - just a few blocks from Penn Station. Service was fine. My hair dryer didn't work, so after about 20 minutes someone brought me a new one. Glad I wasn't in a big hurry.

This was my second stay. I was here four nights. A nice place. Small room so don’t think you’re going to hang out in your room all day. But that’s the point isn’t it? Get out to see the city , experience shows, meals and historic sites. The price here is worth it. The neighborhood is great. I will be coming back again in the future.

room was nice and hipstery! loved how the bathroom was setup and the rainfall shower head !the only thing that was really missing was a fridge in the room !when you come in the lobby staff was friendly and ready to help check you in fast.elevators was nice that you need to scan your key with to get to your room.

Stayed here for 2 nights, solid hotel, well priced, clean and trendy! Staff was also helpful and pleasant! Rooms are small but efficient. Noise level for hotel was also very acceptable! Good location and walked to convention center from the hotel!

I travel to NYC for business on a regular basis. On this trip, I decided to try something new when I read about the Moxy Hotel. I was not disappointed.The entry is clean, unique and inviting. Love the look. The staff was welcoming, friendly and helpful. I appreciated the secure and efficient elevator/lift call system, and the decor throughout the hotel.I wanted an efficient, clean and comfortable room and they delivered (think “tiny home” efficient). I had a single room with a queen sized bed. The layout is efficient and easy to navigate. The room was clean and organized. Tables and luggage racks were stored/hung from coat pegs all along the wall. You need it, you take it off and use it. You’re done, you hang it. These pegs also made it easy to hang my backpack out of the way and my coat on a large, attached hanger. The large shower with waterfall shower head and the toilet stall shared an efficient area segmented by a single sliding door. Water pressure and heat were great. The sink and related amenities are outside the shower/toilet space, along the side and “in the room.” Loved the simplicity and completeness of the efficiency. Plenty of storage under the bed for clothing and a separate storage for luggage on the lowest floor (which I didn’t need to use but appreciated). The decor in the room reminded me of a combination of a 1920’s tiled pool/bathhouse (replete with “NO DIVING” tiled into the floor of the shower) and a Scandinavian hotel room. Tile, wood, metal. I can’t recall ever having a large flatscreen television in a hotel room that had “window” channels of bubbling brooks, Icelandic landscapes, forests replete with sounds. It was like looking out the window into a different landscape and I didn’t have to have the television on a channel. It served a different purpose.I found the hotel cost to be highly competitive (surprisingly so) in my experience with NYC hotels. It’s location and proximity to Penn Station, Madison Square Garden, Chelsea, etc. was fantastic. The bar area on the second floor included large comfy chairs and meeting rooms. Again, the decor was unique, interesting and wonderful.This is my new “goto” hotel when I’m traveling on business to this area of NYC. I think I would also choose to stay there when traveling with my family, I just don’t have a sense of the size of the larger rooms but imagine they’d be just fine.

Come out onto 7th Ave. Time Square to the right, Macy's to the left. Easy walking for everywhere including Empire State. Hotel was relaxing after busy days out. Clean and comfortable. Staff very friendly and helpful.

I'd like to mention just one thing, everything else was good enough: for breakfast could've done with a few veggies / fruits. The only "green" choice was a banana. The orange juice too was just water with orange taste.

Nice hotel, great staff and awesome location with small but very nicely arranged rooms. This hotel has a few nice bars and a rooftop bar/club type atmosphere with great drinks. For a quick weekend I would definitely stay here again.

We really enjoyed our 3-night stay at Moxy Time Square. I particularly appreciated the fact that it is only a 3-star hotel but wow, it really went over and beyond what is expected of a 3-star hotel with amazing details and amenities, lots of fun and quirky hotel decor, the Magic Hour rooftop bar was so over-the-top, and the complimentary breakfast and coffee at Egghead was so good. You can't beat the location either! We walked to everything. And when we were jetlagged, we decided to go to Time Square at around 4am because it was so near, and we got to do time square photos with no people but us! With a window view of Empire State Building from our room, and Time Square just literally a few steps away--you just really can't beat that real estate value. And although the rooms are compact, the use of each and every space was ingenious--the shower was incredibly roomy despite the room being compact, and all the leather and black hardware details in the room were super cool.One CON though--the bartender at the 2nd floor should NOT be in the hospitality business. He seemed to hate being there, he was so surly and irritated all the time, and was incredibly unfriendly towards my husband. We are a very quiet Asian couple that just quietly and politely ordered drinks and he scowled at my husband like we did something wrong. To be fair, all the other staff member we encountered, from the front desk to the wait staff at the restaurant, to the doormen at the hotel and bar were all very helpful and nice. It was just that bar guy from the 2nd floor that was so mean.

When you call here you get the idea that you’re coming to a place that’s very different. You’re greeted by a clearly British accent that is way cool. When they finally pick up the phone they say “what’s up? “ So I had an idea before I got here that this was a different kind of place. The room is the smallest hotel room I have ever stayed in. That being said it is very clean, and well appointed. I’m only staying for two nights, and will have an active schedule in New York, so I won’t be spending much time here, and it will do. If I were in town for a week to do sightseeing, with a weeks worth of luggage etc. I don’t think I could stay here.Still a very interesting use of space.

Moxy Times Square is perfectly located near Times Square. Good vibes at the bar of the Hotel, meeting rooms ok.Small rooms yet comfortable and well designed. Rooms with street view a little bit noisy, because of the nightclub.

This hotel was so cute and chic i loved the decor! The location was prime for us since we were seeing a show on broadway. My husband and I got a cocktail on the rooftop, & fell in love with the view of the empire state building!! Def would recommend this hotel to friends and family.

Good Points: + The hotel is in a good location, within 5-10 mins walk of Times Square.+ The hotel is kept very clean and looks very modern.+ The pricing isn't too bad, given the location.Bad Points:+ The staff are some of the rudest people I have ever met. Any question or interaction seemed like a massive imposition on their part and at one point I found myself apologising for asking.+ My card was billed upon check-in without my authorisation nor pre-warning. + I was taken aback as to how small the room was. I don't want for much but there wasn't any space to store / hang clothes, so for four days my clothes stayed in my luggage. + This isn't a hotel; it's a venue. The music from the club (that's open to the public) beats well into the night. Add the restaurant that also open to the public and its serious "hustle and bustle". If you're looking for a restful place to crash after a long day in the Big Apple, this is NOT for you.+ The pillows are dreadful: a strange small square that I would more describe as a scatter cushion. (Add this to the loud music, the endless lift / elevator noise, people running up and down the corridors and it made for a horrendous nights sleep). Overall, I would describe this hotel like a branch of Abercrombie & Fitch:Dark, noisy and full of idiots. **I'm annoyed at myself for not bringing the issues up to management sooner, but I was worried I would be greeted with more "sass" and I just didn't have the energy to deal with it**

Spent there 6 nights an a bigger room with Queen-size bed on 14th floor. That was perfect for our stay, the "normal" rooms are much smaller and we were happy with our room. It was clean and well-equipped, the bed was comfortable. Hotel staff was always kind and polite, check-in and out went really fast.But... a good hotel in an excellent location in Manhattan should have a breakfast buffet that matches its standard... but it didn´t! What a terrible selection (almost none), plastic cups for coffee and (instant) orange juice... that has really been the worst breakfast I ever had all around the world - very disappointing!Improve that and we would come back!

Very clean and more spacious than I anticipated. I’ve been to New York City 4 times and this is the best hotel I’ve stayed at so far. I will definitely come back to moxy next time I visit New york city.
Location is great, check in is easy, room is small but nice. Breakfast buffet was fine. Roof top bar was a hot mess but fun.Only negative was that our room was sooo hot! Could not get the AC to work.

We had a great time at MOXY NYC. People were helpful, rooms were compact, bed was great as was the shower. Would recommend staying here for a city break and if you are looking for a hip and modern hotel in the heart of NYC.

The stay was enjoyableThe location is perfect and the staff were incredibly helpful and friendlyThe bar is quite nice but think there should be a distiction made before arrival that the rooftop bar is not in your building but around the corner

I've stayed in a lot of hotels, mostly Marriott's sometimes Hilton and they are pretty much cookie cutter. At least you know what you'll get. We wanted to try something new and stayed here for a night. WOW!!!! Super cool, fun, quirky. The rooms are definitely small so know the person you're with very well! The seafood restaurant is great. The rooftop bar is awesome!! So fun for any age! There's a chill spot by the 2nd floor bar with a lounge offering an array of board games. I'd stay here again in a heartbeat.

This is the 2nd time in 6 months that I’ve stayed at this location and I truly will stay here again on my next trip to NYC. The ease of checking in, the cleanliness of the entire location was perfection. The bars, restaurant and seated area on the 2nd floor are just what I needed.

I traveled with my family and in general it's a good option, is near to many places, and everybody have a good attitude to help you with any doubt.Everything is fine, but I would change the breakfast menu that is included in the reservation, because every day we ate the same (scrambled eggs, potatoes, bread, bacon, pork sausages and cereals) maybe I would add more options or change them per day.We want to thanks to J.J the door man, for his helpful!

We visited NY for thanksgiving and the first few days of Dec. Amazing location, right around the corner from Macy’s and a few blocks from Times Square- we could wander and watch the balloon parade with ease. The light up staircase was great for photos! The room size (we had queen I think) was fine and the styling was cool, especially the bathroom and in room sink. Room was cleaned daily and there was a handy steamer in the room (also irons and other amenities in a help your self room on each floor if needed). The hotel reception glows pink and smells amazing- but think the strong perfume caused me an allergic reaction as my eyes swelled and reacted if I spent too much time in there. Rooms and corridors were fine however. There were cvs and walgreen stores nearby where I picked up some allergy meds. Use your pass card to swipe for lifts and get in the number the screen directs you too. We were on 3rd floor and it was noisy, some street noise and club music, but not too bad and we were tired so could sleep okay. Ear plugs provided too for light sleepers! It’s right by all cuisine restaurants you could want, and has a snack cafe behind the bar. Free coffee behind bar too 6-10am, really delicious to bring back to room or grab on way out to explore. We made use of the oysters and crab beignet happy hour at Legasea (hotel restaurant) and it was great. I’m not done with New York, and I would stay at Moxy again!

We travelled with Virgin Holidays and chose to stay at the Moxy Times Sq. This was our first time in New York so we wanted to be amongst the main attractions, I can safely say that we couldn’t have picked a better hotel. The rooms were small (as are all in NYC) but excellently laid out, very clean, comfy beds, great shower and great rooftop bar with carousel. The staff were fantastic too, all willing to help and friendly, especially STEVEN THE DOORMAN. He always gives a daily friendly hello and even helped us grab our bags in a last minute rush for our transfer.Thank you Moxy, A++++++++

The location is great, you are in the centre of everything and you are close to all the main attraction of the city. The rooms are quite clean too and the place is aesthetic. However the staff was not very welcoming when we arrived and they were not always eager to satisfy our needs (e.g. needed more towels, the girl told me to go and get them from a room, what?!). It really depended on the person tho, some of the staff was helpful and nice. Rooms were not really soundproof, more than once we fell asleep with loud music. However, if you need a place to stay if you are in NYC with friends, it might be the place for you.

If you you want to experience the real downtown of NY, this is the place. It’s like living in a movie. The hotel is modern and youthful. There’s a cockiness over it. Decide your own pace all the time. They are there for you, but you can definitely just hang around as if it’s your home from home. Outside is loud. You hear police sirens all the time and a lot of noise. The club at Moxy is also very noticeable. All this just contributes to the NY experience. If you want a normal and quiet stay, you should look somewhere else, but if you want to live at a nice modern hotel in the heart of this city, this is your choice for sure. We loved it!

The hotel met our needs and overall we enjoyed our stay. The location is great, we were able to walk everywhere. We stayed in a 2 bunk room and 4 separate beds for 4 people is an oddity that was perfect for our group. They had clearly added additional soundproofing to our room and it was probably one of the quietest hotel rooms I’ve stayed in. Between that and the very effective blackout curtains, we slept like babies! We were in an accessible room so had a bit of extra space, but the room was still rather cave like and I wouldn’t want to spend a lot of time there, but who goes to New York to stay in their hotel room? The bathroom was large and easy to use in a wheelchair without looking clinical. Elevators worked well with a few glitches (not stopping at our floor once even though we got on the right one, leaving before you had time to walk from the touch pad to the elevator, being too crowded to get on). Overall, I think it probably is way more efficient than without the electronic system. DO NOT pay extra for breakfast at this hotel! They had a sign saying “New year, new breakfast” and I’m not sure what they are thinking with the dreadful buffet they are serving. Here is what they had: bacon, sausage, scrambled eggs and potatoes (not bad, but maybe some cheese & or salsa for the dry eggs?), cold toast (with butter and strawberry jam), bananas, corn flakes, fruit loops, and a big bowl of plain yogurt (nothing to put in it, no honey, no granola, no fruit other than the bananas, who eats plain yogurt without anything in it???) To drink: coffee, tea, and one kind of artificial tasting juice punch thing. No other baked goods, no other fruit option. They ran out of napkins and after a long wait finally came in with paper towels from the bathroom. There was a sign saying they were charging $23 for this. We were given free breakfast for one day because of some problems at checkin and still didn’t think it was worth it. If we had more than one day free, we would not have gone back a second time. There was also confusion about the hours. The first day we tried to eat there we called to check the hours, were told it went until 1030, roused the teenagers, got there about 20 minutes later, at a few minutes after 10 and were told they finish at 10.

Location location location this Hotel has an amazing location and that is very important in any trip especially if you are at NYC, the staff is nice but the bad part of this was the ridiculous TINY rooms with a mini small window in the rooms!

Great and easy place to stay. Located centrally near most major transportation. The rooms are small but impeccably styled, clean and comfortable. Will return to this hotel and this location again. Staff was also very friendly and helpful.

We loved our stay at Moxy! Can’t wait to come back. It will be our hotel choice in nyc next time. Good location. Clean, stylish, modern decor. Very Comfortable king size bed. Nice water Pressure from the shower. Excellent Security and friendly staff. We enjoyed the Moxy Bar as well!

A very lively hotel sort of near Times Square- actually on 7th between 36 and 37 streets so not close to Times Square at all. The reception was loud and somewhat manic but receptionist was very polite though hard to hear. The hotel has programmed elevators- Fortunately I am familiar with those but I had to assist several confused travelers who did not know to type in their floor. There is a barbershop and a club in the hotel so very lively.My room was tiny but impeccably clean - a huge plus. The room is well laid out and very comfortable.So as a business traveler the ambience is fun but a bit much. Once you get past the elevators it was quiet and rather nice. The location was ok but the Times Square in the title is kind of bogus.The price was ok for a Marriott.With all that I actually liked the hotel. But you should be mentally ready for it.

Great position to visit the city, rooms are very clean and very well furnitures, staff was awesome as well. I would totally recommend the place and would get back in a future time. Breakfast is also available and cannot complain at all about what’s provided

Amazing hotel! Room was clean, modern and trendy. The shower was a dream. Check in and check out was easy. Loved every minute of our stay. Will be back soon. Great location. Staff very friendly and helpful. Rooftop bar wonderful.

This was the best hotel stay by far I’ve ever had. And I’ve stayed at some nice places. I always want a place to lay my head in the city that feels practical, comfortable, and worth the $. This is it.

The location is excellent, close to major metro stationsStaff is young and welcoming, rooms are small but as often in New York But it a noisy . Even at the 16th floor, the noise of the city is important , in addition when the guest next room is having a shower, the pipes are making a terrible noiseThe organization of the breakfast should definitely be Improved, considering the price of the rooms. Not easy to get a simple tea every morning, for 3 days it was a la carte, then breakfast was a simple buffet served in a too small dining room

My favorite midtown hotel by far. Rooms are adequately sized for two people, the showers are the best in manhattan, and the staff is incredibly helpful and friendly. Anytime I'm passing through NYC this is my first choice.

I’m a bit surprised by the positive reviews that all clearly point out how tiny & closet-less the rooms are. I’ve stayed in Manhattan approximately 20 times, with many price ranges lower than our $400 room & this was by far the tiniest, most non-functional room in which I’ve ever stayed. They never should have booked this room for 4 people as it was simply 2 full (or less) sized beds pushed together end to end with a narrow walkway to the bathroom. We could not even put out suitcases out and had to leave almost everything packed for our entire 5 day stay. The rooms don’t even make use of smart storage or high shelving etc other than a small box below the bed. The pegs around the perimeter of the room were the most insane solutions for hanging clothing/hats I’ve ever seen. This was all topped off by a narrow sink with little storage space and a “lovely” view of the sad looking gray interior. The only upside was joking & laughing about the rooms with fellow travelers in the bars. We got ready in shifts so made good use of the bars so 1-2 people could actually move around this unbelievable room. If most definitely made me think of a youth hostel in a foreign country. I’m surprised they haven’t moved to bunk beds to cram even more rooms into this place...or maybe they have. One star for the shower & bars only.

I was really skeptical about staying here as I was really worried about the size of the room. I was very happy I stayed here and am now familiar with the Moxy brand. I was very impressed with the room. I had a corner room. Rooms while small, felt bigger because it is so beautifully designed with impressive use of space. There is a small round table and couple of chairs all of which are folded neatly and hung on the wall. You can set it if you like or leave it tucked away if you don't. There was no closet but several hooks and hangers along the wall where you could put your clothes.There was a nice bar and restaurant area and there were few other dining options, including a take-away breakfast place called egg-head. There is also a terrace bar that I did not go to but the entrance is from outside the hotel as it is run by an independent company.If i was traveling with family, the room would be too tight but if it is one (or even two) adults, it is really nice.

All in, this is an ok hotel. The front welcome is a bit rash and underwhelming. Then you get to your room. Our room was big but very basic and no furniture aside from the bed which was pushed right over to one side of the room. There are very limited facilities in the room, no tea/coffee, iron, secure Wi-Fi. Don’t look under the bed - it really needed a good clean!But the location is excellent, just a few blocks from Times Square and close to Penn station and the Empire State Building. The hotel is fine for a few nights but I certainly wouldn’t stay for a week.

The property is excellent, staff are exceptional but, and it’s a big but, your enjoyment of your stay will be dependent on your rooms proximity to the nightclub that runs the every night. Stayed for 7 nights in a variety of rooms on different floors and the nightclub noise was a concern every time.

this is the hotel. Obviously New York is cold in December, but a vibrating bed... this is new to me. The heater is literally attached to the bed, so when it kicks on, the bed kicks on. Checkin is at 4pm. They were kind enough to take my luggage at 330. Upon returning at 430 the room still was not ready. No where else to go, we went to the hotel bar. I don’t want to be too hard, but no wonder it’s only a 3 star. Each drink is $15.00, and remind me of my the college bar I used to go to, who only charged $4.00

Looks pretty and stylish from the outside, but the service is the worst I have ever experienced - both in the bar and in the hotel.The staff couldn’t find my luggage that I had handed in, gave me someone’s else’s suitcase instead, no excuse for letting me miss my train due to their incompetence etc.). Cannot recommend!

Usually breakfast is the way to have a good start of your day. Unfortunately here at Moxy Times Square it is not. Having paid $30 p.p extra for breakfast one should expect something.For each day a voucher is given at check-in. This voucher allows for one item on the menu. I had a breakfast sandwich, which is basically a cheeseburger without the burger. Then I asked for a cappuccino. This is not included on the voucher and will be charged extra.Wait a minute? I paid $30 for a $13 sandwich and need to pay another $5 for a cappuccino? When I ask if a combination of for example yoghurt and oatmeal is possible. The answer is short. NO!I do not look forward to using the remaining 5 days vouchers at all! Real pity

Love the concept. Hotel located just off Times Square. Super easy to reach. Super easy check in. Super easy check out. Common spaces really nicely done. Real invitation to chill during breaks from visiting Manhattan. Rooms really good, although really small too. Breakfast very good. Roof terrace splendid, even if it is too bad they don't accept teenagers on it instead of accepting them and simply not serving alcohol to them. Price: very expensive. Bottom line: I would rate the hotel excellent if it wasn't for the size of the rooms vis-a-vis the astronomical price one pays for them and the fact that the only outdoor space is not accessible to families.

Just got back from Moxy Times Square and what a fabulous stay we had! We stayed from the 19th-24th of December and everything was perfect. It was my boyfriend’s birthday during the stay and they decorated the room for his birthday. You’ll see in many reviews the room is described as being ‘incredibly small’.. you will find this in any hotel you stay in whilst in New York and let’s be honest, your there to see the city not stay in the room! The rooms are more than efficient, clean and functional. The hotel is quirky, central and friendly. I’ll definitely be back!! Thank you Moxy

Dreadul hotel - the Chelsea Moxy is much much nicer. My room was accidentally sold to someone else on the night I checked in and i was given a 2nd floor room with 2 single bunk beds instead - it was hot, cramped, noisy, and definitely not worth the c.$700 I was charged for it! THe night after I was moved to a marginally better room and given $200 of bar credit as compensation - I was told if I did not spend this it would be refunded to my card.Upon checking out, I was told that indeed there was no refund and as I did not use the bar credit (given I was there on a business trio, working until late with no time) I effectively was offered no compenation at all.Email correspondance on this issue was met with a very rude and abrupt response that would frankly put me off staying in a Moxy ever again.

Moxy is a perfect location for main turist point of interista. Good night sleep and good price quality.I would recommend to Anyone to state there for 4/5 nights or Also more. Good staff and... see you soon
user_name:
filedoga
New York City, New York

review_body: The location of the hotel is perfect. 30-60 minutes drive from JFK. 10 min walk from Times Square, 20 min from Central Park.
