Enough (good) restaurants (also for breakfast) on a few minutes walk. The restaurant from the hotel is fine also. The rooftop bar is a dissappointment. A bit run down, nothing special. Maybe in the summer its more attracting. We had a look but decided to go into down to look for something more attractive.The rooms are really, really small but it works. The bed is fine and the shower perfect. But the room is ony suitable for sleeping and taking a shower. If your room is facing 7th Avenue, realize the nights are noisy (but thats why you are in downtown Manhattan). The rooms with bunkerbeds for 3 or 4 children are perfect by the way. our 3 boys stayed in this room and really enjoyed it. All in all we had a good stay on a perfect location. We would book it again.

The location is ideal. Walking distance to Times Square, Herald Square, Subway Stations & Koreatown. Rooftop Lounge, Legasea & The Bar offer convenient and good options for meals or drinks. We loved the ambience & interior decorating of the Hotel. The rooms are small but well layout and organized. The Staff were helpful & nice to deal with.

We stayed in a double bed room. The frosted divider glass to the bathroom would be ideal for a couple; however, is very awkward for a family. I'd recommend a curtain wall be added for privacy. Our room was simply a room that was divided by the glass attached to the bathroom. This hotel is geared more towards the youthful crowd with their bar and modern style. Overall, it is clean and accommodating. The Elevators were a maze that proved to be a bit frustrating when you just need to get somewhere. 200 character minimum review, so I'm now just writing words... lol lol lol lol lol lol lol lol lol lol lol lol lol lol lol lol

This really is a review of 2 halves. On one hand, the hotel was clean, modern and had excellent facilities. The rooms whilst small are clean and there is plenty of storage as long as you’re imaginative with the space. They have everything you require and are extremely comfortable. I used the hotel gym regularly which is great, especially that it’s open 24/7 and the bar facilities are great. I love the little touches they had when we visited, such as Prosecco on arrival, daily complementary coffee and every evening they would serve free pink hot chocolate in the lobby! All in all very impressive. However, the rooms are not at all sound proofed. There is a lot of noise from the street (expected) but also from other guests coming back late in the corridors. The room thermostat was set at 20 degrees and when it dropped below in the rooms heater would kick in and it was the noisiest thing ever!!! It would rattle and vibrate loudly every 25 minutes for 5 minutes through the night, keeping us awake. We asked for it to be turned off which the staff obliged with and for a night everything was fine... until they turned it back on (unsure why, we didn’t ask them too) which lead to another sleepless night, this routine happened every other night!! Finally the first couple of times we used the toilet it backed up with sewage water and over flowed, the hotel were very apologetic and sorted it immediately though!!Overall I probably would stay again if the noisey heater would be left off!!

The hotel was centrally located and very clean. The rooms are small however they are efficient. I could probably not stay here more then 2 nights as it can get tight and not a lot of privacy from the bathroom. This is not in our demographics but it was a nice stay overall. The front staff was so busy and spoke so fast it took a while to figure out where our bags were and how to use the elevator. Overall a fine experience

This boutique hotel is awesome..friendly staff and beautiful atmosphere.....just a 5 star rating.The breakfast was incredible as well as the drinks at the bar. So pleasent and concerning of ones needs.

We booked this hotel for a family vacation in NYC. Not ideal. Bathrooms are only semi-private! Only have a frosted class wall that reveals too much. Rooms are very tight quarters. No closets or drawer space. Great choices for food, though.

Okay so here’s the thing, I spend about 50% of my time traveling for work and always stay at Marriotts. I’m Platinum Elite about to hit Titanium this weekend. There are things that business travelers need to enjoy their stay, sleep being one of them if not the most important. I was out on the 17th floor but was never told at check in that I was staying directly (I mean directly) below the rooftop bar, which blasted remixed top hits til 2AM nightly. Had I been warned at check in about the noise I would have kindly asked for a different floor, no biggie. But I wasn’t. And discovered this while trying to sleep. I had 6AM wake up calls both days. I asked to get moved. They couldn’t move me. I just stuck it out since it was just 2 nights Let me state the positives, great location. Cool ambiance. Fun place to stay. I would have probably been on that rooftop singing those Rihanna hits if it wasn’t for being on a work trip. There is no coffee in the rooms so be prepared to bring a non embarrassing pair of comfy clothes to jet to the 2nd floor fresh out of bed and get you some. When checking out and asked about my stay I gave my honest feedback. I was told I would be gifted points for the inconvenience of the noise and asked to write a nice review. This review was nicer and left out more of the not so great feedback but since they never came thru with their gifting of points I decided to be honest. So here we are. :) PS. If you are a Platinum Elite member and are used to breakfast, note their version of “breakfast” is bite sized pastries. The menu breakfast, however, is delish even if not free.

We walked in and found computer stations to check ourselves in. When the one attendant came over and asked if our checkin was ok and we said no, he proceeded to tell us about the hotel restaurants and hours of operation. We would not have known any of this if we had checked ourselves in. He also explained how to use their computerized elevators which we didn’t find all that great in moving people along since there were sometimes several people lined up trying to get to their rooms. One evening one of the computers was not working! The rooftop bar? Well, it’s outside the hotel and it doesn’t seem to belong to the hotel. We tried to get in one evening and had to wait in a long line with non-hotel guests. We left!The service at the hotel restaurant/bar was ok. We went to get snacks at a self-serve area. We asked a waiter who sent us to the bar; the person at the bar sent us back to the self-serve area where we waited until the waiter could ring us up. The rooms are very small- I didn’t expect much from a room in NYC, but even by these standards the rooms are small. Also, not many amenities readily available like lotion and shower caps. At night we could hear all the noise outside even though we were 10 floors up.One other thing - if you are sensitive/allergic to smells or have asthma, the hotel lobby seems to have some sort of strong musty cologne odor. I had to hold my breath when I walked through. Just Yuck!We can not recommend this hotel and we would never stay here again. As a matter we had plans to go back to NYC in January and we are looking for other accommodations.

Ideally located between Penn Station and Time Square. Staff was helpful. Rooms are clean and recently furnished but very small (below average in the area) ; breakfast options in the neighborhood are multiple, as well as cheaper restaurant options

I am not the target demographic for this brand. That being said, I slept great and was productive over a two night December stay. The goodWell thought out and executed rooms. I stayed in a double. Ample floor space to set out the travel and chair for eating and working. I used the other chair as a luggage rack. My clothes hung on the wall pegs. Good sized tv. Functional and easy to use wall mount. Excellent lighting with dimming functions. Great windows. I scored a corner rooms. Lots of night. Deep window sills doubled as storage for chargers, small items, toiletries, water etc. The windows also open Comfortable bed and pillows. I can toss and turn in a hotel bed. I needed my alarm to get me up both days. Love the Stash- where I could go and grab and extra blanket faster than anyone could have run it up to me. Quiet. Some noise from people in the hallway before 10 pm. Then nothing. Good temperature control. The unit vent was placed behind the headboard - where it blows up and diffuses into the room. Unit was also responsive and quiet. Small but functional bathroom. Good sized shower. Good water pressure. Quick, easy and friendly check in. Quick, easy and no hassle luggage storage at departure. I liked that all the collateral was on the hanging clipboard. Too many hotel have too many pieces of paper and notes and cards all over the place and you have to move them all out of your way. I can't say enough about the room design and clever features. Among the best I have seen. Eat at the Egg place. Just go. The disappointingI left my room at 7:30 am and put out the housekeeping sign. I returned at 1:30 pm. The room had not been refreshed. Housekeeping knocked at 4:15 pm. I declined service. It was too late in the day at that point. Sat in lounge space for an hour at lunchtime and was never approached by a server. I would have eaten and had a drink. The lounge is a comfortable space to work during the day. RandomI would have expected this chain to offer reuse of towels/bedding. It's possible this is an 'opt out' hotel where that happens automatically. Unsure as I didn't take service. The bar from happy hour on was a madhouse. 1it would be nice if the restaurant would show some accomodation to hotel guests. I was turned away. I would have thought a single diner at 7 pm or a Tuesday could be fit in somewhere without an hour wait. I'd stay here again and would recommend it to others.

Steven the door man is the best! He stood out in the rain and got us a cab immediately! We were in a rush and really needed help! He was so kind and so helpful! The staff is so great but his initiative was definitely noticeable. Would recommend this hotel, will be staying here again.
user_name:
sydneyd723
New York City, New York

review_body: We stayed one night at Moxy in NYC and were pleasantly surprised with this hotel. We were in town for a concert and to stroll through the city to fall into the Christmas spirit. Check in was a breeze and we were even provided early check-in without hesitation. The rooms are small but well thought out in terms of space utilization. Those who are complaining in their Trip Advisor reviews about the room size should carefully ready the hotel’s website information which clearly states the rooms are small but the experience BIG. There are plenty of hooks which hold in-room necessities like, a clipboard for writing, a folding table, folding luggage caddy and a small folding table for breakfast in bed or to use your computer in bed. The entire wall span has hooks so in addition to these items, there are plenty left over to hold jackets, purses, etc. Also mounted on the wall right next to the bed is large flat screen TV that is on a swivel arm for viewing while in the room or in bed (genius!).The shower and toilet area is separated from the room by a sliding door with soft closure (brilliant!) and very adequate in size. The rainfall shower head had just the right water pressure and did not drown you like some others. The fixtures and tiles were modern and stylish. The sink is outside of the general bathroom area and was nicely appointed with towels, tissues, soap, etc. There was even a magnified mirror for make up application. Kudos to the designer who has the needs of women guests who require and appreciate this minor luxury in the room.The double bed had a shelf that spanned the length of the bed on one side and included storage compartments and a safe in the under bed area. There were outlets with USB ports (good thinking!) on both sides of the bed which made it convenient for charging multiple devices. The only thing I would add is a small shelf or cell phone caddy on the other side of the bed so that the guest on that side has easy access to their phone without crawling over their partner early in the morning. Overall, I was very happy with this hotel choice. I would definitely recommend it and will definitely stay here again.

Don’t stay here your things WILL GET STOLEN!So I start this off by saying that when I arrived at the hotel, I loved it! Some staff were friendly but others were too concerned with talking to their friends. The bar staff are SO rude and the food in the restaurant at Legasea left me speechless... Honestly there are way better places to eat in Manhattan. The only nice thing about the hotel is the room. It’s mod and well designed. However there is a vent in your room and you will be cold! Now... let metell you this.. the standard of the housekeeping service is below par, and I question how are the staff trained, as there is a GREAT inconsistency. Your stuff is moved, or taken, or your room isn’t cleaned properly ...With all of this said Marriott need to check up on their moxy- maybe even close it for a bit to address some issues....cause this place has ALOT of work to go. Retrain, fire or replace a lot of staff because it’s shocking.Stay elsewhere!

Great location, tiny rooms but great for the price, comfy beds, nice lounge on 2nd floor with friendly staff. Steven at front desk went above and beyond to be helpful and made a bad day good...he’s a true asset to your hotel and as a Platinum Elite Bonvoy member I was impressed with the great customer service.

We stayed here for 5 days, loved it so much! Excellent location, helpful staffs and lovely rooms! We had great time at lobby which has beautiful ambience. The hotel was pretty expensive but it will worth it.

Overall hotel and room is modern and energetic. Complimentary serving hot drink in the day and night (pink chocolate) for guests at the winter season. Friendly staff to handle all our inquiries and needs that we requested.

Loved the place.. def will go back!! Room was clean, wish it had more towels and as the room so small wish there was a fan in the bathroom. But overall i loved it!! wanted to try the magic hour rooftop but didn't get a chance.Very nice touch with the welcome proseco!!

My Wife and I were first time stayers loved the hotel.The overall staff were so help full. Our first evening we had dinner in second floor restaurant the selection was wonderful. when we return to New York our stay will be at the Moxy.

Over the last couple years, work has been bringing me back to NYC again and again. This is probably my fourth stay at the Moxy Time Square, and though the rooms are nice, the food and drinks are amazing, the in house barbershop is without comparison... What keeps me coming back is the staff. They are extremely helpful and do all they can to elevate your experience. If you get the chance, make sure to meet with Shirin. She always had the biggest smile, the best recommendations and gives me just another reason to keep coming back. Can't wait for the Moxy to make another work trip worth it!

I do not usually frequent mid town Manhattan, but I was there for work. I will say, this hotel was very good - it had everything you could need and was very trendy and modern in its decor. The shower was amazing and I know that is not the case of many hotels, so I was very appreciative of their care in planning out the style and finishes of the room. The hotel had great amenities as well, for some- you might never have to leave the building!

Recently I stayed at the Moxy Times Square for 3 nights and loved everything about the hotel. From arriving until I left. I honestly was not sure what to expect when I booked the hotel but was so impressed by all that I experienced. The food, the service, the cleanliness of the room, the wonderful smell throughout the hotel...just mesmerized me. To the extent that I purchased 2 candles from the hotel to have in my home and office. Please know that I do not wear perfume but the aroma throughout the hotel was amazing. I also loved the decor. You would think that this hotel caters only to millennials however NOT the case. I am mid-aged and the ambiance is for all. I felt right at home. Loved all about it and will stay here next year.

This is a great place to stay. Right in the middle of everything. Stayed here the previous New Years as well as last weekend. Interesting and funky with options.The rooftop bar was a hoot, bet it is really good time in warmer weather. Eggy is great quick breakfast or you can eat in the lounge.

You absolutely can not go wrong with this hotel. I stayed here this past weekend with a couple friends and the hotel is loaded with amenities. Not only do they have a bar(which you receive complimentary coins for drinks when you check in) but they have one of the best seafood restaurants in the area attached to the hotel. The rooms are cozy and comfortable. And the staff is by far the coolest staff in the hotel business that Ive come across. Its the winter so they're rocking these cool army green bomber jackets...I mention that because I really really want one! The managers are doing a great job running this hotel. Great front office !!!
user_name:
markish95
New York City, New York

review_body: The room was beautiful and also the location. I recommend this hotel to everyone. For the breakfast, you have access to a very good coffee shop at the next door with pastry and also the best “baguette” of New York.

Young & trendy concept, very well located on 36th near Times Square.Very small but very comfortable and modern rooms.Noisy lobby (music) and hallways ; great bar on 2nd floor.Convenient elevator system.

This was out first stay at the Moxy properties. It is very refreshing and the complete experience was wonderful. I will stay there again for sure. I liked the retro 50's look and the common rooms. The noise in the room was modest from the outside. Very well done...

This place had been recommended to me by a friend and I loved it - very comfortable and convenient location being close to 9/11 museum and walking distance to Statue of Liberty ferry. The staff are absolutely lovely. Only thing missing is a proper restaurant and room service.

Over all a nice place. Rooms er small but nice and clean. No place to put your suitcase. Not smaller rooms are not suited for more staying over a fem days. Marisol from staff was very nice. :-) Music in the reception area is very load, but I think it’s an purpose.

I was excited to stay at this hotel as it is one of the few brands within Marriott I have not stayed at. I kind of knew what it was going in, but it was a disappointment. I have stayed in small rooms before in many large cities but this extra small sized room convinced me to be cremated not buried because it felt that claustrophobic.We stayed on the 9th floor. There were no boxed waters as advertised in the room, the sliding door to the bathroom was not working correctly, we had to climb over one another to get into the bed. I could go on but my point is I will not be returning to any Moxy locations. It was trying so hard to be cool and hip, but it fell flat.

I love the Moxy vibe, and this Moxy definitely has it. But boy are the rooms tiny! The bed takes almost the entire space, you can only get in on one side. And it is very noisy. When your neighbors walk around you have the impression that they are in your room, unless the street noise takes over. Service is only so so...I am used to be welcomed and upgraded as a Marriott elite traveler, but not in this Moxy, they didn’t seem to care. And don’t leave your bag for the day...it takes forever to retrieve it. There are many better places to stay at in Manhattan...
user_name:
Dr-Z89
New York City, New York

review_body: Third time staying here and it always delivers. Staff is attentive without being overbearing. Had a great experience with their team each time we interacted. My wife and I spent the days exploring the city, but always returned to a stellar atmosphere. If you are looking for convenience in the midst of the hustle and bustle, this is a great place to call home during your stay. Coffee in the am - bar open late - etc. We didn't visit the rooftop lounge, but hear great things. Room are NYC size, but they are creative with the space plus the showers are to die for. Highly, highly recommend.

This was our 2nd stay at the Moxy Hotel...we love it. Dinner at Legasea was fantastic and we love the bar on the second floor for breakfast, complimentary coffee and cocktails at Happy Hour and beyond. The DJ played some great music on Saturday night. We saw a Broadway show and the location was perfect. The rooms are within my budget and nicely appointed. We had a corner room for a better view. We will be back.

I spend 80+ nights per year in hotel rooms and this is by far one of my favorites. The staff is friendly, the hotel decor is fun and the service is always impeccable. Steven the doorman provided tremendous service during the stay and I enjoyed my conversation with the bar staff too. The pink hot cocoa was the icing on the cake this trip!

Loved staying at the Moxy Times Square, the hotel decor is one if the reasons I chose this hotel, the vibe in the hotel is chilled, friendly staff, great rooftop bar with spot on view if the Empire State Building, great food and perfect location for Times Square, Bryant Park, 5th Avenue, Macey’s, Broadway, Madison Square Garden, would highly recommend this hotel to friends and family travelling to the Big Apple.
user_name:
J9790EOlisa
New York Mills, New York

review_body: The hotel is quirky and the rooms are small but it is a perfect location for getting around NYC. The bed was comfy and there is free coffee in the morning from 7-10 each day. Clean and cosy hotel. The rooftop bar is really designed for younger people.

We stayed at the Moxy for three nights in a queen room - the room is a good size, plenty of hooks to hang stuff on (a few hangers provided as well). The bed is very comfy the tv is massive and complimentary bottle if water a nice touch. Shower is excellent and has very nice good quality complimentary shampoo and conditioner! Hair dryer in room is good and there is a clothes steamer as well which came in handy. Location is excellent. This hotel is very modern and loud music was playing in the foyer when we arrived and I was struggling to hear what the guy checking us in was saying (although we did arrive at 9pm). A token is given on check in for a free glass of fizz in the 2nd floor bar too. Apart from the loud music I enjoyed my stay and would happily return and recommend!

I stayed at the Moxy Times square for my anniversary recently. I called ahead of time to inquire if anything special can be done as a surprise for us. We arrived to an upgraded, decorated room! Andy (the manager on duty) was very professional and accommodating.He made our stay so much better by accommodating us with drinks and breakfast for the special occasion. He welcomed us with amazing service which was the start of a fantastic stay. The waitress at the Legasea (Wish i knew her name) was super nice. She gave us suggestions on what to order and was very attentive. Jailene on the phone was also very nice and professional. The hotel overall was clean, trendy and fun. I will definitely stay here again! Thank you so much Andy and the Moxy Crew!

Top class stay. Good vibes around the whole hotel and great attention to detail! Roof top has good atmosphere at the weekends. I am pretty sure I’ll be taking a trip back to Moxy Hotel Times Square very :)

Midtown exciting locationI liked it that the staff did match the vibe of the hotelI'm curious to come back again soon to see how the experience will be when I upgrade my stay.Looking forward to dwelling around again soon.

My husband and I stayed at the Moxy due to the location to his business conference. I on the other hand had the opportunity to be a tourist for the day. The hotel was very vibrant and had a fun vibe. The rooms were average for a NYC room, the Moxy has however figured out a way to utilize the space with multi functional furniture and pegs on the wall the hold items. The hotel also has a room if you forget some items which I thought was pretty cool, they don’t necessarily cater to you, you walk over to the stash room and get an iron, towel, etc etcThe restaurant was such a nice spot, food was great, music was 90’s R&B they atmosphere was a mixed crowd. The food was average and the price was moderate for NYC. For breakfast we walked over to a deli and had breakfast which was reasonable price. Overall I would stay at the Moxy again!

Very fun. Great bars and restaurants. Rooms are minimalist but very functional and comfortable. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Free drinks are always appreciated! Great location to get around to whatever you want to do.

Nothing is run-of-the-mill at the Moxy! The lobby feels like a cool night club. You can't help but feel immersed in the scene. My kids were awed and the front desk agent went out of his way to make my young son feel like a VIP. We chose a room with bunk beds, which was a blast for my little ones! The room had been set up with these awesome balloons and a welcome note on the mirror, which kept the party atmosphere going! Manager Andy Charles took my reservation, knew I was bringing my family, and went the extra mile to make our room and every aspect of our visit family friendly. The breakfast at the bar was delicious and best of all, the foosball and rack of board games kept everyone's kids happily occupied so the parents could enjoy their omelettes, coffee and leisurely conversation. What a perfect way to start the day! Kudos to Andy and the Moxy team! I never would have thought that a hotel could be both trendy and family friendly at the same time. We'll definitely be back!

We enjoyed our stay at the Moxy very much. The room was ideal and very clean and practical, bed was very comfy, staff were helpful. There was a very nice vibe to this hotel with comfortable bar area. My only criticism would be the rooftop bar which we found quite unfriendly and didn't stay as the atmosphere wasn't particularly nice.

Coming from a long flight the first thing you want to do is get to your room and get freshened up etc. When checking in we were asked for a card fora the security deposit, standard procedure. 5 cards later after all being declined a manager was called. I called American Express straight away and they informed me there was no attempt to charge the card at all. Mike the manager came and helped and then told us one of the cards has been charged... The check-in process was not smooth at all and extremely frustrating... We get to our room finally... Hairs everywhere, a lump in the toilet, in the glasses on the bed it is just not an acceptable level of cleanliness you would expect from Moxy/Marriott.Mike apologised and moved us promptly to another room but unfortunately things were not any better.The toilet seat had a urine stain on the toilet seat from the previous guest, coffee stains next to the bed and yet again MORE hair everywhere! (this wasn't even fishing for errors or mistakes everything was in plain sight)This now brings me to the most important point of my complaint. The basics I expect from a hotel are a clean and quiet room. The window in the room clearly needs replacing the sound bleeding from outside is very noisy I can hear EVERYTHING! Matinence came around last night and put some filler in the windows as we agreed the noise bleeding was there. This didn't improve and I certainly felt part of the city the never sleeps. I was told last night by Yvonne at the crew and she told me that the manager would contact me first thing this morning as we needed to put this right. We got moved to another room the floor was covered in hair and so dirty, by this point we came to terms we wasted our money on this hotel and don’t think we will book the Moxy on our next trip to NYC. Disappointing and felt like the hotel didn’t really care about its guests

Moxy in Times Square was the absolute best experience ever! From the moment we arrived, to the special decorating they did in the room for my daughter’s 10th birthday, to the food and people! A big thank you to Brandon and the entire staff!

We had the best customer service from doorman Steve Nuñez. He carried our bags several blocks to our parking garage right after the Thanksgiving Day parade ended. He spoke with policemen for us and got us through blocked off roads. We never would have made it out without him.

We stayed in the Moxy from the 21st - 25th November for my belated 30th Birthday celebrations. The staff that checked us in were very friendly and helpful which is always a good start. Ok, so the room was a bit on the smaller side but is easily manageable for how long you actually spend in there. The shower was perfect, I have seen a few negative reviews regarding the showers but ours had really good pressure and was hot. We used our tokens for the free prosecco towards the end of our stay and that's the only time we used the hotel bar as we like to go out and explore. The hotel is very clean and has a good vibe. On our first day we were struggling to flag down a taxi (I didn't fancy standing in the middle of all the traffic), after a quick chat with the door staff one was flagged down within seconds... result.I'm not one to usually write reviews but we had a great stay. They have a luggage hold if you have a late flight which is handy.

My husband and I stayed at this hotel last weekend. Upon entering the hotel, I felt a bit nervous at what kind of crowd might be staying there, as it looked like a "fun" place. I was worried we would be kept up all night with people partying. Quite the contrary, most of the clientele seemed to be middle aged couples and from our room, we did not hear any noise, except some typical NYC street noises (ie. sirens). The hotel was extremely clean and new looking. Our room was very clean. We had a king suite and it was quite small (but big enough considering we were only using it to sleep in). Apparently, we were given a handicap room and this was supposed to be a bigger room. Didn't love the bathroom. I felt as though I was in a swimming pool change room. Didn't like that there was no door on the shower and that the water from my shower got the rest of the bathroom wet. Our view from the room was into the rooms of other people across the street, but oh well....we just kept our blinds closed. The young lady that checked us in spent a lot of time trying to upgrade our room for us as we had requested (paying for an upgrade). She told us they were at capacity for the weekend but still put forth the effort which we appreciated. We enjoyed Bar Moxy but were disappointed that the food menu was not available on the weekend....we were dying to try the clam chowder. We did have the breakfast 2 mornings with mimosa's and it was very good. Cocktails in the evening were great. Also, if you are staying at the hotel and the food menu isn't being offered, you can bring food in from the outside or order from uber eats and have it delivered, which is kind of cool. The location was definitely the best part. We felt really close to everything and it was so nice to be able to change for dinner and show after a day of walking around (we usually stay at hotels in NYC that are not this convenient and we have to dress for both). Overall, a good stay.

I read a promotional piece that said, "if you like us, leaving a glowing review".Well...The only thing that glows is the massive neon Parking sign that comes in through the ill-fitting blind on the tiny window. . The Moxy NYC was the worst part of my trip to NYC last week and it's really hard to choose just one reason why. The top contenders are:- The lukewarm shower, it was as cold as you would be after climbing out a hot shower in winter. The water temp and pressure did just not improve. - The middle interested person who checked me in. - The completely disengaged person who checked me out. I didn't know it was possible that a person whose job description includes "making people feel welcome" could actively be so unwelcoming. - The awesome thin towels that had the threads hanging off them. I am a small person and it took all two towels to dry my body.- The lack of room amenities, what happened to the good old days of a glass for water or a kettle for tea or somewhere to put your clothes as opposed to hanging them on the wall. Those are just the top contenders, I am sure if I thought about it for more than 10 seconds I could add some more. The nicest part about the hotel was the gentleman who took my bags, he was lovely and kind and didn't seem to mind that I had no clue where to go or what to do because there was no one else to ask.

The staff, rooms etc were all amazing. Staff were my favourite and were very welcoming and would do anything you needed. The rooms were comfortable and it wasn’t too noisy outside. It was located in a great space in NYC very close to everything. Overall a great stay

We stayed in the Moxy for 5 nights which was more than enough time. Rooms are very small and set out strangely and there’s no storage so we had to leave everything in our cases, the shower is excellent though. Everywhere was spotlessly clean, only disappointment we had was that one one day (the sunday) we didn’t get our room cleaned. Also, we had to switch rooms due to there being a mosquito in our first room which had a field day with biting me. Staff were perfectly understanding and moved us right away (we also killed the mosquito before we left). We never ate in the Moxy so can’t comment on the food but there is so much choice within walking distance round the hotel to for places to eat, the location is great!The bar on 2nd floor has a great atmosphere we drank here every night. Overall a good stay but we’d struggle with storage and room space if staying any longer then a couple of nights.

Not for business travelers (in my opinion). I gave it 3 stars because the staff were nice, and the location is great. And it’s not likely to be a business travel accommodation for many... but thought I’d “warn” business travelers about my business travel experience. A client booked me at the Moxy because I said I prefer a Marriott group hotel, and they had a specific budget allocation. So it ended up being the Moxy. Some highlights: No desk, chair or lamp; awkward layout for using a computer and power plugs; awkward way of ironing clothes (on a tiny, flimsy ironing board set up in the sink!); managing business clothes and space (no closet, just hooks on a wall); noisy guests (1:30am crowd in front of my room with no regard for other guests); sitting on a bed trying to get work done ...is not enjoyable. Maybe it’s a cool and fun experience for young guests, but it’s definitely not a practical place for anyone with business travel needs.

Great rooms and very trendy hotel in a good location. Beds are comfortable. Limited storage space but good value overall given the proximity to Broadway and Times Square. Will definitely use The Moxy for future visits to NYC.

Stayed at this fab boutique hotel for my daughters 21st birthday - I had emailed the hotel prior to our visit and told them we were staying there as part of her birthday celebrations, they decorated our room with balloons and wrote a lovely note on the mirror. The reception was very different to any I’ve been to before, open plan and very welcoming - and it smelt lush! Rooms are on the small size but not as small as I expected - was pleasantly surprised. The rooms were cleaned every day. Staff couldn’t do enough for you, would highly recommend this hotel - we’ll defo be back.

Great Hotel close to Madison square Garden, Empire State Building and Times Square.The room was stylish, functional and bigger than expected. Unfortunately it was very noisy at night because of the loud music from the skybar Magic hour. We really liked Bar Moxy and the served food. The overall hotel service was great. We would definitely come back.

This hotel couldn't have been more conveniently located in midtown! There was a problem with their computer system when we arrived to check-in, and the staff was incredibly pro-active in dealing with the issue so that their guests weren't negatively impacted. The room was very clean and such an efficient use of space. Think carefully: if you reserve a room with one of the bunk beds, it can be difficult to get down in the middle of the night when it's dark (or maybe just if you're clumsy like me).

Great location! Easy walk to theatre.Small room, not so private bath, no closet, have to hang clothing and gear on hooks. Lower bunk comfy, upper bunk hard to get to and too warm. Staff was great, bar and sitting area were comfy. Party atmosphere.

My teenaged son and I stayed here for one night in November to visit with some friends. The Moxy is funky, hip, and puts out a social vibe that I’ve never seen in a hotel before. We were able to drop off our bags because we got there too early to check in. We checked in after 4pm and got a double double room on the 12th floor. That turned out to be two double beds set up foot to foot, cool right? The decor and space saving perks were great. I’ll get to the cautionary stuff in a minute. The second floor had a bar and comfortable places to sit and relax. That was great. There was also a rooftop bar that I heard was great but we didn’t get up there because... The elevators.... oh how I would have loved it if there were step by step directions posted somewhere near the elevators so we could figure out how to use them. Basically you tell the elevator where you want to go and it will tell you which elevator to get on, the trick comes when you want to go to floors that have guest rooms. You have to scan your card. Unless someone is standing there that already knows how to use the elevator, you’ll be sitting there for a really long time wondering why you can’t do a simple task like call an elevator. We figured it out though... eventually.. and by eventually, I mean on the day we left. So no rooftop bar for us. As to the cautionary tale, here goes... if you are a family or with a group of friends who do not normally watch each other shower or use the toilet, here’s your warning. The bathroom and shower can be seen into by whoever is outside of it. If you aren’t into that, you can either shower and use the bathroom in shifts or maybe bring something to put up so you can’t see each other. I don’t know... I like my privacy as does the teenage son. I really like this hotel a lot but this issue kind of makes me want to look elsewhere next time. Except for the bathroom issue, the location is perfect, EggHead is yummy and I’d recommend.

Yesterday before leaving I have asked at the reception to call me a taxi to JFK. Girl at the reception (has piercing in nose), obviously called her friend, and he showed up in a regular yellow cab. At the end, I did not get flat rate drive to JFK, but a around 77$ ride, with some strange bill, for which I will not get refound from my company. I know that this was her friend becouse they were hugging when he camed.My company has some deal with Moxy, so I'm not sure that I will be able to refuse staying here. But this is not ok.Actually, your staff and hotel robbed me.Close this for good, open a nightclub, hostel or whatever.And please, don't tell us that Moxy experience is not for everyone, I'm robbed, and your personel took the part in that.Also, this is what I got after check in:

Hotel is super comfortable and the hotel and bar area have a great vibe! Room is small but more than adequate for 3 of us. Loved the bunk option and beds were pretty comfortable. Location was really perfect with everything nearby. Shower was hot and good pressure. Wish we could have opened the window to get some cool air as the room does get warm with 3 people showering but we had to use the ac instead which seems a little silly. All in all an excellent experience and the best place I’ve stayed at In NYC for the money. Will be back for sure!

The hotels location is great. Near to Penn station and Broadway. Rooms are small but have everything you need. The bar is nice and serves a lovely breakfast. The only issue I had was the load music you could here in our room from the roof top bar, however this did stop at 22.00. However after a busy days we’d have liked to have gone to bed early especially on Sunday. We would however go back.

1st time here and it did not disappoint. Great bars food, service and atmosphere. Even has its own Tattoo parlour. Good location and reasonable price. Room had Mezzanine level with Another bed. Roof above main bed a little low. Only problem was the free wifi often was very very slow. Particularly an issue for Apple users apparently as an issue all Marriott owned hotels.

Steven the doorman saved the day for me. He was able to help me find the correct way to enter the hotel. If you are looking for a something swanky where you do not need to leave the hotel to have a good time then this is your hotel! Also the bed is extremely comfy. The only complaint that I have about the hotel is that it is noisy at night because of street noise. I travel to New York City frequently and never have this happen.

Great property for business or leisure. Always clean with minimalist vibe. Great amenities - bar, restaurants, etc. all conveniently located. Great location between Chelsea and TImes Square - so much in walking distance.

Stayed at the Moxy with four friends for a girlie holiday. Yes rooms are a little on the small side but wasn’t in it for long as so much to do in NYC. Free coffee in the bar from 6.30 to 10.30 which is a bonus! Although the the man on the corner does a great coffee and pastries. 10 mins walking distance to Times Square and about a hour and half walk to battery park to get ferry to Statue of Liberty . The guys in front reception were fantastic and extremely friendly and helpful. Would definitely recommend staying at the moxy and when we are back in NYC will definitely stay again

This is a great hotel. in the heart of Times Square. Great bar, great breakfast. Very different in a good way. Check in staff require improvement. Cannot fault it. The bed was so comfortable. The room and bathroom were spotlessly clean. The room is the smallest I have ever stayed in. Perfect for one. Just about ok for 2. Outside of this it was a really great hotel at a great price.

First time visitors to NYC so picked The Moxy for price , availability and locations. Wow what a find ! Ok the the rooms might be a little snug but you’re in New York why spend time in your room ! The hotel is super clean as are the rooms , the staff are incredibly friendly and helpful. Bar , restaurant, roof top bar , free coffee from 6.30am till 10am ! 10min walk to Time Square . Same to Penn Station for links to JFK . All in all a fantastic place to stay try it , you won’t be disappointed x

It was a great location for a hotel... very clean... but horrible customer service... they over charged me for 1 night because of an error they made... and didn't do anything for me.. and it was their mistake... they also don't like to deliver towels and etc to you.. they say you are ELITE and can walk to a closet in the hallway to get your own...

I had a great stay at the Moxy Times Square. Clean room, very helpful staff, quiet room. I got in late and Daushon at the front desk was so kind and welcoming. And when I was leaving I had a crazy experience with my Lyft driver getting a ticket! Steven the doorman was so helpful and he kept me company and not stressed. He went around the corner, saw my driver getting a ticket, offered to get me a taxi instead, watched my bag while I checked on the situation, and kept me laughing about the whole thing. More than just good service, kind and warm, too.

My girlfriend flew in from LA and we had a great weekend staying at the Moxy! Even had a drink named after me at the roof top bar, “The JoJo” as we waited for the lights of the Empire State Building to shine! The staff are terrific, location is walking distance to many attractions and areas of interest. Rooms are cool, clean and compact. The 2nd floor lounge area is relaxing and comfortable with excellent food choices.

The hotel was brand new and it showed. The room was great, especially the bed and bathroom. The welcome drinks were also a pleasant touch. Slept wonderfully on the bed and will definitely be going back there next time I travel to New York.

Stayed at this hotel for my birthday weekend. It is a very clean hotel to stay at and I like the idea of the stained glass for the bathroom. However on a girls trip I don't feel it's necessary for others to see me in the shower shower. In a personal room or your bedroom at home great. Otherwise I would prefer a little bit more privacy than others being able to see me pee and shower.

This hotel came from the future! excellent way of service... alternative hotel operation... helpful young personnel(pe: Yvette)... young atmosphere everywhere... minimal decoration... super bar very fashionable... a very nice after club with guests DJs every night... close to everything in Manhattan... for young and progressive people absolutely recommended!!!a real example of nowadays fashionable Hotels!

The location was perfect for my business trip so I booked at the Moxy. I was pleasantly surprised about the price, comfort of the bed and the walk in shower. I also tried the rooftop bar and the lounge on the 2nd floor, although it was little pricey the atmosphere was great. I will definitely book again.

So this is the kind of hotel review sites were made for since it would be a mistake to show up without knowing how the hotel was structured. This is what they say millennial travelers want: small but perfectly adequate rooms with cool common space to hang out and work if you want to. As others have noted, the rooms are not really geared toward working or even spending much time in them. That said, my queen room was actually bigger than some rooms I have had in a traditional NYC hotel. The room is a bit barebones, not fancy, but I liked it fine. I was also pleasantly surprised by how good the service was from the front desk where the young woman who checked me in could not have been nicer or more efficient, as was also true of the bartender working the breakfast crowd. Everyone I encountered was great and a more traditional hotel could learn from these folks. The main issue I encountered was noise, some from being in the middle of the City but I could also hear other people's showers as if it were in my own room, and conversations in the hallway. This hotel feels like a rooming house and while others may not care, this was the only negative to me. I was traveling alone (and am older) and I think the room definitely would have been cramped if anyone else had been with me. I did not, however, hear any noise from the rooftop bar and I attribute that to the front desk person when I asked for a quiet room. The location is good if this is where you want to be -- about four blocks from Penn Station/Madison Sq. Garden, and about 10 to Times Sq. and the theaters. Definitely worth a try.

Perfect spot, amazing staff, super clean nice rooms, the best shower heads in any hotel! Literally feels like a waterfall. Easy and fast access to everything. The mobile key check in is perfect! I stay at this hotel every chance that I get and last week they actually upgraded me, wrote a nice welcome back note on my mirror and put balloons on my bed! It was such a nice suprise! Thank you Moxy!!!

You really enjoyed our journey in the Moxy hotel. The breakfast included in our option was very good. There is also a luggage storage service (free) which is very convenient as you can pick them even if you have left the hotel in the morning. A bar and restaurant are available in the hotel, so you can spend good time in the evening, with ou without children.

I had high hopes for this hotel. However I feel short changed and disappointed. The receptionist are ill-equipped to answer client needs and more keen to having fun (it is also difficult to differentiate who is staff and who is not). Whilst they decorate the room for my partners birthday, the room itself is simply too small and not appropriate for two people staying. The negative sides of the hotel are: The sink is in the room and the room is so tight you cannot go around the bed. The aircon wasn't working properly and despite complaining about it nothing was done. Separately the sliding door of the bathroom didn't slide properly and the bathroom/toilet doesn't give much privacy (if you need to go anyone in the room will hear you). The desk is minuscule and the seat is simply reclining one, not good if you need to work on a computer. The rooms is noisy and you can hear people coming in and out of the rooms. The lifts are not convenient and The touch screens was difficult to operate. The communal areas are noisy and The breakfast is extortionate (11usd for a small bowl of oatmeal). On the positive side, the manager was responsive but only when cornered and the shower is powerful and nice.Overall not a hotel I would recommend if you are looking for something comfortable and business like or even for a couple. It is too much unnecessary extra and not enough substance. Could have done with investing in the amenities and the training of the staff instead of all the necessary flashy things.

A small and unique hotel with a modern design primarily for the younger generation wanting to be next to time square. Very automated and simple procedure from check-in to check-out. Spent New Year’s at the local restaurant - food was great, specially during the New Year celebration. The open bar and lounge area are a great place for family and friends to get together. Service was good. Amenities were good too. Rooms are smaller and cozy –same as what you see in the pictures.

Our room was huge but noisy. We stayed in a disabled accessible queen room with bunk bed, shower leaked out and into bedroom we had to use all our towels every day to dry the floor.We struggled a bit with 2 suitcases (I travelled with my mum) as there was only 1 suitcase stand. The hotel was lovely, drinks as expected in a hotel were expensive. Staff were really helpful, especially a weekend student Staff lady named turrine (not sure on spelling).You could sit in the bar lounge area with your own food which was great. The location. Was absolutely fantastic, we saw other hotels we considered and this was absolutely head and shoulders above the rest. I will be returning to New York and this is where I will definitely be staying.

When I booked the room the only thing left was a double, I figured no big deal, it’s just two night for business. Then I check in, the double bed was the size of the room, from headboard to foot, wall to wall. And the tv is on the wall at the foot of the bed. I’m not that tall, 5’ 11” and I had to lie diagonally on the bed just to keep my feet from constantly kicking the tv. Also, there’s no closet, just hooks on the wall to hang a shirt or suit, but there’s nowhere to hang a suit where it’s not in the way of a door opening or closing. And there’s only two doors, front door and a huge bathroom door. And as far as business travel goes there’s no desk or chair to sit at and work. The hotel is new so everything is nice and all, the bar is nice and check-in was fine. But being in that room was like being in a nice tiny hostel.

I stayed in the moxy last weekend with my girlfriend. I also stayed here last year with family!Having got there at around 7 pm in the day I grabbed my room key and headed upstairs to the room to just throw everything in and go out as I was only there for 3 nights. You could barely open the door, we were coming from Orlando and had 2 suit cases and with them in the room, there was absolutely no room to get ready. These rooms are really only suitable for 1 person (it was a double room). Having said that, I did mention it to reception and the manager (Mike) went above and beyond to get our room moved and did so. We were changed to a different double room with the perfect amount of space. The rooms themselves are among the cleanest ive ever been in but in fairness so is the whole hotel. The place just smells amazing and there is not a spec of dirt anywhere. The staff are super super friendly which was a pleasant change from my visit last year. The showers are magnificent, they are the rain forest showers which are the most refreshing thing in the morning and at night. You couldn’t be in a better location if you’re visiting Times Square, it is literally in the centre of it. The hotel bar is insanely expensive and while it is nice, you can go and drink in a rooftop terrace for a fraction of the money. I would have given this a 4/5 if I had have been given the larger room from th start, but I only stayed 3 nights and 1 was in the insanely uncomfortable tiny double room. A beautiful hotel non the less and I definitely will return due to its affordable price, cleanliness and cheerful staff.

Not enough room to unpack your bag. Can sit on the toilet while standing in the shower. Air conditioning units are so loud that you can’t avoid being woken up even wearing ear plugs. Oh, and they vibrate and shake the bed because the room is so small they touch.
user_name:
Brendan Wapple M
Los Angeles, United States

review_body: Really enjoyed the Moxy for an overnight stay in NYC! Birthday weekend couples trip! Enjoyed both bars for happy hour and late night drink on the 2nd Floor! The room was very clean, a little small, but perfect for one night! Would definitely come visit again!

Spent there 4 nights, great location, 1 block from Macy's and in the middle of Time Square, the rooms are a bit small but the service is very good, Sade at the Front Dest is amazing, and Abigail and her breakfast team are always smilling ahd happy to help, good experience

Amazing staff! Awesome food! Great rooms! The front desk greets you with a smile! Best experience of any hotel ever. Your hotel should be a model for everyone else to follow. They all should conduct their trainings at your hotel!

The Moxy is part of the Marriott “boutique” group of hotels. Very nice staff and a great location on the south end of the Times Square district. Close to central Times Square and Broadway shows. The hotel has two great bars, one is a rooftop happening place and a good seafood restaurant. The rooms are very small in a European kind of way where the bathroom room sink is in the room. All very clean and comfortable but a very different feeling compared to a typical American hotel. I do recommend this place as more affordable and nice place to stay.

Loved the Moxy, the staff were friendly, the rooms were clean. The hotel is in a prime position to Macys and about a 10 minute walk to Times Square. The hotel is lively, I would highly recommend it for young travelers. The bar is great and the room top bar is amazing.

Rooms were small but very clean and we had everything we needed. The beds were very comfortable. The atmosphere in the hotel was relaxed and we had a great trip. Free morning coffee and hallowe’en sweets were a lovely bonus.

Moxy Times Square is a in a great location, the staff are helpful and friendly. Room was a little small but we didn’t care, we are exploring New York not our room. Only thing is the entrance to the hotel after a certain time is through the ‘club’ entrance. You have to queue to get in the hotel with people who are just trying to get into the club and all you wanna do is get to your room and go to bed. I found the door staff/hosts to be a little rude. Other than that, great hotel, very lively. Far too hip for me haha. Thanks for a great stay though.

There is a club on the top floor that blasts music until 2am. The rooms aren’t sound proofed, so you can literally feel the bass running through you as you try to sleep.I’ve grown up in a city and have spent loads of time in NYC so am used to sleeping in noisy environments - but this is a new level.The rooms are also particularly small (like, hardly enough space to even lay down a large suitcase on the floor). Im travelling solo for work - but can’t even imagine two people sharing a room here!Imo, if you don’t party or need somewhere to stay for longer than a night or two, don’t stay at Moxy Times Square...

The trip to New York City was amazing and to choose Moxy Hotel Times Square as our home while staying in the city was the best decision. Only a 10 minutes walk to Times Square and to Penn Station also - fabulous!

I had a amazing time at the Moxy. The staff was very friendly and accomondating.The hotel is very central at the Time Square and the most subwaylines. The lounge on the 2nd floor and the roof-top-bar are nice places to be.

First time staying at Moxy, and will definitely be back! Had a great time! Rooms are kind of small, actually very small, but didn’t spend much time in there. Too much to see in New York! Can’t wait to go back!

The decoration of the bar/lobby of the hotel was quite modern and fun overall, and it would be quite crowded at night since the bar was surprisingly popular. The room size and facilities was okay and quite useful overall. TV was able to stream Netflix etc if logged in.The bad: 1. the water would sometimes turn hot after "few minutes" and it was small to say the least. 2. I asked for towels/tissues be refilled three days in a row and finally got it on day 3. they only clean the room every 3 days.3. I left my electronic toothbrush in the room which was my fault. However, I tried to contact the hotel through email/phone for 3 days and they either didn't pick up the phone or never respond at all. Even if they did pick it up, they will tell you to call tomorrow in the morning and then they won't pick it up! I would appreciate more if they would just outright tell me they didn't find it. All in all, nice location, adequate room. If the price is right, you can stay, but just don't count on they do anything more for you.

I loved this place the first time I stayed here, which was shortly after it opened -- it has all the niceness and none of the stuff I don't need. More wall hooks in all hotel rooms please! But even I would like to feel a little bit like I'm not inconveniencing the staff when I ask when I might be able to check in and if there's a room where I might not hear the bass blasting from the rooftop bar. I understand check in times and I understand there's a roof on the bar that plays music, but the least the hotel could do is be apologetic about those drawbacks and offer to do something, anything, about them. And, you know, hold off on the eye rolls. Again, I loved this place and want to love it again. (I had a similar unwelcoming customer service experience at the Moxy in New Orleans not long ago. This NYC location is at least much better facilities-wise than that location).

Great for couples! Great location, very clean and nicely decorated rooms. My partner told them it was my birthday and they took the time to decorate our room with sweets and balloons - it was so thoughtful! The shared spaces are great and the room, although small, is just what you need for a city break. Considering the location, the price was excellent. Our room had 2 double beds, which means it would also work well for friends who were travelling together too! The roof top bar was also a bonus.

From arriving I knew I made the right choice in booking this hotel, from the location to the staff and how modern the rooms were, food in the hotel restaurant amazing and nothing was too much trouble from the staff, When I come back I’ll definitely come back to the moxy! Thank you for an amazing stay!

Stayed for four nights and couldn’t have asked for a better hotel. Great location, comfortable rooms and great staff - especially JJ, the doorman, who made our stay that much better! Thank you JJ for everything!Highly recommend, and I would definitely book again next time I’m in New York.

Fab hotel close to Times Square, note - not actually in Times Square! Very professional and friendly staff. We arrived arrived early in torrential rain and the staff allowed us to check in straight away and couldn’t have been more helpful. When we departed the hotel they arranged luggage storage too.The room was compact, modern and stylish. Everything you could need for a city break in NYC. We went to the rooftop bar one evening, again great service. It is open though so we needed a coat on a cold evening in October! But well worth it for the view of the Empire State Building and ambience.Location was excellent - easy walking distance to many attractions and the all important shopping that NYC has to offer!

Ok, so this is NYC most newer hotels are super tiny. Moxy is no exception. They do make up for it however, with their awesome customer service and amenities. The little details that they take their time with like having fresh coconuts or a candy stand really make the difference. I really enjoyed my stay.

The hotel itself is really well located and I enjoyed the common areas a lot - loads of detail put into making people feel as though they're somewhere special.The barman at the Moxy bar seemed quite bored/uncommunicative which was at odds with the rest of the staff. Perhaps he was just having a bad day.The only downside was the room - absolutely crazy how small it was, and no storage! My husband was also up half the night due to the noise from the rooftop (you'd think with so many complaints about this the hotel would have done something to resolve it by now). We paid quite a lot for our room, the whole point of a hotel is to sleep - get your priorities sorted!

The Moxy Times Square is a very modern hipster hotel with a younger crowd. The hotel isn’t really located in times square more or so in the Midtown area. The hotel is pretty big with around 16 floors. I stayed in a double queen room. It’s smaller than your average hotel room. Very cozy, sink is outside of the bathroom, and all rooms have a nice walk-in shower. The hotel is fantastic for a long weekend. It gives you all your necessities and a little more. The very clever stash rooms have all those extra items so nothing is going to waste. This hotel is perfect for people who aren’t spending a ton of time in the room. The free WiFi and coffee were also a plus. Beds were comfy, it gets just a little noisy on Friday and Saturday due to there Rooftop bar Magic hour. The hotel has 5 restaurants my personal favorite was egghead. Egghead serves breakfast sandwiches that are quite good. The Rooftop bar serves brunch on Weekends which is pretty good. Hotel is very close to Penn Station so if coming from Newark Airport it is super convenient. My only downsides are that the elevators or a little funky and the hotel should be renamed to The Moxy Midtown. I will definitely be staying here or at mother Moxy hotel again.

Centrally located hip and trendy hotel, 10-15 mins from where bolt bus drops you off and close to penn station Easy check in process and they give you coins for a free glass of rose at the 2nd floor bar The room is minimalist and very small but smartly designed The bed and sheets were very comfortable 2nd floor bar lounge area is great, bar/couches, board games. The rooftop bar called magic hour is fun with good dj, 4 holes of mini golf and interesting decor. Even if you are a guest in the hotel you do not get skip the line access. Overall great stay!

Strange hotel. No closets only hooks to hang your clothes & two drawers in our room. We were on the sixteenth floor so traffic noise minimal, don't think we would ever stay here again. Go next door for breakfast Cafe d'Auvignon-fantastic breads & pastries, hads breakfast here every day.

We stayed in the Moxy for our anniversary weekend. We chose this hotel based on location and looks online. We enjoyed our stay at this hotel overall, with a few annoyances. The location can't be beat, you walk out the door and look down the street and Times Square is right there. The rooms were quite small though, we had a king bed room, and I found the temperature in the room quite difficult to regulate for some reason. Perhaps it is because the room is so small, turning the a/c on and it is RIGHT against the right side of the bed so it gets overly chilly when sleeping. If you turned it off the room got super muggy even though it was October when we visited. I honestly think a ceiling fan right above the bed would have made it perfect. Other than the temperature and the fact that the room was quite small it was exactly as it looked online. I liked the styling of it and there was no issues at all with cleanliness. Self check in and out was super easy. One thing I found about this hotel is it is a VERY young hotel. I felt a bit old at this hotel. I would guess that the target age for guests would be hipster 20's and 30's which we are not. I didn't find the hotel staff to be overly friendly nor any of the other guests here. It seemed a bit stuffy and pretentious. The waitress in the hotel lounge wasn't friendly at all, drinks are certainly on the pricey side, unsurprisingly since it is NYC after all. The hotel just lacked the warmth and comfort I enjoy when I am away from home.Most of my issues were not a fault of the hotel and I would have no qualms recommending it to anyone. FYI for anyone staying there, the room safe is in the drawer under the bed. We didn't find it until we were leaving. :)

Trendy hotel with a good buzz. Friendly staff. Great location. Great shower! Cute little tattoo studio on the first floor. I stayed here in March with my Mom and Sister. Would definitely stay here again.

not much imformation about meal, using bar(bar crew was not kind), expensive more than value. But make me happy experience in NY. I want to stay in MOXY NYC asap.almost crews were very kind and joyful.

This is a lovely boutique style hotel with everything you need for an exciting adventure in New York. The rooms are quite compact but there was still enough space for luggage (for two) and shopping. The hotel was great value too.

Room setup was a bit of a culture shock. No wardrobe to hang suits & shirts just an array of pegs. Functional true but personally I would have like something better. Needed a small table desperately to work on. Pity it was lacking. Otherwise extremely clean and wonderful helping staff. Location couldn't be better. Load ambient music (even in elevators) was a bit unnerving at times
user_name:
Paul A
Island of Malta, Malta

review_body: Decent stay overshadowed by ridiculous water charges. Receptionists looked really bored and miserable when I checked in. Was not informed about the bottled water charge by them or anywhere in the room. They should really move the bottles from the bedside table and clearly mark the charge somewhere on the bottle or a note on the bed??? Extremely disappointed. Also requested housekeeping one of my days and this message was not passed on. Luckily when I called later on in the evening this was rectified immediately.It's the small details that matter on short stays, this place sadly doesn't have it!

Shoe box sized room. Bed, bath, but no beyond. No desk, TV immediately at the foot of the bed and against the wall. Smaller than my son's dorm room. Not a place for a business traveler, or someone with claustrophobia.

Great location. The room and bathroom were bigger than I thought. Would recommend if you go by yourself or with a significant other, not with friends since the bathroom door and walls are see through and that can be a little awkward.The check in and check out is quick, but the service is “meh”. I missed out on the bars :(.

Perfectly located near Penn Station, MSG and Time Square. Clean hotel, well and modern equipped, friendly staff. Cool vibes. Easy check-in and check-out procedure. Though in the centre, it is relatively quiet for NYC.

Some of the reviews on here are mixed but my husband and I had a great time. We had a double bed with a single bunk over head which we used for extra storage. I can imagine that if you just got the double it would be a tight squeeze. One comment would be that the bar staff are really slow. But other than that everyone is friendly and we really liked the cool vibe. Would certainly recommend.

Screenshots from under the bed video. Can’t upload video for some reason. Ask the staff to help me find something that fell behind the bed that’s bolted to the floor and I ignored my request on several occasions. Didn’t hear back from the manager as well. Seems like they’re half asleep most of the time

A modern, hip hotel conveniently located near Times Square. Stayed at the hotel with my husband for 2 nights (Sun-Tue). We had two separate reservations (one points and one paid). I requested the Suite Night Award for both nights and just received one for the 2nd night (points night). Breakfast - 4At check-in we received "chips" for breakfast. The breakfast was served in the hotel bar area (2nd floor). The menu had a good variety of options and the food was delicious. We only had the yogurt with granola, honey and fresh blueberries (yummy), but the egg dishes looked really good and we heard the other guests provide good feedback on the food. The waiter that served us both mornings was really great! I didnt get his name, but he was very attentive and was always checking in to make sure we were ok. Amazing service! We also received 2 complimentary prosecco drinks with each check-in.Responsiveness - 1.5I had emailed the hotel prior to the visit with some inquiries related to the rooftop bar (emailed about 4 times) and did not receive any responses back. I understand the rooftop technically run by a third-party, but a response would've been appreciated.While at the hotel, I also wanted to reserve one of their Studios (conference rooms), and was told that the only way to reserve a Studio is to send an email to a specific group with the request. I sent an email with the request but never received a response. To give the hotel some credit, when I checked in and communicated via the Marriott app, the responses were fine. It was just an issue when emailing the hotel - email address obtained from Instagram profile and thw second email issue was with respect to reserving the studio.Rooms:King Corner - 3.5The first night we stayed at the hotel, we were upgraded to a King Corner Room (from regular King) which was decently sized for NYC standards. If you've read the reviews, by now you know this is a unique hotel...and therefore, certain things are a little different than what you expect in other standard hotel rooms. For example, the sink and mirror are located outside of the bathroom in the main "bedroom" area, there is no closet (there are hangers along the wall where you hang your clothes but for longer trips, things may get messy), there is no real desk area (so for business trips, this may not be the best option). Also, there is an area called the "Shed" on each floor. The rooms at the hotel don't have an iron or an ironing board (there is a garment steamer though), but you can borrow such items from the Shed (can also get extra toiletries, towels, etc).The Suite - 5The suite was another story - I loved the suite (see pics)! It had a nice layout (was a corner room) and was spacious! There was a nice kitchenette area, a living room with a corner couch on one side, and a "bedroom" on the other side with a king-sized bed (there was no true divider to the bedroom, but it was definitely a cool layout). There was also a little desk where you could work located in between the livingroom and kitchenette. The bathroom was in its own space as well. Also, the staff included a personalized note for me on the mirror in the bathroom area, which was a nice touch.The suite definitely made up for some of the inconveniences we experienced. Unfortunately, if it wasnt for the suite, I would have probably given the hotel a 3-star review.Overall, it is a nice modern hotel and is conveniently located especially if you're in NYC to be near Times Square or the Theater District. I would stay at this hotel again (for a quick trip to the city, and when not planning on relying on any urgent responses from the hotel). Getting another suite upgrade confirmed would also be a plus! :)-Patrycja savitraveljournal.com

1) Lots of reviews staying the obvious— the rooms are small. However, they have what you need and the room is clean. The size of the room really isn’t an issue as long as you know what you are getting into. I wouldn’t stay here if you are traveling with someone else, but it’s absolutely fine for one person.2) I take it back. It would be fine for one person to stay if the Moxy had their act together. But they don’t. The only reason I stayed at this hotel in the first place is for 4pm checkout under their “social media package” as I needed to work and wanted a quiet place to do so (I even called Marriott to confirm that I had 4pm checkout after I reserved the room and was assured I did). The package was to include two Hot Toddies and 4pm checkout. I was never offered the drinks (which is awful customer service). But what’s even worse is the harassment I received after I didn’t checkout by 11. I got calls. I got an email. I got threatened that I as going to be charged additional money. I received numerous knocks on the door. As of now, this still isn’t resolved. For the price paid I expected much more. This is a complete failure by Marriott and the Moxy.

If you prefer style over comfort then this place will meet your expectations. Don’t expect to be comfortable for more than two or three days as there isn’t a closet and barely any storage space. The one “conveniently” accessible outlet to charge devices is on the wall the bed is pushed against. If you have a room with a view expect noise all night...the sound proofing is not good. Not the hotels fault, but my last night of sleep was interrupted by a drunk beating on their hotel room door for an hour or so at 3am.

Our first impression of the hotel was very good, modern and had a great vibe to it. The location of the hotel is ideal being any few minutes walk from Time Square . During our stay we went to the outlet shopping mall and bought a fair few bits! The next day after a shopping trip on our return to our hotel we found that a couple of the bags have been taken with brand-new items in. We immediately reported it to the hotel they seemed very blasé about it and we are still waiting to hear from them with the outcome .We obviously were really upset about it and the thought of somebody rifling through our room. The only person that had been in our room was the chambermaid. There is a rooftop bar nightclub on the top of this hotel and many of the rooms you can hear the music . Also the people that are in the nightclub exit through the hotel and one night we ended up seeing a big fight in the foyer with some of the people that were leaving the nightclub.... not what you expect to see from this standard of hotel. We definitely won’t be returning to this hotel.

This hotel is beautifully remodeled and cleanly appointed. The rooms are sparsely furnished in a Nordic style. The problem is the nightclub on the premises. It is extremely noisy until about 2 a.m.. The desk even moved me to another room which was even noisier.

Gorgeous cute hotel but no proseco as agreed on arrival and then when I wanted to get a refund on two glasses I had at the bar no refund or reply! The bar is very expensive. It's always expensive in NY and I generally like the hotel very much. I didn't see the fire exits clearly labelled either.

We travelled here as a party of four (2 adults and 2 children) to stay for a week. First impressions were really good; reception service was quick, the reception was clean and lively. We went up to our room and we're shocked by the size. There were two double beds, toe-to-toe, a thin walkway between the wall and the beds and a bathroom, with a frosted glass screen. There was very little privacy and nowhere near enough room for four people to get ready at once. When we enquirer if there were bigger rooms available we were told there wasn't and that this was the standard size for a family in the hotel.Social areas in hotel are great, the bar with the fussball table and ice cream machine were a hit with the kids. The seafood restaurant was lovely and you can't fault the location of the hotel; but I definitely wouldn't recommend staying here if looking to stay in a family room or for a prolonged length.

Very trendy hotel, great (but expensive) restaurants and bars, and they even have meeting rooms! Our room was tiny with a big(ger) bathroom. Location is excellent, and is very clean. They say they have "free" popsicles for guests but when you ask, they never have any,

Stayed here for a theater weekend. Nice to be close but not in Times Square. If you are lucky enough to encounter DaShaun at the hotel front desk your stay will be infinitely better. We were checked in by a sullen woman who gave no acknowledgement of my high tier loyalty status and didn’t bother to give us hotel highlights. We approached DaShaun later that evening with questions and he took the time to give us hotel highlights. Expect a Scandinavian-style room that is very efficient but not a lot of space. Hotel guests get no benefit bypassing the line at Tao, the rooftop nightclub on top of the hotel.

Room was so small! I think 120sft. No closet. Feet hit the tv over the bed. No chair. And 600 per night!!! Never staying again. No iron or board since they have no room. Just no value with so many other choices.

I stayed in this hotel for two nights.Very friendly stuff at the front desk. Room was for Manhattan huge enough. The central location is great for walks to the Times Square and Broadway. Very clean rooms. 4⭐️ from me

This hotel has an excellent location for walkers. Our room was clean, shower was nice and the bed was comfortable. There are no closet or drawers, so you need to line up your luggage on the floor and use some pegs on the wall. The front desk staff is usually friendly, just one girl seemed upset to do her job. The bellman JJ is amazing, he usually works from 3-11pm. He guided us with all the details of the hotel with great attention and the best attitude.

It’s not unclean or anything like that, but I do not recommend this hotel. I’ve stayed probably 20 others not far away that are all more convenient that are a better price to value ratio. It started with a 40 minute wait to check in because they’re trying so hard to be hip that they have no front desk staff and just kiosks that are not working. So one painfully slow front desk person is casually checking each party in front of me in with no apology or explanation. Then I get to a room that looks like a bad version of an Ikea catalog with a tiny bed and a bunk over it?! If you’re a couple one person would have to climb over to get to the bathroom at night. And there’s no sound proofing either. The TV is so close my toes are blocking my view. And it smells like a hipster was choosing between 3-4 perfumes but said forget it and just used them all.
