Great location...and beautifully designed rooms...albeit tiny but functional. Great shower and comfortable bed. No space to sit and relax on the room. But lots of public spaces are available. Delicious breakfast!
user_name:
DupontDCman
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Firstly the room is very small (other reviewers say this is normal for nyc but this is the smallest by far of the hotels I’ve stayed in before and I’ve been coming to nyc almost every year for the last 15 years). The room was so small that the bed only just fit so one person had to climb over the other if needed to get up in the night. The rest of the space was taken up by our luggage. There was no minibar or closet to put luggage in our the way. The tv was at the end of the bed which meant that as our feet were squashed up due to the bed being so small we kept kicking it in the night. Our room also had weird ac which kept the room very damp and there was no extractor fan in the bathroom. So it constantly smelt damp. There were some nice things about the hotel - the welcome drinks was a nice surprise and the bed (for all that it was small) was very comfy. The bathroom was actually very big and had a good shower. However the positives do not in my opinion make up for the negatives. Moxy Times Square was more like a private room in a hostel but with hotel prices.

Stayed with my daughter and her friend. Not our first visit to New York, but definitely the most satisfied with our accommodation! This place is walking distance to all key places. Well, it’s right smack on 7the Avenue and W 34th, what do you expect?The room was perfect for us; a single bunk bed attached to a double bed. Super clean room and bath. It is small by other standards, but definitely not by NYC or other major US cities standards.It’s also walking distance to great foods such as Joe’s Pizza, Best Bagel Coffee, Los Tacos, etc.Room price? That depends on the time of year of course; but it was affordable to me, by NY rates and its convenient location. You won’t regret it!

We had a great time in our recent trip to New York, we wanted an hotel in Manhattan and close to Times Square and Moxy was really the perfect fit, it’s a very nice hotel but it took us some time to figure out all the benefits that were included, we were lucky enough to meet the doorman JJ who from start helped us as it was raining when we arrived, after that he explained us a lot of the important details about our reservation and how to get the most of it! All staff should be as JJ, he also provided options for tours and things to do while our visit! It was really an amazing experience and JJ made us feel like home, he also speaks Spanish which is definitely a plus! If you stay here make sure to ask for JJ’s help, highly recommended. Also, make sure you visit the rooftop as it ya a beautiful view including the Empire State. If we ever go back to NY we will be staying at Moxy again!

The young lady on reception I think her name was Chloe was so pleasant and friendly, always smiling and very positive. A true delight to meet. Made my singles stay a whole lot less lonely. Lovely smile. Really made my trip.

Location was perfect for overnight visit, being just two blocks from Penn station and a few blocks from the Vessel. And the E Train station was also nearby to get to the 9/11 memorial. The hotel design is very edgy and despite small rooms was suitable for a short stay.

Had a wonderful stay at Moxy Times Square! The rooms were comfortable and the staff is so friendly. Tons of on-site amenities like free coffee, free welcome prosecco, and fun programming like live music and trivia night. 100% would recommend, ill definitely be back again!
user_name:
Constance T
New York City, New York

review_body: I this hotel would be great for vacations with friends but not great for business travel. The rooms are very small but clean. There was only a bed, TV, luggage stool, and small night stand. There is a problem with the air conditioning, while the air conditioner is on randomly there is a loud fog horn type sound. I let the front desk know and they said they would have maintenance look into it but it was not fixed. I talked to others in the hotel and they had the same issue. So if you are looking for a good nights rest bring ear plugs.

Just a one night stay. I booked the Moxy because of the quirkinesses, I wasn’t disappointed. From the lobby to the seating areas on the second floor to the room. Yes the room was small, it was expected. We had two double beds. The bed was comfortable as were the pillows. The hooks around the room were an interesting concept and plentiful. A table and chair were hung on the hooks. The bathroom was large. The temperature and flow of the shower was great. We were in room 926, noise was not an issue. Try the retro phone for a bedtime story! The hotel was very close to Penn Station. Times Square is about a 20 minute walk. The breakfast at Legasea left a lot to be desired. Food ran out, it took about 15 minutes to replenish. Servers were not helpful. Didn’t offer a selection of fruit, just bananas. I hate bananas. Don’t waste your money. Too many good restaurants in NY to settle for bad food.

This was our first ever family trip to Manhattan and I'm so thankful we made reservations for the Moxy. It is a few blocks from Times Square, Broadway and the subway line is so incredibly close. We didn't have any difficulties getting around since the Moxy is located nicely. The room was clean and super comfortable. We reserved the room with the the twin size loft bunk and my daughter loved having her own space. Room was super tiny and we had a view of a brick wall but I was already knowing that was a possibility. We are in New York. What else would I expect? But we weren't in our room very much anyways so what does it really matter? Beds were super comfy but we could of used a few more pillows. I sleep super hot and the a/c worked wonderfully :D The shower was great, toiletries were fantastic and our room was SUPER quiet. We didn't hear anyone or any street traffic. Downside...there is no microwave, refrigerator, closet or dressers. This is the only reason why I didn't give them a 5 rating. The pegs worked very well and we were thankful for at least that but it would of been nice to have a microwave or refrigerator instead of a bean bag chair. We stayed for 5 nights and I would feel totally comfortable doing a mother/daughter trip to this hotel in the future.

We were aware that the rooms in NYC would be small but the hanging pegs were ridiculous- over the mirror and TV. Our room was not serviced for half of our stay, the bar is over priced and the roof top bar is a joke. Sleeping proves elusive as the music from the roof top bar thumps down several floors until the wee hours. The lifts are a joke, the salesman must be a master to get someone to buy this gimmick. Some of the extras such as the stash and the candy bar are not stocked. Nowhere to sit in the lobby, staff are too busy trying to be cool and we were treated poorly at the rooftop. The decor tries and fails to be interesting, breakfast is dull and repetitive. Whilst the location is good citizen M is much better. Best to avoid if you want to sleep at anytime. Bed tiny and had a tv at the foot which was knocked while sleeping. The ridiculous ‘art’ positioned idiotically needs to go. More shelf’s and storage needed. I suggest the management considers guests more.
user_name:
Rebecca W
New London, New Hampshire

review_body: Really Trendy /hip hotel with very helpful and friendly staff. Rooftop bar was nice and breakfast was great! We definitely would stay at a Moxy hotel again. The hotel is in a great location that is nearby plenty of restaurants and subway stations.

I love this property . But ... I Reached out to management several times , in regards to a very noisy air condition in my room. It was beyond disruptive during my sleep. I spoke with the clerk at the desk and told me that a manger would get in touch with me. We spoke about this on two occasion. She was surprised that I was not contacted. I emailed two different managers , still no response.

Stayed in the Moxy NYC Times Square in December 2018, after the Moxy NYC Chelsea hadn't opened in time for our trip. And really pleased that we ended up in the Times Square Moxy!On our first night, our room wasn't available so we had a family room with bunk-beds (not great for a couple) but the hotel were great and gave us complimentary breakfast at $15 a head per day - a nice touch!The rooms are really quirky, lots of space, but definitely aimed at a younger crowd. It might not be to everyone's taste.... The Christmas vibe demonstrates this a little (picture attached).We were given a token for a complimentary glass of champagne on arrival which again was a nice and unexpected touch.The best thing is the location. Down the road from Macy's, Maddison Square Garden, a ten minute walk to Times Square - we really couldn't have asked for a better location. I would recommend this hotel (and have) to all younger people looking for a great, well-priced hotel in the Times Square area of Manhattan. Since returning a friend has been and stayed at the hotel based on my recommendation and loved it!

This hotel for us was perfectly located for getting out and exploring NYC (Just a short walk from Times Square). Yes the rooms are compact but for the time you spend in the room they were more than adequate for us. One small detail that we would of liked was tea/coffee in the room. The hotel itself is spotless and carries a really nice atmosphere throughout. We loved grabbing a drink in the bar between being out in the madness of the city. We would definitely stay again when we return.

The rooms are very nice, The location is perfect. Very friendly staff. We'll be happy to come back.We have often been in New York, but Moxy is by far the best Hotel. Near to the Subway, between Union Square und Herald Square.

Stayed at this hotel during the US Open tennis tournament. Designers did a great job making the best use of a small room. Everything I needed as a solo traveler without feeling cramped. Wall racks and hangers, folding chairs and tables, great little sink and storage. Great for a quick trip or traveling solo. 2 in my room would be tight, but given the young travelers, they might not mind. lolOK value for your buck. Clean, daily house keeping, free room wifi, premium cable channels, OK restaurant, in-house barber shop, which I really appreciated. Staff was great. Easy check in and out. No door people, but I didn't need this service. Gym was fine, plenty of ice buckets. I'd appreciate better late night food options.

Great location. However no concierge & not a lot of help from staff for transportation. Very nice people, but not in-tune customer service. Hotel boasts of restaurants & roof-top bar, but didn't feel welcome as guests of the hotel, especially the rooftop. Usually wasn't room or event that kept us from frequenting the establishment. Tried to use transportation service offered but car came late & not large enough for group. Understand things can be out of their control, but the effort to verify things wasn't there.

This was a strange hotel, with nice towels and bedding but the rooms designed to conserve space so rigidly that they felt a little creepy. Our two beds were end-on-end, there was no closet or bench for luggage -- only hooks on the wall where I guess you could hang up some of your clothes. The folding door in the bathroom to hide the shower didn't open intuitively from inside the shower stall, and two of our party got stuck for a while until they figured out how it opened. The hallway outside the rooms was rather narrow. The location was great, but this was not a room where you'd want to sit and relax.

We stayed here for a quick getaway this month and absolutely loved it! Definitely not your typical hotel stay and we appreciated that. Fun and stylish, this place is definitely geared towards the younger or more hip crowd. When you have a seated carousel on the roof, cornhole in the lobby and an area dedicated to a visiting tattoo artist, there is definitely a different and fun vibe here. Rooms are on the small side so if you are planning on spending significant time there, you may want something bigger. It worked perfectly for us. Our only disappointment in our stay was that the soft serve vending machine was down during our time there. Would definitely return for a repeat visit!

I stayed here for 11 nights in August 2019. My husband and I were blown away by the ideal location and layout of this hotel. It within walking distance to all the sights and transportation. The staff were friendly and accommodating. The rates were reasonable in my opinion for NYC. Definitely going back.

I stayed at Moxy Times Square in early August 2019 on vacation. The location is superb and provided almost everything I needed. Although the rooms are small, this is understandable for central New York City. The rooms were clean and linen and towels good quality. I loved the shower! My only recommendation would be some sort of coffee in the bedroom. Complimentary coffee in the foyer doesn't really help when you just wake up.I would definitely stay again.
user_name:
Beverley S
Cape Town, South Africa

review_body: I was really looking forward to this stay. Unfortunately as is often the case first impressions are hard to overcome. Arrived late about 11pm. Only one staff in lobby....although he only had to check in one room it took about 20 minutes. Mobile check in did not work. When my time came, I was told they did not have my room, then suddenly the agent told me he was leaving and left the check in process to a newly arrived staff. No uniforms, could have been street guys for all I know. “So we don't have your room category, that ok right?” When I said it was not he simply responded with a smile. Rooms are TINY which is New York, but the mostly glass bathroom is a bit complicated for any sort of privacy. I did not mind the design but not as thoughtful as Citizen M for example and the darker colors makes it even smaller. Gym is an after thought which is shameful for a hotel that size I think. 7:30pm I had to call to have the room made up, apparently “you must have had your do not disturb sign on” which I did not. Only real hats off are the bar and the restaurant. Though bar service was non existent, the location, ambiance, screen makes for a great place to have a drink and catch up on e-mails. Restaurant was great both in service and food. I would not return. Mm

This hotel is in the Garment District - not Time Square. Their are flags on light posts all around New York stating what district you are in - the one outside the door into hotel - says Garment District. We booked it based on being in Time Square so we could easily go down wait in rush lines - and go back to room. Middle of Time Square was at least a 20 minute walk.I called back after making my reservation and was told our request for early check in was not recorded or request for extra towels. I called the day before we left and the morning on our drive up and was told again the request was not on our reservation, but they would add it. When we tried to check in - I was told again - no request recorded but they would try to accommodate this and send extra towels up. We were able to check in at 12:40 which was great - but did not have any extra towels.When we called to ask question about booking the website and the person we spoke to says there is parking not affiliated with the hotel next door. When we arrived at the hotel we there were trucks delivering items to hotel blocking the entrance to the parking garage next door. When we asked how long this would take that we were trying to park our car we were told by the hotel that we did not request parking on our reservation and so they could not help us - which makes no sense at all because we were told they could not help us with parking when we made the reservation.We did not have sheets on are bed when we got back to room at midnight. Called down and they delivered sheets - which when we went to put them on our bed we saw they were badly stained. We called front desk again and housekeeping came and asked us to show them the stains and when we showed them asked if we wanted replacements. When we said yes we realized the new new sheets had blood on them - at this point we walked down hall and found sheets in a bin and retrieved are own.The next night we went back to our room and the bunk bed was not made - and the sheets had been taken off the main bed and put on top of the comforter. We also did not have towels again. When we called down to the front desk we were told there is a stash room that is self serve and we can retrieve anything we need there. Again if I paid for a cheaper type hotel this would have been fine.The room resembles a youth hostile - which would have been fine had we paid those prices but we paid prices equal to what we could of gotten on time square at one of the named recognized hotels.The toilet and shower are in same space - as if you are on a boat. There is not shower curtain separating them even which makes for that entire area to get wet and is a mess if you wish to go to the bathroom after you shower.The roof top bar they advertise does not appear to be part of the hotel at all - and we could never even see what it looked like because the line outside was so long.The front desk did give us a credit because of our sheet issues and the person we spoke to was very very nice but it is just not something you want to deal with at midnight when you walked 20 minutes to a hotel that was supposed to be in Time Square and you have a teenager with you that is exhausted.My 14 year old by day 2 said she was getting grossed out by the lack of cleanliness issues.At one point another guest was asking why some people had passes to breakfast - which it says on the website you get through August 31 by the way. The host said that the front desk gives them out at there discretion and sent them on there way.Would never stay here again.

We are currently staying at the Moxy for business. @Maeleys @Sal @Star @demiah very hospitable. We stayed at the Moxy and they made sure to make us feel right at home. I absolutely love Demiah and his energy. I would highly recommend this place! Love the posh/Hipster vibe. Great team you guys have going on!

I stayed here solo for 4 nights while in NY and can’t recommend it enough. The rooms are compact but perfect for 1-2 people, especially me on my own. My room was so clean and tidy, and looked after every day. Free water included too. Location is perfect, walking distance to all the main activities and sightseeing. Staff were super friendly and the comms from the hotel in the lead up and approaching check out were brilliant.

My sister and I stayed at the Moxy for a week. We were celebrating her birthday/vacation trip. Our room was kept clean and we had plenty of towels. Since this was our first time in NYC we knew we would not spend much time in the room. Staying at this hotel we knew we would be in walking distance from everything and we were. We had the opportunity to see a lot of NYC as well as with our tours guides. The only thing we didn't like was the hotel does not have a laundry room but uses a service and it is very expensive so we had to take Uber and find a laundry. We also found the people over the upstairs bar are very rude and act as if they don't want you to go up there. You have to go outside to be carded and then you come back in and go up the elevator to the upstairs bar. There has to be a better way. If you had a full day and turning in about 10-11 pm you may hear the music from the upstairs bar. We were on the 9th floor. Any how we enjoyed our stay.

We stayed in the Moxy for 5 nights, the room was very compact to say the least but clean. At arrival I was not informed of the 100 dollar security deposit. I felt this was in breach of my consumer rights as I was not informed of additional withdraws to my account. On check out I requested a car to JFK airport for 6.30 pm. Our bags were stored in storage, which was very helpful. We returned back to the hotel around 6pm, we collected our bags and waited outside for the car to arrive. At around 6.35pm I began to worry that the car was delayed, I went to speak to a receptionist. To my horror I was informed that that my booking was not recorded by a staff member. Another worker tried to book a yellow taxi which I explained profusely that it would not fit all our luggage and passengers. The result of this ordeal ended in being squashed in a taxi and having cases unsafely stored in the front seat of the taxi. Our flight was a international flight which caused us a great deal of stress with the thought of missing it. I understand that we all make mistakes but in my opinion booking a car to the airport should be a serious priority. I was mostly disheartened by the hotels unconcerning manner. Although a passing ‘sorry’ was said, there was no compensation or any act of apology offered. Overall the situation was dealt with very unprofessionally.

Location was exceptional. The full free breakfast was unexpected and nice to have. Would definitely stay there again. The staff was very helpful and friendly. Never had to wait at check in or checkout.

Beautiful, spacious rooms. Love hotel is so close to hype spots in midtown. Great vibe checking in at the lobby. Refreshing mornings with the rain showers. Staff is friendly and accommodating. Love this space.

Nice hotel, staff awesome. We will stay at this hotel again. Close location to Empire state building, top of the rock, central park. Close to Times square. Nice view from the roof of the hotel, you can see Empire state building.

Wonderful and clean rooms. Awesome staff. Great bar and rooftop. And last but not least: located in the middle of manhattan, near of almost everything. I really loved every aspect of the hotel. the rooms are modern and new. the beds are extremely comfortable. I recommend the stay

I have been here for a week with friends.. it was a clean place with a beautiful atmosphere! Staff very polite and young ! We had always a good breakfast and the position is perfect to visit New York city.although it was not noisy near the square! I highly recommend it! Thank u Moxy

A funky contemporary hotel close to Times Square and Macys on a street that has a local feel; an innovative funky design that makes a small room feel spacious, great bed and folding furniture, no wardrobe but ample hooks; a great shower; a pleasant communal space on the 2nd floor; several subway stations within a few minutes' walk. I would stay there again.

Brandon & Moxy Time Square Team,Thank you for following up. We made it back to Charlotte on Friday afternoon and Michelle is feeling much better. She is resting and will continue with medication and therapy to help her back. The good news is that it appears to be a muscular injury and not disc, probably as a result of moving our son to college, heavy lifting and a lot of walking. I would like to take this opportunity to say thank you to your staff! I can’t thank you enough for your kindness, empathy and professionalism. It truly represents a BEST is the Standard culture. This was only the second trip to New York for Michelle and the girls and my first trip back in over 30 years. Needless to say, it was extremely intimidating to look down and see my wife hurting and unable to stand, my teenage daughters standing there, our bags sitting in the lobby and a fifteen-minute window to leave for the airport in order to catch our return flight home. Can you say stressed out? As soon as I asked for help from one staff member, a gentlemen I believe who works in food and beverage, we found ourselves surrounded by other managers, security and the Hotel Manager, Brandon Scamfer. Again, your staff responded with care, empathy and professionalism. After quickly assessing the situation your team went to work taking care of our family. The ambulance was contacted and brought in to pick up my wife. Your team escorted our girls and took our bags back to the room we had previously been in. This was HUGE…and allowed me to feel safe about the girls and allowed me to focus on my wife’s care. You offered to assist with the airlines if we had any problems. You offered to feed the girls or provide anything they needed while we were at the hospital. I received multiple calls while in the ER attempting to check on us. Michelle was admitted and held for observation overnight. During which time flowers, a care package and note were sent to the girls in our hotel room. Wow…. All I can say is First Class and thank you! Please share this with your team and tell them how grateful we are for the care that was extended to my family! It truly made a difference and made a lasting impression. Our trip to New York had been great, our stay at the Moxy had been great and even with this injury, the way your team responded, we only see a Great experience!Again, thank you and we will absolutely be back again and wouldn’t consider staying anywhere but the Moxy Time Square!Sincerely, Mike Minor

FYI- the rooms are TINY. Like a big suitcase just fits on the floor next to the bed. We got upgraded for free once we called reception and explained that my husband was too tall for the bed and his feet were touching the tv (he’s 6’1 so not that tall just the bed was tiny) the rooms feel like rooms in a ship. The overall feel of the hotel is cool and it’s nice to get a complimentary Prosecco at the bar upon arrival. The gym is small but effective. The customer service is overall good. The breakfast is basic however egghead is a very good option and it’s open until 2pm and was great to know our breakfast coupons included that. Our room was extremely noisy, like it was ridiculous but we were on the third floor and facing the street so we heard the trash trucks all night as if our window was open but we didn’t want to complain again as we had already been ‘upgraded’ free of charge to a larger room.

Checked in on the 15th of August. This was our first experience in New York. Overall I would have to say that this hotel is very nice and very sleek. The hotel is setup with a modern feel. Even the employees are very casually dressed and are very down to earth. My only complaint is not being able to do the early check-in that I had requested. But being able to store our bags in the storage department downstairs was very well compensating. So yes I would recommend this hotel and I would probably stay here again. I read reviews were people complained about the rooms. Yes the rooms are small, yet the room is sufficient for all your needs. I mean, this is New York, you don't come to New York to sit in the room.

This is different in a great way. Clean, modern, no fuss furniture and accents. Just what you need, super comfortable and spacious rooms. Bar on premises. Complimentary cold coconut at check in.Staff extremely friendly and helpful.

Having unbearable construction noise and loud drilling at 06:45 am in the morning was “unbelievable” experience.Also that line to get to the breakfast room with half-empty buffet (I came just for a banana and one croissant, but in vain) was “ a cherry-on-top”. So much for paying $370 per night per room. Unbelievable…...

This hotel has a bunch of great qualities that make it a very comfortable stay...1). Location-In the middle of everything with subway access within a few blocks.2) An entire team of friendly front desk/lobby staff3) Cozy rooms..have stayed in small single rooms up to King Suites and they were all comfortable...terrific use of space 4) There is a constant buzz of food/lounge activity and it doesn’t matter if you’re a college kid or senior, there is a place to spend some time relaxing with friends/family.4) Reasonable rates....the rooms are small but clean and well appointed.

Won’t be back here! I wish I had a better experience while traveling for work and staying at this hotel. Yes the room is small, but it’s fine if you’re like me when you travel and you don’t spend much time in your room. The room I stayed in was extremely noisy. I could hear the noise from the 2nd floor bar until it closed. One night that was until 1am... Then another night, there was construction noises coming from inside the hotel. We’re talking a saw, drilling, hammering - and of course I could hear the workers talking when the noises stopped. When I called to the front desk I was told the manager that scheduled it had no idea it would be so loud and they were trying to end it ASAP. This lasted from about 1am-almost 5am (I don’t know when it actually ended... I stopped looking at the time at some point near 5). I was in NY for work... all I was expecting from my hotel was a place to sleep and shower, and I didn’t get one of those things. When I asked the next morning, the manager on duty was vague and was going to look in to it more. He was supposed to call me with what they found out. I took recordings of the noises on my phone and he did not want to hear them. And I received no call. I asked that evening when I returned back to the hotel from work and that person all of a sudden claimed it was street construction noise to which I said no it wasn’t and again asked if they wanted to hear my recordings and they said no. I got only a credit of $70 for the noise complaint - not the full night. I am not a person that complains - I have been at a hotel where a roach flew out of my bath mat in the morning and didn’t complain or fuss. I have sent back 1 meal in my lifetime because it was too cold and asked them to just throw it in the microwave... but this was ridiculous. The lack of care from the managerial team and ownership of an error is appalling. I get it - mistakes happen. Own it and since you’re in the customer service and hospitality industry, hear your customer out and make it right.

I booked this hotel, because of the good reviews on Trip Advisor, free WiFi and as of this month, this property does not charge a resort fee. The hotel has a young hip vibe, with loud music playing in the lobby checkin area and on the elevators. I was told I was upgraded to a queen bed from a full bed room. I was on the 16th floor. Evidently the preferred clients are on lower floors and are provided extra amenities. My room was extraordinarily noisy since the rooftop bar was rocking until 4am. There are no ear plugs provided in the room. I was told on my second night there when I called the front desk at 2am, that I could go to the hallway stash room to get some, or I could have someone deliver some. Well at 2am, I was not going to get dressed for either. I collected some the next day for the remainder of my trip. Of course when paying a lot of $ for a room, why should I also be uncomfortable wearing ear plugs. I was told from staff that they get complaints from floor 10 up. So definitely try to get on a lower floor if you decide to stay here. My room had no dresser, desk or closet. There were hooks on the walls for hanging clothes. There is a big shower with a rain drop shower head. Plenty of hot water. They have hair conditioner and the Shampoo/body wash in combined in one in large jars in the bathroom. They do not provide body lotion or shower caps in the rooms. However I did find both in the stash closet. They have small cartons of water in the room you can pay $5 for. (Buy a jug at CVS for your stay.) Safe provided under bed. Large TV screen on the wall. There is a magnifying mirror in the room but the lighting is so dark, you can’t see the details anyways. There was a full length mirror in the room. Bed and bedding was fine. My room was provided two paper cups. One I used for my toothbrush. The other I used for drinking. It was never replaced on a six night stay. On the 5th night, by my bedside, an ant found my cup with water. When I called & I asked for a replacement cup, the staff brought me choice between a paper cup and a plastic glass. This is how I know the lower floors have more amenities. I do have a Marriott account, but the front desk couldn’t find it to add my reservation. They told me accounts are deleted from their system if they are inactive for a year. I phoned Marriott today and their computer knew me by my phone number. The rep found my account quickly and added my reservation. Perhaps this is why they put me on the 16th floor. Also, the rooms are so close to the neighboring buildings, you must keep the blinds shut 24/7. Otherwise not only will people be looking at you, you will see them. I would not stay here again unless I was provided a ridiculously inexpensive rate that could not be repeated elsewhere.

Hotel MOXY gets 5 stars for design, trendy vibe and service. Rooms are 1 star in terms of actual space and noise control. So small the furniture hangs on the wall and personal storage and safe are under the bed.

Loved everything about my stay here, location was excellent, close to subway and Penn Station, shops and restaurants, room was perfect, great facilities, rooftop bar is incredible, staff were always extremely helpful.

I stayed in this hotel 3 times already. Like the interior of the room, though single rooms are really tiny. They have very nice lobby, DJ playing in the evenings. Nice food there, especially tuna tartare. August was a bit pricey.

Stayed here with my wife during the first week of August and we had a very enjoyable time. Was worried this hotel would come across as too trendy, but it was perfect. The location is great with access to many different subway lines only 2 blocks away. You are only a short walk or subway ride from Times Square and there is always a lot of activity going on in the area. Only a few blocks north of Madison Square Garden. Plenty of good places to eat in the area as well. However, if you are looking for a hotel with a view, look elsewhere. We were on the 12th floor and you are surrounded by taller buildings and though it didn't matter to us, if you want a view of NYC, try requesting a much higher floor and try your luck there. They do have a rooftop bar and club that supposedly offers great views of NYC though. The check-in process was quick, fast, and they give you 2 free drink tokens per person for their bar on the second floor. The elevators are unique but a great concept. There are 4 of them so they don't take too long to arrive. If you want to go to your room, you go to one of the 2 panels near the elevators and select your floor number and then you have to scan your room card. It then programs your floor into one of the four elevators and tells you which one to wait for. There are no buttons inside and I felt it was a nice security feature. There is always upbeat music playing which makes the elevator ride a little more fun.  The rooms aren't the largest, but decent for a New York style hotel room. Had a queen room and we had plenty of room for our luggage and to move around. The room was clean and the bed very comfortable. The tv is mounted on the wall right in front of the bed making it very convenient. The sink is in the main area of the room but not in the way to cause any problems. The bathroom is very nice with a stand up shower area with a rain shower head. This was one of the best features of the room and very nice and relaxing after a long day of walking around New York City.  This was a great experience and you cannot beat the location or price. We would absolutely come back and stay here again. Give it a try. You won't be disappointed.

The hotel is in a great location, and it looks great - but it is very much style over substance. Rooms are comfortable and stylish but a glass door to the bathroom might be unsuitable for some people who are sharing the room with someone else! There is also very little storage space - there are a lot of pegs on the wall to hang items, and one small drawer under each bed. There are many good perks such as free coffee in the mornings and vending machines on site. We had no noise from the streets from our room, or from other rooms but we did have really noisy pipes in the walls which we told staff about but nothing was done about it.Legasea restaurant:We ate here a couple of times. Breakfast isn't the best buffet selection. Meals are very expensive, but food is good and service is too - very attentive. Can get very noisy in the evening.Rooftop Bar:We had booked brunch here for our last day, with the idea being the two teenagers with us could use the mini golf. Statues of naked bunnies were amusing for us, but maybe not appropriate to someone bringing their kids up there! The service there was poor. We asked if it was possible to sit in the shade, but we were told the shaded table was reserved by someone else. That would be acceptable, but these shaded tables remained unoccupied all the time we were there...We ordered coffee, which took 15mins to arrive. We realised it was because the coffee machine had broken and our server had to go downstairs to use the machine, but she did not explain this or apologise for the wait. We asked if we could order another coffee, and she pulled a face and said "I can't use the elevator again..." which translated at "I can't be bothered". I think this is poor as many people would be expecting coffee first thing in the morning! Perhaps customers could have been told this upon arrival, as it's hardly cheap so service should not be this poor.

The 2 star is for the shoebox room you get. It was a king and barely enough room for two people to get dressed. You can’t walk around bed. The width of the room is the length of the bed. There is no real bathroom other than the toilet and shower contained in the same capsule. Toy sink (something from Ikea) is in entry area of room. No closet at all, no drawers. Just pegs on the wall to hang things. The room is maybe 180sf with the toilet/shower. I get the efficiency but come on.Oh and AC did not work upon check-in. Staff said engineering would take care of it. Came back at 1:30am, nope. But they quickly gave us a new room and AC fine. We got a good rate for a Sunday night and we have seen rates north of $500 depending on your time. Location close to TSQR/MSG. But the Moxy is not for us. It’s more of a crash pad. Don’t plan on any time spent in the room outside sleeping. I know rooms can be small in NYC but this was silly. European tourist may be ok with size but it’s a toy closet. It’s clean and I can open door with my phone, that’s it. Another Marriott property, Aloft much better. Never coming back.

I would love to give this property 5 stars due to the awesome rooms. They are smaller with a great use of space. Very trendy and fun areas to hang out. I have to give it a lower rating due to the staff. We had four rooms, requested early check-in (I understand this is not guaranteed) but were not able to check into our last room until after 6pm. Hung out in second floor area. Serving staff was not very friendly, nighttime service for adult beverages was slow. Loved the property, just thought most of staff was rude.

This is a trendy hotel in a fantastic location. And it is new. The rooms are tiny - but if you know that going in, and factor in the price you pay, there is nothing wrong with that. The wifi works, the rooms are quiet and comfortable.Now for the bad things:- the pillows are terrible. Lumpy and some of mine smelt like sweat (not mine).- questionable sheet-change policy. I stayed for 6 days and mine were not changed until I asked on day 5, but I had to ask 3 times and speak to a supervisor to make it happen.- the elevators have a touchscreen which isn't very responsive. It's like a palm pilot touch screen from 1992. This means you have to sometimes push very hard or multiple times to get to your floor - all in all it's a bit clunkyOtherwise this is an awesome hotel. Absolutely recommended.

Second day into my stay at Room 1101 and it has proved to be a disappointment. This is my repeated stay at the Moxy chain - the last experience in Tokyo was amazing so I told my friends to stay here during our NYC trip. I checked in on 9 August around 22:00 and am staying for 6 nights. The check-in experience wasn't that great to begin, the staff struggled to find my booking and once she managed to get me a room she simply took my credit card and handed me the key cards. The impression of being welcome? Negative. The check-in counter is funky dark that I had to venture my way to the elevators. The rail that holds the bed's head panel was broken, the AC track gives weird and loud noise that the engineer proved that's beyond his ability to repair as the noise was coming from the compressor. The design of it is problematic as the cold air practically blows right behind one's head when lying in the bed. The room was not allocated on the quiet side as in the booking request. The shower doors are poorly configured, so it causes ridiculous seepage. With all these I expressed the discontent with the night shift manager who called me to offer a $50 for the first night due to the inconvenience caused, as it's late and full occupancy, he would arrange me to another room solving at least the AC problem for the subsequent 5 nights.No one reached out to arrange a room change. While I checked with the front desk at around 7pm coming back from a day out, the lady, without genuinely enquiring my situation nor the room I stayed, bluntly informed me it was 100% occupancy and she couldn't do anything about it; and said if I wanted to change room, I should check with them around noon time. She literally transferred the responsibility to the frustrated customer - me. This is not the acceptable service any hotelier gives to its customers. It is particularly bothering coming from a brand that I have had trust in.

Loved everything about this hotel. Clean, quiet rooms, with excellent, sleek set up in rooms. Shower was awesome. Bed, super comfortable. Bars were great. Loved it. Just fabulous.Elevators are the only problem I could see. Need to work out the kinks with them.

We were looking for a place to stay close to Madison Square Garden. We have always had a good experience with Marriott properties, and decided to give this micro-hotel a try. True, the rooms are small, but the common areas are inviting, and the staff is friendly and helpful.

This is nothing like a traditional hotel room in any sense. We stayed here for 1 night just to check it out. The room was modern, but really small. The queen bed was locked in on 3 sides...so basically that’s how wide the room is. 5 steps from the bed was the bathroom with sliding frosted doors, which allows you to see silhouettes...so don’t look for much privacy while in the bathroom. One downside was we could hear the music from the rooftop bar in our room, even though we weren’t even that close to the roof! The location is great if you want to be in midtown...we walked from Penn Station. It’s only 1 block to Macys Herald Square. They have a very swanky bar/lounge on one of the levels which is open late.

Marriott trying to be down with the "yoof" - a bit weird. Seems like they're pretending to be a nightclub, with music and lights and whatever. No desk in the room - guess young people don't use desks? Anyway, it was fine, just a bit odd.

This was a good choice for our family (couple, 2 late teens children) for a 1 night trip to New York for tourism. Funky interior design and high energy staff were good. However for the price (hotel was quoting $450 per room night) I would expect more to be invested in service. We had to wait quite a while for bar service, and generally the staff waited to be approached rather than proactively looking to help. Basically the service I would have expected for $100 but not $450 (although I used Bonvoy points so didn't actually pay that price). I'd stay again, though. Overall great location. Parking is just 20 yards away (but $70 for 24 hours, and close to $50 for 2-3 hours so basically you leave your car there for the duration of the stay!)

Instead of wasting time and money on retro urban chic niknaks they should’ve tried harder with the basics. Rooms are tiny you can’t walk around the bed heaven knows how the housekeepers cope changing the bedding. There are no wardrobes just trendy hanging hooks that line the wall and will dangerously cover the wall tv. There’s nowhere to stash your cases or small clothing items. The sinks are in room not the bathroom which doesn’t work. Very limited storage we think it feels like camping but with walls. The aircon is the loudest I’ve ever encountered, had to use ear plugs or I’d never have slept. The breakfast is pathetic, revolting and very limited. No Juice or tea provided but can be paid for if the staff can be bothered to do it for you. There is only rubbery scrambled eggs, one type of toast, one type of potato, bacon, not very nice sausage, croissant, butter, jam and one type of coffee in a flask. That’s it! With only basic items available they will run out quickly but the staff do not try to keep on top of topping up the food, the glasses or the cutlery. We gave up and ended up going next door to Dunkin donuts for tea and breakfast muffin. I will be asking British airways to remove them as a choice from their holiday hotel options list as I don’t believe the Moxy suits British Airways customers.

This hotel is so perfect ! The location, the rooms, the quality of the bed, the bathroom, the rooftop, the cast, the decoration/ambiance... Everything ! Thank you very much Moxy for making our stay so memorable ! We recommand and come back for sure :)

Moxy Times Square is the coolest hotel in NYC! Every detail in this hotel is so well thought out. The room was bigger than I expected, and was laid out in a way that made the space really useful! The Moxy Times Square staff is amazing, and they cater to the guests. Andrew, the manager went out of his way to help me plan a special experience for my nieces Sweet 16. This is a great place with lots of little fun things to see and do on the property.

Really enjoyed staying at this Moxy.Very minimal but has all the things you need - master switch and plenty of outlets right next to your bed, separate sink area, plenty of hooks to hang your stuffs.Second floor lounge area was convenient to kill some time after check out. 'Stash' room which you can conveniently access with your room key had all the essentials such as shower caps, deodorants etc at your disposal.The location is also great - close to all the major transportation and touristy areas.Would stay again.The only issue I had was that the air conditioner was really really loud in my room which I forgot to tell when I checked out.

Located few steps from the hurt of manhatten, great hotel with most new facilities. Aoseme roof top bar and several optations of dining in the hotelModern room and kind staff.A shirt wslk to the times square.

I stay here a lot when I go to the city because it's convenient to get to meetings. The only drawback is it's close to Times Square which I would rather avoid by any means necessary. Like the plague. Other than that the rooms are clean, bed comfortable, shower amazing ... but rooms also on the small side compared to other Moxy properties I've stayed in (Seattle & New Orleans specifically).The staff here are on point!The common areas and especially interior bar are both great. Perfect for working or decompressing after working. Or not working at all. Rooftop bar is packed on nice days with great bartenders and views of the city. Drinks aren't overpriced and the bartenders are fast, professional, with zero attitude. All in all a solid hotel and good addition to the Moxy family of hotels.

Nice hotel. Friendly staff. TV a little to big for the size of room. Other than that it was a great experience. Guess should get special access to rooftop bar. Should not have to go outside to go up to rooftop bar.

Absoulty first class...very friendly and courteous at all times...The room was gold standard and room service was on point. Ideal location to travel to and from all the major tourist attractions. 10/10.

Though the rooms are a bit on the smaller side, this is a great hotel for the price. It caters to the folks who want that trendy experience (which I loved). Still very professional, even with their casual approach. The rooms are very clean and location is great. You must check out their amazing rooftop bar!

Rooms extremely small. The size of a bed! Bathroom so small that the sink was in the room. No lighting to shave. TV to the right of the bed and right on top of it. AC blows on the bed. Asked to change rooms and was denied. Employees are NOT customer friendly at all.

Great location in mid-town. Lots-lots- of high energy, from the music in the lobby, the very friendly staff, the rooftop bar-everywhere energy. Clean, small but effective rooms and amenities. Just a solid place to stay.

I stayed at the Moxy hotel back in May. The perfect location! Everything is either a stones throw away or within walking distance. The look and ambience of the hotel are very modern. Checking in and checking out was very easy. Loved the on site restaurants as well as the amazing roof top bar which has an amazing view. The only things I would change would be the size of the room as I felt they were too small but on the plus side they were very modern. An additional thing I would change would be the incense used in the hotel as at times it was a bit over powering. What made my experience even more special was the excellent customer service I experienced from the moment I entered the hotel to the moment I left especially from one individual in particular, Sade Garcia. Sade was attentive, full of energy, super friendly and very helpful. She informed me of all of the hotels amenities as we all what events were happening in the hotel especially the rooftop bar. She was even kind enough to recommend local restaurants/eateries, bars and the best tourist spots. What made it even more special was the fact that on several occasions during her break she helped me get a cab and waited until it arrived, something I have never experienced while staying in a hotel. She made the whole process of checking in and checking out easy and stress free! In my eyes she went above and beyond which is something everyone should experience. She is an asset to the company and I believe a lot of people can learn from her great customer service skills. I will definitely be coming back this year! Thank you Sade, you made my time in NYC even more enjoyable, bless you !

LOCATION: Moxy is connveniently located -- central to all things touristy.ADD-ONS: Moxy offers interesting add-on services, including breakfast, rooftop drinks, gym and storage facility.ROOM REVIEW: The room was well kept and cleaned timely each day. The room size was moderate but well laid out.BATHROOM: Very neat. The door does not have a locking mechanism and the doors/windows are tinted so you can see through. This makes the hotel couple friendly but not family friendly.Thank you for a pleasant stay.

A quick 10 minute walk to Times Square is what sold me on this hotel. The rooms are very clean and comfortable, and the staff was very accommodating. Luggage check was great since our room was not ready when we arrived in the morning. The bed was comfortable and the shower was great. We will be back!

My daughter and I visited this past weekend. They hotel was great, staff was great, hotel is new. The vibe is what makes it. Both 2nd floor bar and roof top bar were great. Breakfast included and very good. Best part was that my daughter left some jewelry in the room, I emailed them upon our return to Chicago and within minutes I got a reply that the staff had found the Jewelry and was sending it back to us...wow...that is great service. Will tell everyone, to stay at the Moxy!!

We arrived to NYC on a red eye at 6 AM. We made our way to the hotel fully knowing that we would not be able to check in yet. They graciously held our bags while we toured the city. Marisol was so kind to us, remembered us from the morning and was able to get us checked in as soon as possible which was before the 4 PM time. She was very engaging, helpful and made my kids feel special. the room is small but clean, comfortable and the amenities are really great. The free coffee and breakfast it the morning really help the budget and the afternoon coconut drink helped in the heat. Overall, a great experience that was made better by the staff. All that we were in contact with were fantastic.

The Moxy NYC Times Square is like the geeky kid in high school trying too hard to be one of the popular group. In this case, it’s trying way too hard to be a W but falling short in many aspects. I’m a grown man who just stayed there on a five-day business trip and I’m definitely not the clientele they are going after. This hotel is for under-30 travelers who don’t care about basic comforts in order to save a few bucks and feel like they are staying in a European nightclub.On the plus side, there are no ridiculous resort fees (as is the NYC trend), there are good restaurants and bars on the property, and the location is centrally located in NYC and Times Square.Here are the drawbacks:Check-in process is supposed to be easy and people-free. But the technology isn’t there yet so you end up needing a person anyway to get your room number or help you anyway. They need to improve this. I couldn’t find a human to help when I needed it.Same goes for the elevators. They try to be all tech-savvy but the user interface is clunky and frustrating. You have to hit a variety of buttons on a screen and swipe your room card and then wait before getting on an elevator. A simple elevator where you just hit one button to go to your floor is much easier and better for the customer experience. I had to try to find a staff member to help a few times until I got used to it.Reliance on technology around the hotel including restaurant and coffee bar also made it actually more difficult to get anything. I found myself needing to find an actual human to buy something simple like breakfast. Rooms were very, very tiny and like a hostile. In an effort to look “cool,” they took away basic comforts like a closet to hang your clothes and dresser drawers. Instead, there were weird hooks on the walls and tiny cubby spaces under the bed. Bed was like a futon and pressed against the wall and window. Room was not quiet as facing the street. Towels were thin and not plush at all. The free coffee in the morning is a plus other hotels can learn from. But they should put it out earlier as I had to wait around until 6:30 for it every morning. Most annoying was the loud dance music pumping out of the speakers everywhere at all hours, including first thing in the morning on the elevators and in the hallways. Silence is golden in morning hours. Too early for that. It’s not a club.They were also trying too hard to be hip with games everywhere, including a stupid bean bag toss game right at the front door that people played as you tried to walk in.The gym was spacious and clean but still overcrowded and FULL of people just sitting on the machines and equipment staring -4 their cell phones and not working out (this is despite a rules sign saying that no cell phone use is permitted on the gym floor). These people took up all of the space and every machine, and I had to wait or ask them to leave so I could work out. They need to post bigger signs and tell the cell phone addicts to please go to the lobby to read articles or stare at Instagram. Same people coincidentally were the ones who wouldn’t wipe the machines and benches down before or after they used it. Weird.Clientele of hotel skewed very young and European, but lots of smartphone addicts everywhere staring at Instagram and walking into you/not paying attention to where they were going. Almost everyone in the public spaces of this hotel was walking around like a zombie glued to their phones. Weird and eerily like the Walking Dead! Disturbing.Overall, not a comfortable or customer-friendly experience though I did like the independence and not having to deal with staff sticking their hands out at you for tips at every turn for services you don’t need (valet, baggage, etc.) The downside is when you do need a human to help you do something basic like use the elevator you can’t find one.I wouldn’t stay there again but for the right person it might work!

Took a recent trip with my daughter for a Father/Daughter trip to NYC and came upon the Moxy based on location and price. We liked the location, just over a mile south of Central Park and a little less to Times Square. Easy to walk to or take subway (lots of stations nearby) to get to all of the tourist attractions.The room setup was great. I had a queen while my daughter had a single bunk bed above (no sharing of beds!). She loved the bunk bed as it gave her her own space. Overall, yes the room is small - similar to the size of a room on a cruise; but, like a cruise you are not spending time in your room other than to sleep, shower and change clothes. It works. Overall, the hotel staff and ambience is nice. It’s a boutique-hipster feel hotel so lots of younger hotel guests but still lots of families walking around. Fitness center is adequate. Lots of ellipticals, treadmills and free weights - best part is that everything is working! Also had some free weights. The room would benefit from a fan - can get stuffy. Only complaint happened in the last moments. We booked a car service through the hotel to get to LGA. We were quoted a flat rate of $55. When the service picked us up you could see on the visible iPad of our plan, $55. When we got out he charged us $65. I hate that deception. Not sure if he was concerned I wasn’t going to tip so he worked in his own but that is not cool and looks bad on the hotel. Since he inflated the rate he didn’t get a tip. I would suggest the hotel collect payment for service so that guests are not being overcharged for services or find a more reputable car service.

Really nice modern hotel. Quirky room. Small, but I only sleep there! Self check in, so we didn’t know how check out times worked or breakfast etc. But we found someone to ask. Really good time square location. Got a great deal on this in January!

Ridiculously tiny room with a bunk bed above the double bed. Couldn't even walk around the double. No wardrobes just silly pegs all around the room. Room was only cleaned 3 out of 5 nights. Had to request towels and extra toilet roll as not replaced and our key cards wouldn't open their "stash" room. No apology or customer service, just people making you feel you were an inconvenience. Branded water cartons in room but no mention of these being chargeable. Used twice and charged $10 a time on checkout. 2nd floor bar was ridiculously expensive and no beer of any kind on draft. $9 for a 330cl can of Peroni and $17 for a small glass of sauvignon blanc (plus tips).Hotel's focus seemed to revolve around their roof top bar where I can only presume the staff make the most in tips and the hotel in revenue. Streams of people coming and going for that which meant there was no sense of relaxation."Security" held lifts in reserve for roof top bar customers and were unfriendly and ignorant. Most staff had a superior couldn't care less attitude unless they were tapping you up for a tip.2nd floor bar frequently had one person taking up a 4 seat area on their laptops without even using the bar. No idea if they were even resident. Nobody seemed to mind. Had to frequently sit in the balcony like area above the reception which felt like a waiting room.Hotel seems to think it's really hip and cool. It's naff, unwelcoming and uncomfortable. Not recommended.

Great atmosphere, great location, excellent stay. Room is a little small but fine for a couple of nights. If you are tall however you should check if you fit in the bed :-) Located very centrally, walking distance from Penn station, Will definately come back!

As a 12+ year Marriott Gold or Platinum member, I was looking forward to trying a new chain that I hadn't yet tried. Unfortunately my experience was the worst I've had in my time as a Marriott loyalist and I would NOT recommend this hotel to anyone - especially a woman traveling by herself!I checked into the hotel with a woman named Sade. She gave me keys to my room and I went upstairs. When I tried the room, it didn't work. I proceeded to go back downstairs and wait in line to ask her again for keys that worked. She gave me new keys and I verbally confirmed the room number with her. I went back upstairs and the keys worked this time - however, there was already a man staying in the room. He started yelling which scared me, and we both realized that the hotel had put us in a dangerous situation. As a female executive who travels frequently by myself, this was unequivocally one of the worst scenarios I have ever faced in a hotel - especially in a "clubby" hotel in midtown Manhattan. It is dangerous and unacceptable. However, the situation only became worse when I went back downstairs and asked Sade to speak to the manager (named Francusco). As Francusco tried to help me, Sade stood by his side with her arms crossed rolling her eyes at me. She did not apologize once through this whole process. After I told her to stop rolling her eyes at me, she walked over to another guest service agent and proceeded in a loud voice to berate me while Francusco continued to try to help me (and calm down the other guest in the room where I had entered). While Fracusco was trying to help me, he didn't believe me when I told him Sade was rolling her eyes at me and talking about me to the other guest service agent. I was facing her - he wasn't. At this point, as a female traveling alone, I didn't feel comfortable staying at this property and asked him to help me switch properties. He insisted on trying to comp my room at his property (I wasn't interested) so I booked the Edition (a brand by Marriott I actually trust) on my phone. As I mentioned, I have stayed at Starwood and Marriott properties consistently for 12+ years and was genuinely looking forward to trying this brand. At this point, I cannot advise any female traveling alone to stay here. Not only was I put in an incredibly unsafe situation, but I was ridiculed when I tried to reconcile it with the manager. Incredibly disappointing experience!

Never stayed at Moxy before but this was a good find in NYC. Very modern style hotel with any amenity you’d need. Al like all rooms in the city it was small but comfortable.During our first night the AC died out during a 90 plus degree streak. Went to the desk in the AM and were immediately moved to a new room.Hotel was convenient 10 minute walk from Penn Station. Times Square was walkable 9 blocks. Subway stops right at 34th St.One weird thing that is apparently trending in hotels is the frosted glass bathrooms. I understand and don’t mind the shower but the toilet door was a bit much. Seeing another person’s silhouette while they are pooping was a bit much.Great stay, though, and I will return. Staff created a very fun atmosphere.

This place is so unique and fun. Little things like candy jars in the lobby, a (free) closet of toiletries that you might have forgotten, an ice cream vending machine (sadly it was out of service during our visit) really make this place special. The elevators are only slightly annoying until you figure out how they work, and then they’re kind of fun! Location is in the center of it all! We also loved the loft style room. Might not work for everyone but it was so perfect and fun for my daughter and me. We absolutely loved this place and it made our NYC trip extra special.

I am a Marriott Elite member and always try to stay at Marriott Hotels when I get the chance. The look and feel of the hotel was what I have always expected, but I was pretty disappointed with the customer service. Our first issue was with the pricing of the room, which was a bit of a Marriott issue rather than the hotel issue, but when I brought it up to the manager, they said they could do nothing about the issue and that I needed to contact Marriott, which I did. At that time I also let him know that our room had not been serviced and I called more than a half hour ago for new towels. He said he would get right on it. 20 minutes later... nothing. Then we called again for towels and the lady on the other end of the line said I see that it was requested, and I don't know why there was a hold up. 20 minutes later... towels. Then when we returned home I saw there was a receipt for $0 for my stay, but when I found a $400 charge on my credit card for the hotel which should only have been around $240, I called again. They said that it was just a confirmation charge and that it should change in about 4-6 days and I should check back. I have NEVER had that happen before. Crazy business management. It's like amateur hour, business-wise. The hotel is nice and has a certain European feel. The restaurant on site is excellent-Legasea. The drinks at the hotel are uber-expensive. $15 mixed and $10 beers. The night club on the roof takes over the hotel at night. There are all kinds of people through the hotel and it is pretty chaotic. The bouncers aren't going to smile at you, so don't expect that. Also, when you get to the roof, all the tables are reserved, so you'll be lucky to get to the bar.Like I said, while it is a nice looking hotel, I would not recommend this hotel. Too much flash, not enough substance.

Hope that you have the good fortune to meet Andy Charles at check in. He wasn’t just a staffer, he was a host. His professional demeanor, style, and jovial spirit are an awesome combination. I felt like he was welcoming me and my friend into his house, not a hotel. By the way, this hotel has it going on! It’s a special place with fantastic amenities. Perfect for the party-er, tourist or the professional needing to be near Penn Station. I didn’t think a gem like this could exist in this part of Midtown. I’m glad I was mistaken. Drawback: bathroom door is translucent, so it limits privacy.

This Hotel has an amazing service.Good rooms and beds.Breakfast was very good with enough choices and the crew members was kind and friendly.The restorant, resting area an The top-roof was very nice.I recommend this Hotel and it will be my choice for the next time in NYC.

The employees were friendly and helpful. Yes the rooms are small but extremely organized and efficient- the bathroom actually is a very good size with plenty of shelving- nice rain head shower. Had a great experience with my friends. The breakfast was delicious and Bar Moxy is a great place with excellent/ friendly bartenders. Would definitely recommend this place to others- The location is perfect. Rooftop bar was also fun-except had to wait in line to get in.

It pains me to write this, as a longtime, loyal Marriott customer, but the Moxy NYC Times Square hotel is just terrible. The room I was given was equivalent to a college dorm room. It has no closets. It has no desk. The bed had no room to walk around-an inch from the wall at the foot.  The room they stuck me in, as a supposed elite customer and prior customer at the hotel, had a “loft” bed overhead, like a bunk bed. So if you sat up from the pillows your head would hit the wood support the bed above. To answer the phone I had to crouch down under the loft bed and try to read numbers in the dimly lit area. I asked to be moved. They patched me into “customer service,” who blurted “please hold” then disconnected me. I called back, asking to speak to the manager. I was told he was not available, but would call back in two minutes. I sat there for 20 minutes. No call. Called again, finally got through to the Manager. He offered me the same size room (220 square ft) with two double beds, before disconnecting me. I finally just said cancel my booking without charge, even though rooms were tight in the city, I would go through the effort of a re-booking somewhere. Although part of Marriott, he did not offer to re-book me at one of their many others hotels. On check out, he told the front desk person to not charge me and release the room. No apologies. I found another room at a great place at three times the size and half the price. Finishing touch: just got back to my office to find an email from Moxy, containing an invoice for $1185.49. They actually charged my credit card for two nights I wasn’t there, so I now have to dispute this bill. Ahh, but I forgot the wonderful NYC cityscape view. See the below photo looking out my window—I was staring at a brick wall 5 feet away. Get it together Marriott. This place cares about its rooftop lounge and 2nd floor lounge/bar. Unless you are a Hobbit, avoid it. If you actually want a regular room, desk, (iron) and responsive service, go somewhere else. This Moxy is diluting the Marriott brand.

I am a Marriott Titanium Elite Member. I arrived at the Moxy at 8:45 am on 15-July. Since it was early, I expected to drop off my bag for the hotel to hold onto until I checked in later that day. I checked in, got my hotel keys, went up to my room, dropped my bag off, and left for the day. I came back to the hotel around 7:30 pm and my key card wasn't working when I tried to enter my hotel room. I went to the lobby and was informed that someone else had checked into my hotel room and my bag was in storage. This was unacceptable and the hotel should have handled this better. Never stay here.
user_name:
rosalynsantos
New York City, New York

review_body: Myself and a colleague stayed here for the second time. We like the hotel because it's cool and well located. However, their service needs some improvement....We asked for quiet rooms but could still hear loud music playing at night. My main complaint was my room, the usb plug socket by the bed wasn't working, I informed reception several times and asked if I could move rooms, they said they would move me if they couldn't fix it. After several times asking reception to fix it they sent engineering to my room and he removed the plug and couldn't fix it and said the electrician would take a look the next day. To his credit he gave me a US plug socket to charge my phone. However, left the socket face hanging off, pretty dangerous.I also couldn't use that light switches by my bed. I came back to my room the next day and it wasn't fixed and the socket face was still hanging off, there was no offer to change rooms. At that point I'd given up on telling them about the issue. Nobody communicated to me about when or if it could be fixed. I notified them at check out.

We spent our first night in New York at the Moxy and were looking forward to a good nights sleep after our flight from the UK. We weren’t disappointed, the room was cool and quiet, we had a fantastic nights sleep. The staff are very friendly and helpful. We might opt for room only on a future stay as you would get more choice as there are lots of places around.

Me and my other half have just stayed here for six nights and I can confidently say we won’t be returning. The staff are obnoxious and rude and the service is really poor.1) When having our room ‘serviced’, we were given no replacement towels, toilet rolls, toiletries or water - only the bed had been made. This is not what you expect for the price we paid for our stay and for a Marriott hotel. 2) When visiting the Magic Hour rooftop bar, we spent a significant amount of money on food and drink and were then almost thrown out as the bar was closing - despite the fact that the staff were at fault as they were being slow to return our credit cards. On exiting the bar, we were very quickly shuffled into the lift as the bouncer clearly wanted to shut the club and go to bed - not what you expect when you spend almost $400 on the bill.Overall, very disappointed - I would describe the hotel as prioritising style over substance. One to avoid if you’re staying in NYC.

My husband and I spend the first night of our honeymoon at the MOXY and wow they set the bar high. Although the functionality of the interior of the hotel is not conventional is was extremely stylish, clean and filled with helpful staff. The rooms are on the small size but exactly what we expected from pictures and reviews. Our particular room was decorated to the nines with balloons, champagne and trinkets that made my husband and I feel so incredibly special. Thank you MOXY for a very hospitable visit!

We upgraded our room to a suite, which was nice enough although small but then, the AC is right behind you head when you are in bed is so noisy, it is not even funny. No plug in the bathroom for an hair dryer. Our room was never cleaned on night one. The night club is pumping music and despite being on the 15th floor it is difficult to ignore. Yes, the style is cool and interesting but at the end of the day you have to deliver the goods, and as a Platinum Elite customer, this is not what I expect out of a Marriott hotel.

To start with, it was an amazing experience and the entire family loved it. Fantastic location, very functional room, different, but different can be good, as long as you are different and open for new things, things you are might not used to, yet. Some walking minutes away from Times Square Moxy welcomes you with a lobby which is minimalistic, 6 spots with terminals where you are c/i or c/o, the Moxy crew greats you and assist you wherever needed. You can directly feel, that it is meant to be for the next generation, ones you are c/i you receive your room key, without that key, nothing is possible, wrong, you can actually walk upstairs to the massive "Lounge", bar, place to socialize and be connected. Play table football, enjoy some snacks, have a drink and work, the idea is to spend time here on your tablet, phone, laptop. It's seriously a great place, we loved the idea of the table football and the snacks were great. We very much enjoyed our time and our drinks. During the day, this area is packed and it is getting less crowded during the evening, which doesn't mean it is empty. Back to receiving the key: once you received your room key, this key will allow you to call one of the four elevator. Without the key, only the crew will be able to call you an elevator, in case you must store your luggage, while your room isn't ready or after you checked out, the luggage storage is located in the basement, very convenient and easy. Once you navigated through the display of the elevator and confirmed with your room key, the display will indicate which elevator to take, don't try to take an elevator which just arrived but doesn't match with what the display told you, it won't work. Once in the right elevator, some hip music will bring you up to your floor and the signs on each floor will bring you to your room, easy. Once in your room, you will be amazed what you can do with certain amount of space. We were amazed. We LOVED the bunk bed room concept, so did the kids. The message written on the mirror gave a nice personal touch, so did the balloons, confetti and candies for the kids, that was it, Moxy concept sold, once the kids are happy, the parents are happy. Little touches here and there made the room feel warm and welcoming. The "old" disc phone, the concept of the bathrooms, the tiles in the shower, etc., all those small details just perfectly fit into the whole concept. chairs and table were tucked away on the wall and could be taken out upon need, your cloth can be stored in drawers underneath the beds or placed on hangers around the room. For sure not the place you want to invite a guest but this isn't the idea, the idea is to sleep here but this is it. Use the bathrooms and spend the rest of your time, you spend in the hotel at the lounge. The room was quiet, the a/c worked well and the water pressure inside the shower was amazing, somehow we really loved the shower. Moxy offers you a restaurant, which is located as well on the first floor and connections to some other restaurants, located in the same building. A Barber and a Roof Top Bar are as well part of Moxy. If you feel like soft serve Ice Cream, Moxy got it, same as a "convenient store" all located on the first floor and part of the lounge. We loved our stay and can only recommend Moxy, try it, as long as you are open for being different. Thanks Moxy

Thank you so much for a great stay!! The beds were super comfy and the staff made our stay so special for my daughters 16th bday with her friends. We loved the rooms and service was great!! Clean, well kept hotel in Times Square. We would definitely stay again!

Myself and three of my friends were guests at the moxy hotel. We were very disappointed about the roof top bar service. We have waited over 30 minutes at the counter ready to order and we were purely ignored by the staff. We decided to leave as with the high prices like that we would expect much better service! Music and views were good , pity bar staff wasn't professional or maybe bar policy is to serve the people they are familiar with and ignore the new customers (?!) The hotel it self was nice and clean. Room is a bit small but quite comfortable. Great location. Ivana

Moxy is always doing something new to surprise and delight. One of my favorite places to stay. Staff is great. To some of the reviews of people who don’t like the layout, or if you haven’t stayed at a Moxy, the rooms are studio-like, minimal and stylish. The space is fluid, so your bathroom and bedroom are split by a glass door, and otherwise are all just a square box of a room... it really works for me, and I like it. You’re in New York, the hotel is great for being social and active, and is perfect for the city.

The Moxy was great, especially the front desk agent DESHAUN, HE WAS SO PROFESSIONAL,his assistance is great and I thank him for assisting us, big up and best with your project in JAM, I will tell many more friends about you and tHE MOXY HOTEL.

Hi there! I stayed at Moxy last week with my 2 teenagers. The hotel was really great. The room was pretty small but we didn’t spend much time in the room so it worked for us! My son was a bit weirded out because the bathroom door is opaque and he didn’t feel like he had much privacy but, other than that, we had no complaints! Our AC stopped working 2 out of the 3 nights BUT we notified the front desk and they sent someone up immediately to fix it.The shower was the BEST shower I have ever used! The bar was very comfortable and the food was tasty. We would stay there again.

Best points....7 min walk to Times Sq. 12 mins to Central park. Luggage room available free before you check in & after you have checked out. V clean, cartons of water supplied & lots of fluffy white towels. 2 food shops within 2min walk.Negetives.....roof top bar v much a dissapointment, plastic dirty glass & smelt. Children u18 only allowed up 11am - 4pm. Rooms v small with no wardrope. Irish bar accross the road pig & whistle, ok but dont eat in there. V expensive €400 for room only rate.

The hotel immediately gives off the cool vibe that they’ve quite clearly nailed. The relaxed and dark lobby with staff in an equally relaxed uniform makes you feel at ease and requires a lot less pretence than a standard hotel. The room was creatively put together, two double beds toe-to-toe. The bathroom was separated by clouded glass walls and door.
