The entire decor was modern and stylish, but there was a lack of storage for a week long trip. The air conditioning would occasionally kick in a loud volume but would soon settle down. We could not hear the rooftop bar, as in other reviews but we did choose the 5th floor so got a slight bit of road noise, but nothing significant. No ironing board or iron, but there was a steamer which was novel and worked fine.

We stayed here for a night when in town to catch a couple of shows and had a great time. The rooms are very small by “typical” hotel standards but as expected for NYC, but what was unique was their use of hanging pegs and folding furniture as seen in pics, which was actually very useful and functional. The bathroom was actually quite spacious and a great shower. I liked having the sink in the room outside the bathroom. The staff was warm and helpful. The second floor lounge was usually empty enough to find a place to sit, relax and have a drink. Location-wise it was an easy walk to the theaters. Overall the hotel felt new and crisp and we would definitely stay here again on our next trip to this part of the city.

I have had an issue with something on my bill. I contact Marriott about the issue and they communicated they have contacted the Moxy and they would be getting back to me. 2 weeks later I followed up with Marriott and they communicated they contacted the Moxy and spoke with the manager. They stated the Moxy was sorry and would get back to me. They said they had my email and contact information. It has been over 2 weeks and I still have not heard anything from this hotel. I stay there about every two weeks for work and am just SHOCKED that no one has follow-up. I am most definitely changing my routine and staying somewhere else.

The Moxy in Times Square is a hip boutique hotel. This hotel flips the traditional hotel vibe on it's head and I liked it! When you check-in the "Crew" is very friendly and engaging. The lobby is not your traditional hotel with a large check-in desk but little kiosks which can be self-serve or the "crew" can handle your needs. The rooms have a very hip vibe with lots of fun touches...like a record player with an actual record to play, no closets just lots of hooks on the wall(there are hangers as well.) We had a king suite which was on a corner that had lots of windows with great views. Some of the rooms can be quite small but the value for this hotel makes up for it. The bathroom was had a nice rain shower head and they provide really lovely smelling shower gel/conditioner. On every floor the have "Stash" room where you use your card to access extra towels, blankets and things you might need for your stay. They will hold your luggage before and after your stay but it can get a little busy at certain times so plan accordingly. The Moxy is known for it's rooftop bar so make sure to visit while you're here. It's a happening scene with lots of young people, good music and really fun drinks. Plus you have the bar in the main part of hotel which you receive a free drink upon check-in(a glass of Prosecco,coffee,tea.) We also had free breakfast coupons for the bar area or at Egghead attached to hotel.We had a really good time staying at this fun, hip hotel in Manhattan. I would definitely stay here again!

The room and amenities of the hotel were all fine. Due to the location and previous use of the building it’s very loud at night but nothing ear plugs and white noise can’t fix.The biggest disappointment was the staff. I encountered various issues including my room key not working, my AC being broken and room needing to be moved and each person I interacted with was slow to react and made me feel like I was bothering them. Even when asking trying to get half and half for coffee in the morning I was ignored until it was obvious I wasn’t leaving and then coldly helped with the issue. The entire staff needs an attitude make over and to be reminded they are working in hospitality. Wouldn’t stay again. No one should be treated like this but as a titanium status you would think the bare minimum effort would be applied

The rooms are FABULOUS and the "CREW" members are even better!! Every single person we met was so nice!!!!!The location is PERFECT. We walked to Times Square, Central Park, a Broadway show and many amazing meals. We had so much fun hanging out on the second floor, relaxing and playing games.I won't stay anywhere else when I visit New York City.

First, the good. I really loved the design. The small rooms were VERY clean. Loved the "pod" feel, the friendly staff and the price.BUT! There were two BIG issues I had with the Moxy, and they were deal breakers for me. Consider these before booking to make sure the Moxy is a good fit. The AC compressor is the headboard of the bed. The loud compressor roars at your head with blasts of cold air at regular intervals. I woke up constantly (even with earplugs). Staff said most rooms had that configuration but after I pushed (and they saw I was Gold), I switched rooms to where the compressor is along the bed at the left. I finally covered the vent with a blanket and slept warm to avoid the blasts. For those that are not light sleepers, this won't be an issue. The communication between housekeeping and front desk staff is poor. My room was cleaned twice in a week, despite my request that it be done between 11 and 6 because of work. I even talked with a member of the housekeeping staff on my floor as I left at 11 to say I left and could it please be done by 6, but it wasn't touched. I talked to the front desk twice. Finally, I bumped into a rock star supervisor (Jessica) who got my last day sorted. I suggest that you be very clear and ask to speak with a supervisor if you have an issue to make sure it's addressed. Not a big deal for those with normal hours, but for my needs, it was not a great week. It's a shame because it's such a clean, friendly and affordable option in NYC.

We flew in late tonight from an entire day full of travel for a week long business trip. Excited to finally arrive at this boutique hotel. Only to have to deal with a disgruntled security guard of some sort next to the elevators. He was beyond rude to all of us. We are here for a business trip and would expect someone at this type of establishment to be courteous and polite to guests. He was extremely short, was not helpful when asking for information and gave us all a very negative first impression of this hotel. He seemed completely irritated to even be spoken to. We didn’t catch his name. But he’s a larger man. Bald with glasses. And extremely unprofessional works Sunday nights. Either he hates his job or has a huge ego for no reason. First impressions are everything. We are here for a long stay for conferences. All of us are now re thinking our booking because of his bad attitude. I would guarantee this will not have been the first complaint about this person. Or the last. Hopefully the Moxy management does something about it. Why be in this industry if you enjoy being rude to patrons?-signed guests who won’t be coming back

Great atmosphere, great location, and amazing staff. I was checked in by Summer and she was very friendly and very knowledgeable about the area and less common attractions and gave us great recommendations that made my trip much more enjoyable. She represents the hotel very well. Will definitely book here again!

We stayed here for five days in July and it was a lovely hotel and very central. Unfortunately, one day whilst out sightseeing all the money from our hotel room was stolen! We spoke with the hotel manager and security and also filed a police report. As of yet, we have not an update about any kind of investigation and I am not holding my breath for it. Please be very careful with your belongings and money!

Stylish; great mid-town location; rooms are typically NYC small (to tiny) but highly functional in design; large lounge on 2nd floor (to work / relax) including a bar; the hotel advertises and show pictures of the „rooftop bar/lounge“...however this is only an affiilated/different business and open only in the evening (and you have to pay a charge to go there). Service is OK (but limited offering available).

Amazing hotel! Perfect location!!! The rooms were so quirky and cute, super clean too! The atmosphere of the hotel was brilliant aswell. We couldn’t drink or go to the roof as we were 20:( If you can book here for your time in NYC- do so! You won’t regret it x

We spent two nights at the hotel as a family of three. The room was small but well designed.The location was perfect to visit the city (close to Madison Square Garden and Times Square) but surprisingly quiet.The staff was kind and the self check-in and check-out saved us a lot of time.Only waiting for the elevator was sometimes painfully long.

We (my sons and I) have just returned to the UK after a week in New York. We were blessed with excellent weather and the knowledge there was sanctuary to rest and re-charge in the shape of Moxy NYC Times Square. Its a cool trendy hotel with compact but extremely well equipped bedrooms. The staff were friendly and helpful. The only niggle was the frustrating elevator system that involved walking back and forth between the 4 elevators to get the right one. At one point only one of the 4 was working.

I can't say enough about this awesome hotel. The design is very chic and super cool. You get such a fresh energy from the moment you step into the lobby. The staff and management went out of their way to make sure we had a great time. We arrived early and even though our room obviously wasn't ready then, they called us the second it was and we were able to check in early! The management new that it was our anniversary and left us a sweet message and some treats in the room! The rooms are so cute. We loved the design and the bed was SO COMFORTABLE! Our room even had a view of the Empire State Building! The shower was exquisite ( you have to love a good rain shower!) Even though we did not have their largest room, it was more than enough space for the two of us. We had friends from NYC meet us at the hotel bar and we all had a great time! Also, if you get a chance, head up to Magic Hour and check out the AMAZING views of the city while you have a drink. I can't wait to try another Moxy hotel on our next stay! Loving this brand!

I stayed here for 3 nights including Pride Weekend. The location was terrific, close to subway, Penn Station, eateries, Times Square, shopping. Very convenient. The service was not so good. I called every night about the room. There was always some problem and not resolved quickly. The biggest problem with the air conditioner. It turns itself off if no one is in the room (how does it know no one is in the room?) - There was a broken window - the glass was not broken, but the inner part of the window was not within the windowsill track. So, hot air was coming in from the window. I think this is why the ac was not working consistently. It took hours to get someone to bring us a fan for the room. THE ROOM WAS SO HOT. It is the summer in NYC and when there is no ac and no way to open the window and no fan, what are you supposed to do? We took cold showers to cool off and when you get back into the room from the bathroom, it is hot again. Unbelievable. The people who work there at night seemed sympathetic but the issue was just not resolved. There were all sorts of other problems. I feel bad because I really want to like this place but stay was not pleasant and I can't really recommend it. That said, the location is fantastic and the mattress was comfortable. Buyer beware!!

I haven't stayed a hotel with this much personality in a while – especially in the public spaces. The retail pop-ups and curated events are fun, the food at Legasea is a must, and an evening at the Magic Hour rooftop is a NYC must. You'll also love the bear topiaries on the property. Be sure to explore the bedtime stories on the phone in your room... and keep yourself awake until the end! This is a stay like no other.

Alex and Michelle are amazing ! They are very friendly and helpful ! I’m staying here with friends for the first time over the weekend. Looking forward to staying at Moxy downtown again ! Thank you !! Michael

We are a 50ish year old couple and felt very comfortable at the Moxy in Times Square. Saturday night the nightclub was hopping (from what we could tell by the line outside and noise inside), but judging from the outfits on some of the young ladies, we were probably aged out of the that scene. We couldn't hear the music from our room, so party on!!Anyway, the room is tiny to the point of the bed reaching from wall to wall. There are plenty of hooks, but no closet and the bathroom has the toilet and shower with the sink just outside. Smallest room I've ever rented, but the atmosphere and location more than made up for it. The staff was mostly under 30 and were extremely helpful and knowledgeable. This being our first time in NYC, the staff was a definite help when needing transportation and dining advice. Our room was cleaned nicely, the lounge has a nice breakfast and the lobby always had something available (for example, the weather was supposed to be rainy, so the lobby had pink and white ponchos available to take). Although, the candy buffet was my favorite!We are already planning our return to NYC and Moxy will be our hotel for the trip!

We stayed for a solid week and would stay there again. We always felt safe in the hotel and walking to/from the hotel at night (even at 4am headed to the airport) The hotel was clean. The bed was very comfortable. The shower had hot water and a rain shower head. The only complaint I have is the elevators. At times there was a delay, but this is minor and didn't affect our overall stay. Stayed on the 6th floor with no noise complaints- even on the weekend. Shopping, food, and drug stores within a block (I ❤ NY store, Shake Shack, coffee shop, Macys). Very close to Times Square. Easy access to transportation.

I loved staying here! The location was central and convenient to everything I wanted to see/do (as well as close to train and subway lines). Slightly confusing was that the address was 7th, but the hotel entrance was actually around the corner on 36th. The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. The property was clean and offered lots to do (games in the lobby, restaurants, bars, etc.). The elevators were slightly confusing as you had to use your room key to access the elevator (but not inside the elevator like usual, you had to "badge in" on the panel outside the elevator). The room was small (as expected), but it was perfect for me as a solo traveler. The room was clean and offered good amenities. Bed was comfy. Could have used more storage space (shelves, closet, drawers, etc.), but again for just me in the room it worked out fine. The bathroom was large (which was unexpected), clean, and offered a good selection of toiletries (also, if you forgot something like a toothbrush, each floor had a "stash" closet for extra towels, toiletries, and bedding). The shower was great, but I seemed to make a mess each time I showered because there wasn't a shower curtain. Everything about this room worked well for me as a solo traveler; staying here again with another person, I would definitely get a queen or king room. My only real complaint was that one of the electrical outlets in my room didn't work (there were only two, plus one in the bathroom); it was too complicated to have it fixed, but I just used the other one farther away from my bed. I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends/family staying in NYC. I would definitely stay here again on my next trip to NYC.

Great location, quite a funky hotel, more suitable for ages 20-30 as not a lot of cupboard space for your clothing in the rooms. The rooms & bathrooms are very compact. Ideal if you’re not unpacking your bags!

Last Weekend for Father’s Day I made a visit to New York City with my Business partner. While deciding last minute whether or not to stay an additional day we chose the Moxy Times Square. When entering the lobby we came across two energetic young ladies Sade Garcia & Brianna. They had great personalities and made us feel very welcomed. Our check in process went smooth and they were very accommodating. I look forward to visiting Moxy again soon! Oh and the Rooftop is amazing !- Dante PattersonBoston,Ma

Pros-Great spot in heart of garment district just south of Times Sq-Cool design-Nice bar/restaurant and access to rooftop barNot so pro-It was fine for me, but if you need a big room, you won't get it here--bed is pushed against the wall, so you can't even get on the bed on one side-Again, I was ok with it, but shower is in same room as toilet with no curtain or door--unusual but cool

Excellent hotel, great staff, specially Ivette from the front desk, super sweet and helpful, such as JJ at the exit door, outstanding people.The hotel has great rooftop parties, good breakfast and the french fries were awesome! I just missed a mini fridge at the room ‍♀️

Bottom Line - Smaller rooms (even by NYC standards) but good enough for short stays. Beware the double and twin-beds are shorter than your typical queen and king mattresses; Avoid double and twin beds if you are taller than 177cm (5'10"). Staff are friendly but some are more helpful than others. Not recommended for business travellers or those with elite status (little to no recognition at this property).

Unfortunately this hotel has no security as such, we booked for 5 days and on the 4th day our safe in our room was burgled, this was obviously done by an employee as we had a code that no one else knew, we had money stolen and it absolutely ruined our stay in New York, when we reported this the manager showed no concern or interest, he gave us a telephone number for the police which we couldn't get through to and other than that he wasn't slightly interested, for a Marriott hotel this was appalling, if you do stay in this hotel I would highly recommend you lock your valuables in your suitcase, do not use the hotel room safe, as they are clearly not safe at all, the lack of concern was disgusting. The bedrooms did not have enough storage for clothes, we lived out of our suitcase, the lighting in the rooms is inefficient, the restaurant was absolutely fantastic, service was great and the atmosphere was very nice indeed,the reception staff were extremely friendly and helpful really great too, the bar Moxy unfortunately was not so good, very slow service and the staff were not very engaging either, it advertised a rooftop bar and as a resident I would expect to be allowed to visit anytime but we had to queue with people coming off the street and when we tried to book a brunch for 4 people we were told it would not be possible but we could have two tables of two but perhaps not sitting together !! I would most definitely not recommend staying in this hotel unless you are about 20 as it is clearly geared to the younger generation, extremely disappointing on the whole.

Stayed in this hotel for four days. The rooms were small, noisy (you can hear the shower from above and below) and unclean (dust under beds). Service at both bars slow and you are not welcome in the roof top bar if you are over 30! To top it all our safe was burgled (have found out not the only person recently). When we reported were extremely unhelpful. Had to be someone who could get access to rooms via electronic key and know how to get into the safe when locked - aparently they have a key for when guests forget their no. Offers a safe store which isn’t safe and they know this. Not the service or standard you expect from a Marriott. Good points - location, resteaurant lovely and staff service great, reception staff friendly. Customer service, cleanliness and security needs work!

Awesome idea, very self service type of hotel with minimal luxuries but all the necessities. The rooms are small yes, but that is common in NYC from my experience. The use of the space is well done and functional. The bathrooms are nice and spacious in the toilet shower area, the sink is part of your room as is the "closet" idea that is hooks on the wall. The iron and board are shared by floor, that is a bit cumbersome and there is no in room refrigerator or coffee, but otherwise good property and the service at the front desk was great, thanks Sade! Overall I would visit for a brief trip to the city where much of my time won't be spent in room. The breakfast place downstairs is delicious (Egghead) and reasonably priced for Times Square.

The Moxy Times Square looks the part but falls short in service and comfort. For starters, the luggage storage system is self service - meaning you have to venture to the basement and check it in yourself. Sounds simple enough though I was given wrong directions twice by employees and then told to wait by the person on duty in luggage storage once I did find it. Also, a bellhop was about to help with my bag until he found out I was going to luggage storage and not my room, so he backed out, assuming, I guess, there would be no tip? Why not just have someone on staff check in bags from the ground floor and not require guests to go out of their way? Another annoyance came later in the night with whatever club happens to be downstairs or nearby. Cheesy Top 40 remixes bumping late into the night. And to top it all off, the next morning, the shower oscillated between cold and lukewarm.

A convenient location. Our room was comfortable, clean and the space was efficiently used. The bed was comfortable and it was generally quite except forthe A.c.unit which was not equipped with a remote control. Breakfast was delicious every morning as well the staff was friendly. Would recommend staying here.

Smallest room I've ever seen in a hotel. So small that it is only as wide as the bed is long. Cannot walk if front of or behind the bed so the only way to look out of the window is to crawl across the bed. The sink is not in the bathroom, it's next to the bed. The drain did not drain. The shower was fine. The maid only came once in 3 days and I was out of the room ( thank God ) for most of the day. No maid . My suggestion - spend a little more money and get a better hotel. This was the worst NY hotel room I've ever been in.

This concept hotel form Marriott is indeed a great concept with a funky vibe and cool layout and chilled out style. The location is fantastic if you want strolling distance to Times Square and pretty much any theatre you’d want to get to. The rooms whilst small are functional and you have to remember that it’s the middle or Manhattan and a decent rate. What’s not small however is the great full shower which is literally refreshing to have in New York accommodation. The small room size is more than made up for with the ample variety of common spaces downstairs ranging from lounge to desk spaces and games to full bar. Unfortunately where the hotel is let down is the chilled out vibe can border on disinterest from the staff. Common standard offerings like bar food at night and in room mini bar are absent. For the second day in a row our room was not made up, with seemingly no standard system in the hotel for dealing with that. The website alludes to a hotel rooftop bar but it’s actually just a space leased to another operator. So whilst a nice feature offers no special accessibility to in house guests (you ridiculously will have to go out the street to come back and use the same elevator you just took to your room) or room charge facility. It’s somewhat suffers from trying to be so cool it forgets to offer decent service. Overall the hotel is a great choice if you don’t care about hit and miss service but want a modern fresh place to stay in a great location. It’s busy and noisy but that’s a plus for as many of us as it is a negative.

It's quirky, and designed for a younger crowd. Rooms are small and basic- if you're sharing a room, hope your partner doesn't have to get up in the middle of the night too often! Not much in the way of public space except for the bar, which is rather noisy. Whoever designed the elevator system was overly fond of new gadgets. No closets or drawers - you hang all your stuff on the wall pegs - which means there's not much room to store luggage. The staff was friendly and helpful, though, even to a couple of elderly travelers, and it's less than a 5 minute walk from Penn Station.

the rooms are way too small....and the prices are way to high for what you get...Also, very loud: they have parties all night long....impossible to sleep.Won't stay there again.the only good thing is the position: very close to the subways and times square....

That’s what a proper New York hotel should look like: modern, original and fresh. Good room size, great deco, amazing bar and friendly staff. Oh and the elevators...just wow...great music choice and modern.

Lovely hotel, staff were great very welcoming. Love the relaxed friendly vibes. Lovely clean tidy room was on the small side but your in New York you dont go to sit in your room. Amazing shower we loved the MUK products. Room had a hairdryer and steam iron, table and chairs, great TV. Room was cleaned well. Definatley go to the roof top bar its great up there with views of the Empire State. Lovely location as you have everything around you! We would stay again if we came to NY again.

Stayed here on business. The location at 36th and 7th is great -- close to Broadway shows, tourist sites, business meetings in midtown, and more. The lobby is small but fun and they get you through check-in very quickly. The staff is friendly and efficient. But, the rooms are tiny -- even for Manhattan - and very basic with no sitting area and only bare necessities though the bathroom was decent size and well designed with big shower. My room had a small slit of a window with no view (this was on the top floor of the hotel which is 17th) and little light. You had to climb into the bed from the lower end as the walls on either side were too close for walking. I am not exaggerating. The rooftop bar -- called Magic Time -- was relaxing and enjoyable. The views were good of Midtown. The snacks and drinks were good and reasonably priced for the area. The atmosphere was quiet in one area and more loud\music\energy on the other side giving you a choice. I liked the hotel but the rooms were just too small. The price was not that much less than other nearby hotels with larger more livable rooms.

Visited new york for 4 nights for the boxing at Madison square garden. Fantastic hotel in a prime location and a great price. Spent most evenings in the rooftop bars. Thoroughly enjoyed our stay and will definitly be returning to Moxy times square

I have stayed with the Moxy NYC twice. Once last year for my best friends 30th birthday organised through a travel company and again as a returning customer on April 9th with 3 friends as an extension to our visit we made with our choir. The hotel is fun,hip and modern and until my recent experience I would have continued to be a returning customer, recommending to both friends and family. Not anymore! I wouldn’t stay there again or any of the Marriott hotels if you paid me! The lack of customer service is disgraceful. Me and my 3 friends checked into the Moxy... no problems there, we gave the Moxy my credit card details (as I had arranged everything) for the duration of our stay. We then checked out on the 11th April to find out they do not accept cash as payment, a pain but also not the end of the world so I agreed for them to use the credit card I had given to pay for the 2 rooms and my friends would pay me when my bill came in. A few days after returning back to the UK I noticed I had 3 separate payments on my card. 2 payments of $647.76 for the 2 rooms for the 2 nights and then another payment of $323.88. I have been in contact with Amex ever since disputing this charge and still, as I write this on the 8th June this has not been resolved. I thought the Moxy would have looked into this, saw this was a mistake in the system and reimburse me straight away. Instead it seems they have not even taken the time to look into this properly and have sent documents to Amex which shows this was a bill for 1 room on the 9th checking out on the 10th for 1 person? However we were 4 guests there for 2 nights? What annoys me the most is that I have sent 2 very lengthy emails to the Moxy FAO the manager and they have not even had the decency to respond to either of them! So it makes me question, is this just a system error or is this deliberate fraud/ theft? I have seen similar reviews on Trip advisor and I am now very concerned about using my credit card abroad again. We put our trust into hotels, giving our card details and it seems this can be very easily abused. I have made numerous phone calls to Amex and I have also sent copies of all email correspondence relating to my booking including me making the reservations back in 2018 and reconfirming the reservations early 2019. The emails clearly show dates, number of nights and all 4 guests names. I am not sure what else I can do? I just hope that someone at the Moxy looks into this again and using a-bit of common sense, realises the error they have made. The only other option would be to go down the legal route!

We stayed for 3nights, checked in early at around 3pm with no problems at all, we was given all the information we needed, and shown how to use the lifts, which was something I was dreading, from reading previous reviews, but actually it’s a really good system, and is so very simple! Every guest simply just uses the touch pad outside the lifts, chooses where they are going eg bedroom floor, bar, luggage room/fitness centre, then it tells you what lift to use, so remember don’t just jump in a lift as it might not be going where u want. I think it worked brilliantly, and wasn’t waiting long at all. The first thing you notice when you enter the hotel lobby is the smell, it was lovely, and a little sweets cart in the corner for you to help yourself! Perfect simple touches make all the difference. Plus 2 tokens for free processo in the bar, great start to the holiday, thank you! The hotel room itself I would say is rather small, but we did have the cheapest room so not sure what an upgraded room would be like, and the bed felt small and we aren’t big people, and although no you don’t spend a lot of time in your room, and this is my 3rd time in NYC and rooms are known to be small, but this is very small compared the the other ‘small’ rooms I’ve stayed in at other hotels, but on the plus side the best bathroom and walk in shower though, don’t usually get good showers when staying away but best shower I’ve had! We stayed on floor 7, so no music noise, but did have some general road noise but that’s to be expected I’m afraid. The air con was rather noisy, which to be honest aren’t most, but you do just get used to it and for a hot sunny stay it’s needed at night for summer. So with all this being said I wouldn’t hesitate to stay again, I would maybe just choose a bigger style room, as staff were brilliant, location was great, and I really liked the vibe. Also we asked for a late checkout and they said we could at 1pm for free, but we asked if we could pay for a later time at a charge of 50dollars till 4pm was brilliant! So again thank you, it made life much easier so we could enjoy our last day, and come back and freshen up for the 6hour flight home. Thanks for a great stay! We shall definitely recommend and may be back if we shall return to NYC!

Just returned from a 5 night stay at the Moxy Times Square. What a refreshing funky modern hotel. Lots of little perks and ads ons to make the stay easy. The reception staff were great and always welcoming every time we walked iI had read the rooms were on the small side, which indeed they are, but they are equipped with furniture you can move around and make the room work for you. The showers were amazing and just right pressure etc. Beds were comfortable and the room was well maintained. The stash which is on each floor, is brilliant as well for an extra pillow or two and guests can help themselves. The hotel was really busy and at times lifts took a while (something that is just part of life in this city) we were offered a free glass of champagne as part of being Elite customers. My only criticism for the weekend is the bar staff at the main hotel bar were rather unfriendly. ( visited 3 times and all 3 times staff really uninterested) I have recently read other reviews saying the same. I do agree that they need to take a leaf out of receptions staff because they really didn’t make for a nice atmosphere round the bar, so we quickly moved to the atrium out the way which was a nice chilled area to lounge around for a bit. That is my only negative comment for this hotel.Highly recommend this hotel for work or play and the location is spot on for all NYC amenities.

The hotel is located right in the middle of midtown with great access to the city. Facilities were all sparkling clean and provided everything we needed. At check-in, I had a particular request they really didn't need to honor but the manager Mike was excellent. He couldn't have been more helpful and on a busy weekend in early June as well. The free glass of Prosecco didn't hurt one bit. The rooms can be small, but the idea is that you're not spending a lot of time in them.

Just returned from a 5 night stay at Moxy NYC with my wife and 8yo son.Check in was good. Very warm welcome from Michael who had a good bit of banter with my son and I about PlayStation games after spotting my son’s tshirt and all whilst checking us in with minimal hassle and explaining what was what.I had read some reviews about the lifts(elevators) but personally found them a breeze and actually a good system. Choose bedroom floors, then your floor and you’re told which lift to use I.e. P1 or P2 etc. Simple.Our room was as we’d expected. Small, well laid out and very clean. The bathroom with shower was great and to be honest, I’d happily give up a bit of bedroom space for that walk in shower. Really refreshing before and after a long day in the city.The cleaners did a great job daily and the front desk staff were very polite and willing to assist with anything. Great asset to the Moxy. However, I do feel that the bar staff could perhaps take a leaf out of the front desk staff’s book as the bar staff were miserable and despite me trying to engage them for the minimal amount of friendly small talk whilst ordering/being served, they were very cold and uninterested. Not sure that was just with me as I didn’t see them crack a smile with anyone. No great shakes I guess.Negatives: not many. 1) Irons in the rooms in stead of those pathetic steamers 2) some attention to the air con units when on cold/fan setting 3) drink prices at the main bar (we couldn’t use the rooftop one as with an 8yo) beer and cocktails were very expensive even for NYC imo. None of this spoilt it for us. We’d definitely stay again but...it’s a big city so you never know.Thanks Moxy!

Great location. Entrance was confusing because it’s not on 7th like the address. Elevators choices are great. Bag/luggage storage was a hot mess. Staff was new so they were still learning. They didn’t always have the answer.

I really like this hotel for business - this was my second stay - and while I'd like to give this an "Excellent" rating, the service in the Moxy Bar on Wednesday night was terrible. We sat at the bar (not terribly crowded) and were ignored, so we moved to the lounge, where we were ignored again. My colleague even got up and asked someone working there if we could order drinks and was told, rather curtly, that "someone would be over soon". After waiting for another 20 minutes, we left. Legalsea, on the other hand, was very good - both food and service.

Great hotel, very stylish and quirky. Not your usual style of hotel but that was a good thing! Staff were very helpful, great vibe as soon as you walked in (felt like Vegas!). Hotel is in a great spot, not far from the subway, Times Square or Empire State. Rooms are comfortable and modern, no unnecessary furniture, it’s functional to maximise space (NYC hotel rooms are typically on the small side) Negatives? Rooftop bar prices - $11 for a small can of lager, also it’s not open all the time. Other than that a great stay. We loved the city.

This is the worst hotel I have ever stayed in, so where should I start. The rooms are cheaply made and overpriced, the A/C in the room in which we stayed never worked properly, which we complained to the staff about, we continuously had to ask for clean towels to bathe and the food in the hotel restaurant was NASTY and the staff was rude as hell! I guess they are not using to seeing blacks stay in Manhattan. I will never stay in or recommend this hotel to anyone!!
user_name:
Michael K
Memphis, Tennessee, United States

review_body: We spent 4 nights here and couldn't fault it. It is in an excellent location and everybody was very helpful and friendly. Although our room was on the small side it was perfectly adequate and the bed was very comfortable. We particularly liked the bathroom and the shower was great . Due to bad weather and my husband's mobility we spent quite a bit of time in the hotel. I particularly liked the fact that complimentary coffee was available in the mornings.We enjoyed the food and drink, although we found it expensive. It was our first time in New York so I guess we didn't know what to expect . We were advised to go up early to the rooftop bar and to take advantage of their happy hour. We were glad we did so as their prices are crazy. However we thoroughly enjoyed our time up there. The staff were friendly and helpful and our 2 for 1 cocktails delicious! If we return to New York we will not hesitate to stay at the Moxy. A great find!

Mistakes were made by Marriott/Courtyard Herald Square who accidentally gave away my room for Memorial Day weekend. I was left stranded late Friday night alone in a new city and was pretty distraught. Marriott/Bon Voy reached out to them, and they gave me a room, and even a free upgrade which they did not have to do. I was a mess, but they were kind and helpful. Special shout out to the hotel manager (Veck?) and Mike.

I just stayed at Moxy Times Square with my 2 little boys and it was great! I stayed in a room with 4 twin beds set bunk bed style - perfect for a family of 4 - the beds were super comfortable and easy to climb on/off. The front desk crew were all wonderful and welcoming. The room was clean, functional and with a great shower! The lounge area located on the 2nd floor was spacious and fun! My kids think that I am the coolest Mom because “this was one of the coolest Hotel we stayed at” We will be back!
user_name:
Nicoleta1122
New York City, New York

review_body: We did not like this hotel at all, the room was absolutely TINY and I totally agree with the points in the reviews below - - Elevators did not work, unbelievably frustrating system that results in ridiculous delays and not ending up on the floor you want to be on- Luke warm water from the shower- Reception staff were quite rude and unfriendly- Room was very loud between the AC unit and noise from outside/the barsThe only positives were that the room was modern and clean, and the location is pretty handy for Penn station and times square.

The Moxy is like a hostel - sparse, small, and like a dorm room. No amount of chic makes up for that. I would not recommend this if you are anticipating a traditional Marriott style hotel. Extremely small rooms, missing simple amenities like irons and ironing boards (and if requested you get an ironing board that sits on top of a table), very poor lighting (even worse than the typical hotel room around the sink), etc. It may be worth it on a budget but do not consider it if your company expense policy will accomodate more.

I don’t even know where to begin with this one.I think I can start by saying that we really didn’t enjoy our stay at The Moxy, Times Square and we certainly wouldn’t be returning or recommending to friends.We are first time visitors to NY and so maybe naively thought that the best place to stay would be right in the middle of town, but I think this was our first mistake. The area is full of big chains, nothing cool or independent and the noise at night is honestly next level. I wouldn’t say I’m a light sleeper normally but I slept really badly for the whole week because of it.This wasn’t helped by the fact that the air con sounded like a small truck was in the room (and as the weather was beautifully hot, we did suffer over night with over heating as we just couldn’t sleep with the air con on (it was up against the headboard).Another point to mention is that the shower is warm, but not even close to hot and it stayed this way the whole week. We did complain to reception on about day 3 about both the air con and the water, at which a point they said they would send up an engineer but it didn’t appear that anyone came to fix it. As a whole, I did feel that the room facilities were lacking, no safe, no kettle/tea or coffee making facility, no mini fridge . Which when you’re there for any period of time is really quite necessary and was sorely missed. On arrival we were given 4 tokens for a complimentary glass of champagne in the hotel bar. We decided to use the first two on our first night, but wished we hadn’t. The man behind the bar, emptied the bottom of a bottle of Prosecco in to two (wine!) glasses and looked pretty annoyed at having to do so, needless to say we didn’t stay for another drink and didn’t even go on to use our remaining tokens as it was just an uncomfortable experience.One part of the hotel that we were really looking forward to was the roof terrace which on the website looked super cool.The reality is that the terrace is accessed from a separate doorway outside of the hotel (even though there is actually a way that you could get there from inside the hotel) so that’s just annoying. Then once upstairs, you can’t actually just pop up for a drink as all of the tables seem to be reserved. The main area had very loud music playing, (this was at about 6pm, so was just way too much) but then there was a party on the separate end of the terrace who had a band playing and so there were actually two different musics being played over each other and it was just really an extremely unrelaxing environment, we then spent $55 on two drinks and a portion of fries after which we quickly left!! Not to mention that the pretty amazing view of the Empire State is quite severely obstructed by a huge, pretty ugly rotating chair!We ate in some really fab places during the week and as a result often came back on a night super full and as a typical English person, craving a cup of tea before bed. When I went to get one from the bar, I was disappointed to find that they couldn’t provide a cup/mug and my only option was to have it in a paper cup!! Just another thing that made me feel like we were paying a lot of money to stay in a basic hotel. Probably worth mentioning no option of room service either, which I realised when wanting to order drinks to the room one evening.I think the final but probably most annoying point is the severe problems with the lifts (elevators) they are operated using your room card, meaning you can’t just jump in if one is there but have to use a touch screen to order it to your floor etc. There were times when we waited 15 minutes for a lift, and didn’t get in to it at pretty much any point without having other guests complaining about having the same issues and about ready to pull their hair out, I can’t even explain how bad it was, it was honestly like a private joke between guests!!I’ve noticed on quite a few of the comments back from The Moxy on reviews below, that you feel that customers just haven’t ‘got the vibe’, but I really think that’s being misunderstood by yourselves.That is unless your desired vibe is, teeny tiny bedrooms, poor bedroom facilities, nightmare elevator experiences and bad nights sleep.I am 26 and my husband 24, and we were actually really looking forward to what looked like a cool, high end, funky hotel, but were left very disappointed. We stayed at the Hoxton in Paris last year, which I think has nailed the vibe that you are aiming for and we just wish that we’d stayed at their Williamsburg location on this holiday too.In fairness the interior decor was nice and the mattress was comfy.

3 of my friends and I decided to stay at the Moxy Hotels (Times Square) for 7 nights early in May 2019 as we had to attend a seminar in Manhattan prepared by our Business School back in the UK. Our stay was quite pleasant at first, and the hotel had a clean room, a little small but had absolutely any amineities any guest could ask for. The hotel also had a nice rooftop.The main issue took place 2 days before we had to check-out, when, in the morning I open my zipped up laptop handbag, which I had kept next to my bed all week, to find that the envelope containing all my money, had been gone. Someone had clearly entered the room, unzipped the bag and taken it. As I ran down to tell the lobby about the situation, I was hopeful they may have a protocol to catch whoever did this, and find some way to help me out, as I had no idea how to go through the next 2 days, with no money to eat or even pay the hotel at check-out. Unexpectedly, the hotel did not take the matter seriously at all, the security staff present in the lobby was the only person willingly trying to get to the bottom of the issue, by trying to get the head of security on call, while the rest of the management in the lobby were totally unprofessional. I was given the contacts of the head of security and the “manager” of front-office, after sticking around the lobby almost all day in order to make sure they do their due diligence and catch an actual thief of an employee inside their own hotel. To cut the story short, I never heard once from the “manager”, and as I tried contacting the head of security, I got rude responses. All in all, the Moxy Hotel only cared about getting their money back and never cared one bit that one our their customers was left with only 4$ because one of their employees wiped him from all his money. I have learned my lesson, and I will never be staying at hotels such as this one, especially after the fact that i had read a review on here that such a theft had also happened last year at the Moxy, and they still did nothing about it. Managing hotels isnt for everyone, and it requires a great deal of responsibility and hospitabilty, and unfortunately Moxy has neither, if I were to advise anyone, stay away from The Moxy and it’s chains.

This place is beyond hip. The only complaint I have is the elevators. They are also beyond hip. Don’t look for any conventional number buttons or any buttons. That’s ok except they are slow as molasses. And one of the days it was stopping at every floor and we squeezed in like sardines. That being said, I really liked this hotel. The staff is very young, friendly and helpful. The rooms are very small. But, they are very clean, the bed is very comfortable and the shower is great. The location is fantastic. Also, the price was very reasonable for NYC and they didn’t rip me off with a resort fee like other hotels in NYC. The downsides are the place is so hip I felt like 80 instead of 60 years old and the elevators stink. Fix the elevators and you have a slam dunk.
user_name:
Ron D
Baltimore, Maryland, United States

review_body: This moxy offers smart clean rooms for a good value in the heart of NYC. Blocks from Penn Station and Times Square, the super helpful staff ensure that you are well taken care of and assist with any questions you might have.

I loved the vibe of the hotel! Once u enter u r greeted with a lovely smell. The lobby is small and not ur usual reception area. There r seveal computer area for check in and the staff wear dark olive bomber jackets...sooo cool. The hotel is busy with young travellers. Hotel doesnt accept cash for room payment only credit card and they add 20$ per day as a deposit only. There was a problem with my reservation stating 1 nite instead of 2, but once i showed them the booking.com confirmation they fixed it and were very helpful. The elevator is accessed through the room card from the outside and once inside the elevator there r no buttons 2 press so u hav 2 make sure u did the steps from the outside of the elevator. The room is nice and bright. Small but like all hotels in NYC but perfect 4 a solo traveller with 2 luggage. The bathroom is funky and reminds u of a school or pool area. The room overlooked the street but the noise was not overwhelming. There is a lounge on the 2nd floor were u can buy breakfast and is there is free coffee till 10am. The 2nd floor was always busy with people and has nice seating areas. There is a club on the rooftop but didnt try it. Several places 2 eat and buy snacks close 2 the hotel. The subway stations r a short 5 to 7 minute walk. Loved the hotel and will definitely go again.

I needed one night between the end of a business trip and the start of another, for which there was no point in returning to the UK. I’ve stayed in many Moxy by Marriott properties, and the newish property close to Times Square fitted the bill. The PGA golf out on Long Island made staying by JFK horrendously expensive, and whilst no NYC property is cheap, the Moxy was comparative to other nearby properties. Add to that Marriott Elite status and a guaranteed late check out, and it was the right choice.I’ve stayed in enough Moxy properties now to know they are funky. I’ve been serenaded at check in, I’ve had decorated rooms, and until this stay, every Moxy room I’d stayed in was identical. This property was different...it had a NYC “loft living” vibe to it. Don’t get my wrong, the rooms are tiny...best suited to single occupancy as the bed is pressed up against the wall. I loved the funky bathroom, and although there is no closet, that aligns with other Moxy properties. Staff I encountered were friendly, and I used a token for a free glass of Prosecco in the Moxy bar area which is convivial, friendly and quite trendy.The sleep I had was the best in a week, so the bed worked. Towels were fluffy and new, and the TV worked well, as did the free WiFi.This review would have a been a “5” but for the horrendous elevators. Firstly they are complicated. Secondly they are slow. If you want to go to floor 8, you don’t simply press “8”...rather you have to use a touchscreen to select your floor, scan you key, and then it tells you which lift to use. There’s no floor level indicator so you don’t know whether you’re in for a 30 second wait or a 5 minute wait. Then you discover that another 30 people are trying to use the same lift, and you don’t fit. The SHORTEST wait I had for a lift was 7 minutes, and bear in mind this property has 4 public elevators. It also has a service lift, and queues were so bad at one stage that a number of guests including me were taken up in the service lift, seeing parts of the hotel I should never really have seen. I spend 150 nights a year or more in hotels. I’ve never come across an elevator system like this. It’s in-necessarily complicated, confusing for guests, and really needs a rethink. It was so bad it would make me think twice about staying here again, even though the rest of the stay was good.Lifts aside, the stay was good. My late check out worked perfectly, location was perfect...it’s just a shame those elevators left their mark.

Super cool hotel. Great vibe. Cool rooftop bar and club. But... The elevators suck! Having to wait up 20 minutes for a lift to your room floor or off your floor is just stupid. There are 4 elevators and only two are for guest. One is supposedly broken and the other is dedicated just to the rooftop bar. While I can kind of getting over being frustrated by the elevators the young lady at desk was anything but corrdial about it. She asked how our stay was and I said 'great, except for the elevator issue'. She then proceeded to argue with me about the elevators. Ridiculous. But still, cool hotel, great location, just need to fix the elevator programming and resolve a little service training.

Came here for husband and mines wedding anniversary. Just know you'll be accepted regardless to who you are. They are very open to all individuals regardless of race,colorc ethnicity or sexual orientation. Every single staff member treats you with an amazing opening compassionate feeling. Jamal and the crew was amazing. They left me the cutest note on my room mirror and decorated it for my anniversary. They were just the best staff I've come across in a long time, no snooty attitudes, they make eye contact and know how to have conversations and make you feel at home. We will be back to this hotel again and again and again. Oh and you get everything you need in one place. The lovely lady who checked me out was amazing as well. The location couldn't be in a better place, literally near Times Square. Go here you wont regret it, I promise you. You may see reviews about the elevator but honestly the hotel is amazing and it's a digital/computerized hotel, it's not going to be perfect. This hotel is just amazing.

I was visiting NYC for a long weekend on my own dime, so looked for an economical option near midtown via Marriott's new BonVoy search platform. I had qualms about the Moxie... it clearly targets a young and trendy clientele; I'm not that. Because I'm a Marriott points person, I got upgraded to a corner queen room, that may have made all the difference.The rooms are very basic, with luggage stands and tables that fold and hang on the wall. There is no closet, just hooks and hangers, similarly attached to the wall. The bed was very comfortable. A large sink with shelves sits outside the whimsical bathroom, that includes just a toilet and large shower behind a sliding glass door. The shower is tiled as if it were a swimming pool with warnings about 'no diving.' For one person, the space was perfect for me. Had I shared it with my spouse, we might have been crowded. There was a wall-mounted, large flat-screen TV with cable channels at the foot of the bed, but mounted too low to actually watch in bed.Check-in is designed to be automated, but there are live agents to help. The elevator system takes some getting used to: You select a range of floor possibilities, then the specific floor, then scan your room key, after which you are directed to one of four elevators that has been programmed to go to your floor. People invariably get on the elevator that is not theirs. I saw no one else staying there remotely my age (66), but no worries. The second floor features a large bar area with pool table and such and access to in-hotel restaurants. There is an area where you can select snacks, drinks and light meals (salads and such) to pay for at the bar and take to your room. There is a nightclub of some sort, which did not interest me--HOWEVER the booming music from which echoes throughout the sleeping floors of the hotel until the wee hours on weekends. I am not a light sleeper, but if I were, that would be my primary warning.Other complaints are minor and more directed at the clientele than the hotel itself. It rained during 2 of my 4 days there, and waiting for an uber required one to step out into a bevy of smokers immediately outside the entrance. (As a cancer survivor, I'm amazed young people still smoke so heavily.) One morning went I left my room the hallways on the 12th floor were strewn with empty pizza boxes. Perhaps because I had a corner room, I was not bothered by noise from other rooms.

Hmmm... Where to start? Oh right, let’s start with the good points; that should be quick:- Location is excellent, steps away from Times Square, Macy’s and the underground.- We also loved the shower room.- Confortable bedding.But aside from that... the fact that this is a 4-star hotel is an absolute disgrace. Customer service is not even a subject in this hotel, where kids who barely say hello check you in in a condescending manner. Guys, let’s not forget who is the customer here. You are not doing us a favor, we are, let’s try to remember that...Lifts are ludicrously slow (15 min wait to get to my room, in a 4-star hotel, seriously?)Our room, for which we paid a supplement (not your standard room but supposedly a Superior), turned out to be a box with a single tiny window. The opposite wall was literally 3 ft away.When we asked if we could change, the manager told us someone would get back to us, for which we are still waiting 2 nights later.The water in the shower is lukewarm. There is no closet in the room, no table, no armchair, so you end up with the floor littered with your possessions and open suitcases.Standards are high in NYC, and we will definitely never be coming back to Moxy!

Well, where to begin! I have given this review one star for its location and the fact that the bed was comfortable.My husband and myself went to USA to celebrate my 50th birthday - a trip that we had saved for for many years. We travelled for more than 12 hours to get to New York and on arrival at The Moxy received no words of welcome or asked how our trip was - instead we were greeted by a young, arrogant man in a bomber jacket, who barely spoke to us as we were checked in. He didn’t tell us anything about the hotel facilities, how to get to the room or why he was putting $100 on my card.When arriving at our room we were gob smacked at the size - it was as wide as a double bed - we would both have to climb in the end of the bed in order to get in! We turned on the air conditioning and it sounded like there was a tractor in the room!! There was no way we would have been able to get any sleep, so we went back to the reception to be greeted by the same man, who eventually (after sending maintenance men to look at the air conditioning and making us feel like we were complaining about nothing) swapped us to another room but advised us that this one would be even smaller!! This room was of similar size but the sink was in the tiny bedroom and not in the bathroom. I knew that hotel rooms in New York are meant to be on the small size but this was just ridiculous.Our main reasons for booking this hotel was for the roof top bar which in the pictures looked amazing. However on visiting this one evening we were made to feel very unwelcome and as if we just did not belong there. This was not the New York hospitality that we received anywhere else. There was one nice young bar man who chatted to us but this was after he checked with his manager if we could be served or not. We felt totally uncomfortable being there and did not visit again, which I think is just what they wanted.This hotel is trying too hard to be hip and trendy and seem to have forgotten how to make their guests feel welcome and to want to return there.What a shame. I would not recommend this hotel - I’m sure there are plenty others that would be a similar price, give you more space and make you feel like there were happy to have you there.New York however was absolutely amazing and the location of the hotel was great for visiting all the tourist attractions.

The rooms are funky and functional - best shower ever!!! Location is absolutely perfect for exploring both uptown, Downtown and mid and the food was reasonably priced and very tasty - great vibe about the whole place - the lifts run extremely efficiently and the rooftop bar is AMAZING!

I would never normally write a review bad mouthing a company but this hotel completely ruined my experience to NYC. The hotel itself is beautiful and quirky and everything that I would be hoping for but the "customer service" that I experienced here was just unbelievable. Long story short, me and my two friends wanted to split the price for a room at check out, I had my credit card on file (in case of emergency) and we all wanted to pay via our pre-paid cards with us being from the UK. I have ended up paying for my third three times over, my friend twice and my other friend was the only one to be charged the correct amount. This left us out of pocked for the rest of our trip to NYC, sent me into my overdraft and now I am paying fees through no fault of my own. We were promised an email to confirm the charges and a receipt of the transaction to provide to our bank, nothing has been done. The gentleman who first dealt with us was rude, refused to answer my questions when I asked why I had been charged (at that point twice) and he lied and said it was pre-authorised. He walked off in a huff when I asked to speak to someone else as at this point I was becoming upset. The manager Victoria did offer us a complimentary lunch which was great, but in no way makes up for me paying three times more than I should have and I am still yet to receive a refund. I am devastated after such an awful experience in what could've been such a magical trip.

I very much enjoyed my stay at Moxy NYC Times Square. The room was nice, the staff was very helpful and it was very convenient. The noise was nearby events was probably more than most people would like. I used earplugs to block it out when I was ready to go to sleep, so it worked out fine for me.

Thank you Moxy Hotel for the fun visit! We got breakfast included with our stay and it was very nice. The hotel is cute and fun. The bedroom was very nice and clean. A short walk from the train station we felt this was a great place for a great price. Thank you Ceaser for the excellent cocktails! Will stay again if I’m New York City.

I have never in my life written a Tripadvisor review but this hotel was so bad that I just had to. I'd have loved to work this out with the hotel directly but as they did not have any interest or customer service skills, I wasn't given a chance. This is not a hotel but an expensive youth hostel. I was booked for a longer stay but changed hotels after few days because I just couldn't take the "Moxy experience" anymore. Entrance experience: Deafening music and a bunch of staff standing around in bomber (!?) jackets. They were too busy to look cool to take care of their customers. And what's with the parfym you keep bumping in the air? Thank you also for the wine token, which was promptly taken from my room the next day. The elevators are a nightmare and there are confused people going up and down.The room is tiny, separate shallow sink is not functional. Trying to work is impossible as there is no desk and no chair. The shower only produces lukewarm water so no hot showers then. Your morning breakfast service deal with Egghead sounds very good until you try it. Tried several times and ended up calling them every single morning because of no delivery, late delivery (90 minutes...), wrong delivery. During my numerous calls to staff I spoke with one friendly person. Rest of the calls ended up with them just hanging up the phone. One star for having a handy mini steamer in the room. Apart from that you should really be ashamed of yourselves. I have never encountered such rude and arrogant staff anywhere. As I checked out they tried charging me for 4 water bottles. I was not asked about how my stay was and the person clearly did not have a word please in his vocabulary. Thankfully I switched to a lovely hotel where I was greeted (I know!!) upon entering the property and provided with a lovely, spacious room.

How can I start with this review? The hotel is in a great location, its Wacky, wild and very unusual.The rooms are very small with no storage space just hooks on the wall.The showers are great, rooms clean and well decorated.The second floor bar is excellent but very expensive, its got a celeberity tattoo parlour in it as well as table football games. Don't go on the roof top bar unless you have lots of dollars in your pocket.The rooms are very noisey if you have a lower floor room its street noise if you a higher floor its noise from the roof top bar we tried them both you can't win. Reception are very polite checking in and out are very efficent but don't ask them about sightseeing any trips or booking a taxi because they do any of them the only taxi they will book is the airport return. It's a very brash hipster type place if you love New York you'll love this hotel. If your young or young at heart and get it for the right price book it....

We stayed in three Manhattan hotels on our holiday and unfortunately Moxy was the worst. Here's why;The reception team were busy having a giggle with each other to want to check us in.The lifts are a usability nightmare. There are no floor buttons, instead you have to use a touchscreen to select your room, it then tells you which lift to get in. Lifts come and go whilst you wait for yours. As many people were confused by the lifts, they inadvertently enter the wrong one, once it goes there is no way to make it go to the correct floor, so people not staying on our floor were getting off there. There are security issues having people just wandering around floors.The rooms are cramped which I knew before but wow, they are poor. To let some light in the room doors have a window, unfortunately this shone light on to the pillows on the bed next to the door. I had to sleep the opposite way to get some sleep.The room had not been cleaned properly, the floor was filthy with dust flying around, hairs on the floor and orbees (little water soaking balls, mostly childrens toys) on the floor. As we left the next morning the cleaner was outside our room so I asked her to give the floor a vacuum, she didn't. There are no chairs in the rooms, you are expected to sit on the bed which is back breaking.The shower divider does not do it's job, resulting in flooding the bathroom each time you shower.Excessive music playing until midnight, don't expect to have an early nightThe reception team were as vacant on checkout as check-in.To save the hotel, the communal areas are pleasant to spend some time in.I expected the rooms to be small in this location, but the cleanliness was awful. We were only here for 2 nights and my experiences with the reception team left me with little confidence that any comments would have been sorted so just put up with it until our next hotel.

If you like staying in a dorm room/prison cell, with poor lighting, no chair, no desk, no coffee, no newspapers, $5 bottle of water, small sink which is also next to your bed. Then this is the place for you.

Room was quite small which we expected for New York but they made good use of the space. Quirky hotel, with cool rooftop bar with a view of the empire state building. Everyone was very friendly and helpful. Really good location.

Highly recommended hip hotel. Onsite facilities were great with a selection of restaurants and bars. Rooms are highly functional (don't make you feel like you live in a closet) and modern. Priced very well for a central Manhattan hotel.

So a great little hotel and will definitely stay here again. Positives - great location - a block away from Macys. Very clean room and for New York not a bad size either. Only one negative - the doors do not block noise very well. We got woken up a couple of times with people walking past the door. Not a major problem for us but could be for those who struggle to sleep.

Great location - one block away from Macy's and Madison Square Garden. Staff is really friendly and helpful. The only reason I am giving this one star is that people walking past your room door can be heard. Woke us up once or twice but nothing earth shattering. Bed was super comfortable and shower was perfect. More importantly - room was ultra clean!

This was our fourth stay at the MOXY in Times Square and it gets better every time. This is one Hotel where you can literally stay inside and never leave the building and still have an amazing time in The Big Apple. We had Breakfast at Egg Heads, Brunch on the Rooftop, and dinner at Legasea. Our Son and daughter-in-law went to harry Potter and we enjoyed the City. We had the semi bunk room and it was perfection. Late night dancing on the Rooftop along with some mini-gold capped the weekend!
This hotel MOXY is very very cool and clean. All the time with great music, we can take a drink in the beautiful place!! Ideally located, next to Times square!!We will come back soon for sure!!! ++++

As I write this I am being kept awake by the non stop music thumping from the rooftop bar. The noise is unacceptable. In addition, the staff at the Moxy bar was incredibly rude. Awful all around. Will not recommend.

Visited New York for the first time with my wife in November 18. On arrival, we were greeted by a pleasant member of staff who was quick to help us check in. Everything went so smooth and a few minutes later we were on the way to our room. Baggage arrived immediately and we settled in. Nothing was too much for this great hotel. The bar is amazing, great bar staff and amazing conversation. Never tried the restaurant on site although it looked super cool. Slept perfectly every single night! The shower in the room was amazing! Really cool decor and chilled environment. On check out the staff held our luggage as we had a late flight, and they also sorted a cab for our journey back to the airport.Don't pay attention to reviews that slate this hotel! The hotel itself boasts a on site barbershop, restaurant, roof top bar, indoor bar etc. really clean establishment and fantastic location!! If i ever returned to New York again, i would most certainly only stay at MOXY NYC

I was dreading the thought that I've made a bad choice, as i have never been to NYC before and some previous comments suggested that the hotel wasn't all that great (too small, too noisy, etc). However, I must say that I have been absolutely amazed with how approachable, professional and nice their staff were!I called prior to my visit, to ask if my room could be decorated, as our visit to NY was a birthday surprise for my fiance. The amount of effort that they've put into decorating was really pleasing.Yes, the rooms aren't big but they've been designed thoughtfully and allow a pretty decent stay. Anyway, who needs a super-duper room when they have a whole of New York city to explore?! :)) What really matters is that the room was always very well cleaned. Any problem reported to the team was solved within minutes, so I think problems can happen anywhere and with anything, what really matters is staff's willingness to help, and it certainly is the case at Moxy.My only regret is that I kept missing the person who's made an effort to decorate the room, as I wanted to personally thank for such a great job, but I hope that the card's been handed.Thanks for an amazing stay!

Let me start by saying I know nothing about the size of rooms in New York as I have never been there before. I have travelled across the country and Europe many times. I did find these rooms smaller than I was accustomed to. I also have read all the previous reviews from others who have stayed at this Moxy. Those reviews made me think twice about reserving there. My 26 yr old son was home on Leave from the service and we wanted to do something he would enjoy. Moxy advertised as millennium oriented. So I took a chance and booked the rooms. Again I read all the reviews and had worries. Our first contact was about 1:30 in the afternoon when we brought our luggage in to store so we could wander the city. The young woman was friendly and when i asked for rooms in a quiet part of the hotel she immediately reserved rooms on the 6th floor saying it was very quiet there. It was! We enjoyed our afternoon, came back and checked into an exceptionally clean room that could be described as others noted as pretty small. We live in a large, but minimalist style home so we found the minimalist style of the room just fine. It is simple in design and is small in sq footage but yet suited our needs. We only plan to shower and sleep there in reality. We had enough room to open two suitcases (queen room) on stands without difficulty. Yes there are no closets but plenty of hooks to hang w hangers and under the bed cubbies. The bathroom does not provide the privacy that others might prefer with a glass “barn door” separating the room. Yes, the sink is outside the bathroom just around the corner. We did not see it a problem. The shower is awesome and the beds very comfortable along with four pillows. I crammed my husbands pillow in my suitcase after reading that the pillows were not great. I found them fine. The tv is close to the foot of the bed and one side of the bed was up against the wall. Not a big deal as I already read about this In the reviews. We enjoyed our free champagne on the 2nd floor and explored both lounge/restaurant areas. We found them expensive to eat and drink at but found them inviting and had friendly staff. We later chose to eat elsewhere nearby and found prices more reasonable. Overall we would definitely stay here again. It is important to read reviews but at the same time we are not all the same in our lifestyles and we must take that into consideration when choosing lodging and restaurants. Much of the previous reviews made me aware of what the accommodations were like but we found it comfortable and staff very accommodating when asked questions. This is clearly not the traditional Marriott that we are all accustomed to but it is not intended to be that. It really does depend on how much personal space you need and how much of your day is going to be spent in the room.

Rooms very clean beds super comfy but rooms very tiny once your luggage is in there is little room to move also no storage for clothes ,views awful could see people in other rooms getting undressed. Hotels main selling point is roof top bar but it's virtually impossible to get up to as there is always private events and the prices when you do get up are extortionate and the staff and door men make you feel you are not welcome, The lifts are ridiculous and you have to wait ages for them can't just step in and chose the floor you want and we had to carry our luggage up from the bag store as the lift wasn't working. Not many staff and if you had a problem you have to chase them down.

We stayed here for 4 nights can’t complain the rooms are small but but very comfortable ideal for a weekend close to time square there’s a lovely cafe around the corner it’s called Andrews we went there every morning
user_name:
Harryrocker
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

review_body: Perfect location that allowed me and my significant other to be able to take in all that New York has to offer... Legasea was amazing and it was an awesome surprise to find out that there was an amazing rooftop bar where we spent most of our nights.

Loved staying at the Moxy Time Square - really friendly staff, great bar area, nice clean room with everything we needed. Most of all a great location in Midtown - it was my first time in NYC so a central location with easy access to everywhere was just what we wanted. Would definitely come back and will recommend to other travellers!

Young crew, very nice hotel with rooms that are not too big but with everything you need for a pleasent staying .Very nice bar and restaurant.Position is perfect to visit New York either walking or taking metro.

The location is perfect for sightseeing. Djs were playing music in each evening and made a good atmosphere. The rooms are small but comfortable. Bathroom was a bit weird with their window wall. The hostesses were very kind.

I recently stayed at the Moxy Downtown NYC and was very impressed so upon my return I immediately booked the Times Square Moxy. The hotel staff are lovely and very helpful. The room is very clean and although small they have some very stylish storage options. I was very unwell on the day of check out and the staff kindly extended my check out by 5 hours and only for a $50 late fee and not the full night. Amenities at these hotels are fantastic and staff are very willing to help. Another great stay at a Moxy hotel.

I was excited to try Moxy because they remind me of Ace Hotels and other innovative brands with fresh takes on hospitality. At check-in, it was clear this place is different; reception wasn’t stationed at a desk, but rather the one staffer was out in the lobby talking to people in an almost aggressively friendly way. It was confusing, but fine.The room floors are stylishly spare - small spaces and limited amenities (no coffeemaker, no mini-fridge, no closet, etc) but done in a thoughtfully designed way. I like the portable table and chair that you can pull off the wall hook and use, or leave hanging out of the way, for example.There is a clear attempt for a communal vibe, but the downside is that convenience and ease of use doesn’t seem to be a big priority. This may be frustrating to business travelers or those with loyalty status who are accustomed to more traditional amenities and services. For example, last night, I wanted ice and couldn’t find it. There was nothing on the single info sheet, so I called guest services and learned I would have to take an elevator downstairs. The problem being the elevators are slow and buggy. So I gave up and skipped the ice - not worth the effort. I get their thinking here, and it was just a minor annoyance. But all the little things start to add up. Where they lost me was this morning. I had limited time for breakfast before a conference call, so I went down to the second floor to grab a quick bite. What I found was a confusing and chaotic amalgam of different seating areas, with lots of lounge-y sofas and chairs. I wandered the floor for several minutes trying to decipher it all. There was no clear signage, no host, no obvious breakfast menu, no waitlist and virtually no available seating. The full restaurant was apparently not open, so people were eating in the bar/lounge/coffeehouse hybrid space. A grab-and-go snack area was unattended - even if I wanted to grab a juice, there seemed to be no say to pay; a small menu board listed oatmeal, but again nobody in sight and no way to order, even to take away. The couple of servers I saw elsewhere looked overwhelmed and unhelpful. There was a quirky ice cream vending machine and a table with free coffee, but that was the extent of my self-service options. It was quite evident I wouldn’t be able to sit, get service and sat in a reasonable amount of time, so I left. It’s worth noting that an egg sandwich I spied in passing looked delicious. Alas, I will never get one. I am still hangry as I type this.
user_name:
waycaffeinated
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: I loved this hotel! Very different to your normal hotel. The size of the room was perfect for me and the shower was just lovely! It had a great atmosphere and fun vibe.I would not recommend this hotel if you were looking for a quiet stay. I knew that this was a 'party' hotel before I booked and brought earplugs just in case. My room was on the 17th floor, near the rooftop bar, so I could hear (and feel) the music :D but I was so tired at the end of the day I didn't need the earplugs!The staff were friendly, the place was clean and modern. The location is perfect as it's right in the centre of everything.I visited the rooftop bar during happy hour and it was really nice in there.
