I was sipping a cocktail called "We were on a break!" while looking at the empire state building...what more could you want!Would definitely return.

Stylish place with a good service, gentle people and perfectly located. It’s not the last time we’ll be guests. The rooms are smaller then usual but that doesn’t matter because everything is functional and clean!

This trip was literally the best trip ever as it says in the title! The hotel was just perfect, they’ve thought of everything, cute, clean, quirky, modern, stylish.....bed was a dream, rooftop was fabulous, staff were delightful

Fabulous hotel in all aspects, perfect location, great facilities and comfy beds, not to mention the rooftop bar Magic hour with views of empire state. Was surprised at how quiet a room in Central New York was too, we heard no noise at all! If you stay at this hotel you will have a blast! We will be back for sure!

Staying at The Moxy was pretty cool - and I don't consider myself cool, so I enjoyed being part of a trendier experience for a short time. It’s true, the rooms are quite small but I was very impressed with the design - super functional, industrial and minimalist. No dresser, but cubbies under the bed, hooks on the walls, etc. There was a fold out table and chair hanging on the wall hooks. We had a room with bunk beds – they were super comfortable. If you needed anything else there was a closet on each floor called “The Stash” where you could find all sorts of goodies – iron and ironing board, toiletries, extra towels, pillows, blankets, ice buckets, etc.Also, the location was terrific - the proximity to Chelsea, The Meatpacking District and Times Square was so convenient. And you MUST NOT come to NYC and not go to Ellen’s Stardust Diner. The staff sings and dances all night long – sometimes even when serving your food!! The lineup is long. We had to wait an hour but it was worth every minute. We loved it so much we went back for breakfast on the Monday before leaving the City – only waited 10 minutes for a table. Bottom line – This hotel is not for everyone but I would highly recommend it if you are looking for something a little different! Staff and service is incredible, rooms are small but awesome and the location is perfect. And remember, you are in NYC – how much time do you intend to spend in your room!!

This was my fourth trip to New York and by far the best thanks to chossing to stay in moxy. The hotel is modern an stylish and far surpasses the 3 star rating it was given. I don’t think you could choose a better location for a hotel if you are trying to see the sites

A lovely hotel, with a great location. The rooms are small but very functional. Breakfast was immaculate, plus the whole place has a lot of positive energy. We shall stay at the Moxy when we’re back in NYC.

Great location. We booked a family room and found it to be a bit small for a family with two teenage children. The staff were also very helpful and the luggage facility was really helpful as we were able to go out for the last day of our trip. Very handy for 34th St. stations and the Hop On Hop Off which stops outside Macy's.

Perfect location, 10 min walk south of Times Square. Great staff and vibe, very welcoming. They use the most of small spaces, but let's be honest. You are not spending much time in your room except to sleep. The bed was very comfortable.

My stay in Moxy was amazing from the facilities which it is a very cool and smart design to the location and experience in overall. I would defo come back again and recommend anyone visiting NYC. The staff is also very helpful and the smell in the lobby is very unique and terrific

Personally, I liked this hotel and would stay there again. Slept well both nights that I was there, which is my number one requirement in a hotel, and hard to achieve this near to Times Square. I started the review with "personally" because the unique style of the rooms is a good fit for my personality, and I stayed there alone, so that was just fine. The staff were very helpful, and more efficient than the laid-back style might suggest. The common area on the second floor is one of the best lobby concepts I've encountered anywhere.I would give the Moxy NYC five stars if I thought everyone would enjoy the same style - but I doubt this is the case. The Moxy goes all in on its minimalist style and some folks will want more room - like more square footage (I'm not even sure if my wife would like staying in the room I had - the person sleeping next to the window has to to climb over the other person to get out of bed). Just how different this place is was a bit of a shock when I arrived, so the Moxy might do better at setting expectations. But when I realized my room had all the amenities that I needed, including a cleverly hidden safe, I relaxed and went with the vibe. I was able to rest there, work there, show up for a meeting at Nasdaq looking sharp, then relax in the evening. As long as the rates stay reasonable and service level remain high, I recommend it to the seasoned traveler who wants the basics done right: rest, relaxation, and a solid base from which to ramble.

Where do I even start?! I've been to so many Marriott/Starwood properties, being Marriott Bonvoy Platinum Member, and this is certainly one of the worst. Pretty insulting experience in dorm like surroundings, The good thing is that I used my points to book 1 night in Moxy, otherwise I would ask for my money back, no joke intended. I do understand that it is focused on millennials market, and it is New York, but it still blows my mind when you get to stay in dorm like room tiny room for $400 or so! Well, I also stayed 1 night in 5 star Sofitel right before Moxy, and what a contrast! BTW, the price point is very similar, and Moxy is even more expensive at times. Indifferent front staff providing indifferent experience at check-in. Was refused upgrade with a shrug, and was given $10 casino style token to spend in a bar (really?!). Asked for quiet room, and was given room on the 8th floor, that was nothing but quiet due to street noise and lack of insulation. Room was beyond tiny, even by NY standards. No space at all, nowhere to work, no desk or table, nowhere to put the luggage and personal belongings. To add insult, there is ancient air conditioner that is as noisy as the old car with broken muffler! Had to turn it off, so I could sleep. Rooftop bar: very expensive Sidecar, and remarkably slow service. Now, to the worst part: checkout! I told them that I was unhappy with my stay, and met with indifferent shrug. Asked to remove totally ridiculous $10 charge for 2 small cartons of water. They asked "why"? Because I refuse to pay for bottled water in hotels, and it was first time in many years, when I was charged for eater in Marriott property. They said that only tap iced water is free, had a nerve. To be objective, they removed the charge, and their Manager called me back, and gave me back some points foolishly spent on this reservation. Ok, enough said, stay away: there are tons of better and less expensive properties in Midtown Manhattan. Thanks from Marriott Platinum Member to SPG/Marriott for having much nicer properties, like Aloft, that are cool and trendy, functional too, unlike Moxy!

Staying at The Moxy was pretty cool-and I don't consider myself cool, so I enjoyed being part of a trendier experience for a short time.I like to take notice of all the details that amount to the overall customer experience, and The Moxy did a great job on that front. I was a bit thrown by the modern check in-it wasn't your typical hotel lobby with a line of people waiting to check in at a front desk and staff lined up in formal uniforms - what I'm used to. There were separate kiosks - one side was for self check-in and the other was check-in with staff who were dressed comfortably and casually. Thankfully, they were on top of it and jumped in to help as my husband and looked around wondering what to do, lol. They were friendly and helpful as they oriented us to the hotel and checked us in quickly.The rooms were small, but this is NYC and I used to live in 400 square feet, so that didn't bother me. I was very impressed with the design - super functional, industrial and minimalist. No dresser, but cubbies under the bed, hooks on the door, etc. There was a fold out table and chair hanging on the wall hooks but we didn't have use for it as we weren't in our room that much. I have to mention that the bed was very comfortable!We were only there for a quick stay, but I think that if you're tidy and organized and can contain your belongings, it would be comfortable for a longer stay.Also, the location was terrific-the proximity to Penn Station and Times Square was so convenient for travel purposes. And there was so many places around to eat, drink, shop, etc. That was awesome.Overall, we had a very good stay with a great team overseeing the guest experience!

Spent a night for our anniversary and had such an amazing time! Didn’t even have to leave the hotel to have the best night. The restaurant LEGASEA was phenomenal ( as well as our waitress Allison) and the rooftop bar had great vibes and views. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Decor is very unique and trendy! Overall great experience and cannot wait to go back the next chance I get!

Had the opportunity to visit Moxy Times Square few weeks ago for a friend's birthday celebration. Upon entering this trendy hotel, first encounter with staff at check in was very positive experience. My inquiries were well addressed by a woman in the lobby who had a friendly demeanor. Aesthetically pleasant, especially the 2nd floor area. The hotel has a rooftop bar which is cute and cozy with a carousel - better to get there earlier on especially on weekends. The hotel staff was very accomodating to our needs during our time at there. The birthday celebration was a success and well enjoyed. It may be louder than other hotels but the beauty is in its central location if you are aiming to get around the city. During out stay we encountered no noise issue. The staff knew it was a birthday celebration and we were surprised to birthday decorations and mirror messages. What I especially found great was that when we asked if we could have our luggage held prior to check in so that time was not wasted in our city activities -- we were met with no hassle. Overall a reasonably priced, trendy vibe with pleasant staff in an excellent location close to Penn Station and Path train.

Poor service. Didn't have much expectation before I came but did not expect to get no greetings by staff when I checked in. Asked me for my ID and credit card, passed me my room key and the welcome drink token and didn't say another word. Another night I came back trying to enter through one of the side doors and saw a staff just pointing a finger at me to use the revolving door instead.Size of the room was decent as I didn't expect much from New York. Location was convenient.I have stayed with Moxy as a platinum member in many cities but this one is definitely the most disappointed one ever.

It was night out for my Family for the spring break.We want to have good stay at the hotel. the Moxy T SQ was good for us.The Hotel lobby and check was fast and very friendly. the room we check in had bunker bed. my daughter who is 6 years old loved. this was first time she spend night on the bunker bed.My wife and I was very please with compact size room that features lots of excitements. The restaurant was goods and all other amenities was good as well.I strongly recommend this property.

Beautiful functional hotel design, friendly staff, well lighted, nicely sized cozy bedrooms, amazing rain shower, comfortable spacious lobby to work/grab a bite/chill, and great views of the city! Nice place for business meetings also!

Checked in for the Opening of the Hotel. Flower district is close to everything - Chelsea and Flatiron with lots of great options. I enjoyed my experience in-house, great staff and extra perks - breakfast and drinks. Bought a few gifts at the Flower Shop - candles smell great.

Rooms are small but perfect for what you need. They have clever storage space and room to hand things on the walls etc. The water pressure in the shower is not the strongest or the hottest but was not in any way bad enough to make a complaint.The hotel itself is so cool and smells amazing! You can buy the candles they use to make it small sooooo good (which we did) for $25 in the cute little barber shop thy have inside the hotel. The rooftop bar is also very cool - perfect for some drinks pre going out. When the weather is nice it’s stunning up there. The staff are really friendly. I don’t have a bad thing to say about the hotel. Beds are seriously cosy too and the egghead breakfast club is great for a cheap breaky on the go. Free coffee was a life saver too! All in all, I will definitely be recommending my friends to go there in the future and I would go back there in a heartbeat. The location is also ideal - in walking distance to everything and has Penn station across the road which takes you quickly and cheaply to all of the NY airports - ideal!

As a “titanium Elite” lifetime Marriott customer I have to state clearly that I’ve never been so disappointed by an establishment under the Marriott family if hotels. From a rude non-greeting at attempted check-in to ONE ICE MACHINE in the entire building, poor quality food, terrible service, and LIES and/or exaggerations about property amenities, this property defies the opinions established during my previous 800 Marriott stays!!! The rooftop bar isn’t Hotel friendly nor is it hotel managed. After two attempts to get a drink there, we finally had one manager up there give us a table only if we’d leave within 30 minutes. The other bar is a pit on the second floor with shabby wore out furnishings and and a foos ball table with noise that racks your brain. BTW, the food is marginal even by Time Square standards. Gratuities and requests for housekeeping attention resulted in money gone, services not provided. And the tiny sink in our suite drained approx 20 minutes after use. If you’re shaving or brushing your teeth, the residue is disgusting. If I could give this establishment NO STARS I would. The only people served reasonably where younger business people who found the stools and counters on the second floors acceptable for working at their laptops. For a retired couple, the Edition, the W at Time Square, the Renaissance are all far better choices.

This is my 5th visit to NYC and this is the best place I have stayed. It has a really great vibe. Funky music, Gen Z centred and great food. Rooms are a good size for NYC, nice and clean.My only criticism is the lobby staff. They are not always on the ball. We were waiting on mail to be delivered to the hotel, however between 4 different staff members they didn’t even know if the hotel accepted mail sending us all over the place. Same thing happened when we order some Uber Eats to the hotel. They rang our room to say it was here, but when we got down to the lobby they were not sure where they had put it. We had breakfast vouches, and they were not even aware that they would be used at Egg Head. Overall great, just need to train the Lobby Staff.

I stayed in the Moxy for 7 nights just before Easter 2019, when I arrived I tried to check in and was told to go way and come back later as checkin started at 4pm despite being a platinum elite member. When I checked it at 4pm I was told that I had to pay for my room, but this should have been prepaid by my Corp Travel Agent, after 15 mins of conversations she agreed it was in my booking and should be paid for by the travel agent.Getting to the room I was surprised just how small the room was, but to be fair they do tell you the rooms are small, and I did not get and upgrade even thou I was was a platinum member.On the second night I was using the bathroom which is right next to the door and a member of the house keeping team just walked into my room without knocking, and after standing there staring at me using the toilet said sorry I thought you had checked out and walked out (if your in the room lock your door). Previous to checkin out I checked with the reception team and they had not resolved the charging issues which I then called my travel agent and connected them to reception and even with this pre-action they did nothing to resolve the issue. At checkout I was told they would charge my credit card and the issues which I had tried to resolve with them a number of time which they accepted should be charge to my travel agent was dismissed. I will not be traveling here again and have already taken action to have them removed from our company travel program.

I work in tech so I travel from SF to NYC a lot, and I've probably stayed at 30 different hotels there over the years. I decided to try the Moxy this time because one of my coworkers suggested it. It wasn't in an area where I've stayed in the past, so I didn't know what to expect- but I will definitely be back. The bed was as comfortable as mine at home, and that's saying something because I'm really picky about beds. The room was quiet, the bar scene was awesome, the price was right, and it was easy for me to get to different meetings all over town. I even met Jonboy, who has a tattoo shop by the bar (I'm a big fan, so that was pretty sweet). Next time I'll have to get a tattoo. I've already booked a room for my next trip- definitely stay there if you're looking for a reasonable, hip, convenient place to stay!

The Moxy had a great location. It is trendy, which really isn't my style. They use some sort of air freshener in the lobby that was truly overpowering. The bar was nice. The room was super small where both sides of the queen bed were not accessible. The bathroom "door" did not close properly. You better know who you are staying with very well to share this space.

This is a great hotel for the $$. It's located within walking distance of Penn Station and just south of Times Square. It's hard to tell from the photos, but it has a cabin/camping theme and they have done a great job with the details yet keeping it functional. It was very clean and our room with the bunk, twin bed was fun and perfect for our needs. The bar/lounge area is designed with the outdoors in mind and it very bright and inviting. Only issue is the elevator system. You call it from a touchscreen and then are assigned a car. The default seemed to be car 2 and it was always packed or took a while to arrive. Nevertheless, I'd highly recommend this property.

A great location to be in and an amazing set of staff who go that extra mile to help.The rooftop bar is an added attraction. Ivette was just wonderful as she ensured I got the right room. Would surely stay here again !

Well use of limited space . I never once felt cramp or crowded. The rainforest shower was amazing. We were on the 6th floor and it was very peaceful and quiet. I will be returning and I highly recommend.

Check your folio! Upon checkout, we checked the folio and noticed we were charged $10 for water. We didn’t drink the water. We didn’t even touch it. When I questioned this, the girl asked, “Did you move the cartons or open them a little?” No, we did not. I then asked - if housekeeping hadn’t even been to our room - how could this mistake occur? The girl actually said that they ASSUME people are going to drink the water, so they charge the bill. What? That is unbelievable and unacceptable. Maybe it’s because there is no sign on the water or prices. Maybe they assume people will think it’s free and drink it, and so they charge them? So, get your receipt when you check out and check it twice! PROS: Comfortable pillows. Clean room. Cool and trendy use of space. Amazing shower. Good location. CONS: The guy who checked us in was extremely cold and disinterested - basically rude. The room is so tiny that you have to jump or dive into the bed. No coffeemaker. No free bottles of water. Few towels. The elevators are bizarre.

Came in at 3am after a 24hour travel day (flight delays) and met Stephen at the counter. Absolutely pleasant guy, checked me in quite quickly, upgraded me to a double room and helped me with my luggage. Absolutely great guy. Checking out this morning and needed some help again with my bags and who comes to rescue me...Andy the manager. Truly a great guy. To my two heroes...thank you. I really like the rooms..minimal loft basic chic but still cosy. Also very centrally located. Moxy for Stephen and Andy and the rooms...I will be back!

This hotel is an excellent location if you’re visiting New York. The whole hotel has a very modern vibe with loud music playing from reception to the lifts. (and can be heard from some rooms apparently!) Rooms are tiny, I actually rolled over in bed one night and hit the light switch, no wardrobe and had to live out of suitcase with only hooks on the wall to hang anything and no tea/coffee facilities but you don’t spend a lot of time in the rooms for this to matter. There were two cartons of water which we were charged $5 dollars each for-not complimentary. The room was immaculately clean, maid service daily with clean towels and the bed was very comfy with good quality sheets etc. Shower was good but we had to direct it against the wall as it flooded the bathroom first time we used it. The sink didn’t drain at all well. The bar on 2 was expensive but being where we were situated it was prob inline with other places and we enjoyed our free glass of Prosecco while sitting and able to chat. The rooftop bar seemed quite hip-with all of us approaching 50 we walked in-turned around and walked out again-very loud and dark (had to use our phones to light up the menu!) but obviously a great place if you like that sort of thing! We never ate at the hotel but had breakfast at Applebees (a few roads up 42nd?!?) a couple of mornings after trying a few dodgy places. It was nice to be waited on and eat a nice hot full plate of food and not out of plastic cartons or buffet style but again that’s our preference.

Luv this place. kind of reminds me of pseudo rustic Maine overnight camp cabin. Small room with inventive design of space. Clean, Quiet. Great location. Fun Hotel. Boutique vibe. The staff is very helpful.

Just returned from our stay at the Moxy Times Square and have already recommended it to our friends and our travel agent!The rooms while on the small side are ample and extremely well designed, the en suite bathroom was modern, spotlessly clean with a great powerful shower.The rooftop bar has a lovely view of the Empire State Building, good music and all round good atmosphere with a mix of locals and hotel guests. The bar on floor 2 was also really fun - great bar tender service, comfortable seating and good atmosphere.The location of the hotel was absolutely perfect for our 4 day trip - 5 minutes from Penn Station, Madison Square Garden, Macy's and Times Square.Highly recommend to anyone looking for a stylish stay in NYC! Thank you Moxy.

Amazing hotel, they really care for you, free yoga on the roof on Thursdays made my trip.. rooms are small but absolutely fine if you are just visiting. Staff gave tips on where to go and gave a personal touch on our trip

I VERY rarely write reviews on here, but Moxy Time Square will be the exception because it's awesome on so many levels. You'd never guess you were in Times Square because it has major hip downtown NYC vibes, which you'll immediately feel on entrance via the lively lobby. Impeccable, quick check-in, by the way. Everyone's very helpful and friendly. The room is great, which I'll get to, but I also spent a lot of time at the super stylish Bar Moxy and the rooftop bar and lounge, which apparently is the largest indoor/outdoor rooftop bar in all of NYC. Views of the Empire State Building and the carousel (!!) = very Instagram-friendly. I also loved LEGASEA, their posh (but non-pretentious) seafood restaurant. Really yum. I could go on and on... In short, the vibe of Moxy NYC Times Sq is uniquely NYC. Hip and fun, yet also somehow kid-friendly. It's an experience hotel. A total gem. As for my room? It was great! Nice city views and flooded with natural light. I love the minimal yet very creative decor. Especially the cute collapsable table. The stars of the room for me? The heavenly bed and the great rain shower. In short, you'll never wanna leave the hotel.

We stayed at the Moxy Times Square for the first time this past week. Great little boutique hotel right in the center of everything. The regular rooms are small, but it is NYC. We moved to a one bedroom suite for the second night which is great for a small family! Modern and clean hotel, cool restaurant/lounge with great food. Will definitely stay here again in the coming months. It would be nice if they valeted cars, but there is a lot adjacent to the hotel.

It was a new experience for me in this type of hotels.Lobby has cool music, small basketball & some other games.Room was small, the bathroom is sort of in the room and offers no privacy if you are planning to stay in the room with a friend . Some amenities were available on the same floor in a small room next to the elevator.Hotel is close to Times Square & also next to Macy’s and Manhattan Mall which has a few retail options including JCPenny.Employees were very friendly & supportive.

This was our 1st time to a moxy hotel and 1st time to America. Great hotel as soon as you walk in, amazing smell too! Friendly helpful staff at reception area, they were always very approachable. We had a king size room which was lovely, rooms were clean and the showers here are fab, the beds were also really comfortable. Rooms were cleaned and fresh towels daily. The roof top bar is really nice and quirky, nice to chill out up there after a busy day. The hotels location couldn't be anymore perfect, central to everything and everywhere. Overall, me and my partner loved everything about this hotel and when we return to New York again we will definitely be booking to stay here again :) Thank you Moxy!

Location was great. We enjoyed the stylish & comfortable 2nd floor lounge for coffee & meeting. Beds comfy & great decor. A tight space for a family of 4 with big teens. Great hooks everywhere but bags took up most of floor space. Will book a larger room next time. So appreciated bag storage so we could enjoy our last day.

So I write this mixed review because there are SO many things I like about the Moxy. I’ve stayed there 2 times. This past tine they put me in a room that was literally the smallest room I’ve ever stayed in my entire life. Thankfully it was just me, another person could not have fit in the room. The rest of the place is great. Good places to hang out. Good food options. I can check in and out on my phone. All great but Moxy the rooms are smaller than my closet in a European hostel, Cummon!

Travelling to New York City was a dream for years. When I finally went in April ‘19 I went with my best friend. There are so many hotels to stay, but when we found Moxy we fell in love! The exterior and interior is amazing, very friendly staff, the rooms are clean and stylish and the rooftop...what a view! Also locationwise this really is THE place to stay. Love from Amsterdam

I had looked at reviews and was a little apprehensive before bringing my mum to the Moxy for her big birthday, I don’t know where the ones who left the bad reviews were staying but it can’t have been where we were. Mum and I were on the 10th floor and yes you heard a little music but it was not loud or deterred is from sleeping. Hotel is clean, makes great use of space and the elevators are straight forward and great for security....no one can get to the bedroom floors without a room key! However the real star of the show was Adrianna, all staff were fantastic but Adrianna goes above and beyond with her key phrase “I’m here for you” I am just sad she was off on my departure day and I didn’t get to thank her personally or show her my engagement ring (surprise visit from my boyfriend)! Thank you to all for making our trip perfect!

Not your usual style of hotel and not for everyone but we enjoyed our stay. Received coins for the rooftop bar for complimentary drinks and what a view of the Empire State Building. Tried the restaurant and the steak was great. Two blocks from Macy's.....huge store. Easy walk to Times Square and the hustle and bustle. Well served by the many Irish bars. Close to Broadway where you must watch a show, we saw The Lion King while we were there, much better than a show in London's West End. We didn't find the hotel noisy and slept well apart from when the fire alarms went off in the middle of the night once, false alarm. Staff friendly and helpful would definitely recommend a stay.

The hotel was in a great location and everything was too close even if you wanted to get to the attractions on foot!The room wasnt so big but it was very clean!The employees were all very helpful and friendly to us!

This trendy hotel was very clean, lively and upbeat. The 2nd floor bar and lounge area is a great place to hang out with friends. The location is perfect for walking around during the day and shopping. I highly recommend this hotel.

Double room was super small however this modern hip hotel was in every way great! Location, service and staff perfect. So if you are large do not stay in double room. Bed against the wall. Tiny. Privacy is not there with the bathroom. Shower fabulous. Bed and pillows comfy. No fridge. Location next to everything! I would stay here again IF I had a larger room. We were 15th floor and I could hear the club music on sat night. The staff on checkout honestly recommended Uber instead of taxi which worked out great.

This hotel was very poor in many aspects. For a midtown hotel, no valet parking. You had to park yourself at a public garage, and the closest one didn’t open until 10 am the next day. The front check in desk couldn’t process the reservation that asked for 2 separate rooms. The room A/C unit was very loud and kept us awake. The second room had the same issues. The queen sized bed was literally pushed against the wall with no space. The hotel is geared for low cost, low service. Not what we wanted

Stayed with my 3 children, 23,19 & 12. it was my youngests birthday, and the staff decorated our room for her! Cannot rate the staff enough, they were so friendly & helpful as soon as we arrived, until our departure. Would certainly return

As a titanium elite with Marriott, I am somewhat spoiled in the way that I’m treated when I go to a hotel. Especially the way that I’m treated at the W Hotel in Fort Lauderdale. Extremely professional there. The Moxy is the latest brand launched by Marriott more designed for the millennials. Unfortunately I am not a millennial so my 3 night stay was not a positive experience. When I checked in, not only did they not thank me for being a titanium elite but some of the staff was playing Nerf basketball in the lobby. Which I guess is a Marketing technique. If a guest get a basket they get something. It just did not come across as very professional. I specifically asked for a room with some type of view and a king bed. When I got to my room, as small as it was it had no closet and only hooks on the wall, I was in an alley facing a building with four women on a computer about 10 feet away in an office as they looked at me when I entered my room. I went downstairs and they were able to give me another room however on the fourth floor no king and no view. Just a little claustrophobic feeling. The rooms do not have any ironing board or irons. They did however bring up an iron and a board that was probably about 3 feet long. The sink was on the outside of the bathroom and took a while for any hot water to appear. I did like the shower though. I had asked for extra pillows and after four hours, I did not receive them and talked to the manager. He was very kind and retrieved the pillows himself and gave me extra points. The room reminded me of a mixture of hi-end dorm crossing over to a youth hostel. For $265/night I would expect more. I really think the staff needs to be educated and oriented about guest services and how to treat a customer, especially an elite customer. So if you are 21, perhaps this is the place for you. If you’re a professional, perhaps this is not the place for you.

Wow - the perfume stench in the Lobby, Elevator, and 2nd floor lounge is unbelievable. I am talking 10x worse than walking into a department store fragrance section. We all got sinus headaches (migraine level). As well, we were in a quiet inside room on a low floor...and the rooftop club's music was unbelievably loud (went until about 3am). Just like the other reviews, everything vibrated so it was absolutely impossible to sleep. Not to mention, the air conditioner temperature would only go to 68 (it was roasting in the room so I don't believe that it ever got to 68 degrees). We loved the style and the rooms, we just won't be able to ever stay here again...

Thank you for being awesome! The free champagne on arrival was the perfect way to kick off our girls night out. The breakfast was delicious and the staff was very welcoming, kind and helpful. We can't wait for our next trip and will definitely stay here again.

Took Railroad in for a show and fun weekend. Incredibly convenient to shopping, restaurants and entertainment. We walked to the hotel. We walked dinner. We walked to the show and back. The rooftop bar was incredibly fun.
user_name:
Inspire57198398957
New York City, New York

review_body: Would stay here again. When you check in they give you a coin that gets you a free drink at the bar. The room is small but great for a couple. Location downtown is much nicer but my boyfriend and I loved that this location has a rooftop bar/lounge.

Even though this hotel has the industrial chic appearance, the Service sucks. Housekeeping is not daily, your bottled water in the room looks free but it’s actually $5 that I found out after check out

Reminds me of staying at my GF's college dorm. 10x10 room with no real furniture. Fold out tables / chairs. It's efficient and new. Just make sure you set the table before putting a laptop on it. (else it falls)

We were in town for a concert at the Cutting Room and this was a good location within walking distance of the venue. Minimalist hotel with low key check in but very nice staff. High tech elevators working from your room key. Loyalty membership gave us free coffee and a couple of glasses of prosecco. Room was compact and only one, not very comfortable, chair but we didn't spend too much time in the room. Bed was comfortable although the person by the window had to climb out to go to the bathroom. Good shower although it didn't drain very well. Water cartons were a nice touch. Stash room had ice buckets, irons and body lotion, I thought the Stash Room was for luggage, lol! An interesting variation of the Marriott family.

Not your average hotel! Has a nightclub attached, very popular on the weekends. Advise getting a room above the 5th floor, we were on the 3rd floor and could hear the music and crowd noise from the nightclub through our bathroom vent until 2-3 AM. Rooms are small, but this is NYC where space is at a premium. We had a room with a king bed, which took up the entire end of the room by the window, so if you were sleeping on the window side you had to crawl over the other person to get out. Bed comfortable. Room fan a little loud, works almost too well for cold air. No enclosed closets, just pegs on the wall. Bathroom shower not enclosed so sometimes floor and toilet got a bit wet, sink was in the entryway. Lots of outlets, they provided a hair dryer and mini clothes steamer. Hotel lobby and elevator kept on the darker side, lots of attentive staff for check in and answering questions, elevators computerized so no more push buttons, have to use room key to access elevator to the "bedroom floors" so that was a nice security measure. 4 elevators, and the call screen for the elevators will direct you to the appropriate elevator so you know which one to take, and the wait time is minimal. Then your destination is already programmed in so you don't have to worry too much about accidentally hitting every floor button. Really enjoyed staying here, but would get a room on a higher floor next time.
user_name:
Margaret W
Fairfield, California, United States

review_body: We really enjoyed our stay at the Moxys. The staff was very nice, the modern room was small but clean. The hotel overall has a very nice feeling. It‘s near PennStation and perfect for when you want to walk to a lot of attractions such as times square etc.

The staff is amazing! We were only there for a few hours but we were treated really great for the time we were there. The drinks and food are delicious and we loved the rooms. The rooms are a bit small but other than that, no complaints.

Great vibe & atmosphere, it is hip and cool. Staff are easy going, friendly, nice, and service minded. The decor, design, architecture all felt good and modern. Nevertheless, we did not like the bathroom doors, as they are transparent, which might not be ideal for a multi-generation family or a group of friends, as it really affects the bathroom privacy. Other than that, we enjoyed the hotel a lot. Rooms are small, but functional and well designed to make the best out of the small space. Beds were comfy but the pillow was thin and no second pillow available. Plenty of USB portals. Guests under the age of 18 were not allowed to access to roof-terrace, not even for taking a photo. The location of the hotel is superb, easy access for shopping, sightseeing and dining. The bakery next door is very good for a quick breakfast, excellent croissants & bread and for us the best coffee in the neighbourhood of the hotel.

We loved the location, so central. I booked an upgraded room and it was still tiny! I’m still not sure it was the right room. By the fourth night we were ready to leave unfortunately, the novelty of climbing over my husband to get into bed had worn off. The main bar area was lovely and the drinks good too. The staff we interacted with were all helpful and friendly. The roof bar although had great views felt intimidating so we didn’t stay long.I’m not sure I’d return which is a real shame as it had so much potential.

My boyfriend and I stayed here from the 29th of March - 2nd of April. Free glass of Prosecco on arrival was a nice touch. Bed was quite small but REALLY comfy. Had a great sleep all 4 nights. Shower was unreal, the power was immense - I didn’t want to get out! The roof top bar is amazing - really good views of the Empire State and the cocktails were tasty (2-4-1 for hotel guests every day from 4-6). Staff were lovely and helpful! Overall a great stay.

Great Hotel with awesome atmosphere. Rooms were comfortable and there is not a square inch of wasted space. People were very helpful and seemed to sincerely enjoy their jobs. Excellent change of atmosphere for business travel.

I chose the Moxy NYC Times Square Hotel for a much-needed staycation and new job celebration. For starters, our check-in experience was super easy, as the hotel staff was friendly and helpful without being overbearing. The modern look and feel of the lobby was a nice touch and a fun vibe - especially in contrast to the hustle & bustle of Midtown. On that note, getting to the hotel was super convenient by train and the area was surprisingly quiet, given its proximity to Times Square / Penn Station.I really enjoyed the room design - especially the huge bathroom. The amazing rainfall shower were exactly the touch I was looking for on my staycation. Wish I had one at home! The room's layout was cozy & efficient, which I didn't mind as the bedroom area was just as large as the bathroom. One downside is that I would've liked a guest robe in the room.My favorite part was definitely the hotel's many bar and restaurant spaces. Magic Hour (rooftop bar) was so much fun (love the amusement-style decor) and the food / drinks selection were perfect for grabbing drinks with friends. Even better was grabbing breakfast sandwiches at Egghead the following morning. Honestly the food options were so good, that I'd definitely return while in the area.
user_name:
lijlife
New York City, New York

review_body: I checked in at around 10pm. It took awhile to figured out the ultra confusing elevator system. I got to my first room an a waft of marijuana smell came at me. I instantly closed the door and went down the confusing elevators to the front desk to get a new room. The lady at the desk was nice about giving me a different room. The only thing left was a room by the elevator she warned me. That was fine I actually didn’t hear the elevator at all. The only thing I could hear was the very loud AC unit right by the bed. I had to turn off the AC and then it was really hot in the room. The room was very small!!! I could stand in the middle of the room and almost touch both walls. While on the twin sized bed which goes from wall to wall my feet touched the tv on the wall. I have had closets bigger than this room. Overall I was not impressed with this place considering the cost.

Moxy was perfect for our first visit to NY. My husband and I had a very compact room on 9th floor which had everything we needed and was very quiet. Loved the hooks and the shower was fantastic. Only problem was quite noisy air con which was not an issue at this time of year but in summer might be.

Wow! What a great alternative for a place to stay near Times Square. Obviously the location is great, but the rooms were surprisingly quiet. The decor is so fun: modern and funky. The rooms are built to give you just what you need but not an inch more. We had a family of 4, so we got a room with 2 bunk beds. Much cheaper than 2 separate rooms with doubles. Beds are comfortable. Shower is good. The staff are great. Happy and engaging. We love this hotel and will book it again when we come back.

Rooms are small, but everything you need is included. They make good use of the space. Very modern, lots of outlets and USB ports in the wall for charging phones. Bar on second floor as well as rooftop. Great location and friendly staff.

Loved this hotel. From the minute we stepped through the door the reception staff were really welcoming and helpful. Great location just off of Times Square, close enough to be nearby to the hustle and bustle but far enough away to be quiet when you are in your room.Rooms are cleaned every day, fresh towels. Only downside was the bed was a bit soft.

Thank you, I love the modern style and comfort in the room. The pamphlets are very affordable. I had trouble syncing the phone app for the tv. More instructions would be really helpful. I use iPhone products and found it difficult to connect my tv. Being able to watch tv after dinner would have made the stay perfect. The bed was really comfortable and I enjoyed the dinner options. Socializing was really fun and I look forward to my next stay.

I had an amazing experience from the lady on the phone who assisted me with parking next to the hotel, a smooth checkin process less than 5 minutes, free drink tokens, and out in the city within 20 minutes from the time I parked my car. It was great to end the day of driving with the Muk shampoo and conditioner leaving hair so soft. It was my partners first trip to NYC and he adored this experience.

Great vibe though ‘sparse’ rooms. Two fun bars though roof has high minimum. Try and get a king as the queen is pretty small. Magic hour has great brunch and fun drinks. Egghead breakfast offers room service.

It was a very clean and fun place to be in. Everything about my stay was the absolute best, except we had a bartender who was racist and did not want to serve us and she called for security to put us out. We only shouted across the bar to a cousin so we can all order drinks. Other than that this place is beyond beautiful and great vibes.

Me and my wife decided on a short trip to NY to celebrate our wedding anniversary . Moxy location was good, atmosphere was warm albeit fairly young vibe. Food and drink were all great albeit fairly expensive ( but it was NY after all , so expected).

Its you are going single to spend a few days in Times Square, its a good location and hotel. Fast check in and fast check out. Rooms is a little noisy all day long by the new york traffic. Restaurantand Bar is really good , good space and comfort sitting.
user_name:
Felix V
San Juan, Puerto Rico

review_body: Pro: Great location. A street down from Macy's and Penn station subway. They don't have bellboy or concierge opening doors, taking your luggages for you, the hotel also don't have 24hr maid or room service. But I see as an advantage, nyc have food everywhere, and there's no need to tip anyone! This hotel is more suited for the independent and young at heart people. Con: Water drainage not very good. And air con/heater is noisy.

I was looking for a place to stay in NYC while interviewing for a couple of jobs, and my friend who travels for work all the time suggested the Moxy Times Square. I'm really glad I took her advice- the location was PERFECT for anything I needed, the staff were super friendly and the vibe was fun/upbeat, with a great bar and cool restaurants to choose from. I was supposed to meet up with friends during my visit and invited them all to the Moxy instead of going somewhere else, and we all had an amazing time! Also, I was really surprised at how comfy the bed was and how nice the shower/bathroom were something in this price range. I've spent a fortune on a hotel room and had way less quality amenities. I was sad to leave at the end of my three days, and I can't wait to go back!

By loud I mean just the common spaces like reception and the lifts (why?). The rooms (we were on the 14th floor) were quiet and we had no problem sleeping. The rooms are unusual but work very well, although I would have liked a kettle. The shower is wonderful. The staff are all very pleasant and fun. We walked in the door thinking we were in the wrong place- we thought it was a night club. We never ate here and had only 1 drink (a bottle of beer for $10)

Perfect nice new style hotel close to Time Square and infrastructure in Manhattan. Fast check in, nice service, cosy bar and small but efficient room. What else do you need? Qualuty of all is very good and it’s not cheap, but certainly good value.
user_location: Alphen aan den Rijn, The Netherlands
user_name:
Solong1963
Alphen aan den Rijn, The Netherlands

review_body: Delighted to have discovered this place when we came for a friend’s wedding. Great energy and the staff couldn’t do enough for us. The room was small but no claustrophobic so what a great use of space. Loved the shower and the quirky messages on the floor (our friend’s room had a different message). The lifts were in regular service so you never had to wait long.The hotel bar was hip and a great atmosphere. The location on 7th Avenue means it’s a great base for sight seeing as nearly everything was in walking distance.

I love the moxy so much!! We are returning guests. I am so happy we chose the Moxy again to enjoy our NYC trip. Normally we like to hotel hop and try new places. I can’t stop booking at the Moxy. Everything we need is right at the hotel or within walking distance. No wasted time and over spending on Uber or cab faires. Or wondering where to go. We ate at Legasea and ordered the most amazing Lobster bake. From check in to check out the staff is amazing! The hotel room is incredible. We always end at the amazing rooftop carasoul and finish the night roof top sipping on the best cocktails. Moxy surprised my husband and I and upgraded our room .. what a complete treat!!! We had a time square view and it was something out of a movie!!! We can’t wait to come back and recommend This place to everyone!!! I’m coming back for a girls trip and bringing 5 friends along!!! See you soon Moxy! Thank you for providing the best experiences in NYC.

Maybe too cool for me. Lots of noise and action. Maybe not the place for business, but may enjoy it on a vacation. They are making me say more. Rooms are very small and are not completely cleaned each day.

What a place small but got the whole package.superb bed unique room shower as strong as a fireman's hose.this place has great friendly staff.also what I liked about it was nothing was any trouble best location in new York great value.everybody it's time to party now.

Loved this hotel! Very friendly staff and amazing rooftop bar.Downside - little noisy and rooms are tiny. First visit to NY and I was warned hotel rooms are small.We stayed for 6 nights and would recommend as great location and good price

Clean, contemporary and cool hotel. Incredible location just a few minutes from Time Square/ Maddison Square Garden. Staff were all so friendly and on hand to help at all times. Bars and restaurants on the premises were all fantastic too

Fun and modern hotel.Check in was quick and easy.Room was lovely and spacious. The bathroom was big and shower was great. The only negative for me was there was no wardrobe space, there were hooks for your clothes to hang along the wall, this was obviously the design and style of the hotel. rooms Great location. Times Square was a 5min walk. Subway was close by. Would definitely stay here again or recommend to others.

I ove the Moxy. It’s an off-beat, off-the-wall place that brings much-needed pizzazz to my work trips. I absolutely love sitting in the super-comfortable second-floor lounge in the morning, reading the news on my iPad while enjoying a cup of coffee.

We absolutely loved this hotel the staff, cleanliness and decor are amazing..the room we had was small (expected) but everything had a place and was very well laid out. The rooftop bar is a go to it serves cocktails and food with a view and crazy golf! This hotel has everything to offer and the location couldn’t have been any better for us who had a lot of sightseeing to do Thankyou Moxy for an amazing stay

I stayed at this hotel March 1st- March 5th and everything was amazing about this hotel other than the sound but let’s be honest in the middle of times sqaure what do you expect.The hotel is clean, friendly (apart from maybe security, they could maybe be a little happier ha), quirky and the most perfect location we could have hoped for!! It was a two minute walk from the craziness of times sqaure, 2 minutes from the Empire State Building, half an hour from Central Park. Just amazing Also may I add the smell of the hotel! I have never ever noticed such a distinct, sweet and welcoming smell to a hotel! I would 100% recommend this hotel but also If I am ever back in New York I would stay here too.

I have stayed here several times in the last couple of months. The rooms are very clean. Staff are very friendly. Conveniently located to train, great restaurants and the convention center. I highly recommend this hotel.

You walk in the fast paced streets of Times Square and right in a perfect spot, this beautiful hotel design is casually waiting for you. Walking right inside immediately, theres friendly staff, a cozy comfortable vibe, right amount of lighting, and a clearly functional lobby. The bedrooms are so comfy, perfect with friends, amazing rain shower...and the VIEWS. They have a rooftop and lounge that is just everything you could ask for when staying in NYC for a night or longer. Awesome bar and restauraunt on the second level. Its just amazing. The owners, employees, cleaners and cooks, every staff member really care about every detail. This place is simply amazing.

The moxy is definitely a hotel that is fresh, hip, clean and cool. They ambiance is just great...This hotel keeps its guest happy by making sure that the hotel is clean, modern and has all the things that you could want in a hotel in NY. The parking is right next door...great restaurant up stairs, great roof top lounge and cool games around the hotel. Love this place and would recommend. Dont like to hear loud music on the weekends, just ask for a lower level room, other than that, have fun!!!

Perfect location! The room is small but practical.Hot water, super comfy bed. Stuff were friendly and helpful. We arrived and got upgraded to a room with a bigger bed.Breakfast is nice, you get to choose one of a few dishes plus tea or coffee. Would probably recommend having breakfast outside if you’re vacationing in NYC, and maybe go to the bar for drinks and snacks in the evening.Over all atmosphere and vibe is great! Would definitely come and stay here again.

This hotel has an excellent location. It is tastefully decorated and offers a great atmosphere. The bakery that has recently opened next door is a great addition for delicious viennoiseries and breakfast. Rooms are a bit small.

Moxy HOTEL, yes it is a hotel but don't expect to get any sleep. There is a roof top bar that plays music until 3/4 am. We were on the 8th floor and our headboard was vibrating due to how loud the music was. My husband phoned reception who said we were in a quiet room, I hate to think what the other rooms were like. I understand vibe the hotel was trying to achieve but it was a bit on the cringe side and on the whole we thought the staff (reception) acted unprofessional. The rooms were ridiculously small, we had nowhere to put our smallish cases, had to hang our clothes on pegs and had to climb over my husband to get into bed. The location is perfect for times square/madison square gardens but that would not be enough for me to stay there again. I await the ridiculous response from the management trying to justify anything in this hotel. Going by other reviews I'm sure they'll just roll their eyes and crack on.

I have colleagues who had stayed here before so I somewhat knew what to expect. And I would not hesitate to stay here again. It's clean, convenient, comfortable. There's a good gym and it was reasonably priced. They even put balloons in my room for being a Marriott reward member. I then spent the rest of my stay kicking balloons out of my way -- a bottle of beer would've been a much better token of appreciation.I was on business so I found the lack of a real desk or chair annoying. Later on the TV I noticed some kind of folding table that comes in some of the rooms and is meant to be a desk I guess. My room did not have that.I also appreciate an iron/ironing board in my hotel room. The hand held steamer was no match for the wrinkles my roll aboard bag generates.The shower was in a wide open corner of the bathroom. Even being in the room 100% by myself ... showering had a really weird vibe. It was like being in a high school locker room.And some of the small touches are needlessly silly. Oh look, mason jars to drink from - how trendy! Wait, nope those are just flimsy plastic cups that look like mason jars. lol.
user_name:
May0rQuimby
New York City, New York

review_body: When I first started the process of booking a room. I knew there would be 4 women going. I debated on what rooms to get but then came across the bunk bed room at the Moxy Times Square. I read some reviews, and it was clear this hotel was aimed at a certain age group. I, however, am not too old to like the idea of certain amenities not typical at some other hotels.(usb charging ports, shampoo dispensers with good shampoo and conditioner, personal spot lights, Netflix enabled TVs...etc). In the reviews, many other patrons complained about the bar being too loud, the size of the room, and how the desk people didn’t fawn over them because they are “important Marriott customers”. On the not receiving super duper special help from the staff at check in. What exactly is it that they expect? I received all of the help I needed, they were not rude and even walked me to the elevator explaining how all of the controls are outside of the elevator . They gave me a run down on restaurants and bars located onsite, including what entrance to use at what time. I didn’t really hear the bar loud enough to prevent me from falling asleep, I was on the 16th floor. I found it to be a great utilization of space especially when only there for a long weekend. Who really needs closets and chest of drawers for short stays! I loved how the tables and chairs fold up and hang from the wall, how there is a steamer not an iron in the room (however an ironing board and iron were available to me in the “stash closet” located behind the elevator on each floor), and that the shampoo and conditioner were high quality Muk brand. We received free drink tokens upon check in, free water in the room, and coupons to eat at the restaurants onsite as well as suggestions for the best area activities. The location of this hotel is centralized, close to just about anywhere you would want to go in midtown. We got there at 1pm so our room was not ready. They allowed us to check in our luggage in and store them on the lower level to go get some lunch and look around. I then received a text message telling us when the room was ready. 4 ladies lived 4 days in one of the bunk bed rooms. We loved it and did not find it cramped at all. The only complaints I have about this room are that the water didn’t get all that hot in the shower, and the you could see just a little though the frosted glass in the shower/ bathroom. Other than those minuscule things it was perfect and I will absolutely stay there again!

The hotel is noisy with small rooms but we knew this when booking, we stayed in a room on the 7th floor which was an internal room and facing the centre courtyard , which goes from ground floor to the top of the hotel, that was the problem as the noise from the rooftop bar came down the centre of the hotel and blasted you out of the bed.After 2 nights of noise I asked for a room shift and this was done immediately, I was given a street facing room on the 6th floor, only noise we heard was the work going on at night in the street, this wasn't a problem and not near as noisy as the rooftop bar.The hotel and rooms were clean and the staff were excellent, so on the basis that I would get a street facing room the next time I would possibly return to this hotel.

We stayed for the weekend. Loved the hotel and amenities. The bar in the 3rd floor is super fun, there's a basketball court, and the rooms are amazing. But what we appreciated the most was the customer service. James at the front desk was great, super nice and friendly. We would definitely come back.Thank you James!

On March 16,2019 we checked into Moxey for a second visite after a positive experience the first time, when my wife and daughter ran the NYC Marithon in November 2018. Well this time the experience was not the same. We were back in the city this time for my wife and daughter to run the NYC Half Marithon, we arrived early and the room was not ready so we stored our luggage and went out into the city. Upon our return at 3pm the room was still not ready, knowing the rooms are not guaranteed until 4pm we went upstairs to have a drink. Soon after the young lady from the desk came to find us to let us know the room was ready, wow, that was sincerely nice of her as she did not have to do that. I wish I had her name to thank her. This is where the hospitality began and ended on our visit.We went to our room and decided to take a little nap before dinner. At about 430pm we heard a tap-tap-tap. And immediately, without any announcement our door opens and a maid walks into the room, sees us she turned and rushes out and away from our room. We followed and asked her what she wanted and all she would say was sorry and continued on her escape from our sight. So as we left for our dinner reservation, I stopped at the front desk area and spoke to Michael Hilsdorf, who presented me with his card and that was when I found out that he was the Assistant Operations Manager. I thought at that point I was in capable hands and my complaint would be addressed promptly. As a person that works in the hospitality industry, I understand the importance of responding to guests needs immediately (typically that means within 20 minutes). I told Michael we were going to dinner and I would like an answer to why a maid let herself into my occupied room by the time we returned from our dinner. Upon our return, Michael still had no answer. I told him we were going to our room to bed and to please email me his findings at that point. Well here we are 24 hours after the fact and still no call or email. I should add here that I did ask for him or another manager this morning, but I was told that no one was available to talk/assist. Exception, the young man at the desk did offer a 50.00 rebate as we pre paid our room. I received the rebate but it had a deduction for 5.44 for water, which we did not purchase, so I called to see why I was charged for water that I did not purchase. The man I spoke with at the extension for “folios” told me he could not help with a disputed charge and I would have to call on Monday. Again, so much for responding to guest needs immediately. Well the four reservations I planned on making for the next four races in NYC will not be made at Moxy because if they can’t address or fix the small things, how can I expect them to fix the big things when/if they happen.

We loved this place! On arrival the staff were so welcoming. Lastminute made a real mess of the booking but the staff (Lee - thanks mate!) sorted it out with no fuss and made us feel at home. The hotel is in a great spot and once you get used to the lift system with you room card it is an easy place to use. We had a king room and a bunk room for our teenagers. We all loved the rooms, funky and well appointed which didn't seem cramped and let's face it YOU'RE IN NYC so get out there! You can even listen to a free bed time story from the telephone system. There is also the offer of a snowball fight with the staff but sadly we had no snow. There are many hotels to choose from round here but we'd come back because the staff are such fun...

I just left this hotel for work. It was the only thing available in the area so I booked it. The rooms are small. VERY SMALL. The shower has no door you can close, so you have to shut the whole bathroom off to bathe. Everything is so loud, all the time. I would wake up constantly each night from the door noise or anyone on either side of me. There is no good way to get to bed except to scoot. If I moved the TV away from the wall, it would shut off.It was just a miserable experience overall.

and oh yeah, piss poor water temperature. And the sonk doesn’t drain. No insulation whatsoever, heard every noise from the street, every downbeat played in the 2nd floor club until afyer midnight...this property sucks

What a disappointment. Room was tiny, I couldn’t fit on the bed and no where to unpack our stuff at all. Called reception to let them know and ask if I could move room but they were very unhelpful. Booked Crowne Plaza half a mile away for the same price and what a difference! I’ve lost out on money as I had to pay the first night at Moxy after only spending an hour there but given the response to our request to move and ridiculously tiny room, we felt it was best option to go elsewhere. Definitely wouldn’t recommend this place.

I stayed at the Moxy on a Thursday night for a business trip, deciding not to stay in the typical hotel I stay at in midtown, because I was enticed by the price and photos. The photos show a funky room, yet small but looked fresh and clean. Check-in was easy, but when I got into the room, it was smaller than I expected, not a big deal since I was just there for a night. The layout of my room (Double) Had the bed between 2 walls, so you have to climb into it from the bottom. Also the sink is separate from the rest of the bathroom, so if you don't like that, be aware. Decent amount of plugs but space is limited, especially if you want to setup the desk (whcih is a foldup that hangs on the wall). Other than a few cubbies for clothes under bed, there is no other storage in this room, though there was a safe, which was nice. Overall, if you are a business traveler, the size probably won't bother you, families or people international with bags, YMMV.I had a particular issue during my stay. Because of the location and the price, I have a feeling the typical customers are on the younger party side (also pretty clear based on the asthetic). From about midnight to 5 AM, one of my neighbors who was far too under the influence, was making a ton of noise, banging on walls, screaming, being calmed down by friends. I called guest services and notified them, was told it would be handlded, but it was not. So all in all, not a great night's sleep. I would probably not stay again because I am more comfortable with a little more space and would rather stay in a road-warrior style hotel than one for tourists. I would reccommend it however based on what you are looking for.

I usually don't write reviews but needed to in this case because of how great this hotel is. I travel a lot for work and stay in many Marriott properties from the high end down to economy hotels. Moxy was unlike any hotel that I have been to. It was creative and had a great energy to it. I received a digital key and I skipped check-in and headed right to the room. Unfortunately, the system did not unlock the door so back down to the lobby, but less than 5 minutes later I was in my room. While the rooms are small, they are extremely thought out and everything has a place and a purpose. The bed was so comfortable! However the most amazing part was the shower... huge rain head and tons of water pressure. I didn't want to get out.I recommend this hotel and will be staying here again.

I have recently returned from a trip to New York and I can safely say I will never be staying in a Moxy hotel again. The predominant issue with the room was the NOISE. There is a rooftop bar on top of the hotel, and as we were aware of this we requested a quiet room. However we were given a room on the 12th floor (out of 17) and the noise at night was unreal. Unfortunately we arrived after a long flight on Saturday afternoon and the loud bass music went on that night until 4am. Call me crazy, but I expect to be able to sleep in a hotel! When my friend went down to complain the staff were dismissive and rude. We were told we "shouldn't be able to hear the noise" from our floor. Well then why were we down there complaining? You could hear the music from street level. I had silicone earplugs with me and they didn't make a jot of difference. To be fair to the Moxy, the other nights the music didn't go on as late (maybe til 11pm/12am) but to me that is still too late for a hotel.We also requested late check-out, but someone came to our room to ask us if we were leaving before our check-out time. I said we had late check out and the staff member said "....Was it approved?". Oh no it wasn't, I just decided to stay anyway! Of course it had been. I didn't like the staff in this hotel's attitude to guests.The lifts at this hotel are difficult to use. You are supposed to select your floor, swipe your card over a reader then it will direct you to which lift you should take. However, often when you pressed the screen another random floor was selected so you had to be careful paying attention to make sure the lift would actually go to your floor. Sometimes it took quite a few swipes to get it to recognise your card as well. Pretty inefficient system.The whole vibe of the hotel I found a bit cringey to be honest. They are trying very hard to go for a young, cool vibe. Loud music blaring in the lobby, neon everywhere, no front desk in the lobby. Not my cup of tea but that's not really the hotel's fault.Other issues I had with the hotel were based on the room itself. The room was extremely small, which we were expecting so that wasn't too much of a problem. However the door to the toilet was transparent, which in a small room being shared with friends was extremely awkward!! The other problem was that the mirrors were placed directly beneath lights so it cast a shadow over you, making it very hard to apply makeup.To provide a bit of balance to this review, there were a few aspects I liked about this hotel. The location is really excellent. You are so close to loads of sights and subway stations so it is easy to get around. Also the shower was amazing! The water pressure was really good, definitely the best shower I've ever used.Sadly, these plus points are not enough to save this hotel for me and I won't be back!

Great location near everything you’ll need and in good walking distance to a lot of main sights! Subway is closest 34th on 7th. Easy to use and so cheap! The hotel is very basic, the rooms are really small, even though I was promised an upgrade if room available and all I got was a free glass of Prosecco! There is zero storage in the rooms and it just means the small space becomes very messy! Beds pressed up against the wall and you both have to climb on the side of the bed to get in, really strange and feel sorry for the maids who have to change hundreds of bed sheets! Shower is good! The staff are a mixed bag, some are friendly and others just seem to be too into having a laugh with each other to notice you. It’s self service check in and out so you don’t get much dealing with the staff. I would recommend if you’re all about the location, after all it’s New York and you probably won’t be spending much time in your room!

It's rare that I write a 1-star review but I really did not enjoy my stay at this hotel. Yes, the location is good and the room seemed clean, the employees seemed ok. The issue is the room and the bathroom. I have stayed in this part of NY a number of times and never had a more uncomfortable room. This place tries to be cute with lots of European flare but I have been to Europe -- I don't need a trip to Disney for my hotel stay. No real chair, no closet, no drawers, no clock, no place to work if you need to do something. Then there are the elevators that work so poorly they station a person in the lobby to help people use them. The sink is literally smaller than a dishpan with no place to put a razor (no place for a woman to get ready). The bathroom light is behind you so you cast a shower in the mirror. They do provide a vanity mirror...it precludes you from washing your face as it blocks the sink. Their cute shower door leaks water all over the floor. This a new hotel but the towels were scratchy? I have stayed at 5 other Marriott properties in the area, regardless of price (several were less $), they all provide basic hotel services and comfort. I wanted to be sure I was not being too harsh so I asked a co-worker and a stranger (who was grateful for my elevator tutorial). We all had the same experience.

That was an awesome stay. Clean rooms, nice service, great located! The only thing: small room inclusing a small bed which did not make our stay worse! It was just a little bit uncomfortable for me and my pregnant girlfriend.

The wifi is very slow. The rooms lack simple things like no closets where you use pegs to hang your clothes but enough of hangers aren't provided. The bathroom needs to be fixed with simple things such as a towel holder, fan, shade on door to block the light in the bedroom. I had to ask room service 3 times for a refrigerator to be brought up. The beds are comfortable but no drawers for clothes. The bathroom size is large where it actually takes space from a cramped room. The location is terrific so I guess that's why you stay here. We're only 2 nights into our 5 night stay & it's just not comfortable

Everything was lovely, the room, the staff, the location, the price! We stayed for 6 days and the small room was awesomely designed to accommodate everything you need to be comfortable. Definitely recommended for a week long stay like ours.

The good:It’s one of the more unique hotels I’ve visited (check the pics of the bathroom)As much as others complain about the space we had two full suitcases & more easily accommodated.The shower was the best hotel shower I’ve ever had & it beats my home shower by miles, the pressure was amazing.Location to Times Square & Broadway is exceptional.Rooftop bar was pretty cool.Hotel staff were mostly great (particularly security at 3:30am when they got the fighting couple next door under control)The Bad:Even though the space was good the bed in the corner was inconvenient for two of us.The walls & windows were quite thin. We could just about hear everything opening & closing on our floor & even hear the conversations from the road in our 14th floor room. I swear I even heard someone change their mind at one stage.The 3am wake up & subsequent 30-40min fight of the neighbours the night before we left.Wife didn’t like the post 5pm room servicing.Would I go back? If I was after a massive weekend or trip where I was constantly out & about, then absolutely. If I was looking for a more sedate weekend, then perhaps I would look somewhere else (the chill out area on 2nd floor was ok, but sometimes you might want your own space & the rooms don’t really accommodate that).

I couldn't believe it when I stumbled across this hotel! Admittedly, hotels in NYC are not cheap, so I did a lot of searching before finding Moxy NYC. The price was the initial attraction, at $150 a night, it was cheap for New York. Then realising how close it was to Times Sq, I booked immediately. Located on the corner of 36th St and 7th Av, it was spot on. A few blocks north of Madison Sq Gdns and a few south of Times Sq with Penn Station 2 blocks away. It was a fluke I chose a hotel so close to the subway station and it was perfect for connecting to other lines and it is also the hub for the LIRR, so excellent if you want to travel to/from the airport. Taxis are $52 flat rate plus tip, however you can get the Airtrain for $5 and then LIRR (Long Island Rail Road) for $10 so a much cheaper option. I would do this every time, plus it is probably quicker considering how bad the traffic in the city can be.The hotel is very trendy, has a great atmosphere and suits all ages. They don't have a bell boy so you do have to take your own bags to the room but this saves on that awkward tipping when you first arrive. I also didn't notice a concierge, but all staff were helpful and friendly. The rooms are quite small but this is standard in New York, however they have everything you need; hairdryer, safety deposit, steamer, amenities, satellite tv with Netflix. No wardrobes, but plenty of hooks to hang clothes up. I was travelling with my brother so had a queen bed plus single bunk bed. Beds were comfy with plenty pillows. The bathroom was great and the shower was unreal - so powerful I could have stayed there all day.Didn't go to the bar or eat in the restaurant, prices way too expensive which again, is typical for hotel bars. Gym was decent, all the equipment you'd expect. Would stay again and definitely recommend.
user_name:
debbiebell11
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

review_body: The hotel is in a great location between Penn Station and Times Square and reasonably priced for this area. Even though I saw pictures on the website I was still surprised by how small the room was. I had to roll over the bed to put up the window shade. Also the lighting by the sink made it difficult to shave. Check in and out was very fast and easy using the express system of which there are multiple machines so no wait. The egg place (sort of in the hotel) on 7th was quick and very good. The hotel is new and in very good shape. I thought there would be more noise being on 7th Ave but it was pretty quiet in the room. The elevator system requires you to be a guest in the hotel with a key to get to the rooms and it felt secure. There are no internal buttons as you swipe your key and are directed to an elevator that takes you to that floor. If you don't mind small rooms then this is a good choice in this neighborhood. I rated the hotel average because of room size, otherwise it would have been very good.

I have been to the Moxy near Times Square three times now, so this review is an aggregate of those experiences. Obviously, I continue to come back to this hotel, mostly because of it's location to transit hubs in Midtown and because the rooms, in my opinion, are thoughtfully designed to store and stash all your belongings in a smaller space. Also, on average, it's a great price for the neighborhood. I enjoy the bar, the breakfast shop, the fun games in the lobby and planned activities. Did I mention hipster mac and cheese? It's all designed to appeal to a younger audience, for sure. I also enjoy the access to the huge, hip rooftop club... EXCEPT when I'm trying to sleep. When I book the smaller rooms, it will sound like the DJ is spinning their tunes directly in the room. (I did book a larger room during my second stay, and barely heard anything). No amount of ear plugs, white noise turned up to 11, and pillows over my head could drown out the din completely. This doesn't bother me when I'm out late in the city partying myself, but if for some reason you need to sleep during your trip before 2 am, like my latest excursion to the city, ask for a quiet room, if possible. Everything else is great, and it's why I keep coming back. I like this fresh concept from Marriott, and it's location, so I recommend.

This is part 2 of the Moxy NYC review. Original reservation was at Moxy Chelsea and you can read about that debacle, but my wife, daughter, and some friends ended up at this Moxy and it did not get much better. As it was relayed to me, service really isn't their speciality at the Moxy. After being walked from the Chelsea property, along with a bunch of other people, the staff didn't exactly put in the effort to get people in to their rooms. They finally got in to the rooms at close to 5P when they were told they would be checked in at 4P. The front desk, with the exception of the manager, Mike, was completely unresponsive to their needs. In fact, seems like Mike is the only one that gives a rip.Rooms are interesting and the connected restaurant is good, but they really aren't good at hospitality.

Visited NYC for the weekend from Philly. Stayed at Moxy Times Square given its proximity to Penn Station – literally a 2 minute walk over, was SO EASY! Check-in was seamless and the crew members were very helpful. After checking into our room which was cozy and very clean, we went down to Bar Moxy for a drink. The bartender was so nice and the drink was delicious. We didn’t get a chance to check out the rooftop bar, will make sure to do so next time, heard really great things!! Love everything about this hotel for a weekend stay in NYC.

Stayed at The Moxy Times Square for 11 nights for a holiday. Great central location, very close to Maddison square garden, Times Square, Macy’s and Empire State Building. Rooms very very small, but that should be expected in Manhattan. Rooms can be very noisy on fridays/saturdays from the nightclub upstairs. Cool rooftop bar, but a little annoying to get there needing to leave the building and enter again through the outside bouncers, no drink offers either. Rooms don’t have a fridge or kettle. Immaculately clean on arrival, very very comfortable beds.

This was my first stay at this relatively new hotel. It is a couple of blocks from Penn Station and a great alternative to other hotels in the area.
