Ultra tech in that your lobby is full of self service kiosks. The rooms are interesting. No dressers or closets, everything is on pegs. Bed was comfy although I didn't like that it was up against a wall. If I had been with the hubby, one of us would have been crawling over the other to use the bathroom in the middle of the night. The bar was cool. The restaurant is seafood but I was not impressed by the service or my dinner. My friend ordered the fried chicken and it made me jealous. That shouldn't happen in a seafood restaurant. The attached breakfast place was awesome. This is definite hotel to keep on my list of places to stay.
user_name:
Queenork
New York City, New York

review_body: Great service! We enjoyed the location and the staff made us feel right at home. We hope to come back very soon. Easy check in and out. Friendly bartenders and fun environment. I hope to return soon. Thank you!

Wow Moxy what a shame! First impressions were like this is a modern, cool hotel, however as we got into our room on the 16th floor we began running into problems, I was aware of there being a nightclub on the top floor, what I was not aware of however is that the effort to soundproof is non existant.We were moved to the 6th floor and still nothing but a wall of noise and music until 4am, dont get me wrong Sean Pauls Get Busy is a perfectly adequate song but come 3:30am on the third night with it blaring it becomes somewhat draining when you are be looking to be up early. Now onto the room, again really nice facilities shower is great as is the sink and decor, the heating/aircon system sounds like a generator and is incredibly loud (not loud enough to drown out the music mind) The choices of temperature Frozen Tundra or Molten Lava. The only other quibble was one of the power points in 618 is very dodgy and you cannot get your plug out once you have put it in. Now the staff. I will discount one handyman who came up to help me when I dropped my phone down the side of the bed, he was very helpful and courteous, however downstairs in reception....... not so much. The nightclub vibe carries through into the Foyer and when we were trying to book our transport back via a group bus we had to repeat this three times, the lady then mentioned she would do this, I didnt feel the most confident she had and when I asked her colleague a couple of hours later he said there was no booking, he then proceeded to say well its not my fault!! I then contacted them myself and as I had not left enough time they were unable to book it so I had to get a cab to JFK so lost out on $60.If sleep deprivation and staff caring more that they look cool and aloof as opposed to professional and keen to help then this is your place! They will come back and say that they are working to improve the soundproofing but going by previous reviews maybe the only resolutions is in room earbuds!

I really enjoyed my stay at the Moxy Times Square, from getting into my room early to leaving my luggage in storage.My room was on the 16th Floor and being so close to the rooftop bar I thought the noise would affect me because of some of the reviews I have read but it didn't the music did not bother me at night at all. All staff were very friendly and professional. The hotel is in an amazing location which was really good for me being my first time in New York - very close to Times Square and the Subway - Penn Station. Also the room amenities were great and had a decent size room. I really liked the Stash Room as I didn't have to call Guest services and wait for the extra towels. The 24 hour ice cream machine was simply the best! Next to some great restaurants and shops! Will be coming back here to stay!Would truly recommend anyone to stay at this hotel.

We stayed here for 4 nights last weekend and we had a very enjoyable stay. We were in NYC to celebrate my girls birthday and when we got to our room we found that they had decorated the room and wrote lovely messages to mark the occasion. This really gave us the boost we needed after a long day of travelling from London.The location is perfect for what we were looking for and the bedroom was bigger than I had anticipated having read many negative reviews on here (perhaps we were upgraded I cannot be sure - either way we we're very happy with it). It really is a good value hotel in my opinion and the staff couldn't have been more helpful throughout.The elevator system has been described as difficult by some on here but to us it couldn't have been more economical or user friendly. If you have trouble with the elevators I dread to see how you get by in life. Loved Magic Hour for a few drinks in the afternoon before we went exploring and again the bar staff were great. All in all a very positive experience, keep doing your thing Moxy.Love from London
user_name:
Mike M
Greater London, United Kingdom

review_body: Initially, when making our booking, we requested that one of our rooms be on a lower floor. On arrival, one room was ready and the other room wouldnt be ready for several hours. Needless to say, both rooms were on the 11th floor. The lady at the check in changed swapped one room for a slightly lower floor after a few minutes of pleading. This was not a great start to our trip, but it wasnt going to make or break it. However, by far the most outragous thing about our stay, apart from the over priced bar and grumpy staff is the fact that 2 months after checking out, we still have not recieved our security deposit back. I have emailed the Moxy hotel directly several times, to no avail. I have also email Marriott directly, to no avail. I really cannot see why I have reacieved this back. Beware.

We did a staycation at the Times Square Moxy this weekend. Super easy checkin with the hotel staff, loved the jars of candy in the lobby! Such a beautiful design in my room and throughout the hotel; wish my home looked as chic. Beds were super comfortable and the shower was AMAZING. My room didn’t have a great view of the City, but I guess that didn’t matter so much since I was out and about. Extremely convenient location – like a 2 min walk to all the subway lines. But the best part was definitely the many bar and restaurant spaces. Did happy hour at the awesome lobby bar (Bar Moxy?) then met some friends at the rooftop bar the Magic Hour. Loved it. So cool. Had a very fun night, so definitely loved/needed the sandwiches the next AM at Egghead. Really delicious. Cannot stress how many cool options for food/drinking in this hotel. Would definitely return!

room was not ready at check in. I waited over 2 hours before giving up. The room was not ready at 4pm either. I had to store my luggage and return at night. Then I was placed in a room with bunk beds, which is not what I ordered.

We stayed here from Thursday 28th Feb - 4th March, the hotel room was compact, very modern, clean and very smart. They have really friendly staff and a lovely restaurant lagesea, which we would highly recommend as the food was very tasty and they do great cocktails too I recommend the lavender girl However the only downside was that there is a roof top bar which plays music until very late Friday-Sunday and it really does keep you awake, we also had some roudie guest knocking on our door very early in the morning, which disturbed us. The location however is brilliant and I think this defiantly makes up for the lack of sleep.

We stayed for four nights and found the hotel was in an excellent location. Very modern inside and clean. Staff were also very friendly. Would highly recommend staying here and would most definitely book again if I returned to New York.

We loved our stay at This moxy hotel ! Very close to Times Square, the empire state building,... and several metro stations! Very kind and friendly people at the hotel! Nice seafood restaurant! My next weekend in New York, I Will spend at This hotel! Thank you for a great stay

Stayed at the Moxy Times Square last weekend. I LOVE this hotel! The staff was so incredibly welcoming. The rooms were awesome. I love the decor of this hotel! We started our night at the rooftop bar for happy hour. Had the best lemon drop martini...ok maybe 2. I honestly could have just stayed there for the rest of the night...loved the ambiance of this bar. We left hotel for dinner. Did some walking around the city and ended our night at the lobby bar which was awesome as well. Had a fabulous night sleep...very comfy beds! I highly recommend staying here. So much fun! I❤️NYC

My boyfriend and I stayed here for a week in Feb 2019. We checked in late a night but found if very easy to do so with the self check in desks. The lift was a little confusing at first as I have never seen anything like that in other hotels, however, after the first use it was simple. We loved our room, yes the rooms are a little small but it was fine for the two of us. The only issue we had was we had a superior queen room and there was a double bed above our queen, we would occasionally hit our heads - this was our fault as when we booked it we chose this option. Just be warned to check what you've booked. The location of this hotel is perfect!... its round the corner from times square,the empire state and pretty much all other tourist attractions.. wonderful! We were on the top floor and never had any disturbance from the rooftop bar. The wifi at the hotel is excellent, really fast and super easy to connect to. The only issue we had was where the plug socket were placed for the hairdryer.. no matter which one I plugged it into it would not reach the mirror so I had to dry my hair without a mirror all week - annoying but not the worst thing. Another thing is the sliding bathroom door, there are gaps when you shut it so using the bathroom isnt as private as one would hope - this is the one thing I would change, having a door that fully shuts in the bathroom! Despite this, we absolutely loved staying at this hotel and if we were to come back to New York, we would 100% choose to stay here again.

I stayed at the Moxy for over a week recently for a business trip. The hotel was located in the center of it all, and close enough for a walkable commute to the Javits Center each day. Service was wonderful and I enjoyed the restaurant and bar with my colleagues. The rooms are small, but that's NYC. The only thing I would have hoped for was more space to hang my clothes. It was a little tricky with the limited space. The bed was very comfortable, and it was nice to be able to kick back after a long day and stream my Netflix account on the TV. I would definitely stay here again for any other business that brings me back to NYC.

+ Very nice hotel close to Times Square and many attractions. Rooms are small but have everything you need. Nice rainshower! Good choice of restaurants, bars in the building.-Air is very dry and cleaning could be improved (floor).

I booked this hotel as a suprise 50th Birthday present for my partner and we found it to be a great, trendy and welcoming hotel that is close enough to explore the whole of New York. Check in was easy and our room was perfect for what we need, on the 11th floor we didnt hear any of the noise from the bar and to be honest not much street noise as other reviewers have said, although this maybe the location of our room. The bar staff on the 2nd floor are friendly and the breakfast there are great, highly recommend the Breakfast sandwich to set you up for the day. We went up to the rooftop bar once during our stay for a cocktail and a look a the views, it was ok quite small but only half was open, I expect it is better in the summer.Overall the hotel is clean, good value and great place to base yourself while you are in New York, we would book again next time

Hotel looks good and the rooms are furnished efficiently.Beds and shower are good.Stayed here twice now. First time I had the TV mounted at the end of the bed with a soundbar below.During my sleep I pushed the soundbar a but upwards by accident obviously and causing to push it against the power button of the TV.So waking up a few times because of a TV that powers on in the middle of the night.TVs have Chromecast support but didn't work on both stays.Asked assistance for it on my current (2nd) stay but nobody showed up after 1h waiting...AC units are really really annoying.On both stays they kicked in every 10-15min by making a lot of noise!!Not acceptable if you ask me. Waked me up a few times...

Arriving with lots of luggage was a chore, fully self serve. No valet. Check in person seemed to take great joy in telling me over and over that check in was at 4pm and that my room was not ready since it was earlier than 4.Never making an effort for any other options. I had to ask if another room was ready. And yes! For $20 more it was! Shocking. For us it was totally worth it, not having to store our luggage which was voluminous since we were about to cruise. A quick look at the room, showed it was clean, but trying to put our valuables in the safe, the safe was not even attached to anything. You could just pick it up and walk it out the door! We were only staying one night so we did did not fuss.We later visited the bar on 2 occasions and the vibe was great and staff very nice. Really nice place. In the morning I wanted to book another day and was asking about it at the front desk and the person at the desk stopped serving me and went to someone else who just walked up without even a mention to me. I eventually walked away and went to another attendant and the same thing happened again!!!I spoke with the manager on duty (Victoria) who gave me her card apologized and told me she would take the $20 up charge off and give me bonus points. I emailed her photos of all the issues in the room. Week later still no response. Up charge still on bill and 5000 bonus points were given. The issues in the room was that the shower seat was falling off the wall, toilet seat was ready to fall off and the previously mentioned safe (not so safe).This pretty new hotel is in a great location, has that boutique feel. Liked it quite a bit. But, the quirky boutique feel, in no way justifies bad customer service. If you are dealing with a customer you excuse yourself unless it is an emergency. This was just poorly trained young people, without people skills. And there is no reason the room is falling apart already! Where is maintenance?

What a fab find this was. Trendy entrance, with music playing throughout and they also spray their own scent in the communal areas which I quite liked. We were upgraded on arrival to a queen room which was a nice surprise. We used the gym a few times, small but does the the job - free weights, cable flies, rower and treadmills.We got a token for a free drink, was nice to sit at the bar and chat to the friendly staff.We were on the 12th floor and the only night we really noticed the noise was on the Saturday night, if you’re sensitive of hearing or on much higher floors I’d bring earbuds just incase - we had such a busy day we just passed out. Location is very good, 5/10 min walk depending on your pace to the centre in Times Square. 2 min walk to Macy’s and Penn station. Fab hotel, great staff and location - I would definitely return

This is an excellent place to stay if your in a business trip, it's nice, clean place to stay but need to add a mini refrigerator and electric kettle in room specially in winter season.I love the stay XXX
user_name:
Venture21456632731
New York City, New York

review_body: Great location. It was a bit noisy at times. There are a couple of things(minor)which would make things more comfortable. A waste basket in the room, a coffee pot. A couple of extra wash cloths would be helpful as well.

Loved this hotel. Room was tiny but fun. Girls trip and three of us made it work. Loved the styling and furniture. Would definitely stay here again. Absolutely loved it! Convenient and fun place to stay in for a quick drink or appetizers. The lounge area had a fun feel.

Shower was amazing, rooms were kept very clean, elevators were very simple to use and ran quickly and efficiently, self check in and check out both failed but assistants were there to check us in manually so all in all great

A great hotel to stay in. Modern, clean and with a great atmosphere. The staff were friendly and extremely helpful especially at check in. Would definitely recommend to anyone considering staying in the midtown
user_name:
FarAway10437730461
New York City, New York

review_body: After reading so many reviews on here about the size of the bedrooms i was surprised at how large our room was. We had our two cases lying flat out on the floor and plenty of room to leave them there.I think the lift system is great as it means no one but residents can get the to the bedroom floors so felt very secure.Really loved the atmosphere of the hotel very funky and i'm no youngster (was there for 60th birthday), found the staff very helpful and friendly and also loved the breakfasts each morning.Would I go back? without a double wouldn't stay anywhere else.MOXY I LOVE YOU

good location, GREAT restaurant but really tiny rooms. i stayed here a couple of times. the first time i was in a double room so the size wasn't that much of an issue that time. the second time i was in a smaller room and the bed was in between the walls -- most definitely not for tall guests. the TV was on the wall, you could kick it from the bed! :) if you're tall and/or claustrophobic, you need to ask for an upgrade or pay extra for a larger room. the property is a bit dark, and music is playing everywhere. it's the ambiance. if you're looking for a traditional business hotel, this might not be ideal. definitely an experience and caters to younger demographic. try the Legasea restaurant. the food's really YUMMY!

I stayed at my first Moxi in Munich a few years ago. This one unfortunately does not have the hip lobby and reception area that the Munich one has. But the location is just a five minute walk from Time Square and the prices are fairly reasonable for NYC.

Great location and amenities, but felt the rooms were just a little too small when living out of a suitcase, as the suitcase takes up most of the floor space. Also the set up of the lifts, were over complicated.

My stay at the Moxy Hotel was a conglomeration of minor annoying design choices that add up to a stay that is like the death of a thousand cuts. The hotel follows a trend to provide smaller and smaller rooms with fewer and fewer amenities in trade for less expensive room rates and masking that with a high design feel and claiming to be modern. The first thing you notice when you enter the hotel room is the sink. It may seem strange that this is the first thing you notice, but it is unavoidable, because the bathroom sink is in the entrance hallway. Why? So that the “bathroom” itself can be the just the width of the shower / toilet. Together, the entrance hallway and the bathroom, are also the width of the hotel room which means the bedroom measures about 8.5’ x 8.5’. The entire hotel room is so small in fact that there are no closets or drawers to put clothes in. Closet and drawers have been replaced with a Quakers inspired rail of pegs that spans the length of the room, on which there are exactly three hangers. Another heavier coat hanger is also provided but for some reason a design choice was that this hanger is not removable from its peg. Note that not all these pegs are really usable, since the pegs are also used to hang the body length mirror, and to store the room’s table and extra chair. More pegs are made unusable as they are over the space that the television occupies. Additional storage is, at first glance, located under the bed. However, of the four spaces provided there, the largest is for a suitcase (please feel free to move the night stand out of the way first), and the second space is the hotel room’s single drawer. Opening that drawer reveals that it is already occupied by the room safe. This leaves two cubbyholes, large enough each for a dress shirt.Staying with the bed for a minute, it is pushed into a corner of the room, right up against the outside wall with the prison-like slit windows. There is less than a foot between the end of the bed and the wall where the TV is installed, so standing there means your knees touch the bed and your back touches the TV. If you are unfortunate enough to have booked this room and are a couple, the person sleeping next to the window will need to climb over their bedmate to get out of bed, which is made more likely since that same person is likely to roll over and be rudely awakened by the very cold, hard outside wall. That person is also subjected to the heat or cold from the HVAC unit right at their feet, which is rather loud but mostly drowns out the noise of traffic coming through the poorly sound attenuated slit windows. Even on the fifth floor of the hotel, it was surprisingly noisy.There is also a fairly long list of things you won’t have when staying in this room. You won’t have any carpet in the room, so be prepared for cold floors. You won’t have an iron to iron clothes. That has been replaced by a handheld steamer, since an iron would have required an ironing board which would have taken up more valuable peg space. You won’t have a fridge or minibar in the room. You won’t have much privacy if you decide to take a shower (naturally, there is no bath as it would have been too big) and your partner decides to use the toilet, as there is no shower curtain and will likely get sprayed as the shower faces the toilet. The space is small enough and the designers conscious enough of that fact that extra small tiles are used to make the space seem bigger. You won’t have separate bath gel and shampoo, as that has been combined into a single bottle. You also won’t be able to really use the sink. The sink is shallower than a roasting pan, and has no stopper to fill with water. The tap itself is designed to be low pressure and have a spread out water flow rather than a normal column of water to prevent splashing from this shallow sink. You won’t have an easy time using the desk, which is hung on the wall. To use it you need to take it down and try to set it up, but it more often than not is persnickety in the exact position it needs to be to gain enough traction to have its legs unfold. Trying to set up one handed is futile as it just flops around. You won’t be able to read in bed if your partner turns off their light, as that is also the master light switch which turns off all the lights, rather than leaving the bedside lights individually controlled like in most hotels. Check in and check out are self serve with a couple of folks there that assist you if you have trouble. However, most people seem to have trouble, and the line to ask those folks a question is long. The drinks in the bar are about $19 per drink after tax and tip, which seems pretty steep, especially for not top of the shelf alcohol. There are some things that are nice about the hotel room. There are plentiful outlets, most with two USB ports to allow charging of devices. The TV is equipped with Google Chromecast, and also is a smart TV that allows you to sign in to your favorite media streaming service, such as Netflix. That sink that is in the your room’s entrance hallway has a lovely blue gray hue and textured porcelain finish. At the end of the day, nothing here really stands up to scrutiny. The switches on the walls are installed haphazardly. The security peep hole in the door is installed crooked so that the cover for it constantly leaves the eye hole open. The drapes covering the room’s front door’s industrial wired and frosted glass window are held up by velcro and not the toggle buckles they seem to be. And the art on your wall that seems whimsical at first with its toy wrestler turns out to be someone violent and scary with a woman bent over showing her bottom, and what can only be described as clouds of flatulence talking about drugs. None of the things are individually so terrible as to make a stay at the Moxy undesirable, but as a conglomeration, they add up to a feeling of hostility, as if the hotel just wants do the very minimal possible. If you are a hip person that values appearance over practical functionality, this is definitely the hotel for you.

Staff are amazing , check in easy, check out painless. Would have given more stars however-Rooms small but clean, lift takes a little getting used too but clever.Rooftop Restaurant is not in the hotel but next door.Very very noisy -music booms all night with no let up - it vibrates through the entire hotel and doesn’t stop until early hours... Blasting music in the foyer as soon as you enter the hotel is not necessary as it’s too loud and aimed at the younger generation... I would have loved it other than the music and ridiculously small rooms - I won’t stay again but the location is spot on.. I will find a quieter hotel next time and advise others who want a bit of sleep whilst here to do the same.

Very centrally located. Hotel is very near to all the New York City highlights. Good and friendly staff. Clean hotel. Bed slept very good, was a bit small though. Do not expect a big room, but good value for money.

My sister and I stayed here a few weeks ago. On arrival I handed over my credit card in case of damages etc as you do. When I arrived home I had a nasty surprise. I had a debit on my card even though I had not used it once. I emailed the hotel to ask what it was for and they told me it was a bar bill. I told them I had not used my card and this was a mistake. They said they would send me an invoice which after about 10 emails they did. It just said bar bill. I told them this must be a mistake as I had not used my card but since then they have ignored my many emails. I have now contacted the head office who are equally as useless. Told me they would have someone senior look into it but days later still no response. Don't like giving bad reviews but this is just theft what they have done and as for the terrible customer service. It is now in the hands of my credit card company. Avoid handing your card over is all I can suggest. Tell them you don't have one. I have never ever had a problem like this as a frequent visitor to the US. And another thing don't expect to be checked in on arrival. Do it yourself!!! Also don't take too many clothes as you have to hang them on hooks all around the room as no wardrobe and it just looks awful and cluttered. Thieves!!!!!!

Very cosy hotel, clean, modern and with a young friendly staff, not always very well prepared to support clients needs.Room are really small and the air conditioning is not optimised. In one of our 2 rooms we had problems (very chilly) and we had to change itVery negative for me the breakfast set up. Few meals mainly based on eggs, and no gluten free alternatives... Having known before we wouldn’t have chosen to include breakfastThe fire alarm activated at night, just because drunk people at the roof bar decided to have fun ... created additional concerns in how serious and professional the service is.The location was excellent... but it is not my style for sure!

Stayed with a group of family and friends for 5 nights from 1st Feb. From walking into the reception of the hotel I knew I’d just love it. Smooth check in and we were given 2 tokens for Prosecco in the bar which we didn’t end up using as had no time! Nice gesture though. Loved the lift system, pick your floor then it directs you to one of 4 lifts. Room adequate for location. We didn’t expect anything too big and have stayed in a few hotels in midtown area and found this room to be roomy, comfy and very well equipped. Bed was the comfiest we’ve stayed in for a long time. You could just about hear the noise from the rooftop bar but after a long day sightseeing all we wanted to do was sleep. Shower was amazing too. Great amount of usb sockets too. Love the quirkyness of this hotel and would love to stay there again. Rooftop bar is a must too.
user_name:
Rachel C
Stoke-on-Trent, England, United Kingdom

review_body: The hotel is delightful with all of its retro touches. Room was small but efficient. We loved being able to walk to the Javits Center, as getting transportation to/from can be tricky at the end of a trade show day. Although the hotel has several dining options ; we thoroughly enjoyed an incredibly relaxing time both evenings lounging in the mezzanine. Here we enjoyed a complimentary prosecco and some lovely dinner bites, with our trade show weary feet up! Thanks again for a super stay! We’ll be back!

Central location, modern no fuss hotel fast checking in and out , great value if you are a solo traveler but I would not recommend this room type if you are sharing the room, also it is bad there is no room service
user_name:
nycfirst2015
New York City, New York

review_body: Such a hip, different hotel with a great vibe. Reasonably priced too! Room was well designed, clean and had a great bed. Rooftop bar was fun abd would be even better when top as a Marriott platinum member we got a 4pm chrcknout, $20 in credits for drinks or breakfast and a room upgrade. Great find!

We had a room with two queen beds. The beds were ever so comfortable and we were given a room with a view of an office. While the view was less than great it meant that all the noise from 7th Ave was muted. We slept like babies! The shower was also really nice. I'd say this hotel is good value as nothing can beat the location. We'd look up 7th Ave and see Times Sq. Down the street is Macy's.There's a football game in the bar, which kept our 9-year old happy too. We'd definitely come back.

Moxy NYC was one of the few hotels in NYC that allowed for individuals under the age of 21 to check in without a parental guardian - therefore my partner and I booked this for our five night stay in NYC at the end of Jan 2019. I have to be honest in saying that was I super disappointed with this hotel. Upon reading reviews prior to booking, I understood that the rooms were extremely small, however extremely small is an understatement. Upon arriving at the hotel there are around 10 self-serve screens that allow for you to check in and check out for yourself. There is also around 4 staff members standing in a corner doing nothing, so doesn’t really make sense? I approached one of them as I wanted to upgrade our room, and they were so incredibly rude - you could tell the staff hated their jobs which ruins the overall experience for the customer. The lady who reluctantly helped us stated that we could upgrade our room for an extra amount per night which we agreed to - now I regret this as the room wasn’t even slightly bigger than the original room we booked. We overlooked this as we were in New York and hardly spent time in the hotel room. On the second night however, I was woken up at around 3am by a PIERCING noise which ended up being the fire alarm. This was VERY scary and there is NO WHERE in the room that explains what to do if the alarm goes off. There was a gentlemen over the intercom, however, he seemed very scared and no one was picking up the front desk phone - I tried calling multiple times. I left our room to see other people standing outside in the hallway unsure what to do as well. Thank god it was a false alarm which I confirmed later with one of the staff members who stated it was steam in the electronics? I also read online that this had happened to multiple people whilst staying at this hotel. I have to say that the location of the hotel is very good, we were within walking distance to Times Square which was helpful for the short time we were in New York - had we had longer and were over 21 I would have stayed near Central Park - much more classy. A few people had also complained about the noise from the rooftop bar, however, we were on the 15th floor and had no issues falling asleep. The hotel also has a candy bar and free hot chocolate - some days there were no cups for the hot chocolate, and the candies at the bar were terrible, so maybe that could be improved. The tv, shower and bed are pretty good in the room, however, the tap does not release clean clear water, it’s murky off-white water which confused me a little. I would never stay here again but the hotel does deserve an average as it was just that, average, maybe borderline poor.

This past weekend i was looking forward to staying at the hotel to celebrate my friends birthday and upon check in ( its self check in on tablets ) with one guest service agent to help you. When we asked for assitance the one girl had a complete attitude and would not help accomdate us. Being that the location is in times square it was already a hassle to get there then for them to say our room reservation does not exsist. And when asked to speak to a manager “he was not there and there was nothing they could do about it” Prior to the days checking in we tried to call to see if they could put champange or decorate the room but its a robot that talks to you and when you reach the “front desk” they cant answer any your questions.Ive been to many hotels and let me tell you the front desk staff always has an answer and greets me properly. This hotel staff was the WORST ive encounteredMoving on.. to get to your room there is a god awful elevator that makes you enter all this information just to open it and the numbers dont make sense to know what floor and room number you are in. Example: (1023) = 10th floor room 23. We had to stop and ask someone if he knew how to get to our room. Paid a ridiculous amount to stay in a queen & it was so tiny and the shower, dispicable. There no shower curtain and the toilet is right in front of it as your sink is outside.This was such a bad experience i had to write about it

Let’s start with the location. I mean, c’mon! This is EXCELLENT! The interior styling is ‘young’, sharp, neon, urban...dome very well.I’m staying in a single room. It’s not big but it doesn’t need to be because what’s there is a comfortable crash pad with everything that I need. The social space (Bar/Restaurant) are welcoming, friendly and well stocked. I’ve just eaten lunch here. A Green Goddess (avocado) salad with steak and fries. Wow!This is a great base for a trip like this!
user_name:
Adam S
Bristol, England, United Kingdom

review_body: The hotel is in a great location, however my room was the tiniest I've had in the US...EVER! The bed touches 3 walls, so goodluck if you're a couple. The bed takes up 2/3rds of the room, I layed my suitcase down next to the bed and it went to the edge of the other wall. Just enough room to open the door. The bathroom is of similar size, if you're a lady with a lot of cosmetics you'll have difficulties because there is no vanity just one tiny shelf on the wall that held my toothbrush and deodorant. There were peg hooks all around the walls of the room and had a computer tray that hung from one. The 2nd floor bar can be heard late into the night and you don't want the 17th floor as it's directly under the roof top bar. While the idea of the hotel is fun, I found myself wishing for more room for a 5 day stay. No amenities like a coffee maker, but there's a dunkin donuts, starbucks, and egg head right next door.

I recently stayed here for 5 nights with family (4 of us in 3 rooms) to celebrate my birthday. I was a little worried that the rooms would be too small after reading some of the reviews, however although small they are perfectly spacious enough for a few nights stay. The room was very clean, the bed comfy and a fabulous shower. I had a corner room which had a view of the top of the empire state building which was lovely. We stayed on the 11th floor and had no problems with noise from the rooftop bar (which was another of my worries). There was also plenty of power outlets in the room and in particular usb outlets which was helpful.We spent some time in the 2nd floor bar and the rooftop bar which were great, although the drinks were very pricey, even by New York standards!The location of the hotel was perfect for our needs - within walking distance to Times Square, Madison Square Garden and the subway with easy access to many sights. Finally, the staff at the hotel were all very friendly. I would definitely return to this hotel in the future and recommend to friends.

We stayed for only one night, as we live upstate and were flying out of LGA very early the next morning. At check-in we were welcomed by a friendly, helpful staff and because we were very early, they put a rush on getting our room readied by housekeeping. We waited in the 2nd story lounge/bar which is very comfortable with views of Times Sq. The staff there was just as accommodating and very engaging. It made our wait enjoyable. The rooms are small but had everything that we needed. I wish we could have stayed longer to enjoy all of the amenities. The vibe here is very cool and chic. We will definitely stay at the Moxy again in the future.

Highly recommend and would stay here again. Perfect location, head north on 7th Avenue to Times Square, south to Madison Square Garden. All within 10mins of the hotel. Perfect for exploring or exhibitions at the Javits centre (15min walk west on 36th)

Stayed here with my husband, son and nephew in two rooms. Pros Great location close to Times Square, Macy’s and Maddison Square Gardens Clean roomsShower fab Great for a one / two day stay Good luggage storage facility.ConsRooms very small and had difficulty getting in and out of bed as no space either side, not great if you have mobility problems.No storage only pegs and a couple of hangers.Had a table but no space if you have a big suitcase to put it up and no comfy chair.Difficult if you brought a drink back as had to put in the sink which is in the bedroom instead of the bathroom.  Room felt a bit claustrophobic with both of us trying to get ready.We were given tokens for free drinks processco or a soft drink. Processco turned out to be a flat wine. Not impressed, spoke to the manager who did offered a free drink but I declined as we were going for dinner.This hotels would appeal to younger people, very hip. A can of beer $10 a bit steep.We asked about a taxi and they said they could order us one for $95 , we went out on the street and hailed a yellow taxi less than $70 as fixed rate to JKF and that was in rush hour.Would I stay here again , yes but only due to great location. I think I would like a bedroom with a bed that I could get out from the side of the bed. Would not bring a big suitcase if I came again.

This is the 3rd and last stay at this hotel. Fun, trendy atmosphere but not so for the hotel guests.Both the last and this time, the main bar was “closed” for a private event. The hotel customers were offered a cozy - read - really tiny - space with bar service. Naturally at 6:30 pm there was not an empty seat to be had nor anytime soon.The restaurant bar was also completely full.The roof-top bar was also reserved for several special events.Seems one of the primary reasons one would choose to come to this hotel would be for the convenience of not having to go out after work to find a drink. Certainly not for the cozy (see above) rooms.I am a lifetime platinum Marriott rewards member and stay in Manhattan 3 nights a week, I will take my loyalty elsewhere. Time for Marriott to rethink this relationship!Go somewhere where you will get a lot more for your money and know you will have to go out for a drink rather than the pretense of having a bar for your customers.

I stayed at Moxy Hotel before and the experience was so great that I decided to visit once again. The location is very nice with nice restaurants within and around the hotel. Macy's and H&M are one and two streets away, and the Korean Street is only four streets away as well.

My fiance and I decided to stay at the Moxy based on visiting magic hour a few times before. The hotel is amazing from the very first foot step in! It smelled so good as if it puts you in this crazy gaze. The staff was amazing and the rooms were so cute. The bars and restaurants were nice because once we got situated in the room we weren't ready to travel far so it was very convenient. I will definitely be back :)

My husband and I spent the night here last Thursday. I loved it! Very hip and very cool. A young crowd, for sure. It had a really good vibe. Small room but that was expected. Very creative and interesting use of space. We were very comfortable for an overnight. The common space on 2nd floor was great. Lovely bar. I checked out the rooftop bar as well but it was freezing out so I just ran out and took a few photos. In the warm weather it must be great. I’ll be back for a cocktail for sure. The midtown location was key! I got to everywhere I needed within a very short walk. I will definitely stay here again.

Great experience. The staff is friendly & helpful. Room was clean. Had a table reservation at the magic hour club, the service was fast & efficient. Our server was prompt with our drinks & readily available when we need her. Far exceeded our expectations. Will definitely be staying again in the near future.

Great customer service from start to finish. The bar and lounge ambience is relaxing. There are activities available for kids if you're travelling with family. Comfy and clean rooms. Will definitely be back.

Overall a great hotel with a great atmosphere. Fun and young and overall a fun time if you’re looking for good quality and good fun. Rooms had everything you need and the shared spaces we’re really nice and fun.

I absolutely loved The Moxy but be warned the rooms are tiny, we were very fortunate to get a bigger room due to medical needs. The staff really make this hotel, they are all very helpful and friendly. It's a very young modern hotel and perhaps not for you if you are used to high end luxury.The hotel is in a wonderful location very close to all the main attractions, a few blocks from Times Square, Macy's, 5th Avenue, Penn Station, Grand Central. The rooftop bar (Magic Hour) is fantastic, great range of cocktails a quirky vibe and amazing views of The Empire State Building.There are onsite eateries and a restaurant which serves a lovely fish and chips!If you want great service, a quirky room close to main attractions then this is the hotel for you. If you want a luxury spacious room perhaps give this one a miss.

Great hotel near Times Square. Just about two or three blocks away! The check in is really neat, it’s all do it yourself. They have candy sitting out for you to take as well as corn hole. Very up and coming. The rooms are nice, though small. Which I guess you can assume since it’s NYC. It was kind of loud outside our first night but after that we did not have any problems. The heat works perfect which was nice bc it was sooo cold when we were there. No complaints at all. The staff was so friendly and even helped us print out Tonight Show tickets. We walked everywhere. It’s a good few miles from everything else so we got some good exercise. I would stay here again if I wanted to be close to Times Square but next time I think we will stay closer to Central Park.

My husband booked a long weekend at The Moxy at the end of January for my 50th birthday. After reading the reviews I wasn't sure we were cool enough for this hotel! I love a party as much as the next person but I also love a comfortable slice of luxury on which to rest my head at the end of the day too - I was worried that it had been previously described as a posh hostel!Well, it's true the Moxy lobby does smell lovely when you walk in. However, we failed the self-serve check-in so had to enlist the help of the lovely staff (in our defense, after travelling for 15 hours we were not functioning properly and the lobby is very dark!) We were allocated an inward facing room on the 17th floor (1703 directly below the rooftop nightclub). Once we'd got to grips with how the (also dark) lifts work (tell the lift where you want to go before you get in!) we were away.The bedroom was bigger than I was expecting, having read previous reviews - the style was minimalist Scandinavian we thought! Very clean and functional. The shower room was also a good size, although we didn't like the see-through frosted glass door between the bedroom and the shower room - no-one wants to see that at our age!! The view out of our window was of the other internal windows in a small square shape so if you had the blinds open, everyone could see straight into your room. Did feel a bit exposed if I'm honest and claustrophobic with the blinds closed. I had a cold and struggled to sleep during our stay so actually welcomed the distraction of the throbbing club music booming into our room until 4am. We only ventured onto the rooftop bar once - it was interesting. The revolving seating was fun, very dark overall again, not sure when the crazy golf would get used? LOL! We only had access to half the venue as there was a private party occupying the other half which was a shame. Lovely view from the rooftop balcony overlooking the Empire State Building!We had breakfast on the 2nd floor Moxy Bar area. Surprisingly and in contrast to the rest of the hotel, it's light, bright and airy - loft style décor. Breakfast was lovely, Hubby had breakfast slider and I had omelette. We returned to the Moxy Bar in the evenings too as we found it to be a lovely bright space - great that they have a DJ on each evening too, not too loud either!The hotel location we found to be perfect - everything was walkable. They stored our bags after check-out in a manned room in the basement - all very efficient. We didn't eat at the Legasea Restaurant as we were too tired in the evenings, but it looked lovely.In summary, if you love a bit of chintz curtain or luxury antique furnishings and indeed some privacy when you're sat on the lavatory - maybe you should give The Moxy a swerve - you're just not cool enough! It's dark, funky, smells lovely, clean, loud and efficiently run. It turns out that we were cool enough and we would definitely go back!

The hotel is perfectly located close to Times Square and a lot of the other sights the city offers.The rooms are very small but every inch is very well put to use which just makes for a cozy atmosphere.And everything is very nice and clean.The vibe of the hotel is trendy and very cool!I would absolutely stay here again!!

Great hotel, close to transport links and attractions. Clean room also not a bad size. We had a really nice time. The staff added balloons and decorations for my wife’s birthday on arrival which we really appreciated! Friendly and helpful staff, free hot chocolate in the lobby some days. Roof top bar pretty cool! Free storage of luggage on checkout and use of computer and printer in basement which was a real plus!I would give the hotel 5 stars although we did have a couple of false fire alarms where we needed to get out of bed to go down to the lobby. Did have one of the adjacent nightclub staff ask why we came down when it was just a false alarm (we didn’t know) which I found worrying. Some cleaning equipment in way of escape stair, needed to be kept clear. Other than that, a brilliant place to stay, and good value for money!

I didn’t love it. Probably, if I’m being honest, I didn’t like it, either. It’s definitely a great value hotel – at a very cheap time to travel to NYC, rooms were priced in the low $100s. For that maybe it’s worth it, for $300 in primer seasons, yikes, no way.The hotel is Marriott’s take on Starwood’s Aloft, and I’m not necessarily the demographic (older, appreciate nice hotels with lovely lighting and bathrooms with tubs and quality restaurants). So weigh that. Moxy does a lot right. It’s a tight space for sure – I write about cruise travel for a living and I get that, and was impressed by the design of the room and the use of hooks to hang stuff (with hangers provided, too, even I’m not that old-fashioned, laughing). What I hated? No comfortable chair. A bed pushed against the window (a pal on the same trip and her husband laughed about how he had to climb over her to get into bed and at some point that’s not actually charming). No view, just dreary offices across a narrow side street, so you had to keep your blinds closed. Claustro-alert!What I liked? Great shower. Super shower. I think that was the highlight and as I’m a tub person, that’s an unusual acknowledgement. The neighborhood, labeled Times Square, is ambitious. It’s the garment district, that dreary part of town where, on the “Marvelous Mrs. Maisel” her hapless husband Joel, works. No good restaurants nearby, not sense of community or neighborhood. Just depressing, though convenient enough to Penn Station. You can walk. You can also walk a few blocks to Times Square. As someone who lived in Manhattan in the 1980s and avoided that area at all costs, well, there you are. I loved the idea of the restaurant, and the service was generally very sweet, and it, located on the second floor so away from the dreariness of the neighborhood, had a wonderful atmosphere. Ate there two nights. Never liked the food. That’s totally subjective, and I acknowledge, but even a Caesar Salad just tasted…not good. And it was expensive. But it was this or Bubba Gump’s Shrimp. I’m just not the right customer for this brand. And if you’re not either, keep looking.And yet: My young friends who are cost-cutting folk and thrilled to be in a clean, safe and contemporary property (inside an old building), will love it. And their mothers will love it, for them, too.

Small Stylish Rooms. Only partial Service; no ups or fedex deliveries. No room service. No valet parking. UPS store accepts the hotels packages for 10 per package fee.Restaurant was wonderful. Lounge is relaxed and comfortable.The Barber Shop is pricey but worth it!Roof Patio Bar is casual, stylish and fun.

We came to see a show and to basically sleep here, wake up and go home. We were recommended to stay here by a friend who has been here before. I loved the smell in the lobby. Our check in was fine, I loved how cute and cozy the room was. The decor in the room was adorable and the shower was great. The pegs on the walls are so useful and the steamer in the room came in very handy. The price was great and the room was super clean, would recommend to friends!

Firsty, this hotel is in a great location. Right on 7th, it's pretty easy to walk everywhere and up to Times Square. We had booked a corner suite (thank goodness) as apparently the other rooms are pretty small. We had a friendly check-in and staff were generally friendly and eager to assist throughout our 6 night stay. It tries to be pretty trendy which is fine, but I find that I am tiring of chain hotels trying to be individual as they generally don't quite get it right. The room was nice enough, great spacious shower, fridge in the room, comfortable bed, there was even make up remover pads and a steamer for getting that little black number looking hot for a night out on the town. But there was no water in the room. There was no tea/coffee maker in the room. So if you wanted a hot drink at 5am - no go - unless you went down to the cafe on the second floor when it opened and paid for the privilege. We ended up going to Walgreens and buying a coffee maker to use during our stay - we shouldnt have to do that. Also, if you are on a higher floor, the noise from the roofdeck partyzone can keep you up until the wee hours. We also had 3 boxes delivered as we were attending an exhibition - these need to be collected 3 doors down and we were charged USD 90.00 for the privilege of them receiving them - c'mon guys - thats half what it cost us to ship them from the UK. Guys, you are doing a pretty good job, just have a relook at the basics and you could be brilliant.

We were received very nice. The room service was very good. The staff were always friendly and answered our questions. In some places the hotel was still in the new building but that did not bother us.

I stayed here over my birthday weekend and I couldn’t have asked for a better hotel! I spent hours reading reviews on hotels and I’m so glad I chose this one. Although the rooms are small, they are designed very well with ways to store and organize your things. The bed was incredibly comfortable, and the shower was amazing! There are even smart TVs in the room and a steamer. I hate ironing my clothes, so the steamer was a very nice touch. One thing I always think hotel rooms lack are outlets, but this room had plenty and in good locations as well. We had no noise complaints during our stay. My only criticism to the room would be to have a waste basket in the room part in addition to the one in the bathroom. The room was clean, modern and new. Magic Hour rooftop bar is so cute, and the food was even better. It is in a great location, and we were able to walk almost every where we went. I 100% recommended staying here, and I will stay here again the next time I visit!

The location is perfect! The hotel is very clean with an efficient design. It smelling good in the lobby and the staff is very professional. The elevators work very well and fast! The room are juste enough t’as the design make it efficient!

I don't understand some of the negative reviews. Yes, you could pay a lot more for a bigger room with more storage. This hotel was more than adequate for a short city break. Although the room is compact, there are hooks all along one wall to hang your stuff. Walk-in shower was great, bed comfortable. Only wee negative was noisy AC, but cured with earplugs. The bar on the 2nd floor was relaxing with good music. All staff we encountered were friendly and helpful. I would recommend this hotel to any one on a short city break, good value.

I stayed at this hotel in December for a work trip. The property itself is nice. I liked the decor and the room, though small, was stylish and functional. It was a bit noisy, but that is to be expected for Times Square.At about 1am, I got up to go to the bathroom. As I put on my slippers, they felt wet. I turned on the lights and was startled to find that about half of the floor in the bedroom was covered in water! I called the front desk and someone came up to look at the situation. The staff person said there was a problem with the bathroom in a room near mine and that, if I wanted another room, I needed to pack up and come downstairs. I agreed, but was annoyed, as I had to be up in a few hours.So, after packing, I headed downstairs to the front desk. There were two staff people there. One gave me a key to another room. I mentioned that this was a real bother, with my early morning schedule. The staff person, who turned out to be an assistant manager, did not seem particularly sympathetic, but said, "Well, I assume we will comp your room." No one had told me that, so I said, "Thanks. My room was already paid by my work, so though that is a nice gesture, it was not that meaningful to me." He responded that he would give me points in the equivalent of a free night at the hotel - 35,000 points. I thanked him and he gave me his card.About three weeks later, I dropped him a line to say that I had not received anything. He said he forgot to do it, but that he would do it right away, but that it might take 4-5 days to post.I dropped him a line two weeks later, after still having not received the points. I didn't get any response.Now it's been a month and a half - nothing.Decent stay - poor customer service.

Cool design hotel with minimalist feel. Great location and super clean. Staff was friendly and helpful, but elevators were “moody”. I liked the bathroom decor and the fold-up furniture. It made the room look much more spacious.

An interesting, yet average concept. Hip, but maybe too hip. All in all it was just a pleasant experience with Moxy NYC Times Square.Check-in was somewhat confusing, with self check-in counters which did not work properly, so needed help from the staff, same goes for check-out. Room was interesting, but way too small - I come from Europe, but even for European standards it was tiny. Air-co was too loud and just next to the bed, so had to switch it off for the night. Bathroom, nice but with no shower curtain, making it difficult to take a shower and keep the rest of the bathroom dry.Rest of the hotel facilities were great. Bar - excellent, really a cool place to spend time at, Egghead restaurant served great breakfast. Staff was very nice, polite, efficient and friendly.Complete impression - average. Would I go back?! Doubt it, will look for a more “traditional” place.

We were in NYC for a whirlwind mother/daughter trip to see Mean Girls and it was great! Really fun, funky hotel. Cleverly designed and super comfortable. I will agree with the other reviews about room size (tiny!) but that didn't bother us at all. Super comfortable, super clean and super close to pretty much anything you would need. We arrived via train and Penn Station is only a 5 minute walk away. There were a couple not super awesome things. The most glaring was that they were actively renovating the hotel and when we went down to the 2nd floor bar to get our free glasses of prosecco (YYAAYYY!!!!) they were jack hammering right behind us, with only a tarp to divide us (BOOOOOOO...) I get that if work needs to get done, it needs to get done, but late afternoon on a saturday?? The elevators take some getting used to and the roof top restaurant is only accessible by leaving the hotel and going around the corner and through what kind of felt like a maze (maybe that's what they're fixing?) but other then that, we had a super comfortable visit and would absolutely stay here again!

We originally booked MOXY Chelsea but the hotel wasn't finished and they moved us to MOXY Times Square. After reading the reviews, I was a little concerned about how the stay would go. MOXY gave us breakfast vouchers as compensation and honored the Chelsea price (less expensive than Times Square) with the same room configuration. The reviews mentioned less-than-helpful staff, very noisy, difficult elevators. None of those things were a problem. We were on the 12th floor; companions were on 8th floor. The room was tiny but this is NYC and I was absolutely aware. The bathroom configuration of having a sliding door that contains shower and commode didn't bother me, as well as the sliding door is heavy and goes floor to ceiling. The shower is fabulous--I need a shower like that every day! The pegs that line one entire wall are very sturdy and provided an easy way to store/stash coats, shirts, jeans, mittens. There are "cubbies" under the bed to use for storage. I found the tiny space very practically designed. Staff was gracious at every turn, especially the breakfast crew-friendly, welcoming, accommodating. They have self check-in stations, but there were two staff members in the lobby who welcomed us and offered to check us in. We arrived around 12:45 and one of our rooms were ready and they gave us keys to stash luggage in early--no extra charge. Some complained that they don't like the way the hotel smells--I loved it. Sweet but not cloying. It was also warm and cozy and felt great when the high was 12! The only concern that might really be an issue was the noise of Magic Hour, the rooftop bar. It is popular but the entrance is around the corner, not through the hotel lobby. We could hear faint bass, but it didn't bother us at all. There are 4 floors above us, so maybe if you were higher up? We weren't near the elevators, but they were quiet. I loved the way the elevators work--choose your floor prior to getting in and it assigns an elevator--easy and efficient. Location of this hotel is great--subway stops close, MSG two blocks away, Penn Station two blocks away. It is on 36th & 7th, so not in the heart of Times Square and only a few blocks north of Chelsea. Great food choices--if you want really good pizza you can walk to, check out Capizzi on 9th Ave.

I stayed for 3 nights, check in was friendly and there was a team on site to assist. They also gave be a couple of bottles of water which was nice. I stayed in a queen room, it was small yet cozy - I'm glad I read reviews here so I knew what to expect. The design is very efficient, bed comfortable, enough space for my 1 bag and the shower was nicely designed with great water pressure. I did not find my room on the 4th floor to be too loud.I never did see any of the coffee in the lobby or the candy station set up. There was a cart but just empty cups sitting on it. Bar area was nice and enjoyed the token for the free glass of bubbles - a nice touch! Bar pricing was a bit expensive but hey, its NYC. Legasea was tasty for a meal my first night and the breakfast in room option was nice too! Overall a nice stay, I'd stay again since it was close to the office.

I enjoyed the trendy vibe of the hotel but several things missed there mark. First off I would like to say the hotel was clean and all employees were pleasant. The rooms are decorated nicely albeit small but practical for a short stay. Also the lobby bar was very nice but there were a few things that were off. The elevators are odd to say the least. Fortunately I understood how to use the buttons but many didn’t or needed assistance which caused a back up in lobby area and caused very long wait times. But since I was on the 4th floor I decided to walk up but the stairs are located in a employee area of hotel which is very odd so I needed someone to give us access to the stairs. The other issue with hotel was the noise from the roof top night club. Now being on the 4th floor my room must have at least 20 stories below the club but it sounded as if the DJ was next door. I’m a heavy sleeper but and go to bed late but the music was annoying when trying to get to sleep after 1am. I couldn’t imagine staying on the upper floors with the music blaring. Overall the hotel was really nice but the noise situation would way heavily if I would ever stay again.

Brilliant location - able to walk everywhere from the Moxy and very close to Times Square. EggHead breakfast place next door is great. No kettle in the bedroom and the water out the tap was a little cloudy.. Shower was great. Room is a bit on the small side for 2 people and there is not a wardrobe to hang any clothes up. I was The hotel bar is nice as is the rooftop bar attached. The lifts were a nightmare and you have to get out on the second floor to be able to access other floors! There was construction going on at the time so maybe that was why. Also the luggage storage attendant mis-labelled our case which led to us debating over that for an hour! Probably would stay again

This was my first trip to New York, andthe location of the Moxy was perfect. We were able to walk to most of the events we planned. They also had a couple of restaurants that had great food, which allowed us to stay in, and not have to go out for food. Thanks Moxy for making my first trip to the NYC a great experience.

We stayed in this hotel for 6 nights. The hotel located in very good place, very close the Times Square and right on the seven’s Avenue. The rooms are very small but nice and efficient. Cool place for coffee in the morning and very nice roof top bar! House keeping can be better, some of the days they didn’t clean our room and they didn’t changed our sheets even one time during the entire stay

The check in was a little unusual. You use kiosks to check in without speaking to a real person (except that didn't work for me because it had some trouble finding our reservation). Another reviewer said it was like checking into a night club....true, but you won't appreciate the fact until you have actually done it.We expected the room to be small. It was, but not REALLY small. The bathroom was decent size, with frosted class (so you can see shadows moving in the bathroom). This bothered my wife. I thought the warning sign in the tile was cute-"no diving"The room used every little bit of space. There were 39 wall hooks to hang things, which was rather cool. There was a table and chair, which could be put on the wall hooks. There was a luggage rack, which also hung on the wall hooks.There was no closet (did I mention the 39 wall hooks?). There was no bureau (another reference to the 39 wall hooks). The sink was no in the bathroom, but in the main room.It was fine for a couple, but I would not think it would work well for a family in a single room.And there is a noisy night club. I didn't have a problem, but it bothered the wife (we were on the 8th floor, which was fairly far from the disco or whatever it was). Everything was spotless. The staff was attentive.Even so, I will probably not go back because it caters to a younger crowd (and the price was amazing).

Very comfortable guest rooms with modern, homey decor. A welcome drink is offered at the bar/ restaurant which has comfortable furniture and entertainment (DJ). The service there was very slow however. Good location, very clean... would stay again!

I just wanted to give it a try as it said Moxy by Marriott but this is the last. Not to my taste . I am sure its designed for a set of target customers but not me . - The hotel staff said I got upgraded . I didn't know what the non upgrade room was like. My upgraded room was queen bed with wall to wall and no room to reach to the window. TV was on the wall - Marriott platinum - no breakfast They gave a 10$ voucher and I ended up not using it - It is under renovation and the front desk was shabby- Room was clean . THe only thing I liked was the shower

Clean is about all the positive to say. The room was TEENY TINY. Basically it's a bed pushed against three walls and a small hallway. The only window requires crawling over the bed to look out or pull the shades. The bathroom sink is in the room. There is no desk, there is only one nightstand. No chairs except two hanging benches with no real space to put them. Difficult to find space for luggage. No closet (just hanging hooks along the wall). The bathroom is a toilet and a shower with a sliding glass door. Fixtures and style is steampunk-institutional, like a mental hospital in a bad movie (sorry). With two in the room, someone has to step back to the wall for the other one to pass by. No amenities, no fridge, no waters. The bar-breakfast area on the 2nd seating is completely threadbare - see the images. A check-in token for prosecco at the bar yielded the flattest bubbly I've ever had. Drunk people in the elevator, angry because there are no buttons. Got yelled at by the drunk, who got agitated and threw his phone to the ground. Had to run out of the elevator before he would get more violent. On the plus side, it was quiet, no noise like others described.For a solo traveler spending a night or two in the city, it's probably a good budget option. For a business traveller, or couples/families, and/or spending multiple nights, it will be a frustrating experience.

Listen up - the rooms are small. Ok let's move on... There is a very cool fun vibe to this hotel. You can self check in or you can speak with someone at one of the desks. The elevator was tricky... choose where you are going then wave your card - there are no buttons in the elevator! We stayed on the 7th floor - I read reviews where people said the noise level from the roof top club (Magic Hour) was too much. On the 7th floor we did not have this problem. The one complaint is the heating/ A/C unit - now that is loud. Luckily, we were exhausted and this did not hinder our sleep. The beds are really comfy and the bedding was a perfect weight. Loved the toilet in the shower area - they could use an exhaust fan. A hair dryer and clothes steamer is provided. There is not much room, so for a family or a long stay person/couple this may not be ideal. We were there for the weekend so it was ok. It is a fun hotel that offers so much that you dont need to leave to have fun. We ate at Legasea - very cool restaurant-food was delicious-kinda pricey. We went to the Magic Hour - DJ was kickin it old school - drinks were eh and $$$$- fun place none the less. Would like to come back in the summer and check it out. Went to the 2nd floor bar - you get a free glass of prosecco - they will give you a token when you check in. There is a cool lounge on this floor as well with comfy spots to sit and play games. Brunch at The Magic Hour was ok. I had read in a review that they did not have Lipton tea bags or English Breakfast - They still don't. Also our husbands complained about the coffee how terrible it was. The food was delicious - drinks not so much.What I really love about this hotel is that it was so nice on a freezing night not to leave the hotel and still have a great night! We will be back Moxy!

The rooms are very small, which I could deal with but it was extremely loud in the room because of the club on the rooftop (I was floor 11 and the club is 16). I could hear the music and even the DJ hyping the crowd. When I asked for a new room at 8:30pm after having been on a red eye and at a conference all day, I was told that there was a room but the noise level would still be bad. I called Marriott to get transferred to a new hotel and while they tried to get in touch with the management at this property to get me a refund, they weren't able to as of yet. Do not stay here unless you are okay with listening to a full-blown club while you sleep.

The location is simply perfect. We highly appreciate the smell in the lobby. However, the room was small, we encountered problems with lifts (no other option), no breakfast buffet (you have to order one plate with tasteless coffee and powder orange juice (no fruits or fresh stuff) but the waiters were cool.The service check in was nice (could be improved in terms of explanations,..Could be crowded in the bar, difficult to find a place to sit if you don't go early.Appreciate the ice cream machine in the bar and the free prosecco drink offered and the overall deco of the hotel But you could find a better rooms and hotels in other location. You pay tbe price near Times Square (at walking distance of everything) Btw the bed was quite small if you are tall 140cm), but extremely comfy

From the easy check in to the easy check out this hotel was perfect for our trip to New York. May partner upgraded us to a suite so I had sight of the smaller room as well. Both were well designed and compact. Loved the hotel and would return without an issue.
user_name:
Aisling V
County Armagh, United Kingdom

review_body: I am a Marriott Platinum Member and they do NOT CARE at all, no help checking in, no dedicated desk, no amenities at all. Not an awful thing, but still a bit strange I really am at a loss, they did almost everything they said they'd do. If you are looking for a regular experience hotel, this is not for you. Young, friendly people on hand at front desk. You pretty much do all the work yourself thru a kiosk though. Elevators are tricky, with touch pads and other intricacies, definitely not standard elevators. BUT, once you understand what is going on they work fabulously and there is seldom any waiting at all. Don't like constantly having to use the key card and mine went dead once during the stay, but it is Times Square and security is important. I had the 3 person room with lofted bunk. The room is tiny, smallest i have ever seen in NYCit was clean and everything worked. The shower and toilet share a glass closet; there is a tiny, tiny sink outside for use. All the tables, chairs, storage is on hooks on the long side of the room. I couldn't spend any time being comfortable here, but the location to MSG was great. The 2nd floor lounge and restaurants were uppity, but they went out of their way to make kid food for my children. It is way smaller than you think it is, your Marriott status means NOTHING, people are friendly and the technology that runs the place works well, once you get the hang of it. I would stay for a night, maybe 2, but anymore would be maddening. Again, really not sure what to make of my stay. Definitely wouldn't call it a home away from home for an extended trip.Not awful at all though, mostly because of the attentiveness of the staffThey did give me my 4pm checkout though, that was the one Platinum perk i was afforded.

Cool vibe. The rooms are SMALL. Be aware. It's really only big enough for 1 person and seems like a dorm room. The bed is EXTREMELY comfortable. It doesn't seem like a hotel room and I normally have a hard time sleeping in hotel rooms so it made it easier to sleep. Cool smart TV in the room that you can sync. The shower is also cool. You get coins for free drinks. Free entry into the club at the top of the hotel. The seafood restaurant inside is amazing! I'd recommend staying here if you will not be in the room very much.

Absolutely phenomenal service - I can't wait to go back! All the people in the lobby were so kind and helpful. The food was excellent and the rooms were spacious (the shower even better!) I can't wait to go back!

Myself and my partner stayed here over New Year’s Eve. We absolutely loved it. The location is amazing, literally 3 minutes walk to Macy’s, close to all of the 5th Avenue shops, Broadway, bus station and tourist attractions. The hotel itself is really modern, I loved the free hot chocolate cart and sweet carts they had in the lobby! They also have games, and fussball table by the bar. We went to the NYE party at the rooftop bar and that was also really good. The staff were really helpful, a really nice lady upgraded us on check in, and all other staff were really helpful with directions and advise. We were on floor 10 and didn’t have any noise from the bars or restaurants. Room was a good size for a couple and the shower was amazing! Loved the tables and chairs that were hung up on the peg boards so didn’t take up floor space when you weren’t using them. We had an amazing stay, I really don’t understand negative reviews about this place, we absolutely loved it and would 100% stay here when we come back to New York.

This is really a rating TripAdvisor is missing: Good. The Moxy is not excellent and not very good either it is just good. Above average, but since I am not given the option to rate it good...The Moxy was our choice for our New Year holiday as it is a bit away from the hum drum of Times Square but still well located - next to the Empire and Macy’s etc. Also the price was reasonable for our 9 nights stay. We chose a suite room to have more space. The Moxy presents itself in industrial style chic with metal and wood furnishings. The check-in is DIY - i.e. you check yourself in. Quick and without problems. Staff is on hand in case you do have issues. They have 4 elevators which operate on a program - common issue in high rise hotel buildings, at peak times you wait 5 minutes for your elevator. In the Moxy this was fairly swift. Unlike other hotels where you swipe the hotel-card in the lift, you choose outside on a screen the floor you want to go, the system then asks you to swipe your key card (if it is a room floor) and assigns the lift. Most of the time that actually works. Though New Year’s night they experienced some serious hick-ups and the following day the system erased our floor half way through and we had to get off and re-enter our destination.Our room was a large corner room of around 25-30sqm. From what I have seen the standard rooms are very small. We realized a bit later that from the 17th floor corner room we had unobstructed view on the Empire State Building. For anybody who likes to arrive and immediately arrange their clothes in a closet - you won’t find one. Everything needs to be hung on hooks alongside the wall which depending on the length of your stay might not be enough to hold all of your stuff. Did not bother us we live out of our suitcases.The bed was not the most comfy I ever slept in but ok. To each side were the two most important USB plugs which should be standard in hotels nowadays. They also scored well on my fluffy-white-towel-scale. I hate when hotels give you towels that could pass for dish rags. The bathroom is surprisingly large. At first I was worried about the wet-room style bath where you have no shower separation, but actually it worked well and did not result in major flooding.What was really missing was another mirror outside the bath. There was a second sink without any apparent use why not hang a mirror above? A second bin would be nice too. The worst was the sliding bathroom door. At times impossible to open. The door was super heavy and the handle, if you can call it that gave you so little hold that it was a struggle every time to roll it open. Also the cover in front of the very noisy A/C came off and hung precariously on one broken hinge. On two occasions we returned from a day out well after 4pm to find our room still unmade. Also, being on the 17th floor we found ourselves under the largest roof top bar of NYC, but of course that had a big impact on noise. Sure, complaining about noise in New York is like complaining about sand on the beach. But when the noise gets beyond the capabilities of your earplugs - since we came prepared - then we are talking serious noise. We ended up using our noise cancelling head phones most nights. Admittedly there were more parties around New Year’s eve so a higher than normal noise level was to be expected. I assume during any other time it will be less loud.They do have a bar and apparently outstanding restaurant on 2nd floor. My girlfriend said she had been to the Seafood restaurant previously and confirmed it was very good. The bar is friendly, provides fun seating and games. They also serve food and breakfast fare. There is a egg head downstairs for take-away breakfast (a DD is just next door as well). And then there is the famous roof top bar. We heard it was the largest in NYC with a sort of fun adult theme. One evening after new year we decided to go there with friends. They make a big hu-ha about it, black light activated stamp that is checked some three times between getting on the lift and off the lift on the 18th floor. Then - probably due to the weather - the space was only indoor and so crammed and small, loud and overrun with not our type of crowd, we went straight back down to the Moxy Bar, sat in the squishy old leather arm chairs and had cocktails there. I genuinely did not see the hype of the Magic Hour Roof Top bar.So overall, it gives you a well located place to stay, away from the hustle and bustle of Times Square but still close enough, for a decent price. In my opinion it is a good place but I am not sure if I would return.

First time outside Europe. We had some trouble with the travel agent who got bankrupt A few weeks for departure). So didn’t know What to expect. Stress! But is was Amazing! So Hip Trendy, friendly, kind, helpful staff. Little things at the check-in like pink poncho on A rainy day, Candy, free coffee, and much more. They even printed my boarding tickets! I am a fan. Like Arnold Schwarzenegger once said “i’ll be back”

There are many great things about the Moxy Times Square and in all but one aspect it was great. But unfortunately the hotel overcharged us. On checkout, they did not use the existing authorisations on my card, but created new ones. I’ve raised this with them, they assure me the previous debits on my card will be reversed, but a week after checkout I’m still waiting for nearly $1000 to be recredited. I’m very disappointed. Beware!
