This hotel is in a very good location for Manhattan or Times Square. There is very little assistance available to use a computer if you don't have one. Our room was very small but we made the best of it. I would chose a different area than Manhattan for future trips. A lot of nice bar and club activity if you travel with the right folks who would party.

The moxy has the best design. Vintage office rooms, great roof top bar, barber shop ,?great regular bar, seafood restaurant gym and even candy in the lobby. If you like functional and trendy this is the place. Rooms are small but functionally designed . This is best for solo or young business travelers

I had the opportunity to stay in two hotels in New York . I definitely loved Moxy more (my first hotel was the New Yorker ; which was ok , but I really enjoyed staying at Moxy). It has nice and clean rooms , they are small but with everything you need. The room included hairdryer and a vapor iron . They gave me one free breakfast and offered a free drink at their bar . It was a very nice stay .

We enjoyed our stay. Very clean. We stayed in a king suite. Some days we left the room after 12:00pm and returned to still have our room cleaned to our surprised. The magic hour staff was very nice on the rooftop bar on the 18th floor that could be reached from the 2nd floor of the hotel or you can use the outside entrance from the outside. You can slightly hear the magic hour club in our room. If you want a quieter room, get your room on 11 or 12. The hotel is centrally located from penn station and Macy’s. We loved our stay.

Okay, you’re in the centre of New York, obviously you’re going to hear the traffic, however the booming, kidney massage thudding noise from the hotel nightclub is horrendous. Finishes at 4.00am...... the rooms aren’t small, they’re minute! Bathroom is something out of a 1930s utility advertisement. Don’t go to this hotel. If you want a decent sleep in a normal size room. Look elsewhere.

Great value! Perfect location. Central and very close to subway. Experience was very pleasant. Ambience in the hotel very comfortable and modern. Loved the scent. :-) Staff were very helpful and accomodating.

Trendy, cute, boutique hotel. Great location and friendly staff. Rooms are clean and up to date. The rooms are a little on the small side, but they make the space work with innovative decor. The bar and loung on the 2nd floor was a great place to hang out for a drink!

The location of the hotel is perfect, near all the tourist views. The hotel staff is very friendly and helpful. The breakfast is delicious and a good start for a long day of visiting the city. The rooms are not big but very clean and have a modern look.

I'm definitely way to old to stay at this kind of hotel !im Platinum spg but im still waiting for my suite upgrade...lolawfull small room, tiny bathroom but nice showera table and a chair are on the wallno viewsstupid system for the elevatordefinitely didn't like !!!!

Did not want to leave. Loved every single thing about the Moxy. Can't wait to come back . So clean and friendly, funky hotel. Breakfast was great too. Great location. Rooms are small but so practical. Lots of hooks for storage. Didnt find the size a problem at all. Fresh water bottles each day. Showers are the best of any hotel I've travelled to. Cannot fault moxy at all

Very cool hotel, everything you need in a hotel and more. The rooms are small. but well laid out with all the amenities. Great location, staff is helpful, free glass of Prosecco is offered to you when you want it. It really as great value, convenient and clean!

Lovely modern hotel, great vibe in reception. Centrally located for Times Square, train stations, restaurants, shops and attractions such as Madison Square Gardens, Empire State, Rockefeller Centre, Broadway, etc. Lovely modern room, even though ours was slightly on the small side compared to ones we’ve stayed at before. Lovely friendly reception staff. Would definitely stay in this hotel again.

The Moxy was hard to rate as I truly wanted to give a better rating. First off the location was great and was only a few blocks from Time square and Macys. Immediately upon walking through the front door, we witnessed an edgy but relaxing vibe atmosphere coupled with the perfumed air (smelt throughout the hotel) created a true wow moment. The staff was more than accommodating and we were able to check in rather quickly. The aesthetics throughout the hotel were very cool and updated, offering a very trendy look. We traveled with both of my kids and it was only for 2 nights. When entering the room, everything was spotless and the theme of the hotel offered up a unique look. We had one queen bed and a loft that was equipped with a bean bag chair and mattress. The bathroom was big for the space and offered a walk in shower that was equipped with rain fixtures and the pressure offered a great experience (didn't want to get out). We must have cracked our head on the bunk beds half a dozen times and always seemed to be in someone way. The bed was comfortable but you felt as if you were sleeping in a vault. I would say this location would be perfect for 2 ppl but would seriously reconsider anything more than that.

My husband and I chose the moxy times square for a special trip for his 30th birthday so we would centrally located. Location is great but that's pretty much where the plus points stop. I emailed the moxy prior to our visit and explained about my husband's birthday and was told they would "put a note" on the booking to make sure they made it extra special. That didn't happen as you don't even check in with a real human, just self check in and create a room key yourself. We booked a king room for 4 nights, we expected it to be a bit small which is why we treated ourselves and paid more to get a king room but it was still tiny. The bed took up most of the room and only hooks to keep clothes on. Nicely styled but not practical for people with a suitcase or staying more than a night or two. The noise from the roof top bar was beyond ridiculous. I was looking forward to a nice chilled roof top bar to enjoy the views but this is a roof top nightclub which doesn't close until 4am some nights. You also can't just "go up" to the bar if you are a hotel guest, you have to leave the building, go around the corner, get ID'd by a bouncer, get a stamp on your hand, go back in another door, show your stamp to about 5 different people, go up in the lift, show your stamp again and then you're let in. Only to discover you can't have a conversation because it's so loud and so busy that we couldn't be bothered to wait to order a drink. We turned around and left. We called reception to ask to move but were advised there was nothing available until the next night. We barely slept which was horrible after a long journey from the UK. This was made worse by the very noisy AC unit. Ive never knowm anuthing like it! There are also no tea or coffee making facilities available in the room which would be nice after a day our sight seeing.We dealt with a manager called Mike the next day who moved us to the third floor but this was also extremely loud (although neither ourselves or Mike could figure out where the noise was coming from!). He then found another room for us which was much quieter but it was a queen room as there where no quiet king rooms free. This meant moving our things twice and this was happening around midnight. Ww were shattered and wanted nothing more than a quiet place to sleep. Our room then wasn't cleaned and no fresh towels dropped off and we had to call to get some brought to us. When the time came to check out, we asked to speak to a manager. Mike wasn't available so another manager came out and told us he was busy and about to go to a meeting...!! Unhelpful and rude. We described our stay and explained Mike had been very helpful in trying to make our stay better but that fact is we paid for a King size room and ended up staying in a queen. Overall, this hotel is clearly for people in their early twenties or maybe party animals. I wouldn't recommend it as a place to stay if this doesn't describe you or if you want a friendly, warm experience from staff. Staff could be much friendlier and much more helpful, they just look at you like you're an inconvenience to them.

LOCATION excellent. size of room terrible. arrived with 2 suitcases but nowhere to put them, no wardrobe, no room at all. had to sit on the toilet to put shoes on, nowhere to hang clothes, just some crude nail like hangers on the wall and 3 clothes hangers. the bed is tiny but very comfortable. it is JUST the ridiculous size of the room that REALLY let us down, had to pile suitcases on top of each other and try to pull clothes out with nowhere to put them after. we asked for clean towels for 3 days running but never got them and gave up waiting v good breakfast

Are you headed to Madison Square Garden? Choose Moxy 485 7th Ave. Fun times are in store upstairs in the adjacent rooftop bar. Room stays will get you in the club with a quick flash of the key card to the door man. Cocktails are fancy and priced to sip not guzzle. Good idea to catch a buzz before arrival so not to spend what one's accountant may label both dangerous & irresponsible. The bartenders do not accept room charges. Hipster blind barber will shape up your beard if you need to clean up before a night on the town located next to registration desk. Egghead will bring you breakfast in the morning to help prevent hangovers as long as you place the order card on the doorknob before 3:30am. Self serving ice cream machine will dispense soft serve with sprinkles if deserved. (Only winners deserve sprinkles) Basically, relax the Moxy is a good time. Stay well.
user_name:
Bryan D
Charlotte, North Carolina, United States

review_body: The hotel is located right in the heart of Time Square. It has easy access to everything you need. The stuff is very kind and helpful. The rooms are a bit small but in the winter it felt super cozy.I’ll definetely come back.

close to Penn station and not too far from theatre dsitrict - this is a loud and energetic property. Food was below average and they wouldn't serve french fries before 5pm....the free prosecco seems like a nice bonus - however the quality of the prosecco is horrible

This hotel is pure beauty; with how the room was decorated and with the way you check in. You can always have fun - you have the bar upstairs, you have a kind of lounge party area on the roof. The drinks are made with love and then you have the great location of where it is. Located in Time Sq, you cant get any better than that. I wanted to live in this place, or at least decorate my apartment around it. Just a small single queen sized mattress room for me and my person. This is the best place to stay in New York.

Hotel is very hip. Service was great. Location is amazing. Rooms are clean but small. Showers are amazing. The food at the bar/restaurant is really good and so are their cocktail drinks. I would stay here again!
user_name:
Traveler21120760925
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: The Moxy Bar on the 2nd floor at hotel Moxy is the site for a pop up Christmas holiday themed bar. As you step off the elevator you are immersed in the Pink Christmas holiday theme with decorations, lights and holiday drinks. We had Pink Christmas Cosmos.
user_name:
LollysLook
New York City, New York

review_body: It is a perfect hotel for people that want a designed hotel with all the needs, and wants to be in the middle of New York for shopping! We were there with the whole family, the rooms are a little small but are very nice. They can be better on the breakfast!

Really stylish and modern hotel with super helpful and accommodating staff. Excellent rooms and comfortable bed. Great vibe in the hotel bar plus nightclub for those wanting it on the roof. Slight noise from bar heard but nothing too serious. Pretty good value for money, even over expensive christmas period

I was visiting from Spain for 4 nights and all of services were excellent. A very good atmosphere and the personal service very kind with me. The rooftop was perfect to find a good moment for relax with new friends.

We checked in on a rainy Thursday using the cool self-service check-in kiosk. First impression - wow - this is a super dynamic place with amenities and people everywhere! It definitely felt like Times Square. The bars and restaurants are (well) run by the TAO group. There is a rooftop club on the top floor so if you get a room on floors 13-17 you’ll probably be bothered by the thumping bass (like we were) late into the night. Otherwise the room was NYC-small (as expected) but cleverly appointed with all the necessary must-haves (except lotion). The elevators were really annoying creating long waits and packed cabs. Overall, this location is walkable from Penn Station and most theaters, it has fun bars and restaurants, and it was clean and comfortable. Oh, and as a Marriott member we received free breakfast and a fun amenity in our room.

Really enjoyed our stay at the Moxie. It is fun and lively but also very comfortable and accommodating. Will be back in the future for sure especially when we need to be around the Times Square in midtown area

To check in and out it’s as simple as putting your name and check out date into a kiosk at the front. It was a simple and easy process and took about two minutes. The hotel is secure as can be, and egghead around the corner is one of the best quick breakky spots. It’s really close to Madison square garden, time square and there is a Macy’s really close by

My room was extremely loud. It sounded like there was a club above my room, and I did not get a lot of sleep. I made several requests before check in that I wanted the quietest room possible. I was in town for the New York Marathon and I believe this affected my performance in what I came to town to do.Other issues:My shower kept flooding the bathroom floor no matter which direction I pointed the shower head and I had to use all my towels but one to soak up the water. There was very low water pressure in the sink. The TV kept turning off on its own. I was unable to skip the line at check in because my phone would not work properly to operate the elevator (I have and iPhone 6S and downloaded the app). So I had to get a key card. There was also a lot of street noise. I understand its NYC, but it sounded as if the window was left open. I’ve never experienced noise level inside of an NYC hotel room like that before. I did not get a replacement menu after ordering morning breakfast on the first day. Housekeeping did not visit my room one of the days to replace all my wet towels, make the bed, or take away trash. I made sure I did not turn on the do not disturb light. The bedding felt wet the first night as if it was not completely dried after cleaning. I did not get my scheduled wake-up call the day of check out and almost missed my scheduled ride to the airport.I don’t know if this is a typical experience at Moxy, the noise level probably is, so I would not recommend staying here to anyone. The experience certainly did not live up to the Marriot name, especially for the inflated price during marathon weekend. I also contacted the hotel and Marriott corporate before leaving this review and they did not seem to care. They basically said “sorry you had a bad experience, come try again”. I would never return to this hotel, even if they paid for my stay.

Great location, room small but very clean. The staff of the restaurant was incredibly kind and always with a smile.Very disappointed with the reception, impersonal staff attention!!! After a long 10 hour journey we wanted a warm welcoming but was totally the opposite. We had to do the check in alone without any help. Except the reception everything was perfect. Totally recommended.

We stayed 7 nights at this hotel. Check in and check out was easy and quick. Here are the pros and cons: Pros: -very close to key attractions and Penn Station and Herald Square and Times Square -room was compact with clever storage (still a small room though) -good vibes and lighting -never once did we need to wait for an elevator -bed was okay Cons: -pillows were very basic and even the foam pillows requested weren’t good-small room, little space for suitcases-no fridge or kettle -toilet gets stuck easily -noise level on weekends made it difficult to sleep

We really can recommend this hotel. Great staff, clean rooms and a perfect Location to explore New York City. And the Fragrance they dispense in the Hotel Lobby is awesome :-) . We didn´t take the Breakfast but we got told, it has to be very good. So , we´ll back soon .

Really great hotel with super friendly front of the house staff. Check in/out was a breeze. The location is great. Parking is right next door. Easy to navigate. Kids loved the bunk beds. Food/drink were great for the price of room.

We arrived in the very early hours of the morning and were allocated a room on 17th floor, what a nightmare bomping music from roof top bar, husband went straight down to see if room could be changed and we were told we had to wait until the morning. Room was minute, bed pushed up against wall and husband had to climb over me to get to the bathroom in the night. No wardrobes, a.c. unit made a racket all night. After a few hours it was morning and reception had a room that would be ready for us later in the day so out cases were left in the baggage room. Later in the afternoon we were told that a room on the lower floor was available asked if you could walk round the bed and she said no so managed to find us a disabled room which was much larger although still no wardrobe. Rooms very fairly basic with no tea or coffee facilities but could get bottles of water from reception. When we checked out 6 days later there had been no extra charge for the room change, thank you to the reception team. Feel this hotel is more suited to the younger clientele, not 50+

I stayed at the Moxy NYC Time Square in September for a business trip that coincided with Fashion Week and therefore limited the number of business traveler-friendly hotels available. I found my stay there to be pleasurable with exceptionally clean rooms and very friendly staff. Still, it would have been great to have more traditional furniture. The rooms basically all just have fold up furniture. Also, it was suboptimal to not have room service.

The Moxy is very central and makes it very easy to see New York in limited time. The check in process was extremely easy and the lobby has a great vibe on arrival. The rooms are clean and a good size and the decor is nice.

Great location just off 7th Avenue, next block from Macy’s department store. 5 minutes from Penn Station and 10 minute walk to Times Square. Hotel has great amenities although the rooms are small, it is Manhattan though so large rooms are hard to come by. Can be noisy as just off a busy road but NYC is never quiet!

I understand. You spent REALLY big bucks for those Hamilton tickets, but this is the single best shower you have ever experienced. It’s steamy hot and the water pressure is waterfall wide and superb. What to do, what to do? Hey, maybe they have some kind of late seating or something. Good choice. Enjoy!

room decor was thoughtful and clean. A+ for the bathroom and shower! moxy bar was crowded with a mix of travelers and bridge/tunnel folk. great value for location and services. check in/out was not as smooth as it could be as both times the kiosks didn't help and I needed a manager to assist.

Highly recommend this hotel! Staff and service is incredible, rooms are awesome and the location is perfect. Not too much noise from the streets, and a 5 min walk to Times Square. The foods also amazing, breakfast granola is the best granola I’ve had and the pizza and fries are delicious! Highly recommend the hotel and also get breakfast included! We came from London for three nights, perfect for young couples. Proper buzz about the hotel, trendy, all around perfect trip away and could not fault it.

Great location! One block from Macy’s and 5 minute walk to Times Square. Easy access to subway, Path trains and Penn Station. Funky lively hotel with great amenities. Room was on the small side but it is Manhattan!

Moxy hotel is far too small for a couple travelling from the UK, yes I understand the rooms are going to be small in NYC but this was beyond ridiculous. I actually questioned the fact is this a hotel or is this a hostel! I complained about the room as travelling with two large suitcases filled the room, in which there are no wardrobes - only hooks around the room! The staff I found very unfriendly and rude, almost as though we were a pain to them, we got messed around with our room situation and then was told we had to pay an additional fee to move rooms, which we went along with. To find the next room equally as small just the bed an inch bigger!!! To get to the bathroom we had to make a walk way in the night with our cases, then waking up move the cases around to get out of the room!!! Not to mention the fact ear plugs get left my the side of your bed because of the volume of noise from the bars. Not something that is appreciated after a long day exploring NYC. Highly disappointed with my stay, felt very unwelcome by staff and shall not be returning to a Marriott group.

I'm in a lot of Marriotts. This was cool. Neat vibe. Good location for my needs. Great service and surroundings. Same great Marriott bed and famous feather pillows (foam for everyone else if you want it). I enjoyed this unique brand in the Marriott lineup.

Yes don’t expect status do do anything for you here but get you points and some free drinks. I love this hotel for business travel bec it is easy very self service. Very much a european hotel rooms are small but efficient and the price is perfect. The bunk bed rooms look cool but I have never been in one. If you don’t like IKEA or ikea laid out rooms don’t stay here. If you want over the top luxury don’t stay here but if you want a safe clean room that is very easy this place is great. I also like there is no rug just hard wood floors

Rooms are really small, nicely put together though and who cares? You won't stay in your room anyway. If you want something quiet and spacious, don't go here. If you want to have fun, please do. It's nice, new, has a good bar and restaurant and a great rooftop. And the location next to Times Square, Penn Station and Broadway is the best.

Stayed couple of nights for pleasure after business trip. Experience marriott traveler with all brands. Here’s my summary Pros Not much I can think of. Location. Cons and worse: Rooms like a jail cell. Tiny. Confining. Claustrophobic. Not practical. Not functional. Ha ha value and cutesie industrial boutique fades real fast. Twenty somethings who like hostels and believe a room is a room may find it perfect. Check in process horrible and absolutely chaotic, confusing and platinum status meaningless to staff. It’s 4 pm with no exceptions even though I exchanged texts at 1 pm and they confirmed room near elevator that was supposedly a nicer king. Can’t imagine what the lesser room was. Breakfast option at hotel small tiny menu and service poor. Hard to get server attention. Bar at night obnoxiously pounding club music and bar staff barely cracked a smile. Awful service. Legasea food ok but seats at bar could not be more uncomfortable. Made for tiny people and commoditized to maximize seats. Underwhelming place. Roof top bar a 21 to 40 year old club. 5 deep at bar, conversation impossible. Demographic very evident. In short, the world is diverse. Vibrant is great. Unique is great. Vibrant unique practical comfortable and classy are optimal. I get marketing and demographics but get a clue Marriott. Basics are service, comfort, choices (over 40 music perhaps ?!) and did I say service ??Finally At these type Marriott properties (similar to vegas ) platinum status (I’m few dollars from ambassador) has no special attention or value. Bad.

You may read other reviews that complain about the lack of tea making facilities wardrobes etc, let’s put that in perspective you have chosen to go to NYC - your not really going to be in the room an awful lot..... The rooms are kept very clean and the beds are very comfortable the bars are great and the location is absolutely superb.

The Moxy is a clean hotel but it is not worth the money that it charges. The rooms are very small, there is no where to put your suitcases or clothes so space is limited. But the rooms are clean and fresh. The best part is the shower. The shower is fantastic and thee best shower in all the hotels I’ve stopped at coming to America. I recommend not going to reception for anything as these are simply check in and check out desks. There is no room service either. There is no iron or ironing board in the rooms or any tea/coffee making facilities. The bed was comfortable. Overall the stay was pleasant.

We stayed at the Moxy for 6 nights and it was fantastic. The staff is extremely helpful and friendly, especially the manager Christian. We loved the concept of common areas and a room that is very reasonably priced yet functional. The bed was very comfortable and the rain shower was wonderful! I loved the vintage look yet everything is new. We LOVED this place and we will be back!!!

Stayed here in a single room, definitely different. Love the concept, from the moment you enter it feels like coming into lively party atmosphere. At check in where people are playing Jenga and other games while waiting for service. The standered rooms are smaller then usual, yet it is compensated with furniture and layout that makes it feel much larger. If you are not concerned about spending much time in the room itself it's perfect having all the modern essentials. The shower is great! I have never experienced a rain shower with so much water pressure. The hotel has one of the top hip night clubs on its rooftop, and as a guest you get priority entry from inside the hotel instead of waiting outside in the cold. There is also a separate bar lounge where we were served a welcome drink. The vibe here is as if a super upscale hostel and a five star hotel had a baby. Would comeback again, this place is great for a couple days stay it is not an extended stay.

This hotel was a hidden gem in NYC And I would highly recommend it to anyone. It had every service presented in a hip,efficient manner. I live nearby and will definitely come back. The room was out of bounds cool - the bunkbeds so clever, efficient & comfy. Excellent service too.

We had a fab time in NYC the hotel we stayed in made it as well. Big thank you to all the staff but especially Ashley and Turheen thanks guys well done Top. Thank You would highly reccomend this hotel fantastic.xx

Stayed here for 3 nights this wknd and can’t say a bad word about it. It’s very quirky and modern. Love the rooftop terrace. The club was great! Hotel was very clean. The Moxy bar was nice. Never visited the restaurant but heard good things. The room we stayed in was very small. But again was very clean, modern. The shower was amazing. It’s not like we spent any time in our room as was so much to see and do in New York so being small didn’t bother us one bit. The beds were soooooo comfy. They supply you with ear plugs as of a night u can hear the muffled sound of the night club. But I had no problem sleeping at all. The hotel is smack bang in the perfect location. Time square where it all happens. Empire State Building is around the corner. So is Maddison square gardens, Bryant park, etc etc etc. Brilliant location and when we return hopefully in the near future I will be staying here!!!

The greeting was very warm, inviting and friendly. The lobby had a great energy filled with color, information on things to do and warmth at the same time.The manager on Duty, Holly, had a great smile and was very helpful and knowledgeable about the hotel and area. A great assetThe room set up is very cool. Everything you need and done very well & chic.The only little thing was that the bar staff could have had a bit more urgency about them

Friendly staff, very clean rooms, great value. We have stayed here several times and the hotel is really consistent. The location is great, albeit busy, if you are in town for a show. The bar/restaurant is very nice as well.

For the rates they charge this is a very poor deal. For this type of aesthetic done much much better head to either of the Arlo hotels. Rooms here are dark with limited windows as it was an old building that was converted. The Arlo’s In contrast were purpose built and have wall to wall windows. Bed was fine. Gym was below average, small with limited equipment and weights. Shower was excellent but the sink’s water pressure was almost nonexistent. Bars and restaurant were all good scenes, would be back for those but wouldn’t stay here again.

Excellent Service! Steven at the front desk helped us with our late night check in. He went over and above his responsibilities. Recommended great places to eat and always welcomed us when we would see him in the Lobby. The staff was all around great! Would definitely stay at this property again because of the fantastic service.

I was extremely disappointed with Moxy. The rooms were very small and many things not working. The first room we were put in was right below the rooftop bar, so very very loud (I am very shocked that this room is even offered) and the next room we were moved to was a bunkbed room which was far from ideal. In the bunkbed room, the heater was so loud (loud fan) that it was impossible to sleep with it on, the shelf for phone next to the bed was broken so couldn't put a phone there, the toilet kept blocking leading to having to call for maintenance, the sink was also quite blocked as water going down was extremely slow. In addition, the extra cost pre-paid for breakfast was not worth it - very small choice with additional cost for a number of items that I would consider normal in a 4* hotel (e.g. cappuccino, juice etc). In addition, the majority of staff were friendly, however in the breakfast area they were very slow.I spend a minimum or 3-4 nights per week in hotels due to work travel each week (and have been doing this for a number of weeks) and this was one of the worst hotel experiences I have had in a long time. It was also HUGELY EXPENSIVE for what is offered. It is all about the "look" but with no substance and actual comfort. The only thing this hotel has going for it is location. All in all, I was extremely disappointed and will not be recommending or staying again.

Cute hotel. Small but well designed. It works. There is a very slow egg sandwich place attached to the building. The water pressure is good. They didn’t give me a late check-out as requested. Overall this place is well located and not gross.

I love the look and feel of this hotel. I am a big Starwood property fan. It's a great hotel. The hotel features a rooftop nightclub. The pounding beat from the club might upset some people. The hotel supplies earplugs--but they do not suffice. It's a great hotel--great location, great staff. The hotel is clean and modern.

The Moxy has a number of up to date features like self check-in and the Chromecast to connect to the TV. The room is nice to look at but lacked some of the basics. The biggest issue is simply the size of the room. For $500 a night, you should be able to walk to the other side of the bed without walking on the bed. My expectations may be too high but I also appreciate a coffee maker in the room and lotion in addition to shampoo and conditioner. If you are just staying one night, its kinda fun but if you want a comfortable room to sleep in and the features of a typical Marriott hotel, don't stay here.

What comes with a young, lively and happening hotel in midtown is a lot of noise. Try to never stay on the 3rd floor like I did, it happens to be right above one of the bars on the 2nd floor. Very loud. a coworker also says Don't stay too high because that is under the roof top bar.

I have stayed at this hotel twice and had two more upcoming reservations that I just cancelled. My first stay was fine. I booked a suite and got one that was well decorated and had fun accents like a record player, board games, plants and more. The hotel tries way too hard to be trendy and is loud. The bed was not comfortable but I thought the suite was fun and decided to go back.When you arrived you're greeted by a staff that stands around more interested in chatting with each other than helping guests. They are behind mini desks and it's confusing as to where you should go.I arrived after 11 PM and was told that they did not have my suite (not an upgrade but one that I had paid). The check in clerk typed for a while and then said he could give me a room. I asked for a manager and when one finally came, he found me a suite after extensive typing. No apology for the wait and no answer as to what happened.I went to the suite and it was pretty poor. No decor whatsoever. Everything that I liked about the first one was missing. It was stripped of almost everything and not fully cleaned.When I checked out, I asked for the GM's card. No one had it. I am a Lifetime Platinum member of Marriott Rewards with an Ambassador for staying over 100 nights a year. I called my ambassador to ask for help in contacting the GM as I had two more stays booked. She tried to get in touch with him for a week and was ignored. It's clear that he does not care and if he can't answer an employee from Marriott, he is not going to answer a guest. As mentioned, I cancelled my two other reservations.If you want to feel cool and trendy by hanging out in the lobby, stay here. If you're looking for an overpriced hostel, stay here. I will not be returning.

Great location, bed & shower. Super clean. Bed is poorly placed, far too close to the window, which leads to a freezing cold sleep. Please make it clearer that rooms are without wardrobes, hanging wall may seem a good idea, but clothes will end up covered in all dust, odours & any cleaning sprays used by your hard working cleaners. Also means living out of a suitcase, like a hostel. Please don’t offer a free proseco at your bar, then hand out something that resembles paint stripper, I get that all your trying to do is get the guests in your bar, to then charge well over the odds for drinks. Tip for future guests... nip to Brendan’s on 35th Street... half the price & just as good.

I was very pleasantly surprised by every aspect of this hotel! I love how it is designed, up-to-date, clean, staff is friendly, and the rooms were great! There is literally nothing that Moxy could to do to improve. It is my new favorite hotel that I will be using on every trip up to NYC!

I paid $350 for a room that was the width of a king size bed, a bed that was surrounded on 3 sides by wall. The view from the room, all windows, was a brick wall about 4 feet away. It's new, it's clean, great location...but if you are spending more than a couple of nights, it's depressing. Not suitable for business travelers as there is no desk except for a tiny table (about 2ft x 2ft). No extra chair, the only amenities are shampoo and soap in a big dispenser that you cannot take away as a souvenir.I had 2 shirts laundered for $13 a piece. When they did not show up in room at the end of the day, I asked reception. Their reply: this is a "self-service" hotel, you must go to the basement and pick them up yourself. This "self-service" is nothing more than "no-service".No room service, no mini bar. You want ice and a glass for a drink, you go down to the restaurant and ask the bartender and you will be given "one" glass with ice.I will not be going back...ever!

This is easily the worst hotel that i paid $700 bucks for 2 night stay. Real clumsy rooms with queen bed barely big enough to be called a queen. The bed is placed right next to the AC vent so u feel the cold air on your face all the time. The walls are very thin and its so noisy that you will wake up everytime someone walks in the corridor or uses the restroom next door. It feels like you are in some kind of hostel accommodation. Stay away unless u r getting a room for less than 100 bucks, otherwise u ll feel miserable throughout ur stay. This is my worst experience having stayed at several similarly priced hotels near the Madison Square Garden.

Just returned from a 4 night stay here at the Moxy and I have to say we absolutely loved it and really enjoyed ourselves. The hotel is a trendy boutique style hotel set right in the heart of the city and within walking distance of its top attractions. We were a group of 4 Adults and we stayed in room 1538 which was one of the quad bunk rooms. I was a bit anxious upon booking it that the room wasn't going to work for us and that it wouldn't have enough room to swing a cat but I was pleasantly surprised. The rooms are small and compact but still of a good standard. The room was clean, the beds were super comfy and the shower was amazing. We didn't have any issues with noise from the rooftop bar but that may well be because its not as busy as it is in the summer. The staff were all really polite and helpful and we'd definitely stay here again. :)

This hotel is perfectly situated - just a few steps away from Times Square. The interior is chic and modern. Super roof-top terrace and good restaurants. Very trendy and stylish in every possible way.The rooms are a bit on the small side, but with all the amenities you need. I was positively surprised, having read reviews that indicated otherwise. Also very handy storing facilities along the wall. I really liked bot the decor, the room and the bathroom - so - why only 3 stars from me?Suddenly I saw the earplugs on the nightstand. When they are not upon request, but placed there for you to use - that is NOT a good sign. And - of course - they were placed there for a reason....The combination of street noise, roof-top DJ noise and A/C noise made it impossible to sleep. Spent 3 nights here with zero sleep. Walked the streets of New York as a zombie, and deeply regretted my choice of hotel.So - if you stay at this hotel it is crucial that you get a room facing the inner courtyard.

The positive reviews must be from people who booked the hotel at $99. DO NOT STAY HERE. Unless you enjoy jail cell inspired aesthetics, horrible composition and customer service. They have disguised themselves as 'millennial' trendy as a way to cut costs.

Moxy is a very trendy hotel in the heart of New York City.. Rooms were well maintained even though a bit small but everything you want in a room was available.. I would say a Compact hotel.. Breakfast in the bar was very good.. would recommend if u wanna stay near to Times Square..!!

Lovely modern hotel in a very central location but our room was unbelievably small! The bed would not suit anybody over 6ft as there is a TV and speaker at the end of the bed which takes up foot space. Bathroom was almost the same size as the bedroom, which was a little unnecessary, space could be made better use of! Shower wasn't closed off correctly meaning the bathroom would be covered in water when one of us was in there.There isn't enough storage and the aircon made a horrifically loud noise throughout the night waking us up practically on the hour, every hour. On checkout, we asked to store or luggage - 5 pieces in total and were given one tag. We informed the member of staff looking after the storage room that we were collecting two pieces of luggage to start with and would return later that day to collect the remaining pieces. The staff member took the tag off us and said no problem but when my partner returned later that day to collect the other pieces of luggage, the guy would not give them to him as he had no tag however this was taken off us when we first collected. We then had to wait until we could get access to another piece of our luggage to find the code that the luggage was labelled under before he would give us them. Terrible experience and just caused unnecessary stress! On check in we were given two drinks tokens to enjoy a drink at the bar/ When redeeming these we were given flat prosecco. When querying this with the bar staff, I was told that because it was free, it was free, it was flat. My advice would be if you're going to offer complimentary drinks - at least offer something worthwhile rather than the cheapest option, it's not worth the gesture otherwise!Nice hotel, terribly planned out rooms and poor use of available space.

We had an excellent room with view of the Empire State Building. The room was clean and big enough for one couple. All important Sightseeing Points was Closer by Moxy. I will always book again at MOXY, when i am in NYC.

Wow, what a brilliant hotel! In the heart of Times Square with a short walk to Macy’s, this hotel really is brilliant! The staff were friendly and nothing was too much trouble, the hotel is very clean, the rooms and quirky and have everything you could need for a quick trip to NYC... including super fast WiFi! The vibe is very trendy and relaxed too, the Moxy Bar was a fave of ours! My husband and I will definitely return again.Thanks for a brilliant stay Moxy!

Stayed here for a week with my partner I contacted the hotel as I wanted to propose to my girlfriend in the hotel room so I got in contact with the hotel. A women called miranda dealt with me and took care of everything can't thank her and her team enough they did so much for us and made us feel so welcome. It's a thanks giving myself and my now fiance will never forgot.The MOXY is in an excellent location and very modern inside.

Marketed for young folks, but works for all. This hip new hotel near Times Square was so much fun for me and 2 friends (all older than target crowd). Check in was easy. Staff was helpful. 2nd floor bar was outstanding with lots of seating/chatting options. Rooms were small, but modern & comfortable. We went to bar crawl the city & mainly needed sleeping quarters. But this is so much more. What a hidden gem!

Very modern hotel. Arrived to find several booking in desks with happy and very welcoming staff. Free glass of bubbly hit the spot after travelling! Our room was a single double bed and we booked a twin, they changed our room immediately with no hassle. We ended up with one double bed and a bunk bed...novel idea and fun. Bathroom was private with shower and toilet, sink was in the bedroom not so private to brush your teeth, you have to be comfortable with the person your sharing with! Warm and comfortable. Not a huge amount of space in the room but we managed. Breakfast included, not a great choice of food. It was cold every day and the portions were huge.the seats were not very comfortable in the bar area.The location is suburb!!! 10 minute walk to the main square and round the corner from Macy's. When we checked out we were able to leave our suitcases in a secure area for the day and they booked a car to take us to the airport as they said it was safer cost of $71.00. Wonderful stay. Definitely recommend and would return.

Just returned from a 5 night stay at the Moxy. The hotel suited our needs perfectly. We knew the rooms would be small but even though they are tiny we felt compfortable even as a family of 4. There is storage under the beds to unpack and hooks lining all the walls. We had no issues with noise during any part of our stay. Location can't be beat. The lounge on the second floor was a great spot for getting out of the room.

Stayed two nights at Moxy Times Square and was a solid overall stay. Room (1 queen bed), as they are in NY, ran small but being there solo it was plenty of room. Some amenities (irons, extra pillows, towels, toiletries) are found on your floor in a closet called The Stash as a FYI. Housekeeping can bring items not in the stash closet. Front desk were friendly and always seemed to be with a guest. Helpful when asked upon which is appreciated. Used check in via the app, so didn’t check in through the front desk. Hotel is 5-7 blocks from Times Square and 3-4 blocks from Penn Station, so a great location (albeit lots of car and people traffic). Will stay again when back in NY.

My husband and 2 daughters (9 and 13) stayed over Thanksgiving weekend and loved everything about this hotel. The check-in was casual but quick and expertly handled. We loved the vibe of the place. The girls loved the bunk beds and we were surprised how comfortable they were! The pegs were perfect for hanging clothes, jackets and the many bags of gifts we bought on Black Friday! And the shower was AWESOME! Great use of space and the 2nd floor lounge area was fun and inviting. The girls loved the ice cream machine and friendliness of the hotel. We walked everywhere from the Moxy. Just a great overall experience and we'll be back for sure!

We stayed at the Moxy for six nights and loved EVERY minute of it. The location is central to everything. The reception with its individual desks were great and the staff were super helpful and friendly- nothing was too much trouble. Fabulous smell as you walked through the revolving doors in to the funky reception. I am disabled and had mentioned this when booking and our room was superb. Lots of room to move about. Grab rails in the wet room and a pull down seat in the shower - which was lovely and hot with good pressure. Super toiletries supplied (Muk) which I loved so much I googled to see if I could purchase in UK. Room was cleaned every day if you wanted and a super stash room if you had forgotten anything. Lovely comfy bed (great height) and ingenious storage ideas. Hidden safe which was easy to use and a good size. Absolutely loved the sink. Huge windows (no draught) which overlooked the roof of the cosy bar so you could see people sitting at it. Efficient AC and heating. We were given tokens for a welcoming glass of prosecco in the bar which was a nice gesture. Great choice of spirits and some lovely cocktails. Lovely comfortable seating overlooking the street below. Also a cosy chillout area. Had some lovely nibbles in the evening - smashed cucumber and mac and cheese were delicious. Went to roof top bar twice which was lovely although too cold to go outside. All in all a fabulous stay with fabulous staff.

What a location , short walk less than 5 mins from Penn station ,10 mins Times square.central park, empire state , Madison sq gardens all walk able. Macy's store on the next block.Funnky boutique well run hotel, rooms NYC size but well thought out for the space great bed ,shower good staff very helpful all round . Has a good bar with food also roof top bar.

We enjoyed our stay at Moxy NYC Times Square a lot. It is perfectly located in Midtown und very close to the subway or Times Square. The staff was very nice and helpful. The room was big enough for two friends, clean and well-thought-out. Our view was not nice (brickstones ahead) and the window did not close well so that there was a cold draft. It's not very good for the environment to have to start heating just because the windows is leaky... also the sound from the street comes up louder than it would have if it closed thoroughly. Nevertheless we had a wonderful time in NYC and definitely want to come back to Moxy!

Great decor in this boutique style hotel. Everyone was very accommodating and friendly. The 2nd floor lounge was enjoyable. DJ played classy music. We would definitely come back and highly recommend this hotel!!

Completely unprofessional management and leadership at this location. Had identity theft while in NYC and my credit card company graciously over nighted me a new credit card. Went to the front desk to receive my package that was signed for at 11:32 am and they told me they don’t receive packages that I needed to walk down the block and pick it up at the UPS store down the street. I clearly stated that I was a guest here and didn’t pay toStay at ups and they were responsible for my package if I sent it there. They could care less. When I arrived to UPS there was a 20Minute line causing me to miss my dinner reservation. They couldn’t find my package in the midst of their stacks and stacks of packages, even though it was confirmed delivered at 11:32 am. The hotel staff continued to argue with me that the package wasn’t delivered even though I had a tracking number. They never apologized. The worse was Sampson who continuously was argumentative and rolled his eyes at me several times. He told me he checked with fed ex and it wasn’t delivered, yet it was a ups package. He said there was nobody named Jaysen at ups who signed for the package although it was confirmed by another manager that there was a Jaysen who worked there. All in all the lack of leadership and ability to handle this situation in an apologetic manor was deplorable and could have been remedied with a simple I’m Sorry. I don’t need management to roll their eyes at me because they are inconvenienced when you ask them toDo their job. Secondly as a Marriott fan I can’t believe that they handled this situation this way, in the past I’ve been overwhelmed by the customer service I receive at Marriott properties. Not the case at this location.

First time staying in this style of hotel, was impressed with check in service, room cleanliness and shower facilities. The rooms are smaller on purpose to make get out and explore your environment. The bed was comfortable and the shower pressure excellent. The restaurant and bar area are made to socialise with your fellow travellers and the location next to Macy's and Time Square is perfect for visitors to the big apple, well worth staying here

Just returned from a five night stay at this hotel with a friend. We found the hotel to be quirky fun and a hipster haven! Upon arrival we where quickly greeted and checked in. They have ‘smart elevators which were at first daunting after a long flight but worked really well when we got the hang of it. The rooms are very compact but utilised well, as two girls with a shopping habit the room became crowded but we where up and out everyday not looking to lay around and relax... that’s what spa hotels are for! We went to the rooftop Saturday night which was nice but all covered in which was a bit disappointing but I suppose time of year and weather are a factor. The only thing was that on Sunday night the music was so loud in our room, we where exhausted after a day of exploring so fell asleep but this could prove a problem for others. To sum up we loved this hotel and its vibe found staff to be friendly engaging and courteous and would absolutely return again! Thanks Moxy!

This hotel had a really comfortable and cozy feel to it, very millennial-West Elm - feeling. I loved the decor. There were a few things that weren't great though: Firstly, the shower water never actually got hot, just luke warm, and in 38 degree NYC weather, it was kind of depressing. Secondly, the heater/AC was SUPER loud. They did supply you with earplugs but if you're a light sleeper, that might make a difference to you. I wore the ear plugs but woke up to the AC as I was drifting off to sleep each night. Thirdly, even though my do not disturb light was on, the restaurant in house (Egghead) knocked on my door to deliver breakfast at 8am, even though I did not order it. (I'm from the west coast so 8am was like being woken up at 5am.) Fourthly, the doors to the hallway are really thin. They actually have a frosted glass window in them (which thankfully you can cover with the canvas curtain they provide), which helps allow for sound to get into your room. Thankfully i was on a quieter floor, but everytime someone would go in or out of their room, it sounds like they're standing in yours. I did like the "Stash" closets they have on your floor, where you can get irons, extra pillows, and razors, deodorant, all types of amenities. It was very convenient to just walk out and grab what you need instead of having to call down to the front desk for it. I also found that the staff was extremely helpful and courteous. Overall, I liked the hotel though, and I'd stay there again, as long as they can promise me hot water. :)

Stayed here for 1 night in October. The nightly rate for this hotel is pretty high for what you get. The rooms were clean and set-up/theme of hotel is really awesome, but the rooms felt crammed. Service was okay, not entirely impressed by this hotel. Skip on this place and find another hotel that offers more

I didn't know what to expect from a hotel labled "trendy" and "unique" as I usually opt for more traditional hotels, but I liked the location and opted to give it a shot. I was not disappointed. What fun it was to just arrive in the lobby which was welcoming and friendly. The wall sized signboard flashed numbers and letters before settling into a fun message of encouragement or welcome. The standing staff were paired with self-serve check-in kiosks for those who preferred less chitchat. I opted for the former and the chitchat lasted all of about a minute before I was checked in. My room was not ready, though, as I was arriving early in the day, so I checked my bags and found my way up the fully automated elevator (you punch in your destination and are assigned to a particular waiting elevator) to the lounge upstairs to work a bit before my first meeting. The lounge was spacious and arranged with a variety of tables, bars, sofas and coffee tables of all sizes with plugs everywhere for the many, like me, who were here to work. When I found my guestroom, later that evening, the origins of the building were easier to see in the upper hallways where the architecture and layout was designed to reflect back to it's original purposes. Each guestroom was a small office and the floors were oriented around an 18 floor atrium. The lights at each door announced the room number and the doors had pulldown, oldtime shades for privacy. The rooms themselves are quite small, but the decor is arranged to maximize space and give a sense of airiness nevertheless. The bed is heavenly, though it was pushed up to a window that looked out at other windows, necessitating closed shades at all times. The remaining furniture is cleverly folded up and hung on the wall, so that you need only open and use the furniture you need at the moment (brilliant!) and the sink and mirror and cosmetics station is very narrow and designed latrine style in the hallway as you enter, leaving the uniquely designed toilet stall and curtainless shower (with a wonderful rainshowerhead) behind a sliding door. It's quirky, but very efficiently designed and, to be honest, fun! The hardwood floors may have been ambiently heated, as I never felt a lack of warmth, however the space could certainly have benefited by a rug or carpet to soften the footfall. I cannot end without exclaiming about the rooftop bar. I don't drink and rarely bother to venture into a hotel bar, but this one I had to see. The rooftop has a phenomenal view of the Empire State Bldg, lit up at night above you, adn the indoor outdoor bar has a rotating seating "carousel", and a small mini-golf facility under the lights of the city. I will try to post pics if I can. I enjoyed my short stay, and would come again, but probably only when traveling alone, unless other rooms are larger. My husband and I would probably find it a tight fit.

This will be my new go-to hotel when I have to be in Midtown. Everyone was incredibly nice and lovely, the hotel bar hip (but not annoyingly so), rooms perfectly appointed, and everything was immaculately clean.

We were in NYC in October/November to celebrate a 21st birthday. We definitely chose the right hotel in the Moxy. Really friendly staff, informal but professional atmosphere and well located. We'd read some of the Tripadvisor reviews beforehand so were a bit concerned about things like noise, so we contacted the hotel in advance to explain it was a special occasion and asked for quiet rooms. The rooms we got were on the 7th floor and we couldn't hear a thing day or night - not even from other rooms. The Moxy staff even decorated one of the rooms with birthday balloons and accessories! Really comfortable beds, spacious shower and a large TV. The rooms are small but you're in New York - you're not going to be spending time in your room.We appreciated the free drinks tokens on arrival and the goodie stall in reception that had freebies to pick up, that changed every day. The lifts aren't complicated at all, no matter what other reviewers have said. Don't forget to listen to the bedtime stories on the phone to get another free drink.We wouldn't hesitate to stay at the Moxy again, or to recommend it to people of all ages.

We loved our stay at Moxy Hotel in NYC Times Square. The design made it feel efficient and open with a retro design. Bright colors, super clean, and comfortable. The rain shower head and overall bathroom layout was awesome. One improvement to the room could be to make the privacy door to the bathroom slightly more private. Since we were on the 14th floor we did hear the rooftop bar until 2am so stay a few more floors down. Great location, walking distance to everything in Times Square. We parked at the garage next door on 36th St and it was very convenient. We will definitely stay again.

I would not normally select a boutique or trendy hotel for a business trip, as I'm often up early, in bed late, working out in the morning, needing a closet and plenty of space to set up a computer and charge devices. However, on a recent business trip to NYC, the Moxy was the only property I could find in my budget and in the Starwood/Marriott group. After reading some reviews and researching the amenities, I decided to give it a shot.The "Times Square" location is a bit misleading since it's not really near Times Square, but nevertheless, you should not be disappointed with this location. It's convenient to many things, including Times Square, 5th Avenue, MSG just to name a few. With heavy traffic, this is still a 1 hour+ trip to/from LGA, but that's not unexpected in NYC.Service at the Moxy really is quite good but not perfect. I don't expect the trendy, more casual hotels like this (and W) to offer good service since I don't feel people choose these hotels for their prowess in this area, but the Moxy is no slouch. Front desk, bar, housekeeping - all so pleasant, but when I requested maintenance for a leaky shower wall via the SPG app, the staff acknowledged the request but didn't actually fix the problem.I was so surprised at the quality of the fitness center. Yes, it's small, but they make the most of this space: pulley station, dumbbells, benches, several cardio machines, and even kettlebells! I cannot tell you how happy I was to see a 20 and 24kg kettlebell in a hotel gym.Now, for the rooms ... they are definitely good and bad, and other reviewers have valid points for both sides of that argument. The rooms are expectedly small, but fortunately my Elite status gave me an upgrade to the "double" double-bed room. In lieu of a closet and luggage rack, at least you have another bed on which you can put your stuff. There are folding tables and a few hangers, but just know that you should certainly not expect a typical hotel experience in this regard. You get a steamer instead of an iron, which is fine, but as another reviewer noted, the A/C is loud and obnoxious. Without a white noise machine, this would have been a problem for me. The TV is huge and has a convenient guide, and the bathroom ... wow is the bathroom impressive. It's enormous given the size of the room, and I was actually wondering why they didn't make the room bigger and the bathroom smaller. I could have parked a SmartCar in the shower, and the bathroom overall has almost as much square footage as the bedroom area.Overall, the Moxy is a cool place, with a trendy, retro feel that is inviting and comfortable. It has a nice gym and a great location, and the rates are reasonable for NYC. I would definitely stay again even though it's not a perfect hotel for a business traveler.

We were in NYC last weekend for a overnight stay for my sons 10th Birthday. We all thought the hotel was super cool, comfy and different. We were on the 16th floor and had no issue with noise at all and slept sound. They are small but the use of the space we thought was amazing, and I read reviews before booking knowing that they were very compact. Although we didn't get to enjoy the free drinks we got during check-in because my son was not old enough to visit the rooftop bar, we did sneak up the following day during brunch hours to be able to show him how neat it was. Our only recommendation would be to somehow fit a small mini fridge in the rooms. It's nice to be able to put some drinks in for the next day or to keep things cool. Overall it was an awesome stay and my son for his first time in the city, LOVED it. Maybe next time we'll go kidless and enjoy that rooftop club.

Room was fabulous! I’m not a great sleeper away from home. Or even at home, but the bed was pretty cozy. The room itself was fantastic! Our son loved the loft bed above ours. Brilliant use of a very small space. The bathroom tiling was great and the shower was wonderful! Great pressure and the soft rain head, delightful! The shampoo and conditions was really nice, too. We plan to book again. Location was stellar! The bar/club upstairs was so fun. What a view! Next time we’ll try out the EggHead room service. Thank you for delivering our son’s pizza to him. We really appreciate how great all the staff was. Wish we could have stayed longer! Five nights was just not enough time! We love you New York!

My husband and I stayed here for our anniversary! The room was lovely. My husband even had it personalized with rose petals on the bed in the shape of a heart and happy anniversary written on the mirror!!! We would like to thank Alma for going above and beyond in making our stay so special! She really was just amazing! Oh! Also, the rooftop bar was a treat too! The DJ was great and the drinks were so much fun! You should definitely check out this hotel if you're in the area!

Been few times in.NYC and this was my worst stay ever, welcoming by the staff on arrival was great though but the hole...i mean the room OMG so so so tiny , no space to put your clothes as they are no closet, hard to move in the bathroom,bathroom windows are polished but you can still see the person on the toilett...AC is super loud, uneccaptable in 2018!!! Sheet were dirty with blood on it, 350$ per night with not even a coffee machine in room...but truly even if they wanted to put one they re is no space to do so.The Hotel Hall is as crowded as central station, night and day!!!they are so many better places in NYC avoid this place, pictures look nice but the rest doesnt follow, and the security from the roof top bar give you so much attitude...

Not a bad hotel. Clean, modern, fun. However, rooms are ridiculously small and the area is so so noisy, it was difficult to sleep. Staff are friendly and knowledgeable about the area. A good base if you want to be in Times Square. But take ear plugs

The overall hotel is great. The staff if very available and communicates their service verbally and in action. The rooms are very cool with furnishings and finishes but the restroom counter space was lacking in my room 1022.

Stayed with three friends for three nights. Really enjoyed our stay. We had bunk beds in the rooms but they were very comfortable. The air conditioning was extremely loud but as soon as we turned it off it was fine! The hotel also has bar and restaurant facilities but be warned, the rooftop bar is very expensive in the evenings. I paid €73 for four drinks! The location of the hotel is excellent and only a short walk from Times Square and Madison Square Garden, and about half an hour walk from Central Park. Easily accessible by subway from JFK although allow an hour for the journey

I really enjoyed this hotel.The location was amazing. There is food, shopping, party stores, you name it. The hotel rooms are small but the space is very well used. It reminded me of a classy dorm room. The room was clean, the shower was hot and the TV was smart.There are bars and restaurants in the hotel and it must get loud because every room has earplugs by the bed. I was on the 11th floor so, I was undisturbed.The hotel itself was quite modern. Technology stands out as well as efforts to make the checkin experience more personalized.I will definitely go back and I encourage you to do the same!

I recently stayed at the Moxy Hotel on Business last week and I was super excited to stay as I have stayed at a moxy before and had a pleasant experience. Check in was very smooth and the staff was polite during check in. Rooms: The rooms are like dorm rooms which I was not expecting at the prime rate I was paying. It was literally the size of a walk in closet. I had room 518 and it was somewhat quiet but can definitely hear all the NYC city traffic noise. Also, there is not trash bins in the room so if you have papers or anything to get rid of you will need to get rid of it at the trash bin in the lobby. I did like that they had a steamer in the room as my suits looked pressed each day. The Bar - The bar on the second floor is amazing decor wise however, I ordered the “box of Chicken” which is a fried chicken meal however when it was served to me the chicken was cooked on the outside and raw in the inside absolutely just grossed me out. Their cocktailMenu is limited however the bartenders are happy to make you anything you like. Magic Hour- The rooftop bar is impressive however the bartenders are not very friendly and the door staff are really rude to hotel guest. I was I would have had a different experience.Housekeeping - As you can imagine on business trip your days are long. I would be out by 7am and return to the hotel by like 9pm or 10pm and daily i would have to call down forThem to restock the towels and reclean the room.I was at this hotel for 5 days on business so it was very frustrating to deal with things that should have happen particularly this being a Marriott brand hotel. Late check out- I had requested a late check out due to my flight delays and was granted it and was willing to pay the fee. So i was working from the hotel when housekeeping knocked on my door and said i needed to check out because they needed to room. I explained that I had pay for the late check out she stated that she was not aware and she needed the room. At this point I did not want to argue as it was already a rough week. So i checked out and requested to speak to a manager. The manager did apologize and removed the fee for the late check out. I am aware this is tourist area however the hotel is branded for all guest tourist and/or business travelers. I truly wished my experience could have been different. The hotel is very fun and decorated nice however that’s about it.

This hotel like most in N,Y. city was quite small and compact but gets the job done and very central to everything but what made this hotel a special for us were the staff one girl in particular her name was Kim on the front desk always went above and beyond so when we had a "minor" accident she was the person we called for help and she was AMAZING. When we boarded the cruise and to my horror we discovered I had left all my medication in the safe at the hotel you can imagine panic set in as I am a type 1 diabetic on insulin 4 times a day and I have stage 4 cancer so am also on pain meds besides lots of others which I cannot live without so although Kim had gone home for the day we called her the next day and it was shipped to the port in Boston and believe it or not there were about 140 10 mg oxycodone and not a 1 one was missing (it really renews your faith in people). I can not say enough good things about this girl without her quick help my cruise would have been over again thank you soo.... much Kim I definitely would recommend this hotel even with out this problem I always find that people make the place thanks to Kim my daughter and I had a wonderful cruise and I hope the management realizes what a Gem they have in this young lady

The location is perfect. It's close to everything. The design and decoration of the space it's amazing. Makes you feel very confortable. The rooms are very functional, also love the software fir the channels. You need to try it.

Love this hotel: friendly staff, great hotel design, cool bar area with an ice cream vending machine ;) Solid gym. Moxy makes a standard hotel look so boring! Plus, a great location near the heart of Times Square and views of the Empire State Building.

If you're reading this review, chances are that you're looking for a decent place to sleep in a convenient Manhattan location, without spending huge fortunes. In that sense, the Moxy NYC Times Square should fit the bill just fine.Here are some of the points worth mentioning about the rooms and my stay:- rooms are indeed on the small side and designed with functionality in mind; the basin and respective shelf are in the main room, while a walk-in shower and toilet are separated through a sliding door (might be worth bringing some matches if you're staying as a couple in the room - fyi)- I had a single room but I guess it could sleep 3 people - two in the big bed, and one in the bunk bed on top (careful not to bump your head, as I did)- this seems to be a fairly new hotel and everything looks clean and modern; the common areas of the hotel look lively and trendy- the shower & conditioner are quite good, so if you're not too fussy about using your own products, the hotel's should be fine; water pressure in the shower is good, too- there is no closet at all, and clothes can be hung on some hangers on the wall or stored underneath the bed- the bed filled the entire back end of the room, and you needed climb over the bed to be able to open the window- even though the Moxy hotel brand seems to be geared at a young & trendy crowd, I found that the general profile of guests was quite mixed- after reading some of the reviews, I was concerned about the level of noise in the hotel because of the bar(s), but my room on the 8th floor was nice and quiet- my room had no view (interior patio) and I kept the shutter down, as the neighbouring building and windows were just across - if a view is important to you, inquire about a room with street views- staff were fine, generally, and service was smooth- on one day, housekeeping didn't show up at my room even though I had not left the 'do not disturb' sign on while out of my room- the rooftop bar is really beautiful (great views of the Empire State Building), as is the bar on the second floor- Internet works very well throughout the hotel- the location is your typical convenient Midtown location - close to several subway stations, Penn Station, and walking distance to some of the main Midtown attractions; other than that, the surrounding area is rather nondescript (which is true for much of Midtown) but you have all you need in the way of delis, shops, pharmacy etc nearbyUltimately, I would stay here again if I got the same rate as for my last stay (paid a little over $200 per night including fees and taxes) and if I can't get a better deal at some comparable Downtown hotel, which is an area I'd generally favor over Midtown.

This is my first time staying at the Moxy Hotel. I would say that it is a very clean place but this is not a place for anyone looking for luxury like bathrobes, spa tubs, coffee makers, etc. The hotel is very comfy, the staff are super friendly and helpful, the rooms themselves are small but roomy, they don't have closets or dressers but they have areas where you can definitely hang up your items and they have under bed storage. But, if you see a pair of ear plugs next to your bed, USE THEM!! They have a wonderful night club called Magic Hour on the rooftop and if you are trying to get some sleep with out the ear plugs....forget it.

Me and my friend stayed in Moxy Hotel during 19th to 26th in room 1424. On the first night of our stay, two strangers opened our door at 12:30am. I fell asleep already while my friend who stayed awake freaked out. The two strangers found us, said “oh, someone’s in’ and left quickly. My friend waked me up and trembled heavily. We felt so scared and called the front desk immediately. The front desk was not helpful at all. They said the manger was on the way. We waited at least 20mins before the manager showed up. I told him what happened but he showed no sympathy and concern. He said there’s never an accident like this happened before. I requested for camera footage however he told me there’s no cameras in the hall. He said there’s nothing he can do at this moment and the investigation would be carried out the next day! We felt great shock and scared. The manager said if you want to change another hotel, you can do that too!The next day, no one contacted us! We went to the front desk and another manager was on duty. I told her the story again. She said the investigation was done. And it’s our fault because we left the door ajar! What a hilarious explanation. We had done several experiments and could not just ‘close’ the door while left it not shut! We insisted to look at the camera footage but she said there’s none!We thought this ridiculous experience was over! But we were too optimistic. On 25th, we went back to our room in the afternoon to drop our shopping bags and to go to an appointment in downtown. When we got to the room, neither of card could open the door. I went downstairs to the front desk. The staff checked a lot of information and activated my room key. I climbed back to 14th floor, just finding out that the room key still didn't work. There’s a housekeeper walking by. I seek for her help. But her room key could not open the door too! She called the engineers, who came to us 10mins later. However, they could not open the door with their cards! They made a call and told us that’ the manger wanted to meet us and shut the door!’ I felt great shock again. A manager shut us out just because he want to see us?! They have my telephone number and email but neither of them was used by them. The front desk even didn’t tell me it was the manger who wanted to see me! I climbed down and asked for the manger. Believe it or not! It was the manager who ignored us on the first night AGAIN! He said coldly that our credit card could not be charged and had to shut the door. I said it’s impossible. When we checked in, a staff told us that she would charge more than the price on the bill and when we checked out the extra money would go back to our card. She succeeded in charging the card and gave us the room keys! How come we would owe the hotel money on the sixth day? The manager said there’s 700USD he could not charge and he had not choice but shut the door. We had been stuck in the hotel for 1 hour and missed our appointment. The manager said he would make an extra and opened the door for us this time but we had to talk to him when we came back! What a drama! It seemed that we were begging him to open our door! Facts are here: 1) we had enough balance on our card and the money had been charged for the first day; 2) if they could not charge the rest stated 700USD, it was their problem not ours. When we came back to the hotel we found another manger was on duty. He said we were all set. I asked about the 700USD. He said it was successfully charged this afternoon! See, we did nothing to the card. The transaction problem was totally from the hotel side!I felt great disappointed and angry. On the day we checked out, we told the story AGAIN to their operating manager (the fourth manager I'd repeated my story). But she’s not helpful at all too! I’ve told the stories to them for more than four times but I got no apologies and explanation! She was impatient in our story.I write my story here to seek help and remind all the potential customers that there’re so many other good hotels in New York (I’ve visited New York 6 times.) the management team here humiliated us again and again! If you want to stay, be careful!

We stayed here for 7 nights recently, the hotel is very cool and has a great feel to it, although the rooms are quite small, but this was to be expected for NYC. The rooms utilise the small space very well, the room itself doesnt have any cupboards for storage it just had hanger on the wall. In terms of location, it is convieniently located for Penn Station & Herald Square subway stations so it makes getting around very easily, it's a great base and almost everywhere is accessible with ease. The hotel also offer ear-plugs within the room and this is pretty obvious why, the outside noise can be quite loud. We were staying on the 3rd floor so were quite low to the ground and there is always noise, but again thats to be expected. I'd recommend a room on one of the middle floors to mask the noise. Overall, I would recommend staying in this hotel.

I stay in Moxy Hotel for the marathon, ten minutes to Time Square, twenty minutes to Central Park, the hotel is very happy place, beautiful fish restaurant in the second floor and good bar/lounge in the rooftop.

I’ll cut right to it, it’s a minimalist, hipster hotel, designed for the the modern day hipster or those who like to travel light. However, this isn’t anything the hotel hasn’t already said. I understand from the marketing campaign, the hotel is “focused on the millennial traveller”. I’m not confident however, that it’s aim encompasses all millennials. My stay with Moxy was average and I say this because there were very clever styling methods which benefited me during my stay. This included what I thought was an amazing shower, I swear I spent at least two hours one morning. It’s designed as a rainfall shower but if you’re travelling with more than one person and sharing the room, privacy is most certainly not at the top of the list. With only frosted glass acting as a speedster and the small space of the room itself you’ll probably be able to see and hear what the other is doing. There are USB ports located so you don’t need to travel with adapters and the hotel will provide you with one if you need. The issue will stem from trying to find a socket (power outlet in your room) as this is fairly limited. There is furniture available if you need to use it (just requires some quick assembly of no more than thirty seconds). This however, significantly reduces the space to navigate around the hotel room. The room came with a safe which is underneath the bed and also some limited storage space (under the bed) and on the walls etc and everything else (soap, gels) as standard. Fresh towels were provided daily. Given that the hotel lifts operate a keycard mechanism it made it highly unlikely you’d find an unwelcome guest making it through to the section which housed the rooms itself. There was a separate entrance for the rooftop bar which caused its own issues and I will explain a little later. The bar area is absolutely gorgeous and I think I ended everyday with a drink. A good selection, quick service and great atmosphere. There is a restaurant and gym onsite for those who are interested. Personally, I explored the city’s other restaurants during my stay.
