There is a rooftop bar which I understand is operational most nights and while the room does much to insulate you from the sound, the noise of partying guests will keep you up. Invest in some good ear plugs to avoid being woken up by those revellers. All in all, an average experience given that there was some trade offs with space, noise, privacy for the price that I paid. However, the strategic location (smack bang in Manhattan) meant that I was within arms reach of everything I wanted to do and therefore really saved me time and money so I would recommend this as a place to stay if you travel.

Stayed her for 8 nights in a king room! Intially we thought the room didn’t really look like the website. But it was just missing some cushions and the big bean bag thingy we thought we were gonna have but after we got over that - we loved it. Extremely powerful shower but sink in bedroom didn’t drain well at all even after we told reception about it. We also required extra pillows but they were brought up to our room that evening. The bed was very comfortable as well we slept great here. Great internet tv and fast WiFi. Fabulous location with lots of breakfast options around and we did try out the rooftop brunch on the Sunday. It was ok - it was a strange club setting with loud music, not really us but the food was nice. Bar on second floor and entrance way all good with lots of staff around if you need anything. Would come back - but maybe opt for a bigger room

Stayed here for an anniversary getaway in the city. Really fun different hotel. We both enjoyed the break from the typical boring rooms you get with the mainstream hotels typically used for business travel. Staff were friendly and helpful. Great stay!

Stayed for two nights of leisure before a business trip. Location is excellent. The staff are friendly. Good selection of food and drink. Room's are a little small but who goes to NYC to stay in their room

My room was quiet which is surprising for NY, but others in my group had differing opinions. If you are close to the rooftop bar, the music is loud all night long! The vibe of the hotel is very young and hip. It’s very modern. If you like that sort of thing you’ll enjoy your stay.

The Rooms were clean and very efficiently designed, however would not recommend working out of the rooms. The various bars and restaurants were great. Also shower water pressure is quite strong, which was a plus.

While checking in, I was asked to present my credit card, at which point I responded that my company used an electronic - virtual credit card to reserve and pay for the room, and that they should have this information. I was countered by the hotel receptionist saying that the company does not accept any type of virtual credit card number (VCN). I noted that I've stay at this hotel twice before with no issues around using a VCN. In fact, this is one of the reasons I've stayed at the Moxy regularly.The reception left and returned with a manager (male) who indicated (without asking any questions of the situation) that the Moxy never had accepted VCNs and that this was actually fraud. It felt very much like they were accusing me of fraud. He also specified that he would fire anyone of his staff who would accept a VCN (as proof that they hadn't accepted VCNs in the past. I was told my only option was to fill out a "third party authorization" form, which is equivalent to what the VCN sends Moxy. The manager was condescending and didn't take the time for fully understand the situation. He jumped to conclusions and made me feel extremely uncomfortable with his accusatory position. I would feel uncomfortable every being checked in any hotel by this individual again.I couldn't fill out the "third party billing" form as I am not authorized sign for this credit card (that the room was reserved under). I called may travel agent for assistance at this point, and they confirmed that the Moxy should have all the information needed to pay for my room. At this point, a DIFFERENT manager came out and she was very helpful. Before jumping to any conclusions she asked questions about the situation, and then proceeded to check my room reservation on their system. She discover that the hotel DID in fact have my VCN on file, and that they only required a credit card for incidentals, which I was happy to provide. The manager apologized for the confusion and misunderstanding; and I was just happy to get out of there. I can guarantee that it was NEVER specified to me that they only wanted a card for incidentals, but I again was made to feel uncomfortable when the receptionist responded to her manager saying... "oh yeah, that's all I asked for - a credit card for incidentals". A part from the second manager who was helpful, understanding, and kind; it was a very uncomfortable check in experience for a hotel that I have enjoyed going to in the past. This was very disappointing.
user_name:
GoPlaces18100967727
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Stayed at the Moxy with my two teenage daughters in October this year. This hotel is in an amazing location being so close to Times Square, Macy’s, Empire State and Maddison Square garden. Easy access to subway at 34th street Penn station. The rooms are small but have everything you need and are clean. No wardrobes only hooks which are fine but they only give you a few coat hangers so take some disposable ones. Staff are friendly and the place has a real fun feel about it. Rooftop bar is not part of the hotel and you have to queue outside to get onto it with the rest of the public. No real complaints and would certainly visit again.

Our recent stay at the Moxy NYC Times Square was ideal for it's 3 block location from Penn Station and it's walking distance (about 1/2 mile) from nearly every Broadway theatre. Bonuses include updated & modernized rooms, super friendly, efficient, and knowledgeable staff, and Marriott affiliation for accruing points!

If you don't care about space, comfort, privacy or traditional amenities, then this is the place for you. Clearly the Moxy is going for a W or Standard vibe, but it's more like a youth hostel with a decent bar/restaurant. The rooms are absurdly small and are not comfortable for a family of 4, let alone 2. There is no closet, dresser, desk or night stand, so forget about trying to work here. The bathroom glass is opaque on the inside so you can't see out, but, surprise you can see in. That's right you can see in very well! Water pressure is non-existent out of the hapless rain shower.The fitness center is well equipped in the industrial basement. The noise from there interior is low, although you can hear all the street noise. The tile job in the bathroom is cool with tiny green tiles.

Rooms are small but clean and close to most things and various subways. Quiet room but do not overpack. Staff friendly. Many food options all around. Easy walk to Penn Station so can take train from Newark Airport to Penn Station and save. We enjoyed our stay and would recommend as long as you are okay with small rooms. Have to crawl onto the bed small.

This hotel was very stylish but perhaps, for us, a little style over substance in the rooms. I know space is hard to come by in NY hotels but there were only a few hooks on the wall with two hangers where a wardrobe should have been so we lived out of our suitcase that filled the spare floor space. The roof top bar is fantastic for drinks however it was about 5 floors above our room and the noise that came from it was so loud we struggled to sleep until the party stopped in the early hours of the morning. I think we'd try a different hotel for our next visit but I'd recommend the Moxy if you're in NY to party, it just didn't suit us.

rooms are NYC tight but efficient, clean, and fun. Check in was easy, fast and someone is always there to help us. Elevator staff are so friendly and helpful if we need anything. Ther rooms are small, but its NYC and everyroom in every hotel is small. Its CLEAN! The shower is great! Loved the convenience in the city for parking and ubering to work places. we stay at this place once a month and its great!

Very good hôtel, well located with nice people available for any request. A little bit noisy as it ils closed to 7th street but rooms are confortable. I recommend this hotel for thé confort and location.

We had the best night out at the moxy in Manhattan. From an amazing room to incredible food. We Enjoyed heading to the roof top lounge and not needed to get an Uber. Our drinks and food where incredible and the scene was beautiful. We sipped on delicious drinks while riding the moving carasoul and enjoying the beautiful Empire State Building. We can’t wait to return. Check out was incredibly friendly also! Big thanks to the moxy!

This vibrant hotel is a new favorite. The staff was super nice, the rooms were comfy and clean, and the vibe is like no other. Yes, it gets a little loud outside during sleeping hours, but for a midtown hotel on Halloween, that was expected. The room (queen for 2 ppl) was bigger than I though it'd be, and the decor/set-up is unique. Photo opportunities everywhere. They do things differently and there's always something exciting to see.

Stayed here for 4 nights... really enjoyed the hotel and the vibe going on. despite being in our 50's we found it relaxing and not solely for the younger generation.Room although small was fun and quirky, comfy bed, great tv ,shower awesome and we managed to make it feel homely despite like of space. we were on the 11th floor and did suffer noise from a huge extractor outside the window which was never off but we didn't spend long in the room and were so bushed after our days out we would have slept through anything!.. loved the 2nd floor bar and food was good, didn't get to try the roof top bar however.location amazing and the staff were really helpful and friendly, more so than at many other places we visited. Basic manners seem to be lacking in many bars, restaurants and attractions we paid good money to visit. anyway that's just a small issue in relation to what was a fantastic time in a wonderful crazy city.final small quibble, I did email the hotel twice explaining to the hotel it was my partners fiftieth birthday and they promised to do something to make it special. nothing happened not even an "happy birthday" when she arrived. I know its not a given that the hotel should make a fuss so we didn't a didn't let it spoil a great trip. Well done Moxy you rock!

Let's start with something positive. The location is great for exploring Manhattan. And the shower was good and unusually large for such a small room. That's about it.So what didn't we like about the Moxy? How about with the fact my wife had a shopping bag taken from the room. Instead of taking responsibility, management have been dismissive and after a week of obfuscating eventually accused us of leaving the room unlocked. As it turns out the two times they claim we left the room unlocked we were 1) out actually buying the items that were stolen, and 2) we hadn't event checked in to the hotel! This matter is yet to be resolved despite our best efforts.The rooms are TINY, which you expect in Manhattan, but this was a new level of small in our experience. Compounding this issue was the fact the air-conditioning motor was located in the room within a wall cavity next to the bed. To make matters even worse again, the bed was pushed right up against said wall. Every time the unit started up (when the AC was actually working that is) it sounded like a car was driving through the room. The ear-plugs on the bed side table were a sign of what was to come. Leaving the AC off was simply not an option as the room was like a sauna, despite cool conditions outside.Finally, there is no storage to hang clothes. Zero. There's also nowhere to place suitcases so they are out of the way. Overall, very basic amenities provided in the room.

A hotel for Millennials...The first (and I would say, most important) factor to note is that this location is really perfect for travel all around Manhattan. From here to the statue of liberty was one line straight down, and 30 minutes, which would be the most travel time around the island. There’s also a transit train to Newark airport from Penn station which is the closest station to this hotel. The hotel stands out so you can always see it from afar, and really it was the best location I think we could have had.To the hotel itself. It tries to make a kind of community, there are two bars, one rooftop and one on the second floor, which is the din you can hear when you enter. They have game nights and fitness classes and pop up shops and things going on. We were given a free drink when we arrived redeemed at the second floor bar, and it is a nice bar, not too crowded, and a nice chilled atmosphere. (A decent Scotch whisky collection – important to me). There are no restaurants ‘in house’ meaning there are two restaurants I guess run by the hotel but they are open independently of it and anyone can walk by. One is some kind of breakfast fast food place, called ‘eggheads’ which only sell eggs with things. (And doesn’t sell tea, but does do coffee) the other restaurant is called Legasea and as you would imagine, is a seafood place. We didn’t try either of these places.Therefore room service is not an option at this hotel. I was desperate for some water one evening and had to go to the bar and buy a bottle for $3.27. The room doesn’t come with a kettle and it wasn’t an option to get one.The room itself was tiny. I was prepared for this reading the reviews, but the overall feeling I got was that they went for style over substance, and the small space might have been better designed. There no wardrobe or drawers or anything, so we lived out of our suitcase; not the end of the world. There was some shelf space under the bed, and a bedside table. The double bed was pushed against the wall, which was an endless annoyance to whoever was sitting or lying on the bed further away from the wall. There were no chairs. The bed itself seemed a little short as well. This was illuminated because at the foot of the bed there was a widescreen TV (With a Netflix button built into the remote!) and on more than one occasion my partner who is average height, kicked the tv and the sound bar that was attached, sometimes dislodging the sound bar from the wall.The TV was cool though, we signed into our Netflix and got American stuff.The bed was very comfortable, we slept very well. It’s just a shame it was poorly positioned. I was stuck with the side close to the wall and had to make-shift a bedside table using the top of the “art” on the wall (which was in a box). Only this side of the bed had a plug socket for phones etc, which is great, but you plug something in, but can’t rest the item anywhere. And my camera batteries etc were hanging loose, and I slept with the phone in my bed.The only other plug socket was by the door, a bit too far away for the person sleeping that side.As there is no closet space, the room has hooks all the way round it. Even behind the TV which might explain why the TV wasn’t able to go up higher out of kicking distance. These came with about 3 coat hanger hooks to hang up, apparently 3 garments between us. I was able to retrieve more hangers, but the space to use actual available hooks was limited and ended up covering the mirror or the light switch etc.The bathroom was again very nice, but not especially ergonomic. First thing to mention is that it was separated from the room by a slide door that didn’t close the whole way, and was designed with a kind of translucent mesh, so we could see everything each other was doing, on the toilet, at the sink, and in the shower. (Thank goodness my partner and I have been together for nearly 10 years… and we have nothing to hide.)The shower was wonderful. Really strong and hot. It DID unfortunately leak, which I think could be easily fixed by bringing the rubber seal down, or just added literally a squared centimetre to the bottom. This being a hipster place, the room has no kind of brochure or compendium with information. The staff were very helpful, but you had to interact to get answers. I wanted an extra pillow and how it worked for these things was that every floor came with a room called “the stash” and you can use your key card to get in and take what you need, such as extra towels (useful for a leaky shower) extra pillows and coat hangers.We stayed on floor 14, and although it was quiet most of the day time, at night the rooftop bar opens and even with windows shut, you can clearly hear the bar. It didn’t keep me up (though it did my partner), and it wasn’t pleasant when going to sleep. I was given the option of a high or low floor and close high because I thought there might be some nice views, but the rooms look in on itself, as the hotel is in a square shape, so I would recommend staying in a lower floor than 14 (the bar is on 18) if you are a light sleeper.The hotel gave free wifi which automatically connected every time and was nice and fast.We deduced from the internet that check out was at 12. The final thing to say I guess is that the staff were all very attentive and helpful. We never had to hang around long to get answers to anything or to check in and out.I probably would stay again as the rate was fine and the location was amazing. But these were really the only factors I feel it had going for it. Not a problem really if, like us, you’re not really there to hang out in the hotel at all. I’d also recommend it for a group of friends maybe who are looking to enjoy the night life, or single travellers.If you’d prefer a bit more luxury and the option for room service and a more traditional hotel experience, this probably isn’t the hotel for you. Think of it as a glamorous, and very clean hostel.

Very noisy and unprofessional staff. Location is good but service is bad and very noisy.Rooms are super small and no place to unpack.If you are staying for 1 day and desperate for the location, it might work. I would not recommend this hotel.

This is the perfect location when visiting NYC. The rooms are really tiny. If you are a "large" person, it is going to be tight. The queen beds are fine but the bunk is for kids or small adults and difficult to navigate. Service is good and the bars here are very nice. Very private for drinks or a meal at the bar. Not cheap but this is NY. Overall a nice hotel and the location carries the day

Nice vibe - good service - I liked it - not the ordinary bland experience. Cool bar. Nice gym, Fun crowd. A good place to hang and relax or have a business meeting, plus great to meet for drinks. Like the breakfast place attached.

The lobby bar, restaurants and rooftop bar all are great places to hang out. A lot of fun and easy to meet people from all over the world. The fitness center is average as seen in the attached pictures with some cardio but missing a real stationary bicycle. There’s one universal weight machine and some dumbbells so you can get in a maintenance workout. Overflow luggage storage is kept in the basement hallway. The rooms are small however you get what you pay for as the price point for this hotel is very competitive. As seen in the attached pictures fun art work and features in the hotel room design. I would stay here again limited to a two night maximum.

I stayed at the MOXY for a week long business trip. The location is very central, close to most top shopping destinations and great food picks.I was offered a "Crash pad" which are for 1. The room was really well thought out, efficient and fun. Only downsides: the view of the inside of the building (not much natural light) and the size (the pad is tiny).The food at the restaurant was delicious and served extra swiftly!

It’s definitely interesting and unique. I love love an adventure and trying new places so I give it a thumbs up for that. However, it didn’t really work for me. I was on a fast overnight business trip and I think I just needed normal and easy. I get like the hotel was like a scavenger hunt to find things and other than the nice girl who checked me in, I didn’t find the service very good at all. For example I went for breakfast at 6:59 and they said they couldn’t serve me until 7... really? So that was ridiculous but I found it I not frustrating I couldn’t get any food until 7 (not even room service) when my first meeting in the city was 7:30am.The rooms while interesting and funky had issues for me. The bathroom sink area is hard for me, as a women, to get ready. The plug is on the sink side. The room and lighting are bad. The only trash can is in the toilet area. The bed is fine but you need to be nimble and comfortable kind of crawling around. The side table-ish area is on the far side and since you can’t walk around the bed, you have to crawl over there to plug on your phone and put your drink there, etc. This room would not have worked had there been two of us. The whole hotel is very dark. I know that’s trendy but I prefer more lighting. I heard there was a cool rooftop bar.For 700 a night, I would only go back for a business trip. I picked it since it’s convenient to Penn Station.

Great location , rooms are small but efficient , we had no noise issue on the 8th floor. We have been Elite Marriott members for years and always choose Marriott because of the amenities they provide. The little things make a stay out of town so much better and this experience was a bit disappointing , our free morning coffee was for just one person, we had to pay for the other and of course no refills. We had to stand in line to receive our one free cup . This may seem like a small issue but it could be so easily resolved at minimal expense, we are in the restaurant business and coffee is not expensive , the cost is more than covered by paying customers. Drinks at the bar were very expensive, I had a Tito’s and tonic for $16.00 which seemed a bit excessive. You can go across the street and get a drink for $10.

Rooms are small, but cleverly configured and sometimes amusing, like the phone that says “Press here for bedtime stories” or the “No diving” sign in the shower. Gym was well-equipped and included free weights. Staff was very helpful, and arranged to have a refrigerator moved to my room at no extra charge. Surprisingly quiet.

Like many have stated before me, this is a different type of hotel. I think works great for a 1 or 2 night stay but here for the week and working -- it's missing many basic amenities I find necessary while traveling.1. No ice machines. If you want ice, they say you can go down to the bar and ask for some. Which I did (very inconvenient) and the workers were not very accommodating.2. No closet. They have pegs on the wall so I had clothes hung all over the wall3. No coffee maker. I don't drink coffee but many of my colleagues complained of this4. No business center. I had to print something out and they had me email to the front desk. Again, staff seemed put out.5. Lighting is awful to get ready/do makeup6. No room service.I am giving this 3 stars because the beds were comfy and my room was pretty quiet (however, my window overlooked a brick wall). It was just me in this room and I can't imagine having another person inside. Very tiny even for NY.

We recently stayed in the Moxy NYC. It is in a lovely location and the staff are friendly and helpful. The rooms are cleverly designed to utilise space. We arrived tired and late and were taken aback to see the wash hand basin in the hallway of the bedroom but in the light of a new day we came to admire the use of space.

Absolutely fabulous! We loved it. Great for the young and young-at-heart. Fantastic use of space in the small room we had (overnight stay to see Eric Clapton at Madison Square Garden). All amenities. Nothing lacking. Breakfast was great. Fun from the moment you walk in. Very contemporary, very moxi! Rounded off our US trip very nicely.

My husband and I stayed here in a queen room for 2 nights. This wasn't where we planned to stay, but the hotel we booked in was overbooked and sent us here. It was certainly not what we expected, but we have no real complaints. Angie checked us in and was just fabulous. We were tired and stressed from traveling, but she took good care of us. The room was small and quirky. No desk, no closet, no refrigerator... But there were 39 coat hooks on the wall. The decorations above the bed were weird. It was a shadow box with a picture of a beer bottle walking a brain on a leash, then a pill bottle with pills going towards the brain, then a picture of part of a man in underwear, and a figurine of a terrifying wrestler. Not what I expect in a hotel room! In the end, our room was clean, the bed was comfortable, we didn't have any noise issues, the location was convenient, service was excellent, and despite the quirkiness of the hotel we enjoyed our stay. We probably will not stay there again, as we enjoy a more traditional hotel,

This hotel is a very interesting idea. I would have loved it at 23 years old. As a 40-something business traveler, it wasn't a good fit. Pros:- Great location- The 2nd floor common area has a great energy. Most hotels struggle to get a "fun" vibe in the bar/restaurant, but with such small rooms and mostly tourists, it felt like everyone was hanging out- Rooftop bar was lively- Coffee/food wasn't ridiculously overpriced like most hotels- Newer bed/pillows so it was very comfortableCons:- Tiny room, tiny bathroom, sink in bedroom (you've read this before)- The rooftop bar goes until 3:00 AM. They provided earplugs, but it wasn't enough (it wasn't the noise, it was the bass shaking the room)- The elevators are S-L-O-W- Gym is just OK (small; few machines)Net net, good budget hotel for the right person/group. Business travelers should look elsewhere.

Our stay was amazing! friendly staff, stylish hotel, comfy beds, awesome pressure of shower. You can reach timessquare by feet in less than 5 min. It wasn't noisy at all as some of the reviws said before we booked!!Nice rooftop!! Would always come back ;)

Family weekend trip to NYC with my three young adult kids and they all loved the Moxy because of the four twin beds so we had our own bed which we all loved!!! The location was great and we just enjoyed the hotel.

I first met this brand in Milan. It charmed. In fact, I am going back soon. I visit NYC often and so decided to stay here as it was not too far from the theaters I frequent. What I did not know was that the hotel is extremely noisey. The nightclub went well into the early morning hours. This spot does not have a cute trendy lobby. But it does have a largish bar in addition to the adjacent noisey nightclub. No in room coffee. I was sent to this bar for what I thought was complimentary morning coffee. $10 including tip for one cup of. Takeaway black coffee. There is, by the way, a coffee shop next door.I usually don’t like to complain, but my stay had been miserable, so when asked, I told the desk clerk about the noise level, the crowded elevators, etc. She apologized and said I would get 2000 points. Fortunately, I had not expected any compensation because the point were never credited. I did get credited with a couple of small tips from the bar for which I had no knowledge. I had paid cash for the coffee. I tried disputing them but gave up when I got no reply. They were, after all, small. And I had already decided I would not be back. No more wasting my time.Do not let this turn you off from the brand. I think it is going somewhere.

We were put in a room on the inside ring of the atrium. Since 3 pm till the early hours of the a.m all I’ve heard is never ending dj music and don’t be fooled, the ear plugs they give you do nothing. My bathroom at home is bigger than the rooms they give you. There’s not even room to open your suitcase up, we have to put the side table in the bathroom and move it around depending on what we need in there. Theres absolutely no amenities, literally a bed in a corner, a tv and a tiny bathroom with a sliding frosted glass door that is quite see through. Overall a massive let down when you consider how much we paid to stay here.The only bonus is the location. The front desk staff also let us check in early which was appreciated.
user_name:
oloem092
New York City, New York

review_body: Lesson learned. I know it’s Saturday and maybe I should have known better but my bed is literally positioned in the middle of a nightclub right now. There aren’t enough earplugs in the world that could drown out this situation (thanks for the multiple pairs next to the bed though). Any good thing I would have said about this place is getting tossed out of my brain with every beat of bass.

This is a really cool hotel with different and interesting characteristics. Unfortunately, for us, the overall enjoyment was a little tarnished by the tiny rooms and even more so by the noise from the rooftop bar until 4am. The earplugs strategically positioned on the bed-stand were of little help.

Who wants to stay in a conventional hotel while staying in New York….No one! We wanted a unique experience for our first trip to New York and The Moxy was the perfect choice.Check in was simple, we arrived a bit before check in time but was able to leave our bags and go explore. We came back around 4pm and was checked into a room on the 12th floor, I was a little worried after reading so many reviews about the dreaded rooftop bar. We stayed over a Thursday, Friday and Saturday and didn’t hear anything….maybe we just got lucky? The location is great as it’s slightly out of times square. Yes the rooms are small but what are you expecting? There is more than enough room to put suitcases/get ready etc. Bathroom was great, really nice shower. Friendly staff and awesome smell in the lobby! We’re 100% returning on our next trip to New York!

Decided to stay here using a reward certificate. Despite some of the reviews, we liked the location and knew some of the eccentric aspects would be fine for us, and they were. Check in was friendly and efficient. Not sure I received all of my Platinum Elite benefits, and I don't know why Marriott makes you ask about it (room upgrade, internet, breakfast/concierge access) instead of telling you. Room was a corner king, and looked just like the photos. Room is small, and probably not for you if you're going to spend a lot of time in your room. Still comfortable. They miss some things with the small size (no closet, toiletries like lotion, no coffee maker, no iron and ironing board, etc) but for one night, it was fine. There was a ton of traffic in and out of the hotel related to the bars, club, and restaurants. Music was loud and still thumping at midnight, but we were so tired we fell right asleep. The hotel bar was nice, and we appreciated the two free Proseccos. Fitness room was adequate with several cardio machines and weights. It is in a strange location and was also crowded in the AM. All in all, we liked it, but I wouldn't want to stay here if I was in town for more than a day or two and/or you spend a lot of time in your room and like having space to spread out.
user_name:
Joshb2j
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: The staff was immediately helpful as soon as we walked into the busy lobby. For the amount of activity throughout, the spaces we experienced were clean and kept in good condition. Modern finishes and unique options kept everyone happy. The rooms were small, but taken into consideration we are in the middle of Manhattan, it's to be expected. With this in mind, they did a reasonable job of providing alternative means to storage - it almost felt like we were in an IKEA small apartment. There was some noise coming from what we thought was the rooftop bar on the weekend, but it was shut down by 11 and several pairs of earplugs were provided. I appreciate it when hotels reduce waste with refillable shampoo/conditioner/soap in the showers, but there was no body or hand lotion provided which seemed weird. Otherwise we enjoyed our brief stay as it was in a great central location for exploring New York.

3 night stay here with my daughter for a 21st birthday present. She was impressed with my hotel choice as it was trendy and modern environment (does she not realise I didn’t want to be staying in a stuffy old fashion place lol) Perfect location and Staff extremely welcoming, friendly and helpful. In house restaurant serves excellent food and has a nice atmosphere. Booked a queen hotel room, very clean, maid had popped in daily with clean towels and tidied up bed, everything you could need, extra seats and table hanging from pegs (nice touch) only thing missing was a kettle but with jet lag it was quite nice to walk over the road to Starbucks at 6-7am when the streets were quiet. People have mentioned before the noise, we stayed on the 4 floor, just over main entrance, could hear a little of the outside music but nothing to complain about. Would definitely stay again if ever in NewYork

Having Read some rather bad reviews of Moxy Hotel we a couple in our early 60s arrived with fear that we had booked the wrong sort of hotel,How wrong were we this has got to be one of the best places to stay in the area yes the rooms are a bit on the small side but very funky as is the whole hotel. The hotel team that work there are very friendly and helpful, on arrival we asked for a quiet room away from the roof bar the young lady who checked us in went out of her way to make sure we were happy.The lifts are very easy to use once you know you have to press where you want to go.Great service in the Moxy bar playing some great music.We were so busy sight seeing we didnt have time to visit the roof top bar maybe next time.All in all ignore the bad reviews go and enjoy x

I have to say the hotel is very well located, nice, modern, welcoming and convenient.The only BUT is the size of the rooms. Some of them.We got a extremelly small one. So small that we had no space to open luggage without interfiereing with the bathroom door or the entrance door.We complaint about it and we got a bigger one, not huge but decent.Our experience overall was good but without this room change the stay would have been a nightmare.

This is a wild hippy hotel. Bars or nightclubs on the roof, next door perhaps in the basement. Elevators just go somewhere, you can't tell them where to go, everything secured by your room card. Your furniture hangs on the wall.It feels like you've entered a hotel on another planet, or you might have skipped a generation or two.But, the bed was good, amenities good, shower nice, and the noise - for Times Sq - not too bad. I'd go back, but also consider more conservative places.

This hotel has a perfect mid-town location close to Times Square, shopping and within walking distance to Rockefeller Plaza etc. We were able to store our bags and return to check in within 2 hours. Our room was clean and the noise level in the hotel was non-existent. The city noise below was expected but tolerable. The 2nd floor bar/hang out area was very nice! The rooftop bar was also a nice amenity and the drinks were tasty!The rain shower was a wonderful thing to come back to the room after a full day of walking around the city!We also liked that the floor in the room was a hard laminate which seemed much cleaner than carpet! The staff was friendly and accommodating! We would certainly stay again!

Overall my wife and I had a nice experience at the hotel. A couple if glitches, I made arrangements a few days prior to our arrival to have our room festively decorated for our anniversary. Upon entering the room, there was nothing. I wanted it to be a surprise for my wife. I contact the front desk to see what happened. Mike, the manager on duty, called the room and said the info for the room was in system but not communicated to anyone. He apologized for this, offered us a round of drinks at the Moxy Bar. We left fro dinner later and upon our return, the room was decorated with confetti, balloons and other fun ideas! Nice recovery. There is one other issue, our room 1211 has a nice king bed, but the person sleeping close to the window (ME) has NO access to get out of the bed. I had to climb over my wife in the middle of the night to use the bathroom, not fun.... The hotel needs to rework the layout of this room.

My husband and I stayed here for a quick weekend getaway to celebrate our anniversary. We had an awesome time. The hotel was very clean and accommodating. It had a friendly out going atmosphere. We thoroughly enjoyed our selves and would definitely stay here again.

The Moxy is a stylish, comfortable and very clean hotel in a convenient mid-town location. We absolutely loved the atmosphere and overall vibe of this place. The bartenders at the 2nd floor bar served up perfect cocktails with a smile. As guests of the hotel, we were able to skip the line for the rooftop bar which is definitely worth a look.The 4-person bunk room was a bit pricey due to New York Comic Con but perfectly served our needs.We will definitely put the Moxy high on our list for future visits to NYC.

Staff was very friendly and helpful. We had a few glitches, but staff was very willing to help. Our room was not ready when promised, but we were given a hotel credit which we used in the bar. We had difficulties using the credit because we had already checked out, but the staff was able to work that out. We stayed in a room with double bunk beds. The room was very small for four people , which is fine if all you want to do is sleep. The bathroom had glass doors which were tinted, so no real privacy there! The shower had a rain shower head ( which was wonderful) , and shampoo, conditioner and body wash were provided. We were short one bath towel which I’m sure we could have called the desk for,. No closet or dresser, just pegs on the wall and some storage under the bed. There also was a small safe. Overall, the hotel was nice enough to recommend, and I would stay there again.

We had a great stay at the Moxy, the hotel room was ready right when we arrived (3 hours early) and the staff was as friendly as can be. The rooms were very clean with not a single thing out of place. You can only access the elevator with a key card allowing for improved security. The only negative thing was the pillows were very flat and when we asked for a few more they were all out of them. So that impacted our sleep a little but besides that absolutely wonderful stay would recommend to anybody traveling to the city with the want of being in Midtown Manhattan. While the room was a little on the small side it was perfect for my girlfriend and I, wouldn’t recommend to anybody that isn’t friendly with each other or needs a lot of personal space.

Overall, a wonderful stay. Loved the modern, minimalist theme and the staff was friendly and helpful. We would have loved an ironing board and a King Sized bed option but certainly not a deal breaker. The 2nd floor lounge bar was awesome. Great drinks, comfortable seats and a perfect way to start our getaway weekend.

Loved this hotel. The design was so unique - modern yet retro & the staff was friendly. Check in & out was super easy. The room was small but very comfortable & had everything we needed. The only thing is there is parking next door although it is a garage not affiliated with the hotel & even though the hotel says $60 a day don’t forget to add tax which brings it closer to $70 a day. Other than that we really enjoyed this hotel.

We love this hotel and definitely plan to return! The staff is very kind and helpful. If I stand in lobby a staff member will actually approach me to ask if I need help, rather than wait for me to approach them. The design of everything is so unique and modern. There is a neat area to hang out with comfy couches, foosball table, etc. Nice restaurants and bars. The room is sooo awesome! We stayed in a room with double bed. For lack of a better reference point, it has qualities of a “tiny home” with a platform bed with storage underneath, table and chairs and fold up and hang on wall to be out of way when not using them, adorable bathroom with modern finishes. My daughter and I fell in love with its charm! We came to celebrate my daughter’s birthday and when I mentioned that to reception at check in she told me they could come to the room while we are out and decorate it to surprise her and at no cost to me! What a thoughtful gesture! My daughter was so happy to come home late and see balloons and a message written on the mirror. This hotel really went above and beyond my expectations! I highly recommend!!!

The service was excellent at this property. Mike helped us check in and also make sure our bags made it to the room as we also had to park a vehicle. The hotel design was very modern and well thought out making the hotel very efficient. Moxy offered lots of amenities including several food and bar outlets, baggage storage, laundry, breakfast service, and concierge services. Overall, the hotel was very clean and service was excellent. I thought the price was steep for the value we received from the hotel; however, the location is what you are paying for. Literally blocks from the heart of Times Square.

I've lost track of how many times I've stayed at The Moxy. I was one of their first guests. This past stay (9/28 - 10/4) really wasn't good. My room was made up ONCE. I was out of the room for most of the day, I had my light on for service and I was constantly falling over housekeeping folks in the hallway. So. . .I don't know what happened. Their "take our area" has NEVER been figured out. It's so awkward trying to make a purchase. And there is rarely someone there to check you out. There was a problem with my reservation where I wasn't booked for my final night. Now, it's my understanding that it's illegal to evict someone from a room they're already occupying and paying for. But, rather than arguing that fact, I agreed to change rooms. AFTER I was told they were completely sold out. My Marriott Platinum status may or may not of had something to do with it. Of course the room wasn't available yet, so I had to store my luggage and wait. AND. . .I had to pay $600 for the room. I'm looking forward to their new Chelsea location to open. It looks like take-out will be more accessible, etc. Again, my stays are never consistent. This time around was just bad.

I stayed here last week with my associate discount and I love my room. The two guys who I meet the night I was checking in were amazing. They gave me more info about the Moxy since it was my first time. One of them even gave me a token for complimentary drink. They are great asset to the hotel. The room was great, different from your typical hotel rooms. I love it and I’ll stay here again. I highly recommend this place. Enjoy the pictures.
user_name:
derrickpeprah
New York City, New York

review_body: For the most part, I can't fault the hotel - great staff, great location, very clean, great place. The only slight gripe was the cost - at $2000 for 7 nights, and given that our room was only big enough to fit in the double bed, and then very little floor space left after you've got two suitcases in there... it's a little on the pricy side - but i get that NY is expensive...

Firstly, have to give credit to Marriott Hotels for developing Moxy brand as they say it is a hip, young vibrant place to be. Decor was different and exuded current. Staff was always happy and helpful. As a seasoned traveller of both luxury, mid market and budget hotels for both work and leisure I have to be honest and say Moxy misses the mark as a hotel for sleeping and being comfortable but makes up for it as a great nightclub.The rooms are tiny even for New York standards. Housekeeping can be bit more diligent as our first room was dirty with used q-tips and tissues and the second room had a pair of ladies underwear stuffed down the side of the bed. (given the demographics of the clientele I gave the hotel the benefit of the doubt and suspect the previous guests left them to be discovered by the next guests) The hotel has some clever designs in the small rooms by having multiple hooks instead of a wardrobe and folding furniture to save on valuable space but the beanbag chair takes up so much of the room that we asked for it to be removed so we could at least have some space to store suitcases. Our first room that we slept in was two levels below the rooftop bar/cub on the 17 floor but the noise and vibrations from the club actually woke us up at 2:30 in the morning and went on past 4:00am. The following day we asked to be moved to another room and as mentioned in some other reviews the rooms at the back of the hotel are very dark and has really noisy air-conditioning units. Even in a mid level room (9th floor) we could hear the noise of the rooftop club but thankfully no reverberations from the music. We suspected that the rooms were noisy as the hotel supplied Moxy branded earplugs ready on the bedside tables when you check in!On the positive side the hotel has a fantastic and Rooftop Club, in a fantastic location, two streets away from Macys, Times Square and Fifth Avenue also Penn Station & subway stations are literally 5 minutes walk so getting around is a breeze. The Moxy Hotel's 2nd Floor bar/cafe is great place with sofas/ loungers and free seating to chill and have a simple bite to eat or relax and The Legasea Restaurant offers fantastic seafood menu and worth a visit. Overall if you are looking for a quiet restful place to stay Moxy is not for you! If you are looking for a convenient hip and happening energetic place to crash then this is it!

I stayed here with a group of friends for my 22nd birthday and loved it! It was my first time at the hotel and we went to the Magic Hour Rooftop Bar in the hotel. So much fun! The hotel is so clean and modern. They give you everything you need for your stay. The people are also very nice! There is an indoor bar, great food, etc. You have to stay here! Great location in Midtown as well. I would definitely go back here.

Funky & Boutique hotel near Times Square. However, there was no study desk in room. The washbasin was outside in the room. No iron/ ironing board in the room. The customer service at bar/ lounge was quite poor (in contrast to helpful & cheerful receptionists)

Funky & Functional - the room is made for crashing and simplicity. This is not a place to stay if you enjoy a plush room filled with extras. It is unique and something you should experience, but I would not recommend it for a long stay.

My family was so, so impressed with our overall experience at the Moxy Times Square. The time and attention they put into preparing the room for my daughter's 16 birthday was incredible. It's the small touches that make the difference and they just seem to "get it".We took a bit of a gamble straying from our usual hotels in the city, but we're so glad we did. The check in process was a breeze. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. The decor was hip, sleek and modern. When they say it's an alternative to the usual hotel stay, they hit the nail on the head. Yes, some of the rooms are on the small side, but they're incredibly well designed and the 3 of us never really felt like we were in each other's way at all. The shower was just what you need after a long day of touring the city. Not only is it really cleverly designed, we can't say enough about the shower. Great pressure, very relaxing.The location was great. Minutes from Time Square, Bryant Park, subway stops and other shopping and amenities makes the address ideal. The have a couple of bars in the hotel and another rooftop bar that sits in the shadows of the Empire State Building. Amazing ambience and a great photo op. I know we wouldn't hesitate to recommend the Moxy to others and we'll definitely stay there again the next time we come to the city.

Stayed 4 nights in my recent trip. Pro: the location ! It's less than 5mins from 34St-Penn Subway station, and round the corner from Macy's. Everything seems to be walkable.The water pressure of the rain shower was very enjoyable. Con: The room was tiny. The aircon vent was at the top of my head, and the TV was at the bottom of my legs. I'm less than 1.6m. I cant imagine someone who's taller in the room. There was no facility for hot water. Need to go to the bar to get a cup. No kettle for loan. Super inconvenient. Neutral: There was a lot of talk about the noise from the bar. I stayed on level 14 and the noise was hardly audible.

Short walk from Times square, empire state building, Macy's, the high line and a shake shack plus the hotel has a roof top bar, all these really sold it to us (a couple about to turn 30). Easy to get to from JFK, short shuttle to Jamaica then the LIRR to Penn Station which is right next to the hotel.

We stayed one night at the Moxy. It’s great for one night, close to Penn Station and the train, and the restaurants in the hotel are great. The rooms have a Scandinavian design aesthetic, but they are the smallest hotel rooms I’ve ever seen in my life. And the lighting in the vanity area is not great for putting on makeup.Check in was quick and seamless. We also grabbed a snack at the bar at Legasea and found the food and cocktails to be really good. I also love that Marriott now has an app where you can request services (wake up calls, extra towels, pillows, etc.).My only real complaint is the noise. At least they leave you ear plugs on the nightstand. I’m not sure why the rooftop bar is so noisy and why you can hear the noise in your room- I’ve stayed at other hotels with a similar setup and the noise wasn’t so much of an issue.This hotel is not a good option for families, extended stays, business travelers that need a desk or workspace, or those looking for a ton of creature comforts. For the same price you can stay at a Courtyard Marriott if you fall into one of those categories. The rooms are small, there is no space for a rollaway, there is no closet to get luggage out of the way. There is also no tub if you have small children.

I get that MARRIOTT is trying to position the MOXY brand for the young, hip, modern customer segment, and the bars, restaurants, etc. do a great job at that. But the rooms? Come on! I have stayed in HOSTELS in my youth with better layouts and accommodations than MOXY's. No dresser of any kind; pegs on the wall to store one's shirts and suits; a "prison style" sink area with water dribbling from the faucets, and extremely poor lighting; hard, cold floors; no room service; no iron/ironing board in the room - must go to a service closet down the hallway (and the ironing board itself was a very small one with no place to utilize it in the room)... And all that for the pleasure of spending over $300 a night! Never again.

Had a quick trip to NYC with my sister for just one night. This hotel was great - the room was very small, but fine for just getting ready and to sleep. It was clean and modern. The hotel was great, service was absolutely FANTASTIC! The rooftop bar was great as well as the 2nd floor bar. For the specific room we had I would say I could only spend a max. of two nights. If we had a larger room then I would definitely be able to stay for a longer period. We had the queen room with just one full size bed. The service/staff was just AMAZING!

Central location, close to Time Square, for a still reasonable price! Cool and stylish rooms which are not too small! Quiet for sure and a comfortable bed. A fancy shower will make you smile. All is well designed and modern. The Wifi and Aircondition are perfect working. One gadget in your room: a clothes steamer which is convenient! There is no minibar (so you can have an express checkout). A vault is below the bed. The view was next to another building, some other rooms might have the view only to the patio. However, do us a favor: do not drink the Prosecco which is offered for free at the check-in. You get in the bar upstairs and it is tapped out of a barrel... - but we strongly recommend this hotel for sure!

Very new and stylish hotel with lots of attention for detail. I slept in a twin room and the beds were put against the wall with the foot end against each other. Very clever, it gives you a bit more distance from each other which is great.Loved the bathroom, nice design and the shower was great! I tyhought the staff at breakfast was a bit unfriendly or at least not trying very hard.Also I missed some nice sweeter dishes on the breakfast menu like pancakes. It was mostly eggs or otherwise yoghurt.You can hear music from the rooftop bar in your room (even on the 5th floor) but I always sleep with ear plugs so it did not bother me.

Rooms very clean, tidy and modern. Shower is amazing. Hotel in general very well kept. Our only issue was the size of the room. If it was a 2-3 night stay, it would have been fine, but we found it difficult storing 2 large suitcases and hand luggage. It was our first time in NYC however and we understand many hotels are like this unless you pay extortionate prices. We were disappointed we did not have chance to use the sky bar. One night we tried it was closed and another night we was told we couldn’t get in because of a private function.Overall a great stay in a very convenient location. Staff always very friendly and helpful.

Ideal location. Lovely hotel. Staff were very friendly and rooms clean. Shower was amazing. We upgraded to the queen room. It was on the small side but to be expected in New York. Would definitely return!!

We stayed for 7 nights and enjoyed our stay much!MOXY is 2 blocks from Madison Square Garden and also very close to Times Square.Nice clean room, kind of compact living. No wardrobe or drawers to out your clothes in but plenty of hangers on the wall.Nice ”rainforest” shower, the sink was outside the bathroom.We didn’t have breakfast at the hotel. There are many really good breakfast places just outside the hotel on 7 th Ave.On the downside was one of the elevators that was shaking and making noises which didn’t felt good at all.

The hotel has a perfect location, we can say in the middle of manhattan. Room was clean and pretty. But we can say a little bit small. Also two people can hardly sleep in the bed if you have tall and a large body. The hotel personnel was nice and helpfull.

Rooms are tiny, the bed was tiny and I went there with my teenage son, they could not have been less interested and gave me some blankets and told me to sleep on the floor! there were no spare pillows on my floor, and very cheap products, however when I went to the floor above it was a different story, how is that right? Airconditioning was so noisy they gave you ear plugs, but it was like sleeping in a washing machine. No place to put your clothes, just hooks on the wall. Oh and do not be fooled that it is actually on Times Square, it is not. Avoid at all costs.
user_name:
Wendy D
Caterham, England, United Kingdom

review_body: I stayed in the Double Room and found that it was minimal, cramped, and bare bones. Firstly let me get one thing clear right off the bat. This “hotel” is nothing but a glorified backpackers hostel. If you’re looking for somewhere quick to spend the night while you’re out partying throughout to the early morning and you’re between 21-35, go right ahead, this place will do fine. If you’re travelling with luggage, kids, want decent sleep and service, look somewhere else. I understand that they’re trying to be hip and cool by being different, but by focusing on one small demographic, you alienate such a large customer base by trying to be edgy. The hanging furniture on the wall is nothing but a hipster way of giving you uncomfortable fold out furniture for your room. The bathroom was adequate, however it lacked basic toiletries provided in most other hotels. The only items were a bar of hand soap, two cups, and body wash/hair wash and conditioner in pump bottles secured to the shower wall. The bed was bearable, but the pillows were so flat that they were non-existent. I called the front desk twice about getting an extra pillow, but after waiting an hour and a half and calling twice more, I gave up. Housekeeping was abysmal. I called the front desk on multiple occasions requesting the aforementioned pillow, and again when the room ran out of toilet paper. After two more phone calls and 45 minutes of waiting, they finally arrived with two rolls and no apology. I also had someone from housekeeping come to my room saying that they were coming to clean the room even though my Do Not Disturb sign was illuminated. After telling them that I had organised no such thing, they were adamant that I had requested it and tried entering my room without my permission. Room placements are a complete mess unless you’re a party animal because there is a rowdy bar on the second floor, and an obnoxiously loud club on the rooftop that goes on until 4am. The only saving grace is that they provide earplugs. However if you’re unlucky like me, you’ll find yourself with a box with no earplugs inside. At least it’s the thought that counts. The elevators are clever, although frustrating, and can cause congestion at peak times, be prepared to use the stairs to save waiting for 20 minutes. What left the worst taste in my mouth however was the lack of service from the front of house staff. Everyone was more interested in hanging out and chatting with friends rather than look after their guests. While asking one of the staff downstairs a question about the easiest way to get to Grand Central Station, they overheard one of their friends helping someone get to a bar, to where they completely ignored my question and went over to another guest and started talking to them about the bar. All in all, if you’re young, hip, and fashionable, they’ll treat you like a king and you’ll have a great time. If you’re anything else, consider other options.

Tight quarters, but comfortable bed and well located. Shower was a tiny standup square that splashed water all over the floor. But great for the value. I found street parking that was free overnight and the next day (Sunday). Valet is $55.

Very cute hotel. Not a lot of variety when it comes to food inside the hotel but there are plenty of options right outside. Super close to the theater! Would stay again the next time I come to New York City.

Staff was friendly but seems like they didn’t know what they are doing during check in!Lift doesn’t work!Room extremely small, sink in a bedroom, no wardrobe.Second floor bar most of time occupied by office workers, no space at all.Top roof bar beautiful, unfortunately all tables always reserved! Good location but not worth money !

Great trendy spot! Loved the 2nd floor space . Everyone was friendly and helpful. Room was clean and bed was very comfortable .I was here overnight on business and I'm hoping that I am able to stay here again for pleasure!

I stayed two nights at the Moxy NYC Times Square on business, I was in the city for a short period of time and so the location was critical. The rooms are smaller but perfectly thought out with lots of clever touches and plenty of room to work and relax. The rest of the hotel was great. I had dinner in Legasea one evening and the quality of the seafood (octopus and Branzino) was amazing. All the team members I encountered were super helpful especially the night team as i was up and around early due to jet lag. Nothing was too much for them. This is a very well run property and I would not hesitate to recommend it!

Pleasant 1 night stay on a rainy night in Manhattan. The hotel was lively without being a scene. Room was not large but well appointed and bed comfortable. Will come back for rooftop on a better night.

This was the perfect place to stay in NYC. It was conveniently located to Times Square, and walking distance from nearly everything else I wanted to see. I saw several Broadway shows, and this location was perfect to walk to the theaters. The rooms are small, but very well laid out to maximize space. The furnishings were comfortable and modern. I couldn't have been happier with my stay at Moxy. I'll stay there next time I visit NYC.

Nothing worked at this hotel. Elevators broken, no light in my room, no coffee maker, safe didn’t work. From checking in to checking out... all was off. Hallways dirty, staff uncaring. And I paid a lot for lousy room—smelled of cleaning products.

The hotel is in a good location within 5 minute walk of Times Square. The room itself was nice but a small size for two people. Also is there is no wardrobe space and very little space to hang clothes up. This was a problem for 2 girls. We went to the restaurant for breakfast one morning it was very overpriced for all we got. The food was burnt and a very small portion. The rooftop bar was also disappointing as they stopped serving around 11:30 and the staff were very rude to us. Also the hotel does not offer room service, what sort of hotel does not offer room service??? Overall I would not stay here again.

I stayed last week. Forgot a pair of shoes and haven’t been able to contact the hotel staff. No answer on the telephone. No answer on the fax number! I need to contact them to get my shoes back. Tried to call them. Tried to fax them. So frustrating!!!

I come to visit often and have stayed in many hotels but this one was my favorite! From the moment we walked in the door to the second we left the staff was so friendly. Our room was extremely clean and the night life was so much fun. It couldn’t be in a more perfect location since Times Square is within walking distance! We got to visit so many places we always wanted to but never got the chance since it was in the middle of everything! I highly recommend this hotel to everyone! Thank you Moxy for the best experience yet!

I paid $275 per night for a modest room with a queen sized bed. The room was small, but functional. We did wish there were raised cabinets to put clothing. The in/room storage is pretty sparse.It is easy to spend much more for a hotel within a 10 minute walk of Times Square, so expectations need to be reasonable about room amenities. The noise from the hotel bars and outside can be loud too. Given I am not much of a drinker these days, I think I would prefer staying in a hotel near 50th, but a few avenues to the east where it is less hectic and quieter, but still an easy walk to Times Square.

The location,room is very clean and supercute.I had a great view of the Empire State Building from my window. I can hear the music from upstairs so if you are very sensitive to noise you can request to give u a room in lower level.I did’nt mind it coz I don’t want to sleep anyway.I am in the city that never sleeps...

This hotel from the service to the rediculous design was the worst hotel experience I have ever had. From the beginning, they did not have our hotel room ready and they still didn’t the next two times they gave us that they said it would be ready. The room was half the size of the smallest room I had ever been in before. The width of the room is the length of a queen bed plus six inches. You can’t walk around the bed. The shower and toilet are in the same room without a door or curtain between them. Room is so small that toilet paper stays wet from the shower. The hallways were very claustrophobic... about half of the width of a standard hotel. Felt like a hotel room you would have in Japan... Tiny. The room and “communal” area had offensive pictures. Very disturbing vibe in the hotel. Elevators are completely computerized (no buttons) which sounds great until it takes 25 minutes to get down stairs. Included breakfast is in the bar, not a restaurant. This hotel tries to be so different that it has lost its basic service of providing a comfortable place to stay. I am very surprised that Marriott has put it’s name on this brand.

From arrival to departure this stay was calamitous.Staff clueless. Lifts slow and/or not working. Room small with little storage space. No room service. No laundry collection. Door lock failed and I was waiting for an engineer for over 30 minutes.Breakfast poor.Over-priced.Never again!!

We had a couple drinks here and loved the rooftop venue. Very unique atmosphere. A carousel, and some risqué art. Nice view and a cool vibe. Weekend nights have a line to in but hotel guests can cutTo the front! It’s got to be the Kind

Loved the Moxy! Cool, hip place in the heart of NYC. Rooftop bar was awesome on a Sat night! Rooms were a bit small, but totally NY and we loved it. Heard it was noisy all night, but had no noise at all. Loved it!!

I did cancelled this hotel for two nights. The following day, yes, the following day (not even 24 hrs later) I had to cancel due to an unexpected situation. I did explained the situation to booking and they did understood and agreed o talking to the hotel pointing out that it was less that a day after reserving and should not be a problem. The hotel decided to charge me with 289$ for cancelling.I understand that the reservation did not admit cancellations but less that 24 hrs and due to a unexpected and explained situation there should have been more that a cold no and charge. No flexibility or understanding from their side means i will never go there again. I travel every month to NYC and I was looking for new hotels in order to explore different areas but this is not going to be one of them for sure. Thank you for nothing MOXY NYC TIMES SQUARE.

My friend and I stayed here for 5 night in March 2018. It was a fairly new hotel and had only been open a few month I believe. Pleasantly surprised when we arrived, I would say it’s aimed more at the ages 21-35 purely because there is loud music in the lobby and in the lifts. There is also two clubs in the hotel which admittedly did keep us awake a couple times.. they do supply earplugs but a little uncomfortable! The location is perfect, set a couple minutes walk from madison square garden, Macy’s and in the other direction about 10 mins walk to Times Square! My friend and I loved NYC!!!

This is my second time back at Moxy Times Square. I travel to NYC often for business, and have yet to find a better value in the city. The rooms are nicely sized, with the most comfortable bed and huge rain showers. i love that i can stream my netflix or hulu or anything right to the TV. Bar Moxy is always happening, and you get a free welcome prosecco when you check in. I loved eating Egghead in bed each morning of my stay, they deliver it right to the room. The lobby is a fun place to work but there is a table and chair if i need to work in my room. The free fitness classes on the roof are a good way to stay in shape on the road. The service is always friendly and helpful. If you're looking for a modern hotel in a central location Moxy is your spot!

I debated whether to write a review or now but ultimately I felt people should be aware. Let me start by saying i travel to NYC quite a bit for work and have stayed in dozens of NYC hotels all over Manhattan. I stayed hear in early August for several days. The Hotel seemed clean, rooms are small, no closet. But for work travel, it was convenient and modern so I picked it over older options in the area. On the second night of my stay, a BIG rat jumped out from under my bed. I ran out of the room and management was responsive, they offered to move me to another room. Needless to stay I wasn't interested in staying there. Seeing a rat less than 1 foot from your face is traumatic. I will never forget it and had trouble sleeping after the incident. I later learned that it was a problem on the 3rd floor and it was fumigated but where there is one rat, there are likely many more. I won't be staying here again.

Situated in the center of NYC on the 7th Ave. subway is near by walking distance. Cosy hotel, great atmosphere if you seek a different experience than traditional usual hotel - this is for you! I wouldn’t recommend if you are age above 60, this is loud hotel with music all day long, so for young crowd that is the place to go. Good strong WiFi on all areas, great GYM , fine cocktails all day long! Roof top bar with great view. Stuff is kind and helpful, plus a Marriott chain hotel

The rooms here are small and that's fine. In one of the densest places on the planet, hotel rooms are expensive and trading size for cost is worth it for me.The place very much as a millennial vibe to it. The bar is busy with non-hotel guests, but that's also fine. It isn't noticeable when you are in your room.

Booked this trip with friends for a festival, we arrived late at night but checking in was easy and quick. We were very tired and there wasn't too much messing around.The room was a great size for three people, and bathroom was a good size. the only downside is when you shower the water leaks to the main room. Other then that the beds were comfy and hotel was cool. We found the food in the hotel 2nd floor was over priced so we ate next door but what was disappointing is that they don't offer hotel guest from next door money off. The roof top bar was fun and the brunch food was amazing as it was such good weather.I would book the Moxy again. If you like being surrounded by the mayhem of NYC this is the perfect location.

Very cool Hotel just below mid-town. This is a Marriott flag property tailored toward the younger traveler. The rooms are small but very well appointed and very comfortable. You'll love the bathroom and storage options. Close to everything with a hip bar on the roof.

This hotel has a great, central location, microscopic rooms, beds that are so close to the wall that you have to crawl over your bed partner to get out of them, and pretty decent room rates for New York City. This hotel is good for single people or flexible young, patient people who are on a leisure itinerary. If you are looking for luxury, a good night's sleep, a place to stay on business, or are looking for relaxation this is not the place for you! We were there with family members that were around 50 to 60+, and they were miserable! We are in our late 30s, and we dealt with it okay until intoxicated people from the bar were making a lot of noise throughout the hall outside of our room in the middle of the night. Fortunately, security was responsive to this situation. They did remove the offending people who were also guests at the hotel. Management did provide us with compensation after we spoke with them about it the following morning. So, they did make it right with us. However, this hotel does attract a demographic of people that are very much in to partying, so disruptions of this nature are probably bound to happen here.

Great hotel. Good location near Time Square. Penn Station nearby with easy connection to JFK using LIRR. Room was big enough for solo traveler. Good bathroom facilities. Lots of shopping possibility nearby. Macy's 1 block away.

Our room was absolutely spotless, perfect for what we need and for only staying 4 night we had ample space. Really enjoyed my stay here, and trying the different bars (rooftop - stunning view, main bar - nice and relaxed and my favorite was in the seafood restaurant - great cocktails and cocktail maker). Our room was tidied every day and the staff was nothing but friendly. My next trip to New York, I will definitely be staying here again!

I was booked into this hotel on my trip to New York in May.Upon arrival myself and my colleagues were extremely tired from travel and just wanted to go to sleep. When we walked into reception the music was extremely loud and instantly you could tell this was a party hotel.The staff were very friendly however upon check in they told me that the room I had booked (a double room) wasn’t available until the next night as they had other guests staying. This was extremely annoying as my company had paid for a double room and the hotel was booked about 3 weeks in advance with a note to say late check in. As it was 1am by this point I just accepted and went to go up to my room. Upon arrival in my room I opened the door and no joke I wheeled my suitcase in, closed the door and could touch all four walls that’s how small it was. I brushed it off thinking it’s only for one night so proceeded to routinely make sure all was clean before settling in.To my shock when pulling the sheets back I found that the sheet and the mattress protector were soiled with bodily fluid from another guest. Not what you want to see when trying to settle in for your stay and especially not what you want to see after a long flight (by this point 1:30am in the morning). I called down to reception who after 5 minutes of ringing finally picked up. I explained that the sheets and bedding were unclean and to my UTTER AMAZEMENT the staff member said “would you like us to move you to a different room?”- there was no apology and no real care that the room was still unclean from the guest before. Nor did they seem to think it was an issue that I had a soiled bed. Anyway after speaking to them I got moved to another room- again a single bedroom- which was a bit bigger (and I couldn’t reach all 4 walls by standing in the middle)- the room was clean this time and I was finally able to get to bed at 2am.This hotel would be ideal for any teenager or young traveller who just wants a place to stay whilst they are on holiday and having fun. It is very much geared around partying- they have games in the reception, free drink token upon arrival and the rooms provide ear plugs with a note about if the music is too loud to use them. The decor is very modern, the rooms are compact but small so fun to look at but not the place to stay at all when on business.They do advertise for all groups of people which I do think is wrong considering the type of hotel it is. We had parcels delivered which we had to pick up from down the street at another location as they don’t take in packages. I have visited a fair few hotels in New York and although a lot of hotels can be small in the city- this took compact to a new level. The entire stay for me was not pleasant and I would personally never want to stay here again.

There was a mixup when I arrived at check in and it took about 15 minutes for them to figure it out. For some reason, my room was canceled but since they were able to get the room back, it wasn’t a problem. The room is very small with very limited space. I reserved the loft room since I needed two separate beds. The sink was in the hallway and the outlets for the dryer were in weird areas. What we didn’t like was the noise we heard throughout the night. We were woken up at least 5 times and did not rest well at all. Plus, the pillows were so flat and uncomfortable. They barely provide toiletries. Just body wash and conditioner in pumps in the shower. The location was ok. Next time, I’d rather stay at midtown or anything further away from the chaotic Times Square. Overall, we were not happy with this hotel. It was nice and modern but only provided the very basic essentials with limited space and the noise was frustrating to say the least.

I am giving a negative review due to an issue at check-in.A colleague booked three rooms under his name - he stayed in one and the other two were for myself and another. All of us arrived separately and I was the latest, arriving at 2am in the morning. I was tired and jet lagged after a long fight so I took my keycard and stumbled into my room.Only to trip over someone’s suitcase and stare the bare legs of someone who was already sleeping in the bed of this occupied room. I immediately rushed out of the room and went back to the lobby. It appeared I had been given the room which had already been occupied by my earlier arriving colleagues. At least the room was occupied by a colleague - it would have been even more uncomfortable had it been a stranger.I lost about 20 minutes standing in the lobby at 230am in the morning whilst an empty room was located. This negative experience coloured my stay at the hotel. I reported my feelings to the front desk both immediately after the event and also at check-out. I felt that my concerns were not properly acknowledged and I would prefer not to stay at this hotel again.

This hotel is not for business trips. No desk, no coffee, no taxi services during daylight hours, etc. Note that room is minimal with no view, windows are almost non existing. Location is fine although, near time square and penn station.

We stayed in this hotel for two nights while visiting the "Big Apple". The Moxy NY is in a perfect location in Time Square which provides easy access to all the tourist hot spots. The rooms are very small but equipped with everything you may need. The hotel offers a very vibrant atmosphere with the best rooftop bar in NY!!!

Modern hotel in good location, 10/15 minutes walk from times square. Found staff to be excellent throughout our stay. Very popular night club on roof level. Stayed on 15th floor and music was not an issue. If a very light sleeper, request bottom half stay and you won't hear anything at all.

We stayed for 4 nights. This property is in an excellent location. Very close to the theater district and many major subway stations, Port Authority and Penn Station. The rooms are small but very functional. There are ample areas on the second floor to relax and socialize, We ate at Legasa on the second floor which was very good. They had a great selection of salads and entrees. Check out the beet salad. They offered 20% off the total tab for Marriott Gold members. For a late night snack, check out the automated ice cream vending machine! Roof top bar is cool, but the drinks are VERY Expensive. $23 for a mediocre glass of wine served in a plastic wine glass. You can go up to the roof top for no cover charge as a hotel guest. Beware of rip off bar prices. Free coffee for Marriott gold members. The staff is very helpful and attentive. We will definitely stay at the Moxy our next visit to NYC.

Small rooms but practical. Cleaner than I expected... overall great experience.Not fan of the location though. Close to restaurants but about 25 well yo soho and other trendy spots Friendly staff but pricey for breakfast and lunch

Had a great time in NYC staying at the Moxy. Staff were really friendly. Room was very clean. Comfy bed. Great walk in shower. Everything in the room you needed. Great base to explore the city and the sights. Thanks for a great time.

Great value right near Times Square. A little loud with the rooftop bar rocking late into the night, but the hotel provides earplugs for light sleepers. Great business travel hotel and is the only place I stay in NYC.

Hotel is nice, staff is friendly, food is great.. rooms are a bit small, but clean. Central to everything in the city.. trendy and worth the repeat visit for sure. The elevators tend to get a bit crowded to each room, so do not be surprised.

This was the chosen hotel for a BA holiday including flights and although the location was very convenient for what we wanted to do we were not impressed with the service rooms and amenities. Firstly we were given a room which had air conditioning sounding like a drill working. There would be no way you could sleep there. We asked to change and were given a better room both being a better size and reasonable sounding air con. However only one flat pillow each on the bed. No wardrobe, just hooks on the wall and stupid furniture hanging up. A most uncomfortable bean bag seat. Bathroom was large and had a big shower. Essentially this was a wet room.
