There was nowhere to put your toiletries. With contact lenses that need a shelf for the container I took up the whole of the tiny shelf over the sink. The rest had to sit on the floor or on the windowsill in the bedroom. There were a couple of drawers provided under the bed and open shelves for anything else. Only hair/shower gel plus conditioner provided in large dispensing containers. Nothing else. We were told there is a store that guests can access. We looked for more pillows. None and having phoned housekeeping for more we expected them before bedtime. None came and we had to ask again and again. Only when the store was replenished we were able to get them. Breakfast was very limited. No fruit juice and only 6 or 7 options to choose from. This is a hotel that is clearly only interested in having a certain type of guest and if you don’t fall into their demographic you feel like you are invisible. Staff fool around laughing and joking in the lobby which we thought was most unprofessional.

My husband and I stayed at the Moxy for 3 nights, whilst sightseeing New York. It’s a different type hotel than we usually stay in and we were nervous after reading some of the reviews. The hotel itself has a cool feel to it, the rooms are small but nicely themed - industrial style. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The roof top space is lovely but there are 2 sides , one side is fine if you don’t want to talk - the music is so loud , the other side is quieter but they have coffee tables to eat from - to low !Lovely bar area with a pop up themed area - the Theme this week was fun fair - some games to play - you have to see it. Wow legasea the fish restaurant was amazing as were the staff. We were on the 8th floor and the noise was there on the Saturday night , but no earplugs required. Would definitely stay again

I stayed at the Moxy Time Square for Thursday to Sunday the Labour day weekend. There’s a lot of great things about this hotel and I don’t want it to get overshadow by my biggest issue with this hotel. The noise from the rooftop bar was crazy . You’re supplied with ear plugs but you can make out the songs so you know it’s loud. It goes way into the night 3am maybe 4am. This is New York so buckle up and go with the flow. This is not a hotel for families with young children. Great location to Time Square and excursions pick up. If you’re a solo traveller , you need not worry about safety . The hotel has many cool features to enjoy and admire. My room was spacious and all the amenities you need except for lotion, slippers and snacks and water to purchase. I had to ask room service for clean towels but that wasn’t a big deal to me. Everyone I encounter were very polite and very accommodating. The Magic Hour is a rooftop club/ bar/ restaurant that you have access to. It’s neat up there and the rooftop viewing is stunning. I didn’t eat at any of the other restaurants but they were buzzing every time I walked by. Would I return? Yes, the loud music at 2am wouldn’t stop me. This is NEW YORK the city that never sleep. I stayed and the TIME SQUARE area so noise, crowds and craziness is to be expected.

Good location, clean room. Bad elevator service, wait for long time and overly crowded elevators. Elevator system not optimized to balance demand across the 4 elevators. Bare necessities see pics. Not the best choice for business travel, fine for tourists.

Great location minutes walk to times square and subway to anywhere. Hotel itself was really urban and cool. Staff were so friendly and helpful. Great location and style of hoyel for younger ones especially. Can't wait to go back.

Eclectic hotel - small rooms but perfect for a quick stay. Easy walk to theaters. Front staff was very attentive and helpful. Worried that it would be noisy due to the rooftop bar (and the fact that earplugs are left on the nightstand), but pleasantly surprised that it was quiet.

Our 9-night stay at the Moxy was great! The hotel was pretty new and very clean. Staff was really helpful and cheerful. The location couldn't be better since it was our first time in New Your City: It was close to pretty much everything we needed. Walking distance from the subway station and to Penn Station. Also, there is a Dunkin' Donuts just one building away, which made our mornings very easy. We were worried about check in and check out times, but they stored our luggage for free and the process was very easy. We read lots of reviews before booking and a lot of people was complaining about the loud music that comes from the bar on the rooftop, but we stayed on the 6th floor and it was not a problem for us. Yes, we could hear the music some nights, specially on Sunday, but it didn't bother us at all since even the air conditioning noise easily cancelled out the music. We were really excited about the rooftop, but it was not really our vibe: the music was so loud we couldn't talk and people was way too dressed up. The view is nice, though. We would recommend this hotel for young couples, people traveling with friends and solo travelers. By the way: the smell at the reception was awesome and comforting!

I am a regular here at this hotel. It's conveniently located just a couple blocks away from the busting Times Square scene. A lot to do, see, and eat around the hotel. The rooms are cozy, clean and very nicely laid out with all the essentials that you'll need and not more. What I mean is this hotel is not a traditional type of hotel where you have many things and empty spaces that you don't need, which I love because I prefer a cozy room. It can get bit noisy due to the club right next (or on top) of the hotel, but that doesn't really bother me since I am not a light sleeper. The elevators can get crowded especially at nights and during weekends since they reserve at least one of them for the club and restaurant goers. They do need to rethink this situation a bit. Regardless, I do love the location and like the hotel enough to come back on a regular basis.
user_name:
PhucT
New York City, New York

review_body: Couldn’t have picked a better place to stay. The rooms are spotless - sure their compact but that’s the whole point... you sleep in the room nothing else! Public spaces are super modern and welcoming. Will definitely be returning , the only downfall is it’s quiet pricey...

Room was small but very functional for a one-week stay. Spacious shower/bathroom compared to rest of room. Check-in and Check-out was seamless. Modern concept elevator system is brilliant! Earplugs provided but not required (4th floor). Great value for NYC Times Square!!

I stayed at this hotel the last week of August with my female friend. We booked this hotel as part of a package with British Airways before going on to Las Vegas. The staff were really friendly and helpful on check in and we didn’t really have any need to speak to them for the rest of the stay but they were always friendly when we were coming and going throughout the trip. Now the rooms. We stayed on the 6th floor in what I think was a standard double room. It was exceptionally clean and modern and the bed was comfy. However, the bed was tiny, barely a double with a tv on the wall at the foot of the bed. I’m only 5ft5 and my feet almost touched the end of the bed. Anyone much taller wouldn’t fit. There’s no storage space and the floor space was tiny. 2 girls travelling for 10 days we of course had huge cases each and had to strategically plan how we would get ready in the mornings as there wasn’t enough space to have more than one case open at once. We spent a lot of time sitting on the toilet with the lid down as it was the only way we weren’t on top of each other. Luckily we’re long time friends as we were very cozy for the whole of our stay! We actually found it quite amusing and referred to it as our box. The whole reason we booked this hotel was for the roof top bar. We actually never made it during our stay as we couldn’t be bothered to get glammed up after a day out doing sightseeing and opted to go to other bars with more relaxed dress codes.The location is spot on! 5 minutes walk to Times Square and walking distance to most of the other attractions. My only issue was the air con in our room was so noisy and right by our heads when we were sleeping so it did wake us up a few times. All in all I would recommend this hotel, if I was to stay again I would not stay in a standard room unless it was for a night or two as there’s just not enough space! The upgraded rooms might be a bit bigger.

Bunch of girls hanging in nyc chose moxy hotel very cute and love the rooms very small but functional Great resturant and the rooftop bar so fun !!2 floor lounge was also a great hot spot Totally recommend this hotel

Newer hotel with modernistic rooms. The more informal lobby and the vibe of the hotel was appealing. The elevator concept of pressing which floor you want and then being told to go to which elevator seemed clever. For what ever reason it didn’t seem to work and congestion occurred often. Very frustrating to see other people arriving and requesting their floor after you getting their elevator arrive earlier. Biggest complaint was the music from their bar permeated through the floor into our room above right up to closing. Fortunately after full days beating around the city we were wiped and it did not cause too much disruption.

This was a great find for my bf’s 30th birthday surprise - having read about Moxy in Cosmo the decor and numerous bars sounded right up our street and we weren’t disappointed The location is fab, the welcome glass of prosecco a nice touch, great toiletries- they even had makeup wipes and the roof top bar is on point with cheeky bear topiary, a carousel and great views of the Empire State Building. Would definitely recommend!Also as a side note having stayed on 7th floor and read previous reviews about the noise and the complex lifts, I have to say we didn’t hear a thing from the bar (although the hotel are courteous to provide earplugs, but we didn’t need them) and the lifts really aren’t that hard to useThanks Moxy!

We had the best time in New York and MOXY made our stay even more perfect! The location was so good and the rooftop bar had the best view! The rooms had a charming interior and were very clean! Really loved it!!

I would really recommend this hotel. The location is great - 5 minute walk to times square. The rooms were very comfortable and clean. Beds were super comfy! Lovely staff and great bar/restaurant. I will be returning to this hotel the next time I will be in New York.

I had a wonderful stay at the MOXY. The mattress and shower were fantastic. Staff were very sweet and helpful. The food and beverages at the MOXY Bar & Egg Head were delicious. The Legasea restaurant was outstanding. The location was ideal. Only a 10 to 15 minute walk to all things "Broadway" and Times Square. I will not hesitate to rebook in the future.

HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE! A TRUE NIGHTMARE!Although I had booked my room and I had confirmation of my reservation, once I got to the Hotel (at 1:30am) they said that my reservation had been cancelled. Please note I had informed them that I was getting to the hotel late.They basically gave my room to someone else (most likely at a higher price) SINCE IT WAS HOLIDAY WEEKEND: WHO DOES THAT??The manager acknowledged the fact that I HAD A VALID RESERVATION, and they could not produce any further documentation of why my reservation was cancelled.Nobody informed me that my reservation was cancelled until I got to the hotel. They didn't offer any alternative accommodation...they just left me on the street until 3:30 am when I got a room in a different hotel.They are just the worst!!!DON'T BOOK A ROOM THERE UNLESS YOU WANT TO TAKE THE RISK NOT TO HAVE A ROOM!!

Although this hotel is clean and has a funky vibe - we booked a king size corner room with city views - well you can see the street I guess that counts as city views right? The bed well it looks more like my queen size bed from home and 1 person has to climb over the bed to get into bed! Too bad if you need to use the bathroom at night when the other person is sleeping! Defiantly not value for money and definitely shouldn’t have cancelled my booking at the Novotel for this hotel.

the hotel is very good located, but it is more for Young people, rooms are very Little and modern, what it shocked to me it is that there are not closets in the rooms, so you have to hang your clothes in the walls, there is not too much space for clothes if you are going to stay more tan 3 days, by other hand the bar is very lively, it has a roof bar with a lot of people at night, it seems that it is a very modern spot. reception girls are very friendly

So, I start this as someone who runs a cleaning services company. I was very impressed by the level of cleanliness of my room and impressed by the cleanliness of the public areas. The staff, including the reception staff, were polite and friendly. The room lived up to the website 'hype' - small as you expect from a New York hotel room - but well designed. I particularly appreciated the wall hooks to hang clothes from which meant that I could unpack all the necessary clothes I needed for my 7 night stay. The room was quieter than expected - i was on the 8th floor - and there was no appreciable external noise that disturbed me. I think the idea of having the 'Stash' rooms was excellent and very useful facility.The only negative really was the air conditioning in the room did not go below 68 degrees which was a bit disappointing given that I stayed during a heatwave.
The hotel is well situated minutes from Times Square and other local tourist attractions.The hotel is funky and all the staff we encountered were attentive, welcoming, helpful and very knowledgeable.

We would definitely stay at MOXY again. Lots of sights, shops and restaurants are nearby and the food at Bar MOXY is amazing. Don‘t miss out on the spectacular views you get upstairs (rooftop bar). And most important: staff is wonderful and so nice and helpful.

We loved the hotel! The staff is great, the vibe really fits to different people and (even if this sounds weird now) they have this unique smell which just stood out in NY. And the location! Only a few minutes to some Metrostations, great restaurants or shopping destinations and you can walk to the Times Square and the Empire State Building! The only 'negative' thing we noticed is that the rooms are relatively small (but have everything you might need, except for a minibar, which would have been necessary during this heatwave), so they had to put the AC right beside the bed and you would always feel a breeze during the night or get really hot when you turned it off. We recommend this hotel 100% and would go back in a heartbeat.

9 days weren't enough to solve the problems we had at Moxy NYC. Air conditioning without function in full summer and water leak in the room. Most of time the help desk attendants were useless. They couldnt provide the repair of the air conditioner even thought I have requested about 5 times. In addition, the room is too small and the bathroom box is open - so, everytime you take a shower everything gets wet. Moxy NYC is worried about being cool not about being a good hotel.

Stayed for a 4-night, the hotel’s location is great. Subway stations very nearby which allow businesses men to get to places fast and still enjoy great bars and restaurants in the evening. Rooms are on the small side and it can get noisy, but if you are looking for quite don’t come to new york. Staff is very friendly, and they make you fell right at home. Would definitely return for both business and leisure purposes.

Excellent location, great layout, marvellous look- very trendy and edgy. Just my kind of hotel. The staff are completely out of this world! So friendly, approachable and friendly! Room was very clean, newly built and cool. Housekeeping would write a cute message on the mirror everyday which was lovely. Will definitely go back to stay at the moxy.

Outstanding hotel, good price. It’s design was superb ! Ashley in the reception desk was so great, kind and friendly. The room too small but beautiful and comfortable, perfect for a couple ;) , the rooftop was great too but really expensive I think, anyway it is worth giving it a try.

Hotel with an original design. Very kind staff and always clean environments. High quality bar and restaurant. A must is the rooftop at the top to enjoy a drink with a view of the Empire State Building

I recently stayed at this hotel with 3 of my friends in the bunk bed room and it was great. The beds were super comfortable and were accompanied with terrific pillows. We found the bathroom roomy and loved the rain head shower. There was lots of hooks on the wall to hang our clothes. Room includes a hair blower, clothes steamer, shampoo and conditioner, also ear plugs if you need them. The location is perfect and close to many attractions, but there is plenty of street noise. The noise was not really a factor as we were usually so tired from our day's adventure we had no trouble sleeping. We had drinks at the bar and although the service was slow, it was fine. Please go and enjoy this gem of a hotel!

Ultra modern hotel, very simplistic (maybe a little too simplistic for my liking but that is personal taste). Very small room but to be expected in the centre of New York. Room mostly clean but with the shower/toilet being a wet-room there was a slight smell of stagnant water so had to purchase an air freshner. Location very central so excellent for accessing all tourist attractions, everywhere is within easy reach on the subway. A couple of bars to choose from (indoor or rooftop).

The stay was very comfortable, not excellent for 2 reasons: rooms are too small, and the service didn't always clean the room when we requested it.The hotel is new, cozy, there is a nice bar and techonological items.

The space is small yet extremely comfortable, hence the utilization of every available space with the ability to add your own touch and style. Bed was large and comfortable, room was extremely clean and cleaned everyday. Amazing WiFi and TV services along the whole stay. The hotel is designed tastefully yet unique with every space having a special take, from the entrance that smells great and is dimly lit to the lounge that has this wooden yet modern feel and the bedrooms that have also a quirky design (like a button on the phone for bedtime stories). Once during my week stay I needed a refill of tissues, the employee took my request with care and quality and before I even got back upstairs to my room it was already there for me. I would come time and time again to stay here and I think its a perfect fit with anybody i'll bring along. My stay here had to have been the highlight of my trip.

Dear Moxy We really loved our stay from the moment we got there to leaving. The check in was so easy the rooftop bar with the retro carousel was fabulous and the room was funky clean and roomy. Thanks again for help to Ashley and Dillon. Definitely will return.

Fab hotel! Right in the centre of the action. Close to Penn, MSG and Macys, to name a few. The room was spotless and compact - ideal for solo traveler or a couple. Staff are so friendly and helpful. The breakfast was delish especially the eggs and bacon. Would definitely recommend it!

In fact this is a very fancy, funny and friendly hotel. Rooms are quite small and don't expect a great view from your window but all the small details make it so charming and comfortable! It's a busy hotel, with a lot of rooms and visitors due to Legacy restaurant (very noisy but with a delicious food) and Magic hour rooftop bar (that is very popular). The only thing that was not so good was the noise, but to be honest it didn't bother us during the night.

Great hotel, room had everything we needed, although when we had arrived our room had been given away, had a stupidly long wait in reception to even get a room, even though we had booked through British Airways, despite this i would return, didnt find it noisy, the rooftop bar was amazing, i would reccomend reserving a table though as everything is reserved,

Sometimes you win, sometimes you lose.This hotel is a big loser. My upgraded room barely fits a bed, there is a collapsible "stool" hanging up for work at the small 2 x 2 "desk. But the worst part is the shower and bathroom are reminiscent of India and combined into one space. This is like someone vomited up one of those tiny houses and thought, let's make a hotel out of them.

This was such a great find while we were traveling on a budget. This was our first time to NYC, and we wanted to do it right. So we booked a room at the Moxy that was only a couple blocks from the famous Times Square. It's also close to the Penn Station with all of the major transportation routes. You can walk just a few minutes to most of the major attractions like Times Square, Rockefeller Center, Empire State Building, etc. The room was very clean and cozy. The rainfall shower was amazing after a long day exploring the city. The room was a bit small, but we only slept there so that was not a big deal. The hotel staff greeted us every time we walked into the lobby. They ofter had free candy waiting and were playing games in the lobby (very cool and fun). The hotel has a rooftop bar called Magic Hour. It's a great place to get a nice drink and take in the views of the city. It was never very crowded, which was nice. The hotel was a great experience, and I would definitely go back!

Here's the thing about Moxy--not all the kinks are worked out and there's a definitely learning curve to the experience. So know ahead what you want out of your hotel.My stay:I arrived sweaty and tired from the airport and was greeted by some hip 20 somethings playing around in the lobby. This 30s business travel felt a bit out of place. It was busy, and instead of one front desk there were several kiosks to check in, making it was difficult to tell who was staying and who worked there. No worry--I had downloaded their app, checked in early, and had a bluetooth card key. Problem was, I couldn't figure out the elevators. It seemed most people couldn't because you had to use your bluetooth key to get upstairs. And my phone's bluetooth wouldn't work for whatever reason.I made it to my floor with staff help, but my phone's bluetooth still wouldn't open the hotel door. So back down I went for a card key. Once finally in my room, I was in love. That waterfall showerhead...good bathroom amenities..the counter space on the sink. This girl was so happy. And the little clothing steamer? Life saver. I've always been an iron gal, but no more. Traveling for work, I had a lot to steam out, and all the pegs made it easy to do the whole lot of clothes at once. My one irritation with the room--so loud in the later days of the week. As the bar traffic below ramped up, it was very audible from a lower floor room. They do have ear plugs in the room (use them!) and my white noise app I was fine. That said, if you need it dead quiet to sleep, this will not be for you.Overall--it's a cool space. I loved the design of the rooms. But the bluetooth phone keys and noise from the bar need some work. If you are in your 20s and plan to be up late, go for it. If you need a quiet retreat after a day out, this will not be for you.

After a red eye from California we arrived at 10a.m.. They stored luggage and said our room may be ready early and they would call or text. We said no problem, as we had reservations at the 9/11 memorial at 1 pm. After walking for HOURS, we arrived back at 4:45 (we never got a call or text). They said the room wasn't quite ready and to wait in the 2nd flr lounge and they would get us. After 30 mins, no call, went back down, only to find that the room I specifically reserved (two sets of bunkbeds for 4 people) was not the room they had for us and it was not available. After clerk said he couldn't do anything, we asked for manager. Andrew Clayton, was super nice and told us we couldn't have room that night but could get it for the rest of our stay. He comped 4 of us breakfast for a couple of days and a room credit. We were happy.....until next day when we repacked, restored our luggage. Explored the city again and came back to find out the clerk had no idea what we were talking about . Had to grab Andrew again. He straightened it out and comped us more breakfasts. Frankly room was way smaller than first one with 2 double beds, but it all worked. Bottom line, staff needs more training, restaurant is good, but service is sketchy if you don't sit right at the bar. We refilled our own coffees, cleaned our own tables etc. But in the big scheme of things we spent more of our time out of the hotel, so when we were there we were just crashing. Candy cart from 4-7 pm is a sweet treat before dinner too! Location for us was fabulous.

I stayed in this hotel for a week in August with my girlfriend. The stay at the hotel was great but the lasting impression I am left with is overall a negative one. I paid for my stay when I arrived at the hotel however when I was paid my wage a week after I checked out of the hotel I had next to no money available. I called my bank and found out that there was a pending charge to Moxy hotel Times Square. The charge is more than I had originally paid for my week at the hotel, almost a full months wage. When calling moxy to inquire the charge the service I have received has been terrible, essentially everyone I have spoken to has apologised but passed the blame on to either my bank or booking.com, who I booked it with. I have been told that the money is some kind of charge that will be paid back into my account after 10 working days. I was not made aware of any such charges when booking or checking in to the hotel. I have been left with almost no money due to this and all I have had from moxy and even Marriott directly is an apology. No explanations as to why the charge was taken and why I wasn’t made aware of the charge and also no attempt to sort the matter has been made. I have booked through Booking.com before and this has never happened, I have stayed at plenty other hotels and again this has never happened before. After being on the phone to Marriott customer service for far longer than an hour all that they have let me know is that they have logged a case. No offers of sorting it sooner and no offer of compensation, which I believe is more than a reasonable ask due to the fact that an unauthorised charged has left me with not enough money to pay my normal bills or even feed myself. I still have no idea why the charge was taken and when my money will be returned to me. Had I been made aware that an additional charge would be made, even a temporary one, I would not have stayed at the hotel as it is entirely unnecessary. Overall the awful service that I have received from this company after a great stay has soured my opinion on the company as a whole. I was planning a return trip to the moxy next timeI travelled to New York however after this hassle and service I will not be going back or recommending to anyone. I don’t want any more apologies from moxy or Marriott, I just want an explanation as to why this has happened and I want the issue sorted.

Great centrally located hotel which is ideal for your First NYC experience as it is in walking distance to Mann sights. The location however is also the reason why its always busy outside and the complementary earpluggs are of good use. The staff is very helpful and the rooftop bar a nice after Sightseeing location to grab a good cocktail with a more private view of the Empire State Building.

I stayed at the Moxy's for my business travel and will come back next time I get the chance to work in NY. The hotel is very central and part of the Marriott chain, yet it feels like a boutique hotel with beautiful and colourful amenities. I love this place to relax during my free time - and the free drink at check in is always welcome!

This hotel is modern, very clean and has a great location, not far from Times Sqaure, subway stations, MSG, etc. My girlfriend and I had a great stay. I definitly recommend it for couples. Will definitly return there next time !

This is a very trendy hotel nearby Times Square. I really liked the decoration of the hotel rooms and the look & feel of the bars, not a typical business hotel or hotel bar. The only downside of the hotel is that it can be rather noisy in the hotel rooms because of the loud music and people talking in the bars.

- Service, worst ever I have experienced in the US- house keeping bad.  One day no show, one day only towel change only  (put on the floor! new towels!..) bed untouched and  room not cleaned at all, - grease smell from opposite kitchen - reception put a deposit on credit card and could  not explain the amount- incl breakfast very disappointing (pick one from 5  dishes and that’s it) not one single friendly word  spoken during breakfast. We felt not much  welcomed at all - room tiny with extremely loud air con - elevators very annoying (crazy system)We will not come back here and won’t recommend this place.

First let's talk about the noise. I read the reviews and thought that a good pair of ear plugs would make a difference as I'm used to sleeping through street noise as I live in London. The noise from the nightclub has to be heard to be believed. Staggeringly, boneshaking levels of noise so absolutely no way even my industrial strength ear plugs could help. In fact, the level was so loud my ears were ringing the following day as if I had been in the club. We are in room 706 so many floors below the nightclub and honestly I have never heard anything like it in my life. And it isn't stopping any time soon. They need to decide what's more important the club or the hotel guests because they can't do both. Every single night, even mid week, booming music until 3am. Seriously, if it wakes up my husband who sleeps like the dead no-one stands a chance of getting any sleep. So if sleeping is an important aspect in a hotel room try elsewhere. Secondly, the check in was as if it was a surprise we were there. Despite this being booked nearly a year ago. In the end, after waiting for a long time they gave us two rooms, two floors apart. Not ideal when your tween kids end up being on their own two floors away.It has quite a few redeeming features but overall the negatives such as the noise far far out weigh what it offers.
user_name:
Nadine C
West Yorkshire, United Kingdom

review_body: Had a fantastic first trip to New York City with my husband for our anniversary. This is a new hotel (not even a year old yet!) so everything was nice, clean, and fresh. Staff was extremely friendly and helpful with the techy additions to the hotel. The elevator system is a little confusing at first and could be slow at times but overall was not a bad experience.Super close proximity to Times Square, Madison Square Garden, the subway and much more! Very central to the main attractions, which we loved. Went to the rooftop bar called Magic Hour, got in for free since we were staying at the hotel, and had a fantastic time! Beautiful views!I will say that the rooms are fairly small (normal for NYC) and pretty basic. There was no mini fridge and the ice bucket, iron, and a few other small amenities had to be taken from a closet on the floor called "the stash" (cute!). There are no ice machines in the hotel so you have to ask the bartender to fill your bucket. Not exactly convenient but it was something we could work with.One fine note which may not relate to many people but while away, my parent's had called the hotel to try and arrange a small surprise for us since it was our 1st year anniversary. They wanted to purchase a bottle of wine from the hotel and have it sent to our room. Every time they called the number provided for the hotel they got the laundry service (who was very nice and patient) and when they finally got through to someone in customer service they were told that they can't do it. A little strange because they have the rooftop bar. It wouldn't be very difficult to charge the bottle to a credit card and have a staff member deliver it. Not a big deal but this is definitely not a higher end hotel service like you would find at a Hilton or Sheratin.

great place, great vibe, good food in the restaurants but...it is not a bad hotel, and I only give this feedback as an area to improve but the free prosecco would have been a good touch if it wasn't warm and stale and there were roaches in my room which completely made it uncomfortable.

A creative use of space! If you like a lot of space in a hotel for your things or to spread out, then this is not your place. Good place for a night or two in the midtown area. Read the reviews on the “tricky” elevators before reserving, but not worth a negative review from me. Tricky or not, there’s less wait time for your elevator - mission accomplished Moxy! Finally, our breakfast experience at the restaurant in the bar area could have been better. Not sure if they were short staffed that morning, but we waited a while for service, coffee refills and the check.

Was slightly worried about the size of the room after reading the reviews. We stayed for a week and it was lovely! The shower was wonderful and the bed was SO COMFORTABLE! The tv was a brilliant size and had Netflix available. They have done brilliantly utilising the sizes of the rooms and the decor is great. Bar is great (bar one miserable barmaid one night) - rooftop bar was fab and the location was perfect! No complaints and would definitely return, the air con in our room 1510 was a bit noisy sometimes and would randomly turn hot but wasn’t a big issue. Was also worried about the noise from the rooftop bar reading reviews and we were on floor 15 and could hear it slightly but not loud enough to bother us. Plus during the week they don’t tend to play music late anyway, they also provide ear plugs on the bed side table should you need them but we didn’t The hotel also smells amazing!! Was a great stay and would definitely recommend

The location was perfect - very close to Penn Station. The bathroom was the right size and the shampoo and conditioner were really good! It was clean as well. The room was not as small as I thought, there was enough room to store our luggage and yet still be able to walk around comfortably. Everyone that works there was extremely helpful - we had someone help us with the suitcases right from when we opened the door of the taxi! On the rooftop of the hotel there is a rooftop bar which is nice to visit.

The Moxy NYC is just awesome. Plus you earn points with Marriott. A boutique style hotel that is chic, modern and in the middle of where you want to stay. Rooms are so quaint, smaller but very manageable and 'new'. Hotel has a great bar and relax space and everyone was really friendly and super helpful. The location is perfect! Will definitely go back!

First time staying here as I normally stay over on the east side. This place is incredible. It’s modern with a groovy flare of funk. The rooms are stylish. The lobby bar is sweet and delicious drinks. It’s walking distance from Penn station, subway just steps away and just an incredible new place I will stay at again!

What a great addition to the Marriott portfolio. We usually stay at Renaissance or Marriotts but they were sold out the nights we needed in NYC. So we decided to try another brand. Wow... this place is really cool. Great restaurant and bar on the 2nd level and a really fun rooftop bar that will surprise you. The folks at Tao manage it. It’s really fun. For the rooms they are eclectic but very stylish. Good art and ideas for smaller spaces (nyc hotels can be smaller). This room didn’t disappoint. The bed is what you would expect in a Marriott and the bathroom is a really great design. The location is near Times Square but not in the craziness. Just close enough to make this a very central and easy to get around from spot. Loved it. Can’t wait to try another Moxy elsewhere.

I stayed at the Moxy NYC Time Square in May and was pleased with the experience. The location is convenient, the rooms are small but well-appointed, and the staff was helpful. While we all know NYC is a great spot for restaurants, the hotel does a great job of catering to the needs of tired travelers in-house. Great choice for Midtown.

Great location! Very close to Penn Station. Staff was very nice. Rooftop bar was fun as well as their lobby on on the 2nd floor was spacious and a great meeting spot for friends and family! Bed was super comfortable- even with the NYC noise outside I had a great night sleep which is unusual for me!

This was a great hotel stay! The staff were exceptional- very helpful and polite. The room was great and had a very cool interior. We used the gym and it had very new machines. And the rooftop bar was so fun !

Generally very good, but, elevator service was clumsy, room AC was not great, bummer that kids weren't allowed on the roof during the week. Would be ideal if there could be a limited kids happy hour so that they could enjoy the view.

location is very handy.the room was very nice inside, well thought, modern feeling.view could have been better though, room was 341staff very positive, young feeling, professional but also friendlythe rooftop bar Magic Hour is super nice, staff is friendly there as well, had a night out and also brunch, only positive feedback there. Actually maybe the fans should not point towards tables, that makes it cold, but we could see some people actually liked it so it is up to personal preferencemost importantly it was 1 of the rare places in NYC where we did not feel that the staff is being nice in order to get a tip, but is just natural and that's it.

The staff were attentive and friendly. Hotel felt extremely safe with the key card lift activation and the location was absolutely fantastic. A very comfortable cosy room, excellent bed, lovely bathroom! The space was utilised very well in the room and the decor was very chic. Only thing is that we could have done with a few extra coat hangers however other than that everything was great!

Neat rooms, great bed, millenials atmosphere. The rooftop is a good spot to have a drink. I got upgraded to a larger room that was perfect. The tv and sound bar in the room are embedded with Bluetooth and Netflix.

Room space is utilized very well. Our room sink didnt drain very quickly unfortunately but that’s the only room negative. I appreciated the ear plugs as we were on the 4th floor and could hear the music from the rooftop so def a necessity for all floors. The elevator situation wasn’t the best. Often had to wait a while and was only ever directed to use 2/4 elevators

Infuriatingly disappointing. Booked a family 4 bedded room months in advance. On getting here we were told the room was unavailable so would have to have a room with 2 (small) double beds. However we were promised a 4 bedded room next night. This also transpired to be unavailable. There are plenty of better, less expensive 2xdouble beds in NYC and the four bedded room was Moxy’s only unique selling point. Very disappointing- avoid if you are a family of four!! Shame, since the fabric of the hotel is ok.

Stayed at the Moxy for 4 days. We spent a little extra to get a suite which was on the 17th floor. Rooms are unique and stylish. Hotel staff are great - helpful and friendly. Even though the roof-top bar was directly above us on next floor, it's really not that loud. I was able to sleep just fine. Others say it's too loud, but it's really not. Yeah you can hear it faintly, but the sounds of honking horns and fire/ambulance sirens are much more audible. The hotel room was very clean. My wife who is likely OCD (by my diagnosis :-), decided to open everything and inspect every corner of the room looking for bugs, dirt, etc. She gave it a A+ so that means the place is really clean. We asked for a late checkout, but the request couldn't be accommodated. Instead, this hotel will store your bag for you after you checkout for a few hours so you can get some more time in exploring the city before you depart! That was awesome! The location of the hotel is great. You're right at 36th and 7th which means you're a 10 minute walk from the epicenter of Times Square. The hotel cost us ~$1,350 USD for 4 days which in Canadian, is like $4 million dollars. Glad my company paid for this trip. Only negative we'd like to mention is the perfume/scent that is pumped into the lobby and elevators. It smells like a mix of fresh-fruit and stripper perfume. Wouldn't be so bad if it wasn't so strong. All-in-all amazing hotel, amazing location, and we'd definitely return to the Moxy!

The hotel is in a Great location! The Room was spotless. I was there with my mother and son and had a great time. The Staff was very attentive and helpful. The rooms are small, but it’s NY, so you’re not there to hang out in the room anyway! I Wish we had checked out the lounges but we were too busy checking out the sites. I’ve already recommended the hotel to a few other people. It has a different feel, but we enjoyed it. Walking distance to Times Square and theaters. The hotel is ver Close to subway. We Would definitely stay there again on our next visit.

I've been staying at this hotel every week for the past 6, and I prefer to get checked-in by Shirin Azad. She has always been extremely attentive and goes above and beyond to ensure I have the best check-in and check-out experience as possible. Her service has prompted me to continuously stay at the Moxy for the weeks to come.

Excellent all around, although lacks valet service. Great service, great location. Excellent social atmosphere with restaurant and bar area, typical expensive NYC drink prices but that's expected. Overall excellent grade.

Great hotel on the great place. Very kind and helpfull staff. Hotel has great position in the midle of Manhaton. You have almost everything near. Metro stations of different lines are also very close to the hotel. And very good breakfest!

I stayed there for 8nights and all of them were OK. Staff was very friendly, kind and always eager to help - that i appreciate the most. We also had breakfests which were wonderful. I would recommend this hotel to everyone who wants a nice, quite and cozy place to stay for a night and during day wants to explore NY wonders.

Just stayed at the Moxy Times Square. Every interaction with the stafff, from the front desk, baggage room, bartenders, waiters to cleaning staff was a pleasure. The atmosphere was great too. I would highly reccomend this hotel.

Friendly staff very helpful; excellent location; very clean; good vibe; compact room; modern ambiance; Love the rooftop bar and the restaurant/bar on second floor; check in was quick and easy; no problems with noise

We absolutely loved our stay at the moxy! We travelled as two 18 year old girls and constantly felt safe and loved the experience! There is a smart TV which can connect to Netflix and Spotify in the room which was lovely after a long day exploring the city. Rooms were clean and modern and always felt like home. There was a Charli XCX after party on the roof of our hotel one night we stayed there and often the music from the rooftop bar was pretty loud but honestly as you’re so tired from long days out you barely notice it and just want to sleep! We definitely will return to the moxy if we visit New York again but may try one of their new hotels! Really liked the chain and would now trust a moxy anywhere. Would recommend to any young traveller coming to New York! Staff were lovely and efficient and there was even a free pick and mix sweet bar and games in the lobby! The location was perfect, not so close to Times Square that it was constant noise but only a 5 minute walk away. Amazing!!

The hotel is great fun and really funky. We used the gym and also enjoyed having drinks in the bar. It’s great to stay somewhere so close to where the action is in NY. We are planning to stay at another Moxy sometime.

Stayed for a week at the moxy Hotel and had an amazing time. The rooms and very modern, with air conditioning in the rooms and an amazing modern bathroom as well. The food for breakfast on the second floor at the moxy bar is brilliant would definitely recommend the eggs any way with sausage!! The only let down was the 2 fire alarms that occurred during our stay and the rooftop party which we could hear for a lot of the night and into the early hours of the morning.Fully enjoyed though and definitely would come back again and recommend it to anyone wanting a modern hotel room in the buzz of New York Citys Time Square

Being a new hotel, MOXY NYC is clean, well-appointed, styled and immaculately designed. The rooms were small but smart, power ports where you want them to be, good storage, hook system was such a good idea. For two people, there were two double beds and we even loved the modular cushions + bed = sofa system. However, all of this is foiled by an unimaginable volume of pumping, bass-heavy club coming from the rooftop bar. For at least two of the days of our stay, it went on until 4am. We became acquainted with the listed opening hours of "MAGIC HOUR" because it would be an indicator of when we could actually sleep. The ear plugs provided varied in quality (very odd, two different brands for two different requests) - but even ear plugs cannot quell the very potent thump of the bass beat. I am happy about so many things at this hotel - good value, central location, quick access to subway, fast & free WIFI - but not being able to get quality sleep and sharing premises with a night club (just think: lots of bodies in the building at all hours, and a really awful elevator system) takes all of that away.

Stayed here in August as a group of 4 in a family room. The beds were toe to toe with minimal room for our baggage and clothes. The room was clean, the bathroom area was very modern however you can see right into the shower/toilet through the screens.The location was excellent and a short walk from Times Square. Staff were friendly and always happy to offer water / help with directions etcHotel was quite noisy in the early hours, ear plugs are already in the room!Overall not ideal if you are travelling with large cases en route elsewhere as the rooms are quite small. However great location, clean and helpful staff. Ideal for young couples/groups.

I stay in hotels 75-125 nights a year and usually stay at Marriott properties. This was such a surprisingly pleasant hotel stay. I usually avoid Times Square at all cost but this location is great with a subway stop very close by. And it's actually tucked away and not the heart of the chaos that is Times Square so that is a plus. On top of that, the service at the hotel is fantastic from check in to check out. I highly recommend this hotel for younger travelers.

The hotel is located within walking distance of Penn Station; great location, close to shopping and everything else. Check-in was smooth; early check-in wasn't available but they store luggage for free until your room is ready. The shower was excellent although am not sure I Iiked that the bathroom sink was outside of the bathroom and in the actual room; I tend to splash around a little. The wifi was excellent.

The hotel has the perfect location, you can nearly find the subway and good restaurants, shops etc. The rooftop bar is awesome.The personnel was always friendly and very helpfull. For a short trip to NYC I can only reccommand you this hotel.

I want to preface this by saying I never complain about hotels. I didn't even have a trip advisor account until right now. I made one just so you could know how terrible this hotel is. Avoid the Moxy Times Square at all costs.They seem to put having a hip, cool image ahead of making guests comfortable. If you are looking for a room to stumble back to at 4 AM, wasted out of your mind, this is the place for you. However if you're looking for a good night's sleep and basic amenities, Do Not Stay Here.The rooms are bare bones, and small, which is fine and to be expected. The beds are comfortable enough. But the rooms are missing some things I've come to expect. There is no coffee, no ice buckets or ice, no fridge, no hand lotion, nor extra pillows and blankets. When you check in, they tell you that you can get some of these things from a closet in the hallway on your floor. However, each time I've gone to "the stash" as they call it, it had been picked clean. Also, the fact that I have to get dressed and leave my room to get coffee is kind of unforgivable. Its 2018, I mean... come on.My personal experience at this hotel has been awful. it is impossible for me to get a good night's sleep here. The first room I was put in was directly above the bar. It came with earplugs. This, I should have known, was a bad sign. The bass booming through my floor until 4am made it IMPOSSIBLE to sleep. On my third night, I asked to be moved. They didn't have anything in the 'quiet' areas of the hotel, so I was moved to the 17th floor... which is directly under their rooftop bar. It's quieter here, but still so much bass booming all night long. I have earplugs in and it's still absurdly loudI've stayed in half a dozen other times square hotels. I'm not bothered by street noise or people in the hallways or any other normal sort of hotel noise. This, however, is unbearable. I really regret picking this hotel.I want to note that the staff has been nothing but excellent. They did their best to accommodate me, but this hotel is just not my scene and it's not for anyone who expects to sleep at night.This is not a good hotel. It is much more like a college party house. It's designed for the party to go all night and then for people to stumble off to their rooms to pass out. This is not for me. It has been impossible for me to sleep here and I would NEVER stay here again.

Central location. The room is perfect with fine beds. Tv with you tube and Netflix. The bathroom had agreat shower. WiFi is working perfrect. From the rooftop bar you dan make a great picture of the Empire State building

Stayed for one night between cruises on Friday 3rd August 2018. Reception were fine & we stored our luggage free of charge because we arrived early. The room was "small" (the headboard of the bed touched one wall, the left edge of the bed touched the end wall & the foot end of the bed touched the other wall so in effect the room was 6 feet wide by about 12 feet long; couldn't fully open a suitcase on the floor, without it stopping the door opening & also stopping entrance into the en-suite - OK we thought, it's just for one night & it's clean. The en-suite was good (actually nearly the same size as the bedroom !). After having a drink later in the evening we went back to the room about 11pm - we then noticed two sets of earplugs on a bedside table & a bit later we found out why, woken by incessant music from the nightclub which was somewhere above us I presume. The ear plugs were pretty useless & the fact that they were there signified the hotel must have known about the noise issue - difficult to get any uninterrupted sleep until about 2am when we think the music finally stopped. It wasn't worth ringing reception as I wasn't too keen on having to dress, re-pack & move rooms even if they had one. Next morning breakfast was good. All in all not a great experience & I'd recommend anyone to ask when checking in about the size of the rooms & possible noise from nightclub - my advice to the hotel is to invest in some effective ear plugs & advise customers in advance !!

This was our first visit to New York, where we were celebrating our anniversary. We booked the Moxy as wanted something central of up and downtime, the Moxy is a 20min walk to the southern edge of Central Park and a touch longer to Soho.The hotel is very modern, plenty of staff in he main reception. We were given room 1205, a corner room. Fairly spacious with enough room to hang 5 days worth of clothes. Shower was brilliant, very powerful. I was fairly apprehensive given I'm a light sleeper about the reviews concerning noise however being completely truthful it didn't bother us. Whether this was the outside room, us both being knackered or a combination of both I'm not sure though!We didn't eat at the hotel or go to the rooftop bar but found the 2nd floor bar extortionate for drinks, there are numerous places nearby for a lot more reasonable. There are no inroom coffee facilities but again "Dunkin Donuts" and "Andrews coffee shop" are both brilliant and within a 30 second walk from the front door. All in all it was a good hotel for the location and we would go back again, with the request for room 1205. P.S. Moxy what is your lobby fragrance? Smells great!

Hotel was amazing. Location was very central. Staff were lovely and very friendly. Hotel was modern and very clean. Bar was lovely and had a very nice atmosphere. Couldn’t find any fault to the hotel. I would definitely recommend and will return again!

Loved this hotel!!! Great staff!!! The location was perfect. Walking distance to Times Square and plenty of stores.Lots of great restaurants in the area as well.I didn’t get a chance to check out the rooftop bar but I will next time.

While vacationing in New England, I unexpectedly had to go to New York City to apply for a visa for work. I was planning on staying in town for just one night. As this was an emergency, I just booked the cheapest Marriott property in Manhattan and Brooklyn through the Marriott app the same night I arrived - for that particular night, it ended up being this hotel.The location is good - I was about a twenty-five minute walk from the foreign consulate I had to visit. The rooms are quite small - my wife and I got a room with two double beds. My wife has regular conference and video calls in the morning, so she had nowhere to really sit other than on the bed, which she wasn't really happy about. As she also does video calls, she also mentioned that the lighting is quite low, which made video calls difficult. The room layout is poor, not making the best usage of the space - it was basically a shoebox with two two beds on one side and a small way to get to a small bathroom. I wasn't expecting a large room, but without a desk, without a place to sit, with just two beds taking up the whole area, it really emphasized the small size of the room.The gym is overall quite good -

From the time I booked and wanted to pay in advance I knew it was going to be a terrible stay. I called three times and finally had to ask for a manager Tammy to charge my card. She was so nice and if it wasn’t for her I would have probably canceled my reservation all together. My husband and I were checked in by a front desk agent I think his name was Jamal, didn’t really look happy to be there. He charged my card 9.59 and didn’t even tell me what it was for until I saw it on my card and asked him; he said it was for the taxes on the room but never said anything on check in, that sounds shady to me. At least explain to me that you’re charging my card and what it’s for. Every day there was a bug, dirt/blood on all of our towels which is unacceptable. The hair dryer in the room was dirty also. I’ve attached pictures for your records. Last night my husband and I were locked out so we went to the front desk and the front desk agent said she’d put a note on our reservation and have someone from engineering. Didn’t exactly know what that meant but okay we went back up to our hotel room but were still locked out. Waited 10mins and still no one. My husband had to use one of the phones outside our room to contact someone to take a look at our lock they fixed it. Then today before we checked out we heard someone knocking on our door at 8am with our DND light on and asked to fix our door. No one communicated with one another that it was fixed last night so we were disturbed very early even with the DND light on. The front desk agent who checked us out was very nice as well as the girls who held our bags. At checkout I asked for an itemized receipt and never received one showing all my charges it just says $0.00. I will never ever go back.

Had the pleasure of doing a group brunch recently. This is a unique spot. Not your average brunch menu or vibe. And definitely not family friendly, Upon entering you have some sense that this is going to be very different. Sort of a fun-house type atmosphere. Be prepared to enter a scary elevator cage that only fits 4 guests at a time. Once on the roof top it was clear this was going to be fun. The service was top notch even on a very busy Sunday afternoon. The food - delicious & plentiful. My only negative would be the comfort level with respect to temperature. This was a hot afternoon. Although there is a cover on the roof, the sides are all open & that is where the tables are set. We were sitting in the scorching sun all afternoon which was not comfortable. We moved our tables inward to avoid direct sun, but to no avail. The rooftop appears much larger on the website. The dining area is quite small, so there is limited seating choices - majority in direct sunlight. I think they would benefit greatly by some umbrellas or additional coverage of some sort. Other than that, this was a great time & I would highly recommend it.

Great location, very close to Macy's, hat lot of fun shopping in the area. Rooms are a bit small, and cannot be rated a 4 star. Staff is great and very helpful. Many places to have coffee and lunch nearby (within 2 minutes of walk)

Cool, modern, friendly hotel. Great location and incredible staff. The rooms were very cozy and well organized. All of the staff at e every level were professional, witty and knowledgeable. We asked for restaurant recommendations and Michael told us about an amazing restaurant. Highly recommend Moxy!

My family stayed here for a week vacation. We loved the hotel. Room was small but very well designed to maximize space. It was modern and cool. Comfortable bed. Loved the amenities. The wifi connection was great. Every staff member we encountered was very helpful and friendly. I liked the casual attire of the front staff which gave an easy going feel to the hotel. Check in and check out was quick and easy. Location was fantastic! Close to almost all subway lines, restaurants, theatres, time square etc. Also the Stash Room was a nice bonus. Only one concern, we took an extra blanket from the stash room but was dirty. It look like something spilled on it. Would definitely stay here again!

Fun hotel. Different from most. Laid back yet professional approach to their customer service. I enjoyed having so much on site. Rooms are fun. Loved the showers and the products offered. Farooz at the front desk was so helpful and he remembered that it was my boyfriends birthday numerous times and continued to ask us how the trip was going while we came in and out. He was great to have around!

This is a great place with a fabulous location. Lots of fun if you're interested. Great beds for a great nights sleep. Excellent bar and bar menu. Love Legasea! Love the elevators! This is a boutique hotel without boutique hotel prices. Best value in NYC!!

We visited the Moxie for its stylish, posh look and were hoping for a romantic weekend but won’t be back- ever. The room was tiny, allowing me to empathize with those who are claustrophobic. The bathroom looked like a clean, wanna-be subway corner, with the sink around the next wall. And unless you are a partier, love reminiscing about your party days by listening to loud bass until four in the morning, or simply don’t want or need to sleep, you will likely not sleep well, despite the cozy, comfy bed and pillows. Take your money elsewhere.

We stayed at the Moxy NYC on August 11th for one night. We were in the city to see Harry Potter with our granddaughters and needed a hotel near the theater with four beds. The location was good and the twin bunk quad room was perfect for us.We used the garage right next door to the hotel. I got a promotional code by downloading their app and added an extra hour which came to $55 for 25 hours of parking. We were greeted by a friendly, young staff when we arrived at 11:30 am and although we couldn't check in we did leave our luggage with no problems. When we returned to the hotel between plays our room was ready. We had a corner room on the 7th floor overlooking 7th Avenue. The noise was absolutely no problem as it was minimal. Yes, they do give you earplugs, but I think that everyone gets them and we did not need them. The beds were very comfortable and we slept well.The elevator system worked well once you quickly figured it out. The check in was quick and smooth. We were given four tokens for a complimentary drink at the 2nd floor bar. We had the complimentary prosecco and the girls had sodas. We were able to sit in the second floor lounge area in large comfortable chairs and then we were quickly off to the theater for the show.I would definitely recommend this hotel and suggest that everyone read the information describing the rooms and the size. They are small, compact, and perfectly fine for a stay where you do not plan to hang out in your room. The bathroom door is made of frosted glass and did not give a lot of privacy, but if you choose a small hotel room like this then you wouldn't expect the privacy you would get in a standard hotel room.The service was friendly, quick, and we had absolutely no complaints just compliments for the staff. We would definitely stay again for a quick visit to NY.

My young adult children (18 & 19 year old) stayed for 8 nights. They found it very comfortable, (it’s a budget hotel so rooms are small!). Great location to explore NYC. Penn Station subway and train station very close. Plenty of shops and a variety of eating place nearby. Helpful and friendly staff. My daughter got stuck in elevator for nearly an hour, they dealt with problem as quick as they could, engineers on site within minutes and they compensated her with $75 voucher.  The only negative is when my daughter got back to the U.K. she discovered they had charged her twice for their stay (taking her into a negative balance and unable to use her debit card) and being students they used a debit card and the bank can’t do much to stop the transaction. So she is waiting patiently for Moxy to sort the problem out. I will keep you posted on my dealings with the Moxy accounts team and I hope for a positive out come.

The Moxy is a very reasonably priced (For NYC) hotel in a great location! It's just about 10 min to times square. The rooms are comfortable, not spacious but just enough room. You really feel like you're in New York :) Now I wouldn't say this is a luxurious hotel but its chic and the rooms are very well kept.

Great hotel centrally located with a small stylish and compact room that was well appointed and made a great use of the space. Incredible gym facility. Go Marriott - nicely done and I look forward to staying in more Moxy’a around the country.

+ location+ friendly staff+ modern design+ rooftop bar+’legasea’ restaurant- small rooms- Bedroom hasn’t been cleaned for three days —> after complaining it was fine for the rest of our stayWe’ve been there a week, and we would consider going back.Most of the hotels in NY are small (for this kind of budget) but they made the most of it. Very efficient with their space available :)For couples—> I would recommend a king size bed.

When we arrived around 8:00 PM, we were told our room was not available even though I had made the reservation months ago and guaranteed it with a credit card. We were told we could wait in the lounge until they figured something out and they would call my cell when they were ready. After an hour with no call, I again went to the desk. They clearly had not been working on anything. I stood there until they did something. They gave us three alternate rooms and told us they would move us to our original room the next morning.In the morning, I was told that our new room would be ready in a couple of hours and they would take great care in making sure our luggage was moved to the new room. They would also call my cell when the room was ready. Never received a call. Returned to hotel late afternoon to find that nothing had been done. We ended up moving our luggage ourselves.On third day we returned to our room to find that housekeeping had taken the generous tip I left but they did nothing to the room including not even picking up our wet towels and replacing them. When we returned at 9:00 PM to find the room still not taken care of we called the front desk. They told us that housekeeping had gone home for the day. We pressed them and they ended up sending someone to clean the room while we waited in the lounge at a time when we were tired and ready to go to bed. I had been planning for this trip for months...saving up money since January. It was one of the few times our now grown children would be able to join us. Part of the reason we picked this hotel was that they had a room with four beds we could stay in and we hoped this would be a place we could rest between activities. With all the transitions and problems we ran into, that ended up not happening. We had stayed at Marriott hotels many times in the past and found them to be consistently well done. This was such a disappointment on so many levels.

If you don’t want to sleep, this is the hotel for you! Booked 9 nights here with my teen and tween. Leaving after 3 nights to switch to the Hilton Garden Inn. I wanted to love this place, but the quirkiness just tipped over to irritating. The 4 elevators are amazingly efficient if you know how to work them. Unfortunately after traveling 13 hours and getting a 5 minute lecture on all the other hotel amenities, I didn’t understand how to work them upon checkin. No valet service is offered to help you to your room. As the elevator requires you to select your destination from the OUTSIDE and to wave your room card to get both TO your room and BACK to the lobby, it’s possible to find yourself stranded on the 10th floor when your card gets demagnetized and you’re locked out of your room. That didn’t actually happen, but my card did get demagnetized 4 times before I had one that worked both the elevator and my room. (No I didn’t have it near my phone or another card). Good times. I know NYC has smaller hotel rooms and is noisy. But the bunk bed room literally has no place to sit down if you are over 5’3”, because the bottom bunks have a low clearance. There is no chair in the room. And the music from the Magic Hour (4 pm - closing, sometime after 3:30 am when I’m typing this) at the 18th floor rooftop bar reverberates through the empty core of the hotel, waking me from a dead sleep on the 10th floor. The staff is all really nice. So nice they will tell you whatever you want to hear. One was “so concerned” about the noise that they were going to notify the bar to “keep it down.” Hahahaha. I am in a room facing the inside of the hotel. Some rooms face out, so maybe the acoustics are different. I asked to change rooms. The first person I reached was going to “not give up” until I was happy. He transferred me to someone who told me they were full and there was nothing to be done. Bye Felicia. The first morning I was here I got a 7 am wake up call that I didn’t request. (After getting to sleep at 3:30). He apologized for the inconvenience, but definitely seemed to think *I* was the one who had made a mistake, when confirming my room number. Later that day I talked to the front desk and it was still in the computer for the next day. The bathroom is a nice size and the shower is hot with good pressure. The high quality shampoo and conditioner in dispensers was appreciated. The two inch gap between the closed shower door and the wall results in a small flood with every shower. No fan in the bathroom means the humidity in the room is high. AC cannot be set below 68 degrees to help dry things out. There is a magnifying makeup mirror that I loved. Unfortunately the lighting in the bathroom is one bulb in the center of the ceiling, making the application of makeup tricky since your head casts a shadow across said mirror. But I think my favorite part is the bathroom door of almost see-through glass that neither locks nor blocks any sound. My teen son was shocked to discover he could be on his top bunk and pretty clearly see his mother sitting on the John. I tried to capture the noise but my iPhone really doesn’t do the acoustics justice. I think the AC fan took the edge off the noise in the recording, but not so much in reality. Looks like I can’t post video so I’ll just post a pic of my cocktail. The “Got Moxy.” It was really good. The hotel offers no coffee in the lobby or the room. Of course there are multiple restaurants and stores nearby.... but I thought in 2018 a Marriott would have some coffee somewhere. Its 3:45am and the music just stopped. Time for bed!

Had 5 nights here Hotel is in great location younger crowd, lots of food and pubs nearby and close to penn Station subway and train station location can't be beat.Bar on site good place to chill especially as a solo guest. Gym is okay does the job. Staff good helpful rooms kinda strange layout but functional and kept clean.Negatives.AC very noisyLots of street noise due to locationElevators kinda slowIf I come back to city I'd stay here again.

Amazing hotel! The location was superb, only 5 minutes walking distance from Times Square and very close to subway stations. Next to Macy's. Rooms were small, however very modern design and clean. We loved it.

super stay nice staff would come again, great roof top, great breakfast, modern rooms, best power shower of all our trip through the states, central location with just a few minutes from times square and other sights

The hotel is just south of Times Square so it an easy walk. If you are comfortable with the NYC Subway system, there is great access to all points of the city. The rooms are purposely small but cozy and efficient.
user_name:
TSquared303
New York City, New York

review_body: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Moxy near Times Square. Everyone on staff was very helpful. The rooms are very cool and highly functional. I would recommend lower floors if sound is a concern. There is a club on the top floor.

If you’re looking for a simple and unfussy hotel at a great price in the center of Manhattan, consider staying at this one. Very lively atmosphere, with about it equal proportion of business and leisure travelers.
Very nice and young hotel near Times square and empire state building.Metro station just two streets ahead.Choice of 5 meals of breakfast.The room was clean.I would recommand the hotel to everyone.

Pros: We are a family of four with a son and daughter who are 15 and 17 and don’t want to share a bed. So the bunks worked out well. At first I was worried that we were too close to the roof bar being on the 16th floor only two away but I never was bothered by noise the seven nights we stayed here. I did use earplugs which are provided for the street noise. Comfy beds with reading lights make you feel like you are on a train. Location is great near everything. By passed the line at Best Bagels and used Liberty which we really liked for an inexpensive breakfast. Free proseco at the 2nd floor bar. Cons: House keeping missed our room the first day after six hours out. The other days I called when we left but still had another time after all day out our room wasn’t cleaned. The shower could use a grout scrubbing but not so much as I wanted flip flops. Some of the shelves for items are lose and need repair and I lost my reading glasses because the bunk couldn’t be moved. Small annoyances.

The hotel's location is perfect. Rooms are small but have a cool style. Cleaner on my floor didn't clean properly, opposed to cleaner on my friend's floor. Personell's very friendly. Rooftop bar's great but expensive. Loud during some nights due to music in the rooftop bar. Families with small children won't be happy there because of the size of the rooms and the loud music during nights. Great for party people though.

Clean modern rooms, but very small as can be expected in New York, our room had a tiny window looking out onto the street, which was no problem for us as we were out and about literally all day and into the early hours. Check in staff are friendly but don't exactly go out of their way to help. Moxy bar staff are very nice but breakfast service was a bit slow. Frankie was one of the bartenders who helped us while we had drinks in the evening and he is fantastic! I heard people at breakfast complaining about the noise at night, we had a bit of street noise but I didn't hear the club once so if you are worried about that maybe ask for room 1235 (remember tiny window though), also the aircon gave issues twice but they quickly reset it, might be a problem if it happens in the middle of the night. All in all, it served it's purpose and for me to have a newer, cleaner hotel was more important than having huge space and a view.

Travel solo? Like NY? Looking for downtown hotel? Dont look furtherThis place, is the talk of the town,and its easy to say why. Super clean. Hip room. Fantastic location.Staff that is always available to help you!Plus you enjoy your privacy, if you feel so.Bravo!!

This hotel was excellent. It is conveniently located to Penn Station. The rooms are cleverly and comfortably designed. The workout room is clean and well- equipped. The food in the bar and the restaurant, Legasea was delicious. I would highly recommend The Moxy.

We liked the cool vibe and idea. The location was great! But the execution was a bit lacking. For starters, I did online check in and gave the time we'd arrive. When we got there, they told us our original room was ready, but that they were giving us an upgrade that was still being cleaned and could we wait a little bit. We ate lunch, checked again... still not ready. Ok, it was an upgrade. Came back an hour and a half later, and got the original room...no upgrade...no explanation...no mention of an upgrade having been in process. Grrr. No mention of the fact that housekeeping is not daily. Not even every other day. Not mentioned on the website. Not mentioned at check in. Housekeeping came once the whole week unless I specifically requested it. That might have been ok if I had known there was no housekeeping. It just came across as odd having not been communicated at all.Be aware of the noise if you are anywhere remotely near the nightclub. It's loud. Really loud. Until 3 am on Thursday, Friday and Saturday nights. They put a set of ear plugs on your night stand. They know it's loud. We did not know it was going to be loud and nothing was available to get moved away from how loud. I didn't see it on other reviews. Thought it was worth mentioning.

My first time at the moxy hotel was not a good experience. I purchased a 4 bunk bed room for me and my family and when I arrived there they stated they did not have my room type available. Then told me they had a double double bed only available but we did not want to sleep with each other it was four of us. I was very irate but then this girl can’t really remember her name but she had very nice green hair I think it was Jasmun said hold on let me try something. So I waited and when she came back she let me kno she got in contact with housekeeping and she had them setting up a room for us I was so relieved. I was going to get another hotel.she made my day much better. The room was very small and not really anywhere to place your bags but was happy I can sleep alone. Theirs also not really any perks for us elite members and the roof top was horrible. They say it’s free for guest but then the bouncers make their own prices. I will not be returning and if so it would only be for the customer service I received.

If you need a great spot to relax, do work or just enjoy a coffee or cocktail, go check out the lounge. If you can get into the Magic Hour on the roof, you will have a blast! Staff is great, fun, lively envirnoment

We had a week in NYC with our base at Moxy at 36th St. It was perfect for us – the room was small, but efficient and clean. Location was splendid, most subway lines were within a five minute walk and Penn station only three blocks away with swift access both on Amtrak and from the airports. You could probably find a hotel with spacier rooms, more comfort and so on, but We'd rather spend on restaurants and attractions than the hotel, which makes this absolutely perfect.The downsides? The hotel has four elevators, which proved too little during busy afternoon hours. A few times we had to wait for way longer than acceptable for the elevator down. Also, the air conditioning unit was quite loud and located next to the bed. Not too peaceful. (Actually, that bothered us more than the street noise, which was noticeable but no probs for us)But for the price and this location, we could very well live with the flaws.And finally, the staff was excellent. Everyone we met was service minded, with a smile on their face. We really had a wonderful stay.

Service was very average. No tea/coffer in rooms. The bar is beyond a bar more like a night club that boomed out loud music to the early hours of every morning, so much so there are earplugs in the room. Can't even enjoy the rooftop bar and sip a lemonade and take in views during the day if under 21. Not really for older or families.

I love the MOXY NYC! This was my first time visiting NYC and I was worried about finding a hotel that was in my price range and clean... the Moxy exceeded my expectations. The staff was friendly, the location was AMAZING and the rooms were so clean, modern and comfortable.

I did a little research and read some reviews before settling on this hotel, so I was prepped for what we were getting. My husband and I planned a long weekend trip in NYC and didn’t expect to be in the room a lot. We wanted a comfy place to sleep and that is what we got. We booked a double room and got breakfast included through a travel site. The check in process was quick - young girls in t shirts and leggings checking you in on iPads. Elevators operate from the outside which was fine for us but seemed to oddly cause others a lot of confusion. The bedroom was small but very clean and all we needed. The hooks on the walls, small table, cubbies, and USB ports made the entire space functional. Would I have wanted to be here with my 3 kids? No way! But for the two of us, it was just right.We were on the 12 floor and could sort of hear the bar at night but nothing that was an noisier than any other hotel I have stayed in. They do provide earplugs if needed. The air conditioner kicked on and off often, but never did really get cold given leaving it on 68 all day and night. The shower was incredible. I want to stay here again just to take a shower in that incredible waterfall rainshower pure joy experience. Seriously - best shower ever. Breakfast was surprisingly good at the bar on the 2nd floor and there were lots of cozy sitting spaces if you need to spread out a little. Overall, I think this is a great option if you aren’t going to be in your room a lot (and who would be when there are so many things to do outside???).
