I would suggest a little more info at checkin - I had read about the stash but no one told me where it was or what was in it. I just had to go exploring when I needed more pillows. This hotel also has a very young vibe. We felt a little old when in the elevators - we are mid-40s and were nearly 2x the age of everyone else staying and working in the hotel. I don’t really care but I could see someone feeling out of place. Also - the art is weird. I really wish someone could explain to me what the art above our bed was supposed to represent :)

The hotel was smart and clean and high tech although they had not notified us of works being carried out all week! Staff at the reception were friendly, however moxys after sales care is appalling! We were charged double (nearly an extra $600 was held from our account) in an unauthorised (therefore illegal) transaction by the hotel. 2 weeks later they had no explanation for us and we still didn't have our money which meant we had to really watch our spending throughout our trip! A month on and thankfully after multiple calls we have our refund but still no explanation or apology for ruining our trip and no replies to our emails! Terrible customer care!

The restaurant was delicious and the bar area was funky and fun. I loved the small and functional rooms that had everything so needed. There were even little steamers for my clothes. I was surprised that it was also quiet for being in timesquare. I’ll definitely be back again.

It's not your average hotel, so don't expect a big reception area with uniformed staff and fancy furniture. It's actually quite a small foyer with no furniture at all, but the 2nd floor has lots of comfy seating areas and a couple of bars to relax in. There's also the rooftop bar if you feel like splashing out on an expensive cocktail or two. Not cheap but worth at least one visit. Rooms are small but have everything you need, including a clothes steamer which came in handy. My only criticism was that the air con was too noisy to leave on at night as it kept us awake. We soon worked out that if we needed extra pillows, towels etc we had to visit the "stash" cupboard.Like I said, not your average hotel.Staff were really friendly and helpful (found us one of the quieter rooms when we requested it) and the free bottles of water at the front door were really appreciated and sometimes there was a big jar of free candy too.It's not actually on Times Square, but that's a good thing, as it's close enough without being in the thick of it and meant we could actually get some sleep. A short walk to Penn Station meant we could take the train to JFK airport, which is cheaper and quicker than a cab.I think it's definitely aimed at the younger end of the market, but my friend and I were celebrating turning 50 and didn't feel out of place. Would definitely go back.

Great stay....just what I needed the room was a bit on the small size but It was perfect as I was by myself. The decor was amazing so was the colour scheme and the over all design.I was in a twin room. The only con was that my room sisnt overlook times square.

Great location, super clean, fun. Be aware the rooms are purposefully small, and not suited for working in them. Moxy does have plenty of workspaces on the 2nd level that work great for me, but don’t plan on being productive in your own guest room. Staff is awesom. Great place as long as you are aware of what you are getting.

our office is around the corner and i'm going to recommend other colleagues to use the moxy when they visit our ny office.i appreciate the amazing service of the crew. thank you very much for help making my work trip pleasurable.

Great location with a very clean room, beds are very comfortable. High tech, industrial look to the room. Plenty of room for sleep but not a lot to just spend time in room. 2nd floor lounge/bar area is a really comfortable place to hang out/read/meet with people. Highly recommend.

Clean rooms and a very good ambiance. The room was a little bit smaller then we thought. The location is perfect. You're in the middle of Manhatten and it's a easy walk to Times Square, Madison Square Garden and the Empire State Building!

This hotel is new and trendy, The bar is fantastic (although the breakfast is not something we would do again...the food was very good but minimal choices). The room was simply too small. The photos do not accurately reflect their size; you literally cant walk past each other from the bathroom to the bed. I would stay in one of the rooms if traveling alone but am unlikely to use it again if with others.

small bedrooms but great facilities, including the gym and magnificent roof top. Bar has a great feel to it, although the elevator system wasn't entire clear without explanation (especially since you don't have any floor buttons), but it works well and is very simple, once you know!

Moxy Time Squares Hotel is a great big hotel that you can prefer to stay. We as a couple had a great time in Moxy Time Squares, it was cool and very very nice exprerience. Thank you Moxy for every thing.

Excellent hotel. Boutique accommodations with a playful spirit. Difficult to navigate with luggage hold in the basement, bar and restaurants on the second floor and affiliated, yet separately owned rooftop bar. The various staff members don't seem to understand how it all

The Moxy has a way with cool vibes that is so effortless and authentic. They really are a whole new motel experience. I've now stayed at two, this one and Phoenix. They both just delighted!! This one has a great location and parking right next door is a huge plus, even if it is $70 a night. I especially loved the "stash room" on each floor where you go get extra blankets pillows, etc. And the token for free champagne is a big plus!

The Moxy was probably one of my favorite hotels I’ve stayed at as far as it’s vibe and style. It’s ultra modern and cool but yet chill and inviting. It has the best of both worlds for people there with their families, including kids and babies, yet totally fun for people who are there to party. In addition, it has food on site which is so convenient and it’s location is perfect. I will definitely be returning to the Moxy.

I stayed in the Moxy for one night in July. The location is great, just one stop from Times Square. The rooms are teeny, but so cute and very comfortable, everything you need out of a hotel room really. The people were very friendly, waters and candy were provided upon checking in. My room wasn’t ready when I arrived, so they promptly switched me to another. Don’t miss the free drink token at check in, it’s for a pretty good prosecco on tap in the second floor lounge. I was on the 9th floor and had no noise problems at all. The upstairs bar was a little disappointing, but it was pouring and they did their best. Overall a great experience for a solo traveler.

I traveled to NYC with a teenager and wanted to stay in a hotel that had room comfortably for three. I had seen other hotels with bunk beds, but as someone over 35+, I wasn't exactly wanting to sleep in a twin bunk bed for any length of time. I loved the room I found at the Moxy with the queen bed and a bunk over. It looked comfortable for the amount of time I was spending in NYC. I do wish they had mentioned the time of day that under 21 was not allowed on the rooftop. I would have planned better so that the family could have enjoyed the mini golf. My only beef with the hotel was the floor in my room - it was gross. I called to have it cleaned on Saturday and I could tell the room had been tended to while I was out. However, if the floor had been cleaned, it was not obvious. My guess is that the floor had been destroyed by a prior guest and not able to be repaired. It looked like wax had been spilt on the floor and a large bag of garbage had been pulled across the floor staining the floor boards. It really was quite nasty. I was overall pleased with my stay because the hotel is very cool and super conveniently located. The 'this is the last room available of the kind you booked' is fine, but attention should have been paid to the actual room. And in most other chains, if there isn't a room available based on your reservation, they typically upgrade for free. I suppose that might not have been available while I was there, but that floor...I wouldn't call it uninhabitable, but I sure don't mind sharing that it was gross and should be replaced before someone else stays. Otherwise, I doubt this will be the last review about the gross floor.

My girlfriend and I visited last month and everything was perfect. The bed was insanely comfy, the room had everything we needed, and all the staff were very friendly, especially the housekeeping lady who lined all out shoes up along the wall every day! Little details like that made the stay amazing. The location is ideal, 5 minutes from MSG and Penn station, 10 minutes from Times Square. Nothing we could fault about the place at all.

We stayed at the hotel for five daysThe hotel has a great location close to the theaters of Madison Square Garden and is easily accessible to areas of tourist value.The rooms are small but functional and pleasant. The lobby staff is very accommodating and the food solutions are varied and suitable for everyone.

The staff at the Moxy was Amazing! From the guest check in to the rooftop doormen, they were a blast! Lei Quan was impeccable, lent me his umbrella to run to the store!! The Moxy bar was a fun place for Happy Hour. The rooftop bar Magic Hour has wonderful brunch and views. It also is an excellent place to have a 21st bday party which we did for my daughter

This hotel was unique and fit my needs. I was out in NYC for a girls' trip and the 4 of us fit nicely in the room. Although it was small, it really was the perfect size, as we did not spend much time in the room.The hotel staff was extremely pleasant and welcoming. This type of customer service is vital to returning guests.

Look no further. A short walk from Grand Central and an even shorter walk to Time Square. Dunkin Donuts is right next door waiting to make your morning coffee for you. Check in and out was a breeze. The staff was super friendly and you cant beat the price. There is a lounge and restaurant on the property if thats of interest to you. Check out is at noon and they will hold your luggage if you are done exploring Time Square.

I was in NYC for one night only, happy to have stayed here. New and clean, funky barracks styling, comfortable bed, good shower. Would stay again next time I go to NYC. We came in at about midnight, stayed on the 4th floor and could hear the music loud and clear from whichever bar. The room is equipped with earplugs, but be aware if you need a quiet place (which most people do to sleep). Check in service was attentive and helpful, overall a positive experience.

The Moxy is perfect for your staying in NY! The location is great, the staff is great and everything else is top! I will reccomand MOXY to everyone! The main attractions of NY are walking distance like Empire and Time Square!!

Stayed at the moxy for 5 days and it was phenomenal. I got a one bed/one bath room. The room was small but so chic, perfect for one person, very comfortable and functional. Hottest rooftop bar in the city is located at this hotel location. Will be staying here over and over again!

Called Marriott customer service to book a weekend reservation. They suggested we give moxy a try. So glad the for the recommendation. The hotel just opened in 2017. Its close to everything. The staff was great and you cant beat the price. The place was super clean, while the rooms were small, they had what you needed. I love moxie and i now have a favorite place to stay when i visit time square by the same name.

Stayed at this hotel for 2 nights; new and funky style. The location is great! The room is small but very well designed and functional. The 2 floor lounge is great. Staff are all very friendly and helpful. Would love to stay this hotel again if on budget!

I was at Moxy with a group of students. The hotel has a young, friendly and modern atmosphere. The reception staff were very kind throughout our entire stay. The location is great. For my group, the only problem was the unavailability of bunk beds.

Here are a list of good things:Well staffedGuest-centric, helpful staff Fantastic location on Times Square New property = spotless, super efficient rooms with up to date cool design features throughout the hotelGreat food @ restaurant on 2nd floorVery fair room pricesAfter check out, they will hold your luggage all day (be sure to tip)Many, many other pros but the best part is the rooftop bar!We have stayed here twice and will be back!The only con could potentially be the street noise but there are high floor rooms, each with complimentary ear plugs...and you’re in Time Square so who cares?!? Highly recommend!!

I really enjoy staying at this hotel when in NYC. I’ve been a few times and it’s great every time. LOVE the location - an easy walk from GCT, and in the heart of the fashion district on top of Herald Square and Macy’s.The second floor bar is great and, every time I’ve been there at least, not crowded. Cocktails are good - but stay away from the free one. It was some awful premixed sugar bomb. The second floor bar has a small food selection, but if you want to keep it basic, the flatbreads are quite good as is the breakfast. They also have a grab and go located there, which is very convenient. The rooms are what make this place, in my opinion. They feel like glamping. It’s not for everyone, for sure, but I love it. They are on the small side (typical for NYC) but high marks for how functional they make the space. For example, there are camp stools and a table hanging on the wall and there are storage cubbies under the bed. So, the bathroom: some people may find this weird but the sink is outside of the bathroom in the hallway area of the room. In the bathroom itself is the toilet and tiled standup shower, which is actually very roomy. Again, I don’t mind the setup one bit, but some people might not like it.The ONLY thing I don’t like about this hotel is the rooftop bar. It is insanely packed and the one time it wasn’t when we were up there, nearly every table was on reserve, even though it was early evening. It is a scene, to see and be seen - not a chill place to hang out, even right after opening. But if you can deal with that, it’s pretty cool.

Stayed a few nights on a business trip and really enjoyed it. Rooms were clean and functional. Separate shower room but no furniture with wall hooks etc so made a small room work well. The atmosphere is young and vibrant. Lots of bars and a nightclub inside the hotel. It was busy but so is everywhere in New York. If shopping is part of your trip then this place is perfect as it is for nightlife and shows. Almost bang in the middle of manhattan it’s proved a good spot for a short stay visiting all areas.
user_name:
James_winter1911
Chalfont St. Giles, United Kingdom

review_body: Hotel Price - Hostel service. Stayed for 10 nights, 20 days on still have not received the security $1400 deposit payment back to our account. Room service very hit and miss: told we had to request it at reception every day.....Staff unhelpful, room tiny - few hotel amenities in room. Reception is constantly rowdy - playing kids games...College dorm vibe from check in to check out. Avoid Legasea restaurant on the second floor: cremated fried fish and chicken....overpriced - don’t understand why it’s so busy! As for Level 2 bar/cafe.... yikes! Feels like you’re inconveniencing the staff to order a coffee in the morning :-( Never again thank you MOXY .... NEVER! xoxo

Theres no microwave or refrigerator. Our phone fall behind thw bed and it was too heavy to pull it. Ive made a request to get our phone but a security team didnt talk to the other at night and they were at our room late at night searching for this phone.

This is a great little boutique hotel in the heart of Manhattan with lots of perks and excellent customer service. The price is right for its plum location and the rooms although small are well appointed with lots of amenities. But what I liked most about this hotel was is excellent customer service which was prompt, professional and always with a smile. From the front desk to housekeeping and the serving staff, all were excellent. There where a few suggestions that I will post here as constructive criticism, but I am not going to take off points because my overall experience was so good. I would recommend a small closet and or a chest of drawers in the room instead of the wall pegs that serve as clothes hangers. Also, a coffee maker in the room would help sleepy heads like me get a start on their day. Finally, I checked in late on a Friday night and the party scene was in full swing. As I was going up to my room, there was a drunk riding the elevator who was belting out the tunes from 'The Sound of Music' way off key. Luckily he got off on a lower floor to the relief of the other guests. I know this is something that management can't always control, but it's important to make them aware of the situation since there where many families staying at the hotel. Also, some of the guests myself included, had trouble using the elevator cards, so perhaps making them more user friendly couldn't hurt. Other than that, I had a great time and would recommend this hotel to those traveling on a budget.

Friendly staff and very helpful. A very youthful vibe about which I had concerns but turned out to be fine, even with kids. Funky, functional & fun rooms with an excellent & creative use of space and the location was great.

The attitude of staff is awful and unhelpful. I requested for a wake up call at 6 AM which never happend. They refused early check in inspite of me confirming with the hotel before my booking. I called again and they said you can just cancel it and don't care attitude. The rooms are unbelievably small, the elevator system is meant to by high tech but confusing. Will never stay here.

We travel frequently and stay at Marriott properties a lot of the time due to their high level of customer service. (Also Marriott members ) The Moxy doesn’t feel like a Marriott. Firstly it has a rooftop bar which is not associated with Marriott but attached to the Marriott building. The bouncers were extremely rude and acted as if they were some kind of gods instead of just bouncers. Asked to speak to a manager about an issue I had and was told he was too busy. That’s nice !! If he doesn’t care why should the staff. The only good things about this hotel is it’s location which is great and close to Times Square. The rooms were nice. Overall very disappointed with the Marriott and would never stay here again

The Moxy is perfectly located in the centre of the action, with a short walk to Penn Station. The hotel room is small (you couldn't swing a cat in it), there was no wardrobe but the bed was comfy. We were on the 5th floor, we could hear the music from the roof top bar, but it didn't disturb our sleep, in fact the air con was louder but we were so shattered by our day's activities we seemed to have slept through it. There are no computers to print off any boarding passes, but the staff ask you to send the email to their printer address and they print it off for you. The bar and restaurant staff was a bit slow but they were friendly and helpful. The food was good value and really tasty. We did visit the roof top bar but we didn't stay as we were just 20 years too old! There are no views from the roof top bar. Would I stay here again? Probably not, but the location for us was 10/10.

Great hotel a little different more for the younger cool folks. I had fun there knowing it was going to be a little funky. Good location good value modern decor. Rooms are a bit on the small side but it is manhattan.

Great location and cool environment. Rooms are comfortable. However, the last night the crazy dance music kept me up past 1am. Not so cool. That said, it is a very cool location, and I love the neighborhood.

I love the Moxy. It is a boutique modern hotel in s great location. I highly recommend staying here ! The staff is so friendly and very helpful. The rooms are a perfect size and the shower is very unique ! Loved the bar too

This hotel has a great location. You are central to everything in mid-town. The check in process was easy and fast. The service was great. The rooms are funky- remind me a little of the Ace. The beds sit foot to foot versus parallel. The rooms are small, but cozy. I loved the feel of this place. It had a very fun vibe!

The location was perfect, and the rooms were clean and beautifully decorated. The second floor bar and lounge were nice and the rooftop is stunning. My friend and I had a great weekend; we are coming back in the fall!

This is my second trip to the big apple. I decided to stay in The MOXY because at the time of my booking it was one of the cheapest hotels i could find that fit my criteria in regards to location. i was not disappointed what so ever. This hotel is amazing. The marriot is the mother company of this hotel and you could definitely tell! The attention to detail is amazing. i stayed in the basic double room. Yes it was small but if you expect to travel to NYC and receive a large room at any hotel you are going to be disappointed wherever you go. Even though the room is small, the use of space is incredible. the little holes under your bed and the hanger space is very funky, the SHOWER IS AMAZING and the bed is very comfortable. Yes the aircon is a touch noisy but its bearable and its actually very easy to fall asleep to the noise. i read reviews about the noise from the parties they hold on the rooftop bar... believe me there was no issue with this noise at all, don't be put pff by those reviews because you couldn't hear a thing! and i was fairly close to the 18th floor; its a very quiet hotel! The soundbar in the room is a nice touch and the Tv has the capability of netflix so its cool to be able to watch whatever you want after a long day of walking in NYC. Location is top notch. close to 34th/Penn station and far enough out of times square that you don't have to deal with the noises of the city but one stop away on the subway so its easy to get to if you want to spend the night in times square. The hotel bar and open space is amazing and the hotel has definitely succeeded in making the second floor lounge somewhere that you want to spend some time. Bar is well priced and welcome cocktail was a nice touch. Jessica in the bar area is amazing and really attentive to you, as are all the staff, they are young, vibrant and charismatic. The only frustration i had was the rooftop bar. it was over the top, as a hotel guest spending nearly $2k on this hotel for the week i didn't expect to have to jump through hoops and be spoken to by security the way i was just to get up there, its as if the security think the kardashians are on that rooftop 24/7 it was unnecessary and it changed the whole vibe of the hotel from being a small boutique quirky hotel into something that was unwelcoming and the staff seemed to think you were an inconvenience. its a nice space but i don't understand why its so hard to get a table or service. i preferred the second floor, and i left the rooftop about 10min into my stay to go back to the second floor where i enjoyed my night much more than i ever would on that rooftop it has much the same products for less money. it was probably the only disappointing part of the stay. i actually cannot recommend this hotel enough! HOTEL MOXY YOU ARE AMAZING! thank you for making my week in NYC the best.

Top location on Times Square, the rooftop was big and super, the breakfast was simple you can choose from 6 different dishes but all 6 super delicious! The cleaning was also super every day. Rooms are smaller than average but very nicely decorated and tidy and in the middle of NY. The city is great!

Loved the moxy in Times Square! Very clean and unique. Nice rooftop bar. The room was very small and did not have a fridge or microwave. Very close to plenty of bars/restaurants and easy walk to all there is to do in times sqaure

This was one of the worst stays I’ve had in NYC. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone ever due to bad service, rude staff, terrible people and horrible service. One of the worst experiences I’ve had to deal with in the city!!!!!

Hotel is very conveniently located for Times Square, theaters and the garment district. Magic Hour rooftop bar is fun and active. Rooms are small but quite efficient. Could hear some noise from the bar in some rooms but the provided ear plugs did the trick! Mac & Cheese from Bar Moxy was excellent! The games in the lobby can keep you occupied if you should have to wait.

We loved our stay! We will tell all of our friends and family to stay here!! The hotel was modern and classy and close to everything. It was also affordable. We will be staying here every time we come back to the city!!

I was stranded at JFK with my two daughters when our flight was cancelled. I did a very cursory search for 'kid-friendly' hotels. As soon as Moxy popped up with 'bunk bed' my kids were excited to go there. Moxy had candy jars and games in the reception area, the staff was friendly, we were just a few blocks from Times Square. The room was small but that's NYC, however it was really lovely, bunkbeds with all sorts of shelving all over the place to cleverly put things into, and each had a little night light with a shelf for a book/iPod. Oh, and it was so QUIET!!! I've never stayed overnight in NYC and not heard street noise but miraculously this hotel was silent. Girls slept in later than they do at home. Everyone remarked that the rainfall shower was the best shower we had had. All in all, a great time, you saved our day, Moxy!
user_name:
siobhanmf2018
Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

review_body: Maybe I am getting old and crotchety, but if I never stay at the Moxy again, that will be fine with me. The hotel is trying to be very hip and cool in all things ranging from the way the room is arranged to the lobby to the elevators, but it misses things that a traveler needs.Like many people, I believe, I have a toiletries bag, yet there is really no place to just put it down on a counter in the bathroom. I had to move it back and forth between the toilet cover and the edge of the sink. They would be well served to put in a shelf or something.The room itself was small (fine, it's NYC, I get that), but the luggage stand was too small and too wobbly to truly support my bag. The steamer (instead of the iron) was ok, but the big issue for me was the temperature. It was either freezing or way too hot.Little things like the Chromecast to the TV (which was promoted didn't work because it was on a different wi-fi network and couldn't be access) don't matter all that much, but were minor irritants.I found the staff to be very nice and the workout room was great, but between the noise outside my window and the noise outside my door (I was right near the elevator), it led to a pretty bad sleeping experience which was not good given that I had a big meeting the next day.If you are a vacation traveler and you prefer style over substance, the Moxy is for you. If you just need basic functionality, find somewhere else.This was my 2nd time here.
user_name:
Jeremy E
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: And I’ve decided it’s just not a Marriott Brand I will continue using. Although this experience was much better than the Chicago one and they did have irons to use in ur room from the floor “Stash” rooms. Read the reviews at each level from poor to great. It’ll tell you what you need. As with the last one I reviewed, if you were/are a Hostel kind of person and have more money to spend, I’d say this is you brand of hotel. Very trendy. The rooms are tastefully decorated, though extremely small if ur 6’3” like me. See picture. The layout is weird and it’s geared to get you to go to the public hang out space. Not my thing as I travel 45+ weeks a year. The rooftop bar was loud and I was several floors below as is the AC fan mentioned in several reviews, but they said that when I checked in and there were ear plugs in the room. Not really for me though, kind of weird sleeping with them and normally I can sleep in NY even with normal noise. You basically have to sit on the bed or a little stool of you want to read or watch TV. And all the public spaces are packed and super loud like at a mini club. As a lifetime platinum elite member who’s stayed at every brand of Marriotts, this just isn’t one I’m going to contour to use. BUT read the reviews if it piques your interest even a little, you’ll probably love it. The decor alone was an actual treat. If you want plenty of interaction opportunities in the place ur staying, this is it, especially if you want a younger crowd. Anyway, I can appreciate the demographic the brand is geared toward, but I don’t believe it’s really a long term seasoned travelers brand. The staff was great and super helpful and the gym had PLENTY of space, a rarity for NY.

Having only arrived yesterday I can say the moxy is an excellent establishment. I was welcomed by Ashley, who took her time to explain everything I would need to know about the hotel! She also personally took me over to the lifts and showed me how to use them which I think was a nice personal touch. The staff all seem to be friendly and helpful and I am sure I will continue to enjoy my stay here. As for the room I was quite surprised as the room is bigger than what I expected. I can hear a slight sound of music from my room but this hasn’t disturbed me from sleeping and the moxy also provide ear plugs. All in all if your looking for great base to explore the city book the moxy now!

So many things went wrong on our recent two-night stay; it was a comedy of errors. We checked in, found water on the floor of our sixth-floor room. Tried calling front desk(s) and twice phone was picked up and immediately hung up.Ok.....Went to lobby, was told, quite apologetically that we would be moved to a "much nicer" room. Sent to an identical room on the 14th floor (I should have refused, knowing there was a bar on the 18th floor rooftop). Loud noise until 4 a.m. -- so much for "much nicer."Incredibly cramped layout of furniture which, oddly, wasn't really the problem. We liked the room. The problem was just a series of dumb inconveniences, from the free "specialty drink" not being available (bait and switch?) to not being able to get a human to answer the phone for more than an hour when one of our party forgot her key and would not be able to access the elevators.An aside: coffee, tea and pre-packaged baked goods are not "breakfast." Even if it's free.So it comes down to this: the staff at the Moxy is perhaps the worst-trained I have ever encountered in any place, anywhere. Granted, they all seem friendly and want to help but don't seem to have a clue as to what a basic level of professionalism might be.I know the manager or whomever will reply to this and say "Oh we're so sorry you did not have an awesome experience," but I would just hope that something will be DONE ABOUT it for future guests (I will not be among them).Honestly, I have run across hotel clerks in Marriott level 3 hotels with more service acumen than this crew. The fault lies with the management. Train your staff. Expect more. Being hip and cool is great, but what's really awesome is good service.

This hotel has very friendly staff, and the rooms were clean. I think it would be fine if you were single or with your partner. I say this because the when someone is in the shower or toilet you can see through the diving partition and so there is no privacy at all. I had to shower in the dark to offer me that privacy. The rooms are decorated very nice, but it is bare bones. There is no closet, so you have to get use to hanging your clothes up on pegs that are around the room. A lot of other things like getting ice is a hassle as you have to go to a closet to get an ice bucket, and then go all the way to the bar on the second floor to get the ice. I was also in an ADA room and it did not meet code whatsoever ie. the shower base had a curb and ADA rooms should have no curb so that you can roll a chair straight into the shower. My biggest gripe was that i had some money on me that i was going to change a few days later at the airport in to a different currency. I know i should of been more careful but you would like to think that money that is hidden in a bag and not on display would be safe. Needless to say i had a lot of money (340$) stolen out of my bag. I was told that a thorough investigation would happen but was later informed that it had not been stolen. The only people able to access the room was the cleaning people and of course they wont own up to it. I basically got the spiel of the manager saying sorry but it was his word against mine. I will never be back this hotel ever again.

Kudos to the front office crew and especially Crystal for a great experience during my brief stay. Crystal took time to familiarize me with the hotel's amenities, entertainment options, and some of the food choices in the area. She insisted that I reach out to her if I needed anything. She also arranged for me to get a peek of the night scenes at the exclusive in-house bars. I felt very special.... like I had exclusive VIP status. Thanks Crystal and staff for a great stay! Will be back for sure.

On checking in at The Moxy, we were greeted by Miranda, who became our go to girl. She had a room on the 16th floor, but was reluctant to give it to us, as we were staying for a week. After searching through her booking system, we were advised to take a 9th floor room, as this was away from any excessive club noise. The room had a good use of space. You will get used to climbing into bed, if you are next to the wall. The tv is located on the wall at the foot of the bed. The rainforest shower gave us piping hot water daily, with no problems. The stash cupboard supplied us with daily towels, razor blades, deodarants. You collect these items yourself as The Moxy does not offer a full daily turn down service,( unless you ask at reception).Being on 7th Avenue & West 36th Street, meant that there is a bus stop across the road as well as shops, restaurants, bars, banks. Macy's is only 2 blocks away on 34th Street. Yes, the rooms in The Moxy are small, but this NYC. The lifts are easy to get used to, it might take a few minutes, but you will get there. I did hear a degee of street noise, mainly from the emergency services. As I have said already, We Will Be Back One Day. Thank you Moxy & Miranda.

So there are no closets; you hang everything up on pegs along the wall. Ok if you are just here for a few days living out of a suitcase. Use the second floor space if you need more room to socialize or work. Convenient location around the corner from Macy’s. A good walk up to Times Square. Staff was friendly which is nice to find in this big city. Still has that new feel and smell. Negatives. The aircon makes loud noises like those old motels. Maybe that’s why they have earplugs on the night stand. Supposedly they have a great rooftop bar but that wasn’t our crowd. .

We just returned from a visit over the 4th. We were pleasantly surprised at what your dollar can get in NY. We did our research and knew the rooms were small, just 2 of us so not a problem. The layout was great and the bed was very comfy. We loved the shower as well, especially the hot water right away. We were on the 9th floor and it was pretty quiet. I also like that you had to use your card to use the elevators, and the do not disturb was a change of the light outside your room instead of a hang card. Only small issue we had was the sink drain needed some draino or something. When brushing teeth the water drained really slow. The location was awesome. There are a lot of younger people around, so elderly would probably feel out of place. I would definitely stay here again, great value...good location...and a lot of fun!

Wow! This place was super!! First of all the center of NYC action (Times Square) was basically right outside the door. When you enter you get a feel for just how cool this place is when you see games like Jenga and corn hole set up in the lobby. The rooms were small but I guess that expected in NYC and regardless the room had everything that was needed. It was super clean and quiet which you never would have guessed from all the activity in the lobby and on the streets in general. The staff were super friendly and helpful from check-in to check-out and every need in between. I highly recommend this place!

I don’t think I’ve ever stayed in a hotel room that was so small. That being said it is New York City and I guess that’s what you should expect. The price wasn’t completely out of this world and the convenience of the location was 2nd to none. I wanted to catch a lot of theatre whilst I was in New York and I was only about a 10 minute walk from most of the major productions and theatre venues. It was great being on such convenient subway lines to so made it very easy getting around Manhattan. The hotel staff were extremely friendly and helpful, I had a few bits and pieces that I needed their help with such as suggestions of local laundromat services, printing off boarding passes and work documents.Although my room was small it was very cleverly designed to fit a lot into a small space. My double queen was definitely only big enough for one person, just wasn’t enough space for two peoples luggage. The rooms were very funky and had a cool design and had been newly renovated.The only downside that was when I was staying, every night at 1 AM major construction occurred on the road directly outside the hotel entrance by the City. Obviously the hotel staff couldn’t do anything about this but no attempt was made to apologise for the disruption or in anyway make up for it. Luckily I had a fantastic silicon gel earplugs so generally wasn’t disturbed but that wasn’t the case for many other hotel guests. As it was New York Pride that weekend, all hotel rooms were booked so it wasn’t possible to move me or anyone else.Although my experience was generally positive the size of the hotel rooms was definitely a problem for me personally. If you’re not bothered by this sort of thing then this is a great hotel for you but I just need a little bit more space…

Stayed 4 nights at end of June with my 12 year old. Hotel is clean, quite cool and trendy for a 12 year and this 49 year old. As it says on the website, the rooms are small but for us, it was perfectly adequate as we were out enjoying NYC...roof top generally not open to under 21s apart from brunch on Sat/Sun in July and August, where the menu is fine, view amazing, and crazy golf was funny... Was worried about other reports of noise from the club - we were on 12th floor and it was fine. If you like the photos on the website and minimalist rooms, you'll love it. Bar staff nice to my 12 year old. Water and candy in the lobby, basket ball too....perfect location as we walked everywhere. Didn't eat in the hotel but just two blocks away from Best Bagels and Coffee - the perfect place for breakfast. Will be back for a tourist trip....perhaps not so great for business travellers if you like time in your room. P.S. cocktails are good and 12 year old loved the intelligent elevators.

I enjoyed this hotel somewhat the first timeI stayed a month ago. Big room. Hip. Nice staff. However, just checking in again and I see that it is not suited for any business travelers or really, anyone over 25 years old Room was tiny. Smallest I’ve had in NYC. And that is saying. A lot. Funky hangers can’t hold your shirts and absolutely no table to sit. Only a bed. The only way to iron any clothes is to put the tiny table top ironing board (no table here) on the floor and hope you don’t get your clothes dirty (see pic). With platinum status I thought I would get an upgrade (they said I did at checkin but didn’t happen). All I got was “sorry”. No help even. Just “sorry”. In their defense I know this hotel is catered to the younger crowd (I’m only 40), but lack of simple amenities makes it a poor choice for anyone who is coming on business. If you’re 22 and want to party, you should stay.

This hotel isn’t for everyone - I realise that but we really liked it. It was a prefect ultra modern, metro type hotel perfectly situated 5 minutes walk from from Times Square. I enjoyed the express check in/check out counters/reception area. We always found staff available here to speak with if we needed to. They were all very helpful and friendly. I liked that you have to use your key card to activate the lift, it made the hotel feel more secure. The communal area gave the hotel a relaxed vibe. The room we had was tiny, teeny-tiny - but I read about it before and it was fine. We were barely in the room, we were in NYC, we certainly didn’t want to sit in our room! Although it was small it had everything we needed, it was clean, modern in style and perfectly adequate for our needs. We were able to get an iron etc from a cupboard near the lift. We were given 3 drinks vouchers on arrival which was nice but to be honest we really didn’t like the drink and would have prefered if they could be used towards something else too. The roof top bar and is amazing and definitely worth a visit. I would stay here again if it was jut me and hubby again but it’s defint not a family hotel but a great hotel all in all.

Moxy Hotel is fun and a hip place to stay.Is has a great location and the rooftop is a perfect place to chilling and relaxing.The staff is helpfull and the rooms are dynamically designed. Will come back!

Great hotel hip and modern . Not as noisy as you think to be in Times Square . Close to all the excitement but still far enough from the noise. Can’t go wrong if you choose to stay at the moxy in NYC.

Friendly staff I like to say Jailene from the front office gives the brightest smile , making you feel welcomed as soon a you walk in the hotel. I was helped the moment I walked through the door to the elevator doors closed which lead me to my floor.

This hotel gas a cool hip vibe once you walk in. The rooms are different from any Marriott I have been in. Had a great time at the bar. The staff was very friendly. I definitely plan on staying here again when I go back to the City.

I enjoyed my stay at Moxy hotel. As soon as I checked out, I found out that Moxy had the largest rooftop in New York. I wish I got a chance to see it but it will be a reason for me to stay again at this hotel.

We have stayed at many similarly priced hotels in NYC in the Times Square area. This one, by far, exhibited the best use of space I've ever experienced. Yes, the room is small, but unless you plan to pay a LOT of money per night this is the norm for NYC. The thought that went into the use of every inch of this room is unsurpassed. From the door - which you can unlock with your phone and has a button to push for DND instead of a hang sign and 2 different safety locks, to the hooks that line one whole side of the room in lieu of a closet - the hooks do not have sharp points and there are hangers and such if you need them (as well as a steamer instead of an iron in the room), to the beds with comfortable mattresses and no dumb bedspreads - only fully washable bedding - we got a room with a Queen and a Twin bunk and it was brilliant use of space with storage cubbies underneath a platform bed instead of a boxspring, to the bean bag chair tucked in the corner and the tv tray to work or eat on since there is no desk, the room doesn't miss a detail. The bathroom was also a good use of space and the roomy, fully tiled, waterfall shower made coming back at the end of a day in a heatwave something to look forward to. I look forward to staying here again.

I had a wonderful stay at Moxy. It’s the perfect place for entertainment,chilling,and relaxing. It is also in a great location many great restaurants near by and it is also a 4 minute walk to Madison Square Garden.

Everything was perfect, the room beautiful, staff was wery helpful everytime I needed them. The location is simply amazing. I walked around the whole stay. The room was on the 7th floor, quiet and pleasant. Will be back!

As a Platinum customer, this is one of the worst hotels I ever stayed in NYC area. We came here for 4 days during 4th of July week, and decided to reduce our stay to 1 night only. Not only the hotel was dishonest to us about their being a quiet hotel (I specifically requested for a quiet room in a quiet hotel), and yes I travel to NYC often for work and pleasure, and I am not asking for nirvana, but the fact that they did not disclose to me beforehand that there is a party for 2 nights in a row until 4am because of 4th of July is concerning. Why did not they tell me about it? I specifically requested and VALIDATED twice before I came here, and they assured me. Why was the planned party on the roof top not disclosed? The AC is also very loud in the room. I asked their engineer to come and he said there's no way to reduce the power of the fan, because the setting is either on (which is very loud) and at full speed, OR automatic, which is on and off, but still very loud when it is on. I stayed at room 1229 first , and the rooftop party was on 18th floor, and they put me there without telling me or alerting me that there'd be noise until 4am from the rooftop. NONE. They just stole from me, and wanted my business. I am surprised that hotel business can be as sneaky as that. I called at 11pm and asked to be moved to a much more quiet room. Someone named Kitty (not sure if it is the correct spelling or not) picked up the phone. She was polite, but not helpful, and we had a lot of back and forth because I asked her specifically what made me her think that moving me to 8th floor (room 814 specifically) would guarantee a better experience for me, because I wanted to know that first before making a decision whether or not I wanted to move. I thought this was a fair ask. Why would one make a decision without knowing all of the facts first ?! She could not answer right away, as she was just a middle man so to speak, and the front desk had to make the call, so there was a couple back and forth between me, Kitty, and the front desk, until finally a front desk person named Drew, who was quiet rude by the way and hung up on me, explained why he would think room 814 which is on the 8th floor could be better. Next time, clarify and be more transparent to your guests, particularly to your top guests like platinum guests. I don't expect to give this hotel anymore business, and I will tell all my friends and my business colleagues to avoid this particular hotel going forward. They are not professional, and more importantly they lack good work and business ethic.

We had a terrific stay at the Moxy, near Times Square. The family (4 generations) gathered in Manhattan to see Lion King. The Moxy staff were fabulous, from the doorman to the waitstaff. The desk clerk worked hard to get us rooms all on one floor, and they were able to accommodate us at their fun rooftop restaurant. They took severe allergy concerns seriously and served up 11 hungry diners, ages 6-92, with the most delicious pastries and brunch items. The rooms are dynamically designed and have very comfortable beds. The 2nd floor bar serves a great, quick breakfast. Kudos to the Moxy.

The bedrooms are small so you need to be a bit organized with your space there is no fridge but in saying all this the beds are king size and comfortable the shower space is great with excellent shower pressure plus the accessories for showering etc are good and the rooms are very clean all in all when you need a good break from the hustle and bustle of NY it does that exactly.

I had a room with a queen bed. It was not large but adequate and I don't spend a lot of time in my room. Pluses:1. WiFi was the fastest I have ever witnessed in a hotel.2. Love the fact you press a button that changes your exterior room number light to yellow, signalling that you don't want to be disturbed. A much better system than hanging something on the door, which can fall off, get turned around or get taken.3. Elevators are fast as there are 4 of them and they are designed to optimize who gets in what elevator. 4. Great location. Minuses:1. It was annoying having to always crawl over the bed to adjust the blinds. It would have been much better if they had provided a fixed wall control (vs a remote control which only would get lost, broken)l. Would it really have cost that much more to provide that? 2. The master switch beside the door, which is a great idea as it both saves electricity and avoids having to run around and turn off all the room lights, ironically does not turn off the bathroom/shower light. This seems like a HUGE oversight.3. The sink was wide enough, ie left to right, but not deep enough front to back. Trying to wash your face in the morning in it results in water splattering on the floor. They could have installed one with a bit of a concave front to allow a bit more space. 4. The elevator music is blaring and obviously is not going to be to everyone's liking. Quieter and more 'easy-listening' music would be better.5. The wide-screen TV is not adjustable so when you are sitting at the table and char (that you take off the hooks on the wall if you so desire) you have to look at it at a real angle. I would have had the TV hung on a thick piece of plywood and have had hinges on the right side so you could swivel it like a door and get a better view from the chair. This would have been super cheap and easy to have done. 6. I agree with the comments about noisy. Music is blaring everywhere. It's a bit much. Having said all that I would stay there again.

I spent two nights here for a weekend. Little touches such as the candy jars and cold infused water in the lobby on a sweltering weekend were appreciated. Bed was very comfortable. Clothes steamer instead of clunky ironing board. Great water pressure in the sizable shower. Water was hot when I needed it to be and AC was cold when I needed it to be. My room on the 3rd floor was compact but well appointed and perfect for one. Very little street noise. Good customer service. Location to MSG and Penn Station is ideal. Easy walk up to Times Square for theatres or over to Hell’s Kitchen for great restaurants.

Staff were very helpfull and enthusiastic. A very modern hotel but the room allocated to my wife and I was too small (unsure if this was a double room as seemed very small) and noisey with A/C and the roof top bar being the issues even though we were 11 floors below the roof top bar.The bed was not easily accessed and very limited storage space resulting in having to live out a suitcase for the duration of the stay

Perfect for young travellers with a trend rooftop bar and friendly staff and music! The Moxy went the extra mile to decorate our room for our birthday and made the stay so memorable.Our room was even upgraded. Excellent location, very close to times square and Penn Station. The Moxy is our new favourite hotel and we plan to stay at their other hotels around the world. Thank you for everything!

Great location for Broadway, museums, shops, restaurants and of course Times Square (the center of the Universe). Fun Finnish efficient design meets Manhattan. Very personable and professional staff, including tech engineers, and housekeeping.

I had an amazing time at the Moxy Hotel! Everything was just perfect! I was at the Hotel for a short trip with my friends. We had the 4-bed Room. The style is amazing and there is enough space for everything. The only thing that bothered me, was the loud music from the club on the rooftop.

The Moxy is steps away from Times Square and the Empire State Building. The hotel is hip and stylish. The rooms are small but functional. We didn’t spend too much time in the hotel other than sleeping and cleaning up. This hotel is not for everyone but it worked for us. Enjoy your stay!

We had the best time at this hotel. Food similar prices to the rest of the city but everything we ate breakfast, brunch on the roof, dinner in the bar area was delicious.Great location next to 34th street subway.Very modern not too space but worth it for the location.Dj plays 3 nights a week in the bar area and up on the rooftop bar...not to be missed!

This hotel is in the Garment District; the location is OK. Beds are comfy with as many pillows as you wish. Bathroom has plenty of hot water and good water pressure. No natural light or view. There are hundreds of thousands of marauding children in the lobby. Blaring music in all of the public spaces. Deafening really.Rooms are minute, barely room for a suitcase, and that was with an upgrade. So upgrades are not great. Cocktails in the bar are 50% more expensive than neighboring bars, with more marauding children (yes, in the bar) and more blaring music. I would go to the Rag Trader or Keen's instead but you can find whatever you like nearby.Rates for NYC are low and quite reasonable for what you get. If you are an Elite member you might do better at another property.
user_name:
Bob S
New York City, New York

review_body: Room is box size!! No benefits for platinum member honoured. No customer service at all; no manners of talking to clientele - tried to check in early at 12:30 pm and the guy did not even ask my name plain “no” we don’t have any rooms at the moment. We don’t clean the property before 3 was his answer. Come back later was his answer.No proper amenities in the room; if you choose to stay all night out and intend to return just to sleep this may be a ok hotel.I would not recommend it for an experienced traveller.

Had a great experience here. Hotel is new and well appointed. Vibe is a cross of W and 1Hotels. Like the lounge area on the second floor. Restaurant in hotel is great. Locale is good -- close to TS, but not IN TS, 5 minute walk to Penn Station. We are large family--had two rooms. Kids loved the bunk beds. Note - They don't have connecting rooms. Best they could do is keep us all on the same floor. Space it tight, but they do a nice job of keeping the rooms livable. Staff was super helpful. There is a rooftop club so, after 5ish the traffic in the lobby area picks up and they have security at elevators

I have now stayed at this moxy location 4 times. It is conveniently located near the subway and a bit south of the hustle of times square. The staff is friendly and attentive and the rooms are uniquely designed and a good size by NYC standards. Will continue to stay here when in NYC for the value..and its got a really great vibe from check-in to check-out.

We had a great experience staying at the moxy hotel from start to finish. We were granted early check in and even offered various different rooms with the pros and cons of the options well explained. The room itself is modern and the shower absolutely superb. Wonderful hotel and helpful friendly staff. Would not hesitate to stay at this hotel again

Chris—individual who checked me in—was enthusiastic, helpful, motivated, and made my check-in experience awesome. The hotel is great; I have stayed many times over the past couple months and have not been disappointed. I have also eaten at Egghead which is great too.

I think I’ve stayed with you a half a dozen times and this was another great stay. I think I’ve gotten familiar with the steamer and no longer require an iron. I tried the roof d close for the first time and found it nice but expensive

We truly enjoyed our stay at the Moxy! The staff were so welcoming and friendly! The moment we walked in from the noisy streets, the energy I'm the lobby felt healing and warm. For a small - town guy like myself, that meant so much! I also appreciate the support the hotel demonstrated for the GSM conference. You are beautiful

I had the pleasure of staying at the Moxy for Pride weekend. The hotel staff were fantastic always making me feel welcome and they also hosted a Pride event in the lobby. Additionally, from the hotel both Hell's Kitchen and the Village are a quick ride a way. I highly recommend this hotel and can't wait to stay there again myself.

The Moxy is fantastic. The hotel is fun, clean, in a great location and oozes energy! The rooms are a little small, but you're in NYC, right!?! How much time are you going to veg out in your room. Highly recommended!
user_name:
chrisbowers25
New York City, New York

review_body: This was the smallest hotel room I have ever stayed in. Let me point out that I used to live in Manhattan, so I'm familiar with small places. Also, I've stayed in those small hotels in Europe. This room was smaller. Also, I was told I was given an upgrade (Platinum status).Aside from the extremely small room, it's a nice hotel. Evidently, the brand is aimed at millennials. I'm a suburban Gen X dad, but I enjoyed the vibe and the decor. The location is good if you business in that part of town or want to be near MSG / Penn Station. I grabbed a coffee and croissant at a Pretty a Manger just outside the hotel. Bottom line: not a bad place to stay, but given the very small room andy personal preference, I probably won't go back.

So we were due to arrive at the moxy as part of a multi stay vacation and did what most people do before arrival and read the reviews ! Given some of them we arrived slightly apprehensive.. in short we needn’t have been it’s fab ! There were negative reviews about the noise one saying don’t stay in a floor above floor 7 can you imagine how we felt when we were given floor 16 but to tired from traveling to argue we decided to wait till next day to discuss . We never did have to discuss it not a peep of noise was heard and that was over the weekend. The reviews about lack of cupboard space .. yes there are no cupboards but there is a large row of clever hooks some with coat hangers on more than sufficient to hang all your clothes also storage space under bed . The review saying no hot water in shower .. the shower was my favourite part massive with loads of hot water anytime of day .The review about lack of an iron ( really ! ) there was a quirky hand held steamer that did the job better than most hotel irons iv used . Finally the review saying don’t go if you are over 50 ! Well we are and still loved it so many people our own age or older none of whom seemed concerned to be there . In summary the Moxy is a modern spotlessly clean hotel that makes clever use of the space available. It is located in the heart of Time Square and a five minute walk from Penn Station . It has a lovely bar area as well as seating area and a roof top bar .. what more do you want ! Look forward to going back .

I've stayed here 4x now. Each time the breakfast service, and service in the restaurant /bar area is as poor as it can get. Non-attentive, and when you get a server or bar tender, they make you feel lucky to have their attention.

good for a quick stay. Location is good on 7th and 36th. Close to many good locales. Bar and restaurant in hotel is good. The rooms are very small and not conducive for those that want to work in them.

I had a big birthday coming up and New York was the obvious choice for me. So, myself and 3 friends booked this hotel as we wanted somewhere in a great location and that offered something a bit different. We booked a room with 2 bunk beds which was fine for 5 nights since we didn’t plan on spending much time in our room anyway apart from sleeping. I have to say we were all really pleased, the room looked exactly as it did in the pictures, clean, modern and fresh. We knew what we were getting in terms of size so that was no issue at all. All seemed fine and the staff were really friendly and helpful, especially the girl who checked us in, think her name was Ashleigh. The facilities were superb, a great little touch was ‘The stash’ which was a cupboard with extra towels and irons and ironing boards etc which guests could help themselves to. So far so good!However, it all went wrong on day 2 when I discovered that $250 had been stolen from my zipped up rucksack. Yes, I know, there’s a safe in the room but I certainly didn’t expect anything like this to happen! I reported it and security took down a report etc but still to this day I have not received any kind of apology or explanation. It’s pretty obvious that a cleaner had rummaged through our bags and helped themselves. It’s obviously my word against there’s and there’s not really anything I can do about it but as you can imagine, this incident cast a shadow over the whole stay. If it hadn’t been for this I would have rated it much higher because everything about it worked perfectly for our stay but the fact is you can’t trust the staff which is pretty poor! Everything else about the hotel is great though and although a lot of reviews have complained about the noise from the bars we didn’t have any issues at all but then I did request a room to be as far away from noise as possible so that’s worth thinking about. I’ve no doubt you’d have a great stay here but make sure you lock EVERYTHING valuable away that you can!! I’ve learned my lesson and I feel really let down by the hotel but I guess that’s life. I definitely won’t be staying here again though simply for that reason.

Hotel brand is made specifically to appeal to millenials. At first I found it a little jarring but after a minute I loved it. They have really thought through everything. The rooms are typically small but the use of space is very interesting.

My husband and I stay in many hotels all over. We were blown away by the Service, Decor, Attention, Style, Staff etc. Each and every person we came across was so available and attentive...especially Sasha, (who seemed to be everywhere wanting to assist); Alex and Gabriel in Legasea. (Food was excellent)...Mike and Alex at Registration..Christopher..Everytime we turned around, someone was asking to help us. Loved all the games set up ( and staff who played with us) ; and all the places to hang out. We are planning on returning this summer with our 4 young adult children....Wow, Wow..Thank You...

I will start by saying I really like this chain, having stayed at the Moxy in Munich. Our check-in was a bit frustrating as we made our reservation through Booking.com, but thanks to the perseverance of our young agent, she finally found the (prepaid) booking. The elevators are dark and uninviting but our room was fun with a funky, young vibe. We weren’t able to check out the rooftop bar, sadly, as they wouldn’t allow children in, not even for a quick look. We didn’t want to leave them alone so we had to forego that one. Our room was newly decorated, funky and young in design and decor, and very small, but adequate. The whole vibe just made me smile ... especially the bedtime stories option on the phone. The lobby was decked out with a hopscotch outline, hacky sack games and fun colours and vignettes. No chairs or seats of any kind however, which would be helpful. Our precooked shuttle failed to arrive for our return to the airport, which caused me a bit of stress at check out time. A new one arrived, 25 minutes later, thankfully! All in all, I would stay here again.

Great location, great concept, great design..The team still needs some training. Pillows are too high to my taste/neck.There are too many rooms and elevators are not enough. Be patient!!In general, a very good experience.
user_name:
RRAlvarez
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: we had wonderful time in Moxy which is very good location for travelling and the inside of the hotel are young, energetic with unique and modern design, we had the brunch in the roof bar which was amazing with stunning view in the heart of NYC

I come into NYC quite a bit and often stay at Moxy due to it’s centrality. Over the last 6 months the fire alarm has been tested no less than 3 times - in the most inopportune times - either 11am when you are trying to have conference call or at 8:45 pm when you are trying to relax. The showers are very stylish retro dark green tile but I have noticed that because of their dark nature cleaning is not the best. For a hotel that is less than a year old, there should not be moldy growth in the shower.

I really enjoyed staying at the Moxy Time Square! The hotel is super trend with a great atmosphere, the staff make you feel so welcome, and the king suite that I stayed in was very comfortable. I love how you walk out of the hotel and everything is so accessible. It is now a far walk for anything that you want or need. I felt so safe at this location and will be staying there whenever I am in NY!

We stayed for one night at this hotel just to be at the same hotels as some friends that were already at NYC for more days.Cons:- the room is very small. The bed was placed against the wall and I barely fitted in... there are no closets, no safe- there is a major problem of noise because of the night club of the hotel. It goes up till 6:00AM in the weekend, so if you want to try and sleep you need to bring strong earplugs- the Air Conditioned is really noisy- overall its not worth what you pay for itPros- breakfast is included but we waited for more than 30 minutes to be served- location is ok

Stayed for two nights in end of May. First time in New York. Perfect location on Manhattan to walk around the city and occasionally pop back to the room for a rest or maintenance break. The room I got was not spacious but big enough for 1-2 persons without feeling small. If you see what I mean. I enjoyed its trendy interior and fun decoration. The bar and restaurants were nice with friendly and helpful staff. There's also a roof top bar but the entrance is not inside the hotel but around the corner.

Superbly designed use of space in a centrally located hotel. Rooms are small but comfortable - everything you need and everything has its spot! The rooftop bar keeps late hours, so the mid-level floors are the best way to avoid both bar and street noise. Our 11th floor room facing 7th Street was perfectly pleasant.

Despite upgrading to a "Queen" room there was no space to walk round the bed. The air con was very noisy and despite 2 complaints nothing was done. On the positive the room was clean and reasonably appointed though lack of tea and coffee facilities was a poor oversight. The hotel restaurant and bar were well appointed and the staff helpful.

The Moxy Times Square is my new favorite hotel in NYC. When you first walk in you’ll notice how hip this hotel is. In the lobby they have bean bag toss to play while you are waiting. You are able to use your phone as a key instead of a key card, which is a unique feature ! The rooms were on the smaller side, but the space was used effectively!

I live in New York City and came here for a one night stay-cation. It was such a fun experience to see a different side to the city. It felt so uniquely and exclusively New York. The F and B and nightlife was awesome. The vibe of the hotel was next level. Definitely coming back for a drink with my friends!

The Moxy is a very trendy hotel with themed decor and affordable prices. Very clean and comfortable. Some of the rooms are very small and not suitable for more than one person. If you’re traveling with a buddy, opt for a loft room. Beware of the higher floors bringing you closer to the rooftop bar (and DJ) where music plays until 2 or 3 am. That said, if you end up close to the music, the hotel provides free earplugs in every room (which worked to drown out the noise).

My wife was looking for a hotel near Times Square for my birthday weekend. The Moxy had just opened and prices were a bit cheaper than other hotels in the area. The plus side was it was new, clean and close to Time Square. And was a Marriott property. It even had a great Irish pub across the street.The other side. The room we got was 6 feet wide. I could touch both walls at the same time with outstretched arms. The bathroom was ok size and for a two day stay it was doable. There is no where to set your stuff so it all has to be hung up on a row of hooks on the wall. So, if you want more room be sure to ask for it.The other thing was my wife had secretly planned a nice birthday dinner up in the Moxy resturant. Before that I was to walk into our room with ballons and champagne. Surprise! No they were not there. The hotel had forgotten. And no reservation for dinner. The lady was really nice and scrambled to get things together and get us a table upstairs but it was already late. So, we walked across the street and had my 50th Birthday dinner at the Irish Pub. A great way to go I say. Anyway, I was OK with it but my wife was bummed out of course because she had worked so hard to surprise me. I mean all in all it was OK and I'm sure some people really love the place. But, they really had a chance to shine and it didn't happen. I'm sure now it's better because they have been open awhile and worked the bugs out.

Stayed over the weekend with my husband and 12 year old daughter. Our room had a Queen bed and loft. We loved the design of the room. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Was a bit hesitant when I read about the noise, but we didn't have any issues. Had a wonderful time and would definitely stay here again. Loved the Moxy!

The Moxy is one of the most high energy and fun hotels I have stayed at recently. Rooms are small but expertly designed for efficiency. We stayed in a room with a Queen bed and, since my son and I were only in the room in order to sleep, the size of the space was not an issue. The youthful vibe is noticeable from the moment we entered the lobby and I found the staff to be engaging and attentive. The elevators operate based on access to assigned floors which took some getting used to, however, it flowed smoothly every time except one time when the lobby was slammed with guests.The gym is adequate with lots of treadmills and elipticals as well as free weights and a punching bag. Location of the hotel was excellent for the purposes of our visit and is within close proximity of Penn Station, the ESB, and Times Square. A great selection of eateries surround the Moxy including a Dunkin Doughnuts right next door.We were on the 5th floor and noise was never an issue although the hotel supplied ear plugs on the night stand just in case.

This was the only hotel on my corporate site that was available for the dates I needed- I get NYC hotel rates are aligned to demand and can fluctuate- but this hotel offers rooms for 99.00 a night and truthfully that’s all it’s worth. The room is about the size of a prison cell with “trendy” finishes that try to distract you from the reality of your situation. Here are a few fun facts about my stay.1. The sink doesn’t drain properly2. The toilet seat is broken 3. The smell is so bad (musty) I had to go to Duane Reade to purchase air spray, cleaning supplies and candles to mask the scent.4. The bed is against the wall which feels so unsanitary 5. The shower water pressure is terrible 6.The lines to the elevator are long and one elevator isn’t in use because it’s for the rooftop bar 7. The lobby is full of 20 somethings- and extremely hecticMy recommendation- Unless you’re spending 99.00 a night stay elsewhere.
user_name:
eliza7654
New York City, New York

review_body: We were 7 friends (all ladies ages 52-63) visiting NYC. We all LOVED EVERTHING about the Moxy NYC Times Square. It has a really cool, funky vibe and lots of great spaces to hang out. Rooms were spotless, well thought out, practical and the beds were super comfy. We had food and drinks in various areas of the hotel and all was superbe!We will definitely be back.

I stay here because of the convenience to my office. The staff is great, the restaurant delicious and teh roof top bar enjoyable. The guest rooms have clearly taken a back set. This would be fine if the value was there. Poor beds, below average blankets and pillows, no coffee machine and no room service, no bath products other than soap and shampoo make this a no frills room. Room prices leave you expecting more!

I would highly recommend the Moxy for those wishing to hob nob around central NYC. Excellent service, staff are amazing and although the rooms are compact, they are perfect for purpose! Definitely visit the Magic Hour rooftop bar!

I tried giving this hotel a second chance, and again the staff let me down. I extended my stay here. I went to their restaurant Legasea to have food & drinks. I advised the bartender Nina that I needed to go downstairs to refurbish my room key. Nina the bartender asked me to leave a credit card, because my room was coming up unoccupied. I typically put the food & drinks to my room at a hotel, because of the points. I advised Nina that my credit cards were in my room, and that I will be right back. As I was having my room situation clarified, the manager Alexis,at the Hotel restaurant, Legasea, came down in an aggressive manner with my Bar bill in the amount of $25.00, making me sign the bill with great urgency, as if I were trying to run out on the bill, which she could clearly see that I was at the front desk. I felt embarrassed & humiliated. And I still gave a twenty percent tip, despite them mortifying me. I then proceeded to go back to the hotel restaurant/Bar to finish my meal & drink. I had some unpleasant words for the bartender Nina. The hotel restaurant Legasea, would do so much better if they fired or retrain the bartender Nina, and the restaurant manager Alexis. They need a comprehensive lesson in Hospitality. It’s a shame, because the hotel is funky, cool, fun, the restaurant Legasea has great food & cocktails, but some of the staff members have no business in the hospitality industry. I don’t recommend this hotel to anyone. I predict that if this Hotel does not train their staff accordingly, this hotel will not survive. I just call it how I see it. I’ve never had such a horrible experience in the many Hotels I stay at, like I’ve had at this hotel. We’ll see if they shape up a year from now.
user_name:
TheGustoExperience
New York City, New York

review_body: We have just arrived back from a week in NY, staying at The Moxy. It hadn't opened when we booked it and when the reviews started coming in saying there were problems with the room sizes and noise we were a bit worried.We needn't have been. From arrival to leaving we could not fault them. We had emailed them in advance asking for a low floor (away from the club noise) and a room with the tv facing the bed and also that it was our 20th wedding anniversary.Got to our room.... on the 11th floor with a tv side on to the bed in what can only be described as snug. My heart did sink a bit but when my hubby showed me the tv was on a cantilever hinge I was ok. The room, although small was perfect, and as long as I had a comfy bed and a decent shower I was happy and I'd heard these were perfect.We were given two tokens each for free cocktails which we got from the bar on the 2nd floor. Very impressed with the bar area, also has a relaxed but funky lounge area to sit in with street views. There was a DJ there playing fabulous tunes, I was almost reluctant to leave. The day after arriving was our Anniversary so we went out exploring NY and went for a meal we'd pre booked, not getting back till around 9pm. We opened the door and our room was decorated with balloons and flower petals. It was such a surprise and made our day feel extra special. I don't know who did it but thanks to the moxy crew, it was a lovely touch.The bed was v comfy, we were reluctant to get out of in the morning and the shower is fabulous. The maid came every day although there is an option to refuse.There was a stash cupboard that supplied toiletries, which was brilliant as I'd forgotten my razor. No charge. You could also help yourselves to extra pillows and towels, such a good idea.We were up and out by 8am every day, grabbing two egg and cheese muffins for $3 at the Dunkin donuts next door, very handy when you're out and about. If we were back at the hotel before too late we could grab a handful of sweets and a bottle of water (free) before they were put away. We tried out the rooftop bar on one of our evenings, we went up early before the crowds and managed a game of crazy golf and drank our drink on the carousel with views of the ESB, fabulous. It's free for hotel guests but others have to pay an entrance fee. The drinks up there are pricey but we only went for one. On our last day we checked out at 12 ( very respectable) and we were able to use the luggage room for free until we left for the airport. You were given a ticket for each bag/case and its manned so no worries about leaving your luggage unattended. Can honestly say this hotel is fabulous. Yes it's got a vibe that is possibly aimed at the younger traveller, the fun and funky elements in the decor, the basketball in the lobby, the music, the rooftop bar, but don't let this put you off if you feel too old. There's a real mix of ages, nationalities and clientele but that's what makes it fun. We would definitely stay here again. Thank you Moxy crew.

Moxy is a great concept. A reasonable price with excellent services and location. The bed is rather small but apart from that our stay was perfect. Try the magic hour rooftop as well! Amazing view and very cool decoration.

Cool hotel in a great location. Rooms are small but very thoughtfully prepared. Nice fitness facility and the rooftop bar and brunch are great. Staff is extremely friendly and helpful. Great value. Will definitely stay here again.

It’s a super dope hotel. Cool bar, amazing roof deck and staff is exceptional. The room is tiny. Like super Super duper tiny. Amazing use of space and very hip but not a room you can spend a few hours in hanging out. If you’re in town and don’t need to spend much time in room, the. I totally recommend it. If you like to hang and relax in the room, you may want to think about a larger scale hotel. Overall i totally dig the place tho.

A unique hotel. The staff was friendly and the check in process was easy. The rooms are TINY (ie: head, side and foot of bed were against walls) However - the bed was very comfortable. The staff was great - the elevators took some getting used to, but worked well. The room was clean -shower worked well - not much room to put toiletries around the sink. They give you bottled waters each day which was a nice touch. However - the biggest downfall was that it was very noisy - there is a rooftop bar and the music was quite loud. So loud that I wouldn't stay again. (and I'm not talking the normal "city" noise) Location wise was perfect - easy walk to Penn Station

Stayed for 5 nights early June. We had a great time room was perfect. On the small side but that’s New York. Location is perfect. Rooftop bar was ok but pricey. Read some reviews complaining about noise but we didn’t have a problem at all(we stayed on the 8th floor) would stay here again in an instant and highly recommend it .
