excellent location; modern design and fun staffs; disappointed that the rooftop not accessible from the hotel; neutral feeling to the elevator system; bathroom design is more chic than functional: sink is not deep enough, big shower area (handicaps accessible room?) with some water not running to drain and bathroom as clean as I expect. many hooks in room for hanging stuffs, foldable side table and chair designs are exceptional.

I booked a twin-bedded room. I was just looking for an affordable room that was conveniently located (conveneint to Penn Station and subways). I was pleasantly surprised by the hotel and room.Front desk and security team were very friendly. My room was the expected size, but everything was efficiently laid out. I felt like it was plenty of room for me and my suitcase. I liked the little touches like the hooks all along the wall and storage space under the bed. The bathroom was new with a nice shower.I didn't have time to explore the rest of the hotel but next time I'd like to try the rooftop bar and take a gym class.

Moxy was perfectly located near Times Square. Very busy hotel but the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Although on the smaller side the rooms were modern and comfortable. All the amenities worked as advertised and I found myself getting good uninterrupted sleep. Also a 15 min walk to Central Park, not to mention any food option you might need.

We picked this hotel based on the nice interior which did not disappoint us.I should be noted that the rooms are quite small. The customer service at the front desk was not how it should be.The front desk people did not care about your needs.Rather they were playing games or bragging about how good their hotel is.

We booked in to the Moxy for location. I did not know it was going to be so cute and quirky! The staff was exceptionally good with us … friendly, helpful … taught us how to use the elevator. No. Really. ;-) They even treated us to a free drink at the bar! There is a very nice restaurant, and a bar at the top that seems VERY popular, based on the lines outside the door in the evening. The room was very unique … but not very big. We had just come from a long European trip, with four cases between us, and the room was not "quite" big enough for all of us … We had to keep one case in the bathroom, for example. ;-) (I did find out LATER that they have luggage storage …) The bed was on a platform, with no way to get in from either side (one side against the wall), so it was a bit challenging for "old folks". Small table and small stools folded and hung on the wall. Not a lot of space for "stuff". There were so many other fun little elements to the place …. I will certainly stay again … just not with my "older" husband. ;-)Bottom line: This is a great little hotel for a stay in the big city … take your overnight bag. If you are older and have flexibility or mobility issues, this is probably not the best choice.

Very modern hotel. Lovely friendly staff who give the hotel a very welcoming and lively vibe. Very clean rooms with everything you need. Restaurant on site serves amazing food. Also has a rooftop bar with a fab view of the Empire State Building. Would definitely return to Moxy hotel!

we had a ticking sound from most probably airco, so they have changed rooms. we were on the road side, except for the one night construction workers kept us awake there was not much noise. good service en nice rooms. great location!

We absolutely loved our stay at the Moxy. From the speedy check in on arrival after a 17 hour journey, to the decor in the rooms, and to the ideal location, everything was perfect! The view from the rooftop bar was also stunning!I'd recommend anyone to stay at this hotel and believe the price is very competitive for such a lovely hotel only a 10 minute walk away from Times Square. It also had the feel of a very modern hotel, and I particularly liked the eye for detail in the rooms. It was tastefully decorated and felt like everything in the room was positioned where it was for a reason.Only negative I would say is that it can get quite loud on certain nights from the rooftop bar (Weds-Sat I think), but the earplugs provided managed to drown out most the noise for me and I'm a light sleeper!

I loved the clean room, fabulous shower and convenience at the Moxy. If you like your dance music loud, into the wee hours, that is a plus, too. It was difficult sleeping with all that partying going on upstairs.

I spent 2 nights at Moxy NYC Times Square. My room was not cleaned and made between the 1st and the 2nd night and the Wifi was "Service Unavailable. DNS failure" both nigths. No one available to help with Internet after 4 calls to the lobby and 2 attemps to connect with a helpdesk service that ended up in hanging me up... Unexpected Marriot service

Cozy, friendly, excellent food, great staff, cool decor, nice work-out facilities, and STUNNING rooftop! Moxy is very convenient for market trips - overall great experience. Not to mention - technology on steroids...wait until you take the elevator...it's really cool!

I had an excellent experience in Moxy. Exactly what I needed for my independent spirit. I felt at home.The room satisfied perfectly my requirements except for the air conditioning that was noisy and made me catch a serious cold because it was always moving too much air just at the side of my bed.The rest of the features excellent.The crew kind and present when it was needed.The design and concept of the entire building trendy and avant-guard. Free water everyday very useful and chocolates and candies when it was rainy a nice gesture.

Location was perfect, right at Time Square! Very nice hotel, clean and cosy.But the best of all, was certainly the high quality level of customer service.A young staff, always ready to help, very kind, repectfull and effecient.I will go back there for my next visit to NY.

This is definitely a unique hotel experience, but if you are open to it then it will add to your NYC visit. I loved the whole look and style. First night we got in near midnight and just wanted to go directly to bed. That room was on 16th floor so music was an issue and it was smaller than I realized, plus an issue with the AC. Next day the front desk was so helpful to switch our room to better size and location for four of us, plus even gave us a Starbucks card as a sorry about the A/C. Its the small things often and the care and thought the staff showed for us went a long way. The gym was good sized to get a work out in, limited weights but effective and good cardio equipment. Elevators are quick but yes take getting used to, but after a try or two you'll get it.After getting a room with two beds, it was super comfy and the elements of the room are fun. Yes no closet but plenty of underneath the bed storage and no wasted space. Its NYC so rooms are smaller, they just are. Shower was a joy, so relaxing.We even got to use our free drink token for signature cocktail which hit the spot, nice area to hang out, my kids loved it. I also liked the visible security and staff at all times, felt welcome and safe. Perfect location for really anything you could want to do. Plus a great price and value.While the style may not be for everyone, don't let that intimidate you. The staff have excellent customer service, they were always around keeping things full and ready, had plenty of warm smiles and know how to be hosts. Definitely will be on the top of the list next time our family is NYC. Thanks Moxy staff for a wonderful trip.

Loved my stay! Rain shower head, blackout curtains (that really work!), clean, stylish, comfortable bed, central location that is great for walking around NYC, welcome cocktail in their fancy shmancy bar was a classy touch. Would definitely stay again.

Rooms are new, clean and very trendy. Front desk folks are very friendly and helpful. Hotel is located very close (5-7 mins walk) to Penn Station which connects you to several subway lines towards West Village, Chelsea, Downtown Manhattan, and also Grand Central Station, and East Manhattan. Overall great experience and would consider returning again!

We like this place. Great location, friendly and helpful staff. Moxy is the new generation of Marriott hotels and I think they did this right. I worked for Marriott for 13 years and I am proud they are staying current and listening to their customers needs. The second floor,Bar Moxy, has a nice bar with a simple menu is perfect for a bit and drink. Additionally it is a large space with lots of workspace with free Wifi. If you are a Marriott rewards Platinum member...skip the welcome drink and get your points. The champagne was flat and not good quality.

I stayed at the Moxy for one night on a stopover in New York. The hotel has a great location on 7th avenue right by Times Square so very convenient to go out and explore the city. Really liked the design, layout, dining options and use of the common spaces to hangout and work. It’s trendy, vibrant and has a great buzz. The room was very small, but comfortable, bed and shower were both great, but no wardrobe space so have to use the hangers on the wall to store your stuff...Was very disappointed with the noise levels in the room however, not just from the rooftop bar, but also the air conditioning. Wasn’t able to sleep (not even with the earplugs provided which is usually a sign!) and ended up changing rooms in the middle of the night which was very inconvenient . Second room was a bit better but could still hear the music so think there’s definitely an issue with soundproofing.Breakfast was good as was check in and checkout and there’s a gym that’s open 24 hours. I think this hotel, and especially the concept, has great potential but they definitely have to look at the noise levels so beware when you book.

This hotel was so much fun for me and some girlfriends. It’s in a great part of the city and everything was very accessible. The hotel itself was so fun and all amenities were perfect for a stay! Great trip overall!

Spent nine days at the Moxy and I wish I could say that the good outweighs the bad, sadly I simply can't do so.1) We were overcharged some $350+ in lieu of a 'holding charge' that a) we were not told about, b) was never even brought up until I asked about the overpayment and c) a payment we are still waiting for some two weeks since we returned from our trip2) No one came to clean our room for the first four nights, incredibly I know. I brought this up with the staff and they seemed genuinely surprised and offered us a free breakfast, the next day the room was still not cleaned... Over the course of our entire nine day stay, our room was cleaned twice. Given the price of the hotel this is a level of service that can not be acceptable.3) I've heard a lot of complaints about the noise, to be honest this wasn't such an issue, the ear plugs supplied were not needed, so that's a major plus.4) The staff overall were helpful and the vibe or the place is a positive on the whole.5) The location is great and the rooms, though small, are well designed and just needed to be cleaned more often6) The lifts took some getting used to. Tip, do not 'double order' the lift, you'll know what I mean when you find yourself standing around for ten minutes waiting for a lift to pick you up.7) The bed provided was one of the most comfortable I've ever experienced, big plus there.I wish I could say the positives were enough to make me want to stay again but the sheer fact that an additional charge was taken from us, without being informed, and has still not been rectified, leads us with a very sour taste to be honest. I'd hope this hotel would try to rectify these problems but you can see from previous reviews that these problems are very much still evident.Must try better

We stayed 7 days in the Moxy hotel. It was a very pleasant stay! The location is fantastic, in the middle of the centre. The staff is very helpfull. The rooms are small, but you get used to it. Everything you need is in there.

Fantastic vibe to the hotel, young and... Funky! Rooms are Scandinavian in design and configuration and small but very fit for purpose. A Great restaurant, staff and bars. Will definitely be going back!

Staff was great. Room small but we just slept there. Very fun place to stay not your typical stuffy hotel's new wave hotel for all ages. I'm 47 and had a great time staying thereno recommend you try this hotel. You won't be disappointed.

Stayed here for a week with my son. First impressions are really good, the hotel looks new and had a funky, hip reception area. The lifts are good and easy to use. The rooms are small with very little storage space, as others mention you have to hang clothes on hooks around the wall which doesn't look particularly good. Bathroom was adequate although again quite small. The noise from the rooftop club is definitely something to be wary of if considering booking this hotel. We didn't use any of the facilities other than our room preferring to get out and about instead but the 2nd floor bar looked nice. I would consider this hotel again but maybe for a shorter stay and definitely requesting a lower floor room. I think the management need to decide what's most important to them - the rooftop club or the hotel patrons. Maybe they could relaunch the club for a different more laid back clientele with a less frenetic play list :-)

We stayed at the Moxy for 4 nights at the end of May 2018. Absolutely no issues whatsoever. Staff were helpful and friendly, perfect location for exploring the city. If previously seen people moan about the noise coming from the rooftop bar, we stayed on floor 17 one floor below the bar and heard nothing even with the window open at night. Great beds, great bathroom and a great experience.

The hotel was ideally located midtown so sights were within a walkable distance. The subway was easily reached to go further if required. Hotel was vibrant with plenty of energy with staff that only wanted to help and make your stay enjoyable. I would have no problem in recommending this hotel for a trip to NYC.

Modern, young, vibrant midtown hotel in the ‘boutique’ style with a popular roof top bar. Excited to be in NYC and all wide-eyed whilst also sleep-deprived, check in was easy even if it was by a rookie under supervision, our room, lift use instructions and token for a free drink in hand was simple. No stuffy desk receptionist and big queues here. Up on the 17th floor room 1703 has no view, not even into the central atrium, blinds are permanently down to ensure privacy from our neighbour’s adjoining window at a 90 degree angle and everyone else just a few meters away. Also there is little or no furniture to speak of. Instead of a wardrobe or built in hanging space - we were booked in for a week - pegs line the wall and so we decorated our room with our clothes. Not a good look. The double bed is great, the en suite is accessible with hand rails and spacious. All ok really, though the blinds piss me off, I can live with it. We check in on a Monday and spend 3 glorious fun packed days exploring NYC. Wednesday evening however is noticeable because from about 10pm, directly above us we hear banging house music. We feel royally annoyed that no mention anywhere was made to this fact. The earplugs provided offer no protection. 12.10am and I call the crew to be told this is on until 2am and then it’s a busy weekend with parties until 4am. I’m given apologies that we were not told, apologies not accepted and I’m told we can ask for a move in the morning. We speak with John first thing, he tells us we can pack up and leave our bags at reception and there should be room by 4pm - nothing showing at that time. We go eat breakfast and pack and when we go down with all our things we have to explain again as John isn’t there. Our crew member says there is a room available on a lower floor and says it’s a queen room so it’s an upgrade. Have to say they are helpful and sorry for our discomfort. However, our room in 723 is half the size and to say this is disappointing is an understatement. The bed is accessible from one side only. The few things I’ve taken out of our cases make our room look like a thrift store and the hand basin is outside the shower room, taking up more space so that we are excusing ourselves to get by. Basically, it’s a single occupancy room set up for one/two night stays. Had we known the impact the rooftop bar would have had to our comfort, I’d have made sure we were below 10th floor - the music is a distant, occasional noise from the 7th. Had they told us in person on check in or made mention of the bar playing loud music we would have thought twice about booking it. It’s clean, stylish, crew are friendly but not coordinated enough to deal with our moans.Seems to me this place is more like a trendy roof top bar with accommodation rather than a hotel. If I was 25 years younger I’d have more sense than to spend my money here. Older doesn’t always mean wiser.

not a good experience. The place is super loud, sleeping without ear plugs nearly impossible. the rooms are humid, the volume of the AC unit is that of a tractor and sometimes they clear and do your room, sometimes not. You never know. The speed of the breakfast is that slow you need to allow for a 1,5 hours. Sometimes you get water on the room, sometimes not. It is a pretty unpredictable place. Not suitable for people with a tight business schedule. But if you are laid back and 25, than it's a cool place.

This hotel is sexy as it can be...smells great, everything is super clean...the people working is very aware and helpfull. The low lights, comfy room and its roof!!! Woooww... best place to stay in NYC! By far!

This is a clever hotel with the necessary at premium quality and the unnecessary gone or reduced. Funky and affordable hipster vibe to the place. You get all you need with many added touches and great customer focussed feel with cut back approach to the rooms. Cool.

Rooms are small which is to be expected with no storage cabinets but very clean and cute! Overall the hotel is in a great spot, awesome views fun atmosphere, great food, staff and service was great as well! never a dull moment.

This was an extremely clean and modern hotelThe staff are extremely friendly and helpful and it’s in a great location in the heart of Times Square It can be a little load at night as the rooftop bar is open till 4am

We found this place perfect!!! Really nice staff, perfect location, you can do everything just walking a few blocks! We was with our son and needed a fridge so we ask and they put for us at our room! Really great and we will return for sure!

Great location, easy access to subway, walking distance to many restaurants and NYC landmarks. Super friendly and knowledgeable staff. The Moxy is great for families, weekend getaways, or business trip. I am looking forward to returning to The Moxy.

Amazing ans helpful staff! Crystal was great fun and there was always a great vibe. Roof top was beautiful and the location was great! 10/10 and I would def go back! They also have amazing shower and comfortable rooms!

What a trendy different hotel! Very fun and wonderfully convenient to everything! I wasn’t sure what to think at first because it is so different, but the stay was wonderful, I slept like a baby and loved the shower

I stayed at this hotel with my partner, we had the most amazing experience. The staff are very helpful and friendly and will always go the extra mile. The rooftop bar has amazing views of Empire State. The location is excellent 5 min walk from Times Square. We will definitely be going back to NYC and staying at Moxy.

If you like a young,hip,clean hotel in the center of New York,stop looking!Also great breakfast and very good service.I would come again,definately!Too bad we didn’t find time to go to the rooftopbar,it must be fantastic,cause the lines to get in sometimes have shown that!

Arrived at Moxy and pleased with helpful staff and great amenities and location - rooms were very small even by NY standards but comfy and beds decent size.. Biggest annoyance was lack of wardrobe space - we had to hang our clothes up around the room - not ideal. We come to the city a lot and have found it frustrating that simple things at the Moxy are not quite right. Firstly it’s been a Hot humid week in the city and clearly the air con systems are not up to scratch as we had to move rooms as our unit stopped working. Second room was bigger - great - but again air con not working so was really sticky in the room and had to have all the windows open. Secondly they won’t take cash on check out so had to load the credit card. They also took two lots of charge for the room - preauthorisation for any charges, but again no idea when this will come off. Another thing to mention is the rooftop bar is disappointing. We did go up one night but there’s no where to sit unless you pay a minimum bottle charge ($600) and the bar takes ages to be served. If you want a decent rooftop experience head to 230 Fifth where there’s loads of seating and happy hour from 2pm TIL 7pm. Overall not the worst hotel generally but as we have stayed in Ny regularly we probably wouldn’t come back again.

The location is a hotspot especially with its rooftop terrace. If you are not expecting a quite hideaway but a trendy and urban hotel you are definitely right at this place. The rooms are functional and very modern.

Great location, but far enough away from the hustle of Times Sq.Funky hotel with access to the best roof top in NYC providing views of the Empire State Building.Fun and friendly staff.Great value for money when compared to The Refinery.

First they welcomed me and my entire family (8) to relax in the 2nd floor lounge early in the morning after our 15 hour flight. Thank you, it was a life saver! Once we gained our land legs, and the kitchen opened, we enjoyed a delicious breakfast with huge portions. We were then able to check our bags (the whole group's bags), while we explored NYC until our room was ready. They then accommodated an early check in! I mean service was impeccable. The room is super cute and exactly as pictured on website. Very comfortable. 15th floor did not acquire any noise from rooftop bar. I would definitely recommend this hotel. Thank you Moxy for making my stay comfortable and exceeding my expectations!!! Friendly desk staff with every interaction.

My room was comfortable for my solo two day trip but it was not family friendly, not sure if other rooms are available? Trendy, modern designs with the sink being outside of the shower and toilet area. Hotel amenities are good, friendly staff and great location.

Moxy has it all, I enjoyed it so much this was my 2nd stay in a month. The staff is just great. The roof top bar is one of the best clubs I have ever been to. Great drinks. Mike at the font desk is so helpful with tips on where to go and how to utilize the hotel.

We had a fantastic stay. The location is great, it is super easy to walk everywhere. The restairants in the area are super tasty but the hotel breakfast is awesome too, especially when NYC is too crowded on a sunday morning. The staff is really nice and helpful as well. We would come back anytime. Best stay in NYC so far! 10/10

Stayed last week for 3 nights, lovely greeting on arrival and everything explained to us by a lovely girl. Yes the room was small but if we’d bothered actually unpacking and putting stuff away (in too much of a rush to see the sights) then we would’ve had a bit more room. Bed was comfy and and room was kept clean throughout our stay. Got two free cocktails on arrival and the bar was well stocked, although they need to learn how to make a porn star martini properly to get a 10/10 . Visited the roof top lounge which was busy but jumped the queue as residents. Ate in the hotel restaurant and the food and service was good. Would definitely recommend the hotel, friendly staff, clean, excellent location and something a bit different. Will definitely visit again.
user_name:
Helen9467
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

review_body: I enjoyed stay at the Moxy. Not my typical NYC stay, but the location was great, with several nearby restaurants. And the hotel itself, and rooms in particular, are nicely designed and modern. I see claims of tiny rooms, which are fair, but I managed.

Enjoyed our stay very much. Super-clean and stylish. Great staff. Perfect for the brief visit we made. Nice lounge, bar, and available restaurants. Appears to be relatively fresh and new facility. I will return!

On arrival at the hotel we were greeted right away and the host then advised us that there would be additional charges to the room USD916 and USD20 for incidentals, this money was reserved from our bank card .. fair enough... Then we arrived in the room, the bed was a standard double of which 3 sides were flat against the walls, i.e. you climbed in on one side roll over and your partner gets in the same side so I now have to climb over my partner to exit the bed! see photoThe Gap between the entrance side of the bed to the bathroom is one door width then a narrow slim sink and standard shower. I have stayed in many hotels and even in Hong Kong my bedroom was far bigger and around the same price!DAY one - BAD START - TERRIBLE - "FREE" COCKTAIL - TRIED TO GET IN ROOF TOP BAR - HAD TO GO OUTSIDE ADVISED WE WERE RESIDENTS AND TOLD TO GET IN QUEUE - ARRIVED EVENTUALLY, NO ROOM, NO SERVICE AT BAR TOO BUSY!! - WASTE OF TIME!DAY two - NO ROOM SERVICED so went out ARRIVED BACK 11.30PM STILL NO ROOM SERVICED, CALLED RECEIPTION BASICALY THEY SAID NOTHING WE CAN DO.. :-(DAY four... left the room on time to check out went to reception told them we were not happy.. again host said nothing we can do now... then proceeded to swipe my card again... SO NOW I HAVE TWO PENDING CHARGES FOR THE HOTEL TO THE TUNE OF GBP 1895 !! I REQUEST ANSWERS AND FAST CURRENTLY MY BANK TELL ME I HAVE TO WAIT 10 DAYS TO GET ONE PAYMENT BACK MAYBE IF THE HOTEL DOESNT REQUEST TWICE??Shockingly bad - Terrible service - Terrible room - Terribly over priced!

We stayed here for the first time in an overnight trip to the city. We didn’t need fancy, but we were surprised at the quality of this experience for the price. It was a great location just a bit south of where a lot of the action is in the Times Square/Midtown section of Manhattan. The location was great with lots of coffee shops and restaurants nearby for a quick breakfast meal. The room was small in terms of square footage but it’s NYC, & you don’t come here to sit in an hotel room! In our two double room there was no chair but we didn’t mind. Also no coffee maker which was probably the only real downside.Great shower. Bathroom was small but it worked for me & my brother. Funky bar on the 2nd floor. Staff was super friendly, especially Jailene & Christopher at check in.

Our room on the 15th floor with four bunk beds afforded zero room for our luggage. To make matters worse once the Magic Hour rooftop bar opened it was as though we were in the nightclub literally until 4 am. The bass echoed off the interior of the building, it was absolutely unbelievable how loud it was in our room, and the provided ear plugs were of zero help! We were all miserable and unable to sleep. When we returned from a show Friday night I did call the manager to see if we could leave the property (was willing to pay more to get outta there), but he said they would still have to charge us (with taxes around $312!). Thankfully they let us out of he balance of our reservation. Steer clear of this property if you are looking for sleep.

Great little hotel, 10 mins from Times Square. Great food, stunning rooftop bar. Rooms are great! Not what i expected. Very friendly staff. Lots of places to eat within walking distance. The breakfast choice at the hotel, is good, and large!! Macys is a 5 minute walk away.

I stayed at the Moxy NYC Times Square - a Marriott property - and overall had a very good stay. But as many other reviewers have noted, you need to understand that the target audience of the hotel is toward Millennialls and make sure it works for you.My purpose in staying at the hotel was to save some money on my semi-annual business trips to Manhattan. Hotel rooms in NYC routinely run over $400 for mid level hotels. So when I heard about the Moxy concept and price point (~$200/night), I thought I'd give it a try.To begin with, I did save the money I hoped to. I typically stay down near 24th Street at a Hilton Property and by staying at the Moxy I saved over $180/night for three nights. I'll take the ~$500 savings every time. My stay was from Sunday to Wednesday so I did miss the notoriously loud weekends.The hotel is focused on being hip/trendy for the Millennial crowd. Lobby is sparse with a chic vibe where several check-in kiosks are staffed by employees. Second floor is the communal area which includes couches, tables and high-tops to spread out and work, get a bite to eat or have a drink at the bar in the evening.The hotel rooms are very small. You definitely need to know that before making a reservation. I have also stayed at a POD Hotel and thought the Moxy's room was a little bit nicer. The bed was comfortable, there was a small sink in the room versus in the bathroom, and hooks along one wall as there is no closet. My one room complaint was about the hooks - almost half of them were over the TV or the sink, etc. Therefore functional hanging space for suit/dress shirts was at a premium. There was an in-room steam iron which was handy for getting my clothes looking nice for meeting. Having stayed at the POD Hotel and small rooms in Europe, the room was fine for my purposes. But definitely look at the pictures to make sure it suits your travel needs.Regarding the noise - I came in knowing it could be loud from the many reviews noting as such. I thought Sunday - Wednesday would be quieter. It was quiet on Monday and Tuesday night. But Sunday there was a raging party on the second floor and the music was loud up until 3:00 a.m. On the 5th floor I could hear the DJ word for word. The hotel does provide ear plugs and somehow I slept okay the first night, but a party lasting that long on a Sunday night is kinda ridiculous. I realize who the hotel is marketing to, but I think the hotel, the Moxy brand and Marriott could benefit from focusing more on the hotel guests rather the party atmosphere - at least Sunday through Thursdays.I am planning on staying here again for business trips as the savings are worth the small issues. I also think Marriott is missing the boat on business travelers. Many of us just need a place to sleep and don't want to drop $400 - $500 per night in Manhattan and/or don't want to stay in New Jersey to save a few dollars. Focusing on business travelers mid-week and younger travelers on the weekend seems like the best of both worlds. Mid week (Sunday - Thursday) the music should stop at midnight. Otherwise the location, nightly rate proximity to Penn Station and trendy vibe make for a good place I plan on staying at in the future.

I Loved it!!! The hotel is very clean,great atmosphere , practical design and perfect vibe.Location near 34th street for shopping.The hotel roof bar was memorable. Hotel's crew were very nice and polite

I cannot say enough good things about this place. Number 1. Location is excellent, number 2. The food is awesome, number 3. Magic hour at the rooftop bar cannot be beat. Shout out to Priscella, Sean, and RJ at Magic hour, you guys went out of your way to make sure everything was perfect and it was. Also to Trevor and all the staff at Legesea. The food was too die for, great a ps, entrees and do not get me started on desert. Thanx guys. Loved everything about the place. We will be back. I read comments about noise and yes they do provide earplugs for you. We never used ours and never had a noise problem. Also yes the rooms are small but very tastefully done and the rainfall shower is a great perk. Bar moxy is a great place to hang out and chill, play games or people watch. A winner all around

This was our second stay at Moxy NYC and it did not disappoint! When you walk in to reception you are greeted by a super friendly staff with great music and games! The hotel is clean and modern. It offers great food choices and location can’t be beat! We will definitely come back again!

This hotel is aimed at young travellers. It is a hotel with a party vibe and the decor is very hipster. We got the room with 2 double beds and it was sooo comfy. The room is quite small but I don’t think it needs to be bigger as it adds to the coziness. The only reason we noticed is because we had a lot of luggage.The hotels location is flawless, easy access to anywhere with Subway and Uber. Of course it’s within walking distance of Times Square too. The roof top bar is also a bonus, I got the alcoholic cupcakes and they were HUGE for the price.The free drinks tokens were great. Play about with the in room phones and they give you phrases to say at the bar for free cocktails.The only major downside to the stay was that our shower was was faulty meaning it was dripping quite loudly all throughout the night. They tried to fix it but it was still broken. As our stay was so short it wasn’t even worth moving rooms.I would highly recommend this hotel to young travellers but its draw may be lost on the older generations.

Well positioned for sightseeing and Times Square. Very popular roof top bars. Rooms compact but good quality beds and excelllent shower en suite. Helpful staff. Not great views from the room sadly. Did not eat in hotel.

The hotel has very friendly staff who are all courteous and really helpful. Jasmine in particular was really helpful. The hotel is in a great location too, right in the centre of the city. Everything is very new and very clean.
user_name:
ksv2124
New York City, New York

review_body: Location is perfect, hotel is totally clean, staff are very friendly and extremely helpful. Would fully recommend this hotel to anyone perfect nights sleep no noise at all in the evening and the wifi and air conditioning is free as an added bonus. Rooms are a nice size with unique decor and even got a chrome cast with the tv to watch anything you want to ! Would defiantly return.

No concierge. No closet. No drawers. No desk/table. No help from front staff...where to go for a great meal; have a couple free hours what touristy thing could we see; do you have a pen/envelope... 1 staffer,Alex, was helpful but if he was off or on break, no one else could help. Literally your bed mate has to climb over you to get out of bed as the bed is against the wall on 3 sides. Seriously ! Rooms are ridiculously small!

Me and my husband are visiting the MOXY for our honeymoon and we can’t recommend the hotel enough. Samson, at the front desk, was kind enough to upgrade our room for our honeymoon and the room is absolutely amazing. It’s made an already wonderful trip, even better! The location is perfect and everyone working here is so helpful. Would recommend 100%

I tagged along with my husband during a quick business trip from MD to NYC. We arrived at Penn Station and were able to easily walk a few blocks with a large suitcase each. The checkin process was fast and all the employees were helpful. The lobby is full of oversized games like connect 4 and Jenga, but the lobby air-freshener will knock you out. I got used to it after a few days. The room was tiny, but functional. It was very tight ,and because my pocketbook is the size of a small duffle bag I had to hang it in the shower (see photo). There are no closets in the room, just hooks. The side table and chair are collapsed and hung on the wall because there is simply not enough room (see photo). The video we uploaded on FB was absolutely hysterical of us trying to move around in this tiny space, but we powered-through. I must say that the shower was THE BEST shower ever! I know that sounds crazy, but it is literally all we talked about at breakfast with the other folks who stayed at the hotel. The water pressure was unbelievable and the rainfall shower head was the BEST. There is a very large common area in the center of the building that is very comfortable with lots of great seating options for groups and loners. The bar is also located in this area. At night, this place is quite the little hot spot. Good music and cool people. I really enjoyed the people watching during out stay. This floor also has prepared food available, which includes one of the best fruit salad I ever had. Seriously, everywhere I went in NY had the best fruit. We didn't get an opportunity to visit the rooftop bar because it didn't open until evening and there were private events every night we stayed. That was a little disappointing.The elevator was annoying. You must press your floor before the elevator arrives. Then the elevator tells you which door to use (number 3). We missed the elevator several times because we were quick enough. At times I felt like I was on a hidden camera show. lol Overall, I liked this place. It is not a luxury hotel and we knew that going into this, but we felt like we were getting a real NY experience. I loved the convenient location in mid-town Manhattan. Everyone staying at the hotel was nice and I would be perfectly comfortable staying here again.

I would like to say that this Hotel was awesome!! I truly enjoyed my stay at the hotel, everyone was very helpful. I enjoyed seeing the games as I came into the Hotel. The Adults Games for Game night was very fun!! The rooms was great!! I just love the Hotel.

I stayed at the Moxy while I was in the city for business. Check-in was smooth and we found all of the associates we dealt with to be very friendly and professional. The lobby had a very fresh, updated look and was very user friendly. My room was on the 7th floor. I liked the unique layout of the room – 2 double beds end to end against one wall. The bed was super comfy. There is no closet or dresser. Instead there are hooks on the wall (evenly spaced – it’s a nice design feature) and underbed storage. If you are the kind of person that likes to unpack and settle in, this might be awkward, but I was living out of my suitcase, so I was ok with it. The air conditioner was very loud, but I didn't mind that as it acted as white noise (I didn't hear any street noise or noise from the bar upstairs at all). However, there was no additional chair or small table in my room - I thought that there was supposed to be. I wasn’t in the room much, so it didn’t matter, but if there had been others with me, it would have been nice to have that chair. The bathroom in my room was HUGE! I liked all of the space, but I would have appreciated a bigger counter in the bathroom to put my toiletries. Also, the 2 sided mirror was a nice touch, but the lighting around the bathroom sink was terrible so I could not use the mirror for putting on my makeup. The window shades in my room did not go up, so I was unable to get any natural light. And I was a little freaked out that the deadbolt lock in my room did not work. These were all small things, but they did add up to raising my annoyance level a bit. I really liked Bar Moxy. It's a great space to hang out, with big comfy lounging areas and some games (jenga, a foosball table, etc.). Went in the evening and got the “welcome” cocktail. Also ate there for breakfast. Service was a bit slow, but the staff was very friendly. Overall I liked the hotel. Not sure if it will be my go-to hotel in the city, but I think my teenagers would really like it.

My wife and I arrived at the MOXY after getting our transfer from JFK which took about 45 mins. As it’s located on 7th Avenue the hotel is perfect for a short walk to Times Square and lots of other iconic attractions. The hotel it’s self is super trendy; there are 6/8 kiosks instead of normal hotel desks, there was great music being played and the staff (crew!) were very friendly. You are given your key card which you put into the elevator and using a touch screen select which floor you are going to, the screen then displays what elevator you should use which is either P1, P2, P3 or P4 (they are all right next to each other in the lobby) we were on the 3rd floor in room 325. The room it’s self was very small (but not small enough to put us off returning) but had everything; double bed, floor length mirror, shower, toilet & sink. The sink was outside the bathroom it’s self which was strange but fine! There was a flat screen TV on the wall facing the bed, there was a fold away table and 2 fold away chairs which when not being used were hung on the wall (very quirky and space saving!) there is no drawers or wardrobes, instead a few hangers from a pole on the wall. The bed was pushed up against a wall and was the full length of the room which meant if you were sleeping on the far side, you have to crawl over the other person to get out of it but again, not a huge hassle. We never made it too the roof top bar, there were massive queues to get into it both nights we were there. You do get two coins at check in which you redeem at the bar inside for two free cocktails; the bar itself was lovely and the barman was really friendly, even making us cocktails that weren’t on the menu! A few other reviews commented on the noise, we must have been luck because all three nights we never heard a thing so we didn’t even need to use the ear plugs provided! Wouldn’t hesitate on returning but just be cautious that the rooms are small so not much room for movement but who stays in their room for any great length of time in the city that never sleeps!

The location can't be beat and the atmosphere is really fun. The complimentary drinks and access to the rooftop bar is also great and I found the staff to be super helpful and friendly. My only complaint was the bed was not super comfortable and being right next to the air conditioning was kind of noisy. But otherwise, I'd stay here again
user_name:
MrsvonCullen
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Hip and cool hotel close to Time Square. Rooms are small but we'll designed. Staff were friendly and helpful. Large rooftop patio and bar is fun. Great value for the location which is close to Time Square.

Moxy was great to stay in! The location is awesome you can do a lot my walking and you have every necessary metro staction within a few walking minutes. The ambiance is very nice and so is breakfast too rooms are small but for a city trip all you need!Would definitely recommend and come back!

I stayed at the Moxy for 4 nights for a Business event. ++The staff at check-in was very friendly and welcoming. The bathroom was big. Nice roof top bar. Restaurant was good. -My room was on the 12th floor but could barely sleep because of the music coming from the roof top. The hotel does provide earplugs, however it doesn’t help. My room did not get serviced the first 2 days. When I went to check with reception, I was told that they are not a full service hotel, but since I had requested it they would clean my room. When I got back at 11:30pm, it was still not serviced. In the morning I went to reception again and finally when I got back later that day it was serviced. Mind you, my other coworkers had their rooms serviced every day, even one coworker whom had the do not disturb light on. Overall, my stay was ok.. however I will not go back to stay there. Maybe just for drinks on their roof top bar or have dinner at the restaurant.
user_name:
EmFama
New York City, New York

review_body: Had a decent stay at the Moxy in NewYork. Chose it because of its location and due to this was totally expecting the small rooms and street noise. However, what I wasn’t expecting was to be questioned as to whether I had actually paid for our room and that of my daughters (who was celebrating her 21st birthday). The young girl who was trying to check us in was great but the colleague she called upon to help was not pleasant and downright rude. As a Platinum Marriott member, or even if I wasn’t actually, I would expect far more. I won’t stay again!!!

I've never stayed in a Moxy property before but recently was able to do so on a visit to NYC. On the positive side the staff was really nice and the hotel was new and clean. It's also in a great location. But it was a bit quirky for me. On the negative side the room was one of the smallest rooms I have ever had anywhere. The bathroom was so small the sink was in the main room It was also impossible to take a shower without soaking the bathroom and the toilet paper. It might be a good choice for some, but I don't think I'll stay there again.

A definite no for anyone over 50. Small rooms, beds which are against the walls so making it difficult to get in or out. No wardrobe, only hooks which were impractical to use. The shower is good but the rest of the bathroom is too small. We didn't experience too much noise from the roof top bar as we were on the 12th of 17 floors, so somewhere in the middle. We had to shut the air conditioning off at night as it was so noisey. We tried to use the lounge one evening but it was noisy and we gave up trying to get served after a long wait. We had breakfast there one morning which was good, the second time we tried we gave up due to such a long wait to be served. The reception is a joke, cold unwelcoming and too noisey. The hotel is bearable for one or two nights. But why would you want to?

I stayed at the Moxy Times Square because of its central location, modern decor, cool crowds and moderate price but who knew it was a Marriott disguised as a hipster? Very helpful lobby attendants (like 8 check in stations) check you in in seconds, then escort you to the elevator. Rooms are compact, ultra modern but have everything you need laid out in a clever and thoughtful way. A simple folding chair hangs on a wall mount (to save space!), a small writing (or computer) desk next to the bed with desk lamp is about all the furniture in the room. Large bed and pillows are very comfortable. Modern shower/bathroom and pedestal sink complete the package. Nice bar/lounge and restaurant with great food and a very young crowd. Check it out!

The whole idea/concept of moxy is cool, is trendy, rooms are very new and clean, staff is helpful and polite, however moxy has some real deal breakers.The rooftop bar on the top of the hotel - called magic hour - makes impossible to sleep and not so magic for the sleeping guests. Sooooo loud music up to 2 a.m.!!! The sound echoes through the whole hotel. Some nights my bed was jumping together with the music beats. inside the rooms, you’ll find earplugs at your disposal (see photo), unfortunately they hardly work once the volume is awfully loud.I’ve asked to change to a quieter room, the manager kindly helped me and I did change, but the noise was the same. I spent nine nights at moxy and i only had 2 decent nights of sleep.Now reading other reviews i see it’s a regular complaint. What a pitty.Apart from that problem, everytime you’ll get a shower the rest of the bathroom gets wet/flooded (see photos). It happened on both rooms as well. So i had to whipe the bathroom floor for nine days... after every shower with its own towels i would never ever recommend booking it... i’ve been to some many marriotts and this definitely does not met marriott standards.

very noisy at night but a good spot to be in if you want to be in Time Square. room was small and my bed was pushed against two walls and i was to big to fit in the bed. Unfortunately they were sold out so i had to sleep on the floor. Showers were cool

The moxy is a very friendly, modern, relaxed hotel. The location is great, we could walk to most places from the hotel. The rooms are really modern and minimalist and you are supplied with everything you need. The beds are also super comfy! Thank you Moxy.

Great location. Hotel itself was really bad. Room so small and badly designed we had to put our luggage in the bathroom as there was nowhere in the room to put it.Huge tv at the end of the bed so low that we kicked it with our feet during the night. The bed was up against the wall so had to climb over each other to use bathroom.No hanging space. Hooks on wakks but again behind the huge tv.The only thing going for it was its position.

We had a wonderful week in NYC. Moxy Hotel is really well located and an excellent place to stay at. Very modern, with a nice perfume when you enter, and a pleasant rooftop. The staff is also very helpful and welcoming, especially Ashley who welcomed us.

This is the worst hotel I've stayed in - ever. The staff are terrible, the rooms are terrible and the location - albeit central - is terrible. I have never had such awful service in a hotel - the staff want to be your friend one minute and are extremely rude the next - you are asked for ID ever other minute even though you are paying for $500 a night a room. Ignore what they say about a roof top bar - that is entirely separate to the hotel itself and so you won't get in - and if you do you will be given plastic glasses as if you can't be trusted with the real deal. Also the hotel is super noisy - the roof top bar is relentless. The rooms are like bunkers. What more can I say?! AVOID.

Place more concerned with being trendy. Definitely not level of service I expect as a Platinum member. Early check in not honored so had to go business meeting in casual attire. Dinner reservation delayed and an attitude to go with it. The manager tried to appease me with an appetizer. Not set up for business travel or platinum experience. Better off at full service Marriott. Good location with loud music and kinda cool rooms but rooms are NOT conducive to working.

Location is great, however room size was tiny. We stayed here before flying to Europe, we had 2 big check in luggages you and it was a struggle packing, we had to pack our bags one at a time and use the bed for extra space. The room is not ideal for anyone who likes to 'settle' into their hotel room i.e use the wardrobe or lay out toilettries as there is no space. The bed in our room was wedged up against 3 walls, it was impossible for a person 5'10 or taller to sleep in this bed as they would not fit end to end .We booked a twin room, at check in the receptionist informed us a twin room could not fit 2 people as it only had a single bed. Why would you call it a twin room if it can only host 1 person? This misleading and confusing description needs to be revised. Also we were hyped up about the roof top bar which supposedly had views of the empire state buildig. Our venture up to the roof was completely a waste of time, there was no view of the empire state building. Further we were told by staff we could immediately get into the bar being hotel guests this again was wrong information. Security told us to go around and we had to wait in the public line for an hour to get in and up onto the rooftop. Highly advise not to stay at this hotel if you are looking to have a comfortable night sleep. If you are staying up with the city that never sleeps, then this hotel would be a good place to crash.

The hotel is funky, with a nightclub that is very loud. I found the bedrooms to small for four perons but the location is good. I wouldn’t recommend this hotel if you want to sleep at 10 Pm. They offer you one free drink at the bar. .

My son, who is nonverbal, and I visited recently and had a fantastic time! In fact, he demanded to rebook for our summer visit. It's convenient to the subway, either Penn Station or Times Square, but far from the contagion of Times Square. We enjoyed the small room, although would have loved some space around the king sized bed. We travel with smallish backpacks and don't need extra space. Our room on the 5th floor was quiet, and navigating the elevators was particularly sane. Breakfast and dinner at the bar were convenient and well priced (except for $16 cocktails...) The staff members were friendly and helpful. Our only complaint was the loud sporadic air conditioner. We'll be back!

The MOXY is a very exciting, high energy, state-of-the-art techno hotel. Nothing is traditional, even the elevators operate differently.Sleeping facilities are small in square footage, high in design. But when your here you won’t want to sleep, too much going on.Best part is the bathroom. A whole lot packed into a small space.Not for everyone, ideal for many.

Having read reviews I was quite worried about staying here. I had visions of getting no sleep!Check in was extremely efficient and the staff member who dealt with us was lovely and friendly. We were given room 803. Rooms are modern and clean but, other than hooks on the wall there was no hanging space. Some of the hooks were so close to the sink that the danger of covering clothes with water or toothpaste was fairly high. Other hooks were over the TV and mirror so not particularly practical. Beds super comfy, bathroom lovely and clean and toiletries were nice. We did hear music from the rooftop bar but had taken our own silicone earplugs so it wasn’t an issue. The cheap ones provided were t great so I’d advise you take your own.Public areas were lovely and the staff were all extremely pleasant and willing to help. We didn’t eat in the hotel but the cocktails we sampled were tasty if a little expensive ($16 each).Check out was swift and they store luggage at no charge in a special area in the basement.Lifts were quick. Just remember that you need to enter your floor on the keypad and wait to be told what lift to get into.If I were to return I’d happily stay here again.

The hotel is nice, new concept of welcome, young team, stylish atmosphere. The room are definitely not so big but the shower is great! In the evening the bar is very nice, good music till late. Very close to the main public transportation. Just few bad point, if you have the room on the main road will be very noise and the breakfast, that offer a good menu but the staff is underperforming ( long time to wait and they most of the time forget the order)

I don’t event know where to start. This hotel seems so great, appears beautifully designed, clean, etc. unfortunately this is not the case, while the location is great and staff is friendly— the rooms are a disaster. I have a sprained ankle/ moving with crutches and I can barely move around. The bathroom is oddly large but there is no place to put my belongings. The worst of it all is the cramped bed into the corner, there is no luggage rack, place to hang clothes, no bathrobe, extra pillows, or area to work. I was on the 6th floor for 6 brutal days and all I could hear was blasting remixes by David Guetta... I guess there a is a club here? I’m all for a good time but blasting music at 1 am is a NO GO. The music is so loud the hote provides ear plugs... Great location, but want to avoid this for my next business trip.

Interesting micro-hotel concept from Marriott. Rooms are comfortable but extremely small with no work area whatsoever. Great location and the price was right but never again if I can avoid it. Was on the 10th floor and may as well have been sleeping on the street. The noise is so bad that the hotel provides earplugs on the nightstand. WiFi was free but spotty.

Just a beautifully designed hotel perfectly located. Very professional and courteous staff. Restaurant and roof bar are stunning and a wonderful way to spend an evening. The rooms met all our needs and was exacly what we needes.
user_name:
H3636VZmark
New York City, New York

review_body: Perfect location, terrific design, first class materials (lots of leather, wood, linen and cotton), superb shower, no carpets in the room, nice staff,very good bed linen, good towells. Plus: beautiful & tasty bar/cafeteria/restaurant. Stunning place to be in NYC. Try Keens for steaks and Macarons, just across the street, and Dr. Martens for shoes.

I visit NYC from Boston 1-3 times a year. I am always looking on the outlook for the best possible room, in the perfect location and an amazing price. Moxy Times Square checks off all the boxes. Checkin-in was easy and the staff were very welcoming. The feel of the hotel is innovation mixed with rock & roll. It's how I imagine where the cool kids stay in NYC. The room was beautifully done, the perfect size and creatively set-up. They use every inch of the room to make it easy to use and fun to hang out in. The decor of the hotel is fun but also elegant. There is a bar that is open most of the day to serve breakfast, lunch and with the help of a DJ, amazing drinks at night. There is a room deck that is just plain fun with amazing views of the city. We had cocktails and food which were perfect and service spot on. And the location of the hotel coudn't be more ideal. South of Times Sure and not far from Hell's Kitchen which is full of great places to eat and hang out in. Overall, I loved this place. My ONLY complaint, and it' a big one, is the parking garage next door. Horrible, horrible, horrible. The staff running the place are the definition of how bad customer can really be. The price ($70 a day) is expensive even for NYC. Once they take your car, you are not allowed to see it again until you leave. I needed to get to my car twice and they made it seem like it was the end of world for them to help me. I do understand Moxy does not own or run the garage, but they do list the garage as part of their website. I will either take the train next time from Boston or park elsewhere, irregardless of the inconvienence. I love this hotel and everything it's about. I can't wait to return!

Overall Rating: 67/90 (7.4/10)Class of Room Booked: StdClass of Room Stayed: Std Double (Room 304)Price per night (w/o taxes): $302The Quick Hits:Would I stay here again? Probably not - see belowValue rating based on price paid: FairThe Details:Hotel Design Location and Layout:Location (8/10 – Met Expectation) – Located conveniently between Penn Station and Times Square you are just minutes away from tons of options, but not in the thick of the crowds.Hotel Lobby/Common Areas(8/10 – Met Expectations) – There were multiple common areas available, all fairly well appointed. Seperate check in desks made for a smooth and fast checkin. Not sure about the games down there like Giant Jenga as not really a good place to play them, I considered them more visual than practical.Hotel Amenities(8/10 – Met expectations) – The candy cart in the lobby is a nice touch. The hotel offers several dining venues and a pre-made food selection at reasonable for NYC pricingRoom:Design and Layout (5/10 – Met expectations) – Did I say the room was small? I knew the Moxy had smaller rooms going in, but this was pretty tiny. But that's manageable. More important is the tiny space means less than usual storage space and not in convenient locations. The only place to put a larger suitcase away would be the bathroom. The score would have been lower but the bathroom was comparatively spacious and well designed. Lack of any form of a desk or chair will be a negative for a business traveler. They do provide a lap desk. Only plugs in room are above the beds (the little shelves for phones there are nice, but the plugs themselves are not convenient if you need to charge a larger device like an ipad.Comfort(7.5/10 – Met expectations) – This would have been 8 except for one thing. The room I had was back on a courtyard so was mostly quiet. I say mostly because even on floor 3 I could still pick up the bass from the lounge. The one on floor 17. I was very glad the staff at check in decided to put me on a lower floor.Condition(7.5/10 – Met Expectations) – Condition as expected for a brand new hotel, except the design of the bed left a huge gap between it and window. I almost dropped something down there and when I looked I could see debris and dust buildup on the floor.Amenities(7.5/10 – Met Expectations) – Towels were nice and fluffy. Not a big fan of the combo body wash and shampoo (I know they are basically the same thing, its not that, this was just a very thick and creamy and heavy shampoo). The retro style phone with pre-recorded bedtime stories was a cute touch, but no clock. Clothes steamer in the bathroom also appreciated. Do not disturb light and blackout curtains a plus.Staff:  Front Desk/Service(8/10 – Met Expectations) – Check in was fast and efficient, and the agent immediately advised me against my higher floor preference because of the club noise.Housekeeping (7.5/10 - Met Expectations) - Only a one night stay so did not interact but room was properly prepared.Other Staff (NA)Food Service:Paid Dining:Restaurant/Cafe (NA) – Room Service(NA) - Complimentary Dining:Breakfast/Reception (NA) - Other Areas:Frequent Traveler Program: (Applicable Status) - Marriot Gold - no particular benefits at this hotel beyond standardClub/Lounge (NA) - Special Perks(bonus point) - Other:Internet Speed Test Results (from Room via Oookla): This was tough. When the net worked it was fast but had a tendency to drop out for a minute or 3 and come back up. I switched to cell data just to finish some tasks.Family Friendly: No. Rooms are too small.Pet Friendly: NoNotes: First up, I am very aware that I am NOT the target market for this hotel as a middle aged business traveler. And I know millennials look more on rooms as a place to sleep. But the design of the rooms here felt just a little claustrophobic. It was ok for one night, but I couldn't do an extended stay here, not when there are so many other options in the area. If you were looking to dance the night away and collapse into bed, this might be the place for you, but I can see even partygoers having issues hanging dress clothes and putting on makeup due to the very limited space. Of course, there may be other rooms more suited to different types of travel. The staff I interacted with were great, I love the decor and the general vibe, but overall not for me. Also note - the elevators are the kind where you request a floor from a central panel and are told which one to use. A lot of people had trouble with this even though the front desk took pains to explain to me as I am sure they had with others.Even though the average was 7.4 and I did score it a 4 overall, I almost went three because of design issues.About my system - All scores are based on expectations, where 7.5 = met expectations, 10 is highly exceeded, and 1, well, something went horribly wrong. Expectations take into account a number of factors, such as price paid, brand, and location. They will vary greatly from the Waldorf Astoria to a Super 8. All scores are averaged and translated to a score out of 10. 1 Trip Advisor dot applies for each 2 points, so 4 dots is the most likely scenario.

Perfect location friendly staffNice rooftop barRooms small but cosy and all you use it for is to sleep. Free WiFi I will definitely come back to this hotel Only thing I think needs adjusting is the lift system. Gets packed at times and waiting for quite some time.

This hotel was wonderful. Moxy hotels are geared towards millenials - with smaller rooms, yet the amenities and social options that millennials love and a decent price. The rooms are very very small, but who comes to NYC to stay in the hotel room anyway? The amenities are amazing and I do wish I had time to experience more of them. My stay included two free drinks, and each day has complimentary activities. The lounge is also fantastic. I love staying in hostels for the social aspect of it, and I felt the same way in this hotel - with much nicer and private rooms. This is the only hotel I'll be staying in NYC in for the future. Only downsides are that walls are pretty thin, and beds could be comfier - but, for me, these are minor details.

Great spot to stay especially if you are younger. Very L.A. Style. Located in a convenient location to theater and everything. Try to book a suite since rooms are small in size. Definitely designed for the happening person. Rooftop bar.
user_name:
sweiner2018
New York City, New York

review_body: Very progressive hotel with lots of new technology (mobile checkin, mobile keys and elevators) Very clean, modern and cool decor. So close if you are in town and need to be close to downtown or the train. Would recommend if you were here for a few days, rate is decent compared to other in the area for what you get. Cool lobby and waiting area with bar and lounges. Worked there until my room was ready. They have a very cool roof deck (too cold to try it out this time) but will definitely come back to try it out.
user_name:
Christina C
Northborough, Massachusetts, United States

review_body: got together to talk about what mattered to them when they stay in a hotel, it would probably be how fast you check in, not having to wait for elevators, free wifi in the room and a cool design overall, with shades that block out the light. Moxy NYC ticks all those boxes in spades; you walk in to find six check-in desks, behind which are four elevators that appear immediately; the wifi connects instantly and the style of the room is retro New York meets glamping. It's dark. The boxes of ear plugs were a useful touch.Yes, rooms are small but I've been in smaller in the city and the flow is fine although it might be too tight to work, but the lounge/bar/breakfast room has ample space. I would have liked nicer pillows and linens, glass tumblers instead of plastic and an iron....But you can't have everything. Had there been an iron, I might have offered to use it on the young man checking me out as he was wearing a T-shirt that looked as if it had been crumpled in a ball all night. That said, staff overall is helpful and cheery and hard-working.
user_name:
underwaydd
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Rooms very clean and hotel very modern but the width of the bed is more or less the width off the room with approx 6ft in front of bed at door entrance. No coffee making facility. Would never, never stop here again!

At the arrival you can feel the special and unique ambiance of the hotel. Great music, great staff with customer oirented attention. The location is great, just at walk distance from many attractions and metro stations. The room was comfortable, especially the bed (No coffee maker, maybe the only thing we missed...). The breakfast was very good - recommended!. John and Dillon fron the reception desk did great job recommending places to visit and taking care of every request.

The location was central to my business mtgs. Mattress was perfect for me (what brand/model is it?). Pillows weren’t so great. Rooms are compact but clean and well designed with interesting and modern details. Water pressure in the shower was awesome. I checked in at midnight and the front desk associate could tell I was tired from traveling. She was kind enough to not put me in a room right below the rooftop bar. Free drink tokens for the bar were provided but I never cashed them in. Next time!

The entire hotel concept is different which is not by definition bad, but definitely unusual. The room has more of a dormitory feel with two beds up against the wall in a very small space. There’s no closet but rather pegs on the wall to hang things. As a business traveler lack of a desk or space to work is not helpful. For most of the first day I was also unable to access the WiFi and the tech support company wasn’t able to help. The staff was very friendly but other than my asking for a late checkout there was no recognition of my status as a Marriott Rewards member.

Stayed at the Moxy over last weekend. The vibe is upbeat and trendy, with the staff friendly on arrival. The room, whilst small and cosy, is adequate to needs for a few days away. However, if you like peace and quiet, then this is not the hotel for you. Despite earplugs being supplied, we were kept awake by loud music every night, with one to the early hours of 4.30am. Not great after being out and about all day. We were also slightly disappointed that a pair of hair straightners were broken during our stay, which we had left in our room in working condition. Still awaiting a response to the ‘investigations’ by management after 72 hours.

we stayed at the Moxy april 5th 6th 2018 nice hotel rooms very small have to climb onto bed cant walk around it , Rooms are clean modern and work as long as you don't have to many cases the bar is very nice does very good food rooftop bar was not as good as l thought it would be. Very full couldn't sit or stand really very loud cant have a conversation. like the downstairs bar comfy seating nice feel the D.J went on late very loud in the room very loud in fact nice hotel for younger folk wouldn't recommend it for older folk. Staff very good well trained nice arranged a car for airport very nice man in a big car turned up early hours and got us safely to the airport all in all good hotel well run.

This past week was my second time staying at the Moxy. The first time was ok as it was only for a day (thank goodness) I must admit that regretfully I am not a huge fan of this place. If you are staying for maybe a day or so, then that is fine, but it is WAY since it is a boutique type of hotel, staying for a week is a NO GO. (I had to stay here as it was a place that my work picked as our staff hotel)First things first, checking in is fine and the girls are sweet. The first thing I dislike about the hotel is their elevator set up. Once you select which floor you are going to, the "trendy elevator" lets you know which bay to go to and then you wait for the said elevator. You usually have to wait until about 5 other people are also going to be in the elevator before it finally shows up to go to whatever floor you have chosen after making umpteen stops since you had to wait for others before a bay would even show up. Some would be like, why is that a big deal? When you are tired, you just want to get on the elevator and go to your room, not have to wait for like 5 other people to show up before the elevator decides that it will make the trip.Next is the room itself. I am lucky to have had a room to myself because I am not sure how those that had a double survived, seeing how small the rooms were. There are no closets or drawers in the room. Only pegs for you to hang your clothes and few cubbies under the bed to store a few items. You have to be strategic on how you hang things as well as store your desirables and luggage so that you are not tripping over everything.Having the do not disturb button on seems to not mean anything as they come in and service your room anyway (mega fail). Yes, I did report it and after that, it did not happen again. However, it should not have happened in the first place. You are either going to be freezing or burning up as the thermostat is not consistent. Also, the TV is on some weird timer and it will give you a warning that it is about to cut off. Even when you press "ok" for it still continues to countdown and then shut off. Annoying, especially when you are in the middle of watching a movie. I highly doubt that I will be staying here again unless it is absolutely necessary. Sorry Moxy, you just don't do it for me.

It has exceeded all expectations. Great value of money. Friendly young staff, helpful and professional. Room is small of course but it’s very functional. Comfortable beds and clean room. Water pressure is working just great on 15th floor. It takes a little walk to subway. We love the hotel! Thank you.

Love this place. Very close to everything in the heart of midtown. Typical efficiently sized room for NYC but these are styled in a very cool yet warm feel. The best thing about Moxy is the staff.... absolutely the nicest team I’ve experienced in a long time. They are super friendly and go way out of their way to make sure you are happy. Cheers!
user_name:
jjcajohn
New York City, New York

review_body: This hotel is located in a great area (walking distance to all touristic places as well as some co-working spaces and offices). The room is nice but small if you are planning to spend a lot of time there. In the hotel, you can find a rooftop, bar with nice drinks and amazing restaurant! Thank you, for this great experience!

Checking in was quick easy and friendly I honestly did not like my room at all and explained to the staff why as I had to step up to the bed and felt like I could have fallen on getting out they immediately changed the room and could not have given a better one they also decorated my room as it was my birthday an excellent surprise Ashley and Andrew best staff ever definitely go again

Very helpful front desk, decent location, bed was good, room was nominally quiet. But everything else about my room was just not suited for people looking for comfort after a hard day of work on the road. I checked in after taking an early AM flight and working a full day, and reached my room to find it basically empty except for a bed. This is because all the furniture is collapsable and hung on hooks on the wall -- like going to an Ikea in Hell. There was not even a surface to drop my wallet, phone, etc, without first having to assemble furniture. I could only figure out the little tiny side table. There's also the world's most uncomfortable little folding chair. Useless.Bathroom: the shower was great, but the toilet was a dinky european model (that clogged twice without being actually used). The sink is in the main room, not the bathroom and may as well have a been a pitcher and a washbowl for how useful it was while shavingI understand NYC hotel rooms are small but this strategy for utilizing space did not win any points with me, personally. If you want a fun NYC visit with friends or whatever, this will do. If you live out of a suitcase like me, pass.
user_name:
Andy T
Roswell, Georgia, United States

review_body: My friend was visiting from out of town. There happened to be a event going on the rooftop venue that Sunday night at the magic hour. The location was great, conveniently located. Very clean and zen. Looking forward to visiting again

We are in love with the Moxy!!! This was our first time in NYC and we are so happy we chose to stay at the Moxy. The staff went above and beyond to make our trip memorable. The rooms were super comfortable and so unique. We all slept like babies, even though we were prepared for noise but never even heard it!! Don't even get me started about the water pressure in the shower....Seriously, I was sad to have to get out of the shower, it was so amazing! I have told everyone that has asked about my trip that staying at The Moxy was the best decision by far and we will definitely be back!

The staff were amazing, so friendly and helpful. The room was impeccable, so comfortable, clean and not noisy at all. Really good location! We will definitely be staying here again! Couldn’t ask for better service! 5 stars!

I loved staying in this hotel because of its perfect location. It was a wonderful experience from checking in to checking out. The Moxy may be a party hotel but I slept like a baby. Great use of the space (king room), comfy bed and fun deco. They have a nice gym too.Clean, new bed, fab showergreat customer service
user_name:
lenynd
New York City, New York

review_body: Was central, nice and clean. The room was small but to be expected and not a surprise.Really loud music in the foyer giving that nightclub feeling. Wasn’t super happy with the customer service but happy with the cleanliness of our room.

I had a great stay at the Moxy. The rooms are small, but luckily I wasn’t in my room much. If you want quiet, stay on the lower levels. I really enjoyed the restaurant legasea, the rooftop bar and the breakfast place attached. Overall, the best thing about this hotel is the location- walking distance to time square!

My partner and I stayed here for 7 nights for his 30th birthday two weeks ago. We were a bit apprehensive after reading the reviews on here but we had a great time!The hotel itself is very clean and it's design is really interesting. The bar area was great for relaxing after a long day of sightseeing and the cocktails (especially the 'got moxy') were amazing!Our room was small but lovely and functional - not at all as tiny as we were expecting from the reviews. The shower/bathroom area was great too. The only downside to the room was that the air conditioning was very loud but not loud enough to stop us sleeping.The location is fantastic - we walked pretty much everywhere sothatwas great!The staff were super friendly at all times, especially the check in staff and bar staff!The noise from magic hour was not as bad as we're thought. We could hear it but it was just like background noise, no louder than the usual New York street noise. No issues whatsoever!The best thing about the hotel though, was the smell! What is that? And can I buy it? Haha. It was glorious!Thanks Moxy, for making our visit amazing! If we return to NYC we will definitely be staying with you again!

I stayed here for 2 nights before flying back home. At first I was hesitant in choosing this hotel because of the room size which is small compared to other property I'm considering within the price range. But I opted to try it out because of its very convenient location. I was not disappointed at all, its walking distance to some tourist spots, shopping area and train station. The staff were accommodating but don't compare it to the usual 5-star Marriott Property. The hotel has a character, it was previously an apartment for immigrants, but the way they converted the rooms made it look modern with things you don't normally see like bean bags instead of usual seats, folding furniture like a small chair and table hanged on the wall and you just open it when needed. The hotel has two bars, one on the 2nd floor and the other one on the roof deck, I tried the one in the roof deck and it was great, I passed by the one the 2nd floor it also looked ok. The one in the 2nd floor also served food during day time which I only found out on my last day where I had a light breakfast. There is also another resto within the hotel but was not able to try it.

This hotel was allocated to us on a deal we booked through a local travel agent and if i had a choice i wouldn't have chosen this hotel. I read the reviews before travelling and was worried about the noise that everyone complained about so made a point of requesting a quiet room on check in so we were given a room on the 12th floor which turned out to not be quiet!! Well after a 7 hr flight and queues at JFK and then an hour slog to the hotel we entered reception with Maroon 5 booming and the staff at check in in party mode.(not what we wanted when we were tired!) I had to shout over the music to tell the member of staff my details, she swiped my credit card (didn't know what that was for) but as i checked my account the following morning i found i had been charged £42 and a sum of over £300!!! My hubby went down to sort it and the girl at check in had charged us for the room when it had already been paid for!! The money was reimbursed! Good job i checked! My advice here to the hotel would be to maybe turn the tunes down and instead of playing massive Jenga in the foyer maybe provide a better customer service at check in and then maybe stupid mistakes like this wouldn't happen???First impressions at the lift area was how pretentious the hotel felt and didn't like the whole party feel. I'm not boring by any means but i like a hotel to be a hotel and not a nightclub.We loved the room and the size didn't bother us at all.
