Our only complaint would be that there were no tea and coffee making facilities. The shower was amazing and the bed was so comfy.We were prepared for the noise and we did experience some but it was the Sunday night we were woken by the DJ singing and loads of clapping and shouting etc from the rooftop bar! We popped our earplugs in and they did the job! Monday night, we didn't hear any music so had a great sleep!!I preferred the feel of the hotel on a morning, we had a lovely breakfast and the staff were very welcoming at the bar area.We didn't visit the rooftop bar or the bar on the evening so i can't comment. We had free drinks tokens which we used on our last day whilst waiting for our lift to the airport. It wasn't very nice! So i bought a malibu and coke and nearly choked at the $16 it cost!!!All in all the location was great! and the room was quirky, clean and comfortable it's just not our cup of tea as a hotel and the charging of my credit card made me really angry and really shouldn't have happened if the staff had been concentrating on the job in hand instead of partying!!
user_name:
Claire F
Trimdon Village, United Kingdom

review_body: This hotel was a good price especially for the location. The staff was all super friendly and helpful. Some reviews stated the noise was loud but I honestly did not have a problem whatsoever. It was not loud and I went to bed early as I was not a young party goer. I knew this place was different and that’s why I chose it. I took my 10 year old daughter to NYC for her birthday and she took a friend. I loved the double bunk beds allowing us to all have our own space to sleep. The room was slightly smaller than I anticipated, however, it was fine because we weren’t in the room much anyway. I’m not sure I would recommend this hotel for families only because the kids can’t go to the rooftop because it’s only accessible for 21 and over. My girls were a little disappointed with this but it was all good I understood. The beds were comfortable. The hotel was very clean. Great staff. Great price, especially for location, and I would recommend this hotel. Especially for younger people.

Just back from a 6 night stay at the Moxy Hotel. The location is excellent I can't fault that and staff were nice and helpful I just had a couple of things that I wasn't happy about. So when we booked this which was through a travel agent I had looked up on the website for pictures of room types and I did read some reviews and I understand the rooms were going to be small bit my god was my room small. The bed had a t.v which when we lied down out feet kept hitting off it. The bathroom was a good size probably bigger then the "double" room we booked. It was so small we didn't really have anywhere to store our luggage which was annoying because we had to live out of our case because we only had 6 places to hang stuff between two people there was hanging space at the end of the bed but thats where the t.v was so we could avail of that space.We were on the 15th floor with a view noting only corridors and windows and every night there was a DJ playing on the rooftop which was extremely loud it didn't bother me too much because of all the walking you do in NYC we were wrecked at night but one or two nights it was a struggle going to sleep as the music went onto about 4am.I did mention it to the staff that I felt like the room was a bit small and noting like the pictures on the website and it was noisey and I was told that most the rooms were like that. Then my mam and sister checked in two days later and were given a queen suite room that actually had space to walk around in this room was more like the photos I seen.It had a very cool kind of vibe and the lobby and the second floor where people were meant to hang out was very loud too not really a place to relax in. The day before check out a member of staff mentioned they could booked transfers to the airport which was great so I asked could I have late out so they gave me 1pm we were getting picked up at 2:30pm so I asked could I maybe have the room until 2pm to which I was told no because of the availability yet my sister and mother were given their room until 3pm I was told I could put my bags in the luggage room and hang out on the second floor which I thought wouldn't be great because of the rustle and bustle of that area wouldn't really be relaxing. Overall my stay was ok bit I dont think I would return to the Moxy Hotel just because the experience of it just isn't for me I'd rather somewhere to relax and have a drink after a busy day and be able to get a good night's sleep which isn't possible at the Moxy Hotel.

Another reviewer put it best: a nightclub that happens to have rooms. The rooms are tiny but smartly laid out, and I get the trendy lobby/decor/attitude. Fine. But blasting EDM music from the rooftop at 2:30am on a Sunday night/Monday morning is not cool. I figured Fri/Sat nights, OK, I get it...but then Sunday was even worse! I finally called and requested a room switch from 14th floor to 3rd floor (I was wary of low number floors because the lobby was blasting music at check in). The staff was nice enough about switching me. But ultimately I ask for a nice room and a good night's sleep and the latter is nowhere to be found here. Buyer beware. For some late night 20 somethings ONLY.

Pros:Good location off Times Square and quiet. Room was newly furnished and price we paid at $185 was cheaper than other Marriott properties. Public work space on the second floor is large and comfortable. Bed reasonably comfortable. Cons:One of the smallest NY hotels I have ever stayed in. Less than 200 sq feet. The hotel/dorm room is designed to appeal to the 30 something crowd with the silly nonsense of a funky lobby and hotel room identifiers. So what you get is a single person dorm room with a bed shoved up against a wall and a one foot window to the back side of another building. My first reaction is the room on the 6th floor was a trap if a fire broke out because of the tiny window.The bathroom combo toilet/dorm shower worked but if I see another stupid cool hip design marking in a hotel room I think I will throw up. In this case it was the tile word “no diving”. Barf. Everything in the room including your table and single chair is hung up on hooks along the wall. Oh yes and there is again the stupid but absurd unrealistic bean bag in the corner which doubles as a second chair? The sink was outside the bathroom much like in a dorm and as we were shaving the sink backed up. We notified the front desk and someone did show up without a plunger and watched the water fill up and whose english was so poor that I still am unsure what his explanation meant. I think he tried to say it was the air in the pipes but who knows. Sink still fills up while brushing teeth or shaving.As a platinum Marriott member the standard benefits were not offered part of this hotel. The more boutique hotels Marriott markets the less the standard benefits are provided. The Marriott upgrade to our room was from a “double bed” to a “queen size” bed. Now if we had not been upgraded it would have been two 6’ ft people in a tiny double bed! Really? There were no rooms with two twin beds when we checked in and once we got to our dorm room we knew why....there was no room for two beds.For a single person on a tight budget in an expensive part of the city and if the price is right then this would be a good option. But give me a standard business hotel any day.

Got a chance to stay out in the MOXY Times Square for a week this past January, and I had an absolutely exceptional stay. This hotel isn't going to be for everyone, as it has a frequent night life with its rooftop bar, as well as the bar inside the hotel as well, but the laid back vibe really hit it off with me. The staff was gracious and accommodating at all times, and the hotel is in a prime spot to get anywhere you're trying to go around the city, as you're right near Penn Station. There's a lot of great food options in the area as well, and honestly, I couldn't have enjoyed my stay more. The hotel was still in those early growing pains of a new hotel, but I enjoyed myself enough that I can't wait to go back and give the Moxy another go once they've fully found their groove. If you're looking for a laid back hotel in the heart of Manhattan, this is the spot for you.

I am here in NYC on business. I just arrived after an exhausting 22hr flight only to not be able to sleep because of the rooftop disco. I specifically asked for a quiet room and they assured me it was quiet - yeah right. I am booked for 5 nights. I am getting the hell out of here tomorrow.

This is a fun hotel that offers a wide array of sleeping rooms from bunk beds too king size beds and everything in between. The rooftop bar is amazing, and the second floor bar offers food and beverages. Staff was very friendly and accommodating. I’d definitely stay here again. Pictures are of a queen room

Friendly and helpful staff (especially John!).Very clean. Nicely decorated rooms.Very good location, close to shops and public transport.The loud music at the entrance is the only negative point!We had a great stay!We will come back soon!

Loved the hotel. Front desk staff was moderately helpful but unsure about basic questions about the local area and the amenities. Was disappointed that there was not a time set aside for under 21 crowd to visit the rooftop bar to see the view. My son would have enjoyed seeing the view from the roof. Candy Bar in the lobby was never stocked and when it was there was nothing to put the candy in. Loved the quirkiness of the hotel. Would stay again...Location was excellent!

Ok so I’m going to give advise more than review, I won’t knock the place just because it didn’t suit us.... The rooms are tiny but I have heard this is the trend in NYC, to me it is not a hotel more a night club with bedrooms, if your up for party nights every night then this is the place for you! We chose because of the amazing roof top bar, which we didn’t even visit, the roof top bar is a night club which plays very loud music till 4am the last song being the loudest which woke us all up every night ( we were on the 11th floor) we did try to visit on our first night but had to cue outside in the freezing cold even though we were hotel guests, we gave up in the end at realising it was actually a night club and not some where to relax and take in the amazing views of New York, honestly if your in to partying and love clubbing this is the place for you, please make sure you have plenty of money or BYOB as we had a drink in one of the bars in the Moxy if I can recall, four of us one drink each $60 something, a brandy was $21, didn’t eat there so can’t comment!

Arrived at The Moxy in New York from England on Easter Friday. Check in was very swift, nice friendly atmosphere and the hotel was spotless.I was there with family and we had an issue with the rooms that were allocated. We went to the reception to discuss possible outcomes. How lucky were we to get Alma, she was smiling, understanding and very efficient. She quickly rectified our room issue within a matter of minutes. She delivered excellent customer service and had very good banter. Would definatley go again. Big Shout out to Alma-your with your weight in gold!

The hotel was really great and located in the most ideal location right by Times Square. Subways located all around and shopping right out the door. Great food places nearby and an amazing lounge in the second floor as well as a fun rooftop bar. Great hotel for younger people in my own opinion as the rooftop bar is loud in the evening. Make sure you try Best Bagels and Coffee just around the corner on 35th. I will definitely stay at the Moxy again!

We booked a double-double-bed room. It fits 4 adults with 2 big & 2 cabin-size luggages at half price of an average Time Square hotels.The wardrobe is replaced by hanging hooks ( a lot of them ) all over your room and the working desk is replaced by a portable one hanging on the wall. Additional spaces are under the 2 double beds that can fit your clothes and shoes.The temperature control and shower pressure are perfect and we just can’t resist to enjoy the minimalist design of the small but yet big room.The location is great where Time Square, Macy’s & Korean Way are just within walking distance. Part of Marriott/SPG, as a lifetime Platinum member of SPG, I enjoyed it.

We arrived and were checked in promptly and efficiently and they explained the lift process which you need to understand or you will never work out how to get to your floor!The room we had was small - however luckily we have stayed in a similar type room in the UK before so it wasn't as much a shock as it could have been.TIP: Make sure you know what type of room you are choosing before booking as there are lots of different types pictured on their website.As some other reviews have commented, the shower was AMAZING! The pressure was great and hot water plentiful. There was aircon in the room how ever this was really noisy and no way could we have slept with it on. Luckily with it being cold outside when we visited it wasn't a problem but I wouldn't like to be having to use it during the warmer months nights.We were on the 14th floor with an indoor courtyard facing room and you could clearly hear the rooftop bar at nights - however it didn't really affect sleeping (maybe because we were tired after all the walking/sightseeing we had done each day) apart from the last night when the sound was horrendous. A lot louder than any of the previous nights and a much heavier bass that thumped down the walls. I rang Reception at midnight complaining and got told that it was a private party going until 3am.......... Tried the ear plugs and you could still hear it but was a bit better and finally managed to get some sleep. Spoke with some people in the lift the following morning who were also annoyed by it. We also had the fire alarm go off in the middle of the night but this stopped after a minute so we didn't need to evacuate.Didn't try the food there although went for a drink in the bar one night before heading out. When we checked in we got a token for a free "special" cocktail at the bar so though we'd redeem this. This was horrible and we only had a few sips each before leaving.We had to confirm our transport pickup time by phone 24 hours before our flight and the receptionist was very obliging in doing this to take us having to use our foreign mobiles.PROSA++++++ ideal location between 7th and 8th. Short walk from subway and Times Square.Room appeared to be clean.Decent electronic safe in the room which was ideal to store laptop, cash, passports etc.CONSVery noisy room top bar - avoid high floors.Noisy aircon.Quirky room - make sure you know what you are booking beforehand.

Difficult one as this hotel has equal good and bad points. Firstly the smell in the lobby was gorgeous and the shower gel provided smelt the same. Rooms are small and there are no drink making facilities, wardrobe or fridge. But the rooms are incredibly clean and the small space has been used well.Upsides are: modern, fun, excellent location near Times Square. Lots of breakfast places nearby can recommend the diner Andrews Coffee House. You get a free drinks token on your first night.Downsides: this hotel is for young people wanting little sleep and lots of fun. Didn’t suit us as we spent our days very busy so needed rest at night. We were 2 floors down from the rooftop bar and basically got very little sleep as it closes at 4am. They provide ear plugs but they were not very effective. Also fire alarm went off at 6am, we started to get dressed to leave then it went off. Went off again at 10pm, again got ready to leave then went off. Complained to staff but they couldn’t have cared less. Couple of female staff were nice and attentive but most of the staff are very young and need to work on their customer service skills. A modern fresh young hotel our 12 year old loved it ( free candy in the lobby) but if you want rest after a busy day sightseeing don’t stay here.

We stayed at the Moxy for 4 nights last week (April 4th). We upgraded to a bigger room as my husband was too tall for the smaller bed which was done without any hassle and for only $10 extra a night. Excellent location and wonderful hotel. An amazing smell in the lobby also!! Would highly recommend.

Excellent location. Modern quirky hotel. At first I was worried about the small compact room but if worked for us. The lack of a wardrobe irritated me as I like a tidy room so having all our clothes hung on the hooks was a little messy. There is a fold down table and chair will a full length mirror which was ideal to do my make up. Hairdryer and a clothes steamer which I thought was a brilliant idea. The shower room and the toiletries were ideal. The rooftop bar with views of the Empire State was amazing.

We were very pleased with this hotel. It's modern and fun. The rooms are small, but that is what makes them really reasonably priced. The beds are laid out in a fashion that maximizes the space in the room. The bathroom/shower have opaque glass, so you have to be comfortable with the other occupants. Although you can't see clearly through them, it is a bit personal. The room was clean and they provided a steamer so you can freshen your clothes. FYI - no coffee maker. Sort of a bummer, but Starbucks is really close by so no biggie.There is a bar on the 2nd floor that is really loud, but has lots of energy. The sound of the bar floats down to the lobby (open ceiling) so if you are looking for a quiet little hotel, this isn't it. This place gets hopping as the night gets underway. We could hear it from our room (4th floor) but we weren't surprised by it. They kindly provide ear plugs for each occupant of the room in case you are having trouble sleeping. Honestly, its the city so you should expect quite a bit of noise, especially on the weekends. We didn't need the ear plugs. The beds are comfortable and the heater/air conditioner is very responsive.The location is great! It's basically equidistant from 2 metro stops on the 1 and 2 line, providing us easy access to all of uptown and downtown. The kids loved that the candy counter was open in the afternoons. They could stop off and grab a few bites of candy to take to the room or around town. They also have a foosball table in the Moxy bar which the kids enjoyed playing. You can't count on this being available, but we stayed the weekend of April 7 and they had no problem playing a few games both nights (around 7 each night).The bar menu/drinks are rather expensive, but that is probably normal for the city. The only negative I would add is: we lost one of our keys and it was in the original holder with our room number on it. Obviously I didn't want anyone to pick it up and go try the key on our door... so I asked the woman at the front desk to re-key our door. She was happy to oblige, but she didn't ask me for id. So, could I have taken my key to her and asked her to re-key another door and walk in? I didn't see her swipe my original key, and without id, I don't know how she would have known I was the true occupant. The price was really good and the only reason we would actually debate whether to stay again is that the beds were doubles and my kids were sharing a bed. One is a roller.

We had booked this hotel for four nights and as it is a Marriott hotel we thought it would be ok but sadly it wasn’t and we ended up checking out early. upon arrival at this hotel you are greeted by what looks like a school playground. The rooftop bar they advertise is actually a nightclub that plays loud music until 6am at the weekend and 2am in the week this can be heard in your room (earplugs are supplied) the room we had was tiny and I couldn’t fit in the bed as it was wedged in between a wall and a 42” tv and a sound bar, upon complaining to the staff we was told they would look at moving us to a bigger room which of course never happened so we decided to leave upon checking out nobody asked us why we were leaving no apology nothing just simply said ok your free to go, anyway to save yourself sleepless nights give this hotel a miss there are plenty of other much nicer ones just around the corner

This is more of a youth hostel than a hotel. The atmosphere is clubby with a loud vibe, the bar is great but the rooms are like jail cells. If you don't plan on working or staying in your room other than to sleep, great, but all the furniture in the room is a bed and small table. Younger people may really enjoy but the group I was there with for business voted no the next time. BUT if you are wanting to party non-stop,, this is the place for you!

Amazing hotel, fantastic welcome from friendly staff. Great room, on the small side but had everything and quirkyness won us over. Welcome cocktails a nice touch. Free fitness classes on rooftop bar fab and fun.

We booked this hotel because of the location and trendy setting. You are close to subways and it is easy to walk to all the major attractions. The bar and roof top bar are very cool.However- the rooms are tiny. The hotel does try to use the walls for storage etc which is good. BUT you feel like you are cramped in a prison cell. Also we have never experienced the noise the ac generated. It produces a loud bang when in use. When we queried this we were told that’s just the motor working. We were really shocked and disappointed with this, especially the price we paid and being part of the Marriott hotel chain. Furthermore the tap (which is in the main bedroom) was constantly dripping and was very irritating. We asked to get it fixed & the engineer said he would come back and fix it- they never did. Book for the location but you will sacrifice on everything else.

The Hotal offer you small rooms but wonderful service with young spirit and very good food both at the bar and the resturant, You have to choose the right beds size and expect new approche to rooms standart but the placing on the 7th near by every thing giving you best value to your money.

The public areas of this hotel are really top notch, well designed and lovely to spend time in. The location is very central for main attractions in the city but the compromise is it isn't the nicest surroundings in midtown. The hotel is let down by the service and rooms unfortunately. I didn't experience the noise issues that other guests have described (I was an outside room on the 5th floor) but finding that I needed to store my clothes and toiletries on the floor was not the best start. I understand they're trying to be minimalist and the rooms are small but there is scope for shelves, cubbyholes or drawers on the walls above the hooks and the sink area badly needs a shelf for toiletries and makeup - a real miss given the targeted demographic for the hotel. I was also bitten 3 times in the room by something so being able to store clothes and toiletries more hygienically would clearly be preferable. It's great that you can stream to the TV but my TV stopped working half way through my stay. I called reception when I got in (around 11pm) who wanted to send someone up then, I said no as I was going to bed and tomorrow would be fine but no one ever arrived. When I checked in, I asked about booking transport to a trip I'd organised and was told the hotel could pre-book me a car. When I then phoned down to do this I was told they couldn't and then had to spend half an hour going back and forwards between different people explaining myself again and again.The staff also wanted to continually remove my credit card from my possession. One of the Ts&Cs of a credit card is that it remains within your sight / possession, however, on multiple occasions the bar and restaurant staff wanted to take it away for 30 minutes plus, leaving the customer open to fraud.Ultimately, if I returned to the city, as funky as the public areas are, I wouldn't choose to stay here again.

Hotel is centrally located, very friendly staff. Love the stash closet idea; able to get what we needed when we needed it. No hallway noise or noise from other rooms will definitely stay here again. Rooms are small, but very efficient.

Moxy is wonderfully located for a trip to New York, was very clean and had a very unique and funky vibe. My son and I got a kick out of the perfume smell at the entrance, the games in the lobby and the candy cart. The staff was accommodating and helpful when one of the kids we were traveling with came down sick. The beds were super comfortable and the shower head was awesome!

We loved everything about our stay at the Moxy! We wouldn’t have changed a thing! We stayed in the bunked rooms and loved them! The beds were so comfortable and the atmosphere was exactly what we needed for our get-a-way!

Well where to start, the smallest rooms in the world will do. Add to this the disco that starts at 11.00pm and finishes at 4.00pm and the nosiest aircon on the planet. If you can actually get to sleep I would be amazed. Do not stay here.

Although this hotel is aimed at the younger traveller I found the Staff very pleasant and accommodating. A double room is tiny & basic, bed pushed up against the wall so if sharing not ideal, the mattress is on a wooden platform so have to step up on to a narrow ledge to access the bed. I requested a room with 2 beds and was moved to a suitable room the next day which was much better. No charge was made for the upgraded room. Ideal location. Bar prices on the steep side. Overall a friendly welcoming hotel with young pleasant staff.
user_name:
Deborah F
Mansfield Woodhouse, England, United Kingdom

review_body: Just arrived home to find out that they have taken money out of my account without consent. As we left yesterday I asked if we had any charges to be told no. Nobody responding to calls !!!! Aside from this the rooms are awful & I'm astounded by reviews stating otherwise.... I travel around 6 times a year & this is by far the worst room I have ever encountered. It's almost like a hostel style layout so if you are used to comfort & luxury then please book somewhere else

Just returned from a 3 night stay at the Moxy. We originally checked into the 16th floor, however due to the noise ( there is a roof top bar) I asked if we could move rooms. The team at reception were very helpful and moved our room to the 4th floor the next morning. The rooms are really cool, beds are SO comfortable, shower is very hot and powerful. It was great being able to watch Netflix too. Location is great a short distance from Time Square. I was hesitant to book this hotel as I am a light sleeper however, I would 100% recommend it and slept really well. Ear plugs are provided which is a nice touch. Just note if you are a light sleeper, avoid the higher level rooms as the music is loud and on till 2am / 4am. Fantastic hotel and staff!
user_name:
Cecely J
London, England, United Kingdom

review_body: I loved how different Moxy was, but a few things were not thought through, which makes it difficult to give it a higher score. First, we were "upgraded" to a "better" room that completely disregarded my and my husband's age. I had to crawl over him to get into bed. While doing so, I realized that with the bed tucked into a corner of the room, it must be a nightmare for the custodial staff to make the bed, much less change the sheets! It probably takes them half again as long to change the sheets if the bed was positioned away from the wall. In addition, there is wasted space in our room to the left of the side table where some type of storage bin could be placed for one's clothes. While I am perfectly capable of getting on the floor to put my clothes under the bed, it wasn't fun or convenient at all. Trendy, yes, perhaps, but not user-friendly. The sink did not drain well at all. We had to swirl the water around the drain to create a vacuum to get the water to drain. This is because the floor of the sink isn't tilted enough to get the water to flow in well.I did love the toilet/shower arrangement and the water pressure was phenomenal. Our sons were in a room with two double beds, and they said their shower head was tilted, permanently, toward the wall, making it difficult to shower well.The elevator situation was awkward since there were only two places to press the elevator call buttons. When people congregated around the pad, others couldn't get to it. In addition, since the elevator numbers were always lit, you had no idea if your elevator was there unless you stood directly in front of it, and sometimes the elevators arrived and left before you could get to it. Could you also post signs somewhere educating younger people that those who are on the elevator get to LEAVE the elevator first before you get on it? At least twice, I had to force my way by people to get off. This is a safety issue, as well as just being rude.The fitness facility is large, with several ellipticals and treadmills. I wish all workout facilities were either kept VERY cold or that a fan could be turned on while I work out.However, the beds were very comfortable; our room was exceedingly quiet, it the hotel's location was perfect being just off Times Square and close to Madison Square Garden. We will be back, but would prefer a different room set up, like the one in the video when you turn on the TV.

Had such an amazing stay at the Moxy! So close to everything and really friendly crew. Also check out Magic upstairs was amazing and it even goes off even on a Sunday! Great Vibe. Awesome People. Highly recommend.

Great hotel fantastic staff and central location gives you access to everything Romans are perfect comfy beds and house keeping was excellent Really good shower as well only negative was heating was a bit noisy how ever you will be that tired you soon forget about it Nice touch with free drink as well

I never have high expectations when booking hotels in Manhattan. All I really want is a clean place to sleep after the end of a long day, but many hotels fall short of even this simple requirement. NOT MOXY. Moxy was a fantastic experience all the way around. The room was cozy and clean, the staff was very friendly and accommodating. The hotel bar was a fun place to grab a drink, and the restaurant was fantastic! Will absolutely stay here again next time!

Loved the location of the hotel - room was smallish,.,,, but had everything we needed in a very stylish way, loved the bar and the restaurant attached to the hotel - John Peratta was great and treated us really well

I was a little nervous to stay here after many negative reviews but I’m glad I saw it for myself. As soon as you walk in the hotel has the coolest vibe. It has a couple of simple podiums where you check in with the staff. Everyone we encountered was so friendly and helpful. We got drink tokens to get their welcome drink at Bar Moxy which is on the second floor. The drink is terrible. That’s really my only issue. One reviewer complained about the elevators. They are so simple. You touch the screen, select bedroom floors and put in which floor your room is on. It will tell you to go to elevator P1, P2, P3 or P4. It’s quite simple. There’s no getting in the elevator and then selecting your floor. It takes you right to your floor. We had a queen room. It was small but comfortable for two. We had a view of a brick wall ne t door. We didn’t spend much time in our room so that was ok. We were able to bring our fire stick and plug it into the smart tv. You can watch Netflix on it either way. The furnishings are simple yet cool and sufficient. I was surprised st how much I liked having hooks instead of a closet. It worked for us. We had a comfy bean bag chair in the corner. It was high quality and not your typical bean bag. We had a table as well. We were given ear buds by the bed but we never needed them because we heard nothing in our room. Many have complained about excessive noise. We didn’t experience that. We were on the 8th floor. Maybe that’s why. We checked out the rooftop bar. The first night the dj had a pre recorded mix that wasn’t great. The second night, a Saturday, it was so much better. It might have been pre recorded but it was great. We attempted to go to the new club Show a few blocks away but the lines were ridiculous so we left and went to Moxy’s rooftop. It was the best decision. It was great being able to do everything in your hotel. The drinks are okay no great and of course over priced. Right across the street from Moxy is a liquor store. It’s clean and has good prices and a large selection. We went there before we checked in and got a bottle. It saved us a lot of money. For lunch we went to Los Tacos in Times Square. It was amazing!! Dinner were at Katz’s Deli and Pio Pio 8. Katz’s is open 24 hours. Get the cheesesteak! Pio Pio 8 is Peruvian and the best chicken rice abs beans I’ve ever had. Not very eoehsuve. Strong drinks. I loved this hotel. We’re already planning another trip. The location is perfect and close to everything. I’ll never forget the view of the Empire State! Don’t listen to the negative. Try it for yourself. I did see some kids not many. This is great for boys or girls weekends or if you want to be out and busy and like to have fun. Not a place to sleep all weekend

This hotel is one of the best! It is true the rooms are tiny, but the space is very well organized. smart spaces... it is high tech as well and very clean... u dont need to as for room service, they serve you by themselves. the location is amazing... very close to broadway show and times square! staff are very friendly! It is high recommended!

Visited: 24th December - 30 December 2017 Check in: We arrived to the hotel by taxi from the airport, it took just over an hour. Check in was super quick and we were given a free welcome drink! Room: Our room was so clean and very original. The views of New York from our window was lovely! The room was a good size considering most people moan about rooms in New York. Food: We didn’t actually eat at the hotel, there are lots of places locally to get to, but we heard good reviews regarding the food in the hotel. The restaurant always seemed very busy. Staff: The staff at this hotel were very welcoming and our room was cleaned daily. Location: Well, this hotel is in a brilliant location. You are far enough away from all the hustle and bustle of New York but still in close distance for everything. I think this prime location is perfect for a short stay in New York, and one day we hope to return to Moxy! The roof top bar was just in the process of being opened. Half was open and the other half was soon to be opened. The views of the Empire State is lovely and it’s got such a good atmosphere!!

We stayed for 4 nights (Fri-Tues) in March. Everything about the hotel was perfect. Our room on the 8th floor was very clean and spacious. The beds are so comfortable and we slept perfectly for the 4 nights. We didn’t experience any issues with noise and didn’t need the ear plugs provided. The hotel is in a great location; a 5 minute walk from Times Square and just around the corner from Madison Square Garden and Penn Station. Looking forward to a return visit!

Stayed at the Moxy earlier this month for 4 nights. After reading some poor reviews on Trip Advisor I was keeping my excitement levels in check but I’m glad to say the stay was really good. As another reviewer suggested, I asked for a quiet room on check in and I got one. 1639 gets more noise from street level 16 floors down than from the rooftop bar 2 floors up. Sadly my friend was not so lucky with her room but she is a better sleeper than me and was only really disturbed on one night by noise from the roof bar. Great check in crew. Always welcoming and friendly but never in your face. Very helpful whenever asked and the free storage of luggage on checkout day was a lifesaver. The free sweets on departure kept me going all through a long night flight home The room was exactly as the many pictures portray so no surprises there, but it was very clean and tidy, warm (perhaps a little too warm - never did get the hang of the heating) and attended to every day. Fabulously comfortable bed. Can’t add anything to the rave reviews regarding the shower that hasn’t been said already. Didn’t eat breakfast in the hotel but I can recommend The Bread Factory Cafe and Andrews Coffee Shop both very nearby. We did eat in Legasea. New York prices and New York portions, it was good but not exceptional. There are many better places to eat all around. This is a super quirky hotel. TA reviews sum it up pretty well and the only reason it didn’t get an Excellent from me was because there is absolutely nowhere in the hotel’s public areas (that we found anyway), to sit back and chill with a drink at the end of a long footsore day. From 17.00 onwards the music is relentlessly loud and it is impossible to hold a conversation without shouting. Great cocktails, though don’t expect much from the free tokens handed out at check in. The “champagne cocktail” came from a pump and was a very long way from France. Better to offer one token for a properly made cocktail at half price perhaps?Would I go back? Yes - promised improvements to sound insulation should sort the worst of the issues from the roof and the location is fantastic. Would I recommend it? Up to a point but do research, read reviews and take a middle line through them. If you want a peaceful country club vibe, this isn’t the place for you. But if you like a hotel that fizzes along then go for it and you won’t be disappointed.

My husband and stayed here in March we came over for the St Patrick's day parade . We arrived from Scotland just after midnight to be put in a room on the 17th floor . When we arrived in the room it was very narrow & compact & also loud music from the rooftop bar . We went down stairs to be told that was the only room available but someone would be intouch with us the next day to see if it was possible to move us. This never happened so needless to say another night of sleeping with earplugs in . When I went downstairs in the morning and explained the situation again I go a very rude girl on reception who told us nothing could be done till after half 3 .After we came back in from the day we went to reception and got a really nice gent who appoligised and put us on the 12th floor . A better room and we could still the music but not as loud. I wouldnt recommend this hotel unless your a person who wants to be awake till 1 in the morning. Very disappointed in this hotel .

Just arrived back home from a 6 day trip to New York for my girlfriends 21st Birthday present. When I booked the room I mentioned that this was the occasion and asked if they were able to put anything in the room as a little surprise, I was not expecting anything big. They replied almost instantly saying that they would 'Hook us up' and they certainly did. Room was covered in balloons and had a huge 'Happy Birthday' sign across the top which was a nice touch. Location wise it's a 5/10-minute walk from the centre of Times Square and just around the corner from Madison Square Garden, we felt that everything we wanted to see was within a reasonable distance. If you're looking for a diner for breakfast there is 'Andrews Coffee Shop' one block down that was great, be ready to queue for a table though. Some reviews have mentioned that noise was an issue during their stay. We stayed on the 10th floor and did not have any issues with traffic noise, cant speak for rooms that may be lower down but the hotel do leave ear plugs in the room.Every staff member we came across was great and more than happy to help with anything. Before we checked out I inquired about how best to get to JFK, thinking we would either have to get an uber or yellow cab. Turns out that the hotel offer transfers to JFK, ours was a fixed rate of $75 and we were picked up in a big SUV which was nice.The room itself was clean, spacious and had a really nice shower. We were able to sign into my Netflix account through the smart TV in the room if we were feeling a bit lazy and wanted a quiet hour or two. Wifi was great (make sure when you first connect that you select the right amount of days that you will be staying there). We did not have any issues with noise from the corridors or neighboring rooms throughout our stay. Oh, and the bed was ridiculously comfortable. Cant really fault this hotel at all, they also have a free candy station open from 3 pm - 7 pm in the lobby.Would happily recommend this hotel to others.

We arrived after an 8 hour flight to be told despite prebooking and paying two months earlier that the hotel oversold our rooms and we were downgraded to a tiny room where you could put out your arms and touch both walls. The staff were unapologetic - ‘this happens all the time’, ‘a booking only guarantees a room, not a room type’. Well what’s the point of booking a room type then?! They told us they would try to change us to the room we booked the following day and to leave our stuff in the room in the morning and they’d move us during the day. We got up after an uncomfortable sleep in a tiny bed, repacked our stuff and went downstairs to the Lobby. We let the staff here know the situation only to be told we couldn’t leave luggage in the room and they weren’t allowed to help us move it. So essentially we need to remove the bags ourselves, check out, and can check back in sometime after 3pm. The service and attitude provided by the staff has been so poor, it’s really made an awful start to our New York holiday which we’ve been planning since last year. Worst, we are stuck here for another six nights - let’s just hope we actually get a room later and things improve. Not holding my breath.

We got a room on the 17th floor which was just below the rooftop bar, music was played until around 3am in the morning, so we did not get much sleep. They supplied ear plugs but I am afraid these did not drown out the music!

I always wanted to stay in the heart of New York and, with Moxy, I got just that! The location is perfect!Upon entering the hotel, I felt the urban, modern vibe right away - loved it. My room was very clean, right down to the corners of my bathroom (which is very important to me).The room was fairly small, but I still enjoyed it and I was really glad to find that my room actually looked like the picture advertised by the hotel. If the view from your room matters to you, I would advise requesting a view of the busy streets of NY prior to booking. The view from my windows were of tall buildings - no action (however, I did not mind this...just something to be mindful of). The service at Moxy was excellent. The staff were friendly and genuine - I really appreciated their manner, especially on the phone. They were very professional and polite! The bed was very comfy and any requests I made were accommodated quickly.I recommend packing an extra light (like a small bendable lamp or a book light, if you plan on doing any reading, or doing your makeup to go out during the evening). Also pack hangers if you are staying for an extended period of time and would like to keep your clothes out of your suitcase...there is not much storage space. As for any hotel, I would also advise packing an extension cord.I rate the Moxy NYC 5 stars. I especially liked that guests have the option to keep their bags at the hotel (free of charge) after checking out. This was an added bonus for me because it allowed me to explore the city sans heavy luggage before catching my evening flight.I will definitely stay at the Moxy again next time I am in New York. I hope to checkout their rooftop bar the next time I am there.Overall, great experience! :)

Felicia Adjoyi was amazing! I had some concerns before my arrival & she was able to assist me with getting a nice room. I also left my ID in the room & when I called, security could not find it. When I called a 2nd time, Felicia was able to locate it! She is amazing!!
user_name:
mandylaflare
New York City, New York

review_body: If you like to party and drink, this is the perfect place! They have a cool bar and restaurant at the place and also a nightclub that`s very trendy at the moment. But if you need to sleep and has a lot of stuff, look out because the room is really small (but practical) and because of the night club and the times square environment, the room is really noisy. But i had a great time there.

A hip hotel experience that's ideal for young couples or solo non-business travelers. Very cool, different vibe and lots of fun spaces to sit and enjoy a drink, game, or connecting with others. The hotel is constructed to be a like a big dorm with multiple bars/clubs. Very lively at night. I was surprised to see families checking in - it's not an ideal setup for young kids.

We loved our stay in this hip hotel! Arrived on a Sunday, Game Night in the bar! Free drink tokens upon arrival. Our room was clean and comfortable, think tiny house, great use of the space. I had a wonderful nights sleep and our roof was just above the bar. Didn’t hit the magic room, but hubby ate at egghead, the basic was yummy. Close to everything, we walked to Gotham comedy club for a fun night, walked to the village the next morning to explore.

The rooms are a lot smaller that the rooms I usually stay in when I am travelling out of state on business trip. The location was near many restaurants that were in walking distance. I loved the atmosphere of the hotel. I would definitely like to stay there again.

I recently stayed at this hotel with a large group of friends. We stayed in the king suite on the 15th floor. The room was amazing and had a great view of the Empire State Building. The location was awesome. The suite had a great set up, large seating area and the bathroom area was separate from the room and could double as a closet. Other friends we traveled with stayed in queen and double rooms, they all enjoyed their rooms as well. I appreciated that there was a steamer in the room instead of an iron. Also the shower was amazing!! Both the second floor bar and magic hour were fun places to drink. Would stay here again, great location, really cool rooms!

This hotel was very modern and trendy. although I did not get to visit the rooftop for the magic hour the hotel has another bar located on the second floor that provides good drinks in a more relaxed chill environment. The location is perfect! Also visit Egg Head it is below the hotel. Best egg sandwiches ever the hash browns are filled with cheese. I will be staying there from now on.

Stayed here for 2 nights while on a business trip during a snow storm in NYC. Would rate this as one of my favorite hotels in NYC (having stayed at more than 15 different ones) - it does not have the largest room, may not be as elegant as the W, but has character, and is interesting, beginning with the sculpture in the lobby, to the non-traditional check in counters, to the utilitarian rooms with tiles, metal and knobs to hang clothes. The location is great, yes but there are more than 2 dozens hotels in the vicinity. One can draw inspiration from the decor and the furniture, and the sitting/working area on the 2nd floor is fantastic. I like Egghead, the inhouse breakfast joint, and had lunch at Legasea (so-so). The gym is in the basement, and pretty sad. I feel a little claustrophobic in the dark wood-paneled elevator, and the hip music makes it a little better. The bed is comfortable and the heating flows upwards to the ceiling, rather than blasting into my face, which is a plus. It is a little noisy, even though I was on the highest floor, the soundproofing between rooms is not fantastic. They provide earplugs. Like the body wash/shampoo and the shower is very easy to use (I would not say that for 3/4 of the hotels I stay in). And it is one of the few hotels in the US where there are enough lights in the room for it to be nicely illuminated. Will stay here again.

Easy access to the hotel. Very Clean and right in the middle of all that New York has to offer. Very Nice area Lots of sights to see great view from my room. I would stay again because the location is super convenient.

This is an honest and realistic review...Just back from our NYC trip..Sorry, but all previous reviewers must be under 30. Location of the Moxy is great. Ideal for everything- short walk from Macy's, Times Square etc..The rooms are very clean with a great safe in a drawer but the rooms are so small. No storage space -wall full of coat pegs, 3 coat hangers and 4 small pigeon holes under the bed to place all your clothes in. We found this so hard to work with, living out of our suitcases for 6 nights was certainly not easy. No other reviewers seemed to find the noise SO LOUD......We had to ask to change our room after our 2nd sleepless night with, music still playing and booming at 2.30am in the morning. The music came from the bar on level 2 and all the bedrooms are above this--NOISE TRAVELS UP!!!!!I rang reception every night. We were moved to another level which we were informed was a quieter room. Ha... There was no difference in the noise level. After a busy day sightseeing everyone needs a good sleep.. We should have wondered why there were packets of ear plugs on the bedside table in every room. We have never stayed in a hotel where ear-plugs were provided. This could of really spoiled our holiday- we refused to let it...

Was very skeptical when I was booking this hotel, rates were great and pictures were nice...but sometimes that’s deceiving and it was rooms are very very very tiny with limited space. But the design and layout took advantage of that space. Why a five start review, because I simply love it and I would come back again. Sorry for the short review but it’s simple, this hotel is amazing.

Overall review is good, I had an amazing experience in here. But only feedback is not all staff is friendly (there’s one staff male who were in reception area, not friendly at all and unwilling to support)

We had a great stay at Moxy. The staff was very friendly and very helpful! We didn't have enough time to check out the rooftop but heard great things about it from other guests. We are defitnitly looking forward to coming back and stay at the Moxy!

Location is excellent. But the room is bit too small for the family. Not much storage and closet. Beds are comfortable, relatively the bathroom size is pretty good. But the bathroom’s window wasn’t double wall, kind of noisy, you can hear the traffic from the street in the room at 15/F.

Everything was great - hotel, staff, service, vibe and location! Games in the lobby, roof top bar with DJ. Lounge with DJ. Rooms are clean, cute and functional. Very cool atmosphere. Staff fun and pleasant

Room did not have an iron, but it did include a steamer, which worked fine. Overall, I would recommend this place if you want to be close enough to Times Square. I was able to jump on a train to anywhere or a quick 10 to 20 dollar Uber ride to most places. Lyft to LaGuardia was about 35 bucks. The hotel is swanky and alive!

Great visit to NYC. The Moxy is unlike any other hotel I have stayed at. Its got music pumping, and a nightclub vibe to its lobby. The rooms are very comfortable and well appointed with fresh modern furniture. There is a lounge on second floor that was hopping at night. This is a great place to meet others and have a night venue right in your hotel. I would not suggest this for a business trip or quiet getaway. I will definitely be coming back.

the people make the place! customer service is top notch. loved the clean room. the bar lounge was real nice. location is great. nothing bad to say. i will be back. Robert at chk in is the man! He was accomidating!

We stayed for three nights as part of a package through a travel agent. We had a family member and friend with us who were sharing a room so clearly stipulated the need to have a twin room. On arrival we were allocated two doubles and were told that the hotel was fully booked so there was no flexibility to provide a double room. The duty manager (female) at the time was quite dismissive and unhelpful so we ended up with two small rooms with small double beds. We initially had to rearrange the sleeping arrangements and got to the point where we had to ask for additional bedding as one of each party were going to sleep on the floor.It was at this point that our saviour arrived - the hotel manager - sorry I don't know his name but he couldn't have done more to help us. He found another room with a double bed and bunk which in an instance sorted out what we were originally requesting. The hotel is busy and has a disco on the roof top - which you can hear in your room until 0200hrs.Our rooms were very small and the beds were barely what we would call doubles ... but ... the shower is one of the best we have had in any hotel!If you are looking for a party atmosphere and not to concerned about the room comfort then this hotel will be okay for you. If you are looking for comfort, good service and a quiet place to go - look elsewhere.

Looking for a reasonably priced hotel for a last minute overnight in NYC, we found this hotel on the Marriott website. PROS - best hotel shower ever; simple, modern decor; great use of small space; excellent location near Times Square, theaters, etc.; the priceCONS - awful strong perfume odor in lobby and elevators (made me nauseous in lobby); lobby/check in a bit disorganized (where is the line? Which side? One line or 2?); not much room in bathroom to change/dress if need privacy We had no issues with noise. Might not be comfortable if large person. Not really for business or families. But, for us, a couple, it was perfect. Did not use gym or go to bars/restaurant. We will stay here again.

From the moment I walked through the revolving door to the time I left this place, the atmosphere the staff, the room, everything made me feel electrified. It was my birthday weekend and they gave me an amazing surprise one that will stick with me forever. There is no doubt that I will be back over and over as there isn't any comparison. I love the decor and everything that came with the hotel. MOXY Times Square and Front Desk Staff you have a new friend in me. See you soon.

Staying at the Moxy for Patricks weekend...Great location for time square and Macy’s...rooms very small but quirky...spotlessly clean and had a feel of the Roosevelt’s hotel in Hollywood ..only negative is the a/c ...when it is on to cool down the room it starts off ok but then gets very loud and rattly.....the staff today unable to fix it obviously even after two requests...so I lie awake for a second night cool but awake!..the a/c unit is inches from the head of the bed so the rattling is right at your head...there is no getting away from it....otherwise fab hotel...I love the proximity to time square....the bar on second and top floor were great fun and very atmospheric...small room and bed but sure that’s New York...5 out of 5 if it wasn’t for the air conditioning.

This place is trying to fool you into thinking the so-called hip atmosphere is justification for the ridiculously small rooms. I'll bet you'll find a good rate, but you'll get what you pay for. I am a business traveler and I expect a relative baseline of amenities in a Marriott property such as a room that is larger than a broom closet, a bed shoved into a corner and only accessible by one side, furniture that isn't collapsible and hanging on the wall, a closet with hangers, a coffee pot. I really don't need to be overstimulated upon entering the hotel with loud club music, rowdy workers cheering one another on in oversized versions of Jenga and Connect4 and basketball. The place is chaos and lacks professionalism. The staff are barely out of high school, and useless in their ability to provide any real service. Never again. What a joke.

If there's something NYC has to offer besides being the city that never sleeps, it's hotels which is kind of ironic. How do you wow travelers and lure them into your new hotel in the center of the hustle and bustle of The City? the answer is: The Moxy Hotel. This hotel has the cool vibe of any higher priced hotel (owned by The Marriott after all) but at a cool lower price. From the moment you arrive, you are in for a treat--don't miss the candy bar where you can scoop out from an assortment of candies to take with you. The best part...it's complimentary. We also received two tokes for the bar to experience our "welcome drink" also complimentary...Be sure to ask upon check in how to use the elevator, they are very cool and modern but can be tricky for non techies. The rooms are also really cool, ours had two large single beds set up like a train car and I overheard a conversation about other rooms having bunk beds. The shower is spacious and has all the amenities you will need during your stay. If the noise of the city bothers you, The Moxy has earplugs right in the room.What will they think of next. Get ready to be amused at The Moxy.

Moxy Times Square New YorkI contacted the Moxy a few weeks prior to a planned weekend away with my 15 year old daughter. I spoke w Vincent. He was very informative regarding location, amenities and the atmosphere within the hotel. Some of the reviews mentioned risky lobby area. Vincent reassured me that hotel would be appropriate for our stay. We had a late check in. We were greeted by the staff.super trendy and fast paced. Within ax few minutes we were in our room. Our room had a double bed and a single bunk bed. The shower toilet area was small but perfectly fine for one person. The sink is in the room not in the shower toilet area. We liked that. The room was very compact. Perfect for us. They had a soap shampoo and conditioner in the shower area. We did venture down to the lobby bar and met with friends. The kids sat in the lobby that offered complimentary wifi. We enjoyed two cosmos. Super full of energy lobby. The next morning I used the gym in the basement are of the hotel. It had treadmills free weights. Nice and compact. I got a cup of java from the lobby and off to the UN building We were able to walk to Times Square. You could easily explore all of NYC staying here. There was a Starbucks around the corner!! There is a roof top bar I wasn't able to go up to since I was traveling with my minor daughter. It sounded like a lot of fun. The entire team at the Moxy was fun and full of energy. Hats off to the management for hiring Vincent. Super professional and very helpful. Will stay here again in The future

Such a cool, modern little place. Fun atmosphere, great location...You never even have to leave the hotel to have fun in NYC! I was nervous as I am not a pet owner and it said pet friendly...but honestly I know it was one of the cleanest most lovely smelling hotels I ever stayed in!

Finally cleaned my room at 10 PM....people trying their be hip but looking unprofessional....I have asked GM Christian to call...tried to call Manager on duty and after 20 rings they hung up....surprised Marriott is not aware of reviews and needed change...

Stayed in 1608. Since they added the extra sound resistant windows it's quiet, comfortable, and has the BEST shower. Easy to get work done on the computer in the spacious and quiet lounge. Really friendly and helpful staff. Amazing egg sandwiches! Great rooftop bar, great restaurant. I can't say enough about this place!

Moxy is Marriott’s smaller room concept with active social spaces. I had a single queen room which worked for me. The room and shower are comfortable, there is a table hanging on one of the pegs that I used for my desk and there are plenty of outlets and usb plugs to charge devices. Front desk check in was fast and friendly and I received a complimentary cocktail coin which I promptly cashed in after storing my bags. I had lunch at Legesea, a cool fish concept that was very well done. They kept the restaurant week pricing for lunch which was a relatively good value. The second floor space is the main activity floor with bar, restaurant, meeting rooms and tables and sofas to hang out work, drink, and relax. There is always music playing here, so not a place for conference calls.WiFi worked well. I didn’t use the gym nor did I go to the rooftop venue which was closed for a private event. I didn’t get a chance to go to Egghead, but I am told the food is good. Next time.Good concept with fun second floor vibe, worth checking in.

My husband and I enjoyed our stay at the Moxy. We got to the hotel after a full day of exploring lower Manhattan, check-in was extremely easy and the staff were extremely kind. After a quick refresh in our room, we headed to the bar and had a few rounds of drinks before calling it a night. Our room was exactly what we expected based on pictures from the website. The only complaint we can think of is that we requested a room on a higher level and we were placed on the 5th floor where a flood light on an adjacent building lite our room if the blinds were open. Overall, we had a great stay and would visit the Moxy again.

Please read the negative reviews about this hotel. There are SO many places to stay in NYC, there is no need to choose this one. It wants so hard to be hip, but fails at the expense of comfort, sanity and normal hotel behavior. The whole place feels like you're crashing at your college friend's dorm room.Pros: Location. It is in a great location. The staff is very pleasant, if someone lost about what is going on. It's as if it's everyone's first hotel job. They WANT to be great, but they don't know how to do it. The elevators that send you (mostly) to your own floor are very cool.Cons: So many. Housekeeping. I don't know what they did other than make the bed, because in three days there I never had towels or glasses replaced. The first two days I sought out Housekeeping and they got me towels immediately. The third day, I called the front desk and they told me that I just needed to go to the room that said "Stash" and get my own. Seriously? Why wouldn't they let me know this from day 1? The earbuds (so many sets in the room!) were an indicator of the noise level. Fortunately, in our room, it wasn't as bad as I heard other guests complain about. The room is tiny - I mean I could stretch my arms from one side to the other tiny. At the end of the room was the queen bed - no room on three sides. Do NOT sit up at night because you bonk your head on the bunk that's on top. The TV is huge - seriously huge - which would be nice if you weren't 3 feet (max) away from it. Worst is the lighting. That may sound funny, but you can't put on makeup or shave! The tiny light is directly over your head. It's not possible to see clearly enough to put on makeup. I cannot imagine who would come up with that design. The water in the shower is tepid at best. You don't need to turn the cold water nozzle on because the hottest it gets is tepid. Finally, I had some papers FedExed to me, but the hotel refused delivery because they "get so many packages that they can't store them all." What? Just accept packages for people who are at the hotel and put the packages in their rooms, if necessary. Instead, this new (month old) policy mean that my package was delivered "2 doors down." There was no store 2 doors down, and I never found the store where my package was supposed to be. I was off during the day did not have time during the store's open hours to look and find it. Of course, if I found it, I'd have to pay at minimum $5 to pick it up! This is relatively unbelievable for a Marriott hotel. Super disappointed in them.In conclusion, please, please PLEASE look for a different hotel. I haven't had such a bad experience in a very long time at a hotel.

Positives: hotel is modern and clean and in a great location, great if you are a party goer and dont intend sight seeing .. deffinatley Not family friendly or for those who value sleep.reception staff very friendly, bubbly and helpful however the loud music dull lighting and strong smell of perfume in the reception area, should have warned us what was to come.The hotel has a rooftop bar on the 18th floor. our room was on the 8th floor and we were kept awake by very loud music which goes on until 4am making it impossible to sleep, the tell tale signs were the provision of ear plugs on the table in the room. very disappointed with the reaction of the staff when we complained about the noise, thought they could tell us about the new windows which are going to be fitted this year at a great expense to the owners, this does not help when you need sleep. after 2 nights with little to no sleep we were given a quieter room. Management and .staff are aware of the issue especially in the atrium, we were never once told about the issue, and all the hotels information does not highlight the problem.ruined what was a celebration for our daughters birthday

From the moment you put a foot in the lobby, you feel really good about your choice of hotel. Customer service is friendly and on target. For every question, you have a simple answer. Great place, great rooms, good vide, European concept... but not everyone likes to sleep with earplugs!

Great Hotel with so many fun and nice touches in a great spot and great staff. It made me feel young again. If I had to define hip this place has it. Bathroom was huge and bed was really comfortable. Great touches such as ear plugs and a closet on every floor with towels, Hotel Bar was amazing

Loved how the bed was close to the wall and close to the tv. Just seemed very cozy. Read on yelp that the music would be a problem but it completely was not for me and my boyfriend. Would definitely stay here again

First of all, kudos to Ivette, Stephanie and the staff (Crew Members)a t reception, as well as those who trained or were responsible for hiring them. The attitude and positive disposition of said personnel is of world class caliber. Then Location: if you want to visit Mid-Town NYC, Macy's Herald Square, Broadway, Madison Square Garden, and be a located very close to public transportation this location is superb. The restaurants and food offerings in the area are very good within a two city block circumference, ranging from the fast and casual to the sit down NY restaurants. However, if you are sensitive to ambient noise to sleep before 2 AM., this may not be your first choice. Other than that the vibe and atmosphere of the place is part of its secret sauce.

This hotel is a great find in a great location. It was very upbeat and welcoming after a long day! The atmosphere just brings a smile to your face when you walk in the door! I loved the layout of the room! So cute and cozy. I would highly recommend to anyone looking for a great place close to everything!

The Moxy Hotel is the place to be, location, location, location. The Hotel is right near Penn Station and was walkable to all I need to do, including the Theater. The lounge/lobby allows you work space, social space and terrific food options.

Just returned from a manic 5 days in New York and had the privilege of staying here. Yes its not for everyone; there is music playing but we didnt think excessive. There was some noise from outside but they have no control over that. The room we had (queen) was lovely, very modern. Had the best nights sleep EVER. Shower is brilliant! No wardrobes, but plenty of pegs for stuff. The staff were so helpful and friendly. Yes they dont wear uniforms, but so what. They did their jobs efficiently and were very attentive. All in all, a brilliant break in a manic city!!! Well done to the crew!

After travelling through a winter storm to NY for a conference, the experience from the time I walked into this hotel was amazing! The location is close to Penn Station and in the middle of EVERYTHING! The lounge area is beautiful and perfectly sectioned off for those wanting to either socialize or get some work done. Everyone I spoke to (staff) was helpful and engaging. The noise from the club and outside can be a little disruptive however the hotel also provides earplugs. I love the room design and the feel of all the shared spaces. I will absolutely be back!

We nearly changed hotels after reading some of the reviews on here but decided we would stick it out and hope for the best. I hope I cover as many issues as possible because this hotel deserves guests to defend it. We stayed on level 14 and the only noise we heard was street noise... it wasn't enough to keep us awake but earplugs are provided in all rooms if your overly sensitive to noise.The quirky lifts/elevators!... you press a screen, enter your floor number and it tells you whether it's number 1-4 that is going to your floor... it's really not hard. The pegs to hang clothes... these came in particular handy after being caught in a storm and our clothes were soaked... dried out in no time.Nice hot shower, another thing we were grateful for.Our bed touched the walls from head to foot, I'm just short of 6 foot and had a really comfy sleep.We didn't have any alarms go off. The staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel looks great. The bars were very elegant and modern. We really couldn't fault this hotel in any form.Thanks for a great stay guys and we wish you the best for the future!

We stayed here for 5 nights in February. The hotel is in a great location on 36th street on 7th Avenue. It’s 6 blocks from Times Square and 2 blocks from the nearest subway station on 34th street. We had a room on the 5th floor, which was a double double room. The room was small and compact, but you expect nothing else in New York. The room was practical and the beds were comfortable. They have a safe in the room under one of the beds. They had several pegs around the room allowing for you to hang up your clothes. The bathroom was clean and the shower was great. The room has a hairdryer and also had a steamer for getting any creases out of your clothes. They also had earplugs for each guest, should you want them. They have what’s called a stash cupboard on each floor. Inside the stash cupboard you have irons and ironing boards, additional towels, extra toiletries, toothbrushes, eye masks etc, which is a great idea. The bars in the hotel were lovely, trendy and modern. They attracted a younger crowd of people. The drinks were slightly overpriced so I wouldn’t advise drinking too much in the hotel. However, it was nice to experience the atmosphere. The staff at the hotel could not have been any friendlier. I don’t understand how anyone could give the hotel a negative review. My friends and I would definitely recommend The Moxy Hotel Times Square to anyone. We will be back again the next time we are in NYC.

Having read reviews about the noise from the nightclub, I was a little nervous about my stay at the Moxy with my two teenage daughters. But because it looked like a cool place to stay in the city and the price was right, we took a chance. We were glad we did. We found the front desk staff to be extremely friendly and helpful. We did ask for a more quiet room. We were on the 16th floor and had no problem with noise. Once the fan was on in the room we heard nothing. The beds are the most comfortable beds we've ever slept on so we slept great. Def a minimalist feel so not a warm and cozy type place. We liked the hooks and the storage spaces under the bed for organization. The second floor lounge area is beautiful. Overall a very fun, contemporary hotel with a futuristic youthful vibe. I think it's a perfect NYC hotel esp for those who enjoy a different experience. it is part of the Marriott. Loved the music playing in the lobby and the futuristic elevators. While it is minimalistic, it felt like a special place to stay.

Everything was perfect. Staff was super friendly and attentive. The location is very convenient and the rooms are quiet comfortable. I would definitely stay here again. The bar was also very nice and with a great ambiance.
user_name:
Enrique I
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: If you like a traditional hotel experience, this isn't the hotel for you. This is a hotel very much designed with a minimalist European aesthetic and sensibility. The good news is it is a good, clean, affordable hotel in a good location in Manhattan. But, for those looking for all the standard American hotel chain amenities then you'll be disappointed.I like the room because it maximizes a small space. Unlike other higher cost hotels I've stayed at in NYC that have tiny rooms packed with too much furniture, this room feels spacious because it gets rid of everything you likely don't really need or rarely use. The hooks are great, though the lack of a traditional closet does limit how much you can really hang and if two people were in my room it would have been an issue. The bed is definitely not easy for two people as the person closest to the window had to crawl over the other to get in or out. Again, not an issue as I was alone but two people likely wouldn't have enjoyed it.I also really like the "stash" closet on each floor which allows guests to get extras without waiting for housekeeping. The self-service is more convenient and easier.It's definitely a hotel that does not encourage lounging in the room but rather tries to facilitate everyone getting out of the room to congregate in the common spaces. Definitely something designed for Millennial guests so older guests may not appreciate the lack of comfort in room.Breakfast at the bar was consistently good. Legasea was also very good, though I didn't appreciate the hostess essentially telling me they wouldn't sit a single person at a table even when the restaurant wasn't full and I had checked on Open Table that there were reservations available. The flatbreads available in the afternoon were only ok.

If in a room with a bunk bed, watch from bumping your head. Moxy has nice lounge areas and clean rooms. Be aware that daily cleaning services are limited. Beds are surprisingly comfortable. Front lobby service was quick and professional.

Great location, very clean, great stay. Would stay there again, price was great and the overall atmosphere was fantastic. The staff was very attentive and I love how they'll store your bags if you get there early and can't check in yet.

As a regular business traveler (2-3 times per month), I typically book a full-service style hotel. For this trip to NYC, my options were limited so I gave Moxy a try. After reading the reviews posted, I was skeptical of my upcoming stay..reviews about small room size and noise were concerning. Upon arrival, I was immediately greeted and brought to a check-in station (not your traditional front desk). I was quickly checked in and given two free drink coins that could be used at the second floor bar. I was also offered complimentary boxed water and grabbed a couple to take to my room. There’s also a free candy cart in the lobby—just help yourself! The elevators can be a little confusing to use at first, but you get the hang of it. My room was small—as I anticipated. Just big enough for the bed and bathroom. The bed was comfy. I requested a couple of extra pillows which made a huge difference. Love the shower—best water pressure in NYC! The room was neat and clean...which I appreciate. I was in room 1405 and did not have any issues with noise—quiet nights sleep!I deducted one point for the following that I felt were missing from this hotel experience:-There is no coffee maker/Keurig in the hotel room. Love a cup of coffee when I wake up-No iron and ironing board in the room (they do have a handheld steamer in the room was it didn’t quite work well)-There’s not a closet, just hooks to hang clothes onI would recommend Moxy as a comfortable hotel with small rooms—if you just need a place to sleep and shower this is perfect.For a business traveler looking for more—may not be for you.

This hotel does not meet the basic level of service that I expect from a New York hotel, much less a Marriott property. Avoid. Avoid. Avoid.Even as a Marriott Rewards status member, your experience will not improve. There is nothing positive on offer here besides what a committee of people at corporate thought would be a good idea.Attn Management: loud music in the lobby does not make a good hotel. Fix your in-room experience or risk failure. I will absolutely not consider your hotel again - opting instead for your Courtyard offerings at least - until you obviously fix the issues with everything from poor service to cheap, polyester linens.Avoid avoid avoid!

Perfect for a quick NYC getaway. Rooms are very small but new and modern. Can’t complain because the price was unbeatable. Don’t bother with the welcome drink although the bar was inviting and the naan snacks were very good. Location is more near penn station then Times Square.

Great location in Times Square. Super cute hotel, very trendy, clean rooms. Rooms are small, but welcome to NYC. Upon arrival there is no shortage of hotel staff in the lobby.... but was a bit annoying that it seems like everyone was standing around not working. No ice, so you have to go to the bar, annoying. Fairly priced. Bars and restaurants on site. Dined at legasea, it was awesome. Great rooftop bar. I would return.

Awesome stay in NYC - Cannot say enough about the Moxy! Will definitely be back. From the friendly staff to the fun rooms and the games in the lounge, it was an amazing stay. It was also close to everything making it easy to get around and visit the sites. We will definitely be back!

They spent too much time making it a trendy place and did not focus on the basics. The room does not come with complimentary water. Just reusable plastic cups. For something that is supposed to used consistently, plastic is not the way to go. I still filled up the cup because I was thirsty and I got a cup with gray water (see pic). Went look my for ice and soda machine and did not find any on the floor above and below me. I then called the front desk and they told me that they do not have ice or vending machines and that I would have to go to the bar on the 2nd floor (staying on the 15th) to get either. Being in some sleep ware, I now had to dress up and go into a packed bar so I can have a glass of water. CRAZY! After that fiasco, I crawled into bed and realized they only place 2 flat pillows (I am a side sleeper and need at least 2 for myself) on the bed and they do not use a sheet. Just a duvet with blanket inside. For a Marriott hotel, I feel that this is just unacceptable. The TV placement in my room was also horrible (see pic). It took up valuable space under the hooks and it does not allow you walk at the base of the bed, which screws the 2nd person in the bed against the windows. They literally have to jump over the 1st person to get out of the bed. Also, when I was laying in bed, my feet are a little over a foot away from the tv and in the view. They should have definitely placed the tv above the hooks.

Overpriced rooftop bar but with amazing views and a really cool quirky decor thing going on. The faux-but-functional mini golf course is great for photos and laughs. Skip the food, there’s way better stuff around but it’s worth an overpriced cocktail on their carousel spinning seating to take a few pictures and enjoy the midtown view!

It was wonderful place to stay I loved the design of the rooms and bathrooms just be careful if you have a 3d picture frame by your bed ouch!!! Overall wonderful place to stay the rooftop is crazy beautiful up there I would definitely come back and stay
