My wife and I stayed at Moxy Times Square for a night, and we both had a blast.This place is fun!This hotel does a great job acknowledging what people actually want in a hotel today- an affordable, clean, well-designed room in a perfect location for anyone making a visit to the city. They forego most of the extraneous fussy amenities that I’ve never found myself using on vacation, and achieve a price point that is really impressive given the overall experience (which is very fun).The bars are fun. The restaurants are fun. The view from the roof is fun. The design details in the rooms are all fun (and smart). The entertainment system is fun. The staff that we interacted with are all very fun.All of that aside- I wanted to make a special call-out about the shower in the room. It’s exceptional. Fantastic water pressure from a waterfall shower head is one of those things that all of us deserve from our lives. It was one of the most fun showers I’ve ever had the pleasure of using, and made me feel the need to up my game in our home.Will definitely be back next time we want to spend some time in the city.

I arrived at The Moxy Hotel exhausted from a long red eye flight and as soon as I arrived I was greeted with a friendly welcoming staff that was more than happy to get me checked into a room at 7am in the morning! A super early check in rarely ever happens. I was immediately happy I was able to get situated in my room and rest up before a crazy busy day during NYFW. The hotel is a very lively, hip, and fun place to be. With amazing restaurants grounds, music playing nonstop, diverse crowds! Definitely recommend to anyone looking for an affordable hotel and good vibes.

My husband and I stayed at the Moxy to have a night out before we have our first baby. We chose The Moxy because the price and location were great, but also because at 9 months pregnant the idea of having a nice dinner and a great lounge and bar in the hotel would make the night easier. The rooms are compact, efficient and very comfortable. We asked for extra pillows when we checked in and found out there is a "stash closet" on each floor you can access with your key that has extra things you might need. Brilliant! The room had water and gummy bears waiting for us. We relaxed for a few since we had just had dinner and then went to the 2nd floor lounge with our drink tokens they had given us when we checked in. The lounge was spacious and comfortable with good service and it didn't feel like we were in Time Square at all (a plus for native New Yorkers!). Very tasteful design everywhere. After a great nights sleep we each took long showers with the most amazing shower head ever. It was like a glorious waterfall.

We arrived at this hotel fully expecting to hate it based on prior reviews, but it was by far the most affordable Marriott hotel for our weekend in NYC. Surprise - we really enjoyed our stay! The shower was great, the bed was comfortable, the room was new and clean. We loved the room design, especially the pegs for hanging clothing and bags.Only downside: it is really noisy at night, but the earplugs solved the problem well enough.

The Moxy from check in to check out was very pleasing. The check in site was welcoming and easy to find. I very much enjoyed the room's fresh minimalistic vives. Anyone staying here is guranteed to feel young and modern.

This hotel has a fun, young vibe. The staff is friendly, helpful and they informative. Rooms were small, but had a smart design. There are pegs all along the walls that allow for purposeful placement of belongings. The water pressure in the bathroom shower was amazing.

When we checked in, we asked the front desk person, Alex, for some suggestions to hear jazz. He recommended Smalls, in the Village, a place we never would have found on our own. Given we were short on time, he suggested we eat at a French restaurant, next door called Bobo. Both were spot on recommendations. My wife loved the cassoulet (best she's ever had) and my cod was top notch. We gobbled our dinner and walked next door to Smalls to hear a really cooking quartet, with a special gift, the bandleader's uncle. Great night, great recommendation, great hotel.

Stayed at this hotel for the first time and the overall experience was fantastic.From the location to the room size and gorgeous modern decor, I was very impressed.I was even more impressed with the staff, both in the bar/restaurant and particularly the reception team.One member of staff, Beatrice, went above and beyond to help me with my stay in New York as I was travelling alone and experienced some issues upon my arrival, unrelated to the hotel.Beatrice’s standards around courtesy and genuine interest in the customer experience was outstanding and I hope this is recognised by hotel management.I plan to visit New York again in Spring and Moxy will be top of my list for places to stay and I will be recommending to my family, friends and colleagues.

this is a very interesting hotel. It is nothing like a hotel I have ever stayed. The service was outstanding, our room wasn't quite ready, so they gave us a free Prosecco at the 2nd floor bar. The rooms are nice, however, we stayed in a corner room for the view, but the bed was in the corner, so I had to climb over my husband to get out of bed while he was still sleeping. I am also not a fan of showers without doors. I suggest going online to look at the pictures of the rooms as it is difficult to explain the concept. It was also very noisy. They give you ear plugs which my husband used when the trash truck woke him at 5am. The roof top bar was a lot of fun. Will go back to the bar in the summer when they retract the roof

My husband and I and 13-year old daughter stayed one night at the Moxy on Sunday of President's Weekend. We were headed to see Sponge Bob the Musical and wanted a reasonably priced hotel convenient to the theater district, but didn't want to be in the center of things as we were in December at the Doubletree Hilton Times Square. We loved this location and as a bonus there is a parking garage literally next door (where we made an advanced reservation for our minivan 'an oversized car in Nyc' using the app ParkWhiz). Check in was perhaps the friendliest I've ever experienced anywhere and as a nice gesture guests are given drink tokens that can be cashed in for signature prosecco drink for adults and Shirley temple for kids. We had a room with 2 double beds that were situated end to end in the shoebox shaped room. The decor is modern and trendy with a fun: We got a kick out of the "Leave me Alone" button to push that lights up outside your room instead of hanging a boring "Privacy Please" tag on the door knob, the bath room has a swimming pool theme that was fun--plenty of counter space and a terrific rainmaker shower head. There's no wardrobe or closet, but rather about 60 peg/hooks where you stash your coats and clothing which for a short stay was not a problem and kind of fun. We were on the 10th floor overlooking the interior courtyard. Our room was not noisy--no loud base music that I have seen referenced in other reviews--we did not use the earplugs that were supplied. Only minor negatives were that the air handler in the room was noisy and the bathroom door doesn't seal shut so you can hear noises from bathroom in the bedroom--the door closes tightly, but there's a gap at bottom and hinge side so noise travels. The second floor of the hotel is a real gem for families or groups staying in separate rooms. There's a large bar that is family friendly, several large square game tables in side rooms and board games to play, comfy couches in a variety of arrangements for groups large or small, a foosball table (free) and a light fare snack menu and grab and go food area as well. We did not get to the roof top bar to experience or check out the roof top mini golf and the candy bar was not open while we were coming and going....reasons to go back!
user_name:
Tabitha O
Saratoga Springs, New York

review_body: I stayed here for 2 nights. It was a great experience. The room was great, staff... awesome! Restaurant and bars... great. If you need a place to stay while gone most off the day! This is the place, great concept! Will be back!

After reading mixed reviews I was very unsure what to expect. On arrival met by very nice staff member who checked us in. Made my way to our room and heart sank it was very small. Lying in bed my foot kept hitting tv a foot of bed. No I am not the tallest so could cause issues. Anyway room was clean and tidy. Bar area was great and again staff were friendly. Hotel situated in a great location and would definitely go back

Innovative design and customer assistance. Younger crowd was great with a part attitude with taste. Fantastic roof top bar and lounge to include bar and restaurant on second level. Needs more adult entertainment or activities

I wish I could read all the reviews before I booked this hotel. SO REGRET!!!!!This is not a hotel, but a huge night club. The loud music and base sound won't stop. Check their website, the magic hour lounge won't close until 4:30am. EARPLUG is useless. A good hotel supposed to be cozy and comfortable. If a hotel can not provide a good rest for their customers, it should not be a hotel. Why do not just named it as a night club?I know I will not have any sleep tonight, and the marriott member customer service won't pick up the phone. What a shame! DO NOT COME TO THIS HOTEL! or you may end up in hospital after staying. no Joking.

We stayed at the Moxy for a friends 40th. Check in was quick and efficient and we were greeted warmly. The room is small but sufficient.. beds super comfy. Can be noisy ..but its New york, where isn't?. Ear plugs provided. The location is great, and the roof top bar has a great view of the empire state building. On the whole staff were friendly and helpful. Not your run of the mill hotel.. very funky.

When in NY you need a quality place to unwind and rest those tired feet and legs. The Moxy has it all. Its perfectly situated, comfy, spotless and the staff are just fab. The rooms are adequately furnished. They may be small (boutique) but are very modern. What more do you need?

This was my 3rd stay at the Moxy and we live the vibe! John at check in and Brittany at the bar were awesome! We will be back again this summer. The room was super comfortable and the roof top bar is amazing. Check this place out!
user_name:
Errika G
Staten Island, New York

review_body: Lower the music for top rooms. The people were friendly and the place was amazing. I will be back to stay every time I am in NYC. Location is great to get to just about anywhere. I had to bring a bunch of things into the hotel and they were very helpful.

Room is stylish but small. Noise level is unacceptable!!! I am in a room on the 11th floor and can hear the loud nightclub music from the 18th floor as if I was 1 floor below the club!!! Outside construction noise is ridiculous! At 1:15am the best the front desk can offer is a room change. I’m in pjs with my stuff unpacked...if you move me higher up the music will be louder. If you move me to a lower floor the outside noise will be worse. Front desk told me the club closes at 3am...if you need to sleep, DO NOT CHOOSE MOXY NYC
user_name:
Cindy H
Utopia, New York, United States

review_body: My husband booked this as my 30th birthday treat. It is very central to all the places you’d want to visit, which was a must for me being 21 weeks pregnant. I got the staff to do a fun mirror message which was great to see on arrival. It’s a lovely hotel but no wardrobe (which we knew before we went) but it does mean you have clothes hanging around the room. It’s a lovely comfy bed with soft pillows, tv, good view and great shower. Not too pricey considering the location either so would definitely recommend. You can go to the roof to get great views of NYC. I did find the evenings over the weekend quite noisy but they do provide ear plugs which help. They had left sweets on our arrival which was a nice touch. Will be sad to leave NYC

We stayed for long weekend 2/16-2/19 with another couple. Location, Location, Location was great!!! They did the hotel up nicely but the design, atmosphere, entertainment, etc is geared toward the "Millennial generation". We are an age group of 48-55 and we did enjoy our visit. I will say if we do go back, we will ASK for a room away from either the lounge on 2nd floor, or a room way below the "Biggest Roof Top Deck in NY City". Music till 3am-4am, loud music and although they give earplugs in room, bring your own, they did not due the job. Overall, stay was great! Atmosphere was great, staff was great! But will research and request room away from loud music all night long~

I booked this hotel for a NYC pre-Christmas holiday getaway weekend with my eldest daughter. Fun theme, young & hip crowd. room was quirky, well insulated from ambient hotel noise, and with fun accessories....but crowded in its layout. With winter coats and luggage for two adults, there was absolutely no wiggle room at all. Bed was against wall and window with no walk-around space. Narrow entry hall/room space but in an “IKEA-like” decor style, makes the most of every possible inch! They have a luggage storage area, for last day of sightseeing after room check-out, which was being inundated as we checked in our bags and while it looked a bit sketchy in basement hallway, nothing was amiss when retrieving our bags. My only complaint was when we returned mid-afternoon to retrieve our bags I asked on the ground floor if there was a restroom; profiled and questioned as if we just drifted in off the street. For what I paid for the weekend I don’t think using a restroom before departure to the train station was a huge imposition! I’d return again, but request a slightly larger room.

It is a great location, if you are in town for broadway show or time square. it is near by a lot of sightseeing. The room is small, but it has everything in it, besides fridge or microwave. overall, its great!

If you miss your college dormitory, this is the perfect place for you.If you’re looking for a hotel room with the basic amenities, this not it.I’ve spent over 1500 nights in hotels and this is the first I checked out of within an hour of checking in.This place should not be part of the Marriott chain.

The hotel is so nice! Everything was just right.The room is cozy; sure the room is a little small but you do not feel cramped or anything. Everything in the room is nicely designed. Large stand up showers with cool retro deco. The boxed water and gummy bear were nice touch. The 2nd floor communal space was very cool and there is a bar~~ Rooftop is a must go, they have bench seating on carousel for crying out loud. Great hotel for couples to stay in the city during weekends! close to EVERYTHING! The front desk people was also super cool and nice, unlike other large hotels. Super recommend to anybody!!!!

I checked in and the process was flawless.. I was in my room within seconds which is typically unheard of in NYC. The room was the easiest room ive ever unpacked in- I could hang everything right on the walls and the every where I turned was well equipped with outlets for all of my chargers. The bed was insanely comfortable, I passed right out. In the morning I went down to the bar where the staff couldnt have been friendlier - they understood I was in a rush and got me coffee right away... the doorman helped me find my car and assisted with my bags as well. Definitely recommend staying at the Moxy.

Went with to NYC for the night with my 3 children. Booked the Quad twin bed room, and couldn't have asked for better quick getaway. Design was modern and sleek, staff was super friendly and helpful, the room was a perfect size for us and we really the surrounding hooks came to good use. Definitely going to be coming back with friends, family or solo!

I tend to steer clear of Marriotts' given the somewhat bland nature of them (I know, I'm generalizing) but kudos for the Moxy in NYC.Great concept and very well executed. Sure the rooms are small but so well done and the public spaces are terrific. Nice job...and I'll be back!

Really great modern hotel perfectly located between Times Square and Madison Square Garden with easy access to the subway for trips to Brooklyn or downtown ManhattenVery nice, modern, compact rooms with ultra fast WiFiExpect noise in the evenings and use the ear plugs provided :-)) since this hotel has an awesome roof top bar/club with music most eveningsA must try is the Eggheads food place on the ground floorNot sure I would recommend for a business trip unless you're a heavy sleeper

We arrived at 7am and went to the hotel, who allowed us to leave our cases in the luggage room, we then returned at 6pm to check in (we spent the day out and about in NYC).Check-in - hassle free, friendly and no problems, explained the elevators and where the various bars were.Room, we originally were in room 1407 which we found the situ of the bed very small and cramped for the 2 of us, so I went straight down to reception and they immediately switched us to 1418 which had more space and this was perfect, the staff couldn't of been more helpful.the location is 1 block from Penn Station and MSG, and less than 10mins walk to Times square, so location is perfect.the roof top bar is pleasant and quirky, even if you don't want a drink, go and have a look anyway.Free wifi throughout if thats a major factoroverall this is a good hotel and wouldn't hesitate to stay here again

Working across the street from the Moxy, I love heading over with my laptop at the end of the day and getting comfortable with a glass of wine while I finish my work. They have great spots for working, with big working tables and plugs that make it easy to work in a buzzy atmosphere. I love their new weekly game night - super fun with old school games!
user_name:
geb2989
New York City, New York

review_body: As a local I was SO excited that the Moxy opened up a few doors down from my office. I hang on their second floor bar all the time to finish up work for the day.... tons of great work areas, a cute pup roaming around (!!!) and apps/wine. On Thursday nights they even have game night.... Nintendo 64 to be exact (plus others)!!!! Highly recommend.
user_name:
brigidmcotter
New York City, New York

review_body: First of all the only downside to this is that there is no wardrobe. I totally get the affect the hotel are going for. They have hooks along the whole length of the room for you to hang your stuff onto. It is cool but we had one of the smaller rooms so it can make it look at bit messy, but in all honesty you spend zero time in your room when in NYC so it really doesn't matter. Hotel is clean, beds are comfy and showers are good! Bar is really cool and you get a free token for a cocktail, which isn't the best but it gets you drunk! Staff were amazing and friendly and there was good music being played. Upstairs on the rood top bar was super cool, can see the empire state right literally there. Didn't eat here but saw food being brought out and looked and smelt tasty.

One of my friends was having her Bachelorette in New York and had me and my sister book it. Being that it's February in New York and the weather can totally be unpredictable. We were trying to find a hotel that was centrally located and had options i.e. Bars. The Hotel has only been open since September of last year. I was lucky to come across something about it on Instagram. The great thing about the hotel was it offered bunk beds since there is at least 8 of us going this was an amazing option (Also a great price). The hotel is very trendy which we all loved & you can even play jenga in the hotel lobby. The rooms were very comfortable and fit everyone's stuff. The hotel staff was so friendly! The 2 bars at the hotel definitely had different vibes at each. The rooftop bar called The Magic Hour was very cool but, at 2 they close off the carousel bar. The other side of the roof is very nice but, not exactly what we were looking for. We tried the bar on P2 (Not sure what the name was). We sat at the bar and chatted with the bartenders they were super friendly & one even did to magic tricks for us! All in all I would highly recommend this place for anyone staying in the New York City. Location was great staff was amazing, rooms were awsome. If you're going to New York I definitely recommend trying out this new place!

Husband and I were in town for a couple days celebrating my birthday. The Moxy was a great hotel. Rooms are small but we are only there to sleep and shower anyway. Extremely modern design with a cute attitude. Comfy beds and a great (strong) shower. As with all Marriott owned properties the staff are well trained and personable. We visited the roof top bar and enjoyed the service and the view. And all this for a very reasonable price especially for such a centrally located hotel. Highly recommend.

Saw that this place had just opened in January, and is a Marriott property.After reading other reviews I decided to chance it. (this because so many had complained about the noise).Well not only were we on the 17th floor, but we were literally able to walk up the stairs to the club....and the 3 of us slept like babies!!!!The vibe here is so trendy, the bar, the restaurant, the lobby.Elevators are only accessed by your key card.Altho the room is a true version of an IKEA showroom we LOVED it (for 1 night).Very clean, modern and efficient.So many of my friends on FB could not believe the size of the room, but yet most were keeping it on their radar for the next trip to NYC w/ kids. (Our daughter is 17 and loved the loft).

This doesn’t mean Moxy is a bad place to stay, far from it. Just beware of its design and then decide if it’s for you.Yes, the rooms are very small, but do you really want to pay for more space in this city? The shower is good and the bed very comfortable. Just be warned that the wardrobe consists only of hooks and hangers along the wall. Be warned that the only shelf for clothes storage is a cubby under the bed. Be warned that there’s no minibar or snacks or tea awaiting your arrival in the room. Be aware that the a/c unit is immediately next to the bed and makes a racket. Finally, be warned that the bed fits against three walls, so one of you needs to climb across the bed and jump onto the floor to go to the bathroom. Overall we liked the hotel. The public space is good, though bar staff clueless. Moxy offers decent value for money, so long as you’re comfortable with the nature of what it offers

I felt like I fit right in! It had a High End|Retro|Contemporary feel. Staff was fun and very welcoming! Rooms were cozy and the restaurant & bars had their own vibes. Food and drinks were great too! I have been recommending this location to all my friends! Def will be back again!

Great Experience from check-in to departure! We spent 2 nights at the Moxy. It was a modern hotel with unique amenities. Upon check-in we received 2 drink tokens for a welcome drink and were tempted by the candy cart! The rooms were a nice size for NYC hotels and were spotless! The design of the rooms were well thought out for travelers. There were 37! (yes, I counted them) hooks in our room to hang up our belongings. First time ever I have unpacked while on a weekend get away! The shower had a pool theme, which was super cute...And I loved how the sink had a nice sized counter that was located outside of the showering and toilet space...I was able to blow dry my hair without fighting the humidity from husband showering (yes, the little things in like make me very happy!) The hotels proximity to all of our planned weekend destinations was perfect...we were able to go out during the day and stop back in to freshen up for the evening. Saturday night before heading to dinner we got to stop at the Moxy bar to relax on the comfy sofa, charge up my cell phone and enjoy our complimentary drink from our drink tokens! Friday night we went up to the roof top bar...it was a great playful atmosphere with beautiful views of the city...oh and the drinks were yummy too! We will definitely be back for another stay at the Moxy real soon!
We had a whole week, it was perfect and we arrived just on the day of the opening party the hotel was excellent Beautiful modern design Located in an excellent location No doubt I'll come again!!!

Moxy NYC Times Square is great! The hotel is BEAUTIFUL, the rooftop bar is the coolest in NYC, and the staff are super friendly and always willing to help you out. Plus, they have a game night every Tuesday, which features free drinks and candy, so obviously it's a good time! I had so much fun and enjoyed every minute of my stay at Moxy.

Stayed at the Moxy for a weekend with my teen daughters. It was exactly as expected since I researched online beforehand. Price was very reasonable and good value. Very small rooms - but it is NYC after all. I'd rather have a smaller cool looking space than the usual two queen, dull textiles & ho-hum furniture - particularly for a quick trip to this city. My daughters liked being in a trendy and more hip space. Location is really the garment district but Times Sq. is totally within walking distance - as is Bryant Park. No closet - but everyone has warned you about this.They could def use a few more hooks in the bathroom IMO. I don't think we received maid service but for a short stay was no big deal. Fun atrium lobby, meeting spaces, bar on 2nd floor. I never hit the rooftop bar. Our room 422 was quiet. It was a single loft over a queen - facing inside alley space. Fitness room on basement level was fine and empty although at one point - it took elevator a while to get down there and made me think for a minute I might be stuck. Candy bar was a nice touch. I think the check in area needs some improvement - there seemed to be no rhyme or reason - who was checking in - checking out etc. Maybe a velvet rope might create a queue? I was waiting for help while other guests would walk to another desk and be served. Also a bench in the 1st floor lobby would be welcome - was pouring and cold outside and would've been nice to sit near window while waiting for uber etc.

Service by everyone at all outlets was superb! Clean, cozy room with such a unique touch. Staff is hip without being pretentious. Loved the hotel, restaurants, and location. DJ at the bar on the 2nd floor played great songs with such a variety!
user_name:
Paola F
New York City, New York

review_body: I wasn't sure what to expect, but was pleasantly surprised by my experience at Moxy. The rooms are small, but are comfortable and have a cool vibe to them. I stayed here for one night, and for the price and location I would definitely stay here again. My boyfriend and I went to dinner at Legase, which was very good, then Magic Hour, which we stayed at all night and had a great time. Moxy is a great hotel if you're visiting from out of town and want a hip spot in a great location.

Many times in New York, and probably the quickest hotel I’ve ever stayed ever. At first was not impressed, you enter and is loud, noisy and looks like a club in the 80s. How wrong first impression can be. Room are small but very nicely decorated. Sort of like ACE hotel in a way with lots of peculiar and old fashion accessories. The bar on the second floor is awesome, gym on the lower level great. Staff helpful and very polite. Lots of unusual decoration and music but all in modern style that resemble the good old 80s. Lot of young people, like a fashion trendy show. I’m on room 533 and I thought it was going to be noisy from the outside. Not at all. Bed comfortable and the best sleep in ages. Can’t tell you I’m so going to use this as my NY base. Plus unusually cheap for NY standards. Top mark for me

This isn't the first time I've booked a room in a hotel and found the accommodations to be more similar to a cruise ship. The space is tight but reasonably well arranged IF you don't need to spend time in the room other than sleeping or dressing. The queen rooms have more room than the double queen rooms, and have furniture such as chairs and lap desks hanging on pegs on the wall, which is also where you put your clothes. The double queen room has two beds end to end and a companionway about three feet wide running the length. One issue was that the toilet in the bathroom was directly in front of the head of one of the beds and the sliding glass door and lack of exhaust fan didn't offer any privacy. That being said, the beds were comfortable, the bathroom was sufficient and the shower was hot with good pressure. There are 2 restaurants in the hotel and the second floor bar serves breakfast and has a 2-go bar for food to take with. We didn't eat in the restaurants but did have a nice breakfast in the bar. The rooftop bar got a lot of hype but wasn't really all that special as far as I could see but half of it was closed in the winter and apparently that's where the carousel is, which could be quite fun. When we went up to the rooftop to just take a look, all the tables already had "Reserved" signs on them so I don't know that that was all about - I asked but didn't really get an answer.The location of the hotel is good and the prices when we were there were quire reasonable.
user_name:
happyfeet51
Saint Helena Island, South Carolina

review_body: We ( two forty somethings!!) stayed for 5 nights and have mixed feelings of this hotel. We arrived late having been travelling all day and our first impressions were not good...loud, like really loud music in the dark sparse reception area, coupled with a unique aroma which you can smell from the approaching street akin to a cheap perfume or fabric conditioner did not fill us with optimism. It reminded me of walking into a hollister or Abercrombie and fitch ..low lighting, young hip trendy staff and aftershave overload. The young gentleman who checked us in (pink hair) was very helpful and our room , whilst very small and minimalist , was immaculately clean and comfortable. There is no wardrobe or drawers for clothes, but the quirky hooks provided an area for hanging shirts and jackets. Not a lot of space for storing suitcases , but we were in the room basically to change , shower and sleep so it fulfilled its purpose for us. We did not encounter any of the internal noise problems described on other reviews, but did hear a few complaints from guests who were on lower floors 3-5 and higher floors 14-16. Our room was made up daily and we received daily clean towels and the room had the most fabulous shower ever. The bar area on the 2nd floor and the roof top bar were both great. We found the staff throughout the hotel friendly , helpful and polite and overall we enjoyed our stay. Probably wouldn't go back as we've been home in Scotland for 2 weeks now and I still can't get the cheap perfume smell out my nostrils! Turn the reception area music down a notch and get rid of the 'Abercrombie and fitch' vibe and you'd have a place that guests would flock back to.

When I say loud, I mean they leave earplugs in all the rooms. They have 2 clubs inside the hotel. The rooms are cool but crazy small. I could reach across the room. It was very clean and the staff was very nice but it is definitely a party hotel. Good location but be prepared for a party.

Went to the city as a single traveler and it was perfect. The rooms are designed very will given the space, spacious enough to chill out and recharge and small enough to make you want to get out and enjoy their programing layers they have on a daily basis. It was a bit noisy having a street-side room but nothing some complimentary ear plugs and free drink can help.

Positives were not easy to come across, hotel is modern and clean and in a great location, probably the only positives. It was apparent that reception staff had no idea what was happening, even though we had prepaid our room we had $1200USD of charges put on our credit card on arrival and no one could explain to us why or what they were for. We questioned this to be told it would be cancelled and removed within three days, OVER A WEEK LATER, it was removed. Upon checking out, we were informed $2000USD was outstanding on our account... not impressed, luckily this was resolved quickly thanks to the manager on duty.The hotel has a funky bar downstairs and rooftop bar upstairs, however, thursday through sunday it is very loud making for a difficult sleep, they even provide ear plugs in the rooms, perhaps sound proofing would be a better investment. We stayed for 6 nights and twice our room was not cleaned during the day. Overall the hotel is hip and funky, good for a dirty weekend or for somewhere to stay if you're going out late at night. Not very family friendly or for those who value sleep.

Love the cool, clever rooms, friendly staff, and awesome restaurants. It was great to have free fitness classes and game night too. Will definitely be back, as its quite a bargain and and excellent location.

Booked two rooms for a recent family trip to NYC. Got our 4 kids (13, 17, 20 & 25) a 4 bunk room. Really a unique hotel room---fun bathroom with a swimming pool motif (you need to see it). Not wildly impressed with the bar when we dropped in for a drink/snack upon arrival but definitely see why people like this place, I've never seen anything quite like it in NYC. Great location- - easy walk to theater district, PATH, Macy's.

First off, if you aren't a millenial or interested in small rooms, then this isn't the place for you. I am a millenial and decided to try the brand new Moxy hotel during my latest trip to NYC because I'm also a Marriott fan. The rooms were ergonomically designed and offered great storage options, considering there was no closet. Instead the bed had shelves underneath to store your luggage and shoes, and there were hooks on the walls to hand your clothes. The bar inside, and the rooftop bar, were equally impressive. Oh and did I mention the seafood restaurant there, called Legasea is the BEST?! If you want a totally upbeat and unique hotel experience, then visit the Moxy.

The Moxy has a new modern feel to it, maybe a little too unconventional for me. Newly remodeled hotel which appears to be aimed at a young crowd. Loud music in all the common areas all the time, even a 7:30am in the elevator on the way to breakfast. Rooms are on the small size, but pretty standard for NYC. I did not like the beds, too hard, maybe they are from IKEA? They did check my luggage for me while we went out waiting for our train for no cost, which was very nice of them. The hotel seemed to be trying too hard to be cool.

Trendy fun hotel in the heart of Times Square! Rooftop is amazing with great views of the Empire State Building. The staff is kind, fun and very helpful. The Legasea restaurant and Bar Moxy are super. All your needs will be met at this fun hotel in the Big Apple!

I was invited by concierge's Alex and Ro to game night last week!They know how to throw a fun party.I had the party’s signature drink in my hand within 5 mins of arriving.The games part was awesome, and the fact that almost everyone was super competition made it great!They even included other people at the bar, who also participated in the games and had a good time.Alex and Ro were talk about other creative ideas for future parties and I look forward to seeing what they do next!Best,Josh

Great hotel. People say its noisy, however if you do your research you can see that its meant to be noisy as it caters to a party crowd. Loved the size and configuration of the rooms. Small but furniture is very functional. Very clean. It was excellent
user_name:
ilimela0609
New York City, New York

review_body: The hotel is super cool and trendy. It has a fabulous bar and disco. I loved the vibey music playing as you enter the hotel and there is a lovely candy bar by the lobby. Alex was an excellent check in assistant. The hotel has all the modern needs, like usb ports, steamers etc but if you are not tech savvy this might be a problem. It is not ideal for a family, If you like an early morning there is no coffee maker but this is perfect for a weekend break with a girlfriend.

It's a very funky hotel in terms of decor and branding. Restaurants and Fun night club on site.. rooms are a bit smaller size but functional.Looking for spacious rooms.. Don't go there. Looking for silence and sleep.. Don't go there! Roof top club on Friday and Saturday nights is busy and happening.

When you get to room you notice 2 pairs of ear plugs next to phone. This is a clue to a MAJOR problem that hopefully is being resolved now.Imagine rehabbing a historic hotel and bringing up to modern standards but then leasing roof top to a disco without any regard to the impact of its noise on their 600+ room hotel. The present reality is that the disco operates to after 1 AM without any noise constraints and severely impacts most (all?) of the hotel rooms. The hotel appears to be in the process of replacing all the room windows with more soundproof versions, starting at the top floors. Will it work? Who knows? But unless you can confirm the upgrade was successful I suggest you avoid this place unless you have certain sleep disorders that let you sleep through any noise or which prevent you from sleeping until 2 AM any. Or unless you are a millennial who intends to party until 2AM EVERY night Just scan some of the bad reviews, an unusually large percentage, and you can see this is a bad problem. Otherwise it is a very promising hotel at a good price point. The rooms are small but well designed. It is a convenient location for visitors. Make sure you understand the room size, but the website is clear. We reserved an upgraded corner king size room, not the minimal size room and found the price reasonable.There was some mixup. The day before we came we discovered we needed a medication requiring refrigeration. We called the hotel and discovered that if a refrigerator was needed for medication, it would be provided for free. (Room has neither refrigerator nor coffee pot - unless most rooms these days.) But while we we assured at checkin that the fridge would arrive "in 5 minutes", it required 30 minutes and 2 more calls to actually get it!! Also considering how small the room was and the fact we only needed about 2 cubic inches, it was a rather large unit - a few cubic feet.In summary, a promising hotel. Most of the problems noted in earlier reviews seem under control, but unless the disco noise problem is solved quickly the big bucks spent on the rehab will go down the drain. A quick look at preview reviews shows that Marriott is now rapidly alienating many of its most loyal customers with this situation. Does this make sense?
user_name:
cjmike2016
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: The hotel is very clean, young, up-to-date in style and provides u great hospitality. The check-in was amazing, we were greeted by "Samson" (The over Night Manager) who provided amazing service and cared about all of my needs. He was very helpful and guided me throughout my entire stay on things to do! The staff were very helpful as well; with Samson help, he introduced me to the manager (Mickey) who handles amenities. She and her team did an amazing job setting the room up for my significant other, with rose petals, I had provided and writing on the mirrors to continue her scavenger hunt throughout the city. This hotel absolutely provides u almost everything in a very nontraditional way, which was fresh and exciting-Thank You Guys
user_name:
cheyoung2
New York City, New York

review_body: Finally got a chance to check out Moxy. It is a really nice and trendy hotel with great customer service. The checkin was fast and the team were friendly. The rooms had this really cool industrial theme. Even though they were small, the designer really thought about how to utilize the space. The art pieces were a fun touch too. Also, don't miss out on the rooftop the view of the Empire State Building is great!

I stayed at The Moxy the first night they were open. I've been back twice since. My last visit was for 5 days. They ARE suffering from some growing pains (getting coffee is always a challenge) but it's the best affordable hotel in the city. Yes, the rooms are small. . .but it's incredibly safe and clean. You don't feel like you're in a cheap motel. I'm a Marriott loyalist and this is a great place to earn points for pricier hotels! I LOVE that they offer fitness classes a few times a week on the roof top. They always save space for hotel guests. They also have an incredibly cute gym and you're 20 blocks (1 mile) away from Central Park if you're a runner (which I am). So, yes. . .they have some things to work out (room service would be another plus) but it's a funky and fun hotel and incredibly reasonably priced. Kids love it (bunk beds) but I wouldn't call it a "family hotel."

Had a blast at Bar Moxy. Amazing hotel, great restaurants. The rooms were very comfortable and the checkin process was smooth and easy. I got to play basketball in the lobby with the employees. What a cool new concept!

I stayed at the Moxy NYC Times Square for 3 nights this past week for a business trip.The price was right, but the reviews were not.....noise, size, customer service, noise.....So the expectation bar was pretty low.Here are my observations, relative to the other reviewers:1) Yes, the lobby is a little casual, and the staff do not wear Marriott-uniforms. But go to the kiosks/counters and a staff member is behind it, ready to help.2) Yes, the front desk staff members may be too casual.....particularly the 'posing' male staff member that check-ed me into the hotel. Almost putting on a non-chalant air. But all interactions with the check-in process are short and curt.3) No, I did not hear the rooftop bar or the 2nd floor bar from my 11th floor room.4) Yes, the rooms are small, even by NYC standards. Almost like urban camping, hostelling, or perhaps jail. BUT you know that going in.5) Yes, there are several bars/restaurants in and around Moxy.Overall, a great location just south of TimesSquare and a good, remodeled hotel.I'd go back for a short stay and recommend for a young family, or business traveler for a few days.Good job Moxy.P.S. The pressure and flow of the shower is among the best ever.

Everything you want in New York. Modern, trendy, great bars and night club. No hangups of big hotels. Just get on with it. Yes the rooms are very small but you're in New York. You shouldn't be spending time in your room! Would definitely book this again for the price. Location a little bit out of where we were expecting but hitting 20,000 steps a day more than made up for the big meals!

The room was unlike anything I have stayed in before but I absolutely loved it! The bed was beyond comfortable and the shower made me never want to leave! The first night we went to dinner at the restaurant Legasea. The food was dynamite! After dinner we went to Bar Moxy for a drink and ended up down in the lobby playing a fun and very intense game of connect four with one of the staff members. This is the hotel for you if you want to have fun! The staff went out of their way to get to know us and offer their assistance in any way we needed.

I have already stayed twice at Moxy in the past two months. The staff is very attentive and friendly, the rooms are very clean and well designed. There is a great restaurant as well as an extensive grab and go. I also love the location. Truly a gem of a hotel! I look forward to my next stay!

Really nice little place. Rooms are tiny but they’re used to the maximum. Not great if you’ve loads of luggage but you can make it work. Shower was incredible. Staff were friendly but not hugely knowledgeable about the local area, to the point we asked how to get the the airport and I got a confused answer. However, they did try. Nice bar and good fair priced food. Nice atmosphere too. Pokey, but fun.

This is not your usual hotel. It is Marriott's attempt to attract hip younger travelers. Although I am not in that category, I'd stay here again (just not in a room facing 7th Ave, as it was noisy). The rooms are tiny but comfortable. The table and chair are folding and hanging on hooks in the room. The bathroom has everything you need including counter space (something lacking in many NY hotels I've tried). The bed is on a platform and is extremely comfortable. Only issue was the noise. The bars and restaurants offer great food selections. The bar downstairs (I never made it up to the rooftop one) was very loud due to the DJ (but the music was great) and filled with people wearing black (LOL). The bartenders were super-friendly both eating at the bar in the restaurant and at the bar. I'll definitely stay again as it is convenient to my firm's New York offices and a good price point.

Room too small for a couple had to crawl along bed to get in no kettle in room Lucy we had our own tea bags and milk so just got hot water from bar no storage space suitcase had to sit on floor on top of each other just glass we only sleep there shower was nice I would not stay there again.

This hotel is cute and unique. The rooms are small, typical New York, yet they are funky and thought out. Table and chairs hang up on pegs, bathroom sink sits outside of the bathroom, beanbags for chairs. Some rooms have a lot of street noise but the employees are willing to help you and will move you to other room locations.They even have earplugs in the rooms. Employees are friendly and helpful. Marriott has knocked this brand out of the Hudson! I would definitely stay here again.

I stopped by The Moxy Times Square this past Tuesday for a few drinks with friends. Apparently they were holding a “game night” that evening and were very engaging inviting everyone to take part. What a blast! Alex and Ro were very gracious hosts and were able to be fun yet professional. The hotel itself is trendy, full of flavor and has excellent food. Highly recommend!
user_name:
Maverick21NYC
New York City, New York

review_body: This is a great new modern hotel. The design is fascinating. The rooms are very small but the space is brilliantly laid out. You have a surprising amount of space for your things even though the rooms are small. The customer service is good. I would like to compliment two of the staff members who were just really professional. The person who checked me in was Beatrice and she is a true professional. I later had to move rooms because I was on the 3rd floor just above the bar where loud music was playing. Jamal from the front desk came to my room with a new set of keys for a much more quiet room on a higher floor. He actually helped to carry my things up when I told him he did not need to. Great hotel, good location, and very good staff of professionals especially Beatrice and Jamal. I highly recommend this new, trendy hotel.
user_name:
ericbroyles
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: I absolutely love this hotel. The front desk team is friendly and greets you with a hello as you go about your day. The public spaces are beautifully designed - by day, a great place to work and meet clients...plenty of space with great wi-fi. At night, it buzzes with social activity. The on-site restaurants are a must see! Great food and service.The rooms are very well appointed. Just what you need to feel comfortable. The showers are outrageously fantastic! Loved the whole experience. Will definitely be back!

Last night, my last night, had dinner and came back to Hotel here i was invited by 2 workers Alex and Ro to attend a "game night" on second floor lounge. At first, i was only going to stop by for a drink and check it out.... ended up staying the WHOLE time. Great games (Moxy connect four, Heads Up, Jenga), Cool DJ and cocktails (house cocktail could be better) but the lounge and people were super nice and Alex was really into everyone participating (which was great!). I cant wait to come back, moving to the city next month and now i have a Tuesday nights after worked booked at The Moxy Game Night.
user_name:
micahfeliciano
New York City, New York

review_body: Since I've lived in NY all my life, I don't usually frequent hotels in the city, BUT I happen to be at Moxy often for their food and nightlife AND their #sweatatmoxy fitness program that they offer as a complimentary perk for those staying at the hotel and locals alike. During one of the #sweatatmoxy sessions that happen early am, I was so tired I forgot one of my sneakers behind! In true Prince Charming fashion, the hotel returned my sneaker for the next class. Very happy to have them as part of the NYC community.
user_name:
Stephanie C
New York City, New York

review_body: Moxy is great hotel for people that is Looking for fun, is young and out of the box. However if your objectives are rest, comfort and silence on your room won't work for you at all.Cons -Rooms does bot have closets and are really small- Cleaning staff limitated. Do not expect your room done unless you are staying 5 days or more including towels- Music is very load in the rooms as they have a great club on the roof- Strange and repetitive noises like tacs/tocs all night, day and afternoon- Lifts are very slow so takes you up to 5 minutes to get to thw lobby. And in rush hour could be more- Prices on food & drinks cost benefit are over rated: 7 usd for a cup of coffee & shot of tequila 17 USD- Most of the staff is amaizing but they do not care about the complaints if any, pretty good smile when they are listening thoughThere is not bad hotel, just different concepts. This one was not my cup of tea.

I have had the pleasure of using the open area at this hotel while I do work on my coaching business. I have had phone calls with my clients and am able to work in a nice comfortable and energizing environment. Staff is great My favorite work space in city. Love it.
user_name:
Christine R
New York City, New York

review_body: OK, you expect New Yorkers to be rude and loud, but from the loud and overbearing greeting in the lobby through the one dreadful meal experience to incredibly noisy rooms, everything about this hotel says 'they don't understand the business'. Maybe for 20-somethings and swingers this makes sense, but I would encourage people to (a) go elsewhere or (b) take their own high quality earplugs and (c) long suffering pills. We wont go back!

We really did love our stay at Moxy due to the great staff, location & proximity to all we were doing - seeing Hamilton & also traveling through the city, to Brooklyn a few times, and leaving from Penn Station at the end of it all. Funky hotel with odd art & a “Tiny Home” vibe with table & chairs hanging from the walls... which works... if you like that sort of thing! On our last day, we were able to leave our bags & pick them up on our way from broadway to the station within minutes easily - which made catching out last minute train easy & carefree!! A few off things: The bartender was perturbed when we brought the drink tokens, and literally poured a splash of prosecco for us. We tipped her well, and are sure this had to be as a result of ALL the tipless drink tokens she received daily. On our first night, the pipes next door burst, causing the elevators to be down (luckily we only had to walk up 8 flights of stairs), but also caused the fire alarm to go off at least five times after 11pm. This is not normal I’m sure, but was a major headache as we were very sleepy from our travel day!! Otherwise, highly recommend if you want a comfy bed & great staff in a central location to Times Square (without being IN the middle of it all).

The Moxy is an interesting and different concept hotel that appears geared toward the millennial demographic and for international travelers who desire an affordable stay in Times Square NYC. First the Good: The location is excellent, the rooms are very clean, the contain a large walk-in shower, Free Wi-Fi, and a large HD Smart TV at the end of the bed. Other highlights include a large social area on the mezzanine level (Fllor 2) with the Moxy Bar and games, couches, tables and their seafood restaurant. The fitness center is very good and of course, you can earn Marriott rewards. The Not So Good: This hotel is noisy. My first night the elevators kept me up all night - they were loud and rumbled - it sounded like a subway was going through the hotel every 10 minutes. Others I met complained about noise from the street and loud music from the roof top bar. They must be aware of this and that's probably why they included 2 sets of free earplugs in the room. The room is very small and laid out more like a dorm or hostel. There is no closet, but a row of hooks with a hanging folding table, chair and 3 hangers. And although the shower was large, the toilet was located in the same shower area with no separation. Finally, there is no desk - this is definitely not a business hotel. And just in case you were wondering, its certainly not a romantic getaway either. Its simply functional and funky.All in all, I enjoyed the innovative spirit of this hotel and I'm glad I tried it. But the noise levels, small rooms and lack of business amenities discourage me from considering a stay here again with so many other options in New York.

Have stayed at many of the Marriott AC properties and was hoping for something similar. Présentation À+ but when it comes to service nor so much. Presents as a. Place for Millenials. Maybe service is not a thing for The M generation. Love love love the concept but really hate having to beg for service. Like the idea of staff being accessible and friendly but there needs to be a balance. Bar staff having a 20 minute conversation with a couple of clients while the rest of the bar is waiting for service... really!Busy bar so a plus for lots happening but you have to pay attention to your clients.Will8I come back .. yes, but hope this great hotel potential gets a wake-up call re: who are your customers!

Great location. Lobby, halls and rooms were different from pretty much any hotel I've stayed at. Hip vibe throughout which worked for me but might not appeal to others. The rooms are real small yet well laid out and as others have mentioned plenty of hooks yet no closet. Everything is brand new. The cost of the stay was rather reasonable for NYC yet something has to give in return. Maybe the noisiest room, from the private carting trucks (garbage trucks) outside that I've ever had in my life. Faced 36th street. They kept coming from 11pm-12:30pm one after another to the different businesses adjacent to the hotel. I did ask for a quiet room when I checked in. Guess there is a reason they have earplugs in the room. They need to do something to soundproof the rooms from the outside and I live in an urban area. The 2nd floor bar and the lounge on the top were rather nice and the food above average with the drink tokens being a great touch. I would come back if I could have a half-quiet room.

The location is great and love the second floor area and bar. The rooms are not large but since there is so much to do in NYC you don’t need a big room. There are a lot of unique qualities to the hotel including the interior of the room and all the decorating around the hotel. I will stay there again for sure.

We arrived at this hotel on 15th December having taken a yellow taxi from JFK from Heathrow. We were greeted with a cocktail token and shown where everything was, mainly the bars which was excellent, we had a double room that faced out over 7th Avenue, with good blinds so people in the building opposite couldnt see in! We had a alre shower and a quirky bathroom area, the only drawback was the lack of closet space but they had a lot of hooks along the wall which we used. The rooms were cleaned every day, the hotel is in a smashing location and the staff couldnt do enough to help (including extra cocktail tokens when I was cold). the bar on the mezzanine was great and had a cool vibe and the rooftop bar was amazingly weird, we sat on a merry go round for about 4 drinks, and whilst the terrace area was closed due to it being winter I was still allowed to have a nose around. I would recommend this hotel, although perhaps not suited for people who like to be neat and tidy as chances are you will only have the hooks in your room and not a wardrobe. Great stay. We were also given ear plugs just in case the traffic was too noisy, TV was big - what more can I say

I have to say, reading some of the reviews on this site are somewhat frustrating considering the superb stay my partner and I had over the Christmas '17 period.It seems that a lot of people do not do their research before coming to stay at this hotel. Yes, the rooms are not huge and no, this hotel isn't a haven of peace and quiet, but it's New York - get over it!The room itself has all you need, whether it be for a couple of nights on business or a getaway to the big city. Space isn't the hotels selling point, but you soon get over it when appreciate how clean the hotel is and how great the location is. The shower was particularly pleasant, which incorporated the generally appeasing interior or the rooms and hotel alike. Fresh towels were provided daily, bedrooms redressed too. It would suffice to say that our expectations were exceeded for what was a 3-night Christmas getaway. Other highlights of the hotel included the bar area, of which you receive tokens for a free cocktail at the beginning of your stay. Again, keeping up with the trendy vibe of the establishment, the bar served as the perfect area for a drink or two before heading out to dinner. This must not be confused with the roof-top bar that is available to guests, but at a premium. We were quoted $100 entry per person, which we concluded was a hefty price, but saw the appeal had we decided to immerse ourselves in the local night life.In conclusion, we had a pleasant stay here. The Moxy Times Square is a cosmopolitan flare in very busy area of Midtown New York. It's simplistic, it's trendy, it's very a la mode. If you want serenity, a turndown service and a mint on your pillow then go and stay in Central Park - or maybe just don't stay in New York at all. It doesn't take a genius to figure out whether this hotel is going to be for you or not before you stay here - it's why reviews exist. We've already booked our visit for Christmas 2018 and we can't wait!

Wonderful new flagship hotel with a lot of fun elements. DJ in the evenings and a lively bar scene. The rooms are minimal, but efficient and very well designed. Great rooftop bar. The largest covered rooftop venue in NYC. I was there to scout it out for a corporate event and it’ll work. Contract is in the works. The restaurants are wonderful too. Can’t wait to go back. My 9 year old was with me and he LOVED the hotel too. So many whimsical spaces and lots of fun. This is Marriott’s newest brand, so you earn valuable rewards points too.
user_name:
WiFiPerJet
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: The atmosphere at this hotel is unmatched. Very modern and sophisticated. I loved that you receive a drink token when you check in! The only downside was the size of the room. For me, I was traveling by myself for work and it was ok, but for more than one person in the room, it could get tight!
user_name:
Meredith C
Mount Pleasant, South Carolina

review_body: Great hotel for a weekend in the city. The hotel has a great vibe. Great bar scene. The staff is fun and welcoming. Small rooms but very functional. If you are looking for a traditional hotel this place is not for you.

This ultra contemporary party-time hotel isn't for the family, business man, or someone that doesn't like music playing just about everywhere you went. Upon entering the hotel I looked for the check-in. The design there was different. Just a laptop on a pedestal. I liked the idea of the candy-cart in the entrance. Great candy thanks. The front desk clerk asked me if I wanted a quiet room. Ah, hello - of course I want a quiet room. The gym was great - lots of equipment The restaurant was expense and the food wasn't the best. Called Legasea and offering mostly sea food. I got the Tuna steak, and they stick tips. The best part of the dinning experience was the servers. Very friendly and helpful.The rooms were very small and I didn't have a desk in the room. There was no housekeeping service either. Which was very strange. Great shower though with the rainshower head.No closets in the room or desk of drawers. There are hooks on the wall to hang your clothes (and pillows?)

I could get over the small rooms even though I had to store part of my luggage in the bathroom. I'm not a picky traveller at all and I'm easy to please. However, it is currently 1:30AM on a Wednesday night and I have club music blaring into my room from the rooftop bar. It's an absolute joke to pay so much money for this type of experience. The hotel provides ear plugs (which is already a sign) but they do little to help. I like club music....when I'm at the club! But when I'm trying to get sleep, the last thing I need is reggaeton with a heavy bass flowing into my room. It is so intrusive that I have just turned up the TV because an infomercial is preferable at this point. Please think about your hotel guests who are paying hundreds per night. If you're going to have a bar blasting tunes, make it more soundproof or cut the music off by a decent hour (midnight).

Hotel is new and nice overall. Very trendy atmosphere and decor. No issues during our stay. Lobby and rooftop bars can get crowded, which ca be both good and bad. Rooms are small, but comparable to other NYC hotel rooms. We had a Queen room and it was fine for our weekend stay. My only wish is more hooks or something else to hang additional clothes. Check-in was efficient. They held our luggage so we could go explore since we arrived late morning. They also held our luggage on our check-out so we could go do activities since we had an evening flight. Overall - I’d stay there again.

The location is superb-- just a few blocks west of TS. It is compact, but very clean. As everyone else notes -bring earplugs ..If you can be flexible about space, you will be happy here. I will stay here again.
user_name:
maeera s
Salt Lake City, Utah

review_body: Stayed Dec. 7-10. Read the unfavorable reviews, but we are big fans of Marriott properties and thought we’d try it. Noisy, hot, tiny rooms. Thought we were urban camping. Couldn’t even walk around the bed - it went from wall to wall. And the “Playskool” furniture hanging on the wall - c’mon Marriott you can do better than this. The lobby was chaotic. Hard to figure out who to talk to or which desk to go to. The final straw occurred when we were leaving when the hotel staff wouldn’t call us a cab. We were told they could only call us their private cars. Expensive joke of a hotel.

rooms are very small but clean, no desk or workspace, breakfast not available til 730am, staff is enthusiastic but not kelpful knowledge-able ie told me 2x they would send someone to help with my wifi no ever showed and it never worked, this is a Marriott property and I am platinum member but will never stay there again, only good feature is the price but not worth the effort - shame on Marriott for this inferior product

When we arrived at the Moxy Times Square we were blown away with how kind and attentive the staff was. The staff was very knowledgeable about the area and gave us some great spots to check out during our stay! The T.V. and waterfall shower in the room was out of this world! I love the fact that I could hook up all my accounts (Netflix, Hulu, Pandora) to stream through the T.V. While you are there you have to visit Magic Hour the Rooftop Bar! The view of the Empire State Building does not get any better than that! We will definitely be back!

If you are travelling on business, and have hand baggage only, one clean shirt, and no overcoat, then stay here. So long as you have headphones that is. And don't stay for more than one night.Upon arrival our booking could not be found - and after 18 hours of travel, late at night, that isn't funny. Eventually - it appeared ! Don't know how !!Our room, 1402 had a double bed, which touched walls on 3 sides - no joke. That was the width of the room. The length was one and a half times longer - just enough room to drop a suitcase. So ......... suitcases were stored side on side next to the toilet, and loose clothes were stored on the 2 small shelves underneath the sink !Did I complain - yes - on the first night I phoned down and spoke to the duty manager and asked for a larger room, as we were in situ for 6 nights. I was told that the hotel was full that night, but slightly bigger rooms would be available the next day and that reception would contact us. They didn't - surprise eh !!So - next day, chased this up on the evening - no notes on record and no move available.At this point I knew that we were resigned to a week in something smaller than a prison cell. We survived. Will we go back ....... Nooooooooooooo!!!! Don't do it !!

Not Good, to noise and a lot of wannabes . There is a lot of better places around the area, but Nicky on the rooftop bar is beautiful, if that helps. Small rooms with no wiev and very noisy, you get earplugs for free.

So this hotel is what I would call a hipster hotel where if you don’t wear skinny jeans you might stick out a bit. I made the reservation after a recommendation from a colleague who had recently stayed there. Rooms, restaurant and bars are top notch. Some normal hotel things are a bit difficult to understand in this different style (e.g. how to get ice). They seem to be having major problems with the fire alarm where it will go off at random times and is very, very loud. In the many situations where it went off during my stay (4 AM, 10 PM, 11 PM, 12 N) they were all false alarms. It would probably been advisable that they explain this prior to check-in so that you know not to start fleeing the building when you first hear it If you are thinking of working from the hotel not all rooms have a desk. Mine had a lap desk that you could use in the bed. My stay was unexpectedly extended due to the Blizzard of 2018 and the hotel was kind enough to offer a reduced rate of $99 for that one night. Also, after I mentioned the inconvenience of the fire alarm they offered some Marriott Reward points. Certainly would have appreciated more of a proactive approach.

The hotel has a good concept -- only give you want you need, and don't give you what you don't need. They do it in a stylish way, service is very friendly and accommodating, and it's very good value for New York as long as you don't mind a very small (but trendy, efficient and clean) room. Restaurant is also very good. The main problem is structural: they have a club on the second floor and a club on the roof that play loud music well after midnight every night. Rooms have minimal soundproofing, and the front desk told me all rooms are noisy at night. In addition, on two of my three nights, there were loud false fire alarms at midnight, 1:00 am, 2 am, and 4 am! Don't stay here if you're on a work trip and need sleep.
user_name:
Joe E
New York City, New York

review_body: What a shame. This hotel has all the potential to be something amazing, however the lack of attention to detail is making this hotel a disappointment to guests.As the reviews shown below, we are all experiencing the same frustrating things- why are none of these being addressed when people are continually complaining about the same issues?The entrance hall smells like cheap perfume, there is lack of a personable experience (we thought we’d walked into a night club) and there was little explanation given on the whereabouts and what the hotel was about.We were warned about the noise as it was NYE - understandably so. HOWEVER, this was every night. I am a light sleeper and I have not had one full night sleep yet- whether from the lack of glazing on the windows (also makes it freezing) that amplifies the noise from outside of whether it’s the fire alarm that went of 5 times during our stay. The last 2 times the alarm went off no one reassured us that there was no issue. No one was clear on the instruction over the fire alarm- stupidly dangerous considering we are 14 floors up. Thank goodness we have no children is all I could think.We are a young couple (what the hotel is aimed at) and the quality is not up to standards. Although the shower is powerful, it’s luke warm. Sink water is hot- so they’ve obviously turned it down to save costs. Room was sometimes cleaned, depends if they could be bothered it seemed and again the noise is unbearable.It’s a pricey hotel- with hostel like attributes and is honestly not worth wasting your money.To end it on a high- location is fab and the hooks on the wall are pretty cool.What a shame moxy- doesn’t seem like this year is going too well.

I traveled to NYC with my two daughters and my niece the week before Christmas. Our special overnight in Manhattan was spent at the Moxy. I was not thrilled from the moment I walked in. The strong smell of perfume smelled like I was in a Victoria's Secret store and someone had broken a few bottles of their signature cologne. Although it may not bother some, if you are prone to migraines, it is not good. We tried to check in around 3, but our room wasn't ready. When we finally checked in, our room was on the top floor. When I got off the elevator, I almost had a panic attack since the hallway was so narrow and I felt trapped being so high up. Upon entering the room, I called and asked if we could be moved to a lower floor. I was told that was not possible. The layout and cleanliness of the room were fine for a one night stay. However it was very noisey and not good for anyone looking to relax. The price for this hotel was extremely inflated for Christmas week and I feel like I was totally ripped off. Surprised that this is a Marriot property.

Save yourself the hassle and book one of the many other hotels near Times Square. We stayed here over the New Years, which wasn't cheap, and ultimately staff customer service is diabolical and they almost go out of their way to ensure difficulties. (I cannot speak on behalf of all staff, just the many I encountered)- no concierge or welcoming, just a quick check in, given key card, and a brief explanation of how to use the confusing elevators. Staff do not where uniform so it's a guessing game of who works their and who doesn't.- no wardrobe, no mini bar, no room service (not even for water), very small rooms (quite cosy and reasonable clean) - rubbish view of the building opposite for majority of rooms (always a cold breeze by the windows)- I'd recommend sleeping in your coat as the heater in the room is unbelievably loud, and wakes you up every 2 hours (unless the fire alarm does which occurred 3 out of our 6 nights here) let's just say I'm glad it was a false alarm as relying on the staff here in an emergency situation is scary as they had absolutely no idea how to handle it.. or stop it ! - beds are quite comfy, only one pillow, however when I rang to ask for our sheets to be changed the unhelpful lady informed me that the hotels policy is to change bed sheets and towels every SEVEN DAYS ONLY. Never stayed in a hotel with this policy, and alternatively you can go to the store cupboard and sort it out yourself ...- we booked this hotel as the New Years package on the roof top looked good, however when trying to purchase tickets no staff members could help. When any issue arises staff members fob you of from one person to the next person to the manager to the third party.. so on and so forth.. we were told we had to pay $250 each, plus VAT, plus $60 ticket fee, when we later found out other individuals paid $110 each. Hotel members should have supposedly got 10% off these tickets, however this didn't happen. Matt and Zach, probably the only two helpful staff members in the entire building eventually, after 3 stressful days got us tickets at $195pp. We also never received and confirmation from the hotel regarding check in or check out or any hotel information at all.Ultimately - I understand this hotel has recently opened, and they may still be finding their feet.. if you just want to solely sleep here, it is more than adequate, but for any assistance what so ever, research other hotels. (Including a request for toilet paper - which after 4 phone calls arrived 5 hours later! )

I am a Platinum Elite Member with 98 Marriott stays in 2017. I took my wife and two children for a week to NYC and stayed at the Moxy as it was new, next to Time Square, and looked fun for all of us. I have never complained at a Marriott property in my 15 years of constant travel.This was the worse experience of our travel (Hotel Only) lives. Two nights in a row the fire alarms went off and we evacuated with our children who were so scared we could barely get them to come back up to the room. The manager the first night said it was something in the boiler room. The second night she said maybe something in the kitchen, at 4:30 AM?? My daughter lived in fear all night and all day of being trapped on the 6th floor in a fire, that was a traumatic experience for her and one we won't forget. No empathy from the staff, just no big deal.Both of our windows leaked and a 5 degree wind whipped through our room. When you turned the heat on it became a sauna. It was just a hot mess. None of the 4 of us could connect to the wifi so had to use all of our data plan while we used our devices in the Hotel. I complained and they said they were working on it.... They never offered to send an engineer up to help.We started taking the stairs down due to being trapped in an elevator in case of a fire, fire alarm. Once we got to the bottom of the stairs and two gentlemen in suits told us we weren't allowed to use the stairs...??We asked for bottled water at check in and they said sure since its part of being a platinum elite member. We were told they were out and each day after that they said they would get us some but each day they were out.Day 3 our room did not get cleaned and I called the front desk and they said they would have someone right up. We left for Central Park and had to be back at 4pm to shower and get ready for dinner and a Broadway Show. Nobody cleaned the room. No towels and wash clothes....Day 5 nobody cleaned our room. I called the front desk and was told they would send someone right up. 30 minutes later I called a manager and she said she didn't know why they told me they would send someone right up, all of the cleaning people left around 2pm. She said I could go to the Stash closet and get some towels. I found the Stash closet and it was empty.... and on and on...At breakfast in the Hotel I interrupted the Hostess on her cell phone texting, and asked for a NY Times or any paper. Instead of her helping me she said I needed to go down to the front desk and they will give me one. I left breakfast and went to the front desk. They told me I would have to go down the block and try and find one as they don't have papers and I should just use the apps! December 30th I stopped in the lounge to reserve a table and seats for the 4 of us for a New Years Eve event. I was told by the bartender to find the manager and he would help me schedule it. She didn't call the manager or help me find him just told I would have to find him. There was nobody at the bar... I found the manager and he told me that the bartender was wrong and I needed to contact a third party across the street to reserve a table for the event. Instead of him calling his contact he had me go get a pen and paper and he got me the name and number. I called the 3rd party across the street and they told me they don't handle reservations for that event and I had to discuss with the lounge and manager! Dec 31st we went down and asked to get car service to LaGuardia Jan 1st at 9:30am. The gentlemen that handles that brought out his binder with fee schedules and on the front of the binder in bold it stated LaGuardia was $55 from the Moxy. A large van cab was $35-$40 so no big deal. We agreed on $55 and booked it. The car service showed up on time and we loaded up. The driver said he would be right back and went inside the Hotel. He came back out and said the price was now $65. I stormed in and got the guy and his binder. We opened it up and saw our reservation. He had taken a pen and changed $55 to $65 poorly. My wife was right behind me and she handled this one as professionally as she would have at this point. Someone was just getting an extra kick back of $10, no big deal, but it was for some reason to us.i would never write anything like this but I am writing a letter to Marriott corporate and Bill Marriott himself. I don't know if he will ever get it but I am compelled. I stood in the little lobby full of new people checking in and told the manager this was not a Marriott and in no way do they reflect the values and culture or what Marriott is. I would strongly advise picking any other Hotel to stay at.Scott FairmanBettendorf, Iowa

New property with unique lobby & check-in process. Staff was very friendly, attentive & accommodating. The room was perhaps a little too quirky for my taste - small & industrial to a degree. The size is comparable to a European hotel room. In our room, two to a bed meant that one of us (me) had to crawl across tom their spot as there wasn't walking access to the other side of the bed. Closet space was mostly hooks on the wall. Nice, clean and safe spot if Times Square is a convenient location for your travels. If we had stayed more than one night we would have wanted a larger room. We literally spent 5 hours in the room and caught an early flight out.

We stayed there with our 2 children, and we loved it. It suited us well for why we were there. The person at the front desk John was a highlight of our stay as how friendly and helpful he was. The place is new and everything worked well.

We booked this before it opened so didn't know what to expect.Check in process OK; quirky lifts explained so don't understand the other reviews.Positives:Location is very good, close to Times Square and Empire State Building.Bar on 2nd floor airy and spacious.Industrial style decor.Free earplugs.Good shower pressure.Housekeeping good.Free, fast wi-fiNegatives:The smallest room I have ever stayed in (a caravan at Skegness was bigger than this).Bed crammed in on 3 sides.Air-conditioning unit is as loud as a jet engine which starts up every 2 hours or so! Even when switched off you can hear the units in other rooms!Nightclub on the roof goes on to 4am, noise penetrates the bedrooms.Quirky lifts which at peak times became a joke - please just have normal lifts!Didn't try restaurants or gym so can't comment.I'm a light sleeper, so won't stay here again.

I visited the Moxy while on a tour for the boutique hotel convention as I am in the process of developing a boutique hotel in Canada. In an effort to make certain I understood the ethos or vibe they were going after, I booked 3 nights with my kids. This in my mind would represent a “worse case scenario” trial. Here is my take away from the 3 nights. First a quote from Bill Bullard so people understand that trip advisor, when in the wrong hands can ruin a business. ...”Opinion is really the lowest form of human knowledge. It requires no accountability, no understanding.
