The highest form of knowledge… is empathy.”Yes this is my lowly opinion.I now know for certain, that despite whatever psychological studies have been done about lobbies, second floor lobbies, making the transaction part of the stay less memorable and the lobby more memorable by separating them on two floors is just a pile of bla bla bla. When you enter a hotel that is chasing that hipster dollar and trying so hard to be different, you still need a door man. Someone to open the door. Period. No name tags, I get the pragmatic approach but at least introduce yourself at check in to customers. First impression... I now get the weight of that concept. Walk in, there is no bell man, door man or lobby for that matter. The cool and warm lobby is on the second floor...which you will miss if you are a normal human being that wants to shower after getting off a flight. From the ground floor straight up to the room is generally what I witnessed. The tokens they give you at check in I suppose are meant to lure you back down. I stayed all over Europe and struggle to understand why a youth hostel is cool now. In a hostel, the bathroom is in the hall to save space. I would not have ruled that option out completely here. Yes, it was unbelievable how noisy, yes the windows seemed to somehow amplify the noise into your room. It is true, room comes with earplugs; even as a 20 something university party goer...I still slept. So don’t tell me I’m too old to stay here, if I was 25 and out till 2 I’d still need to sleep at some point. This place seems to pride itself on its party theme and the hotel that never sleeps. Success if that’s what they were after. The HVAC in the room is totally and completely absurd. It is ether a total ice box in the room or a hot mess. There is a brief ten minutes in between where you will find comfort as it “automatically” cools and heats to find the temperature you’ve set it for. The room:The entire hotel seems to have ripped a page out of ikea. There is a point where pragmatic, or utilitarian becomes sterile or useless. The bathroom sink is in the room to cleverly save space...so you can watch your wife brush her teeth. The shower and toilet are combined, so she can watch you void the days edibles. There is room for a partition between the shower and the toilet which would have been terrific. Here’s why...The shower head, which is an incredible rain type fixture that distributes an amount of water that would make Noah nervous. HOWEVER, the temperature maxes out where infants are safe. Technically warm, but arguably so. Therefore, had there been a partition rather than a 50 square foot shower-toilet...you wouldn’t shiver while using the body wash on your hair. (Yes, no shampoo, just body wash-shampoo in one) Things like that, and no hangers for certain sweaters and shirts I now know will only make people angry on a different level. The room is totally hard surfaced and in the absence of a top sheet on the bed, just makes for a cold experience outside the temperature connotation. Alex the manager gave a nice tour, seems to be someone my team would love to work for. Very approachable and affable guy. In the world of social media and data crunching and VIPs and all that cool manipulation of the herd I can only make one suggestion for you. As a manager, look through the eyes of a customer. Read all the terrible complaints about the noise and see that your cut and paste form letter response is read by the average customer. Hotel goers don’t read the sterling reviews, they read the terrible ones to see what to look out for. What customers are seeing is that you are running out of things to say and you’re busy. I can assure you people, I got a good read on this manager, he cares...but when there are this many complaints and the construction is done, he doesn’t get paid enough to take this many bullets for his crew. Marriott should give Alex a raise or move him on up, he has paid his dues.

Such high expectations for this hotel. Looked amazing for a young couple but sadly I was mistaken. Start on a good note, the staff were really friendly & upgraded us when we arrived which was really nice. The room was spacious, we were upgraded to the Queen room. Great location aswell, 4th time in New York so know my way around but this was in the perfect location for newbies! However there was no storage space, no cupboard or shelves only coat hooks and a small hole under the bed. So sadly had to live out our suitcases the whole week, which was messy and took up the floor space. The windows were far to thin, the draft coming through was so cold & the noise from the street was like you were standing on the sidewalk. Not to mention we were woken up with the music coming from the rooftop bar early in the AM, we were on the 7th floor so would have hated to have been further up. The fire alarm went off at around 10.30pm & I feel the staff should be trained on how to properly action the announcement advising they were investigating the alarm, it was like they didn't know how to work it and it was more frustrating than the actual alarm. It then went off again 2 nights later at 4.30am & the same again, most frustrating situation. End on the only other good points, the bed is very comfortable. Sadly wouldn't stay again, I am 24 and really thought this hotel would have been amazing but unfortunately not & even though New York is the best city in my eyes, I couldn't wait to come home to get a good night's sleep!

Stayed here in mid-December 2017 with wife and two kids (8 and 12). I chose the Moxy because of the location (ideally situated between MSG and Times Square), as well as the fact that the hotel offered the unique option of a room with four bunked twin beds (which allowed our kids to not have to share a bed, a big treat for them for a hotel room). We arrived to a nice but fairly minimalist lobby where friendly staff greeted us, and checked us in at small podiums. The whole hotel is brand new, modern, and clean, and has a nightclub feel to it. We arrived about an hour before the standard check-in time, so we were encouraged to head up to the 2nd floor bar/lounge area to relax while our room was being prepared. There was comfortable seating and some games to pass the time. The first odd hospitality experience came when my wife and I decided to order a drink while we waited... my wife ordered a Moscow mule, and I ordered the IPA on tap, and we were told that they were out of both ginger beer as well as the IPA, so they couldn't serve either drink we ordered, which was odd for a bar to be 0 for 2. We also noticed that the large cushion on the back of one of our chairs had sex scenes pictured all over it, which I didn't personally care about, but wasn't appropriate for my kids to be staring at.When we went to our room, along the hallway, we saw several nearly nude mannequins posed in a holiday scene in the center of the building. (Again, not a huge deal, but a little odd to walk the kids by.) When we arrived in the room, it was nice, had some really unique design, and was on the small side but not unheard of for NYC. The bathroom/shower had a glass wall separating it from the main sleeping area, which didn't seem terribly private. The biggest issue was that the room was frigid, blowing cold air from the A/C, and the thermostat was not allowing us to heat the room. We made multiple calls to have it fixed, and were told each time that help was on the way, but after not getting any help, they finally moved us to a similar room on another floor. I later had to request extra pillows to elevate my leg due to a knee injury I was traveling with, and we again had a lengthy wait and multiple calls before someone arrived.I did not experience the noise issues others mentioned, but I did see that earplugs were provided in the room, so it may depend on room location.Overall, the good:+ Great location+ New and clean+ Good value, relatively reasonable cost per night for the area+ Unique design+ Friendly staffNegatives:- Spotty service (will hopefully improve as hotel is more established?)- Theme is more adult-oriented, and while fine in general, obvious that they are not catering to the family/young kids crowd

Repeatedly poor service, from check in through to housekeeping. Woman who checked us in clearly had better things to do - no explanation of elevator use, facilities, wifi or anything important we needed to know, really. Arrived to the room which had dirty sheets. It’s okay, my partner and I said to each other - we’ll let this one slide, and then the next day housekeeping will come in and fix it. Housekeeping still is yet to appear.We are actually staying here right now - our third night of seven while in NYC. It’s important people see reviews while guests are actually staying there - not after stay after thoughts. We have approached reception staff twice to complain about dirty sheets, no housekeeping for three days as well as towels that need to be changed (among other things).The first woman couldn’t be less helpful - no apology, didn’t even break a sweat at her desk. The second man was very apologetic and said he would look into it. After the second man looked into it, around 20 minutes later a member of staff came with one fresh sheet, an extra blanket and towels. “Can you please change the sheets?” we asked - “No, I’m only doing the delivery. We only have one housekeeping person for the whole hotel. She’s very busy”. Busy doing very little it seems.What we then came to realise was that housekeeping actually HAD come to our room. We knew this as we checked out the trash can in the bathroom, which had been emptied (and definitely not by us). Please check the photos we have attached to show you her bed making skills.The ‘hot’ water in the room is not ideal, especially when it’s -10C outside. The air conditioner could wake up a hibernating bear, and we really didn’t appreciate the fire alarm going off at 3:30am on our second night there, to then be bombarded with ridiculous voice overs from hotel staff who clearly (a) had no idea what was going on, and (b) have no idea how to manage situations like this. Fire alarms happen, but the way it was handled was a joke.This is not a cheap hotel (unbelievably part of the Marriott chain) - and my partner and I have both lived overseas for a long time, as well as travelled to numerous countries. There’s a difference between error and incompetence. Clearly MOXY abide by the latter.Do not stay at this hotel - NYC is a big place and I’m confident another place will appreciate your investment into their business much, much more.

CHRISTMAS IN NEW YORK!!!!An amazing hotel advise anyone to stay there cant fault the location! in between Madison Square Garden and Times Square!we used the Air-Train and the Subway to get from JFK Airport to the Hotel and it took us straight to Penn Station (underneath Madison Square Garden)Great welcoming when we arrived into the hotel and got 2 free cocktails at the 2nd floor bar (shame it was a specific drink) but free! AMAZING..... GREAT FOR THE YOUNGER MARKET!

Check in: Arrived late and were greeted by welcoming, helpful and polite staff who checked us in very efficiently and explained the general workings of the hotel.Room: Our room was on the 15th floor, a Queen sized bedroom. The bed was really comfy, shower amazing and climate control which was wonderful. There is no wardrobe but a unique hanging system on the wall which my wife loved. We didn’t have any noise issues.Bar Moxy: Not the usual hotel bar. Quite lively with a DJ playing some cool retro tunes...so we felt right at home. Good fun.Rooftop Bar: The Magic Hour cool setting with great views of The Empire State Building.Restaurants: Legasea a must, we didn’t try Egghead.Location: Great location in the heart of the city. We pretty much walked everywhere, so returning to the comfort of our room made for a memorable holiday.NYC is an exciting destination and The Moxy Times Square is an exciting place to stay.

I don’t usually write reviews, but since this is a new hotel and I haven’t seen any reviews from families with younger kids (ages 10 and 8), reviews of the bunk rooms, or reviews from people staying for more than a few days, I wanted to share my experience. We chose this hotel because 1)it’s a Marriott and 2) my kids saw the bunk beds and begged to stay here. We were there for a week. The location was great. Just a few blocks from Times Square, Bryant Park, and even Rockefeller Center. The subway station was just down the street. When I was researching, I saw alot of reviews on how small the rooms were and the noise level. So, I was trying to prepare myself. First, I am a super light sleeper, so anytime we travel and stay in a hotel, I always sleep with earplugs, so this part wasn’t anything new to me. However, I was worried about my kids being able to sleep, so a few weeks before our trip, I called the hotel and told the lady (she was super nice and accomodating, by the way) my concerns and she said don’t worry, I have already booked you a corner room in the middle of the hotel and have already issued you a room number. And, sure enough, she did! I was able to sleep fine every night without any noise issues. My kids were also able to view the street below from our room, which they enjoyed, especially on the day it snowed. The staff was also very friendly and accomodating. One of my kids pushed the do not disturb button by mistake, so one day we didn’t have clean towels. I went downstairs to ask for some and they had dropped them off before I made it back to the room. My kids enjoyed the little candy cart they set up in the lobby for a little while each night. The room was quite small, the other reviews are pretty accurate on that. We had 2 big suitcases and 3 carry ons (because winter and a weeklong stay). It was pretty tight with all that. I tried to hang as much as possible on the hooks. Our suitcases took up all the space in the little entry nook. I stored our shoes in the little cubbies under the beds. But, there just wasn’t much moving around room. We were basically only in our rooms at bedtime, so we managed. One thing that I did not like is that the bathroom isn’t very private. The doors are sliding frosted glass doors. I could see anyone who was sitting on the toilet (not like regular glass, but pretty well). I wish the bathroom would have had solid walls for privacy. However, I did LOVE the shower head! I wanted to stay in there forever! One other thing that was disappointing was that there was no refrigerator, so we couldn’t bring back leftovers. I knew this beforehand, so it was just something we dealt with. Overall, this was a fun and pleasant hotel. We had a great experience here and would stay again (maybe not for a week, or maybe during warmer months where we don’t have so many clothes to pack). My kids loved it!

I like this hotel. I got a good rate and booked one of the twin rooms. It actually ended up being one of the larger versions and I will say it was exactly right for what I needed. It was modern, clean and I slept great. The vibe of this property is pretty cool and everyone was friendly. The one small con is how loud the room was. Granted, the building is in a very busy area, but those windows let lots of noise in. Overall this is a nice hotel that removes the frills and extras of classic hotels in favor of a smaller, but more efficient and modern property.

We have just returned from a 4 night stay over Christmas arriving on the 23rd December.Location - The Location of this hotel is Fabulous! If you are looking for a hotel that is in a central location close to everything then this hotel is perfect! It is on the doorstep of Times Square, Empire State and Madison Square Garden! We walked everywhere and even down to Battery Park which was a brilliant walk that took about 1hr 10 Minutes! There is a subway station only a few hundred yards from the hotel. We were so glad of the location being slightly away from Times Square as it's just pandemonium there! The hotel - is a new hotel and only opened September 2017 and that is apparent through the hotel as everything is new and clean. On approaching the entrance to the hotel there is loud music being pumped out onto the street which I still cannot understand the reason for! As you enter the loud music continues in the lobby however you are greeted with the most amazing smell which turns out to be Moxys own scent that's blown through the lobby. There is no reception desk, it's six white stands where the staff book you in on a laptop. The staff are very welcoming on entry but none of them wear a uniform it's just their own clothes! Check in was simple and we were given a Queen Room facing the front of the hotel on the 10th Floor. The lift key operates the elevator for security so even if there is a waiting lift you can't get into it without pressing your floor and scanning your key as the lifts only stop at the floors where keys have been scanned! It's very simple to do but can be a nuisance when you are carrying things and your key isn't always handy! Room - PLEASE READ CAREFULLY if you are booking this hotel! If you are travelling MORE than 1 person and have more than 1 Bag DO NOT book a standard double room it is TINY! The Queen Room was only big enough for 2 of us as we were there for only 4 Days and only had 1 suitcase! There is nowhere to store your suitcase in the room and only enough room and hangers to hang up 2-3 pieces of clothing on the wall! Our room had a massive bean bag in the corner and to be honest we would rather it wasn't there so we had somewhere to put our case rather than it being in the middle of the floor! The sink is in the room outside the bathroom. The shower in the room is the best Iv ever been in, the rain shower pressure is just amazing and after walking about all day it helped the aching muscles!! I said I feel that is hotel is confused, well here is why...... We are both in our mid 30's and on arrival there was loud music being played out to the street??? I felt like I was approaching a city centre Night club in the 2000's and that's also what the sign outside looked like! On entry to the lobby it was like entering a nightclub, we liked it but could see others entering wondering what they had just checked into! There are men standing about the elevators in black coats exactly like you would see in a nightclub so again it feels like a niteclub experience every time you enter and leave the hotel! We were able to hear the music being pumped outside the entrance to the hotel in our 10th floor room till about 2-3 am AND the nightclub on the roof till about 4am! Moxy there is no need to be playing music out to the street after 8pm as you should be considering your guests who may wish to relax in their rooms, yes there may be traffic noise from the street however we expect that in NY! The night club on the roof is also having an effect on your guests with the noise till 4am and mostly being attended by NON hotel guests.The Moxy is a fabulous hotel and lovely inside however in my honest opinion guests getting a good nights sleep is clearly not high up on the list of the hotels prioritys and that's why I say that this hotel is confused as to what it is supposed to be. It's simple things that need to be addressed to be more guest focused rather than making the place a party Palace all the time.

As a family of 3 we stayed at The Moxy in NYC. There were 3 of us (mom, dad and adult child) staying 4 nights. This newer hotel has a great location (7th Ave and 36th St.) for anyone wishing to be near Macy's (1 1/2 blocks away), or near Penn Station which provides Metro or LIRR service. You are only blocks away from 42nd St and Times Square. Loved the location. Our room was very small with a lofted bed for the 3rd person (steps to the lofted bed are very steep and that bed was hard). The double bed was pretty comfortable but because the head of the bed tucks under the loft be aware that you may easily knock your head if you are not very careful! Rooms have different configurations from the one that we chose ... We needed enough space for 3 people and as I said the room was really small. There is no closet but many hooks on the wall. There is no frig or microwave. The sink is located within the room (not in the bathroom). The bathroom was ok and the shower was hot (watch your step into the shower as it is a definite step down). There is a room called "the stash" where you can go to get extra linen or towels, etc. which was nice. You need your room key card to access the elevator from any floor including the lobby which is an interesting safety measure which I did get to like (no buttons to push in the elevators). 4 elevators were very quick. Staff were young and personable and very happy to help. This hotels has a rooftop bar area which opens at 4 pm and stays open late -- definitely attracts the under 50 crowd! The second floor of the hotel houses a large lounge area, a bar, a restaurant and food available for purchase. This hotel has a boutique atmosphere although there certainly were families that stayed there.

The Moxy is a fun hotel, but the rooms are a little cramped. My hotel room was adequate although the bed, boxed in on both sides, was a clear meter from the back wall which made it very difficult to close the blinds which were behind the bed head (and was a rather strange waste of space in a reasonably small room). I had to almost fall over the back of the bed to close them down. Checkin was very straight forward and in fact they let me check in early which was kind. It is a reasonably modern place - a bunch of mini desks with staff sort of milling about so it’s difficult to know where to wait before getting someone’s attention. Also, I did have an interesting exchange about there location of a place for breakfast - clearly there is no place within the hotel for breakfast but despite asking several times, this was not made clear until the third request! It’s fine, just say so and point in the right direction for the closest diner. I’m all for the modern cool hipster hotel but there is a reason that the usual front desk check in system has worked for years with orderly lines and an obvious system. Look, it served its purpose, but I think some of the bells and whistles are just that.

This is an upscale hostel with a first class lounge area. The food and staff were excellent. The location was great. The hotel was fun and we stayed over Christmas...7 of us, two young people. We spent Christmas morning in the lounge with our gifts and our cut out tree (one of us is a kindergarten teacher. ). The staff were fabulous.Thanks so much

First impression I was worried what we’d let ourself in for. Really disappointed that there wasn’t really a Christmas decoration for our entire stay (we left on Christmas Eve...), but I can get over that. The bed was amazingly comfortable, though the first night sleep was disturbed by a lamp under the bed on a sensor which I managed to turn off for the second night as it kept randomly coming on. The room is cosy and it was exactly as expected - we had a queen room and loved it! Loved the whole feel of the room itself! One of the reasons we booked was for the rooftop bar as it seemed really appealing - but as per my review for the bar the staff were so rude it left a lasting impression on the Moxy brand for me which is quite bitter. The location is good (there’s a Dunkin Donuts right next door too!) and even though it’s not the quietist (but where is in NYC?!) the sleep was great and there are ear plugs provided if you want them! Disappointed at the lack of effort for the festive period, and for the rooftop bar - but other than that, we had fun!

We completely enjoyed our stay. One room with bunk beds and the other was a king room. Such a cool hotel. Great common areas. Staff was amazing, especially Vincent at the front desk. We had NO problems with noise. So good, we are going back In December!!!!!

I have stayed at over 30 hotels in NYC and this was one of the worst experiences I have had. I mainly stay at Marriott properties. Cool/fresh looking hotel with a great location but very noisy with both the street noise and from the rooftop. Also I sent my cleaning in the first night (19-21 Dec) and asked where it was the next evening only to find out it was not sent out. The manager said she would clean it herself (it was my uniform) and she did but the pants are now falling apart since she washed them in a machine. I was trying to sleep early and could not because of the noise and eventually had to move to another room. It was better without the DJ in my room from the rooftop but still a lot of street noise. I guess my experience would have been better had the staff seemed to care about my problems. They did not and I will not stay here again.

My lady, best friend and I stayed at the Moxy for a brief visit for Sneaker Con and I was very impressed with the presentation of the hotel, as well as the service provided by the friendly staff. I'd like to thank Anthony and Vincent (Night Audit) for taking the time to share information about local attractions and also being kind enough to grant me a late check-out. It definitely came in handy! I'd also like to thank Destiny, as well as her fellow associates (I didn't get their names, but one assisted Destiny as I checked in again the following day and another served us candy from a cart) for the genial service and information about the hotel's amenities. The candy and cocktails from the bar upstairs were LEGIT; so big thanks again to Destiny and crew. All in all, I had a PERFECT experience at the Moxy and will definitely return the next time I visit New York. Thanks Guys,Calvin P.

This place was really different from other places we've stayed. Was going to see "Elf" at MSG, so it's a few blocks away. From the initial entrance, the vibe of the hotel was great. The staff super friendly. The only thing I wasn't a fan of was the strong smell (wasn't bad), just a strong fragrance that hit you. You get a free drink token on check in, (doesn't have to be used for an adult beverage, although we did). Overall feel of the hotel in general was modern, and trendy. The access to the rooms with the elevator is secure using your room key for access. The rooms are really cool, but on the smaller side. Didn't really matter to us, cause everything you needed in a traditional hotel room was there, and made the most of the space provided. The only draw back is that it could be noisy, but it's expected when you're on located on 7th Ave. in NYC. They do provided ear plugs in the room as well. Overall, definitely recommend staying here if you're trip takes you to the mid-town, times square, theater district. You can't beat that price. Saw young couples, as well as families staying there. They are also pet friendly.

We arrived in the late evening, and could see a huge queue for the rooftop bar as we walked around to the lobby entrance. It is clearly a very popular spot, even on a Tuesday. There was fairly loud music playing immediately outside the entrance, but this was much more reasonable in the lobby and in the lifts. Check-in was very fast, and we were quickly up to our room. The rooms are small even by New York standards, but the bed is very comfortable, the TV was perfectly placed for watching in bed, all of the power sockets had convenient dedicated USB slots and the monsoon shower was one of the best I've ever had!Walking distance from Penn station and very competitively priced, well worth a visit for a short NYC stay.

I made an appointment to see the rooms with the possibility that I can stay there one night after work when my husband comes into town. The rooms were small but perfect for the travelers that need a place to lay their head down. They also offer hourly rates for those who need a quick afternoon delight.... The staff is friendly and the interior is unique. I think you would be comfortable staying there considering it is conveniently located in the heart of Manhattan without all the crowds and characters as if you were staying in Times Square.

On the positive side, the hotel is brand new, impeccably clean and modern. There is a terrific bar area on the 2nd floor where you can have drinks and snacks while lounging in comfy sofas. The location is a prime spot in midtown, walking distance to the Theater District, Times Square and 34th Street shopping area, without being close to the grittiness of Port Authority. The staff is friendly and helpful. You can get a room with 2 sets of bunkbeds, which my college-aged kids liked a lot.But this is not a typical Marriott property. It seems to be Marriott's answer to minimalist-style hotels, such as The Pod and Yotel. The rooms are very small. There are no closets or dressers. You'll find some drawers under the bed and hooks lining the walls, as well as a beanbag chair, and a trendy folding table and chair. There is no coffee in the room. If I had been here for business, I would have been typing in my bed. The bathroom door and shower wall are glass with some kind of screening within the panels to obstruct a clear view. Even so, my kids did not feel is was sufficiently private (and the slider to the bathroom did not fully close, leaving a small crack - maybe a half inch - that others could see through).Our room was very noisy due to the combination of the rooftop bar (which Marriott can help) and the street (which it can't). The Moxy brand, in general, tries a little too hard to attract the Millennial crowd. A promotional add on the TV shows people making out in elevators and a smiling woman grabbing a man's buttocks in a bar. Even my Millennials rolled their eyes.

Had all the good qualities of a Marriott - friendly people, amenities, good location and clean. No complaints. It did try to be a little to hip for my liking but bear in mind I am about as un-hip as you can get. The rooms were smallish but nice, the shower was bigger than most I've had in New York and I did like the tile work. The thing that scared me a little was there were ear plugs on the nightstand next to the bed. We ended up really needing them. My complaints are really about New York more than this hotel in particular. First off, they have no parking - which is OK - but neither do they have an arrangement with a local garage - which is not. I was expecting to pay about $55 for my one night stay. Well, the rates were $59. Oh, and its $12 more for an SUV. So the guy tells me $71. When I went to pick up the bill is $128. $71 plus $46 for one hour extra and $11 for 3 minutes over the hour. Sure, my fault for not reading the small print but that's why most hotels have arrangement with garages - so their customers don't get taken advantage of. I'm a lifetime Platinum and I still get taken to the cleaners like this on occasion and it is very frustrating.Secondly, the hotel was $400 per night. I know, New York is expensive. (The shows are expensive, the food is expensive, the shopping is expensive.) That's the going rate. But if I'm gong to spend that kind of money I expect something exceptional. Well, at least better than average. And the fact is you need to spend a whole lot more than $400 per night in December to get an average hotel that would be below average in most other big cities. I think I've had my fill of New York for a while.
user_name:
Eric H
Los Altos, United States

review_body: We stayed there while in town for a meeting. The hotel is very different than others we've stayed at, but mostly in good ways. The decor is very hip, and they seem to be catering to a young crowd. The furnishings are "utilitarian modern", but very nice. The room was very small, with very little counter space. Plenty of hooks to hang things from. The bathroom was small, the (fairly small) sink actually wasn't in the bathroom, but in the main room. The shower was great. The staff was attentive and very friendly. Breakfast (not included in our deal) was served in the bar (which looked like it would be a nice place to have a drink), and offered organic eggs and other healthy options. The elevators were truly unique; no buttons inside the "car" to push at all - all programmed from the outside. So, overall, we liked the place; a reasonably-priced property, clean, with attentive staff, but with a small room, no coffee-maker in the room, and almost no counter space. But if those aren't "deal-killers" for you, you'll like it.

The hotel has a great, clean and modern vibe to it. The front desk staff were friendly and we managed to check in early to our room. On arrival we were given two free cocktail tokens. the rooms are small, but perfect for what we needed. The rooms had everything you needed (apart from an iron) however they did have a clothes steamer. The bar has a really nice atmosphere and has a really cool lay out. We would 100% stay at this hotel again. It is 5 minute walk from Madison Square, and 12 minute walk from Grand Central.

We liked the modern feel of the hotel when we walked in. The rooms are very small, but that is what you pay for. The maid service wasn’t very good, only changing our sheets once and giving us ONE new towel every other day. The bar was fun except for the what seemed to be very under aged kids dancing around and making a fool of themselves. We never actually made it to the rooftop bar just because the first time we tried to get there we were ushered by staff/bouncers and couldn’t find it when we got out of the elevator. I probably wouldn’t stay here again just because the hotel tries too hard to be an exclusive type hotel, bar, and club.

After reading all the grumpy negative reviews, I was hesitant to book! But I asked in advance for a quiet room - 10th floor, facing another office building - and it was pure silence all night long. Super strong water pressure in the shower. Super comfortable bed. Spotless room.For the sound sensitive: plan ahead by contacting the hotel to arrange for a quiet room until they get their windows updated.Better than the Ace and Yotel in terms of value and fresh new spaces.
user_name:
newyork1091
New York City, New York

review_body: Moxy is simply moxy. It has an attitude and a character. Visually designed to create a different experience when one walks into its space. Friendly staff and great location. Here is my love hate review.Love the design, location, crew and the whole experience. I loved the shower, it was hot and super soft (go experience it for yourself)My biggest disappointment and struggle is dealing with the noise. I first got a room facing the street and the air conditioning was making a loud hum plus noise from the street... Siren and traffic. Then I changed room and got one at the atrium... The music from the club was banging away till wee hours of the night / morning.Moxy, as much as I love the visual design, please invest in sound proofing the club and rooms. I've lived in airport hotels and had no problems with noise because they invested in making it peacefully. You are after all a hotel and we pay to sleep ;)

Two of us stayed for one night while we caught some Bway shows. The place is centrally located; staff was very welcoming and attentive. The whole place has a cool, eclectic vibe. The free cocktail was a bonus, and the bar area / lounge is spacious and comfortable. Drinks were priced w/in what you expect for NYC. The room was very small but efficient. We had a double bed which sat on a platform with storage underneath and a side table. Tables / chairs hung on hooks on the wall and were easily set up. Bathroom is tiny - shower is a rain head, which was nice. The sink is in the main room - lighting for the mirrors were non - existent, which is my real only complaint. There was even a separate cosmetic wall mirror which could have easily been fixed w/ a light. We were on the 12th floor - closer to the roof top lounge, and could hear the music. They put ear plugs by your bed - which we didn't need because we were so tired, but for some this could be an issue. Struggle a bit w/ adjusting the heating system - but overall it's a good place to stay if you are not planning to be in your room much. Would stay here again.

Rooms are very tiny <150 sq ft), but clean and modern. Only stay here if you like unusual quirky hotels... not a traditional room. There's no space to work for business and the lobby/ roof play music and have a party vibe until 2am most nights. Not ideal for business travel and sleeping before midnight. That being said I would love this place if I was on vacation or a weekend getaway with the girls. Great location for vacationers! Staff was sweet and amazing!

This is one of Marriott’s newer hotels near Madison square garden. Easy walking distance to Penn station. Fast checking. Rooftop bar is cool but not affiliated with hotel. Restaurant on second floor. Pleasant space, great bar, and a variety of food. Rooms are upbeat, but tiny.

Wow. Since we arrived yesterday we have been in awe of the place. From the moment we walked in and the beautiful smell to the outgoing and friendly reception from I think it’s Ralph (really sorry if that’s wrong it had been a long day of travelling) we couldn’t have been happier. I won’t deny we were regally apprehensive because of the reviews but they couldn’t be further from the truth. We got an upgrade to a larger beautiful room with two beds but we would have been just as happy in the smaller room because the beds are so comfy! I could literally die in this bed. The shower is hot and full powered and the only noise we heard was outside but hey you can’t have everything. I’m over 40 and no I don’t feel like I’m out of place so much so I’ve already emailed my mates so that ten of us can come next year with our kids. So finally we love this place!!! Ps what is that smell I want it?

This is a very new hotel with an innovative, cutting edge vibe. The location is ideal; close to Times Square, MSG and more. There are apparently 6 or more different room layouts and they are not typical hotel fare, As mentioned by other reviewers, they are ideal for NYC - designed for the essentials only; no wasted space. Frankly, that is part of the Moxy's appeal and likely a reason they offer such attractive room rates. Now, here are the people who made this a very nice stay: Ro, (the person who selected the ideal room for me), Marisol and Jailene who answered every question and request with professionalism and a genuinely positive feeling. I'll be back! [Comment to management: the bartenders at Legasea (one of the restaurants) were aloof to the point of me having to leave; they just didn't speak to me as I sat at the bar for 10 minutes without any attention. The people at the Lobby Bar and Lounge were much more attentive.]

Aaron was very friendly and excellent! He helped us hold our bags when we checked out but was not ready to leave for the airport for several hours. He also got us hot chocolates with our drink tokens and delivered them to us while we waited! I love that he went out of his way to do that for us - not seen very often, so it was very much appreciated!

I had read several bad reviews so was a bit worried about this hotel. I found it to be very nice, clean and would definitely stay there again. Rooms were small, but they designed the space wisely and efficiently. Staff was very nice and I did not find the noise to be an issue - now that may depend on what floor you are on. The only noises we heard were sirens outside.

I went with family on vacations in October to New York for a week...wonderful city as always with so many options for restaurants, hotels, etc. We were some of the very new customers of the Moxy. Very different hotel but what a great experience. Well located just blocks away from Times Square. Close to subway stations. People were new but with a great service attitude. My kids fell in love with the guys at the front desk. Young people with the perfect attitude to welcome guest when arriving late after a whole day walking down the City. I liked the bar in second floor. It’s was a must all nights in our stayed there. Kids were listening modern music while we took a couple of drinks before going to bed. Rooms are small but who needs more space in New York. The person who helped the last night to get the taxi to the airport for sure will become a manager some day. She was very friendly making sure all was coordinated even though she was closing her shift. We’re planning to go new year again and we’ll try to book Moxy again!

Funny but I didn’t read the reviews posted until I posted my review...I might not have stayed here if I did but I’m glad I stayed. This hotel is set up in a way I’m not familiar with: small lobby(makes sense) large open common area on the 2nd floor with bar/lounge, restaurant and rooms with TVs and tons of sitting area. The rooms are small but so well layed out that you don’t notice the missing space which is usually wasted space anyway. I stayed in room 928(pics below) and it was a bit noisy facing 7th ave but New York is a noisy city for the most part...that’s why you go, I think. I didn’t have the bar noise others mentioned and I also thought the staff was young, energetic and eager to help...I stayed here a Marriott member and the cost was less than their traditional brands. I hope it stays that way as I will be back if the pricing remains lower than the traditional brands. I’d like to see more mats, some rollers and exercise balls added to the fitness center...plenty of cardio and weights.

It is 12:40 am and I have been told I have 3 hours and 20 mins until the party on the roof with the incredibly loud music that sounds as if it is in my room stops. That will leave me 2 hours to sleep before I have to wake up.If your schedule is to sleep during the day and stay up or out all night then this might be a great choice for you. I was told by the lobby that I have one of the 'quiet' rooms. I can't imagine what one of the loud ones would be like.Terrible if you are looking for a hotel in which to sleep. If you are looking for a place to party all night might be worthy of 4 stars.No other rooms or the city or I would have moved and just paid double for two hotels it is that bad.Not being able to sleep all night overshadows anything positive I might say. The fact that they put ear plugs on the bedside table which can't begin to block the noise says it all!

It's a hotel that wants to be a night club - not for everyone, especially business travelers. Restaurants are "third party" - so Marriott or the Moxy have no control or say, there for as a guest of the hotel, your NOTHING TO THEM. They treat you like a POS if you are a single business traveler, just looking for a meal. They rent out their dinner space for private parties, meaning your hotel guests are shut out.I hold platinum status with Marriott, and get treated better at the F airfield Inn at $89/night, than I do at a Signature Hotel at $500+/night. Management and customer service are horrible - they do not care, rather than treat you like a guest, they treat you like an inconvenience. HORRIBLE Experience.I actually dig the small rooms, and the art museum feel. I don't mind the loud music, and like the boutique feel. However, customer service is still the back bone of the hotel industry, and Marriott prides itself on treating it's guests (and members) first class - THIS HOTEL DOES NOT!

I have stayed at marriott properties all over the world and this place is the worst . They changed my room before we arrived and my family ended up have to split up and not stay together. They are too business being hip and cool to offer even a little coustomer service. Do not even drive to call the hotel as a third party answers the phone and it is virtually impossible to talk to anyone without being put on hold for 20 minutes
user_name:
davidcohen22
New York City, New York

review_body: Let's start by asking the GM, " are you a hotel or at night club? " the noise coming from the club at night are so loud I don't know how anyone can sleep. I have traveled throughout the US and this was my 5th trip to New York, "stay away from this hotel if possible". The rooms are very small but manageable, the bathroom/shower are decent. The location is great, your near Times Square and 5th Ave. The staff is good and took care of my family with any extra concerns we had. I would not recommend this hotels for people traveling with families

Stayed at the Moxy this week for a business meeting. The rooms are small but adorable appointed and efficient. The feeling of the hotel is modern. The rooms are modern rustic. We had our meetings in the rooftop bar room (elephant room) which was cozy and worked great. We also had a cocktail party at the rooftop later in the evening and the views and service were fantastic. Don’t forget to check out the roof top mini golf!! You won’t regret it. It’s IG worthy.

I was told by Reception that the rooftop club is rented out nightly and pumps club music until 2:30 am but the noise didn’t abate until 4 am. Earplugs are provided bedside but it will not help. If you picked this hotel due its proximity to Penn Station and go to bed at 4 am anyway, this place is for you. At 10 pm, Marriott customer service line for Platinum Elite told me when I called to see if there are any other rooms in other Marriott properties available that I should have known that this new brand was like this. Marriott, invest in some sound proofing and double glass panes for a hotel with a club! Sorry if I didn’t equate “energetic” in your marketing to “fancy youth hostel-like vibe.” I was told that all other Marriott hotels were sold out. I was fine with everything else - loud lobby, only one elevator working, small but very functional room. It’s like a louder economy noisy W. If you are a pregnant business traveler with a 7 am Amtrak train then you will get 2 hours of sleep and want to expend what little energy you have to eat warn others to read reviews when booking business travel too - I never do. Hope you are reading this before you book!
user_name:
Soup2130
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: My husband and 2 year old daughter stayed in Early December. The interior design is a pleasure to behold. Around every corner was another beautifully designed and decorated space. The rooms were also interesting with efficient use of space. For a small room, we didn't feel overcrowded. There seemed to be a perfect spot to put each of our belongings. We enjoyed dining at the lounge which also happened to work well with a toddler as the tables were low with couch seating. There was a dj playing trendy but not offensive music for our toddler to get down to. We loved the location. Easy walking distance to Bryant Park, Times Square, 5th Avenue, and Rockefeller Center.I'd stay there again next visit.

100+ night a year in a Marriott traveler. Read the reviews online and all of them said the same thing —- small rooms (like dorm room small) and loud. Both are 100% true. But no.... I need to learn for myself. Asked for the “quietist room in the hotel” at check in. I’m on the 16th floor and can hear the house music thumping away. Don’t stay here. Trust me.  I’m currently working on checking out of here a day early.(Insert lame management email that goes like this : We’re so sorry to hear about your terrible stay in our hostile like hotel. We really don’t care because we make all our money on the bar on our rooftop club. We really don’t care if you stay here again because we have all kinds of other visitors that will stay in your place. But thanks for your feedback.)Ps. If it’s not loud. Why are there ear plugs on the night stand? Pps. I used to live in NYC. I know normal city noise vs frat party lame hotel noise.  I’m saving your nyc trip here. Don’t do it. Ok. Last favorite amateur hour thing. No ironing boards in your room. Like the $20 bucks is too much. So instead there’s a “stash closet” you know bc that’s millennial and cool. But it’s a mini ironing board. College style. And sucks.Good night. As I leave the TV on to drown out the noise. Not kidding. God help me.

It's midnight and there is a party on the rooftop that is so loud I cannot sleep on the 4th floor. I can't imagine what it's like for higher floors. I called the front desk (actually had to call from cell phone as they would not answer after 40 rings when I called from an inside line) and was told that there was nothing they could do and it might be over by 1am, maybe 2am. Got the "I'm sorry you feel that way" response from the staff. Clear that they value the $ from the roof party more than the $519 per night I paid. I've stayed at >1000 nights in Marriott properties and this is the worst hotel I've ever been in.

We arrived late afternoon due to traffic. We checked in and went to our room to get ready to go to dinner. First thing we notice was that the room was an oversized closet with no actually closet. Then the sink was clogged, but we were excited to be in New York and left for dinner. We informed the front desk that the sink was clogged. We returned late that night and observed security screening the elevator to the rooftop bar. We proceeded to the guest elevator where you have to program your room number and it tells you what elevator to get in. While waiting in the lobby my husband saw a young lady avoiding security and get in our elevator. She sneeked into the elevator and rode It up to the 17th floor and started panicking and texting whoever she was meeting. I’ll let your imagination figure out what she was doing there. The point is that the hotel is more interested in the rooftop bar than their guest, anyone has access to the guest rooms.Now back in our room the sink was still clogged overflowing clogged. While taking a shower we noticed the water warm and no hot water. The shower would not shut off completely and we listen to the drip of the shower the entire night and morning. Being a rewards member we asked to get a late check out, but they said the hotel was full and denied our request. We’ve never been denied a late check out at any Marriott hotel full or not. We gave the two stars because the employees were pleasant and they stored our bags while we waited to transfer to another hotel to another Marriott.We advised the PM supervisor and AM supervisor their response this is Marriott new concept not for everyone. But Customer Service and follow up on maintenance issues has nothing to do with the new concept..In conclusion, we read other reviews about the noise, but it did not bother us. The hotel knows it has serious problem when they supply/issue earplugs to hotel guest in the rooms.The hotel should be marketed for young people or backpackers, who don’t care about the traditional or customer service hotel, but if Marriott did that, the hotel would be empty. What a waste of 40,000 reward points for us.On the Marriott website we gave our feedback but Mr Murphy sent back a generic response about our concerns. So maybe readers on TripAdvisors will be read and care about choosing another Marriott property.Thank you unhappy rewards member,Our trip was amazing once we checked out of the Moxy Hotel,

Great new hotel, atmosphere is amazing, room are VERY small but cute, and different concept, great if you are staying 2-3 days. HOWEVER they have 4 elevators, they are very slow, and room service, is horrible. Check in was at 3pm, I got there at 1:15pm, took a chance but room was not ready. Understandable since check is at 3pm. Went back at 3pm, room still not ready, house keeping had not gotten to it until 3:50pm, that is not acceptable at all. There is a safe in the room, but no mini fridge, and no closet, just some hooks to hand some close. Again great place to stay at for 2-3 days, except for the elevators, and room service. OH YEAH !!!!!, If you do not like noise that is not the place to stay. You are on 7th avenue, you hear the noise from outside and the club clearly, that is why they put ear plugs in the rooms for you to use

We stayed at the Moxy after booking with British Airways Holidays in their summer sale.We weren’t disappointed .The Moxy is full of young staff. We found them very polite and helpful.Some people struggled with the noise (music apparently) we heard nothing for the four nights we stayed. We stayed on the 9th floor.Our room was very small and quirky,but as we only slept and showered there this wasn’t a problem.The lounge area was nice and comfortable . A tad busy at times as it doubles as a bar.We didn’t eat or drink in the hotel so I can’t comment.The position of the hotel was perfect for are group .Would I use the Moxy again . Yes

Can't believe I'm sitting here at 12:30 AM while still at the hotel writing a review for a room I didn't even pay for. How crappy can service possibly be. After out of the room all day, return after 4 PM to find room not made up, not expecting much, at least empty trash in the bathroom. Okay fine, I call to complain and ask that they come back after 5 PM as I'm heading back out. Return after 9 PM, room still not made up. Dump the trash and towels in the hallway, hours later, it's still sitting there - on a Tuesday night.

Carla you are worth your weight in platinum ! From greeting us at reception to the good bye rubber ducked we loved it all ! Aran you are a rising star and a real asset to this hotel thank you for making us feel so special ! This hotel is not for everyone. That said my husband and i had he most amazing 4 days here. We came straight off Cunards QM2 Trans Atlantic to be treated and made feel welcome immediately! If you are a stuffy up turned nosed bore who cares more about your precious platinum points then please stay away and continue with what you know. IF HOWEVER YOU HAVE COME TO LIVE BREATH AND EXPERIENCE NEW YORK AND ITS PEOPLE SIGHTS AND SOUNDS THEN YES YES YES STAY HERE !The rooms are small but completely exceptable (have you really come to stay in a room for your holiday in New York if so you should have booked a Chateau in FRANCE). As for the news we had none we stayed in room 542 on the 5th. To those that moan about the noise it’s NEW YORK HINT THE CITY THAT NEVER SLEEPS !The staff were lovely and yes its not everyone’s cup off tea BUT it was perfect for us. Central smack bang where you want to be we walked everywhere did everything and so much choice of places to eat all around. Moxy is what it is a fun party loving hotel we are mid 40s and we loved it as its everything NEW YORK is big loud and brash here i am love me or hate me text book New York ! So please if you want silence and genteel afternoon tea with white glove butler service. If you care more about ur imaginary social status based on how many nights you have stayed on a chain hotel the also please go else where. If you take the moxy for what it is worts and all you will not regret it. We didn’t xxx
user_name:
Kelly-Jane D
Southampton, England, United Kingdom

review_body: This is the perfect place to stay for a visit to NYC. The location is great, the beds are super comfy and the space is very efficient. The only negative I can share is the noise...we were on the 10th floor facing another building and noise was minimal. My parents were on the 3rd Floor facing the street and couldn't sleep a wink the first night between the street noise and the 2nd floor bar noise. The staff graciously moved them to the room next to us the next morning and that helped. If you are too low you will hear the 2nd floor bar. If you are too high up you will hear the rooftop bar. If you face the street you will hear traffic, etc. When we checked in they asked if we wanted a quiet room and we said yes; the staff will work with you to find a room that best suits your needs upon check in. We were happy with our room. This is not a luxury hotel, but has everything you need in NYC. I've never stayed in a large completely quiet room in NYC and I never expect it. The staff here is super accommodating. They printed theater tickets for us, called a cab for us, and as i said moved my parents room. The lounge area on the 2nd floor is great to hang out and relax and wait for others. We are not "hipsters" and my parents are in their 60's and I think i can safely say we would all stay there again. p.s. what "type" of muk shampoo and conditioner are in the shower? Smells great and would love to order it.

Booked through corporate travel. Super loyal Platinum rewards. Got a double for $339 w/o taxes. Compared to Marquis or Westin or Courtyards nearby, it is a joke. Courtyard room includes earplugs. Wasn't represented in description. Enjoyed Moxies in Europe. Total disappointment in US. Staff could care less about Platinum. I know what to expect from Moxie. This one has the wrong attitude, small rooms and little value.

My wife and I and another couple have just returned on 2 Dec. 2017 from a 5 night stay in New York. Overall a great time except for this hotel. I didn't realise that boutique or contemporary meant micro bedrooms.The room was the width of a double bed so they put in a 3/4 bed with a narrow gap on one side only to get into the bed.There was just about enough space to put a suitcase on the floor so the other one had to go on top. No shelves just a few hooks on one wall meaning that everything had to stay in the cases. When you wanted clothes you had to lift the cases onto the bed.We were on the 6th floor and it was extremely noisy from outside generally all through the night. It seemed that when there was an infrequent quiet spell the very noisy ac kicked in.I certainly would not stay in this hotel again and will recommend my friends against doing so.

mygetting towels after numerous requests. NOT A MARRIOTT.WORSE INSULT bartender told my wife that old people like her should not stay in the hotel.BAD MANAGER Upon checkout my wife asked for manager told her about the issues the manager will return the 40,000 points used for 1 night, that never happened after 5 calls and voice mails to manager. reservation 83932105 wife stayed for 1 week had several bad experiences with staff. getting room cleaned, getting towels after numerous requests. NOT A MARRIOTT.getting towels after numerous requests. NOT A MARRIOTT.WORSE INSULT bartender told my wife that old people like her should not stay in the hotel.BAD MANAGER Upon checkout my wife asked for manager told her about the issues the manager will return the 40,000 points used for 1 night, that never happened after 5 calls and voice mails to manager. reservation 83932105WORSE INSULT bartender told my wife that old people like her should not stay in the hotel.BAD MANAGER Upon checkout my wife asked for manager told her about the issues the manager will return the 40,000 points used for 1 night, that never happened after 5 calls and voice mails to manager. reservation 83932105

Unfortunately this is not a hotel. It is a hipster style hostel. There is a lot of noise from outside and inside the hotel. The windows are not sound proof and it is very annoying if you have troubles sleeping. When I told them about that, their reply was “we have ear plugs’!!!! It is unacceptable to run a bar on the second floor and a club on the roof top. The room was extremely too small and overpriced for what we paid for (and paid for a bigger one to be more comfortable). The pictures do not apply to reality. The sink it’s outside the bathroom and uncomfortable. I had to wake up my roommate every morning in order to be ready, as I am an early bird. There is no closet and furniture are hanging on the wall! Besides that, the bed was too small and there is no space to move or go to the bed. You need to climb the bed to sleep.

Moxy hotel is a very nice stylish hotel that accommodates the youth population who wants visit The Big Apple to experience shopping, the broadway theaters and different entertainment in the heart of NYC, its 2 mins from Macys 5 mins from times square and about 15 mins from Javits center. Alot of underground services within walking distance .Recommended for couples and friends but not for families , rooms are between 15 to 30 meter square , no cupboards but hangers all over , new concept with a different twist . Staff are friendly, and very helpful. Thumbs up for Mr Hammond Not recommended for families with large numbers of kids ...

Don’t expect top notched guest service/experience here. We stayed in Moxy for 9 nights for our honeymoon and no free upgrade or whatsoever. The recep simply checked us in, with no intro of the hotel facilities.Our queen room was incredibly small. Even for my petite size. We paid premium price! The only water cooler was found in the gym, we had to make a trip all the way to the gym every single time.No hot water dispenser.No fridge in the room.Bedsheet had small blood stains which made us realized that they do not change the bedsheet at all. Housekeeping left 2 dirty cleaning clothes on one of our luggage(pix insert). We were shocked to see the cloths upon entering our room after the end of the day.Most staff were aloof.Location no doubt was good.

My husband and I booked this hotel because it was new and looked nice. Much to our surprise it is not the place for us. The rooms are tiny with no bottle water daily, no coffee pot, no ventilation in the bathroom and horrible access to the rooms due to traffic from non hotel guests going to bars and club. The wait time to get up to our room was at least 10 min. The staff was rude and not helpful when needed. I do not recommend this hotel to anyone. We will not be returning......

I normally am not a big hotel "cool new place guy" but I was not steered wrong. Very shiek place. I am tall and the bed was big woth room to spare. Really hip bathroom and nice style. Real cross between old fashioned back in style and sleek modern. Rooftop bar is beyond insane; super packed with DJ. I was pleasantly surprised at how the employees seemed like really comfortable and having fun and liking what they do... Big hit and pretty nice price with the best place to hang in neighborhood. Come to hang and sleep a little; it is not a library that is for sure... Get Flounder at restaurant.

This is a great hotel. Perfect for a solo traveler or couple making a getaway. Everything is smaller in space, but they put a lot of attention into details. They have several checkin counters to make check-in and out run smoothly.Pros:- Free luggage storage- Roof top bar w/ view of Empire State Building- large 2nd floor lounge/bar area with food and great atmosphere.- Hip decor - unique and modern- Cool bean bag chair in room.- No closets, but instead hooks against wall, storage under bed, two suitcase holders- My room overlooked the end of the Macy's parade where the performers all get off their floats and go home!- Rainhead shower - lots of space- Close to Penn Station, Times Square, and Shopping- Dunkin Donuts right next door for cheap breakfast- Modern elevators - select where you want to go outside before even getting in and it takes you there!Notes/Cons:- Loud if your room faces the street, but it's New York! I sat in my window and people watched every day. If you don't like noise, don't stay in the heart of Times Square.- Not really for a business traveler. I would say it's more for leisure and fun! There's no writing tables or chairs to work in. I did work for a while using the popup table and sat on the bed.- Elevators are pretty cool, but the call screen is only between elevators 1 and 2 so when it tells you to use 4 to get to your room, you have to book it down to the end of the hallway to catch it before it goes. I missed it a few times if you have luggage or bags and can't run.- Should have second trash can next to sink.- Grab and Go food was expensive, but typical for a hotelAll in all, definitely recommend. I would stay here again when I come back!

Great hotel with very efficient use of space. Great location and easy walking distance to many sights and the subway. The staff were excellent and very upbeat and professional, sure to greet you as you come and go and inquire if you need any help. The bar area was a really nice place to relax and again the staff were wonderful. The breakfast Naan's and coffee were delicious. It could be a bit noisy from the street traffic but nothing I didn't sleep through. Great modern hotel with really great staff!

I spent a few days in this disco-hotel and the experience was ugly mainly due to noise (all rooms, and I tried 3, had earplugs as a welcome gift). The disco was working until 2.00 a.m. on thursday and friday and you can hear it from the 3rd floor. Windows were really bad and noise from the street was entering. The air condition machine was in the room (both pieces, the internal and the external one). Firemen came twice in 4 days, one time (at 4.00 am) because a customer of the disco press the emergency button.Also rooms were narrow and there were not a cupboard to store your clothes. It is a kind of tube with the bed at the end of the room without space to enter it. The good thing is that you can change the tv channel with your hands or feet if you don't want to use the remote control ...

LOL... This is what was written on the mirror in the room. Very nice, small but practical place to rest and relax. Room (Queen) is good enough for 2, cool furniture that folds up and save space. Cool counter with sink located outside the toilet and toilet shower is excellent!!!! Stayed there for 3 nights and can't complain anything... Within walking distance to NY Penn Station where you can take the train to the airport easily as well as subway and major shopping malls.... Check-in is rather fast and the main lobby is fun and trendy with loud music and a group of youngster staffs... Would highly recommend this place for a cool weekend in NYC!!! Keep up the good job!!

I knew when booking that it was a newer hip brand and thought it would be fun to try. However as a business traveler it isn’t a good fit. The folding table may be efficient use of space but isn’t very practical for a laptop use. The bean bag chair was annoying and impractical for trying to use the laptop. The bedding had several long hairs on it which was gross. Lastly stayed on the 3rd floor and it was insanely loud with the restaurant on the 2nd floor. They provide earplugs so I should have left when I saw that. I’m a platinum member and have stayed at many other Marriott brands but as a business traveler this one was really disappointing and next time would stay at a more standard hotel.

Excellent hotel at the city center of Manhattan, near Times Square and Macy's mall. The room we booked was big, clean and comfortable, no view at least but generally a great and value for money choice. The staff was very friendly and helpful and the service concerning to cleanliness was absolutely satisfying.We also visited the rooftop bar which was crowded but with a great view at the Empire State Building. I suggest it unconditionally!!!

Fast, Friendly check-in! Super small room but loved the efficient use of the space! Every inch well thought out and extremely detailed in planning! I was acknowledged as a Marriott Platinum Member with extra points upon check-in. I had a window view on the 16th floor and there was street noise, but it didn't affect my ability to sleep. They provide earplugs, by the bedside, if needed. I really enjoyed the Quality bath products and plush towels and the overall fun bathroom design. Every time I departed the hotel I was acknowledged and every time I arrived back I was welcomed. Aaron F. was super helpful and friendly. Can't wait to have another opportunity to stay at this wonderful, chic property. It was a truly fun experience! Great location too! A++++

Reception looks unwelcoming Rooms very very small no kettle or tea coffee making FacilitiesMore like a youth hostelBar is nice But expenses Nice gym Nice tv in room but won’t connect to phone ipadBed up high on a platform wasn’t good as I am disabled with bad knees and agains the wall No storage had to pile cases on top of each other No wardrobe just hooks along one wall Rooms so small if you have heating on it drys you outLots of noise from the road all night long.The staff are very nice and friendly But I would not stay at this hotel again .

Let me start by saying that I am a lifetime Platinum member that has over 100 paid nights in 2017. I wanted to try Marriott’s new hotel in Midtown because it was new. It is the worst room I have ever had in my life. It is an insult to the Marriott brand. If you are a business traveler - stay away as far as you can. Marriott should be ashamed.

We stayed for two nights, Friday night was good, Saturday night, not so much. Stayed on the 11th floor and heard the music from the 18th floor(Roof top Bar) with the windows closed until 4am. The shower in the room was the best!! The rooms are very small, but it met our needs....just a place to sleep. The hotel was a great place to have a drink, prices were reasonable. The entire hotel staff were friendly and helpful! I hope they work on the noise at night, because I would love to return!

Now let me start off by saying that I never write reviews but this place made me change my ways. Yes the hotel is hip, vibrant, and the rooms are perfect. Not to mention that the location is right in the heart of the city where all the action is but the bars/lounges within hotel are just as fun so there is really no need to go out. That aside, the REAL reason Im giving this place so much praise is because of the staff. I've never met staff, (BEATRIZ, ANGIE, and DESTINY in particular) who are so hard working, pleasant, and dedicated to making sure guests have the best experience possible. I mean anyyyy question I had they not only answered it but made sure I was satisfied w/ the answers I received. They always had a smile on their faces no matter how many questions I had (and I had a lot). If I owned a hotel of my own I would w/o a doubt poach these 3 young ladies to come work for me! haha I usually try to find a friend to stay w/ on my frequent visits to NYC, but not anymore. I will stay at the MOXY NYC every single time!

Moxy NYC certainly tries to be a "hip" place and I suppose many would like it for that. Personally, I found it to be a fine place to sleep, but not spend much time in the room, that was tiny and, in my particular case, a small window faced a brick wall 15' away. But it felt and looked clean and new, everything seemed to work well (though the hot water, even on full hot, was a bit cool for a shower). Breakfast Naan was lackluster, but the other to-go food choices seemed nice. My room was away from the street and so apparently a bit quieter than others. This was great value in central NYC for $100-$150 but if the price creeps up, I think one would need to consider other properties. I would certainly consider returning in the future.

Ignore the lame reviews, the positive reviews are more like our experience. Hotel staff were fabulous, and there were so many, all eager to help, from the time we walked in the front door until the moment we checked out. We were there for one night, Saturday night, so the hotel was busy, but our room was quiet and comfortable. Yes small, but thoughtfully designed. Hotel gym was better than most, rooftop restaurant was decent, wifi worked great. We stayed here because the two other hotels we usually stay at were already booked solid, so we tried the Moxy, which will now be our first choice in the future.

If you're in your 20s or 30s, you'll love the Moxy NYC Times Square. I had the pleasure of staying at the Moxy NYC when it first opened up back in September. My friends wanted to stay here because it was new and because she liked the industrial feel to the rooms. What that means is that the rooms themselves, while not large by any means, are functional and get the job done. They have a million hooks (typical of a Moxy) and they believe in having chairs that can fold up and be hung, rather than take up space in the room. Like I said, very functional. I'm more of a standard hotel visitor - I like my space, my chairs, etc. But my friends loved the hotel. What was a bit strange and funny was that I think they were trying to make it a sort of club experience. The door guys felt like bouncers, as did the elevator guys. The bar on the 2nd floor is pretty cool - as you feel like you're in a hip bar. The DJs play awesome music (think pop hits from various decades), so Moxy did a great job there. The location is near Penn Station and Madison Square Garden. The 1/2/3 subway line is like two blocks away, which made getting around pretty easy. There are plenty of eateries and delis and restaurants nearby as well. Really, it's a great location and you won't feel unsafe in being in that area, even late at night. They were working out some kinks so I'm sure the hotel is much better now than it was when we went. But even so, it was pretty great. The best - absolutely fantastic - part of the Moxy NYC Times Square? The staff. I can't say enough about Anthony who took care of us from start to finish, who never stopped smiling and being friendly. Emilio was fantastic too, taking care of whatever problems we had. At one point he got frustrated our tv wasn't working, and I think it's because he really cared about having it work for us. Really, an amazing staff. If you get either of those guys, consider yourself lucky. Anthony made our stay that much more amazing, so thank you Anthony.Overall, I very much recommend this hotel, especially if you're in NYC to have a good time. This may not be the hotel for business travelers, or families. But if you're looking to take on Manhattan with friends, you'll love the Moxy NYC Time Square.

Couldn't/haven't stopped raving about this place - after staying here this past weekend at a dream of a price. Loved the great location, the compact but unique/stylish rooms (which I want to copy now at home... especially the bathroom) and the irreverent and trendy nature of the whole place. If you're like me, you've stayed at hundreds of other big-brand hotels that have basically been exactly the same, save for the name, the location, and maybe a more comfy bed, here or there. Unless you truly value that Hikton/Marriott/Starwood sameness - or expect lavish treatment, staff fawning, sedate elevator music, and a luxuriously spacious room, you will likely be pleased with Moxy. If you even question if you need those things, don't stay here. (That means more room for "us." Thanks, in advance.)My wife and I (50ish.. somewhat over the target age, but lovers of design) couldn't have loved the hotel more - in town to visit our NYU senior (5 minutes walk to subway.. 5 minute train to NYU) and catch a show off nearby Times Square (5-10 minute walk)... From an unexpectedly ready room at 10 a.m. on Saturday - to a very quiet 10th floor room (save for a noticeably squeaky nearby elevator #3, mostly drowned out by the white noise we - and everyone - should be sleeping or anyway), to a surprisingly convenient location in a modest but lively area I have mostly cut through in the past) - the hotel surprised. (Unknown to what degree, if any, my Marriott Plat status played in room readiness or quietness, but I am guessing little in a big city hotel likely full of those with similar or higher status... which more uber-picky and whiney (see reviews below) frequent stayers ought to come to grips with...)Some positive callouts: Super room design w/wood(look) floors, sleek sink and little wasted space. Amazing looking, tall, shower stall with the best high volume waterfall shower head you will EVER use (water conservation types will NOT like... We loved.) Nice lighting choices and convenient outlets. Soundbar on wall. Glass in door to hall! (We adjusted shade to let just the right out of light in....) Great looking 2nd floor lounge and bar space with windows to street. Hard plastic glasses in room (vs glass or disposable plastic). Hooks on wall!The only minor things that I should point out, that some might not like but mostly are just different vs "standard" hotel: 2 pillows on Queen bed for 2 people and no more in room storage (we like more... And sure I could ask, but...). One combo comforter/sheet on bed. (A bit odd but worked.) Washclothes positioned right under shower head so they get soaked! An interesting but nice cream soap/shampoo combo (worked!) Under-bed storage that is useful BUT which juts out right at toe levle (ouch!!!). And in our room 1025, a headboard pushed out about 6 inches from wall, which gave no room for anyone to pass by on foot of bed/to window without climbing over bed. (Pictures of other rooms seem to show OK room to move at end of bed in similar rooms that ours did not have). Steamer instead of iron, but so what. One tiny wastebasket.. But those are nit-picky.All in all - a wonderful stay in a hotel WE loved and you may, too. Or you may hate it (and what high, stuffy standards you must have!)

We stayed in the hotel for one night for Halloween. Location: The location is very close to Penn Station and Times square. So you can have a nice walk in the city's most popular district at night, find a lot of attractions and fun. Room:We booked the single Queen bed room. The hotel room decoration is very industrial, you will like it or not depend on your taste, but definitely not your normal hotel room. Pros: The shower is great! A lot of usb socket for charging your phone. The WiFi is free and the TV is great. You can connect your phone to cast on the TV using ChromeCast.Cons: The room is small, like all other Manhattan hotels. It is OK for this price range. There is a lot of noise, from the street. Maybe because it is Halloween, and people are having parties. But wish to have double layer glasses to make the room quieter. Amenities:The restaurant is great. Nice decoration and nice food. The gym is small and at the basement level. Not so good. Overall, it is a great experience. Recommended if you have travel for fun. Not proper for a business stay.
user_name:
junesiyu
New York City, New York

review_body: I had a wonderful experience at The Moxy hotel located in Time square. It is in a great location. Right next to time square which means there are many places to eat and shop nearby. I stayed here for 4 days and 3 nights. The hotel itself was beautiful and very appealing to the younger generation. The hotel room did not look like your average hotel room. It was very modern with a vintage look to it. The TV allowed you to connect your Netflix account to it and sound bar. Also the beds were extremely comfortable. When the staff came in to clean my room, they put my blanket under the bed sheets instead of folding it, which I thought was a nice touch so I could go straight into bed and be cozy. My first night, I realized I forgot a toothbrush. I called the front desk and within five minutes they brought one up to my room. On Sunday morning, John and Yakima were kind enough to print out my resume and gave me a folder and a pen for my school event. They were very helpful and wished me good luck. Later when I saw them that day, they came up to me and asked me how it was. The staff was very kind and welcoming. I was given 4 complimentary tokens for complimentary drinks. The rooftop and the lounge is beautiful and has great service. Nothing but good words to describe this hotel. Overall, I had a wonderful stay here at the Moxy and would stay here again! 10/10 recommend for the younger generation!

I am not a very picky traveler, I'm very patient. I'm young, and I don't mind going out and having a good time.
