I understand a hotel near times square is going to be noisy, and I understand space is a premium. The rooms are noisy and small, and that is not my complaint at all. I'm just sad that Marriott has their name on this hotel because it is one of the worst experiences I've had with the brand. I've stayed in much nicer hotels that weren't nearly half as pretentious. Staff going out of their way to make me feel bad for the way i dressed, or for asking for something as simple as an ice bucket. If you go to a Ritz-Carlton and ask for a bucket of ice, they ask what room you are in and when do I want it. Here, they tell me to go to the bar on the second floor but advise me it's kind of low brow and looked down upon. There is a grab and go snack and drink bar but no one to cash you out. You have to go to the bar. I asked to charge a sparkling water to my room,a nd the bartender asked if I had cash and said "It's only 3 dollars ok". What kind of service is that? I'm fine with helping make someone's job easier. There wasn't everyone there, but I'm sure she was busy with prepping for the night. Just ask it bluntly instead of trying to shame me into it is all I ask.Marketing in hotel brands has never made much sense to me. Starwood falls into this trap a lot trying to sell lifestyles instead of rooms. That's exactly what they are doing here. If all you want to attract are rich young partying millennials, they have better options than this too. The reason for 2 stars instead of 1 are the security workers who were outside the main lobby at 1 AM were very friendly and I was given a token for a free cocktail at the 2nd floor bar that was delivered and wasn't watered down or anything like that.

We are a couple in our mid 20s. First impressions of the hotel were that it was really cool. The building looked ace and the pink neon sign was inviting. It was also very comforting on days of lots of walking to see it in the distance and know we were nearly home! It’s quite dark inside and even smells nice! I always said it smells like the lush shop when you walk in. The staff were helpful and always welcoming when you walked in. I will say it was a little difficult to tell who was actually staff and who were guests waiting in the reception. We were offered a lower or a higher room and we chose higher. We got the 15th floor. The room was small but we thought it was really cool. Very modern. Everything was hung on the wall, even the small table and chairs which were a nice touch. We were really pleased with the tv, it was of good size and had Netflix which we logged into my account and enjoyed US Netflix on quite a few occasions. There was also a sound bar but we couldn’t figure out how to connect our phones to it. The bed was very comfortable and the sheets were also of good quality and always clean. As with the towels and toiletries, good quality. The bed however was on like a stand kind of thing which doubled as storage and to get in you really needed to go from the bottom and crawl up. Fine for us but something to consider. The tv was also on the right hand side of the wall and we felt it would have been nicer in front of us maybe on a bracket you could swing out from the wall. The toilet was funky decorations, clean and the shower was of good size and was powerful. Also provided was a hair dryer and a steamer to iron clothes which we thought was cute and did use and it worked well. There was a bar in the hotel which when checking in you get a free drinks token. We did go to have our drink and the bar area is really nice, very modern and sophisticated. The complimentary drinks we got unfortunately, were not very nice. The bar had lots of nooks to sit in and a foosball table which we had a shot of and enjoyed. The staff were nice. There is also a rooftop bar and a seafood restaurant but we visited neither. My only complaint about this hotel was the noise. As we were near the top I think the noise was coming from private functions at the rooftop bar and on quite a few nights I was woken or couldn’t sleep due to the thumping music. The hotel do provide earplugs however I already wear earplugs and could still hear through them. We met a few guests in the lifts etc and some were older and said they couldn’t wait to get out of the hotel and that they felt the hotel was ‘too cool’ for them. The rooms were always cleaned to a very high standard. Fresh bedding towels etc daily. You have to put a sign on the door if you want the room cleaned which is a nice touch if you want your privacy. There is also the traditional hanging door sign do not disturb but also a button you press on the door which changes the colour of the light outside the door to alert people not to disturb you. The location of the hotel is great and it doesn’t take long to get to many main attractions. We were just 0.3 miles from the Empire State Building. There are plenty of restaurants, delis and small shops near by. One thing we would have really liked was a small fridge in the room for keeping drinks in. We really missed this and bought ice a few times to put in our sink and chill drinks but it was a bit of a carry on to keep doing this. Overall the hotel was cool and we were happy. We thought it was good value for money especially at this time of year and we enjoyed our stay. Thank you.

I love this New European concept that Marriott has attempted. The rooms are very tidy, modern and clean. The beds are very comfortable and have a large TV at the foot of the bed. It’s close proximity to Times Square makes it a good walking distance to most attractions and restaurants. The roof top bar offers an amazing new view of the Empire State building. Definitely recommend if you get the chance to go to the top and check it out! The staff is very friendly and will help you out with any questions you may have.

almost after a month can't get correct folio of my stay. No one followed up promises to correct apparent charges mistakes and get back to me. Spoke with dozen of people without result. Disaapointment for gold member.

As close to a youth hostel as I want to get. The room is a bed with a sink and a tiny en-suite. So loud that each room is gifted with foam earplugs which do little to drown the noise. Stunning location but not one I would ever want to revisit to stay in. Bar and roof terrace are however nice, just with shabby service.

We made the mistake of staying at the Moxy Times Square. It was our first and last Moxy. Despite personally calling the hotel 2 times the reservations were still wrong, and they were simple reservations. Was treated poorly upon arrival. When we would call or use the chat function for service there was no answer. The rooms are like the new Motel 6, all cheaply made and sparsely furnished. None of the amenities promised were available. There is no lobby so you have to stand while you wait for others in your party to come down, or wait for taxi to arrive, etc.. And there is almost no room to stand so you are in the doorway or in everyone else's way. Agents are sloppily dressed, without name tags, and do not greet you so you have no idea who works there and who doesn't. Rooms were very cold and no extra blankets in hotel. Could hear the noise of the bar to include conversations through the vent in the guest room, and then since the surfaces are all hard it amplifies as the bar sound bounces through the room. No door man to help get a taxi, no one answers guest requests. Hope you are strong because what little furniture is in the room you have to lift off the walls. The cut corners on everything, no top sheet on the bed, no shampoo, just a body wash, not enough hangers in the room, etc.. If you can crown onto the bed and reach far into the window you can open the blind to a brick wall view. Save yourself the hassle and stay at Motel 6, the service is better. And to make matters worse, even though we stayed to the tune of $3000 in rooms, I find new charges for no-show on my credit card this morning! They really could not get anything right.

I came to the city for a short last minute girls weekend trip. Saw pictures of Moxy Times Square on Instagram and I knew this was the best place for an interesting weekend. Being last minute I had absolutely no plans. Thank god for Alex down in the Lobby! Not only did he fill my day with adorable places to eat, amazing art shows to see and classic New York sights to see he suggested a cool hair salon -- Suite 303 to get my hair looking perfect for my big night out on their rooftop bar! Magic Hour has one of the best views. The space was so interesting and the crowd was great. Definitely will be back for every girls weekend from here on out!!

As a platinum member and in fact a lifetime platinum member of the Marriott program I am very disappointed by this hotel. Moxy is the latest new brand for Marriott and is designed to appeal to the hipster/ millennium generation and want to be very tech savvy. I have stayed in Moxy's in Munich and Vienna and was treated like a Marriott platinum member so I was excited to learn of the Moxy opening in NYC and as a frequent visitor to the city decided to stay at the NYC Times Square property. Arriving on a Friday afternoon there was no greeting, no thank you for being a member from the non smiling check in person and was handed a room key with a enjoy your stay. When I asked about breakfast I was told on the 2nd floor and the bar transitions to a breakfast area. The room faced the street and was noisy and when you noticed disposable ear plugs on the bed stand you know you are in trouble. Yes noisy all noitw with a draft coming thru the windows or vents, no need to turn the cold water on in the shower as the hot water turned all the way did its best to provide luke warm water, the sink is on the outside and is in the small bed area and no hand lotion! Room is small, with only 1 access point to the bed, one can think trendy but very Ikea like with no closet only hooks. I thought about complaining but realizing this is not designed for a mature adult and given the non challant welcome I did not bother. Even on checkout no one asked did you enjoy your stay? The main feature of the hotel is a roof top bar with people lining up to enter at night and you begin to think the hotel portion is secondary to the rooms, I will return to other Marriot properties on my next visit.

This recently opened hotel has a perfect t location. Time square is 5 min walking, Penn station too. The subway is 200mts away. Lots of stores, restaurants and theatres at a short walking distance. The rooms have a good shower & comfortable beds but they are too small and no closets. We choose a double room and we didn't have enough space to open our luggage. Thank you Ivette for solving our problem and offering a complimentary upgrade!Most of the staff, specially Ivette, are really kind and friendly. The ground floor is still under construction but there is a great place at the first floor to sit down and enjoy.I choose the hotel for its location and the rooftop bar. The staff told me that we didn't need to make a reservation. Unfortunately, most of the days the rooftop was closed for private parties and we weren't allowed to get in. Including the fact that we asked the tall blond guy of the reception and he recommended us to have dinner first and then go up, 2 hours later, when we were trying to get in, he told us that it was closed, that guy should be trained harder - we have 2 issues with him. You should also give to the guests a weekly calendar and leave at least 2 days per week or don't advertise something that you are not going to provide.

I really enjoyed the service and the general atmosphere. It is perfectly central to visit all the great spots for a very affordable price. The rooms are very clean and quaint. Perfect attitude and a very sheik vibe. Make sure to visit the popular night club on the roof!
user_name:
juju b
New York City, New York

review_body: Good location, walking distance from Penn Station, Times Square, etc. The hotel has a trendy vibe and offers free cocktails to guests. The front desk person was super nice too. I was in a queen room, and it was small but no crammed. I particularly liked the hooks on the wall so everything can be hung thus leaves decent floor space. The bar was nice and cozy, but the roofop bar was super fun. Overall I think it's a fun hotel for solo travelers or couples. One thing to note is that this hotel is a "3-star" hotel, so don't expect luxury amenities; in fact there were only shampoo and conditioner in the bathroom, no lotion, etc; but I travel with my own toiletry bag so it was non-issue.
user_name:
CYRoamer
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: I went here with a few friends on Saturday night.The bar is elegant and the rooftop club was very classy and a ton of fun.The décor and layout of the hotel is magnificent as well.Definitely should drop by!!!!

Having stayed in a couple dozen hotels across the city, this was a unique experience. It definitely has a hip, young vibe...and either you can live with it or you can't (as can be seen from other reviews). Personally, I liked it. The room was tight, as many in NYC are, but functional. It's designed for sleeping, showering in the morning and going about your day. It's definitely not a room designed for hanging out in...but you're in NYC, so why would you need to hang out in your room. The bed was super comfortable...I literally didn't want to get out of bed in the morning. I loved the industrial feel of the bathroom, and the shower was a nice rainfall. While the noise from the rooftop lounge was a little loud, once I zoned it out and relaxed, I had no trouble sleeping. The staff I encountered were all very positive and casual without being unprofessional. For the location and the price point, this place will be a hit.

Spent one night at the Moxy NYC Times Square for our annual family trip for a Broadway show and an weekend in the city. Location of this hotel fit in with our plans. Quick walk to Times Square, 5th Ave, Macy's and Madison Square Garden. If you are willing to try something different than your average hotel experience than this hotel will work for you. It has a younger (dare I say Millennial) feel to it. - That said I have a few suggestions: Staff should know how to give driving directions. It took us an hour to go around the block based on staff telling us a parking garage was "across the street". It is actually on 36th street, right next to the main entrance. The address for the hotel is listed as 7th but the main entrance for hotel guests is on 36th and the hotel is on the corner of 36th and 7th. Overall the room was clean however one of two glasses (for 3 guests) was dirty with someone else's lipstick. Three pillows on 2 beds. We called for clean glasses and extra pillows at 11pm after we returned from the show. We fell asleep with out receiving either. I woke up with heartburn and realized no one had delivered the pillows. There is no refrigerator so bring water bottles with you and paper cups. Staff the next day apologized for the no show and compensated us with extra Marriott rewards points. This was appreciated, however don't understand how when you call with a request they decide not to deliver.

Last night, a couple friends and I decided to go out at Magic Hour (the rooftop club). First off, it was such a fun time and we met a ton of cool people. We decided to stay at the hotel for the night, so we booked rooms as well. The hotel is clearly trying to change the standard 'hotel experience,' especially for millennials. The common spaces like the bar and lounges are extremely vibrant and definitely attract cool crowds. The bedrooms were smaller than average, but I loved the execution and design a lot. I think its the best bang for your buck hotel I've ever stayed at, and although I live in the city, I will certainly be returning.

I had a wonderful experience here with my friends. The hotel is in a great location - 10 minute walk to Times Square.Brand new hotel with a fun and chic feeling. If you are on vacation or traveling with friends this is the perfect place to stay. Affordable rooms, clean, fresh and a new look. The second floor is one of my favorite spots - featuring a full service bar, DJ, leather couches with games (chess, backgammon, table soccer). Great place to meet young singles and a diverse crowd.The hotel also has a rooftop club. If you enjoy partying, you will fall in love with this rooftop nightclub. Direct view of the Empire State Building and 7th avenue. The club is large, cozy and has bottle service. The layout is great and it already has proven to be one of the better nightclubs in NYC. The Moxy Hotel is a phenomenal spot! I will definitely be back and I advise any tourists or young professionals to stay here - you will love the atmosphere and the experience. Thank you Moxy! :)

Noisiest Hotel. Right on 7 th Ave. possibly worst hotel ever. Not a good sign when your room comes w earplugs!!! Clean. Easy location for theater district but no soundproofing. Drafty ,sirens and jackhammers all night. Then the rooftop bar.... till 4 am boom boom boom.

I loved my stay at the Moxy. I was a bit skeptical at first because the scaffolding signs made it look like the clientele would be extremely "hip"... which is not exactly me, but I decided to give it a shot since it's new -- and I'm so glad I did!During my stay, I ran into a good mix of people in casual attire, as well as people who seemed like they were there strictly for business. Yes, the trendy music and the overall design can be a bit intimidating to "non-millenials," but it is new & clean, got everything you need, and in a great, great location!My highlights:- Second floor bar/lounge. At least for my Wednesday night stay, this space was super spacious. Had no problem finding a comfortable place to sit down, there was no pressure to order a lot of food/drinks, there was a somewhat more lively area (bar), more cafe-style area (near the atrium), quiet study area, and small group loungey area... - Rooms: I loved the rooms and the super efficient design. The shower/bathroom was spacious (cool bath products), and the bed was clean and comfortable. There were electric outlets AND a lamp switch on the wall next to the bed -- how did you know I never leave the bed for anything but bathroom? Ok, so did I need anything else? Not really. The bed had a nice headboard that worked like a sofa. I don't like sitting on hotel sofa chairs anyway (I think it's gross), so the bed with washed-linen worked perfectly. Also, I really liked that there was none of those magazines/welcome letter/etc in the rooms, so I didn't have to "custom-reorganize" when I checked in. - Rooftop bar: I just checked it out cuz I had heard a lot about it. Cool vibes. I was worried of freezing my a-- off but they enclosed it and it was very warm. Strongly recommend it if you are like me and prioritize cleanliness + unique experience + practicality, over something like lots of extra space.

Stayed at the Moxy as a special treat staycation weekend, mainly to check out the hype & it was totally worth it! I've never stayed in a hotel with such high energy - not just from the super helpful staff but from other guests too. It's probably from being so close to the buzz of Times Square, the culture of Broadway and the shopping of Herald Square. Helps that your first stop is the Bar Moxy. :)Rooms were stylish and cozy, just the way we like it, and used space very wisely. Favourite things about the room are the steamer (ironing is so last decade!), the wall of hooks (so easy!) and the killer privacy button (they got it right!).Elevator system was completely new to us, but got it down pat on the next trip. Rooftop bar is huuuuge and was a great place to share a tipple. Food options were plentiful, tasty & so so easy. Naan pizza at 2am? Yes please!The hustle & bustle of the city down below was hardly an issue for us the whole time we were there. All in all, a great space and will definitely be coming back again. Heard they have a quad bunk room which would be great for another girls' weekend. Look out, Moxy. We're coming (back) for you!

It was a supper nice bar with a Mixed crowd. the bartenders were very friendly It has beautiful spacious roof top with DJ and plenty of places to sit and chat.I plan to be in the city again and I will defiantly stay again.

Yes, small, but no surprise. Functional design w storage, tv, cute bathroom, and such a dark quiet room (w shades on 3 windows drawn & fan on) that 4 of us in 2 bunk beds slept til 11am! Excellent​ staff. Bar food is generous, delicious, fairly priced. 10-15 min walk to B'way theaters but no sense of being in Times Square (big plus!). Brand new, perfect place.

Stayed at the hotel over the weekend for an event near Madison Square Garden. Perfect location for our needs with an efficient room, great food and beverage and a young but sophisticated vibe. Would definitely recommend!

This hotel was exactly as expected. It fits its niche. Location is fantastic. Rooms were clean. Will stay here again. Complaining about noise when staying in Times Square is misleading. If you want quiet, stay away from the hustle and bustle.

I stayed at Moxy for 3 nights and seriously felt so comfortable the whole time. I was told the room would be cosy, but I found it spacious by New York standards! You're in the heart of the city with everything at your disposal. The interior of the hotel is so well designed and clean. It's what I'd imagine my ultimate penthouse apartment looking like. When I asked the staff for suggestions for dinner, they delivered me a list of cool spots to hit up and were super attentive but not overbearing. They get that traveling is about the enjoyment of a new city, so they made sure I got the experience I came for. There's always something going on in the hotel, it almost makes you feel like you're missing the action if you're not there! If you're in NYC for fun, this is the place to be. I loved every minute!

My wife and I stayed at the Moxy for 6 straight nights. Ugh. It would be fine for a couple of nights but 6 I will never do it again. I gave it a 3 but would lean to a 2 1/2. It was clean, new nice, but small. Noisy from the elevator blasting music for your ride to the street noise of sirens and honking. You know there’s a problem when they outfit your room with earplugs. Did I say small? I am 5’10 and could touch the side walls with almost my palms outstretched. A double bed to crawl into. No chair to sit in. Other than a foldable chair which we used to place some luggage on. The nicest thing was the shower. A waterfall rain faucet drowned you with water. It was great. The overall bathroom was small but workable. Poor lighting or no lights near the mirror. It’s probably ok for one person to stay at but not 2. I knew it would be small going into the arrangement. But the experience was not good for us. We tried it, now to move on to something else next time we are in the city.

Just stayed at the Moxy TS... simple rooms that have exactly what you need! Super comfortable and great decor! The staff was extremely courteous and helpful. There is a very cool bar/lounge and rooftop. They even make fabulous cappuccinos and parking next door was very convenient. I highly recommend this hotel.... great value!
user_location: New York, New York, United States
user_name:
Christina F
New York, New York, United States

review_body: This new Marriott property was clean, efficient, and as expected in NYC small. We booked the bunkbed room for a girls weekend in the city. The room slept 4. 3 of us stayed in the room and I am not sure if we had a 4th were their stuff would have gone. This new hotel needs more options for storage. More hangars for the walls or more shelving and hooks in the bathroom. The small room can be doable if you have space to put things. Bathroom was large and spacious bedding was comfortable. This is where the specific demographic comes in.... there is a roof top bar at this location. While it seemed like a great feature to be close to we could not enjoy it as the one night we tried to go up around 6pm only half was open and already quite crowded. But also as the night goes on the music from this location gets louder and louder. We would go go sleep at night with the music quite loudly playing outside our windows. The hotel provided earplugs at check in, this should have been a sign. Location was good for us, can not say the price for space and sleep quality was great. If you are looking at this location and you yourself are interested in the nightlife you are all set.

This was honestly the worst hotel experience I’ve ever had. We’ve stayed at a different Moxy and numerous Marriott hotels in the past. Incorrect charges when we arrived and couldn’t check us in for ages. Three staff tried to figure it out and then the manager came out. She acted like we were a massive inconvenience and didn’t apologise. As it turns out I paid the full rate up front but lady on phone manually entered incorrect amount when I was paying. You guys couldn’t figure this for about an hour. Guys I pay to sleep in a hotel and that was just impossible!! The very basic thing of a hotel that you aren’t able to fulfill. It’s a joke. Noise was just utterly ridiculous every night we were there. It was Like sleeping in a night club. I get there was a rooftop bar and I was totally okay about the noise on the launch night. No issue with that. But zero sound proofing made it impossible to sleep every single night. The room would vibrate. And it’s not fair to come back with some reply like “the Moxy isn’t for everyone” which I’ve seen you guys say on trip advisor when people made same complaints. I’m young and like to party but this was just laughable. We even called reception one night to see if something could be done. But the guy on the phone apologised and explained you have no control over what the rooftop bar do. He explained he had slept in the hotel a few nights previous and totally agreed that the noise was insane and he got no sleep himself. He was super nice to be fair to him. Not his fault.To make it even funnier staying at the Moxy gave us no priority access at all to this Roof bar which kept up till 3/4am every night (magic room or whatever it is called). We were still made go out in the street and queue and the door staff were extremely rude. Also - there was only one towel to share between us when we first arrived (jet lagged and feeling dirty from a long flight). Despite it being clear on the booking that it was for two. We even told you guys it was our anniversary. Finally, we went down to the bar Moxy one night and ordered a Beer and a Prosecco. It came to about 22 dollars which my I signed for. Somehow my visa was charged about 42 Euro for this (converts to about 55 dollars) and then on checkout the staff tried to bill me for those same two drinks AGAIN. A couple of the Moxy staff couldn’t figure it out, and again like when we checked in the manager had to come, didn’t apologise, didn’t fix anything and mumbled about a refund for the over charge - which i still haven’t received. Generally the staff were really rude, with a couple of exceptions. I’ve never complained to a restaurant or hotel in my entire life, so I actually feel pretty bad/sad even writing this.Didn’t really mind the small rooms and thought the shower was great. Tv also worked great and had good channels. Trying to talk about the positives but that’s about it.

Nice, new hotel near Times Square. Moxy has been open for about 5 weeks and still getting set-up. Stayed for a business meeting and rented out business/conference room space. The person assigned to our room was excellent- great service and continuously checked if we needed anything. One slight issue- during the middle of our meeting, hotel staff closed off one part of our room and started drilling/hammering. Not cool...The rooms are very small- fairly expensive for size. DO NOT get a room across from elevator. As in previous reviews, not hotel fault, street renovation all through the night. Could not sleep a wink. The hotel leaves ear plugs on night table- you know that's a problem. Overall- not bad and will probably get better once fully complete.
user_name:
ejst
New York City, New York

review_body: From the moment I walked in I was greeted by the very friendly staff that was smiling and actually dancing to the great music in the lobby. It was such a nice warm welcome. Shorty after walking in, I headed up to my room, which I immediately made my very own NYC crash pad. The rooms are cozy and have everything you need. Little details like the usb outlet to charge my iPhone right next to my bed, the steamer, and the bluetooth speakers me feel so comfortable. Also–the rainfall shower was amazing.This hotel made me feel like a true New Yorker throughout my entire stay. The breakfast was delish, the living room with tons of board games was a blast and my favorite part.....was the incredible rooftop bar!! I hungout here every night during my stay. The views are gorgeous and there is a super fun carousel and mini golf course. Seriously so awesome. Can't wait to come back to NYC and stay at the Moxy again!!!
user_name:
WanderlustLady11
New York City, New York

review_body: Such a cool hotel! Loved how modern and youthful it is. Great, friendly staff! Felt like a party when I walked in. Would definitely love to come here with a group of friends before a night on the town in NYC!

I had an excellent experience at this hotel. when I walked in the front door I was immediately greeted by a hotel employee who came right up to me and escorted me to a check in desk. Check in was super efficient and unlike most hotels where they wave you off to the elevator, the employee walked me to the elevators, showed me how the security worked and bid me a good stay. One of the best check in experiences I have had anywhere in the world. The room (421) was more spacious than expected with lots of hooks to hang clothes. The bathroom was very functional and the shower was fantastic with lots of water pressure. I did notice the air conditioner unit was a little bit noisy and like anywhere in the heart of Manhattan there was some noise from the street but these are very minor points in an otherwise great hotel. I get that this is not a hotel for business travelers (although the free wifii was perfectly reliable and fast) but if you're in New York City for a good time and want a great hotel for a really good price, try the Moxy.

Marriott should be ashamed to carry this as one of their properties. Tiny room, plastic cups with a soap dispenser, and not even a pad of paper! Mindless teenage front desk staff! Manager was irresponsible! Avoid like the plague!

After no sleep, an early flight, and a long shuttle ride into the city we were excited to check in and start exploring. Upon arrival we were given the wrong type of room. At first we were told there were no other rooms as it was the grand opening night and they were booked solid. Hours later someone finally helped us switch rooms -even though they were “booked” (it was the only help we had received.) Walking into the room was like walking into a tiny cubicle. If you like privacy taking a shower or using the restroom, this is not the hotel for you! The thin glass panel across the entire bathroom was a great touch to the small room with 2 beds end to end. We were given wrist bands for the grand opening for the bar and party they were holding. We were told many different times on when it would start like 4pm, 6pm, and 9pm. We made our way back from our plans early to check it out and everyone we asked had no idea what the wristbands were for, or even what was going on! Spent all night running around to different people that the previous person sent us to that would supposedly know what was going on. Did that for about an hour until we gave up and went to the rooftop bar where we sat for at least half an hour AT THE BAR front and center. No one acknowledged us sitting there, never offered to take our order, or better yet make eye contact. Finally when we flagged someone down, we were told she was sent up from the second floor bar and was no longer taking customers. We gave up and went back to our room where all you could hear all night was the party going on upstairs. Yes I understand it’s an opening party, that’s fine, but we should have been told in advance to booking. The following nights I assumed the noise level would stop.....NO! It was loud constantly from the rooftop and on the streets below. Thicker windows would have fixed all. We ended up staying here multiple nights and when we got the print out the prices were all wrong. Spent 2 hours between being on the phone with Marriott and at the front desk. The rates changed 3 times within 10 mins and have 3 physical print outs to prove it. This is the most unorganized hotel I have ever stayed at and not a single employee communicates with each other and have absolutely no idea on what’s going on. Management is no help and tell people they are too busy at the moment to help you with your problems. Any discrepancies shown they immediately go to help another customer. I understand and respect the customer service aspect of things completely but that also doesn’t mean you abandon the one standing and talking in front of you. Needless to say this was the worst part of the New York trip and if you’re wanting to be treated kindly like a human being, I would recommend another hotel. The next hotel we went to two streets over have a friendly staff and have their stuff together. The room is also quiet!

I came for 1 night with my husband and son and stayed in a double double. The rooms were cozy but extremely usable and well designed. It was very creative to see the two beds were both on same wall foot to foot instead of parallel - i would think they should invest in making dividers between beds higher but otherwise it was a great room. I loved how thoughtful the design was about the plugs and hooks. I didn't expect to love given prior comments i had read about the size of the rooms but the they were amazing with great showers and bathrooms. The thing i loved the most was the vibe in the hotel, the hotel felt boutique even though was much larger in size but the bar was great. Thanks Jodi

This is a very hip, techie-esque hotel in the heart of NYC! The refined, streamlined modernity of this hotel did not skimp on comfort or customer service. Our hotel room (toe-to-toe double beds) was a trip. In a sense it was a blast from the past-- I felt like I was at the adult version of a sleep-away camp with all the adultish necessities (perfect for a girls trip). Earthy colors, a wool runner, and a heavy canvas window covering on the front door are just a few cool touches that brought me back to my childhood camp experiences. The beds were super cozy, the blackout curtains a major plus and the awesome shower made this hotel room a treat. Now about customer service--- honestly nothing short of amazing! Johnny and Jocelin treated us so well and we loved seeing them in our comings and goings, getting their suggestions and asking them for help with whatever we needed. They were so kind, fun and helpful. Erica and Erica at the bar (either for breakfast or happy hour) were so sweet and took great care of us. Francis and Samantha at the rooftop bar made great suggestions for food and dranks and made us feel as if we were their only customers. Above and beyond the fact that this hotel is beautiful and so fun, Moxy and the rooftop bar are doing something very right in their hiring! Such enthusiastic, kind and warmhearted people have been hired here and they all made our visit there so special:)

overcharged pricing of tiny rooms with no hangars and a rooftop lounge that had music soooo loud I had to move. In addition to not being informed there was an opening party that required a 10 min wait for an elevator, none of the staff seemed to recognize that as a guest I was purchasing a room to rest in.

Stayed there for 3nights. Location I would say is great, one can already see the Time Square and is just some minutes walk. Next to the property there is a Macy’s and many others around. Loads of restaurants and everything is just around.Check in was smooth and the lady was very cheerful.A trendy hotel with a very hip rooftop bar which you must go.The room is ok for the price. Not spacious and unlike many ‘normal’ hotels. It does not offer you a fridge, working table and chair is stow so you need to open up yourself. The bathroom and shower room are at the same area and does not have a glass to stop any splash, so you watch yourself.There is no wardrobe and just 3 hangers, but with numerous hanging knobs for you.Bed was comfortable and using the lift need some education (find yourself when you visit)...Overall I would say it was a good one, is just you can expect the ordinary stuffs your find in other hotels.

This place is simply Weird. Definitely New York never sleeps as all the nosie all night was in our 7th floor room. Windows are paper thin (ugh) noise, noise, noise. Thanks to Manager Mikie for moving us to a much less noisy location. Their rooftop bar was a very unusual place. They have large Bear porno as you enter the bar. Very expensive drinks and bad service.

This is definitely a hotel for the younger crowd, or those who feel young. I very much like the concept of small minimalistic rooms, but with a common space to hang out, work or have a drink. Staff is very friendly and welcoming (and pleasing to the eye :). There is a very good-quality restaurant.A few small disadvantages: the elevator system is supposed to be modern but is just confusing and impractical. The bar on the second floor could have a somewhat wider choice of small nibbles. Important for some: the neighborhood can be quite noisy at night (but the hotel seems to realize this and provides ear plugs in the rooms :).

The great location and reasonable nyc price (I chose stay dates based on pricing, which seems to change considerably day to day). This new hotel has small but well appointed rooms with a modern European theme. If you're looking for luxury or larger rooms this isn't the hotel for you.On the down side is the staff and constant loud music in common areas. Many but not all staff, especially in bar area, are not customer focused. They are often talking to eachother and not paying attention to customers. Breakfast is advertised to start at 6 30am but the coffee is often not ready then. Hopefully they will iron out the kinks soon.Given the convenient location and if I can arrange stay to hit some lower priced days, I will stay here again.

This is a totally hip yet unpretentious property. If you are lucky, you will be welcomed by Joselin who has a knack for making you feel like you are reconnecting with an old friend. The rooms are small but designed for the traveler who is visiting NYC to explore, not hang out in a hotel room. The "toe to toe" double beds are a hoot and perfect for two people who like their own space. The rain showers are heavenly. This is a highly energetic property so if you are a light sleeper, this is not for you. The second floor lounge is such a nice place to sip your morning coffee or have a glass of wine. Every single person I have encountered has a welcoming and positive spirit. Can't wait to return this weekend for more fun.

Booked this hotel for a business trip and was pleasantly surprised. The rooms are small but really fun. The rooftop bar is a good time - it has miniature golf and great views of the NY skyline. It is located in the heart of Times Square, with shopping and restaurants nearby. Best of all, it was very reasonably priced. I’d stay there again in a heartbeat!

Despite promised 3:00 check-in, room not available until 4:45. Staff was useless. Room was tiny-- nice for a new prison. HVAC didn't work for half the night. Asked for quiet room, and put next to elevator. All this, even though my wife was "gold" in the hotel rewards system. Stay away!

This trendy lifestyle hotel is great for travellers who won’t be in the room 24/7. Rooms are small but VERY functional. Cleverly designed and easy to use. Your room will have a hairdryer and a tiny steamer — smartest thing really! Irons are so yesterday. Staff are accommodating, especially Johnny. He knows how to listen and anticipate your needs. They do need to improve on housekeeping. Stayed for 2 nights and my room was not cleaned once even after o requested for it several times. They’re new. So I can understand. Magic Hour, the rooftop is AMAZING. Great views and yummy cocktails. Mini golf was small but cute. You’re a priority if you’re a guest at the hotel. So be a guest! Security is professional and amazingly nice. Kudos to everyone!
user_name:
nikitaconwi
Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

review_body: I just got back from a long weekend stay at the Moxy and can't wait to go back again the next time I am in NYC! The location is perfect and the staff throughout the hotel were So friendly and helpful. My room had a super comfy bed and the rain shower was awesome. The second floor was a really cool place to hang out and had an amazing dinner at Legasea and drinks at the rooftop bar. Will definitely be back!

Had a great 5 nights at the moxy. Excellent location minutes from Penn station that takes you directly to jfk. And 5 minutes in the other direction takes you to Times Square. With lots of bars, shops, restaurants in between. Hotel is very cool and modern, everywhere was spotlessly clean and we felt the room was plenty big enough for two people. Yes there’s no wardrobe but this is clearly stated when you book and there’s plenty of pegs to hang clothes up. The bed is super comfy and we had no issues with noise like some people have mentioned. All staff we met were very friendly and helpful, printing tickets for us and answering any queries we had. Moxy is definitely the most fun hotel we’ve stayed in with it’s quirky touches. Both bar moxy and the rooftop bar were excellent. Rooftop was a great place to celebrate our engagement and partners birthday.We’d definitely return to moxy next time we’re in New York.

My husband and I spent one night in the Moxy to celebrate our anniversary. We are not young, but not old either and are always willing to remain on point with current trends. However, good service, good quality and good space should always be trendy and this property lacks all three. Room was horrifically small with the bed up against the wall, so one of us had to climb over the other just to go to the bathroom!! No closet, EXTREMELY Noisy A/C unit which was right against the headboard and caused the entire bed to vibrate. Staff was not overly attentive and seemed very confused about the check in process. Our first room was 'used', dirty towels on the bathroom floor and shower mat wet. So we had to wait a few hours for the next room. Coming in at over $300, this was totally not up to hotel standards in that price range. The icing on the cake was the false alarm at 4 o'clock in the morning. No apologies or concern from any of the staff standing around like club bouncers when we are all let back in the hotel. Was terribly, terribly dissappointed in the experience.

Cons: I get what the Moxy brand is trying to do in appealing to millennials with the music and club-like vibe but I felt like the fundamental purpose of a hotel (i.e. to offer a restful place to sleep) was overlooked at the Moxy Times Square. Yes, this is midtown NYC so we weren't expecting a country retreat but we were really not expecting to be woken in the middle of the night by blaring music coming through almost paper-thin windows with absolutely no sound insulation. To add insult to injury on our penultimate night we were woken up by 3-4 false fire alarms - that's fine - but there was absolutely no explanation or direction by staff as to what was going on and so after each false alarm having been told to return to our rooms we felt nervous not really knowing if it was the real deal this time or not. I understand that this is a new property and there will be teething issues but I strongly feel that fire safety and evacuation procedures should be reviewed here as a matter of urgency.Pros: The employees were nice albeit perhaps a bit too blasè and indifferent to the needs of guests. The bedroom was funky with nice little touches. That said, the TV and speaker system was too close to the end of the bed. I'm 5ft '11 and every morning we found the speaker had been knocked off the bracket by my feet which was also partly down to the fact it had not been secured fastly. The bed itself was super comfy, just a shame we couldn't rest in it properly because of the incessant noise. The bar/s were cool and we appreciated that we were given priority access over non-guests. Summary: Overall, I feel there is a lot of potential at the Moxy Times Square but there are serious issues with sound/noise disturbance mentioned above and a worrying lack of attention to detail with fire evacuation procedures.

During check in staff was not friendly at all and basically gave us our room key and pointed us toward the elevator which is kinda tricky if you are not tech person. Hotel Location is good and close to everything you need to see and do in NYC. However, the noise never stops from the street (its on the 7th avenue) so its kind of difficult getting a good night sleep. Rooms are clean but very very small - like a hostel type. No coffee amenities or fridge. Interior Design is interesting but if you stay for more than a weekend you need some more space in the room. No wardrobe to hang any clothes and our room was full of clothes all the time. Our first room -1135- smelled of food so much that my eyes itched. After I complained twice, they gave us a second room and NOBODY came to help us transfer to the other room - no upgrades here! Staff is young and some of them really rude and get annoyed if you ask them anything. Overall hotel is for young people looking for a place to crash after partying in NYC. As for relation price-quality? Really, we should have paid as you would for an hostel - max 100 usd/night) as it is one just with a fancy name and design.

When you enter the hotel there are multiple check in staff standing that I assume should be greeting guests but in our case that did not happen. They just stared at myself and my husband as if we did not belong. I had to approach one staff member and tell her we needed to check in. She was not friendly at all and basically gave us our room key and pointed us toward the elevator. Their elevator system is not the basic push your room floor and wait for the doors to open. They have a touch screen and you have to scan your room key card. We were trying to figure out how it works and yet again another hotel staff was standing right next to us watching and it wasn't until I asked for help and then he acknowledged us. Our last not so friendly staff member was the bartender on the 2nd floor bar, we sat down showed him our 2 tokens for the free drinks then told him what we wanted, he made our drinks and after we took a sip he said, "oh those tokens won't work for your order it is only for a "fruity type" drink." We paid for our drinks and gave the tokens to the people next to us at the bar.Many of the hotel staff members are quite young, I am only 40 and I felt like they were snubbing their noses at us.Maybe more training on how to interact with guests will be beneficial. The hotel is very nice and clean. If it wasn't for the staff I would have written a much better review.

Ok i'll admit i didn't check out this hotel -relying on a company booking - but $286 is hardly a "budget" rate even in NYC - - My room 436 (broom cupboard) was so small i could touch both walls at once.Their idea of a wardrobe is two clothes hangers hanging free style on a coat rack. The sink is in the main room (which is too small for a sink ) but the problem is the bathroom is too small for a sink.The best bit though is that it is actually a night club pretending to be a hotel - if you want to get drunk, party all night and not care where or if you sleep then i am sure this place is great, and yes it is quite near Times Square. If you want to sleep however then try a proper hotel. The earplugs on the bedside table were the give away that should have sent me packing before i was awoken at 01:00, 0130, 1045, 0200, 0230 ............after 0500 i can promise you its pretty quiet- a nice walk over to a couple of 24 hr coffee shops on 7th is a nice way to while away the early hours .Ordered a large brandy in the bar to calm down and blew my budget rate as the bill went up $100,Try the lifts (elevators) as a great example of technology taking us backwards - try to work it out without any training (meantime send your partner by the stairs if under the 5th floor - see who gets there faster) NOxy NOxy NOxy from me.

We stayed at Moxy Times Square the weekend it opened for four nights. They were clearly NOT ready to open. On the upside, the beds were very comfortable and the large shower were well done. But, after calling Marriott several times the month, a week, and then two days before arriving and being told it would be ready, we walked into full-scale construction, only several floors open, and no restaurant or highly-publicized roof top bar. We had problems with air-conditioning not working and high noise coming through the brand new street-side windows. We asked for simple things like bottled water and some extra towels and they never arrived. Our frustration after two days hit the max and we went to the on-site manager. They offered to move us to another Marriott property, but the job of packing up and moving ourselves further away from Times Square wasn't much of an offer. Upon checkout, they offered to put a few additional points on my Marriott Account (too little, too late) and then never followed through. Eventually I received an email from the 'Director of Happiness' (no joke) saying they were sorry my stay wasn't very good. They then signed off with a 'Stay Fab' closing. I felt badly for the on-site staff who were trying hard to make up for shortfalls that they had no control over. At a minimum, Marriott should have leveled with loyal customers like us who, when calling to see the status of the new property, should have been offered some type of honest answer and then either given a discount for being the new guinea pigs, or offered to be move BEFORE being subjected to such poor treatment. The Moxy brand is designed to be hip and the demographic is certainly for the trendy ... but, at the end of the day, the 'cuteness' approach (marketing) and loud music 24X7 in the lobby can't mask poor preparation. Just make sure you realize what you are getting yourself into. Perhaps, in time, the kinks will be ironed out, in the meantime, this property was not ready for prime time! Too bad ... it's a great location.

Absolutely loved my stay at the Moxy! I had a room block with a few of my colleagues for a work event near the hotel. From the moment I walked into the lobby, the staff was friendly and accommodating. The rooms were unique and had fun touches all around. The hotel has a great workspace (feels like you're in a hip NYC apartment!), and the rooftop has a breathtaking view of the Empire State Building. I especially enjoyed the carousel bar and mini golf. Would definitely stay again and recommend to anyone!

Just returned from 4 nights a the new Moxy Times Square and this Hotel is fantastic- and not expensive! Yes the rooms are on the small side but you won't find a hotel in NYC for this price and this level of quality. Starting with check-in: It was fast and easy and the lobby has a very fun and young vibe. I was upgraded to a corner room which was great. The rooms are small but lots of windows and great light and even a view of the neon Lights of Time Square. The rooms are very well appointed simple and stylish - huge Flat Screen TV, fast wifi,lots of outlets for adapters, terrific towels and the bed is very comfy. There isn't a lot of room for storage but there are cool looking hooks all over below the bed is a large storage drawer. Rain shower in the bathroom was great and the custom ceramic sink was really nice. As a matter of fact all the "finishes" were nice including the hardware. There is a very hip bar on the roof - apparently its the largest outdoor bar in the city. It has a terrific view but it does get really crowed. Hotel guest have some sort of preference. Definitely worth checking out. On the second floor there is a bar and restaurant. and plenty of communal places to open u your laptop and work.They weren't serving full breakfast yet but they have a grab and go (fruit, yogurt muffins etc) which was fine with me. Workout room is nice on the lower floor.Will definitely be back at the Moxy!

If you are a millennial that is only interested in design and leisure, you could be om here. If you are a wel, travelled business guest it does not work. - personnel needs to be educated. Young and diverse is fine. Incompetent is not. System down when I arrived. Did mobile check in but no keys made.- Rooms are small ( I had a corner which they told me was an upgrade...) and have the sink in the room and no closets. Not my thing.- If you design a pretty walk in shower, please have the shower head come out more than 5 inches, so you don’t have to rub against the wall to get water on your head.....- buy good pumps if you have 14 floors. No pressure....- if you have windows everywhere and other buildings around you, it makes sense to have shades, not just curtains that completely black out, or, when up, show you in all your beauty to the office clerks in the opposite building...- noise is usual in NYC. But some isolation to prevent it as if the trucks are running you over, would have been nice....Trendy it looks, but convenient it is not. I won’t be back as a hotel guest. Maybe I’ll drop by and check out the rooftop bar some day

We spent one night at the Moxy hotel with our kids. We loved it. It's new, clean, modern. Very different from every other hotel we've been before. The lay out and decoration of the room are original and gave us the feeling that we were actually not in a hotel. Gummy bears and games were in the room for the kids. We enjoyed the bar on the 2nd floor with a free drink. wéll definitely go again.

Moxy comes off as the trendy or cool hotel of this moment, a Marriott equivalent of the modern minimalist hotel. I travel a lot for business and this popped up as a priced right hotel in a great location for me, and being a Marriott member, a way to earn points. I'll list out the pros and cons, make your own decision - Pros - Great price, you're not paying for something you don't need. Cool, modern lookRainshower shower headClean room and bathroomCons - Loud nightclub and the windows don't help to keep the volume down at 1 amNo place to hang clothing - yes there hooks on the wall, but they won't hold a shirt on a hangar or sportcoat without something in the way (door, bed, etc)Customer service - great on check in, terrible at checkout.... since when does ANY hotel send you to the basement to drop off and pick up a bag? How about never? Really, is this even something I should have to say? Doorman - Really, you can't leave the front for a second to flag down a taxi? I'll give you a 3 rather than a 2, but I'd be hard pressed to think that I'll return.

Wow! From the minute I walked in the door, the Moxy had my full attention!! Music, relaxed check in and very warm welcome from Johnny. He remembered my name when I walked back in the next day! How often does this happen in NYC? Wow! Tremendous. They deserve more than 5 stars. Give Johnny six stars, please!

Recently stayed at the VERY new Moxy hotel near Times Square for a girls trip. This hotel is definitely a hip joint. The hotel and rooms are stylishly designed and curated. Perfect hotel for those who are traveling light (no closets in the room, but plenty of creative storage and hanging options). Service was quick and courteous, the room was very clean and surprisingly spacious for NYC. We were given two drink tokens to be used in the second floor bar (tokens were only good for the "welcome" cocktail which was delicious). Rooftop bar is quite a scene and very crowded, but offers a spectacular view of Empire State Bldg. No coffee maker in the room, but I was able to get free coffee from the second floor bar (there does seem to be some confusion with staff about whether this is complimentary?). Because I need to know where my morning dose of coffee is coming from, I would suggest to Moxy that they go ahead and make this a complimentary thing for all or have a Keurig in each room or by request.On our last night, a fire alarm went off around 4am followed by an intercom announcement that we did not need to evacuate, this happened off and on for a while. We did express concerns to staff the next morning and they made some adjustments to our stay that left us feeling valued. I would like to return to NYC in March with my husband and will definitely consider the Moxy for our stay.

Just had a girls weekend in NYC and we were all so very pleased with our choice to stay at Moxy. The hotel sounded pretty modern and cool, and it absolutely was!! When we arrived we were helped by Johnny, who was very pleasant, and then treated to EXCELLENT service by Alex! He was top notch!! The rooms are not huge, but that was fine. Perfect, for our girls getaway, and what a bonus to the have access to the fabulous rooftop bar. Best people watching ever! Glad we had called ahead and made a table reservation since we were a group of 7.

As many reviews have stated, I don’t think this new hotel has been trained well in customer service. As Marriott Gold members, we typically stay at Marriott properties for special occasions. To celebrate our son’s 10th birthday, we took him to NYC and booked 3 nights at the Moxy. We entailed the concierge about making the stay special for our son to which we DID get a reply that they would “hook him up”. They didn’t..... they never mentioned it again until we brought it up at check-out. We arrived fairly late at night and things were fine.... the hip and trendy design within the hotel is super cool and our son was loving it.... my wife and I were too until we went to Bar Moxy for a late meal and a drink. My wife quickly noticed that the pillows on the seats had sexually explicit drawings of couples in various sexual positions! (If you don’t believe me, look at the pics of the Moxy website... first page, first pic. You can actually see one of these pillows in the pic!). One of the many reasons we chose this hotel was that our son was excited about putt-putt on the roof!! That’s what it says in the website! What it doesn’t say is that no one under 21 is allowed to go to the rooftop..... and I know why.... because there are large shrubs carved into the shapes of stuffed bears having sex in various positions! Don’t believe me? Another user has already posted a pic on this TripAdvisor site.... I didn’t take a pic for fear that my son would see. This is unacceptable. Like many others, I cannot believe that Marriott corporate allows sexually explicit material in public spaces at their hotels.... I understand provocative marketing and sensual visuals... but in both of these cases, the images and “bear shrubs” are literally people having sex. It’s just a really strange and unfortunate choice. It’s not trendy or cool... it’s in poor taste. I need to mention here that Marriott’s website (where we always book our stays as elite members) doesn’t mention that some of the hotel restaurants were not yet open. The egghead and Legasea were not yet open (which I just wish had been mentioned when booking). As I stated above, the rooftop was off-limits to our birthday boy, leaving us with only Bar Moxy as an eating choice. For future guests, if you are young and wanting to go to a hip rooftop night club in NYC that has some super cool rooms beneath it where you can stay, I sincerely think you would enjoy this place! I really do! We loved the room size and cool uses of space. However, if you are a bit older and have started a family, work hard for your money and are a very loyal customer.... you will not recognize this hotel as a Marriott property and you will be disappointed (if not offended). Let me end on a positive note... we spoke with Felicia upon check out about our disappointment with the hotel experience. She wrote down my comments and made me feel heard. She received what I shared with grace and apology. I assured her that my issues with the hotel were not personal issues with her and she thanked me for that. She made a bill adjustment that I felt was appropriate. Friends at Moxy, I’m afraid in your quest to be cutting edge and access a younger clientele with expendable income, you are a potential liability to loyal Marriott customers. We love new experiences and new design ideas (which you definitely have), but don’t forget to care for your customers who aren’t in their 20’s and looking to party. I offer this review respectively and in hopes that it helps the hotel, the Marriott corporation, and future guests.

This hotel is not for everyone, but it sure is for me.If you travel light, are traveling by yourself, and/or lead an active lifestyle on your trip, this hotel can not be beat - especially given the very fair price which is 30-50% less than other hotels with these amenities.This hotel would be perfect for a weekend with buds: taking a run in the park or spin class at Peloton, grabbing a nice dinner, catching a sporting event across the street at MSG and then hitting a couple night spots and going to bed late. This hotel would be great for people traveling on business who need a place in the hotel to meet informally or semi-formally. This hotel would not be the place for people who bring several wardrobe changes, go to bed early, expect turn down service, in room breakfast, and a shoe shine. There are times I want these services and for those times, I would recommend another hotel.Specifically, I liked the efficient elevators, the minimalist design of the room, and the venues in the second floor living room/bar. The location simply could not be better - near two transportation hubs and not too far from anything.The couple issues I had with housekeeping were addressed by management immediately.Others have mentioned noise and I agree it is a bit noisy if you are going to bed early, but if you are staying out later it will not matter. The only consistently problematic area I noticed is the service at the bar on the second floor. They seem more interested in complaining about their jobs than serving customers. I noticed this 3 days in a row from three different bartenders at different times of day. My advice is this needs immediate attention.Otherwise, I would recommend this hotel for the type of trip and traveler I mentioned above.

My wife and I are currently staying in room 1413 which is a king. Rooms are cozy and the hotel is in a great location. Beyond that things get bad. We've been in the room two nights now and our room has not been cleaned once. We just returned for an afternoon nap to see that it happened again. The nap was needed because of the fire alarm going off around 5 times beginning at about 4am. I asked someone if the problem was fixed and they said "no guarantees." To say we are unhappy with these things is an understatement.

This hotel is the coolest, sexiest hotel I've ever been to. DJ in the second floor lounge, epic rooftop bar open long into the morning, amazing staff in both the hotel and bars (shout out to Alex and John at the front desk). I was blown away from the moment I walked in, where the atmosphere is more like showing up at a party with your friends than a hotel. I travel alone a lot and I couldn't believe the friendly greeting and genuine interest I was met with. Would stay here any time I'm in NYC, I would love to try out one of those 4 bunk bed rooms :D

Awesome place and exceptionally attentive staff all around! Excellent location minutes from Herald Square, down the street from Times Square, and close to all the attractions like Empire State. Moxy is an awesome new take on the old formula - from an awesome lobby bar and seating area on the second floor, to an incredible rooftop with views of the Empire State - this place is an awesome stop for a low-key traveler looking to avoid all the bells and whistles of full service spots. Rooms are small but efficient, with awesome unique art and tasteful designs. I especially love the tile work in the bathrooms - “No Diving!” on the floor made me smile. Definitely worth a visit, even if you’re not planning on staying the night. DJs were playing great music and the bartenders and servers were happy to make some tasty drinks (I recommend the drunken donkey). Check Moxy out! You won’t be disappointed!
user_name:
jim_skylark
New York City, New York

review_body: The windows are thin and/or are not sealed well so there is a lot of noise that comes from outside - including from the outdoor lounge on the top floor. It is hard to sleep there. If they ever solve that, there is a lot to like about it.

We stayed one night. One of our friends is French and alex at the "front desk" was so friendly and spoke beautiful French to her. What a nice surprise. Great concept, and backed by Marriott. A couple startup issues, but did not distract from the great experience. Will absolutely stay again and again.
user_name:
AndyM50M50
New York City, New York

review_body: My name is Josh.My wife and I, stayed at the Moxy NYC Hotel, while on a business trip. The beds were comfortable, and the atmosphere was very nice. There are many hotels in NYC, and we had heard that this was a relatively new establishment, so we decided to give it a try. We enjoyed our experience, and we were glad it was a smooth stay, since we had a very packed trip.We were particularly delighted by the concierge, who introduced himself as Alex Monshaw. He was engaging, friendly, and very willing to meet our needs for our stay.I don't normally write reviews, but my wife and I do appreciate when someone makes extra effort to make sure we are cared for.I look forward to my next return to Moxy NYC hotel.Thanks Alex!

First time staying at a Moxy and was delighted by the decor and whimsical features of the hotel. The front desk staff were friendly and welcoming. The guest rooms are cozy and unique. The bed was very comfortable. Location is in the heart of the city - subways and shopping within two blocks.

I stay 150 nights + a year at MARRIOTT properties for many years and this was the worst ever. This place is terribly noisy through no fault of the hotel. Jackhammering, dump trucks, etc. Property is brand new and sinks don’t drain properly. Just maybe opened too early maybe but got zero sleep. Front desk says nothing they can do about it -

As I write this, there is a constant jack-hammering noise outside of my room that has been going on since about 10pm. This noise also kept me up all night last night. The windows are not anywhere near insulated enough to block out this noise. This may not be in the hotel's control, but beware that you may be kept up all night by construction happening near the building. Unbelievable that construction happens at this hour multiple nights in a row. I would have changed hotels but earlier tonight a person at the front desk told me with confidence that there would be no construction noise tonight. I guess he was misinformed.
user_name:
Bryan A
North Charleston, South Carolina

review_body: The good - beautifully designed rooms, fun staff, unique services, great locationThe bad - lots of street noise due to bad soundproofing, no closet space, limited food offeringsThe ugly - was checked into an already occupied room, which to me is a major breach in security and safety. Overall - a fun hotel with plenty of potential, just needs some time to get it all together.

Moxy! Wow wow wow what a place!. Where do I start......Lobby is awsome totally different feel to any hotel I've been to! Pumping music super modern design lovely staff on point! Checked in and the men in black as I called them were dotted around got into a lift which took us to bedrooms floor 9. Other floors there was the biggest roof top bar in new york. Very new and totally new york. View of the empire state as you sit and sip. Room was double very a small bed not suitable for anyone older as you have to climb Into it. Hooks for clothes and nice bathroom, amazing shower and shampoo conditioner. Full 32 inch tv with all channels but the Marriott link to get Netflix etc didn't work. Air con very noisy but all in all very comfy bed!  Pros.... amazing views on the rooftop bar. Lovely staff A lot of themComfy bedLush showerSuper stylish djs and music. Right near times square.Cons.....its a nightclub bar for the public so hotel guests are stuck for tables at the bars.Very young clientell friday/Saturday night dressed very glam women and men up casual and middle aged didn't work!Super expensive food and drinks.Room was a bit small climbing over my partner to get out.Had to explain we were guests every time to pass bouncers. Annoying. A pass would have helped.Moxy has the wow factor but needs to be more hotel guest friendly.

We stayed at Moxy Times Square for one night. I booked back in late May. We are a family of 4, so we must have two Queen beds when I book hotels. It's pretty hard to find QUEEN beds in NYC! I was intrigued by Moxy b/c of the rooms with four TWIN beds. Perfect for us b/c one kid kicks and clings, and when we share beds, we generally don't sleep well. Four twins gave everyone plenty of space and no bumping/kicking/clinging!! Things we liked:4 twin beds!!Very clean bedding and roomNew finishesLocation was so easy to walk to Broadway (Wicked on 51st) through Times Square for the full NYC experience. Also close to Penn Station (Amtrak) and Subways.Easy check in and check out. (I don't know what that other reviewer was thinking showing up at 11:00 and expecting to check in! Nobody does that.)Quiet room! We did not request a room with a view -- which worked out great b/c we had a room that faced a courtyard! Which meant it had NO street noise. The air conditioning unit does make noise (as is the case at every hotel), but it was better/quieter than any other hotel I've been to. Some hotels are so loud I can't sleep at all. This one was sleep-able.Ledge/light/power for each bed! Loved having the ledge to place my phone on. Loved that the adults could have a little light (lower bunks) while the kids went to sleep with their lights out on the upper bunks.Motion sensing floor night lights! Cool. When you step out of bed, a ring of light around the edge of the floor comes on. Things that could be improved:The music in the elevators was a bit too "adult" for us. By that, I mean it is very "club" type of music. There was a song playing when we first got in the elevator where the lyrics said something about "F-word". They didn't actually say F--K. The lyrics were "F word." And the next time it was the song about "I like big butts and I cannot lie..." So, I would prefer a different type of fun music. Our kids are 11 and 13, but still, we would prefer Adele or Michael Jackson or Pharrell or something.The sink in the bathroom was slow to drain. I told the person when I checked out. Not a huge deal.More HOOKS needed in the bathroom! We liked all the hooks in the bunkbed area, but there is essentially ONE hook in the bathroom and you need to put your towel on that for the shower. There is a long wall that could use 3-4 hooks on it so that you can put your pj's on a hook while you are taking a shower.Shower door has a design flaw: First, the shower is mighty powerful! So that was good. The design problem is that no matter how your put the door after you get out, the water on the door (from when you were taking a shower) slowly runs down the door and creates a puddle on the bathroom floor outside of the shower. We put the mat down and it was soaked when we came back. Water needs to stay INSIDE the shower. Again, this was not a fatal flaw.Shower design: Inside the shower there was a metal bin holding two clean washclothes. That was great, except that it is directly below the soap/shampoo dispensers and very close to the downpour of the overhead shower. So, once you use the shower, those two clean, dry washcloths are going to be wet and look used when they aren't. Who puts the clean dry washcloths right next to the soap and the shower spray? Poor design. Again, not a huge deal, just dumb planning.A/C unit must have had condensation leaking under the wood floor and coming up between the slats of the floor. Part of the floor near the A/C unit (and the run on the floor) was wet. The A/C was working hard, but I think there is a problem with condensation or leaking that needed to be fixed. As this hotel has only been open 2 weeks or so, there are bound to be some punch list items that are discovered and need correction. Overall, we were very pleased with the concept of the rooms and the convenience of the location. We are definitely not the "hip" crowd, but it still worked for us. (We never turned in our drink tokens, but it was nice that they were offered). My daughter is a fan of the "Tiny Homes" show on HGTV and she loved staying here. It was clean, quiet and met our needs. Price was also reasonable (although that may be because we booked so far in advance). We would stay at a Moxy again --- bunk beds PLEASE! :)

I have never written a review for a hotel before today. I never saw the need to write a review for a Marriott, considering it would just be another five star review on top of the thousands already posted. That all changed when we were unfortunate enough to stay at the Moxy. I think horrific is an overused word, but I don’t know another word to describe our stay there except to say it was horrific. The one thing I can say for sure is that the employees at the Moxy don’t give a s**t about anyone staying at that hotel. They don’t deserve to be in the Marriott family of hotels. I would never stay there again even if it were free. It was the worst Marriott experience I’ve ever had in my life, and I’m embarrassed for Marriott for letting them treat customers the way we were treated. I won’t go into all the detail I would like to go into, because this would turn into a novel. I will only state the truncated version here. Let me start by saying that I’ve never had a bad experience at Marriott and that’s why we are long time members of their elite rewards program. That all changed when we went to the new Moxy on 36th in NYC. My wife and I were celebrating our 15th wedding anniversary and chose the Moxy after Marriott emailed us about the new hotel. It was going to be a convenient location for us and we were excited to see a new hotel in the city. We were very early for check in, so we just wanted to drop off our bags that morning. A very nice woman gave us a ticket for our bags and said the room would be ready at 11:00 am. So far so good. We came back at 11:00 and a very angry gentleman told us that the room wasn’t ready and that no one would have told us that the room would be ready at 11:00 since check in wasn’t until 3:00. So at 3:00 we returned to the hotel. This is when the real disaster started to happen. We waited about 5 minutes or so for anyone to show up to one of the kiosks (there is no front desk). The woman waiting in front of us argued with the staff member that finally showed up that her packages were indeed there and she had confirmation numbers to prove it. He was incredibly rude to her and left several times until he finally came back and said that no packages were ever delivered. She got out here email and showed him that two packages were absolutely delivered for her and someone signed for them at the desk at the hotel. Magically he finally came back with the packages. This should have been our first sign to run away from this place. We were then “helped” by a very rude young women named Yvette (I don’t know the spelling since no one wore a name tag). She told us that no room was available. I explained that we were already there twice today and I had a confirmation number. She told us to hold on and then came back and said that no rooms were ready yet. Again, I explained that this was our third trip to the hotel. She asked us to hold on again and went somewhere. Upon returning she magically found a room. I asked her if there were any upgrades available. She gave a scowl and told me that I wasn’t entitled to an upgrade. I didn’t ask her if I was entitled to one, I asked her if one was available. It should be noted that she never mentioned our gold level status, nor thanked us for being members, which every other Marriott in the country does. I then asked to speak to a manager and she rudely said that no manager was available. She gave us a room on the fifth floor. I asked if we could have a room on a higher floor, and guess what? We were nastily told nothing was available. She could not have been anymore unpleasant. We went to our room. The room was a joke. The humidity was so high in the room the mirrors were steamed, the walls were wet with humidity and the bedding was so damp from the humidity that we couldn’t sit on it. At this point we called the Marriott rewards number. We spoke with Sean who was more than understanding. He informed us that there were upgrades available and what we were experiencing was nothing short of ridiculous. He then passed us on to his supervisor, David. David was very helpful, but said there was really nothing he could do, except have a manager from the Moxy call me. A manager did call to tell me that no upgrades available, and there was really nothing she could do except to give me rewards points. (We could see the empty suites across the hall by the way and they stayed empty until we left on Monday, so I believe rooms were available). I expressed my complete disgust with Yvette and said more than once that she should be fired. My concerns seemed to fall on deaf ears.We had a horrible night with NYC traffic noise and a bed so wet, even after running the AC for nearly eight hours, that we had no choice but to try to sleep on top of it. I would have had better customer service at a Motel 6. When we checked out we weren’t asked how our stay was, we were merely given a copy of our bill and sent on our way. Never, never, never again.

Moxy NYC Times Square is a new property, and it shows. From the minute you walk into the reception area you are greeted with young, smiling faces and a spectacular atrium with a bear mobile of sorts - you really have to see it.We chose the Moxy for our trip because of it's unique room styles. As four ( 2 male and 2 female), unmarried or partnered to anyone in our group, we were excited to find a room which provided two sets of bunkbeds...it was going to be an adult sleepover. However, upon our arrival, this very specific room we had books, was unavailable. We were not happy, but the hotel kindly offered us two queen/loft bunk rooms which were very nice and allowed the girls to bunk together and the boys to bunk together.The rooms are what I would describe as tiny-house chic. Furnishings fold and hang from the wall and the small space is utilized for the largest feel possible.
