I truly enjoyed the room.The 2nd-floor lounge/bar was filled with multiple unique seating areas allowing for intimate conversation and group focused environments and the coffee was phenomenal! With the venue being new, I believe there is room for training and growth in the staff, but all in all, it was a wonderful experience and I look forward to returning.Shout out to Samson and the front desk gentleman who made me laugh at 3:30 am on the morning I had to check out!

Everyone on staff was friendly and helpful. The lounge was comfortable and also has an area away from the crowds and noise of the bar to comfortably enjoy talking intimately while eating and drinking. The room was cramped, but efficiently designed to accommodate two. The kitchen did close too early for my needs. I was craving a dessert and some tea but the kitchen had closed. The bathroom spacious enough to not feel cramped, but only standing shower, no bath. The location is convenient to head downtown or uptown and even out of town as it is only a couple of blocks from Penn Station. Unfortunately the rooftop was not open yet when I visited. I will return to see how that turned out.
user_name:
travelwell008
New York City, New York

review_body: Where to startI wanted to try this new Marriott hotelI tried to check in at 2:45 PM and was told I couldn’t as 3:00PM was check in timeI’m a Marriott Platinum elite but okAsked where I could wait and basically got no answer so I waited on the street until 3:15 as I didn’t want to break the rulesThe front desk staff is inexperienced , slow and not friendly at allGot my room key and headed to my roomWow shockingly tiny. There are bigger closets in hotelsIt’s like a railroad car or tiny cruise roomThe TV is right next to the bed and there is no way to get any more then 3 feet from itScaryNext , only one hanger on the peg wall so no place to hang your clothes or put your clothes. So you have to live out of your suitcaseTook a shower and the water flooded the bathroom and ran into the room. Poor design Went to the bar which is nice and has a great view of the Empire State Building. This is clearly the venue the hotel is banking onNext morning went down to lobby and 2nd floor restaurant and not open, not even any coffeeNice guy at the front desk but again no informationTook another shower, flooded again dispite all my attempts to be carefulSo bottom lineNot for business folksMaybe young folks traveling would put up with the lack of spaceStaff untrained, and little customer service or careI am surprised this is a MarriottIt looks like the business model is quick hourly stays after visiting the hopping barOh I had an additional 4 stays booked that I have cancelledRenaissance on 35th is much better and a real hotelOne star was a gift

Marketed as a hostel-like experience but more accurate to say rooms are more cramped and harder to live in than a windowless cruise ship cabin - but with no other adjacent space to relax or chat. Hope you like crab-walking because that’s the only way in and out of bed. Food and drink on-site extremely limited and extremely expensive - like what you can get the airport on the secure side of the security check. Nearby places to eat very mediocre but forget about wrapping up what you couldn’t finish from dinner in Chelsea or mid-town because there’s no mini-frig. The roof-top bar had all seating marked as “reserved” so you may linger over your $20 glass of wine in standing room only. Staff were all very nice, but there’s too much still in flux for anyone to be credible about the status of what’s going on or what options can be offered. I don't know how staff could tidy your tiny room but I could tell they came in to make the bed - but forgot/ did not bother to empty the tiny trash bin. My husband and I enjoy cozy quirky lodging but this is not what Moxy offers.
user_name:
Noreen_LFR
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: We would not stay again. The bad: Tiniest room (just a bed), bathroom flooding, charged twice on check out, unclear how lights in room work, poor value for money, really noisy from nightclub downstairs. The good: location, fun decor, food was good from bar, rooftop bar views (but you don't need to be a guest to enjoy all that).Moxy is trying to be cool but missing essential stuff which they really need to iron out first. If you're going to have tiny rooms, make sure the showers don't leak and flood the bedroom. Give guests somewhere to put luggage. Make rooms more sound proof from the nightclub only a few floors below. Communicate more amongst staff so you don't get charged twice etc. For the money, I have stayed in better hotels in central Manhattan. You stay here for the location, but don't expect much else.

Holy crap! I'm on my 3rd out of 4th night of my vacation and each night has progressively gotten worse- first night was just the street noise, but the last two nights have been the worse. It's 2:30 a.m. as I'm writing this review. The music and the talking are right above my head (I'm on the 12th floor)! I called for "the crew" and was hung up on twice. Not that they could do anything, but just wanted to know when the club closed. I don't think the sleeping side of this hotel is a concern for the management. I can't believe I must endure one more night...

What a blast! Hip like the W but edgier and affordable. Awesome location. Fun bars, with a great vibe and energy Wonderful views from the rooftop. Great staff, special shout out to Jocelyn who checked up in and Aaron who helped us leaving. We'll be back!

I arrived on opening day iat the Moxy . Things I loved.. very trendy , best location ever - ( 2 blocks from Macy and subway ) 5 blocks from Times Square and 2 blocks from 5 th Ave -4 blocks from penn station ) and most charming and enthusiastic staff team I have ever met . My Room was very cozy ( 150 ft ) and efficiently used every space -It's non traditional . - but on trend and very interesting . Opening day meant some glitches that were quickly fixed . But staff made it all work . The Moxy is a lot of fun and shows lots of promise . I plan to explore the hotel more next time and its definitely on my list for a return visit .

From the moment I walked in I knew this was going to be fun! The staff was hysterical and I needed a laugh after arriving late on a Sunday evening. My room was small but completely comfortable for 2 people. The hook system is great -- I am going to install them in my room at home (you have to check it out!) the bar- music- fun vibe in the lobby bar terrific -- I can't wait to come back and check out the lobby bar when it opens... !!!!

Moxy NY is new and needs to work out some service kinks. No one answers the phone (if it even works), messages on the app are not answered in a timely fashion, and the staff has an aloof attitude. The rooms are small even by NY standards. The hotel concept is appropriate only for a leisure traveler, preferably with an appetite for a party scene. I can imagine enjoying the property under the influence of alcohol. However, if you plan to set an alarm before 10 am, Moxy is definitely not for you.

I had the opportunity to experience two different rooms during my stay, due to a very minor issue with a light in my first room. (Hence, pictures of two different rooms are included with my review.) Overall, I had a pleasant stay. The hotel was new and clean, in a convenient location, and I found all of the staff to be pleasant. Here's the rundown...The loves...+Location, close to subway and midtown shopping +Lounge areas, well-designed, plenty of seating options, tastefully decorated, well-played given the compact rooms +Multipurpose furniture; it was kind of fun to figure it all out (the many ways in which some of the furniture could be used)+Very comfortable bed/quality bedding+Surprisingly, the steamer; I was completely skeptical about not having an iron nor ironing board in the room but the steamer was actually much more efficient (I'm sold!)+Pleasant staff, especially Tommy (one of the hotel engineers) who was super professional and helpful!+Welcome drink; I was able to get a non-alcoholic version and it was great!The I can deal...~Size, the size of my first room was really like a pseudo tiny living experience, but I could deal with it traveling solo; the size of the second room (with the sink outside of the shower/toilet space) I think is better-suited for more than one person...I think my husband would have been complaining about the size of the first room had he been there.The not so much...-Storage of the clothes steamer in the bathroom in the first room (something about that brings out the germaphobe in me); it was stored outside of the toilet/shower space in the second room (and I was relieved!)-No lotion (not a big deal, but so glad I had packed my own)

Enjoyed a great staycation at The Moxy! The front desk staff was incredibly friendly and upbeat (Drew was exceptional!). The stylish design of the rooms speaks to it’s functionality - which is minimal yet has everything you could possibly need (not that you’ll be staying in your room much as this hotel has incredible amenities!). The lobby bar is perfect for evening drinks and is versatile enough to go on a date or take some co-workers for after-hour beverages Overall, it’s an amazing property and I can't wait to return!

Treated my best friend to a night at Moxy as an early birthday gift and it did not disappoint. Check in was seamless and everyone was very welcoming. They even walk you to the elevator. We got a double standard and the room was very spacious. The bar has a lot of comfy couches and the service was in point. Will definitely come back to check out the rooftop bar.

we should have known there'd be things we wouldn't like about a new hotel in NYC that required so few points to stay there.The Moxy near Times Square recently opened and my wife and I visited this past weekend. We were intrigued by its proximity to MSG which we liked because of some tickets we had and the claim on its web site that it had the biggest and best rooftop bar in the city.We arrived and learned that both the hotel's restaurant AND the rooftop bar were still under construction and not open to guests!Then we checked into what was clearly the smallest ever hotel room we've ever been in.The one tiny table and single folding chair were actually hanging from pegs on the wall. There were lots of pegs which also reflected the fact that there are no bureaus or closets to be used either.The TV was on the wall at the foot of the bed so could only be viewed while either lying down or sitting on the bed and turning awkwardly.the list goes on... even shaving or my wife applying makeup is difficult because there is no light above the mirror above the sink. No refrigerator, too and you need to crawl across the bed to operate the window blinds.some minor changes would help... better lighting above the sink; maybe a larger table that folds up against the wall might help. the tv need either re-positioning or you need to be able to pull it from the wall and pivot it. And maybe some notice when we booked our room about the incomplete construction!!We made the most of it but this is not a room for a couple or for anyone planning a stay of more than a day or two.The staff was all friendly and tried very hard but it was clear that a number of them needed some more experience... we're great Marriott fans and won't let this change our minds. Just not the place for us. If I was going into the city alone for one night and needed to be around that part of town, I'd probably try it again.

The pros:I am currently a guest at Moxy. I really like the concept. The room design is very unique and I'm especially loving the large shower and the way the 2 beds are laid out. The front desk crew has it going on. They enthusiastically greet you coming and going. Nice touch. Housekeeping had our room done super early after the first night's stay. Netflix in the room is an awesome feature and the wi-fi is super fast. Cons: I would have given 5 stars if not for the fact that the rooftop bar and restaurant are not open yet. I understand that it is a newly opened property and if they had mentioned on their website that those areas were not open to the public yet, I would have been in a better position to decide if I were staying at this particular property or not. I had told the friend I brought to NYC for the first time how amazing our view of the Empire State Building was going to be from the rooftop lounge and the restaurant would have been a nice touch. Here is what is on the website: Hotel Highlights"Dine and drink in one of our brand new restaurants or sit back and enjoy the view at Magic Hour, NYC's largest rooftop lounge."I still love the Marriott and will continue to stay at their properties. My hubby and I are both Rewards members and hopefully on another trip to NYC the Moxy will be completed.

I recently stayed at the Moxy Times Square and thoroughly enjoyed my stay! The façade of the building preserves the old school New York City charm, while the interior has a fresh and stylish appeal. The location was perfect. With easy access to the trains and steps from Times Square. The staff was incredibly friendly. The agent who checked me in escorted me through the lobby and made sure to point out the efficient elevator system. I visited the second floor bar a met up with a few friends. It was a great place for us to lounge, play foosball and enjoy the music from the house DJ. We all ordered from the signature naan list and I chose the “white” naan in particular. It had caramelized onions, ricotta and honey….DELICIOUS! The room was cozy, efficiently designed, with a modern yet elegant look. If you plan on coming to NYC and you’re looking for a great location, gorgeous hotel, and super friendly staff, I highly recommend staying at the Moxy!

I will say upfront that I was there one week to the day of their opening so the fact that it took 15 minutes to check in was probably an aberration. The music was too loud in the lobby and in the elevator (and while I am probably not the chain's target market, i.e. older, it is hard to come in from the noise of the city and be faced with loud music). The room was small, which I knew it would be, but it really worked. It had a great feel and was very efficient. There was a folding table and chairs handing on the wall which also had hooks for clothing. My big complaint was the noise level, specifically street noise. I stay in New York with frequency and this was a window issue not a NYC issue. There was a party at the hotel and I could hear the music (coming from outside) until the middle of the night.
user_name:
Lauren F
Cleveland, Ohio, United States

review_body: I went to the rooftop disco for a party. Friendly and efficient staff on ground floor. Easy access. Beautiful view on the Empire State Building, which that day was lit to the red and white colours of the Global Citizen movement. Beautiful. Friendly staff at the bar. Good music. Noise level sufficiently low to be able to talk (+ one isolated room where it is much higher so that people can dance more easily). All in all very good, so I recommend the place.

Several items about my stay at the Moxy. I found the lobby staff to be very helpful though not at times familiar with the checkin technology. They give you tokens to use at the bar... the check in staff said good for drinks/water at the bar however the bar staff said that the tokens were only good for a welcome drink, some poorly concocted thing that was hideous.Speaking of the bar staff they have a bartender named Juan who could possibly be the laziest bartender I've ever seen. I watched intently as he purposely walked away from any work. I practically had to beg to get a drink. In my case a beer that was warm and I had to ask for a separate glass (not offered) then when done with my first cocktail and waiting 5-10 minutes for Juan I finally flagged him down at an almost empty bar to get another. Good luck with that!The rooms are cute and teeny tiny... the windows are paper thin! I heard every street noise including a full conversation and I was on the 8th floor. No iron, just a steamer, so I got to walk around in a soggy shirt on a warm New York day. The toilet is in the shower! Cute design but no. I'm in New York about once every other month and I will not ever come back here. I'm shocked that Marriott is aligning their name with this place.

MOXY is a friendly, fun place, I would say it's mostly for young people (really loud music in the lobby, might be annoying for an older crowd). Cool design, very comfortable rooms equiped with everything you need and more (there was even a steamer in mine), it's super clean and - this is a huge plus for me personally - the shower is extra spacious. Definitely staying here again.

We chanced this brand new property because of the price and our willingness to try something new. From the moment we entered the minimalist lobby we knew that we made the right choice. The staff is young, friendly and eager to please. As we were checking in, the staffer apologized that no upgrade was available to me as a Marriott Gold member so she volunteered that she will be crediting my account with extra points for my stay. Our queen bedded room was small (but hey this is NYC) but furnished in a very functional and compact way. The furnishing are industrial modern and very cool. The bed was comfortable and the shower had almost instant and abundant hot water pouring out of the rain shower head. Only one bar was open (on the second floor) and the bartenders were amazing, serving creative, well crafted cocktails.. We are frequent visitors to NYC and can't wait for our next trip to stay here again.

This was our first time staying at a Moxy hotel, and we are thoroughly enjoying our stay so far. We were greeted warming, had an easy check in, and the location is awesome. The staff has been very friendly and very accommodating. It's definitely a fun, hip atmosphere (and affordable), something we haven't experienced in a hotel before. The room is the perfect size, especially if you are planning to spend most of your time sight seeing or hanging out in the Moxy common areas like we are. It also has a nice walk-in shower! We enjoyed great food and drinks at the bar on the 2nd floor last night! We would definitely recommend this hotel!

My girlfriend and I had a wonderful stay at Moxy. The staff was warm and went out of their way to make us happy. The room was stylish, modern, comfortable - and the rain shower is HUGE. We couldn't get out of bed it was so comfy and we loved being able to watch Netflix. Bar moxy and the lobby lounge have a great vibe. The cocktail menu was top notch, foosball was fun, and the deejay was great! We were close enough to everywhere we wanted to be, and just below the hustle and bustle of Times Square. We enjoyed the free wifi too. We will definitely be returning on our next trip to NYC!

Checked in on opening day and the rooms are awesome, very clean and great design. The hotel has a cool vibe with a bar on the 2nd floor. The staff is friendly with cool uniforms. The location is centrally located and really close to Time Square. Definitely will stay again!
